SESSION 281 第281节　罗的花粉热　信封68


AUGUST 29,1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年8月29日　星期一　晚上9点
(The 68th envelope object was a poem Jane wrote to me on the evening of July 3,1966. It was written with a dark pen on a sheet of yellow paper, not punched, and the size of this page. The sheet was folded as indicated above, then enclosed between the usual two pieces of Bristol and inserted into the usual double envelopes. The back side of the sheet was blank. I knew nothing of the circumstances under which Jane wrote the poem, and hoped the data would fill me in. Details in their proper place.(第68次信封实验的标的物是珍在1966年7月3日晚间写给我的一首诗。它是用深色的笔写在一张黄纸上，纸没有打孔而且大小和这一页相同。如上图所示，这张纸先折叠之后，密封在两层普通的布里斯托绘图纸[Bristol，西卡纸]之间，再放入一般的双层信封里。纸张的背面是空白。珍在什么样的状况下写这首诗，我一无所知，希望实验资料会让我了解详情。细节的描述将会出现在适当之处。
(Jane began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed. They soon began to open. Her voice was average, with some pauses.(珍坐下来，闭上眼睛，同时开始讲话。两眼不久就开始睁开。她的声音不疾不徐，时而停顿。
(Begin at 8:58.)(在8:58分开始。
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(Long pause.) Now. Ruburt sent a message and it was received. I am referring to the visit of your friend today.(长时间停顿)现在。鲁柏发出一个讯息，而且已被接收。我是说你们的朋友今天来访的事。
The conscious mind had nothing to do with this. He strongly wished for the friend’s presence. The wish became reality. You must understand the rules that apply. For they apply whether or not you understand them, and whether or not the wish is one that you really want fulfilled.意识心与这件事一点关系都没有。他非常希望这位朋友在场。这个希望变成实相。你必须了解运作的规则。因为不管你了不了解它们，也不管你真的想要实现的希望是不是这一个，规则都适用。
(This noon our friend Jim Beckett visited us for the first time in some months. Jim used to be a TV repairman. Last evening our TV set was acting up, and Jane wished aloud that Jim would visit us and fix the set, as he has done in the past.(今天中午，我们的朋友吉姆·贝克特来探望我们，这是他近几个月第一次来访。吉姆以前是电视维修员。昨晚我们的电视机出了毛病，珍开口说出她希望吉姆来探望我们，像以前一样把电视修好。
(Jim lives out of town and is now a traveling repairman for office equipment. He has witnessed a few sessions, perhaps two years ago. Today he told us that as he drove within about four blocks of our house, he received the strong urge to visit us.)(吉姆住在城外，现在是办公室设备旅行维修员。他见证过几节课，或许是两年前吧。今天他告诉我们，车开到了距离我们的房子大约四条街的距离内，他接收到想要来看我们的强烈冲动。)
Take for example this subconscious feeling: “I want to be comforted. If I were sick someone would feel sorry for me and comfort me then.” Such a wish is very seldom on a conscious level, but it is often Emotionally charged, and it brings forth immediate results because of the charge it carries. Whenever you catch yourselves in Moods of self pity, then you are courting just such results.以这个潜意识的感觉为例：“我想要得到慰藉。生病了，有人会为我感到难过，然后来安慰我。”这样一个心愿很少是在意识层面，但它往往充满情感能量，并且因为它携带的情感能量，而带来立即的结果。每当你逮到自己正处于自怜的心情时，那么你就是在招引这样的结果。
There is no way out of this, you see. You simply must realize that self pity, in your terms, is highly destructive. Any charged Emotional feeling will almost immediately be made actual. Now this gives you an advantage, you see, if you understand the principles. When you strongly desire to sell your paintings, my friend, you will do so.你知道，这是无路可逃的。你非得明白的是，按照你们的说法，自怜的破坏力非常大。任何充满情感能量的感觉几乎都会立刻成真。现在这给你一个优势，你知道，如果你了解原理的话。当你对于卖掉自己的画有着强烈欲望时，我的朋友，你就会心想事成。
(Jane looks at me, eyes wide and dark.)(珍看着我，眼睛大睁、颜色暗深)
If you passionately desire that others possess them, and benefit from them then you shall sell them, and because of your desire you will take those necessary measures. But regardless of those measures, the paintings will sell.如果你热切渴望他拥有你的画并从中受益，那么你就卖得掉它们，而且因为你的欲望，你将会采取那些必要的手段。但不管那些手段是什么，画都卖得掉。
When you passionately desire to withhold them, when you fear that you will lose a part of yourself by relinquishing them, then this will be what you broadcast to others, and this is the data upon which they will act.当你热切渴望保留它们时，当你恐惧你放开它们就会失去一部分的自己时，那么这就会是你向他人散播的讯息，而且这也是他们据以行动的资料。
The pendulum is an excellent method of discovering your subconscious feelings, and indeed of changing them. As you both suppose, incidentally, the music you played this evening was highly beneficial from several standpoints.发掘你的潜意识有何感觉，摆锤是一个绝佳的方法，而不是改变它们。顺便说一下，如你们两人所知，从几个观点看来，你今天晚上播放的音乐非常有益
(Yma Sumac.) Any connection with past periods of productivity or joy have immediate reference to the present. As negative suggestions play their part, so do positive suggestions, and both in terms of symbols.(伊玛·苏马克[Yma Sumac])。与过去充满生产力或喜悦的时期有关的任何连结，都和当下有直接的关系。就像负面的暗示有它们的作用一样，正面的暗示也是，而且两者都是就象征而言。
These positive symbols can be used quite deliberately. They should be utilized for your own benefit. You do this often without realizing that you do so. but a conscious knowledge will help you.可以相当审慎使用这些正面的象征。应该利用它们来让你自己获益。你经常在不知不觉的状况下这么做，但有意识的知识对你会有帮助。
Give us a moment here... I am searching for a connection for you, concerning the past. A negative response dealing with Dr. Martin. Some, to me indistinct connection between the strange young woman here with your friends, and Emma Martin. An old unpleasant association. You were uncomfortable, a child. Dr. Martin and his wife visited your parents. You cried, and you clearly heard Emma Martin tell your mother that she should not go to you, and then you would be quiet.这里等我们一下……我正在帮你搜寻一个连结，和过去有关。一个关于马丁医师(Dr.Martin)的负面回应。对我来说，这里和你们的朋友在一起的那位奇怪的年轻女子与艾玛·马丁(Emma Martin)之间，依稀有着某种连结。多年前一个不愉快的联想。当时你是一个小孩，你感觉不舒服。马丁医师和他的太太拜访你的父母。你哭了，而且你清楚听见艾玛·马丁告诉你的母亲，她不应该去安抚你，然后就会平静下来。
Then a door was closed. The girl reminded you, through some association, with Emma Martin of that time.接着一扇门被关上。透过某个联想，这个女孩让你想起当时的艾玛·马丁。
(This was very interesting, and a surprise to me. Recently I have been using suggestion rather successfully on hay fever, following Seth’s ideas. Friday was a good day. We had company Friday evening—Marilyn and Don Wilbur, Don’s brother and a girl named Pat, whom we do not know.(这件事非常有意思，而且出乎我意料之外。听从赛斯的建议，我最近一直在利用暗示处理花粉热，效果相当好。星期五过得很好。星期五晚上我们有客人——玛丽莲和唐·韦伯、唐的兄弟和一个名叫佩特[Pat]的女孩，我们不认识她。
(Later that evening hay fever seemed to get the best of me and I had a poor weekend. I was mystified as to the cause. The pendulum told me I reacted to the group Friday evening. However I had never reacted to the Wilburs before, so I was still puzzled.(那天晚上稍后，花粉热似乎击败了我，周末我过得很不好。原因是什么，我百思不解。摆锤告诉我，我是对星期五晚上那群人起了反应。可是我从来没有对韦伯夫妇起过反应，所以我还是觉得很困惑。
(Dr. and Emma Martin are old friends of my parents, and their age—early seventies, or nearly 80. I have childhood memories of them, of course. As soon as Seth mentioned it, I immediately saw a distinct resemblance between Emma Martin, as she had been, and the young girl Pat. The smile in both was much alike. Consciously I had made no such connection however, before Seth mentioned it, but had sensed something familiar about Pat Friday evening.(马丁医师和艾玛·马丁是我父母亲的老朋友，年纪差不多——70出头，或将近70岁。当然，我的童年记忆里有他们。赛斯一提到这件事，我立刻看到以前的艾玛·马丁与那个年轻女子之间有一个明显的相似之处。两人的笑容非常相像。不过，赛斯提起此事之前，我在意识上并没有做这样的连结，但在星期五晚上佩特确实让我有某种熟悉感。
(Jane of course has no memories of Emma Martin as a young person. Any such episode as described by Seth above would have taken place probably more than 40 years ago. I am now 47.)(珍对年轻时的艾玛·马丁当然没有任何记忆。像赛斯在上文描述的这种事件可能全都发生在40多年以前。我现在是47岁。)
Now such associations have an electrical reality, you see, built within your system. Realization of these causes creates an opposing force that can neutralize the original. The words—“Father, I refuse to accept your hay fever for myself, though I once took it, I now throw it free from us both”—these words will help.现在这样的联想有一个电子实相，你知道，建立在你的系统之内。对这些原因的认识创造出一股反向的力量，可以中和原先的事件。这些话——“爸爸，为了我自己，我拒绝接受你的花粉热；虽然我曾经接受过，现在我把它丢掉，解除它对我们两个的束缚”——这些话会有帮助。
They will neutralize the original suggestions. Such patterns, for this is what they are, throw loose and away, break up. The energy that gave them vitality can then be used in new ways.它们会中和原先的暗示。这样的模式，因为它们现在就是如此，一旦被抛开丢掉，便会瓦解。于是，赋予它们生命力的那股能量就能够以新的方式被利用。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:24. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes opened often. She resumed in the same manner at 9:34.)(9:24分休息。珍一如往常出离。她经常睁开眼睛。她在9:34分以同样的方式继续。)
Now, dear friend. This information will help you.现在，亲爱的朋友。这个资料将会帮助你。
Your father used hay lever as a symptom of helplessness, and as a demand for the attention that he did not get, even then, from your mother. The pattern was set earlier in his childhood. He discarded the symptoms because they did not get him what he wanted. Your mother could not be bothered.你的父亲利用花粉热当作无助的一个象征，也当作一个要求，想要得到他甚至在当时都没有从你母亲那里得到的关注。这个模式在他童年早期就已经建立。他之所以抛弃那些症状，是因为他没有得到他想要的东西。你的母亲懒得理会。
She did not comfort him as his mother had. You picked up the condition when he realized that it no longer served him. At that time you accepted it, however, along with your conception of what it was to be a male. If you had a son and did not know what you know, you would automatically so transfer it.她不像她的母亲那样安慰他。当他明白它再也帮不了他的时候，你接收了这个状况。但是，当时你接受了它，也接受了你认为身为一个男性是什么样子的概念。如果你有一个儿子而且他不知道你知道的事，你就会自动复制同样的状况。
Now. You realize that virility is hardly synonymous with a runny nose. You realize your masculinity. You are too aware now to allow yourself too many privileges in exchange for your symptoms, and you can therefore afford to relinquish them.现在。你发觉男子气概根本不等同于流鼻水。你体会到你的男性特质。现在你太有觉察力了，以至于你也允许自己用很多特权来交换你的症状，因此你能够负担得起放弃它们的代价。
You are not helping your father, for the symptoms will not revert to him. Your system will simply reorganize the energy pattern. There was another element. Your mother treated you as hers exclusively. You also adopted the symptoms as a protective measure against her. You said in effect, “I am my father’s son, down to some of his defects.’’你不是在帮助你的父亲，因为症状不会重回他的身上。你的系统将只会重新组织能量模式。还有另一个元素。你的母亲对待你的方式，是把你当成只属于她的儿子。你也把症状当成针对她采用的一种保护措施。你的大意是说：“我是我父亲的儿子，归根结底我有他的一些缺陷。”
When you realize this, again, you will find the symptoms hardly necessary. Your mother basically did not share (smile) your father’s love of the out-of-doors, and you played both ends against the middle. For the symptoms also allowed you to stay indoors with her on many occasions.当你了悟这一点时，再一次，你会发现症状根本没有必要存在。你的父亲喜爱户外，但你的母亲基本上对户外没兴趣(微笑)，而你则是鹬蚌相争之下得利的渔翁。因为症状也让你在很多情况下可以和她一起待在室内。
All of this information will be immeasurably helpful to you. Your father’s hay fever was a defense also against farm work, you see.这一整份资料对你的帮助之大，无法估量。你看，你父亲的花粉热也是抗拒农场工作的一个防卫手段。
There was an afternoon... I am not clear here.... You were given cod liver oil. The symptoms began that day. You should not eat salads at your parents home, that are mixed with oil, during the season.曾经有一个下午……这里我不确定……有人给你鳕鱼肝油。症状在那一天开始发作。在那个季节，你不应该在你父母家吃混了那种油的沙拉。
Hay fever was for your father also a defense against the world, for it allowed him some isolation. You can have the necessary privacy without using this symptom to get it. The ink has a symbolic association for you personally, a healing one you see, and its presence, according to my recommendation, has the effect of a Mood tonic.花粉热对你父亲来说也是抗拒世界的一个防卫手段，因为这让他能够有一些与世隔绝的时间。不利用这个症状去争取，你也可以拥有必需的隐私。对你的人格来说，墨水有一个象征性的联想，你知道，一个具有疗愈作用的联想，而且按照我的推荐，它的存在还有一种心情提振剂的效果。
Yoga breathing will be of therapeutic value when you need it, but the knowledge gained in this evening’s session should go a long way toward minimizing the symptoms.你有需要时，瑜珈呼吸法是有疗愈价值的，但是要把症状减到最低，今晚获得的知识，症状应该会有极大的帮助。
(Smile.) You should avoid the color red in decorations during the season. You should take steps to realize the connection with your mother and red, so that our friend can use his red curtains at Christmas with immunity.(微笑)在那个季节，你应该避免使用红色装饰物。你应该一步一步去发觉你的母亲与红色有何关联，这样一来，我们的朋友才会拥有免疫力，而能够在圣诞节的时候使用他的红色窗帘。
You may take a break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:52. Jane was out as usual. Her manner was very active, often smiling and emphatic, her eyes open much of the time, etc. I had a sneezing spell at break, probably because of the Emotional content of the above material.(9:52休息。珍一如往常出去了。她的举止非常活泼，经常微笑和加强语气，大部分时间她的眼睛都是睁开的等等。休息时，我打了喷嚏，可能是因为上述资料的情感内容所致。
(It is Wednesday evening as I type this. Since the session Monday night, I have not taken any of the usual pills for the hay fever, and have been, overall, in much better condition than I might have expected. The relief is great.(我替这一节资料打字的时间是星期三晚上。从星期一晚上的这一节开始，我就没有再吃平常用来治疗花粉热的药丸了。
(Jane said she did not know I had taken cod liver oil as a child. I remember doing this, and disliking it intensely. My parents have told me often that I displayed hay fever symptoms by the age of 3 or so, so evidently the first cod liver oil episode was earlier than this, and before my conscious memory. Jane insisted I hadn’t mentioned cod liver oil to her, though I had discussed castor oil.我的父母经常告诉我，我是在3岁左右开始出现花粉热的症状，所以，第一次的鳕鱼肝油事件应该早于3岁，而且是在我有意识的记忆之前。珍坚称我没有跟她提过鳕鱼肝油的事，但是我有讨论过蓖麻油。
(Jane resumed at a slower rate, her eyes closed, at 10:02.)(10:02，珍闭上眼睛，以较慢的速度继续。)
An episode at the age of fifteen served to reinforce the difficulty.15岁那年的一个插曲加重了这个难题。
We will go slowly here. You were in the house, in the cellar or on the upper story. You were not on the main floor of the house. The episode involved your father and yourself.这里我们会慢慢讲。你在屋子里。在地窖或楼上。你不是在屋子的主要楼层。这个插曲牵涉到你父亲和你自己。
He was, or appeared to be, crying, and you saw him. A rather soundless sobbing that involved running eyes and nose. I believe this was in the afternoon, around four. I think your mother and the young boy were out—他在哭或样子像是在哭，你看见他了。是没有发出什么声音的啜泣，眼睛里有泪水，鼻子也流着鼻涕。我相信时间是下午，大约四点。我想你的母亲和弟弟出门去了——
(There was a knock on our door at 10:05. Jane stopped speaking and left her trance easily. She answered the door and explained that we were busy, and company left. By 10:08 she had resumed her seat and began speaking again.)(10:05分，有人敲我们的门。珍停止说话，毫不费力就脱离出神状态。她应了门，解释说我们正在忙，来客就离开了。到了10:08分，她已经回座，再次开始说话。)
I believe a watch was somehow involved. He lost it, or someone broke it. It may have been his own father’s watch. Perhaps your mother broke it in anger, but I am not sure of this.我相信牵涉到一支表，不知道为什么。他的表不见了，或有人弄坏它。那支表可能是他父亲的。也许是你的母亲在生气时弄坏它，但这一点我不确定。
His appearance then reminded you of his appearance in hay fever season, and reinforced your own symptoms until they became a symbol of virility, since they were your father’s, and also a symbol of how a man could cry. You do not need such symptoms now.他的样子让你想到他在花粉热季节的样子，因此加重了你自己的症状，直到症状变成男子气概的象征为止，因为它们是你父亲的症状，此外症状也变成一个男人可以怎样哭的象征。现在你不需要这样的症状。
(I have no conscious memory of such an episode.)(在意识上，我完全不记得这样一个插曲。)
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(At 10:12 Jane took the sealed double envelope from me for our 68th experiment. She held it to her forehead in a horizontal position with her right hand, her eyes closed.)(10:12分，珍从我手上拿了第68次实验的密封双层信封。她用右手把横向的信封放在她的额头上，双眼闭着。)
Give us a moment, please.请等我们一下。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Stirrup. No, something stirred up. Twelve, or one, two. Three people concerned. I have the image of a circular object within a rectangular one, or rather an oval shape as in a portrait of a woman that is oval, for example as in old-time valentines.马镫(stirup)。不是，有东西被搅动(stirred up)。12，或1、2.与3个人有关系。我有个画面是，一个圆形物体在一个长方形之内，或更确切地说是一个椭圆形，就像是一张椭圆形的女人肖像那样，例如，在旧时的情人节礼物当中那样。
A connection with a woman and a card.与一个人和一张卡片有关联。
Something spun, as cloth or material.某个纺织的东西，比如布料或织物。
A distant connection in the past, with a gathering that was formal, I believe... not certain here... With dancing (gesture, eyes closed) as at a wedding reception perhaps.在过去与一场正式的聚会有遥远的关联，我相信……这里不确定……与跳舞(比手势，眼睛闭着)有关联，也许是在一场婚礼上。
Through personal association with my last remark, Ruburt is led to think of the coming D’Andreano wedding.经由个人的联想，鲁柏把我的上一句话想成是得安德里安诺(D'Andreano)的婚礼。
Four plus one. A connection with February 3, I believe. With a rose. Connection with a journey, and invitation. With a brush or something that resembles it, with bristles. 1821 or 1812, perhaps Milwaukee or Wisconsin.4加1。和2月3日有关联，我相信。与一朵玫瑰有关。与一趟旅程和一个邀请有关联。与一把刷子或某个类似的东西有关，与鬃刷毛有关。1821或1812，也许是密尔瓦基(Milwaukee)或威斯康星(Wisconsin)。
The words “A fine form of a woman.”“一个女人的美好形体”这些字。
A yellow square. Black and white. Please reply.一个黄色的正方形。黑与白。请回复。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
(“Can you say more about the yellow square?")(“你能不能多说一下黄色的正方形？”)
I have the image of a small, neat yellow square, in a lower right-hand position. An aquamarine color also.我有个画面是，一个小小、工整的黄色正方形，在右手边较低的位置。还有一种海蓝色。
(“Who is the woman referred to in the card and portrait?”)(“在卡片和肖像上提到的那个女人是谁？”)
The woman I believe strange to you, or at least in different surroundings or attire.那个女人我相信对你来说是陌生的，或至少在不同的环境或装扮下是这样。
(Shakes head, puzzled.(摇摇头，困惑的样子)。
(“Who are the three people involved”)(“牵涉在内的三个人是谁？”)
(Pause.) Two women perhaps and a man. One of the women in the background. However others are involved also. 37 here and a magistrate connection.(停顿)也许是两个女人和一个男人。其中一个女人在背景中。不过，牵涉在内的还有其他人。这里有37，以及一个地方法官的关联。
(“What’s that four plus one)"(“4加1是什么？”)
(Pause.) Four plus one life. Vito.(停顿)4加1。维托(Vito)。
If you have no other questions you may take your break.如果你没有其他问题，那你可以休息一下。
(“I guess not.”)(“我想没有了。”)
And tissue paper.还有面纸。
(Break at 10:27. Jane was out as usual, and her eyes remained closed. Her pace had been average. Images will be mentioned as they occurred.(10:27分休息。珍一如往常出去了，她的双眼仍然闭上。她的速度不疾不徐。画面出现时，就会提到。
(See the tracing on page I and the notes that follow. As stated I knew nothing of the circumstances under which Jane produced the poem used as object. During the delivery of the data however I forgot this, and as a result it seemed to me that the data was off target. It was quite legitimate. But at the time I nearly asked Jane to try again, and was also somewhat at a loss as to what questions to ask. Had I asked Jane to try again it might have led to confusion.(见上面的描摹图和随后的注释。如上所述，我完全不知道珍是在什么情况下创作这首用作标的物的诗。不过，在资料传述期间，我忘了这件事，因此对我来说，资料似乎偏离目标了。它相当确实。但当时我差一点要求珍再试一次，而且也有一点不知道要问什么问题。如果我要求珍再试一次，可能会造成混淆。
(I was also concerned that the interruption would somehow interfere with the data, and after break Seth confirms that this happened to some extent.(我也担心中断会以某种方式干扰资料，在休息之后，赛斯也确认这某种程度上是会发生的。
(The object is a poem written to me by Jane on a sheet of yellow paper, in a dark pen, and dated July 3,1966. The back of the object is blank. Here is a brief summary of the circumstances under which Jane produced the poem; it will be expanded as the data unfolds.(标的物是珍在一张黄纸上写给我的一首诗，用深色的笔，日期是1966年7月3日。标的物的背面是空白的。这里摘要叙述珍在什么情况下创作这首诗；随着资料的呈现，将会进一步详述。
(After supper on the evening of July 3,1966，Jane sat in the backyard. It was not yet dark. also in the backyard were the girl who lives in the downstairs back apartment, Barbara, and her steady boyfriend Dick. Both are in their thirties. As they sat in lawn chairs, they asked Jane to have a drink with them. This surprised Jane, for she saw that Dick was angry with Barbara for teasing him about marriage. Also, Jane felt that being asked to share a drink with the couple was a gesture, and that when she accepted Dick was not happy about it.(1966年7月3日傍晚，吃过晚饭后，珍坐在后院。天色犹亮。在后院还有住在公寓后面楼下的女孩芭芭拉[Barbara]，以及她稳定交往中的男友迪克[Dick]。两人都是30岁。他们坐在户外折叠椅上，邀珍过去和他们喝一杯。这让珍感到惊讶，因为她看到芭芭拉拿结婚的事逗弄迪克，他在生她的气。此外，珍觉得这对情侣邀她去喝一杯只是说说而已，当她接受的时候，迪克不太高兴。
(This in turn made Jane angry. Barbara and Dick went into Barbara's apartment to mix Jane a drink. While they were inside, Jane wrote the poem to me that was used as tonight’s object.(这让珍也生气了。芭芭拉和迪克进去芭芭拉的公寓，帮珍调一杯饮料。当他们在里面的时候，珍写了这首今晚用来当作标的物的诗给我。
(I had been Moody myself that day, and finally lay down for a nap—hence the subject matter for Jane's poem. Jane wondered why the couple asked her to share a drink if they didn’t mean it. Dick, especially, seemed to give Jane this feeling. Note that much of the data concerns the three people involved in the poem's psychic surroundings at the time of creation; and that indeed this feeling on Jane's part overrides the data pertaining directly to the object itself in most cases tonight. But Jane's perception of the object was necessary in order for her to give the data pertaining to Barbara and Dick, and her own feelings.(那天我的心情也不好，最后干脆躺下来睡个小觉——因此成了珍这首诗的主题。珍想不通为什么这对情侣明明不想却又邀她一起喝一杯。尤其是迪克似乎给珍这种感觉。注意这份资料大部分和3个人有关，而在创作这首诗的当时，这3个人都置身于诗中的心灵环境里；而且今晚在大部分情况下，珍的这个感觉确实凌驾于直接与标的物本身有关的资料上。但是为了给出这份与芭芭拉和迪克以及她自己的感觉有关的资料，珍对标的物的感知是必需的。
(Seth helps out a little after break, but we made our own connections as best we could in the meantime.(休息之后，赛斯帮上了一点忙，但我们同时也尽全力自己找出连结。
(“Stirrup. No, something stirred up. ’’ The drink that Barbara's boyfriend Dick gave Jane, in the episode just described in the backyard on July 3,1966, was a mixed drink, a Wink-and-gin. This drink is the one referred to in the fourth line of the poem used as object.(“马镫”。不是，有东西被搅动。”在刚刚描述过，于1966年7月3日在后院发生的插曲中，芭芭拉的男友迪克给珍的饮料是一杯混合饮料，汽水和杜松子酒。在用作标的物的诗里，第四行提到的饮料就是这杯调酒。
(Also, Jane said, the term stirred up could refer to Dick, who was angry or stirred up, and to the fact that it was Dick who stirred the drink.(此外，珍说，“被搅动”这个字词也可能是指迪克，他生气了或被激怒了[stirred up]，还有搅拌饮料的人是迪克的这个事实。
(“Twelve, or one, two.” Jane said this was Seth’s way of leading her, by counting, to the next data, referring to three people.(“12，或1、2。”珍说这是赛斯透过数数引导她到下一个资料的方式，指的是3个人。
(“Three people concerned.” As explained, three people were involved in the backyard episode during which Jane wrote the poem used as object: Jane, Barbara and Dick.(“与3个人有关系。”如上所述，珍写了用作标的物的诗当诗，有3个人参与后院事件：珍、芭芭拉和迪克。
(“I have the image of a circular object within a rectangular one, or rather an oval shape as in a portrait of a woman that is oval, for example as in old-time valentines. ’’ To Jane this refers to the fact that Barbara is an amateur artist. Jane doesn’t know however if Barbara has for instance ever painted such a portrait. Jane wished she had allowed Seth to be more specific here. Later note by Rob: Poem is a valentine of sorts; love poem.(“我有个画面是，一个圆形物体在一个长方形之内，或更确切地说是一个椭圆形，就像是一张椭圆形的女人肖像那样，例如，在旧时的情人节礼物当中那样。”对珍来说，这是指芭芭拉是业余画家的事实。不过，珍并不知道芭芭拉有没有，比如说，画过这样一幅肖像。珍希望她之前允许赛斯在这里传述得更明确。罗稍后的注记：诗勉强算是一个情人节礼物：情诗。
(“A connection with a woman and a card.” This we think is more of the immediately-above data, an attempt to get at Barbara painting pictures.(“与一个女人和一张卡片有关联。”我们认为这和上文的资料比较相关，是为了说明芭芭拉作画这件事的一个尝试。
(“Something spun, as cloth or material.”Jane is subjectively sure that this is an excellent reference to Barbara and her sewing ability. Barbara does a lot of sewing, and Jane has seen drawers of various kinds of material that Barbara has bought on sale, saving it for whatever use the future brings. Later note by Rob: Including sheets. Sheets and half dressed are mentioned in poem.(“某个纺织东西，比如布料或织物。”珍在主观上确定这是和芭芭拉及其缝纫才能有关的一个极佳的参照。芭拉拉做了很多缝纫，珍见过芭芭拉的许多抽屉装满她在降价拍卖购买的各种材料，留作未来之用。罗稍后的注记：包括纸张。诗中提到纸张和衣衫不整。
(“A distant connection in the past, with a gathering that was formal, I believe... not certain here... with dancing as at a wedding reception perhaps. Through personal association with my last remark, Ruburt is led to think of the coming DAndreano wedding.” As stated, Jane was quite embarrassed at the teasing Dick had taken from Barbara about marriage the evening of July 3, and by Dick’s obvious anger. The wedding talk here thus links up with a wedding Jane and I attended perhaps nine years ago in Rochester, NY-—that of my brother Dick and Ida DAndreano. This was a formal occasion for which Jane and I were dressed formally, and at the lengthy reception afterwards there was much dancing, etc.(“在过去与一场正式的聚会有遥远的关联，我相信……这里不确定……和跳舞有关联，也许是在一场婚礼上。经由个人的联想，鲁柏把我的上一句话想成是得安德里安诺的婚礼。”如上所述，芭芭拉在7月3日傍晚拿结婚的事逗弄迪克，迪克显然生气了，这让珍觉得很尴尬。因此这里谈到的婚礼与珍和我大约9年前在纽约州罗彻斯特参加的一场婚礼连在一起——那是我弟弟迪克与艾达·得安德里安诺[Ida D'Andreano]的婚礼。这是一个正式场合，珍和我都盛装打扮，在事后的冗长婚宴上，有很多人在跳舞等等。
(In addition, within the past month we have received an announcement of the forthcoming marriage of another DAndreano, Louie, also in Rochester. We have been invited. Louie witnessed a session a couple of year ago, and was interested in this material for some time. This new wedding, we think, freshens the DAndreano association. We think there is also another association involving this data—the fact that the two Dicks were involved—Dick in the backyard, and my own brother Dick in Rochester.(此外，在过去一个月内，我们收到另一位得安德里安诺即将结婚的通知，他叫路易[Louie]，也住在罗彻斯特。我们受邀参加婚礼。路易在一两年前曾经见证过一节课，他对这份资料产生兴趣已有一段时间了。我们认为，这场新的婚礼更新了得安德里安诺的联想。我们觉得还有一个联想也和这份资料有关——有两个迪克牵涉在内的这个事实——后院的迪克以及我在罗彻斯特的亲弟弟迪克。
(“Four plus one.” We could make no certain connections, nor did Seth’s answer to the fourth question help much.(“4加1。”我们找不到特定的关联，赛斯对第四个问题的回答也没帮上什么忙。
(“A connection with February 3, I believe.” We don't know. The poem used as envelope object was written on July 3. If the Feb. 3 data is connected to the immediately following, we do not know how.(“与2月3日有关联，我相信。”我们不知道。当作信封标的物的诗写于7月3日。如果2月3日的资料和下文的资料有关联，我们不知道这个关联是怎么来的。
(“With a rose.” Jane thinks this a legitimate connection, but somewhat removed. Barbara, who paints, has painted a picture of a violin that she wanted to show me. I have also painted a picture of a violin. It was done perhaps twenty years ago and hangs in my parents' home. My painting includes some wax roses.(“与一朵玫瑰有关。”珍认为这是一个合理的连结，但是距离有点远。会画画的芭芭拉画了一幅小提琴的画，她想要拿来给我看。我也画了一幅小提琴的画。也许是20年前画的，挂在我父母家。我的画中有一些蜡制玫瑰。
(“Connection with a journey, and invitation.” Jane believes these apply in the following manner: Barbara’s boyfriend Dick lives perhaps 25 miles away, and thus had to journey to see her on the night the three people were grouped in the yard, when Jane produced the poem used as object. Invitation can apply through Barbara’s talk about marriage to Dick. It also applies through Barbara calling to me to join the threesome; she thought I was in the studio. I had instead begun taking a nap and did not hear.(“与一趟旅程和一个邀请有关。”珍相信这在下面的行为当中是适用的：芭芭拉的男友迪克住在20英里外，因此三个人聚在后院的那天晚上，他必须历经一趟旅程才能来见她，当时珍写了这首用作标的物的诗。由于芭芭拉向迪克谈到婚姻，所以邀请可能适用于此。另外芭芭拉喊我加入这个3人聚会，所以它在这里也适用；她以为我在画室。其实我已经开始小睡，没有听见。
(Another invitation applies through the wedding invitation to the latest DAndreano wedding, recently received by Jane and me. Accepting this would also involve our journeying to Rochester.(另一个邀请适用于珍和我最近收到得安德里安诺的婚礼邀请。接受这个邀请，也表示我们会有一趟罗彻斯特的旅程。
(“With a brush or something that resembles it, with bristles.” Both Barbara and I use bristle brushes in our painting. In an oblique way this also leads to the next data.(“与一把刷子或某个类似的东西有关，和鬃毛刷有关。”芭芭拉和我都用鬃毛刷来画画。以一种拐弯抹角的方式，这也连结到下一个资料。
(“1821 or 1812, perhaps Milwaukee or Wisconsin.” As Seth tells us after break, this is a poor connection referring to the Victorian room at the Arnot Art Gallery where Jane worked a couple of years ago—and is thus another reference to Barbara and myself being artists. We saw no connection for Milwaukee or Wisconsin.(“1821或1812，也许是密尔瓦基或威斯康星。”正如赛斯在休息之后告诉我们的，这是一个拙劣的连结，指的是阿诺艺廊的维多利亚展览室，珍一两年前曾在那间艺廊工作过——因此这再次指出芭芭拉和我自己是画家。我们看不到密尔瓦基或威斯康星的关联。
(“The words A fine form of a woman.” Jane says this is a clear-enough reference to a remark Dick made when the group of three was sitting in the yard with their drinks, on the evening Jane wrote the poem used as object. Barbara asked Dick why he shouldn’t get married. Dick replied there was no reason he should, since he now sat with “two fine women,” both of them good looking; or words to that effect.(“一个女人的美好形体”这些字。珍说这是一个够清楚的参照，指的是珍写这首用作标的物的诗那天晚上，3个人坐在院子喝饮料，迪克当时说的一番话。芭芭拉问迪克为什么他不应该结婚。迪克回答说他没有结婚的理由，因为他现在与“两名美好的女人坐在一起”，两人都长得好看；或大意是这样的话。
(“A yellow square.” The poem to me was written by Jane on a piece of yellow typing paper the size of this page, and folded as indicated in the tracing on page 1. Jane had an image of a small yellow square. The object was folded into a rectangular shape, actually.(“一个黄色的正方形。”珍给我的诗写在一张黄色打字纸上，大小和这一页一样，如上面的描摹图所示的折叠。珍有一个黄色小型正方形的画面。其实标的物是折成长方形。
(Note that most of tonight’s data stems from the strong Emotional charges surrounding the gathering of Barbara, Dick and Jane in the backyard, during the time Jane wrote the poem to me used as object. I had picked the poem as object in the frank hope that it would have strong Emotional attraction for Jane. But this was overridden by the events and feelings engendered in the meeting of the three people.(注意今晚的资料大部分都出自于芭芭拉、迪克和珍在后院这场聚会的强烈情感能量，当时珍写了这首用作标的物的诗给我。我挑这首诗当作标的物，坦白说是希望它对珍有强烈的情感吸引力。但是3人聚会引发的事件和感觉却凌驾其上。
(“Black and white. Please reply. ’’ This is another reference to the upcoming wedding of Louie DAndreano, to which Jane and I have been invited. The announcement was printed in black ink on white, as is usual. It also requested that Jane and I reply in writing as to whether we planned to attend. Once again, the D’Andreano wedding data, involving the present one concerning Louie, and the distant one concerning my brother Dick, is called up by Jane's associations, because of the marriage talk between Barbara and Dick on the evening of July 3,1966, when Jane wrote the poem used as object.(“黑与白。请回复。”这又是指路易·得安德里安诺即将举行的婚礼，珍和我受邀参加。按照惯例，通知是用黑色墨水印在白纸上。再一次，得安德里安诺婚礼的资料与当下路易的婚礼有关，而且也和我弟弟迪克的婚礼有遥远的关联，因为在1966年7月3日，珍写这首用作标的物的诗那时候，芭芭拉和迪克谈到婚姻，所以珍经由联想而记起这件事。
(As stated, I had temporarily forgotten I knew nothing of the circumstances under which Jane had produced the poem used as object, and so wasn’t sure that Seth's data applied at all. This left me wondering about what questions to ask. I decided to go along as usual.(如上所述，我一时忘记我根本不知道珍在什么状况下创作了这首用作标的物的诗，所以完全不确定赛斯的资料适不适用。这让我想不出要问什么问题才好。我决定像往常一样提问。
(First Question: Can you say more about the yellow square? “I have the image of a small, neat yellow square, in a lower right hand position.” By now Jane had lowered the envelope from her usual position against her forehead, and sat with it dangling by one corner from her right hand; her right arm extended forward and down over the arm of the rocker. It is possible the yellow object inside the sealed envelope had settled into a corner. But it was a rectangular rather than square object.(第一个问题：你能不能多说一下黄色的正方形？“我有个画面是，一个小小、工整的黄色正方形，在右手边较低的位置。还有一种海蓝色。”这时珍已经把她习惯放在额头上的信封拿下来，坐着用右手抓着它晃来晃去；她的右手臂在摇椅的扶手上，朝前方向下伸长。但它是一个长方形而不是正方形的物件。
(“An aquamarine color also.” We don’t know. Jane wrote the poem with a dark colored pen; the ink is actually a gray-blue, but hardly aquamarine.(“还有一种海蓝色。”我们不知道。珍用深色的笔写了这首诗；墨水其实是灰蓝色，根本不是海蓝色。
(2nd Question: Who is the woman referred to in the card and portrait.(第二个问题：在卡片和肖像上提到的那个女人是谁？
(“The woman I believe strange to you, or at least in different surroundings or attire.” Jane was puzzled here. At break she said this data was an attempt by Seth to get her away from the D’Andreano family, the members of whom we know relatively well, back to Barbara, the newcomer to our apartment house, who is a relative stranger to us.“那个女人相信对你来说是陌生的，或至少在不同的环境或装扮下是这样。”这里珍不明所以。休息时，她说这个资料是赛斯的一个尝试，设法让她离开得安德里安诺家族——我们与他们一家子都相当熟悉——回到芭芭拉身上，她是我们这间公寓的新住户，对我们来说相当陌生。
(3rd Question: Who are the three people involved(第三个问题：牵涉在内的3个人是谁？
(”Two women perhaps and a man. One of the woman in the background." As stated on page 6, three people, two women and a man, were involved in the circumstances surrounding the creation of the poem used as object, on the evening of July 3,1966: Jane, Barbara and Dick. In this context it would seem that Barbara would be the woman in the background, since the actual envelope object was an item of Janes. Other interpretations could reverse this order however. We could wish the data were clearer.“也许是两个女人和一个男人。其中一个女人在背景中。不过，牵涉在内的还有其他人。这里有37，以及一个地方法官的关联。”如前面所述，1966年7月3日，在用作标的物的这首诗被创造的当时，它周遭的状况有3个人牵涉在内，两个女人和一个男人：珍、芭芭拉和迪克。在这个来龙去脉里，芭芭拉似乎就是背景中的女人，因为实际的信封是珍的一个物品。不过，其他的解读可能反转这个顺序。我们希望这个资料可以更清楚一点。
(“However others are involved also.” Jane said this was a reference to me, lying asleep upstairs. She wrote the poem used as object to me. In physical terms I was quite close to the group as I lay asleep. They were sitting no more than 30 feet away; our bedroom being at the back of our apartment, on the second floor.(“不过，牵涉在内的还有其他人。”珍说这指的是我，在楼上躺着睡觉。她写了这首用作标的物的诗给我。实质上，我躺着睡觉的地方距离这群人颇近。他们坐在不超过30英尺的地方；我们的卧室位于公寓后方的二楼。
(“37 here and a magistrate connection.” Jane herself is 37 years old, and Barbaras boyfriend Dick is either that age also or very close to it. The magistrate connection arises out of the wedding conversation which was a feature of the groups gathering on the evening of July 3.(“这里有37，以及一个地方法官的关联。”珍本人是37岁，芭芭拉的男友迪克的岁数不是37就是非常接近。地方法官的关联出自于有关婚礼的交谈，这是7月3日傍晚聚会的一个要点。
(4th Question: What's that four plus one(第四个问题：4加1是什么？
(”Four plus one life. Vito." This is enigmatic to us, although the Vito connection is clear. Vito is one of the sons in the DAndreano family and was married a couple of years ago. Thus Jane returned here to the wedding idea through the D'Andreano family.“4加1。维托。”这对我们来说是个谜，但是维托的关联是清楚的。维托是得安德里安诺家的其中一个儿子，一两年前结婚了。因此经由得安德里安诺家族，珍这里又回到婚礼的意念上。
(“And tissue paper.” Another connection to the D'Andreano family. The wedding announcement and the invitation we received concerning the forthcoming marriage of Louie DAndreano, contained the usual tissue paper interleaves.(“还有面纸。”另一个和得安德里安诺家族有关的连结。我们收到和路易·得安德里安诺即将到来与婚礼有关的通知和请柬，里面放着普通的薄纸插页。
(Jane resumed, with her eyes closed and wearing her glasses, at 10:56.)(10:56分，珍闭着眼睛，戴着眼镜继续。)
We will close our session.我们要结束这节课了。
The interruption did cause poor reception for the envelope data. Under the circumstances however it was adequate.中断的确造成信封资料的接收不良。不过在这样的状况下，资料够充分了。
1812 (pause)was, a distant connection at best. Ruburt and the man (meaning Barbaras boyfriend, Dick) spoke of Jamieson.1812(停顿)充其量只是一个遥远的关联。鲁柏和这个男人
(The art director of the Amot Art Gallery at the time Jane worked there). This was a poor association, leading to the Victorian room at the gallery, you see.(指的是芭芭拉的男友迪克)谈到杰米森(Jamieson，珍在阿诺画廊工作时的艺术总监)这是一个拙劣的联想，你看，结果是出现画廊的维多利亚展览室。
My heartiest regards to you both. This session should be of considerable benefit to you, Joseph.我向你们两位致上最衷心的问候。这一节对你，约瑟，应该有莫大的助益。
("Yes.")(“是的”。)
We will take some time in the future with Ruburt and health connections. We will always return to our data however, of course.我们未来会花点时间谈谈鲁柏和健康的关联。不过，我们当然会再回到我们的资料上。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:01. Jane was dissociated as usual.)(11:01分结束。珍一如往常出离。)

SESSION 282 第282节　根源梦


AUGUST 31, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年8月31日　星期三　晚上9点
(Jane had no idea of what Seth would discuss during the session. She was rather tired and yawning by 9 PM. She began speaking while sitting down and with her eyes closed, and with a slow pace.)(珍完全不晓得赛斯在这一节会讨论什么。到了9点，她很累了，打着哈欠。她坐下来，闭上眼睛，同时开始讲话，速度缓慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
In all our sessions we have been dealing with the mobility of consciousness, with its nature and extent.在我们所有的课当中，我们一直在处理意识的流动，探讨它的本质和范围。
In dreams consciousness operates to some degree independently of the physical system. In projections this independence is more pronounced. In physical death of course the connection between consciousness and matter is broken. It is broken and yet not entirely severed.在梦中，意识某种程度上独立运作于物质系统之外。在投射中，这种独立更为显著。当然在肉体死亡时，意识与物质之间的连结中断了。它中断了，但是没有完全切断。
There is a period of which we have not previously spoken, when the personality continues to hover within the physical system, with however certain freedoms that it did not previously possess. During such periods, as has been suggested elsewhere, the personality can merge, blend or change various aspects of his previous existences, using them as you, Joseph, use colors.有一个时期我们之前没有讲过，在那段期间，人格继续徘徊在物质系统之内，但是拥有它之前没有的某些自由。在这样的时期当中，就像其他地方说过的，人格能够融合、混合或改变它各个前世具有的不同面向，约瑟，就像你使用颜色那样，使用各个面向。
This is a private system, the personality using lessons that it has learned from the immediately previous experience. If no lessons have been learned, then on some occasions there may be a psychic reliving of past experience for the individual involved. This will produce, usually, no actual return to physical events, but a reenactment of them. It is possible however for the energy being used to act as a trigger that momentarily recreates sensual data under some conditions.这是一个私人的系统，人格运用它从上一世经验学到的教训。如果没有学到任何教训，那么在某些情况下，涉及的个体可能在心灵上重新活过以前的经验。通常，这不会造成个体实际回到物质事件，而是重演事件。不过，过去习惯充当触媒的能量存在体，在某些状况下，倒是有可能暂时重新创造出感官觉受的资料。
Various kinds of apparitions can be explained in this manner. There is however no one explanation that will serve, for there are many kinds of apparitions. All are valid to some degree.可以用这种方式来解释各种不同的显灵(apparition)。不过，没有一个解释是一体适用的，因为显灵有很多种类。全部都有某种程度的效力。
In projections, for example, you may appear as an apparition within your own system or in another system. You may on the other hand yourself encounter apparitions. Some may be ideas of strong import, which you encounter in physical terms. These may belong to the past, present or future, in your terms.在投射中，比如说，你可能在你自己的系统或另一个系统里看起来是一个显灵。另一方面，你自己可能会遇见显灵。有些可能是意义重大的意念，你在物质层面与之相遇。这些可能属于你们所谓的过去、现在和未来。
You may encounter apparitions that are actual visitors from another system. They may or may not know that they are perceived. Very early in our sessions I spoke of primary and Secondary constructions . You can of course form secondary projections, or fragments, and rather consciously control them, as will be the case in any deliberate, (underlined,) projections.你可能会遇见显灵是来自另一个系统的真实访客。它们可能知道也可能不知道有人感知到它们。在我们的课刚开始不久，我谈过主要和次要建构。你当然能够形成次要投射，或片段体，而且相当有意识地控制它们，在任何刻意为之——划线——的投射当中，情形就是这样。
Dream objects are Secondary constructions , but very valid ones. Now they do have much more than an imaginative reality, and they do possess consciousness, but a fragmentary consciousness, that can however further develop.梦中物体是次要建构，但是非常有效。现在，它们拥有确实远远不只是想像的实相，而且它们的确具有意识，但是，是零碎不全的意识，不过这种意识是可以进一步发展的。
You are quite aware of these constructions as the inner self keeps track of them. You act out many possibilities within dream reality, and within dreams you try out alternatives, and not necessarily short term ones.你对这些建构相当有觉知，因为内我会追踪它们的动态。你在梦实相之内将很多可能性付诸行动，而且在梦实相之内，你也尝试种种替代选项，不一定是短期的选项。
(Jane’s eyes opened, very dark. She looked at me.)(珍张开眼睛，颜色很深。她注视着我。)
You would have made an excellent doctor, for example. In your terms you worked out this possibility by weaving, over a period of three years, a dream framework in which you learned exactly what your life would have been, had you gone into medicine.举例来说，你可能会是一个卓越的医生。按照你们的说法，在3年的期间内，你借由编织一个梦架构，来实现这个可能性，在这个架构中，你确实了解你要是行医的话，生活会是什么样子。
Again, this was more than imagination. In the dream state you experienced literally a future life that existed as a definite possibility. You examined a probability, in other words, and chose another.再一次，这不只是想像而已。在梦状态中，你名副其实体验一个未来的生命，它是以一种明确的可能性形式存在。换句话说，你检视一个可能的结果，再选择另一个。
The physician, you see, existed in some dimension, and continues to do so. Obviously there were financial limitations as far as education was concerned. Subconsciously however you leaned in that direction to some fairly considerable extent. This is all difficult to explain. You met, for example, patients. Some of these people you also know in the life that you chose.这个医生，你知道，存在某个维度里，而且继续这样存在。就教育而言，显然有财务上的限制。然而，在潜意识里，你相当大的程度倾向于那个方向。这一切解释起来很不容易。比方说，你见到病人。这些病人有的是你在你选择的生命里也认识的人。
This traveling in probable systems goes on constantly, with variations, in the dream state. The individual chooses then which probabilities he desires to make actual in physical terms.在可能系统里的这种旅行，一直在梦状态中不断持续，有着种种的变化。然后个体选择他渴望在物质层面实现的可能结果。
You may take a break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:32. Jane was very well dissociated—Jar-out, she said. Her pace was never fast, and her eyes had opened very few times. She was tired.(9:32分休息。珍非常出离——她说，出去很远。她的速度一直都不快，眼睛睁开的次数很少。她累了。
(I had no conscious memories of being interested in medicine while in my teens, but then neither do I recall dreams from that period. Perhaps eight years ago I did a series of medical illustrations for the hospital in Sayre, PA. I enjoyed doing these very much, and remember being surprised at the time at the aptitude I seemed to show for such work. I had never done such work before. The work won prizes during its travels about the country.(对于我10几岁那时有兴趣学医的事情，我没有任何有意识的记忆，但是我也不记得那段时期的梦。也许是8年前，我为宾州塞尔市[Sayre]的医院画了一系列医学插画。我非常乐在其中，也记得当时我对自己在这样的创作上似乎展现出的天分感到惊讶。我以前从来没做过这种工作。这个作品在巡回全国展出时赢了许多奖项。
(Jane resumed at a somewhat faster pace, her eyes opening more often, at 9:44.)(9:44分，珍以略微加快的速度继续，两眼较常睁开。)
The point is that such dream episodes represent probable physical reality.重点是，这样的梦情节代表可能的物质实相。
In one such episode, for example, you followed through your present course to completion. Therefore you are aware subconsciously of your own future, since you chose it.在一个这样的情节中，比方说，你从头到尾走完当下的过程。所以你在潜意识里觉察到自己的未来，因为你选择它。
Now. There are always backings off, you see, and new choices however. You may at any point choose differently now. The various choice possibilities were known in the dream episodes. You foresaw then future possibilities within the main choice system.现在。放弃总是有的，你知道，但是也有新的选择。现在你任何时候都可以做出不同的选择。在梦情节中，不同的选择可能性是可知的。所以你预先看见未来在主要选择系统之内的可能性。
In your present daily life the same process continues. Most of these dreams are very disconnected from the ego, and will seldom be recalled. The self who pursues these divergent paths is actual however. These are legitimate projections. They represent systems of reality of which you are not aware.在你当下的日常生活中，同样的过程持续不停。这些梦大部分与自我的连结非常少，很少会被记得。不过，追寻这些岔路却是实际存在的。这些是真实的投射。它们代表你没有觉知的实相系统。
The doctor, you see, that you might have been and are not in this system, once dreamed of a probable universe in which he would be an artist. He continues to work out his own probabilities. Perhaps he paints as a hobby. He exists however in fact, within another system. You call his system an alternate system of probability but this is precisely what he would call your system.你可能成为不在这个系统的那个医生，你知道，曾经梦见一个可能的宇宙，他在其中是一个画家。他继续发展他自己的可能性。也许他的嗜好是画画。不过，他事实上存在于另一个系统之内。你称他的系统为可能性的替代系统，但他正好也这样称呼你的系统。
Now you will have some experiences that are shared in the dream state. They will be involved with episodes familiar to you both before you went your separate ways. You are like two limbs from the same tree. You recognize the same mother. Some of these probable systems are based upon molecular structure, and your appearances in such systems would be similar, though not identical, you see.现在你们在梦状态中会有一些共享的经验。它们会涉及到你们双方分道扬镳之前熟悉的情节。你们就像同一棵树的两根枝干。你们认得同一个母亲。这些可能的系统有些是奠基在分子结构上，而在这样的系统中，你们的外表虽然不会一模一样，但你知道，会长得很像。
Now the dreams that you would have, and had, in shared experience, are root dreams. Such root dreams serve as a method of maintaining inner identity, and of communication. There may be flashes of realization in such dreams. Projections may occur also from root dreams. You may project for example into the life of that physician.现在，你们会做以及做过的梦，在共享的经验中，都是根源梦(root dream)。这样的根源梦是维持内在本体以及沟通的一个方法。在这样的梦中可能会有灵光一现的顿悟。投射也可能发生在根源梦中。比如你可能投射到那个医生的生命中。
I am using you here and the physician probability as an example. Art, you see, is also closely connected with healing. The projections of which I spoke do happen occasionally and spontaneously on both of your parts. Various aspects of the personality are being developed, you see. Reincarnation is but a part of this probability system, the part that falls within your particular universe. This all involves value fulfillment, which is at its basis. It is obvious then that you perceive consciously only a small part of your own overall reality. The doctor obviously has his own ego, though not within your system.这里我是举你与这个医生的可能性为例。艺术，你知道，也和疗愈有着密切的连结。我说的投射确实偶尔会发生在你们双方身上。你看，人格的各个面向正在被发展出来。转世只不过是这个可能系统的一部分，落在你特定宇宙之内的那部分。这全都和价值完成有关，价值完成是它的根本。所以，你在意识上感知的显然只是你自己整个实相的一小部分。这个医生显然有他自己的自我，但不在你的系统之内。
You may take a brief break, and we shall continue.你可以短暂休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 10:02. Jane was again well dissociated. Her pace had picked up somewhat, her eyes opening more often. She still felt tired however.(10:02分休息。珍再一次顺利出离。她的速度稍微加快，双眼更常睁开。不过她还是觉得疲倦。
(When she resumed at 10:10 her eyes remained closed.)(她在10:10分继续时，眼睛还是闭着。)
There are also some root dreams shared by the race as a whole. Most of these are not as symbolic however as Jung thought them to be, though he used a different term, and had only a dim conception of them. Many root dreams are literal interpretations of abilities used by the inner self.也有一些是同一个种族共享的根源梦。然而，这些大部分都像荣格认为的那样，是象征性质的梦，只不过他用了不同的说法，而且对它们的见解含糊不清。很多根源梦是对内我使用的能力所做的直译。
Flying dreams you see are not symbolic of anything. They are valid and actual experiences, though often intermixed with other dream elements. Falling dreams are experience. They represent downward motion in your system, or a loss of form control during projection. They may of course be embellished with other material.飞行梦你知道不是任何东西的象征。它们是有效又真实的经验，但是经常与其他梦元素交互混合。坠落梦是经验。它们代表，在你的系统中向下的动作，或无法在投射期间控制形式。当然，其他资料也可能美化它们。
(Jane now took a pause that lasted at least two minutes. She sat quite still in her chair, her head down, eyes closed.)(珍现在停顿下来，持续至少两分钟。她安静地坐在椅子上，文风不动，头垂下来，双眼闭着。)
For now, simply record the following impressions.此时，只要记录以下的印象就好：
A boy, three years old. An incident involving a birthday cake, and fire, though not disastrous. This is in the past.一个男孩，3岁大。一个与生日蛋糕和火有关的事故，但没有酿成灾难。这是过去的事。
The name, Jerry. A room, perhaps a living room, with a stove. Perhaps a potbellied one in it, and lace curtains. The boy liked peanut butter, perhaps eating it from a spoon on occasion.名字，杰瑞(Jerry)。一个房间，也许是起居室，有一座火炉。里面也许是一个圆形火炉，还有蕾丝窗帘。这个男孩喜欢花生酱，也许偶尔会用汤匙挖着吃。
An important incident in 1923.在1923年的一个重要事故。
(Another long pause.) A school with a bell. A womans name, like a variation of Mary; for example, Mary and Mary Ann. A stout man. The initials B, M. These could be B and M, applying to two different people.(又一次长时间的停顿)一间有一个钟的学校。一个女人的名字，像从玛丽变化而来的名字：例如，玛丽和玛丽安。一个粗壮的男人。首字母B、M。这些可能是B和M，适用于两个不同的人。
The year 1906.1906年。
(Long pause.) These apply to Wollheim or Fell . Presently Ruburt has the two so closely in mind that I am not sure.(长时间停顿)这些适用于韦翰(Wollheim)或费尔(Fell)。目前鲁柏紧记着这两人，因此我不确定。
(Pause.)(停顿)
My heartiest wishes to you both.向你们两位致上我最衷心的祝福。
A red car. I do not know if this is a present car, or a car the man owned as a boy—a toy car. But a red car is connected here. Or wagon.一辆红车。我不知道这是现在的一辆车，还是这个男人小时候拥有的一辆车——一辆玩具车。但是这里和一车红车有关联。或是旅行车。
We will close the session.我们要结束这一节了。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:28. Jane was again far-out. Her eyes remained closed. She was aware of the first long pause, lasting at least two minutes. She knew something was coming, but not what, and afterward didn’t know whether it applied to Don Wollheim or to Frederick Fell , editor and publisher respectively.(10:28分结束。珍再一次出去很远。她的眼睛一直闭着。她对第一次长时间的停顿有觉知，那次持续了两分钟。她知道有东西来了，但不知道是什么，事后也不晓得它适用于唐恩·韦翰[Don Wollheim]还是弗雷德里克·费尔[Frederick Fell]，两人分别是编辑和发行人。
(Jane said she well remembers the potbellied stove in the living room of her own house as a child, and she thought this fact might have been an association that at least helped bring about the above data.(珍说她清楚记得小时候在她自己家的起居室那个圆形火炉，她认为这个事实可能是至少有助于带出上述资料的一个联想。
(Don Wollheim and his wife and daughter visited us Friday evening, September 2. This session was held on Wednesday, August 31, but was not typed up by Friday. We meant to check it with Don Wollheim, but in the course of a busy evening did not do so. We plan to send copies now to both Don Wollheim and F. Fell .)(9月2日星期五傍晚，唐恩·韦翰夫妇带着他们的女儿来拜访。这一节课在8月31日星期三举行，但是一直到星期五才打好字。我们本来要和唐恩·韦翰一起核对，因为整晚都在忙，所以没这么做。我们现在计划把副本寄给唐恩·韦翰和弗雷德里克·费尔。

SESSION 283 第283节　珍的私人课　外在自我　信封69


SEPTEMBER 5, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年9月5日　星期一　晚上9点
(The envelope object for the 69th experiment was a colored postcard sent to us by Barbara Ingold, our neighbor who lives below us on the first floor. Colors on the front and back of the object are indicated to some degree on the tracing on page 16. Jane hadn’t seen the card since we received it. As usual I placed it between two pieces of Bristol then sealed it in double envelopes.(第69次实验的信封标的物是一张彩色明信片，住在我们楼下的一楼邻居芭芭拉·殷戈尔德[Barbara Ingold]寄来的。这个物件正面和背面的颜色一部分标示在上面的描摹图上。自从我们收到这张明信片以来，珍还没有看过它。一如往常，我把它放在两张西卡纸中间，然后密封在双层信封内。
(The date within the circular cancellation is not clear as far as the last two letters go. At first glance it might be taken either for June or July, but from other records we keep we were able to verify to our satisfaction that Barbara mailed the card to us in July 1966.(就最后两个字母而言，圆形邮戳内的资料是不清楚的。乍看之下，它可能是6月或7月，但从我们保留的其他记录看来，芭芭拉是不是在1966年7月寄这张明信片给我们，却无法验证到我们觉得满意的程度。
(Jane had no idea of what Seth was going to talk about before the session began. As usual she began delivering the data while sitting down, her eyes open from the beginning; she was also smoking. Actually Jane's eyes were closed for much of the material. Her pace was average, her voice also.)(在这一节开始之前，珍完全不知道赛斯打算谈什么。一如往常，她坐下来，同时开始传述资料，眼睛从一开始就闭上；她还抽着烟。其实在传述大部分资料时，珍的眼睛都是闭着的。她的速度不疾不徐，声音也是。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
You cannot escape action. The ego attempts to so order events as to direct action along its own lines.你无法逃离行动。自我试图这样安排事件，以便指挥行动按照它自己的路线走。
It must, of course, succeed to some extent, or the physically oriented personality as you know it would not exist. The ego is of course a part of action. There are endless levels of action however, which the ego does not perceive. It is possible for the inner and outer egos to merge to some extent, and this merging when it occurs does indeed represent the formation of a new kind of consciousness.当然，它某种程度上必定是成功的，不然你所知的物质导向人格就不存在了。自我当然是行动的一部分。然而，行动有无穷无尽的层面是自我感知不到的。内在自我和外在自我是可能融合到某种程度，而且这种融合在发生时的确代表一种新意识的形成。
This concept is hardly a new one. It is not a generally accepted theory, but it has ancient roots. When you carry the waking I into the dream state, this is one approach to this different consciousness. There is also an opening up that can occur in the waking condition. When this occurs the inner and outer egos merge. The outer ego recognizes its own duties, but it is aware that more is involved.这个观念算不上是新观念。它不是一般公认的理论，但它却源远流长。当你带着醒时的我(waking I)进入梦状态，这就是通往此一不同意识的途经。还有一个门户可能出现在醒时状况中。当这个门户开启时，内在自我和外在自我就会融合。外在自我认得它自己的职责，但它也觉察到还有更多东西牵涉在内。
It senses realities usually closed to it. It thinks, “There is more, but beyond I cannot follow.” Here with this realization the inner ego may suddenly open. Intuitive springs rush to the surface, and because the outer ego has already been alerted, it is able to accept these realities while still performing its ordinary duties.外在自我感应到它通常不得其门而入的实相。它想：“还有更多，但是我无法跟过去。”这里，有了这个了悟之后，内在自我可能会突然开启。直觉泉源冲到表面，因为外在自我已经改变了，它能够接受这些实相，同时依然履行它平常的职责。
The knowledge then available is first of all creative, intuitive knowledge which the outer ego may translate into intellectual terms when possible. But it is no longer fearful of intuitive data. It no longer fights the inner senses, nor does it fear for its own survival in the midst of intuitional onrushes.然后可以取得的知识首先是创造、直觉的知识，如果可能，外在自我就会翻译成理智层面的说法。但它再也不怕直觉资料。它再也不抗拒内在感官，也不再恐惧它自己在直觉洪流之中的存活。
It recognizes its position as a part of the whole self. This is indeed a released, free consciousness. It does represent a giant step forward. It opens doors otherwise closed, and it automatically brings with it a state of excellent, buoyant physical health.它认清自己身为全我一部分的位置。这真的是一个已经解放的自由意识。它确实代表往前迈进的一大步。它打开了若非如此依然封闭的门户，而且自动带来一种身体健康绝佳又快活的状态。
Identity is no longer limited to the outer ego alone. The outer ego is now familiar with the whole self, or the entire identity, and has available to it strength of which it was not previously aware. In periods of exuberance, when you are working well, and your health is extraordinarily good, when you are able to remember and manipulate your dreams, then such periods are signs of the emergence of this new consciousness.本体再也不受限于只有外在自我了。外在自我现在熟悉全我或整个本体，拥有它之前没有觉察到的力量可以取用。在朝气蓬勃的时期，你做事顺利，你的健康非比寻常地好，你能够记得并且操纵你的梦，所以这样的时期是这种意识出现的征兆。
In the beginning you will not retain it steadily. It will grow by leaps and bounds however. Its growth has nothing to do with your physical time, but with inner value fulfillments of which you may not be consciously aware. This last is important. Contrary to usual opinion, periods of poor health are often the result of egotistic rather than subconscious manipulations.一开始，你不会平稳地保有这种新意识。然而，它会以跳跃的方式成长。它的成长与你们的物理时间一点关系都没有，但是与你可能在意识上没有觉察到的内在价值完成有关。最后这一句很重要。与一般的看法相反的是，健康不佳的时期往往是自我本位(egotistic)而不是潜意识的操纵造成的结果。
(Long pause.) You become overconcerned with the egotistical situations, and hamper the inner self.(长时间停顿)你变得过度担忧自我本位的状况，而妨碍了内我。
You tie yourself in knots, so to speak. You think so rigidly of concerns that are primarily insignificant to you, as a whole self(long pause, eyes closed) and make a fetish of them. You identify, despite your knowledge, mainly with the ego. This cuts you off from the inner self. I am speaking generally here, to you. Joseph, applying no more to you than anyone else.可以说，你自己困住自己了。对你，一个整体的自己(闭着眼睛，长时间停顿)，根本微不足道的担忧之事，你却如此固执己见，沉迷耽溺在其中。不管你知不知道，你的本体主要是和自我在一起。这切断了你和内我的连结。我在这里讲的是一般情形，对你，约瑟，对你和对任何人都适用。
I am however directing this particular discussion toward Ruburt. As far as his overall personality structure is concerned, creativity is a must. Without it he does not feel secure. His identity is strongly connected with his creativity. The financial success of his book is extremely important to you both, incidentally, on a conscious egotistical level.不过，我要把这个特定的讨论引导到鲁柏身上。就他整体的人格结构而言，创造力是一个必要条件。没有它，他就没有安全感。他的本体非常担忧他的创造力。顺便一提，在一个有意识并以自我为中心的层面上，他的书在财务上的成功对你们两人来说都极为重要。
Such financial success is therefore important, and has its place, but when Ruburt allows himself to become overly concerned with this, then he identifies too closely with the ego alone. There are obvious financial moves he intends to make. Well and good. These moves are not however basically important to the personality as a whole. They should be taken simply, but the overall energies should be used in creativity. When he identifies too closely with the ego he loses inner direction.因此在财务上的这种成功是重要的，而且有它的位置，但是，当鲁柏允许他自己变得过度担忧这件事的时候，他就会太过于只认同自我。在财务上，他显然有他打算采取的行动。很不错。然而，这些行动基本上对整体的人格而言并不重要。应该简单去做就好，但是全部的能量应该用在创造上。当他太过认同自我的时候，他就会失去内在的方向。
Are your hands tired?你的手累了吗？
(“No. ”)(“不累。”)
The main energy and concern therefore should be in his work. Inner broodings over whether or not his book will sell well do no good, and drain away energy. All of this reflects itself in the physical condition.因此主要的能量和关注应该放在他的工作上。内在对他的书卖得好不好的忧思，不但没有任何好处，还会耗尽能量。这一切全都自行反映在身体状况中。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:33. Jane had been out as usual. Her pace had been average, her eyes mostly closed; she had taken a few long pauses. She resumed in the same manner, smoking once more, at 9:40.)(9:33分休息。珍一如往常出去了。她的速度中等，双眼大部分时间闭着；她有几次长时间的停顿。9:40分，她以同样的方式继续，再度抽起烟来。)
Now. Ruburt is simply lucky. He responds to the autumn, and the system will automatically adjust itself.现在。鲁柏就是幸运。她回应秋天，系统就会自动调整它自己。
If he first of all focuses his abilities in his creative pursuits, then everything else will follow. He will have the energy to do whatever else he should do. But he must primarily focus his energies in his creative pursuits, for these give him the exuberance that makes other pursuits possible.如果他首先把自己的能力集中在追求他的创作喜好上，那么其他的一切就会随之而来。他将会拥有他应该做什么就做什么的能量。但是他首先必须把他的能量集中在追求创作喜好上，因为这些会带给他蓬勃朝气去追求其他的喜好。
When these symptoms show themselves, then he should look out for health difficulties. There is nothing seriously wrong with his system, nor do I foresee any serious difficulties. However he has his own pattern. The symptoms are these: Poor memory, or none, of his dreams; no poetry; a consistent lowerthan-usual level of exuberance. These are the main ones, and I am speaking of perhaps a two-month period here.当这些症状出现时，他就应该留心提防健康出状况。他的系统没什么大毛病，我也没有预见任何严重的问题。不过，他有他自己的模式。症状如下：不太记得或完全不记得他的梦；没有写诗；活力持续低于平常。这些是主要症状，我这里讲的可能是一次持续两个月的时间。
If these persist for this period, you see, only then can they be considered in this light. For if they endure for this time they will almost certainly give rise to physical symptoms. Readjustment does not lie, in his particular case, in the present, with soaking his foot for example; but with a return to some definite poetry schedule, to finishing one book now at a time, to renewing the dream suggestions which he has discarded. These will take care of the physical symptoms.如果在这段期间一直有这些症状，你知道，才可以从这个角度考虑它们。因为，如果它们持续这么久一段时间，那就几乎一定会引发身体症状。在他的特定情况中，重新调整并不是发生在当下，比方说泡脚之类的；而是恢复某种明确的写诗时间表、现在一次完成一本书、更新他已经放弃的梦暗示。这些调整都会照顾到身体的症状。
He has finally decided to make financial steps. Now, I do not believe they will be necessary. Both of you do believe them necessary. Therefore you see to you, or to Ruburt, this becomes a necessity. He is now ready to accept this rather than brood, and this will be of help, for the brooding drained his energy. The brooding however, rather than the necessity, you see, was the difficulty. The energies and focus must be directed away from the physical symptoms. He is reinforcing them inadvertently. The creative energy, properly used, will drain away the energy that is now forming the symptoms.他终于决定在财务上采取行动。现在，我不相信这些步骤是有必要的。你们两人的确相信有其必要。因此对你、对鲁柏，你们看到这件事变成一种需要。他现在准备要接受这件事，而不要担忧，这是有帮助的，因为忧思耗尽了他的能量。但是，你看，忧思才是问题所在，而不是需要。一定要把能量和焦点从身体症状移开。他无意间正在强化它们。要是善用创造能量的话，就会消耗掉现在正形成症状的能量。
Were the symptoms serious, physical therapy would be necessary, but they are not serious. There is no real necessity now for me to tell you this, since his system is at its best in the autumn. But the symptoms could have occurred when a high cycle was not approaching, in which case further difficulties could have arisen.症状要是严重的话，就有必要治疗身体，但它们并不严重。对我来说现在其实没有必要告诉你这件事，因为他的系统在秋天状况最好。但是，当一个高度循环周期(high cycle)没有到来时，进一步的问题就会发生，这时症状便可能出现。
These symptoms will always be a part of his pattern. They can serve as guideposts therefore. An emergency therapy will almost always bring immediate results: A week of time given to poetry, simply because this pursuit awakens in Ruburt the strongest aspects of his personality, and frees constructive energy from other layers of his personality.这些症状永远都是他这个模式的一部分。因此它们可以当作路标来用。紧急治疗几乎都会带来立即的结果：一周时间用来写诗，只因为这个喜好在鲁柏身上唤醒了他人格当中更强大的面向，把人格其他层面的建设性能量释放出来。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:56. Jane was dissociated as usual, her eyes closed for the most part, her pace average. She resumed at 10:01.)(9:56分休息。珍一如往常出离，她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着，她的速度中等。她在10:01分继续。)
This newer type of consciousness would automatically allow you to understand, at a glance so to speak, the inner workings of your own personalities.这个更新型的意识会自动让你了解，可以说是一瞥，你自己人格的内在运作。
Much of the needed development takes place in the dream state. I wanted to mention that particular dream of yours, Joseph, in which you saw yourself at your back window. There was a merging of inner and outer egos. The startled outer ego did indeed hold you back from an excellent projection.需要的发展很多都发生在梦状态中。约瑟，我想要提一下你在你家的后窗看到你自己的那一个梦。内在自我和外在自我融合了。受到惊吓的外在自我确实拦住你，不让你有一次绝佳的投射。
(See my dream for August 20.)(参见我在8月20日的梦。)
It was aware, and conscious. However it was simply frightened to find what seemed like the body in a position normally impossible for it. The next time it will go further. In the same way however you will both find the inner ego inserting itself into periods of waking consciousness, and there may or may not be a momentary disorientation.它是有觉知也有意识的。然而，它只是因为发现身体好像处于一个平常不可能的位置，所以吓到了。下一次，它会改进。不过，同样的，你们两人也会发现内在自我把它自己安插在醒时意识期间，而且可能会或可能不会暂时迷失方向。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(At 10:06 Jane took the sealed envelope from me for the 69th experiment. She pressed it to her forehead in a horizontal position with her right hand, her eyes closed. Somehow I knew the results of the experiment would be good.)(10:06分，珍从我手上拿了第69次实验的信封。她用右手把横向的信封放在额头上，两眼闭着。不知何故，我就是晓得这次实验会有好结果。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.等我们一下，这些是印象。
Something oval. Egg-shaped (pause) as a thin oval line just inside of a rectangular card.某个椭圆形的东西。蛋形(停顿)，就像在一张长方形卡片里面有一条椭圆形细线那样。
A connection with a session. With, now(Jane gestured with the envelope, her eyes closed) my impression here is of a desk, or chair connected with a desk. The type used in classrooms. I do not know if this refers to a child who attends school, to a teacher, or to someone such as your friends downstairs who have such an object.与一节课有关联。与——现在(珍闭着眼睛，拿着信封比手势)这里我的印象是一张书桌或是与书桌有关联的椅子，教室用的那一种，我不知道这指的是一个在上学的小孩、一个老师还是某个拥有这样一个物品的人，比如住你们楼下的朋友。
Again, a formal affair connected here. One seven. Perhaps two one. That is, a formal affair or formal arrangement.再一次，这里与一个正式的活动有关联。一个7。也许两个1。也就是说，一个正式的活动或正式的约定。
Red. Two children. A connection with an item usually unavailable. With a machine of some kind. A spectacular arrangement.红色。两个小孩。与通常无法取得的一个物件有关联。和某一种机器有关联。与一个引人注目的布置有关联。
A garden. A variety of small circles, fitting one inside the other, like jewelry Like some earrings.一座花园。各式各样的小圆圈，一个套着一个，像首饰。像某种耳环。
A wooded area. Vases. A distant connection with wine or a wine house. Printed matter, near the center. A date, perhaps June of this year. Also a connection with September. One six.一个长满树木的区域。许多瓶子。和葡萄酒或一家酒庄有关联。印刷品，靠近正中央。一个日期，也许是今年6月。此外也和9月有关联。一个6。
I believe the item came through the mail, or is connected with mail. In any case the impression of a round cancellation shape. And many, more than one, reddish colored stamps. And some blue. With a figure.我相信物件是邮寄过来的，或是和邮件有关联。不管怎样，印象就是一个圆形邮戳的形状。还有很多，不止一个，红色调的彩色邮票。以及某种蓝色。有一个人物。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题。
("What is the spectacular arrangement you mentioned?” )(“你提到那个引人注目的安排是什么？”
I am not sure. It may have to do with flowers.我不确定。它可能和花有关。
(“Can you say who is involved?"(“你能不能说出牵涉在内的是谁？”
(Pause.) Ruburt here thinks of his corn, and Lois.(停顿)这里鲁柏想到他的玉米和洛伊丝(Lois)。
(“Can you say something about wine or the wine house?”(“你能不能说说葡萄酒或酒庄的事？”
(Pause. Jane lowered the envelope to her lap.) Liquor connection. A visit to a place where it is sold. A man here.(停顿。珍把信封拿下来，放在大腿上)与烈酒有关。去拜访一个被卖掉的地方。这里有一个男人。
(“What’s that connection about a session?” )(“与一节课的关联是什么？”
Our sessions were discussed, or the item is closely connected to one used previously in our sessions.我们的课被讨论，或是物件与之前我们上课时用过的一个物品密切相关。
You may take a break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:25. Jane was out as usual. Her eyes remained closed from the time the envelope experiment began. She had images while speaking, and these will be mentioned later.(10:25分休息。珍一如往常出去了。她的眼睛从信封实验一开始就一直闭着。她在说话时有画面，稍后会提到这些画面。
(See the tracings of the object on page 16. The object was a postcard mailed to us by Barbara Ingold from Ft. Belvoir, VA, on July 12,1966. It is of a display called Story Book Land at Woodbridge, VA, and shows Mother Goose. Barbara lives in the downstairs apartment, beneath us.(见上面的描摹图。标的物是一张明信片，芭芭拉·殷戈尔德在1966年7月12日从维吉尼亚州贝尔沃堡[Fort Belvoir,VA]寄来的。画面是位于维吉尼亚州伍德布里吉[Woodbridge]名为故事书乐园[Story Book Land]的景象，也有鹅妈妈[Mother Goose]。芭芭拉住楼下公寓，就在我们下面。
(One image Jane had while speaking was of Barbara 's boyfriend Dick, and of the very colorful plaid sports jacket he wore. Jane saw Dick wearing this today. This is a legitimate connection, since the image served to bring up the idea of Barbara, who sent us the card used as object.(在说话时，珍有一个画面是，芭芭拉的男友迪克以及他穿的那件颜色非常缤纷的格纹运动外套。这是一个合理的关联，因为这个画面带出了芭芭拉的意念，而用作标的物的明信片就是她寄给我们的。
(I picked the card deliberately because it had an Emotional attachment to Jane, versus such a neutral object as a leaf, a clipping from a magazine, etc. In these experiments we try to show that an original Emotional attachment can lead to valid clairvoyant! telepathic data. However Jane had not seen the object since we received it in July, and consciously had forgotten its existence.(我故意挑这张明信片，因为相对于诸如一张纸页、一张杂志剪报等等的中性物件，它对珍来说有一份情感依附其上。在这些实验当中，我们尝试呈现的是，原本的情感依附可能会带出有效的千里眼/心电感应资料。不过，珍并没有见过标的物，因为我们收到它的时候是7月，而且在意识上已经忘记它的存在。
(Seth offered no help with the data but Jane and I made our own connections.(赛斯在资料上并没有提供任何协助，但珍和我自己找出连结。
(“Something oval. Egg-shaped as a thin oval line just inside of a rectangular card.” The object is rectangular and is a card. There is no oval shape just within its borders however, either literal or implied, although there are several oval shapes within the picture on the card, as well as the circular postmark on the back. Later note by RFB: Mother Goose on card carries a basket (of eggs?)There is a goose beside her—reminds me of goose eggs.(“某个椭圆形的东西。蛋形[停顿]，就像在一张长方形卡片里面有一条椭圆形细线那样。”标的物是长方形而且是一张卡片。不过，无论字面或隐喻，在它的边界之内都没有椭圆形，但是在卡片的图画中有几个椭圆形，背面还有圆形的邮戳。罗后来的注记：卡片上的鹅妈妈提着一个篮子(蛋？)，她旁边有一只鹅——让我想到鹅蛋。
(“A connection with a session.” The connection here is Barbara herself, who mailed us the card used as object. Barbara, as well as her boyfriend Dick, played a strong Emotional part in the envelope data for the 68th experiment, of August 29, 281st session.(“与一节课有关联。”这里的关联是芭芭拉本人，她寄给我们这张用作标的物的明信片。在8月29日第281节第68次实验的信封资料中，芭芭拉以及她的男友迪克扮演了情感强烈的角色。
(It may be possible that this connection is reinforced by a postcard as envelope object in the 67th experiment, in the 279th session for August 15. That card was sent to us by Leonard Yaudes, who also lives in the apartment house. See Volume 6.(在8月15日第279节第67次实验用作信封标的物的一张明信片可能强化了这个连结。那张卡片是雷那·奥迪斯[Leonard Yandes]寄给我们的，他也住在这栋公寓。见第六册。
("With, now... my impression here is of a desk, or chair connected with a desk. The type used in classrooms. I do not know if this refers to a child who attends school, to a teacher, or to someone such as your friends downstairs who have such an object.” There are plenty of connections here, though some are roundabout. Merle and Lois Cratsley also live in the apartment house, on the first floor, and do own such a chair. Their apartment adjoins Barbara, and they are of course well acquainted. The Cratsleys have no children but Barbara does have one, a girl nine years old. Later note by RFB: Mother Goose is a child 's tale. The place referred to as Story Land.(“与——现在……这里我的印象是一张书桌或是与书桌有关联的椅子。教室用的那一种。我不知道这指的是一个在上学的小孩、一个老师还是某个拥有这样一个物品的人，比如住在你们楼下的朋友。”这里有很多关联，不过有一些是拐弯抹角的关联。克里斯列夫妇[Crastsleb]，梅尔[Merle]和洛伊丝，也住在这栋公寓，在一楼，而且的确拥有这样一把椅子。他们的公寓毗邻芭芭拉，他们当然互相熟识。克里斯列夫妇没有生小孩，但芭芭拉有一个孩子，一个9岁女儿。罗稍后的注记：鹅妈妈是童话故事。这个地方指的是故事书乐园。
(The Cratsley connection here leads Jane to mention them again later also. The teacher data above may refer to the 67th envelope experiment in the 279th session; for in that session the object was a postcard sent to us by Leonard Yaudes, who is a teacher.(这里的克里斯利关联稍后又导致珍再次提到他们。上述的老师资料可能是指第279节的第67次信封实验；因为在那一节，标的物是雷那·奥迪斯寄给我们的一张明信片，他是一位老师。
(“Again, a formal affair connected here." The card used as object tonight was sent to us by Barbara from Ft. Belvoir, VA. She visited her sister there, and while there attended a cocktail party and a dance in the company of a male she thinks highly of Jane and I do not know if these affairs were literally formal however.(“再一次，这里与一个正式的活动有关联。”今晚用作标的物的卡片是芭芭拉·殷戈尔德从维吉尼亚州贝尔沃堡寄来的。她去那里探望她的姊妹，并且在那里参加了一个鸡尾酒会和一场舞会，与她同行的是她很尊崇的一位男性。不过，珍和我不知道这些活动是否真的很正式。
(“One seven. Perhaps two one.” Jane and I made no connections. No such sequences appear on the postcard, although the individual numbers do.(“一个7。也许两个1。”珍和我找不到连结。在明信片上没有出现这样的序号，但个别的数字倒是有。
(“That is, a formal affair or formal arrangement.” If this data is connected with the numbers above, we miss the connection. We believe the formal arrangement here refers to the layout of the display of Story Book Land at Woodbridge, VA. The copy on the back of the object in the upper left corner refers to ”a beautiful woodland setting” of favorite storybook characters.(“也就是说，一个正式的活动或正式的约定。”如果这个资料与上述数字有关联，那我们就是错失连结了。我们相信这里的正式约定是指维吉尼亚州伍德布里吉的故事书乐园陈列。在物件背面左上角的方案写的是，故事书里最受喜爱的角色置身于“一个美丽的森林背景”。
(“Red.” Mother Goose, on the object, wears a red skirt, and a purple blouse and hat with red circular decorations. The flowers at the foot of the statue are also red, with a few in white.(“红色。”在标的物上，鹅妈妈穿着一条红裙，和一件紫色上衣，戴着一顶有着红色图形装饰物的帽子。塑像脚边的花也是红色的，还有几朵白花。
(“Two children.” We know of but one child involved with the object, Barbara's 9. year-old daughter Lisa. Lisa accompanied Barbara on the trip to Virginia and Story Book Land. But see supplement, page 25.(“两个小孩。”我们只知道有一个小孩与这个物件有关，芭芭拉的9岁女儿丽莎。丽莎陪芭芭拉去维吉尼亚州和故事乐园旅行。但是请参见后面的补遗。
(“A connection with an item usually unavailable. With a machine of some kind. ”Jane gave this data together and we believe it refers to the flight made to Virginia from Elmira by Barbara and Lisa.(“与通常无法取得的一个物件有关联。和某一种机器有关联。”珍一并给出这个资料，所以我们相信它指的是芭芭拉和丽莎从埃尔迈拉搭机前往维吉尼亚的航班。
(“A spectacular arrangement.” In view of Seths answer to the first question, this is a reference to Story Book Land. This also had been my mental interpretation as Jane gave the data, before we reached the question-and-answer session.(“与一个引人注目的布置有关联。”基于赛斯对第一个问题的回答，这指的是故事书乐园。当珍给出这个资料时，在我们开始问答之前，我心中的解读也是如此。
(“A garden.” A flower garden is shown at the foot of the statue of Mother Goose, on the object. The flowers surround three sides of the statue base, and appear to be petunias, red and white.(“一座花园。”在标的物上，鹅妈妈塑像的脚下有一座花园。花朵环绕着塑像的三个边，看起来是矮牵牛花，红色和白色。
(“A variety of small circles, fitting one inside the other, like jewelry. Like some earrings.” The picture on the postcard used as object contains many small circles, mainly the flowers as noted above, and the small circular designs, also apparently flowers, on the blouse and cap of Mother Goose. They do not necessarily fit one inside the other however. Mother Goose wears no earrings.(“各式各样的小圆圈，一个套着另一个，像首饰。像某种耳环。”在用作标的物的明信片画面里有很多小圆圈，主要是上述的花朵，还有在鹅妈妈的上衣和帽子上有小小的圆形图案，显然也是花朵。然而它们不一定是一个套着另一个。鹅妈妈没有戴耳环。
(In connection with the ”small circles” data above, I should add that Jane was subjectively sure the data did not refer to the printing or Barbara's writing on the object. With this data Jane had an image of tiny circles, as on the Mother Goose costume, or of jewelry.(与上述“小圆圈”资料有关，我想要补充，珍在主观上确定这个资料并不是指标的物上面的印刷图案或芭芭拉写的字。给出这个资料的同时，珍有一个画面是迷你的圆圈，就像在鹅妈妈那身衣着上或首饰上的图案那样。
(“A wooded area.” In back of the statue of Mother Goose is a dense, dark green pine forest, as indicated on the tracing on page 16, as well as several trees nearer the foreground. As noted, the copy in the upper left hand corner on the back of the object mentions ”a beautiful woodland setting. ’’ Story Book Land is also in Woodbridge, VA.(“一个长满树木的区域。”在鹅妈妈塑像的背后是一片浓密、深绿色的松树林，如前面的描摹图所示，还有几棵树比较靠近前景。如上所述，在标的物背面左上角的文案提到“一个美丽的森林背景”。故事书乐园也位于维吉尼亚州的伍德布里吉。
(“Vases.” We believe this a reference to the flowers shown on the object, and already described; or perhaps to the gift shop which is partially visible in the right background on the object. See supplement, page 25.(“许多瓶子。”我们相信是指标的物上出现以及已经描述过的花；或者也许是指在标的物右侧背景中局部可见的礼品店。
(“A distant connection with wine or a wine house.” Remember that Jane had an image of Barbara’s boyfriend Dick. Jane is sure this data is a reference to the fact that last Saturday evening September 3, Barbara and Dick visited a local pub; a bone of contention arose between them over this visit, but will not be discussed here. Suffice it to say that strong Emotional feelings were engendered by the visit, and that Barbara discussed the visit with Jane today, the day of this experiment. The connection of course being that Barbara sent us the postcard used as object.(“和葡萄酒或一家酒庄有关联。”记得珍有一个画面是芭芭拉的男友迪克。珍确定这个资料是指9月3日上周六晚上，芭芭拉和迪克去本地一间酒吧的这个事实；在这次去酒吧的过程中，他们之间起了争执，但在这里不讨论此事。只说这次酒吧行引起了强烈的情绪感觉，而今天，做这个实验的这一天，芭芭拉和珍讨论了去酒吧的事。连结当然就是芭芭拉寄给我们而被当作标的物的明信片。
(“Printed matter, near the center. ’’See the tracing of the object on page 16. On the picture side of the postcard there is a plaque beneath the statue of Mother Goose, bearing a rhyme. The plaque is in the lower center of the card, thus ”near” the center.(“印刷品，靠近正中央。”见上面的标的物描摹图。在明信片有图画的那一面，鹅妈妈塑像下面有一个牌区，上面题着一篇韵文。牌区位于明信片下方正中央，因此靠近正中央。
(There is also type on the back of the object in the center, but Jane says the data refers to the rhyme rather than this.(在标的物背面的正中央也有字体，但是珍说资料指的是韵文而不是这个。
(“A date, perhaps June of this year.” As noted on page 17, the last two letters of the month are missing within the circular postmark on the back of the card.” Ju” only being visible. But from other records we have we have determined that Barbara mailed us the card on July 12, rather than June.(“一个日期，也许是今年6月。”如前面所述，在明信片背面的圆形邮戳里，月份的最后两个字母不见了。只看得到“Ju”。但是从我们有的其他记录看来，我们确定芭芭拉是在7月12日，而不是6月，寄给我们这张明信片。
(“Also a connection with September.” This is a reference to the fact that Jane talked with Barbara today, as she does on most days since Barbara lives in the same apartment house.(“此外也和9月有关联。”这是指珍今天和芭芭拉谈话的这个事实，因为芭芭拉住在同一栋公寓，所以大多数日子珍都会跟她讲讲话。
(“One six.” We made no connections, either for one six, sixteen, etc. The numbers appear, separated, on the back of the object, but that is all we can offer here.(“一个6。”我们找不到关联，不管是一个6或16等等。数字个别出现在标的物的背面，但这里我们能提供的就只有这个。
(“I believe the item came through the mail, or is connected with mail.” Yes. The item being a postcard and coming to us through the mail on July 12,1966.(“我相信物件是邮寄过来的，或是和邮件有关联。”是的。这个物件是一张明信片，在1966年7月12日邮寄给我们。
(“In any case the impression of a round cancellation shape.” Yes. On the back of the card is the usual round cancellation, bearing the date, zip code and city and state—Ft. Belvoir, VA.(“不管怎样，印象就是一个圆形邮戳的形状。”是的。在明信片背面有平常的圆形邮戳，标示着日期、邮递区号、城市名和州名——维吉尼亚州贝尔沃堡。
(“And many, more than one, reddish colored stamps.” No. The card bears the usual single gray blue 5f stamp showing George Washington. This data may have been confused with the many red flowers shown on the object, plus the many red decorations on the costume of Mother Goose.(“还有很多，不止一个，红色调的色彩印章戳记。”不是。明信片印着一个平常的黑蓝色五分美元邮票，上面的人物是乔治·华盛顿[George Washington]。这个资料可能混淆了标的物上很多的红花，以及鹅妈妈衣服上很多红色的装饰物。
(“And some blue. With a figure.” We believe this data goes together. As stated the stamp on the object is gray blue, and bears a figure 5. It seems however that this data probably refers to the figure of Mother Goose, shown on the object, and to the statue standing upon a base that is painted blue. In addition Mother Goose wears blue shoes. There is blue in her costume as well as red, and the goose beside her is a blue gray.(“以及某种蓝色。有一个人物。”我们相信这个资料符合。如上所述，标的物上的邮票是灰蓝色的，里面还有一个人物。然而，好像这个资料的人物可能是指标的物上的鹅妈妈，以及在一个漆着蓝色的基座上竖立的塑像。此外，鹅妈妈还穿着蓝色鞋子。她的服装上面有蓝色也有红色，而且她身边的鹅是蓝灰色的。
(First Question: What is the spectacular arrangement you mentioned?” I am not sure. It may have to do with flowers.” This seems to pin the spectacular reference down to the postcard picture, since it shows the statue of Mother Goose in Story Book Land, surrounded by red and white flowers.(第一个问题：你提到那个引人注目的布置是什么？“我不确定。它可能和花有关。”这似乎确定引人注目指的是明信片的图画，因为它呈现出故事书乐园里的鹅妈妈塑像，周围环绕着红白相间的花。
(2nd Question: Can you say who is involved? ”Ruburt here thinks of his corn, and Lois.“ Jane said this is brought about through the chair data, and is a confusion arising from the fact that Barbara, who sent us the object, and Lois and Merle Cratsley live on the ground floor of the apartment house, in adjoining apartments. See the chair data interpretation on page 22.(第二个问题：你能不能说出牵涉在内的是谁？“这里鲁柏想到他的玉米和洛伊丝。”珍说这是经由椅子资料带出来的，因为寄标的物给我们的芭芭拉、洛伊丝和梅尔住在这栋公寓一楼，两家相邻的这个事实而产生的混淆。
(3rd Question: Can you say something about wine or the wine house? “Liquor connection. A visit to a place where it is sold. A man here.” See the wine house data interpretation on page 23. Remember also that while giving the data Jane had an image of Barbaras boyfriend, Dick, wearing a brightly-colored sports jacket Jane saw him wearing today.(第三个问题：你能不能说说葡萄酒或酒庄的事？“与烈酒有关。去拜访一个被卖掉的地方。这里有一个男人。”见前面的酒庄资料解读。也别忘了，在给出资料的同时，珍有一个画面是芭芭拉的男友迪克，穿着鲜艳的彩色运动外套，珍今天看到他穿在身上的就是这件衣服。
(This data is a little more specific than that on page 23, and the man reference concerns Dick; as stated Dick and Barbara visited a certain local pub, and an altercation developed between them because of this. Barbara discussed the trouble with Jane today.(这个资料比前面的那个资料稍微明确一点，而且提到的男人和迪克有关；如上所述，迪克和芭芭拉去了本地一间酒吧，而且因为这个吵了起来。芭芭拉今天和珍讨论了此事。
(4th Question: What’s that connection about a session? “Our sessions were discussed, or the item is closely connected to one used previously in our sessions.” See the interpretation of the session data on page 22. Tonight’s item, a postcard, is closely connected to one used previously as an envelope object. The object for the 67th experiment was also a postcard, used August 29 in the 281st session, and was sent to us by Leonard Yaudes, who also lives in our apartment house. Leonard and Barbara are of course friends also.(第四个问题：与一节课的关联是什么？“我们的课被讨论，或是物件与之前我们上课时用的一个物品密切相关。”见上面一节课的资料解读。今晚的物品，一张明信片，与之前用作信封标的物的另一张明信片有密切关系。在8月29日第281节的第67次实验用作标的物的也是一张明信片，是雷那·奥迪斯寄给我们的，他也住在我们这栋公寓。雷那和芭芭拉当然也是朋友。
(Jane resumed, her eyes closed, wearing her glasses, at 10:55.)(珍在10:55分继续，闭着眼睛，戴着眼镜。)
I believe the data explains itself.我相信资料不言自明。
Ruburt would do well to take this session to heart, and follow my directions.鲁柏把这一节放在心上并且按照我的话去做，会很有助益。
There is a boon coming to you financially. I do not know whether this represents sales, or sale, on Ruburt’s part or not. But some money, either sooner than you expect, or unexpected. The number three is connected here, but I am not sure how. The amount may begin with a three, or it may be received within three days or thirty days. It is definite, and you will receive it in any case before three months have passed.在财务上会有利益来到你们身上。我不知道这是不是代表鲁柏会达成许多交易或一次交易。但是会有钱进来，不是比你预期的还快，就是出乎预期。这里与数字3有关联，但我不确定是怎样的关联。金额可能是3开头，或是在3天内或30天内会收到。肯定会有，而且不管怎样，你们都会在3个月过去之前收到它。
(“Can you tell us who is connected with it?” )(“你能不能告诉我们，与它有关的人是谁？”)
There is a decision of some kind to be made. It is made, but other circumstances are involved. An S and a G here, though their significance will not be apparent until later. Ruburt’s idea incidentally about the column is a good one. My heartiest wishes to you both.需要做某一个决定。决定现在做了，但还牵涉到其他状况。这里有一个S和一个G，但是它们的重要性稍后才会明朗。顺带一提，鲁柏的专栏点子很好。我衷心祝福你们两位。
(“Can I ask a question?” )(“我可不可以问一个问题？”)
You may.你可以问。
(“Did that material in the last session apply to Wollheim or Fell ? Can you tell us which one you meant, now?” See page 15.)(“上一节的那份资料适用于韦翰或费尔吗？现在，你能不能告诉我们，你说的是哪一个？”见前面相应页面。)
We have, unfortunately, some distortion there, for I believe some applied to each.很遗憾，我们在那里有某种扭曲，因为我相信有一些适用于他们每一个。
(Pause. “Good night, Seth.”(停顿。“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:04. Jane was out as usual. She said Seth could have cheerfully continued. )(11:04分结束。珍一如往常出去了。她说赛斯本来可以高高兴兴继续讲下去。)
SUPPLEMENT TO ENVELOPE DATA FORSESSION 283 69TH EXPERIMENT SEPTEMBER 5, 19661966年9月5日第283节第69次信封资料补遗
(On Saturday, September 10, Jane and I checked some of this experiment with Barbara. Two points arose worth noting.(在9月10日星期六，珍和我找芭芭拉一起核对这个实验的一些部分。有两点值得一记。
(Regarding “Two children", interpreted on page 22. This data is more accurate than we had supposed. Consciously Jane had no way of knowing this, and Barbara had not told us the circumstances surrounding the incident after her return from the trip to Ft. Belvoir.(关于前面解读的“两个小孩”，这个资料比我们以为的还要准确。在意识上，珍不可能知道这件事，而且芭芭拉也没有告诉我们，她从贝尔沃堡回来之后，围绕在这件事周边的状况。
(As stated on page 21, Barbara did take her own daughter, Lisa, to visit Story Book Land, the subject of the postcard sent to us by Barbara, and used as the object in the 69th experiment. We now learned that Barbara had taken another child along also—-for a total of two. The other child being one of Barbara’s sister's in Ft. Belvoir.(如前面所述，芭芭拉确实带了她自己的女儿丽莎去故事书乐园，它就是芭芭拉寄给我们的明信片主题，在第69次实验用这张明信片当作信封标的物。我们现在得知芭芭拉也带了另一个小孩一起去——总共两个。另一个小孩是芭芭拉住在贝尔沃堡的姊妹生的其中一个孩子。
(Regarding “Vases", interpreted on page 23. Our interpretation may be a good one, but Barbara pointed out a better one. On the visit to Story Book Land with the two children, Barbara also visited the display for Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves. [The postcard used as object for the session showed Mother Goose.] The Ali Baba display was quite impressive, Barbara said; so much so that she took a picture of Gary, her sister's young son, in one of the large jars or vases belonging to Ali Baba.(关于前面解读的“许多瓶子”，我们的解读可能还不错，但芭芭拉指出了一个更好的解读。与两个小孩一起去故事书乐园玩的时候，芭芭拉也去看了阿里巴巴与四十大盗的展览。[这一节用作标的物的明信片上面有鹅妈妈。]芭芭拉说阿里巴巴的展览令人印象颇为深刻；因此她帮她姊妹的小儿子盖瑞[Gary]，在属于阿里巴巴的其中一个大罐子或瓶子里拍了一张照片。
(Barbara had not told us about this. We did not know about the Ali Baba display at Story Book Land, and had no thought of linking up the “Vases” data with this. We have not seen the photo Barbara took of Gary in the giant vase or jar.)(芭芭拉没有告诉我们这件事。我们不知道故事书乐园的阿里巴巴展览，也完全没有想到把“瓶子”资料和这件事连在一起。我们没有见到芭芭拉帮大瓶子或罐子里的盖瑞拍的照片。)

SESSION 284 第284节　根本协议


SEPTEMBER 7, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年9月7日　星期三　晚上9点
(Jane and I were both tired by session time. Jane had no idea of what Seth might discuss in the session. She began speaking in an average voice, with pauses and with her eyes closed, while sitting down.)(到了上课时间，珍和我两人都累了。对于赛斯在这一节可能讨论什么，珍毫无概念。她坐下来，同时开始用不高不低的声音讲话，闭着眼睛，时而停顿。)
Now. The physical universe is far more complicated than you know, and you understand little about its origins or even about its nature.现在。物质宇宙远比你们知道的还要复杂多了，你们对它的起源或甚至它的本质了解很少。
Individually, you move in a very limited area of this vast universe, and yet inner reality is more你们各别在这个浩瀚的宇宙当中一个非常局限的区域移动，可是，如果你说的是尺寸，那么内在实相的尺寸更加
(Long pause) massive in size, if you speak in terms of size. It is far more extensive even in physical terms, and its reality exists in dimensions which do not exist within the physical system. You take for granted the existence of this largely unknown physical world. You gloss over what you do not understand.(长时间停顿)广大。甚至就物质角度而言，它也是宽广很多，而且它的实相存在许多维度，那些维度在物质系统之内是不存在的。你们以为这个大半仍属未知的物质世界理所当然存在。你们错过了你们不了解的事物。
The nonphysical systems are frightening to the ego-centered personality; but the bulk of the individual’s reality does not lie within the physical universe, but in those unknown areas.
