As you know the ego is the topmost portion, so to speak. Were it not for the dreaming self the ego would not exist. Were it not for past existences the personality as you know it would not exist.对以自我为中心的人格来说，非物质系统是可怕的，但个体的实相大部分并不是存在物质宇宙之内，而是存在那些未知的区域。如你所知，自我可以说是最上面的部分。要不是有做梦的自己，自我是不会存在的。要不是有过去的经验，你所知的人格它是不会存在的。
Remember that reincarnation does not contradict the theory of the spacious present , for such lives within the spacious present are simultaneous. In dreams you journey through inner realities as actually as you walk physically through the matter of the physical world. It is true that the experiences you encounter may not be encountered by another in precisely (underline precisely) the same way, but physical experience is never the same for any two given individuals either.记得转世与广阔的现在这个理论并不相悖，因为在广阔的现在之内，这样的生生世世是同时存在的。在梦中，你行经各个内在实相的旅程，与你在实质上走过物质世界的物质一样实际。你遭遇到的经验可能不会有另一个人以正好(划线)一样的方式遭遇到，这是真的，但是对任何两个既定的个体来说，物质经验也绝对不会相同。
You agree to accept certain data in the physical universe. You agree to form this into certain patterns, and you agree to ignore other data completely. These, now, root agreements, form the main basis for the apparent permanence and coherence of your physical system.你同意接受物质宇宙里的某个资料。你同意用这个资料形成某些模式，你也同意完全忽视其他资料。现在，这些根本协议(root agreements)形成主要的基础，你们的物质系统因而有了外显的持久性和连贯性。
In your journeys into inner reality you cannot proceed with the same root agreements, you see. Reality, per se, changes completely according to the basic root agreements from which you proceed. One of the root agreements upon which physical existence is based is that physical objects have a reality that is entirely independent of any subjective cause; and that these objects, within definitely specified limitations, are permanent.在你们进入内在实相的旅程中，你知道，你们不能按照同样的根本协议继续进行。依据根本协议，亦即你由此开始的基础，实相本身完全改变了。物质存在依据的根本协议之一，就是实质物体有一个完全独立于任何主观原因之外的实相，而且在明确又具体的限制之内，这些物体是持久的。
Now these root agreements will only contuse you in your inner explorations. Objects may appear and disappear in these other systems. Using the root agreements just mentioned as a basis for reality, an observer would insist that the objects were not real, for they do not behave as he knows objects must behave.现在这些根本协议在你的内在探索中只会让你困惑。物体在这些其他的系统里可能出现和消失。利用刚刚提到的根本协议作为实相的一个基础，一个观察者会坚称物体不是真的，因为它们的行为与他知道物体一定会有的行为不一样。
Because dream objects appear and disappear, this does not mean they do not exist. In this particular instance the root agreement or assumption simply leads you astray.因为梦物体出现又消失，这并不表示它们不存在。在这个特定的例子当中，根本协议或假设只会让你误入歧途。
Now. There is a cohesiveness to the inner universe, and to the systems that are not basically physical. But this cohesiveness is based upon an entirely different set of root assumptions or agreements, and these are the keys that alone will enable you to manipulate within, or understand, other systems.好。内在宇宙有一种连贯性，基本上非物质的系统也有。但是这种连贯性是奠基在一套迥异的根本假设或协议上，而且这些是关键，光靠它们，你就能够在其他系统之内进行操纵，或是了解其他系统。
There are several major root assumptions and many minor ones.有几个主要的根本假设和很多次要的根本假设。
Now. One: Energy and action are basically the same, although neither must necessarily apply to physical motion.好。一、能量和行动基本上是一样的，虽然两者都不一定适用于身体动作。
Two: All objects have their origin basically in mental action. Mental action is directed psychic energy.二、所有的物体基本上都源于心智行动。心智行动就是受到指挥的心灵能量。
Three: Permanence is not a matter of time. Existence has value in terms of intensities.三、持久与时间无关。存在的价值在于强度。
(Long pause.)(长时间停顿)
Objects—this is four—are blocks of energy perceived in a highly specialized manner.物体——这是四——是以极为专门化的方式感知的能量区块。
Five: Stability in time-sequence is not a prerequisite requirement for an object, except as a root assumption within the physical universe.五、时间顺序的稳定是物质宇宙之内的一个根本假设，除此之外，它并不是物体不可或缺的必要条件。
Six: Space as a barrier does not exist.六、空间障碍并不存在。
Seven: The spacious present is here more available to the perceptions.七、在这里更能够感知广阔的现在。
Eight: The only barriers within inner reality are mental barriers, or psychic barriers.八、内在实相之内唯一有的障碍，是心智的障碍或心灵的障碍。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:31Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes opened slowly at break, and were tired and bleary. They had been closed for most of the delivery. She had spoken with pauses.(“9:31分休息。珍一如往常出离。她的眼睛在休息时缓缓睁开，疲劳又惺忪。在传述过程中，它们大部分时间闭着。她说话时偶尔停顿。
(Jane resumed in the same manner at 9:40.)(9:40分，珍以同样的方式继续。)
Now. Only if these basic assumptions are taken for granted will your projection experiences make senseto you.好。只有在这些基本假设被视为理所当然的时候，你的投射经验对你才会有意义。
Different rules simply apply. There are other basic root assumptions that I will give you. Your subjective experience here is highly important. That is, the vividness of any given experience in terms of intensity will be far more important than anything else.只不过适用的规则不同而已。我会给你其他基本的根本假设。你的主观经验在这里极为重要。也就是说，任何一个经验的生动程度，就强度而言，远比其他一切重要多了。
Elements from past, present and future may be indiscriminately available to you. There is the tendency to judge such inner experience in terms of reliable physical assumptions, this being an error. You may conclude that a given experience is the result merely of subconscious fabrications, simply because the time elements are obviously intermixed, or physical coherence or sequence is not maintained.来自过去、现在和未来的元素，你都可以取用，毫无差别。有一种倾向是，按照可靠的物质假设来判断这样的内在经验，这是错的。你可能断定某一个经验纯粹是潜意识虚构的结果，只因为时间元素显然混杂在其中，或没有维持物质上的连贯性或顺序。
In a given dream projection for example you may experience an episode that is obviously in the physical past, yet within it there may be elements that do not fit. In an old-fashioned room of the 1700 s, you may look out a window to see an automobile pass by. Obviously, you think, there is subconscious distortion here.比方说，在一次既定的梦中投射里，你可能经历一个显然发生在过去的事件，可是在它之内，可能有些与之不符的元素。在18世纪一个旧式的房间里，你可能从窗户看出去，见到一辆汽车经过。显然，你以为，这里有潜意识的扭曲。
Yet you may be straddling rime in such an instance, perceiving, say, the room as it existed in the 1700 s, and the street as it exists in your present. These elements may appear side by side. The car may disappear before your eyes, to be replaced by an animal, or the whole street may suddenly turn into a field. This is how dreams work, you may think. This cannot be a legitimate projection anywhere. Yet you may be suddenly perceiving the street, and the field that existed before it, and the images may be transposed tine upon the other.可是，在这样一个情况下，你可能跨越时间，比方说，感知这个房间存在于18世纪的样子，以及街道存在于你当下的样子。这些元素可以一起出现。汽车可能在你的眼前消失，被一只动物取代，或是整条街可能突然变成一片田野。你可能认为，反正梦就是这样子。无论何处，这都不可能是真实的投射。但是你可能突然感知着街道，以及存在于它之前的田野，而且画面可能一个重叠在另一个上面。
If you are trying to judge such an experience in terms of physical root assumptions, then it will be meaningless. You may, as I mentioned earlier, perceive the form of a building that never did exist physically, and never will in your universe. This does not mean that the form is an illusion. You are simply in a position where you can pick up and translate the energy pattern before you.如果你试着依据物质的根本假设来判断这样一个经验，那它不会有任何意义。我之前提过，一栋在物质上从未存在过而且在你们的宇宙从未有过的建筑物，你可以感知它的形式。这并不是说，这个形式是幻相。你只不过是在一个你能够接收和翻译眼前这个能量模式的位置上而已。
Now. If another individual under the same circumstances comes across the same potential object, he can also perceive it as you did. He may however, because of his own makeup, perceive and translate another portion of allied pattern. He may see the form of the man who originated the thought of the building.好。如果另一个处于同样状况的个体碰见同一个潜在的物体，他也可能像你一样感知它。不过，因为他自己的体性，他可能感知并翻译类似模式的另一个部分。他可能看见最初构思这栋建筑物那个人的形式。
(Pause.) To a large extent your habit of perceiving time as a sequence forms the type of experience, and also limits the experience that you will have in physical reality.(停顿)你感知时间顺序的习惯很大程度形成这种经验，也限制你在物质实相将会拥有的经验。
It also unites experience. The unifying and the limiting aspects of consecutive moments are absent in inner reality. Time cannot be counted upon to unify action. The series you see does not exist basically. The unifying elements will be those of your own understanding, your own abilities. You are not forced to perceive action as a series of moments within inner reality, therefore.它也统合经验。内在实相里没有连续时刻的统合面向与限制面向。不能指望时间来统合行动。你看见的连续基本上并不存在。统合的元素将会是你自己的了解、你自己能力当中的那些元素。因此在内在实相之内，你没有被迫感知行动是一连串的时刻。
Episodes will therefore be related one to another by entirely different methods, and the methods will be intuitional and highly selective and psychological. You will find your own way through complicated mazes of reality according to your own intuitional nature. You will find what you expect to find. You will seek out what you want from the available reality data.所以事件透过完全不同的方法互相产生关联，这些将是出于直觉、精挑细选而且属于心理层面的方法。你会按照自己的直觉本质找到自己的路，穿过错综复杂的实相迷宫。你会找到你预期找到的东西。你会从可以取得的实相资料当中找出你想要的东西。
You may take a break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:01. Jane was out as usual. Her eyes had opened more often; though she was still tired, she did not appear to be as much so now. She wondered where all the material, excellent as it was, could be coming from. She hadn’t been thinking along these lines consciously lately.(10:01分休息。珍一如往常出去了。她的眼睛更常睁开；虽然她还是累，但现在看起来没那么累。她想知道这么棒的资料究竟是从哪里来的。最近她在意识上并没有思考这方面的事情。
(Resume at 10:11.)(10:11分继续。)
In physical experience you are dealing with an environment with which you are familiar.在物质经验中，你和你熟悉的一个环境打交道。
You have completely forgotten the chaos and unpredictable nature it presented to you before learning processes were channeled into specific directions. You learned to perceive reality in a highly specialized fashion.你完全忘记，在学习的过程导入特定方向之前，它呈现给你看的混乱和无法预测的本质。你学会以高度专门化的方式感知实相。
When you are dealing with inner, or basically nonphysical environments, you must again become unspecialized, and then learn a new set of principles. You will soon learn for example to trust your perceptions, whether or not the experience seems to make logical sense.当你与内在或基本上非物质的环境打交道时，你必须再一次变成非专门化，然后学习一套新的原理。你很快就会学到，比方说，信任你的感知，不管这个经验在逻辑上说不说得过去。
You must learn to differentiate between many forms that may appear in many ways similar enough, to seem to be of identical nature. In physical life however you do this now automatically.你必须学习区分很多形式，它们可能以很多相当熟悉的方式出现，或看起来好像性质一模一样。然而，在物质生命中，你现在是自动这么做。
In a projection the problems will be of a different sort. The form of a man for example, may be a thought form, or fragment sent quite unconsciously by another individual whom it resembles. It may be another projectionist like yourself. It may be a potential form like any potential object—a played-over-andover-again record of a form.在投射中，问题的类型是不同的。一个男人的形式，比方说，可能是一个思想形式，或另一个长相类似的个体颇为无意识地发送出去的片段体。它可能是像你自己一样的另一个投射者。它可能是一个像任何潜在物体一样的潜在形式——某一张一次又一次重播的唱片。
It may be another version of yourself. We will discuss ways of distinguishing between these. A man may suddenly disappear, and to be replaced by a small girl, a nonsensical development to the logical mind. Yet the girl could be the form of the man’s previous or future reincarnated self. The unity, you see, is different. Basically perception of the spacious present is naturally available. It is your nervous and physical mechanism which acts as a limiting device, and also as a focusing device. By limiting many otherwise available perceptions it forces you to focus upon what you can perceive with greater intensity.它可能是你自己的另一个版本。我们将会讨论这些形式的区分方法。一个男人可以突然消失，被一个小女孩取代，对逻辑心(logical mind)来说是一个荒谬的发展。但是女孩可能是男人之前或未来的转世自己。合体，你看，是不一样的。基本上，自然而然对广阔的现在有所感知。充当限制装置，也充当聚焦设备的，是你的神经和肉体机制。借由限制很多原本可得的感知，它迫使你聚焦在你能够以更大的强度感知的事物上。
Your mental processes are formed and developed as a result of this conditioning. The intuitive portions of the personality are not so formed, and these will operate to your advantage in any inner exploration.你的心智过程就是这种制约形成和发展出来的一个结果。人格的直觉部分不是这样形成的，而且在任何内在探索中，这些部分会以有利于你的方式运作。
(Pause.)(停顿)
You are basically capable of seeing this particular location as it existed a thousand years in your past, or as it will exist a thousand years in your future.你基本上有能力看见这个在你的过去存在1000年，或在你的未来存在1000年的特定地点。
(Jane indicated the living room in which we sat.) The senses serve to blot out many more aspects of reality than they allow you to perceive. They are actually rather rigid limiting devices, yet in many inner explorations you will automatically translate experience into terms that the senses can use.(珍指着我们坐在其中的客厅)感官遮蔽的实相面向多过于它们允许你感知的面向。它们其实是相当死板的限制装置，可是在很多内在探索中，你会自动把经验翻译成感官能够利用的说法。
This facility, the translation of data to the ego, who would otherwise distrust it, any such translation is nevertheless a second handed version of the original reality; and that is an important point.这种能力，为自我翻译资料，不然自我不会信任它，虽然如此，任何这样的翻译都是原创实相的二手版本；这一点很重要。
We will now close our session. It has been an excellent one. My heartiest regards to you both.我们现在要结束我们的课了。这一节非常好。向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候。
(“Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:31. Jane was out as usual, and her eyes had been closed most of the time. She now looked and felt better than she had before the session began.(11:31分结束。珍一如往常出去了，她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着。她现在看起来和感觉都比开始上课之前好。
(Jane said that what Seth talked about our living room and the spacious present , she had some kind of “weird” feeling that involved a concept of the thought. But she couldn’t put it into words.)(珍说赛斯谈到我们的客厅和广阔的现在时，她有某种“怪异的”感觉，与一个对这个想法的观念有关。但她无法用语言表达出来。)

SESSION 285 第285节　根本假设 信封70


SEPTEMBER 12, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年9月12日　星期一　晚上9点
(The object for the 70th envelope experiment was the first draft of a letter I wrote tonight, to a local dentist. It concerned the recent sale of a painting to him, made through our friend, Marie Colucci. Details later. Jane had not seen this draft, or even the final copy of the letter, although she knew I was writing it this evening. I sealed it in an envelope when finished; then showed this to Jane and asked her to mail it tomorrow morning. I briefly and roughly described the contents, however.(第70次信封实验的标的物是一封信的初稿，我今晚写的，给一位本地的牙医。它和最近透过我们的朋友，玛丽·克鲁奇[Marie Colucci]，卖给他一幅画的事情有关。细节稍后再说。虽然今晚珍知道我在写这封信，但没见过这份初稿，甚至也没见过定稿。写完之后，我把它密封在一个信封里；然后拿给珍看，请她明天早上帮我寄。不过，我简短粗略地描述过内容。
(The object was folded as indicated, placed between two pieces of Bristol, and sealed in the usual double envelopes.(标的物如上图所示折叠过，放在两片西卡纸之间，然后密封在一般的双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking while seated. Her eyes were closed, her pace good. Her voice was distinctly heavier and louder than usual. It easily rose above the considerable traffic noise coming through our open living room window.)(珍一边坐下一边开始说话。她的眼睛闭着，速度很好。她的声音明显比平常更沉重、响亮。从我们敞开的客厅窗户传进来相当吵杂的车流噪音，被她的声音轻易盖过。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Root assumptions represent the basic premises upon which a given existence-system is formed.好。根本假设代表一个存在系统据以形成的基本前提。
These are the ground rules, so to speak. Your physical mechanisms are equipped to function in such a way that reality is perceived through the lens of particular root assumptions. Using the physical senses alone, it is almost literally impossible for you to perceive reality in any other manner.可以说，这些是基本原则。你们的肉体机制具备以这样一种方式动作的能力：透过特定根本假设的镜片感知实相。光是使用肉体感官，你们实际上几乎不可能以任何其他方式感知实相。
A strong part of your personalities is therefore a product of the physical system in which you have physical existence. All ideas of reality must be glimpsed through the physical net which is the materialized form of these assumptions. You are, in other words, physically able to observe reality in a highly specialized fashion. You must, physically speaking, interpret existence in terms of these very definite assumptions.因此你们的人格有一个强大的部分是物质系统产物，你在此一系统当中拥有物质存在。实相的概念一定都是经由物质之网，也就是这些假设的物质化形式而被瞥见的。换句话说，你们在肉体上能够以一种高度专门化的方式观察实相。就肉体而言，你们必须依据这些非常明确的假设解读存在。
Again physically speaking, you will find nothing to contradict these assumptions, since physically to you they are all that you can experience or perceive. These root assumptions are the framework of your camouflage system. As you attempt to explore other realities you almost automatically interpret such data in terms of the root assumptions of your own system.再一次，就肉体而言，你找不到违背这些假设的任何事物，因为在肉体上对你来说，你们能够用来体验或感知的东西就只有它们而已。这些根本假设是你们伪装系统的架构。在你们试图探索其他实相之际，你们几乎自动依据你们自己系统的根本假设来解读这样的资料。
This of course highly falsifies such data. The inner senses are not bound by those root assumptions however. This is why many psychic or subjective experiences seem to contradict physical laws. Inner experience often seems chaotic or meaningless because you attempt to interpret it according to the root assumptions of physical reality. You must learn the laws that apply to other systems.这当然极度曲解这样的资料。然而，内在感官是不受那些根本假设束缚的。这就是为什么很多心灵或主观的经验似乎和物质相抵触。内在经验经常看似混乱或毫无意义，因为你们试图根据物质实相的根本假设解读它。你们必须学习适用于其他系统的法则。
The root assumptions that govern physical reality are indeed valid, but within physical reality alone. They do not apply elsewhere. There is a natural tendency to continue judging inner experience against these root assumptions however. The tendency, with further experience, will fade. This interpretation of inner reality into physical terms is at first automatic, and far beneath conscious levels. Inner experience, you see, must to some extent be colored by the physical system while you exist within it.管辖物质实相的根本假设确实是有效力的，但只在物质实相之内。它们在其他地方并不适用。然而有一个自然的倾向是，继续按照这些根本假设来判断内在经验。有了进一步的经验，这个倾向就会渐渐消失。从物质的角度对内在实相所做的解读，你看，必定会受到你们存在其中的物质系统影响。
In order for such information to rise to conscious levels, it must of necessity be translated into terms that the ego can handle, and the translation must to some extent distort the original experience. The whole physical organism of the body has been trained from infancy to react to certain patterns, these patterns based on physical root assumptions.要让这样的资料上升到意识层面，就必须翻译成自我能够应付的说法，而且某种程度上翻译一定会扭曲原本的经验。身体这整个物质有机体从婴儿期就被训练对某些模式起反应，这些模式就是奠基在物质的根本假设上。
The nervous system itself must, you see, be so constituted, and the nervous system reacts definitely to visual block images. Such images are received through the skin as well as through the eyes. The whole system is highly complicated and organized, and organized to react to specific patterns that are formed from these basic root assumptions.神经系统本身，你看，必定是这样构成的，所以神经系统肯定对视觉区块影像起反应。这样的影像经由皮肤也经由眼睛接收。另一个系统极其复杂又井然有序，而且组织它的方式使它对这些基本的根本假设所形成的特定模式起反应。
This is obviously necessary for physical survival. The organization however is, biologically speaking, artificial and learned. It is no less rigid for that reason, however. The organizational structure of perception can indeed be broken up, as recent LSD experiments certainly show. This can be highly dangerous, however.这显然是肉体存活的必要条件。然而，就生物学来说，组织是人工的，是透过学习而来的。不过，由于这个原因，它还是一样僵化。感知的组织结构确实是可以打破的，像最近的迷幻药实验无疑就是例证。但是，这有可能非常危险。
The fact that this does occur does show that the systems of perception are not basically biologically a form of overall structure however, but learned secondary responses. It is disturbing to the whole physical system however to break up the strong pattern of perception. Inner stability of response is suddenly swept away. Changes that are not yet known occur within the nervous system under such circumstances, both electromagnetic and chemical.然而，此事确实发生，这个事实显示基本上感知系统就生物学而言并不是整体结构的一个形式，而是学习而来的次要反应(secondary response)。但是，打破这种强大的感知模式，对整个身体系统来说是困扰。内在的稳定反应突然一扫而空。在这样的状况下，仍属未知的变化发生在神经系统之内，有电磁也有化学变化。
The inner senses alone are equipped and able to process and perceive other reality systems. Even the distortions can be kept at a minimum with training. Indiscriminate use of the psychedelic drugs can severely shake up learned patterns of response, that are necessary for effective manipulation within physical reality, break subtle connections and disturb electromagnetic functions.单单是内在感官就有足够的配备，能够处理和感知其他实相系统。经由训练，甚至扭曲都可以维持在最低限度。任意使用迷幻药可能会严重撼动学习而来的反应模式，切断细腻的连结并且干扰电磁功能，但是要在物质实相之内有效地操纵，这些模式是必需的。
Ego failure may result. Development of the inner senses is a much more effective method of perceiving other realities, and followed correctly, the ego is not only stronger but more flexible, and consciousness even of physical reality is increased. Such development becomes an unfolding and a natural expansion of the whole personality.结果可能是自我的停摆。要感知其他实相，发展内在感官是一个更为有效的方法，而且要是做法正确，自我不只会更坚强，还会更有弹性，甚至物质实相的意识也会提升。这样的发展变成整个人格的开展和自然扩展。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:31. Jane was well dissociated, she said. Her eyes remained closed. Her pace was fast, her voice still heavy and quite a bit deeper.(9:30分休息。珍说她顺利出离。她的眼睛仍然闭着。她的速度很快，声音依旧沉重而且更为低沉一点。
(Her manner was the same when she resumed at 9:40.)(她在9:40分继续，态度和举止相同。)
These root assumptions are so a part of your own existence that they appear and cloud your dreams.这些根本假设很大程度是你自身存在的一部分。以至于它们出现并且扰乱了你的梦。
Beneath these root assumptions however portions of the self perceive physical reality in an entirely different fashion, free of the tyranny of objects and material form. Here you experience concepts directly, without the need for symbolisms. Here you experience the spacious present directly. Here you have knowledge of your past personalities, and know that they exist simultaneously with your own.然而，在这些根本假设之下，自己的许多部分以完全不同的方式感知物质实相，不受物体和物质形式的暴政束缚。在这里你直接体验观念，不需要象征意义。在这里你直接体验广阔的现在。在这里你认识你过去的人格，也知道它们和你自己的人格同时存在。
The practice of psychological time will allow you to reach these portions of the self. The ego is not artificially disorganized by such practice. It is simply, for the moment, bypassed. The experience gained does become a part of the physical structure, but there is no massive disorganization of perception, since the ego agrees to step aside momentarily.心理时间的练习让你能够触及自己的这些部分。这样的练习不会以人工的方式扰乱自我的动作。只不过会有一时片刻绕过它而已。获得的经验的确变成物质结构的一部分，但不会因此扰乱感知，因为自我同意暂时退到旁边。
It is not bombarded as with drug experiments, and forced to experience chaotic and frightening perceptions that can literally terrify it into complete disorder. Survival in your system is strongly dependent upon the highly specialized, focused, limited but specific organizational qualities of the ego. It should not be rigid but it should not be purposely torn apart, nor weakened.这不像药物实验那样轰炸自我，迫使它体验混乱又可怕的感知，而名副其实把它吓到完全失调。在你们的系统里，存活非常依赖自我那些高度专门化、焦点集中、有限制但又明确的组织化特质。它不应该是僵化的，但它也不应该故意被拆散或削弱。
The root assumptions upon which physical reality is formed represent secure ground to the ego. We always operate with the ego's consent. It consents to step aside momentarily. It interprets the inner knowledge gained in its own way, true, but it is immeasurably enriched by so doing. Other layers of the self interpret the same inner experiences quite differently.物质实相据以形成的根本假设对自我而言代表的是安全基地。我们向来是在自我的同意之下运作的。它同意暂时退到旁边。它用它自己的方式解读获得的内在知识，但是经由这么做，它也不可限量地充实起来。自己的其他层面对同样的经验有着相当不同的解读。
The ego can exist only within the context of these root assumptions. The primary dream experience is finally woven into a structure composed of these root assumptions, and it is these that you remember. These serve you as basic information, but the information is then put into symbolic form. Objects, you see, are symbols. These objects in dreams are symbols of realities that the ego could not otherwise perceive.自我可以只存在这些根本假设之内。主要的梦经验最终被编织成一个由根本假设构成的结构里，而你记得的就是这些经验。这些提供给你基本资讯，但这个资讯接着又被放进象征形式里。物体，你看，就是象征。梦中的这些物体是实相的象征，若非如此，自我就无法感知那些实相。
We will have a very short break, and we shall continue.你们会短暂休息一下，然后再继续。
(Break at 9:55. Jane was again far-out. Again her pace had been fast, her voice strong; the exception now was that her eyes, very dark, began to open at times.(9:55分休息。珍再一次出去很远。再一次她的速度很快，声音强而有力；现在的例外是她的眼睛，颜色非常深，开始偶尔会睁开。
(She resumed with her eyes closed at 10:00. )(她在10点闭着眼睛继续。)
Objects are indeed symbols to represent inner realities that could not otherwise be perceived by physical organisms. You manipulate these symbols.物体确实是代表内在实相的象征，若非如此，物质有机体无法感知那些实相。你操纵这些象征。
Now. Do you have an envelope for me?好。你有没有信封要给我。
(“Yes.”)(“有。”
(Her eyes still closed, Jane took the envelope from me for our 70th experiment, and held it up to her forehead with her right hand. It was 10:01. Her pace was good, and grew faster as the experiment progressed.)(珍的眼睛仍然闭着，她从我这里拿了我们第70次实验的信封，用右手把它放在她的额头上。时间是10:01分。她的速度适中，而且随着实验的进行变得越来越快。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
(Pause.)(停顿)
An array, or disarray. Something twisted. Four square, or four squares. Geometric.一个陈列或杂乱阵列。某个扭曲的东西。田字形，或四个正方形。
(Pause.)(停顿)
A miscellany of objects. Connection with October, and four, or perhaps 64. A main turnabout, or a connection with Maine. 12.各式各样的物件。与10月，以及4，或许是64有关联。一个大转变，或是和缅因州有关联。12。
Some distant connection with an opera, opera house or music.与一出戏剧、一座歌剧院或音乐有遥远的关联。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Five. Familiar. Connection with a circumstance not repeated, and a road. With lace. A group of people, and connection with a boat perhaps, or water.5。熟悉的。与一个不重复的状况和一条路有关联。与蕾丝有关联。一群人，也许与一艘船或水有关联。
16. I do not know, perhaps 16 people, or a 16 date. A presentation. I do not know what we want here. We will try the word acrimony, or acrimonious.16。我不知道，也许是16个人或一个有16的日期。一个展示。我不知道这里我们想要什么。我们会试试“acrimony”(尖酸刻薄)这个字或“acrimonious”(尖酸刻薄的)。
A disturbance in the afternoon. Connection with a letter. Perhaps a Florida postmark. And with a postcard. Perhaps with a water scene on it, or from a location by water.下午的一个干扰。与一封信有关联。或许有一个佛罗里达州的邮戳。而且和一张明信片有关联。也许和它上面的一个水景有关联。或是来自一个水边的地点。
A name with seven letters. An A. Two men and a woman. She wears a hat. Not on the object, but distantly connected with it, an incident in 1946, summer. An implied border.一个有7个字母的名字。一个A。两个男人和一个女人。她戴着一顶帽子。不在物件上，而是和它有遥远的关联。在1964年夏天的一个事故。一个隐含的边界。
Browns. An object in the center that is somehow sharply shaped. For example a star shape, a sharp shape.多种褐色。在正中央的一个物件，形状有点尖锐。比方说，一个星形，一个尖锐的形状。
(Gesture—with her forefinger Jane made angular shapes in the air, her eyes closed.)(比手势——珍闭着眼睛用食指在空中画了有尖角的形状)
An October 16. A small building or house with a flattish roof. A lightish color in sunlight. An orange color, and perhaps with scrolls, or scroll shapes , and a banner.10月16日。一栋小建筑物或房子，屋顶是平的。阳光下一种淡淡的颜色。一种橘色，也许和卷轴或卷轴形状以及一面横幅有关联。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
(“What’s that array or disarray?"(“一个陈列或杂乱陈列是什么？”
(Pause.) I am not sure here. A display, perhaps, though only perhaps, that is not neat, or ordered. As flowers grown wild and disorderly, for example.(停顿)这里我不确定。一个陈列，也许，但只是也许，并不整齐，或井然有序。比方说，就像狂野凌乱生长的花。
(“Can you say something more about geometric?” )(“你能不能多说一点几何图形的事？”)
The shapes perhaps cubes. Gold colored, and partially in shadow. This reminds Ruburt of Jungle Gyms at a playground.形状可能是立方体。颜色是金色，有一部分在阴影中。这让鲁柏想到一个游乐场的攀爬架。
("Can you be more specific about the two men and the woman?” )(“你能不能更清楚说明一下两个男人和一个女人？”)
A photograph (pause) connected with Ruburt. Having to do with the past rather than immediate present.与鲁柏有关的一张照片(停顿)和过去而不是当下有关。
("How about that word acrimony?")(“acrimony[尖酸刻薄]这个字是怎么回事？”)
I do not know. I only have the sounds here. Perhaps Akron, Ohio.我不知道。这里我只有发音而已。或许是俄亥俄州的阿克隆(Akron, Ohio)。
(“Can you say more about the four squares?") Having to do with the geometric shapes .(“你能不能多说明一点4个正方形的事？”)与几何形状有关。
(“How about colors?")(“那颜色呢？”)
These squares may be filled in; as buildings in a photograph would be picked up by me first as shapes , you see.这些正方形可能是被填充进去的：就像一张照片里的许多建筑物，我会先接收到的是它们的形状，你知道。
(“Do you want to name the object?")(“你想不想要说出物件的名称？”)
I am not sure. There is a strong connection with a photograph, but I do not know whether the object itself is a photograph. Dark colors and light colors and shadows. The object I believe came through the mail, whether or not it is a photograph.我不确定。与一张照片有很大的关联，但我不知道物件本身是不是一张照片。深色和浅色以及阴影。我相信物件是邮寄过来的，不管是不是照片。
I suggest your break. Also a column, or columns.我建议你休息一下。还有一栏或几栏。
(Break at 10:18. Jane was again well dissociated, as she had been all evening, she said. Her voice was not as loud this time but her delivery had been fast, as though she wanted to give the data without thinking about it. She reported no images that she remembered. Her eyes had remained closed.(10:18分结束。珍再一次顺利出离，她说她整晚都是如此。她的声音这次没有那么洪亮，但是她的传述很快，仿佛她想都没想就给出资料似的。她说她不记得有画面。她的双眼一直闭着。
(See the copy of the first draft of my letter on page 31. A brief history: Last month our friend Marie Colucci let a local dentist. Dr. Lodico, whom Jane and I have not met, borrow an abstract painting of mine to try out in his office. A couple of weeks ago, on August 31, Dr. Lodico sent payment for the painting, with a request to see more abstracts for his office. Tonight's object is a first draft of my reply to his letter, and is dated September 12.(见前面我那封信的初稿影本。一则简短的历史：上个月，我们的朋友玛莉·克鲁奇让本地一位牙医罗第可医师[Dr. Lodico]借走了一幅我的抽象画，放在他的诊所看看效果如何，珍和我没有见过这位医师。一两周以前的8月31日，罗第可医师寄来这幅画的款项，并要求看看几幅可以挂在诊所的抽象画。今晚的标的物是我回信给他的初稿，日期为9月12日。
(Seth helps out with a few connections after break, but in the meantime Jane and I had made our own. We checked up on one we thought correct after the session, and instead of verifying the data ended up confused, as will be explained.(休息后，赛斯帮忙理清几个关联，但在同时，珍和我也自己找到关联。课后我们核对一个我们认为正确的关联，结果不但没有证实资料，反而糊涂了，稍后会加以解释。
(“An array, or disarray.” Seth's use of “or” is somewhat confusing here, since both these terms can apply to the object. My letter concerns a group, or array of paintings I have available to show Dr. Lodico. Also, the Arts and Crafts Exhibit, featuring displays, or arrays, at Mount Savior is mentioned on the object.(“一个陈列或杂乱阵列。”赛斯这里用“或”有点令人困扰，因为这两个词都适用于标的物。我的信与我可以给罗第可医师看的一组或一批画作有关。此外，标的物上也提到在救世主山[Mount Savior]的艺术与工艺展有许多陈列或阵列。
(Disarray can refer to the jumbled appearance of my letter, used as object, with its crossed-out words, etc. Jane thought that disarray could also refer to the fact that abstract paintings are mentioned in the letter; to some people abstracts would be in disarray, as compared to conventional paintings showing things in the usual sense—flowers, houses, trees, etc.(杂乱阵列可能是指我这封用作标的物的信看起来杂乱无章，上面有划掉的字等等。珍认为杂乱阵列也可能是指信中提到的抽象画这个事实；相较于传统画作按照一般的意义呈现事物——花、房子、树等等，对某些人来说，抽象画是杂乱无章的。
(“Something twisted.” We don’t know, and neglected to ask Seth to explain. Another reference to the elements in abstract paintings, or to the letter itself?(“某个扭曲的东西。”我们不知道，也忘了请赛斯解释。会不会又是指抽象画里的元素或那封信本身？
(“Four square, or four squares.” This is a reference to the fact that I have four paintings to show Dr. Lodico, in answer to his letter. As stated, Jane did not see either the first draft of my letter, which was used as object, or the final copy, which I had sealed in an envelope. I did ask her to mail it, though, and described its contents roughly.(“田字形，或四个正方形。”这是指我在回信中说有4幅画要给罗第可医师看的这个事实。如上所述，珍没见过我用作标的物的那封信的初稿。或是定稿，我把初稿密封在信封里。但是， 的确请她帮我寄信，也大概描述了信的内容。
(Four specific paintings were discussed between us, and I priced each one with Jane present, so that she could quote prices to the doctor should he call while I was away. This data is reinforced by the next data, and vice versa.(我们在讨论的画作有4幅，而且我为每一幅出价格时，珍在场，这样在我出门时，要是医师打电话来，她就可以报价给他。下一个资料强化了这个资料，反之亦然。
(“Geometric.” An excellent reference to the character of the paintings. All of them are geometric variations, featuring lines, circles, triangles, blocks of color, etc., in a fashion definitely angular. In addition, the painting bought by the doctor is also strongly geometric in design.(“几何图形。”一个绝佳的资料，指的是画作的特色。它们全都是几何图案的变化，有线条、图案、三角形、色块等等，角度明确。除此之外，医师买的那幅画在设计上也偏向几何图形。
(“A miscellany of objects.” A reference to the Mount Savior Arts and Crafts Exhibit, mentioned in the letter used as object. Many kinds of objects will be on sale at the exhibit, other than paintings. I have a letter concerning this exhibit and sale from the monastery, dated August 27,1966.(“各式各样的物件。”这是指救世主山的艺术与工艺展，在用作标的物的信上有提到。在展览上，除了绘画以外，还销售很多种物件。我有一封修道院写来的信是关于这个展览和销售活动，日期为1966年8月27日。
(“Connection with October, and four, or perhaps 64. ’’ Without seeing it to make absolutely sure, Jane and I are reasonably sure that the abstract Dr. Lodico has purchased from me was painted in October, 1964. I am sure I did the painting at least two years ago. I have the habit of dating my paintings, so will be able to check this data when I visit the doctor's office. If no notice is added to this data at a later date, it can be taken as correct.(“与10月，以及4，或许是64有关联。”虽然没有察看以便百分百确认，但珍和我相当确定是罗第可医师跟我买的抽象画是在1964年10月完成的。我确定我画那幅画的时间至少是两年前。我习惯在画作上标记日期，因此当我去医师的诊所就可以核对一下这个日期。如果改天没有为这个资料加注，那就可以认定这是正确的。
(Seth confirms the above, incidentally.(附带一提，赛斯确认上文是正确的。
(“A main turnabout, or a connection with Maine.” The turnabout connection is correct. In the letter used as object, I inform Dr. Lodico that I’ve changed my mind about sending the abstracts to the Mount Savior exhibit, and plan to submit other kinds of paintings instead. This makes the abstracts available for the doctor's inspection, and perhaps purchase.(“一个大转变，或是和缅因州有关联。”这个大转变的关联是正确的。在用作标的物的信件中，我通知罗第可医师我改变心意，不把抽象画送去救世山展览，而是计划改送其他类型的画作去参展。这样一来，就有抽象画可以给医师检视，或许购买。
(“Some distant connection with an opera, opera house or music.” This baffled us at first. We missed the actual connection, and Seth helps out later. At this time Jane said one of the abstracts being offered to the doctor reminds her of music. She was going to tell me this before the session, but did not.(“与一出戏剧、一座歌剧院或音乐有遥远的关联。”一开始这让我们百思不解。我们错过实际的连结，后来赛斯帮了我们忙。这时候，珍说提供给医师的那些抽象画让她联想到音乐。她原本打算在上课前告诉我，但是后来没说。
(“12.” We are not sure. I dated the letter used as object however in this fashion: September 12,1966.(“12。”我们不确定。不管怎样，我在用作标的物的信件上是以下列方式标记日期：1966年9月12日。
(“Five.” Interpreting in the same way, I tell the doctor in the last sentence on the letter that we live in apartment five, second floor.(“5。”以同样的方式解读，我在信上的最后一句告诉医师，我们住在5号公寓，二楼。
(“Familiar. ’’Jane was vexed at herself here, for she realized now that when giving the familiar data, she was going to say something about a familiar location, meaning the location of our apartment as something familiar to us. Our address is on the letter used as object.(“熟悉的。”这里珍在生她自己的气，因为这时她发觉她在给出“熟悉的”这个资料时，她本来要说的是和一个熟悉的地点有关的事情，意思是我们的公寓所在地点对我们来说是熟悉的。用作标的物的信件是有我们的地址。
(“Connection with a circumstance not repeated, and a road.” We make no connections for circumstance. Road is also too general. I thought of the long steep road leading up to the Colucci residence in the country. Marie Colucci is responsible for bringing my paintings to the attention of Dr. Lodico, as explained.(“与一个不重复的状况和一条路有关联。”我们找不到与状况有关的连结。路也太笼统了。我想到通往克鲁奇在乡间的住所那条陡峭的长路。之前说明过，是玛莉·克鲁奇让罗第可医师注意到我的画作。
(“With lace.” No connections. Seth helps out later.(“与蕾丝有关。”没有找到连结。赛斯后来帮了忙。
(“A group of people, and connection with a boat perhaps, or water.” The boat and water part of this data refers to our Water Street address on the letter used as object; on past occasions Seth has expressed an interpretation of the Water Street address in this way.(“一群人，也许与一艘船或水有关联。”这个资料的船和水部分指的是，在用作标的物的信件上，我们的地址是华特街[Water Street:译注：直译为水街]；过去有几次，赛斯也用这个方式表达过华特街的解读。
(The group of people data is too vague. It may refer to a recent gathering of friends here at the Water Street address, about two weeks ago. Marie and Andy Colucci were present, and at this gathering Marie told me about Dr. Lodico being interested in my paintings.(一群人的资料太含糊了。它可能是指最近大约两周前，在华特街这个地址有朋友来聚会的事。玛莉和安迪·克鲁奇也来了，在聚会上，玛莉告诉我罗第可医师对我的画有兴趣。
(“16.I do not know, perhaps 16 people, or a 16 date. ”Jane and I make no positive connections.(“16。我不知道，也许是16个人或一个有16的日期。”珍和我找不到任何肯定的关联。
(“A presentation.” In the letter used as object, I offer to present my paintings for the doctors inspection. A presentation could also refer to the Mount Savior Arts and Crafts Exhibit, which is mentioned in the letter. There could be other interpretations.(“一个展示。”在用作标的物的信件上，我提出要展示我的画作给医师检视。一个展示也可能是指信上提到的救世主山艺术与工艺展。可能还有其他的解读。
(“I do not know what we want here. We will try the word acrimony, or acrimonious.” No connections.(“我不知道这里我们想要什么。我们会试试“acrimony”[尖酸刻薄]这个字或“acrimonious”[尖酸刻薄的]。”找不到任何关联。
(“A disturbance in the afternoon.” Possibly a reference to my invitation to the doctor, on the object, to visit us at any time to see the paintings I offer. I say afternoons or evenings might be best. Technically an afternoon visit on his part would interrupt the working hours of Jane and me, but we would not really call it a disturbance since we want to sell the paintings.(“下午的一个干扰。”可能是指在标的物上，我向医师提出的邀请，任何时间他都可以来拜访我们，看看我提供的画作。我说下午或傍晚来最好。技术上，他要是下午来访，就会打断珍和我的工作时间，但是我们想要卖画，所以不会真的称之为干扰。
(“Connection with a letter. Perhaps a Florida postmark.” The object is of course a letter. I believe the Florida data should be included with the mention of a letter, although a separate sentence. Once again, the Water Street address on the letter could give rise to the Florida data. On each of the several times Jane and I have lived in Florida, we have lived very close to the water.(“与一封信有关联。或许有一个佛罗里达州的邮戳。”物件当然是一封信。我相信提到一封信的时候应该把佛罗里达州的资料包含在内，但是句子分开。再一次，信上的华特街地址可能引出了佛罗里达州的资料。珍和我住过佛罗里达州几次，每一次我们都住在非常靠近水边的地方。
(The Florida and water connections also attach themselves to the next data.(佛罗里达州和水的关联也与下一个资料有关。
(“And with a postcard. Perhaps with a water scene on it, or from a location by water.” I specifically mention a postcard in the letter used as object. The water data arises because if the doctor does send me a card, it will be addressed to Water Street.(“而且和一张明信片有关联。也许和它上面的一个水景有关联。或是来自一个水边的地点。”在用作标的物的信件上，我特别提到一张明信片。水的资料之所以出现，是因为医师要是真的寄卡片给我，上面就会写上华特街的地址。
(“A name with seven letters.” Lodico has six letters. Colucci has seven letters however, and Jane was subjectively sure this is the name referred to, especially when taken along with the next data.(“一个有7个字母的名字。”罗第可[Lodico]有6个字母。但是克鲁奇[Colucci]有7个字母，所以珍在主观上确定它指的就是这个名字，尤其是和下一个资料合在一起看的话。
(“An A.”The first name of Marie Coluccis husband is Andy. As stated above, under the group data, Marie and Andy were in the group visiting us a couple of weeks ago. During this visit they discussed the sale of paintings to Dr. Lodico.(“一个A。”玛莉·克鲁奇的丈夫是安迪[Andy]。如上文一群人的资料所述，一两周前在我家的聚会上，玛莉和安迪也在一群人当中。在这次来访时，他们讨论了卖画给罗第可医师的事。
(Jane was sure Andy Colucci was the name referred to here, and Seth confirms this after break.(珍确定这里的名字指的就是安迪·克鲁奇，而赛斯也在休息之后确认了这一点。
(“Two men and a woman. She wears a hat.” We thought of various combinations here, among them Marie Colucci, Dr. Lodico and myself, since we are closely involved with the object. We didn't know whether Marie wears a hat, though. Seth verifies our interpretation, even though we couldn’t be sure.(“两个男人和一个女人。她戴着一顶帽子。”这里我们想到各种不同的组合，其中有玛莉·克鲁奇、罗第可医师和我自己，因为我们与标的物有密切的关系。但是，我们不知道玛莉有没有戴帽子。赛斯证实我们的解读是对的，即便我们并不确定。
(“Not on the object, but distantly connected with it, an incident in 1946, summer.” We don’t know.(“不在物件上，而是和它有遥远的关联。在1964年夏天的一个事故。”我们不知道。
(“An implied border.” The letter used as object does have an implied border.(“一个隐含的边界。”用作标的物的信封的确有一个隐含的边界。
(“Browns. An object in the center that is somehow sharply shaped. For example a star shape, a sharp shape.” Gesture.(“多种褐色。在正中央的一个物件，形状有点尖锐。比方说，一个星形，一个尖锐的形状。[比手势]”
(This data is an excellent reference to the painting roughly indicated here.(这个资料准确指出下图大致显示的画作。
(It is one of the abstracts referred to in the letter used as object tonight. Note the sharp shapes . These shapes float in the center of the painting. In addition the painting is done in various shades of brown, from golden yellow ochre to deep brown.(它是今晚用作标的物的信件上提到的抽象画之一。注意尖锐的形状。这些形状漂浮在画的正中央。除此之外，这幅画是用各种不同的褐色画成的，从金黄褐色到深褐色都有。
(“An October 16.’’We make no connections.(“10月16日。”我们找不到任何关联。
(“A small building or house with a flatfish roof A lightish color in sunlight. An orange color, and perhaps with scrolls, or scroll shapes , and a banner. ’’ This turned out to be confusing data, and at the same time quite interesting. I thought it all of a piece when Seth delivered it, and still do. It may also involve direct telepathy, Jane reading my thoughts here.(“一栋小建筑物或房子，屋顶是平的。阳光下一种淡淡的颜色。一种橘色，也许和卷轴或卷轴形状以及一面横幅有关联。”结果这是一个令人困惑的资料，但同时又很有趣。在赛斯传述它时，我想它是一整个，而且现在还是这么想。它可能牵涉到直接的心电感应，珍在这里读到我的思想。
(As stated, neither of us has met Dr. Lodico, and up to and including the time of this session did not know, where he lived, although we had his address. All evening however, since writing the letter used as object, I had pictured a certain medical building in our neighborhood as probably the site of Dr. Lodico’s office. The building has a flat roof, is one story high, is of red (orange?) (wood that looks lighter in sunlight, and has a series of shingles or name plates hanging outside that might be called banners. I also thought I remembered cast iron grill or scroll works as decoration on the building.(如上所述，我们两个都没有见过罗第可医师，而且一直到这一节以及这一节上课时，我们都不知道他住在哪里，但是我们有他的地址。然而，自从写了这封用作标的物的信之后，整个晚上我都在想像，罗第可医师的诊所可能就在我们社区里的某栋医疗建筑物里。这栋建筑物的屋顶是平的，一层楼高，红色[橘色？]木造，在阳光下看起来颜色比较淡，外面挂着一连串可以称之为横幅的小招牌或名牌。我也想到我记得，在那栋建筑物上有铸铁栏杆或涡卷装饰。
(Jane had no idea as to this buildings location in relation to Dr. Lodico, although of course she has seen it often. After the session, although it was late, I suggested we walk the few blocks to check out the above data. Arriving there, we saw that Dr. Lodico had no office in the building in question. Instead we discovered his office—and that of his father—to be in a conventional two-story building across the street from the building with a flatfish roof.(对于这栋与罗第可医师有关的建筑物所在地点，珍毫无概念，虽然她当然经常看到它。课后，尽管天色已晚，我提议两人走过几条街，去核对一下上述资料。到达那里时，我们看见罗第可医师的诊所不在讨论中的建筑物里。反之，我们发现他的诊所——以及他父亲的诊所——就在那栋平顶建筑物对街的一间传统两层楼房里。
(This was the first time either of us had specifically noted that Dr. Lodico had his office in a certain building that both of us had driven past many times. His sign is fastened to the wall of the house beside an office door, beneath a porch roof and would not be readable, probably, from a passing car.(这是我们两人第一次特别注意到罗第可医师的诊所在某栋我们开车经过很多次的建筑物里。他的招牌固定在这间房子的墙上，在一扇办公室大门边的玄关屋顶下，行经的车辆可能看不清上面的字样。
(Jane and I considered two possibilities. Since I had the medical building with the flat roof strongly in mind during the evening, Seth could have picked this up telepathically from me and used it for data. Or the proximity of this building to Dr. Lodico’s actual office could have resulted in confused impressions which Jane gave voice to. The two buildings are no more than fifty feet apart in physical space, being directly across the street from each other.(珍和我想到两个可能性。因为今晚在我的脑海里有这栋平顶建筑物的画面，所以赛斯可能透过心电感应从我这里接收到，而把它当作资料。或是，这栋建筑与罗第可医师真正的诊所很相似，可能因而导致珍口述了混淆的印象。在物质空间里，两栋建筑物相距不超过50英尺，两者隔着街道直接面对面。
(Both of us are very familiar with the medical building with the flat roof, since it is of distinctive design, whereas Dr. Lodico’s office across the street is housed in a conventional building we haven’t paid any particular attention to. I may ask Seth to straighten us out here, next session, since after break he told us my first interpretation of this data was correct; actually it is not correct.(我们两人都很熟悉那栋平顶建筑物，因为它的设计独特，反之，罗第可医师的诊所位于对街的楼房却是我们不会特别注意的传统建筑。下一节，我可能会请赛斯澄清一下这里，因为在休息之后他告诉我们，我对这个资料的第一个解读是正确的，但它其实并不正确。
(First Question: What's that array or disarray? “I am not sure here. A display, perhaps, though only perhaps, that is not neat, or ordered. As flowers grown wild and disorderly, for example.” Here I sought elaboration of Seth’s first data. As stated, my letter used as object specifically mentions the Arts and Crafts Exhibit at Mount Savior. This could be a display. My abstracts, offered for sale to Dr. Lodico, can also be a display; and again, to some abstract paintings might not seem neat, or ordered.(第一个问题：一个陈列或杂乱阵列是什么？“这里我不确定。一个陈列，也许，但只是也许，并不整齐，或井然有序。比方说，就像狂野凌乱生长的花。”这里我要求赛斯详述第一个资料。如上所述，我用作标的物的信明确提到救世主山的艺术与工艺展。这可能是一个陈列。我提供给罗第可医师购买的抽象画，也可能是一个陈列；而且再一次，有些抽象画可能看起来是整齐或井然有序的。
(As an aside, Jane personally likes abstract painting, so we don't know whether this would influence such related data or not. Also, checking out the building data described on the last page, we saw that flowers were used as decoration for both the Lodico office, and the medical office building with the flat roof across the street. Both displays of flowers were orderly however.(岔题一下，珍个人喜欢抽象画，所以我们不知道这是否会影响这样的相关资料。此外，核对上一页描述的建筑物资料时，我们看到罗第可诊所以及对街的平顶医疗诊所建筑物两者都用花做装饰。然而两者陈列的花都很整齐。
(2nd Question: Can you say something more about geometric “The shapes perhaps cubes. Gold colored, and partially in shadow. This reminds Ruburt of Jungle Gyms at a playground.” See the sketch of the abstract on page 39. As stated, this is one of the group of paintings written about in the letter used as object. This particular painting has strong cubist leanings. Some of the shapes in it are based on cubes. It is painted in browns, ochres, and golden tones. Shadows play a prominent role in it also. And Jane said the design of the painting, with its interlocking angular shapes and lines, reminds her of a Jungle Gym at a playground.(第二个问题：你能不能多说一点几何图形的事？“形状可能是立方体。颜色是金色，有一部分在阴影中。这让鲁柏想到一个游乐场的攀爬架。”见前面的抽象画素描。如上所述，这是用作标的物的信上写到的几幅画作之一。这一幅画有强烈的立体派倾向。画中的一些形状是以立方体为基础。它是用多种褐色、橘色和金黄色调画成的。阴影也在画中扮演显著的角色。珍说这幅画的设计——多角的形状和线条交互相扣，让她联想到游乐场的攀爬架。
(3rd Question: Can you be more specific about the two men and the woman? “A photograph, connected with Ruburt. Having to do with the past rather than the immediate present.” This is associative data, Jane said, and came about because of the geometric data above. The geometric data recalled Jungle Gyms to her mind; these in turn reminded her of a photograph of herself, which she still has, that was taken of her at a playground in Saratoga Springs, NY, with a Jungle Gym in back of her.(第三个问题：你能不能更清楚说明一下两个男人和一个女人？“与鲁柏有关的一张照片。和过去而不是当下有关。”珍说，这是联想的资料，因为上述的几何图形资料而产生。几何图形资料让她想起攀爬架；这些接着又联想到她自己的一张照片，在纽约州撒拉托加温泉市的一个游乐场拍的，她身后的背景是一座攀爬架，她现在还有这张照片。
(4th Question: How about that word acrimony? “I do not know. I have only the sounds here. Perhaps Akron, Ohio.” Studying the letter used as object, we see nothing to particularly remind us either of acrimony, anger, or Akron. The Coluccis for instance do not come from Akron, nor do we. We do not know anything about the history of Dr. Lodico or his family.(第四个问题：acrimony[尖酸刻薄]这个字是怎么回事？“我不知道。这里我只有发音而已。或许是俄亥俄州的阿克隆。”端详用作标的物的信件，我们看不到让我特别想到acrimony、anger[愤怒]或Akron[阿克隆]的蛛丝马迹。比方说，克鲁奇夫妇并非来自阿克隆，我们也不是。我们不知道罗第可医师或他家人的任何历史。
(5th Question: Can you say more about the four squares? “Having to do with the geometric shapes .” In asking this question I sought to tie the four squares data to that of the geometric shapes , and Seth confirms the idea. See the original interpretations on pages 36 and 37.(第五个问题：你能不能多说明一点四个正方形的事？“与几何形状有关。”我问这个问题是想要连结四个正方形的资料与几何图形的资料，而赛斯确认这个想法。最初的解读见前面相关页面。
(6th Questions: How about colors?” These squares may be filled in; as buildings in a photograph would be picked up by me first as shapes , you see.” As well as answering the question in an oblique way, Seth appears to be still considering the geometric data. Note that the photograph idea persists, once brought up through personal association.(第六个问题：那颜色呢？“这些正方形可能是被填充进去的：就像一张照片里的许多建筑物，我会先接收到的是它们的形状，你知道。”除了拐弯抹角地回答问题之外，赛斯看起来还在思考几何图形的资料。注意，一旦经由个人联想而产生，照片的概念仍然持续不退。
(The photo idea however is quite legitimate, since a photo can be related to a painting in many ways. The areas on all of the abstracts are of course filled in, and also the abstract foundation of the paintings relates them to the idea of buildings. In fact a friend interpreted one of them as being a painting of buildings recently. Jane said Seth might not be able to very easily distinguish between the Emotional charges connected to a photo and a painting; they might appear much alike to his perceptions. This is even more apparent in the next data, which I break into two parts.(然而，照片的概念是相当合理的，因为一张照片可能在很多方面与一幅画有关联。在所有抽象画当中的区域当然是被填充进去的，而且画作的抽象基础让它们和建筑物的概念产生关联。事实上，最近就有个朋友解读其中一幅是建筑物的画作。珍说赛斯可能无法轻易区分与一张照片以及一幅画有关的情感能量；对他的感知而言，它们看起来非常相似。这在下一个资料更是明显，我把它分成两个部分。
(7th Question: Do you want to name the object? “I am not sure. There is a strong connection with a photograph, but I do not know whether the object itself is a photograph. Dark colors and light colors and shadows.” Thus the visual idea of a painting and a photo are closely related, to Seth. Some distinction is made, either by Seth or Jane, in that a photo is not definitely named as the object. “Dark colors and light colors and shadows" can refer to either a photo or a painting; the description is quite apt for the painting roughly indicated on page 39.(第七个问题：你想不想要说出物件的名称？“我不确定。与一张照片有很大的关联，但我不知道物件本身是不是一张照片。深色和浅色以及阴影。”因此一幅画和一张照片的视觉概念是密切相关的，对赛斯来说。不是赛斯就是珍做了某种区分，因为没有明确说出物件名称是一张照片。“深色和浅色以及阴影”可能是指一张照片或一幅画；这样描述前面粗略显示的画作颇为贴切。
(7th Question continued: “The object I believe came through the mail, whether or not it is a photograph.” Very good, if not one hundred percent correct. The object is of course a letter; it is destined to go through the mail tomorrow. A related thought concerns the letter I had from Dr. Lodico, and mentioned earlier—this of course has already gone through the mail, on August 31.(第七个问题：“我相信物件是邮寄过来的，不管是不是照片。”非常好，就算不是百分之百正确。物件当然是一封信；它预定明天会被邮寄出去。一个相关的想法与我收到罗第可医师寄来的信有关，而且之前已经提过——这当然已经在8月31日邮寄过去了。
(“Also a column, or columns.” Jane said she thought this data, tacked on at the close, referred to the fact that she has an idea to sell a weekly column on ESP to the local paper, and has been working up samples lately.(“还有一栏或几栏。”珍说她认为这个在结束之际添加的资料，指的是她想把每周一次的超感官知觉专栏卖给本地报社的这个事实，而且她最近一直在准备范本。
(Jane resumed in a quieter manner at 10:55.)(珍在10:55分以较为安静的方式继续。)
We will shortly close our session.我们很快就要结束这一节。
The lace was a very distant and distorted connection. Ruburt was thinking of a lace altar cloth, which was to have led him to a religious connection. I use his associative processes, you see, but this was short-circuited here.蕾丝是一个非常遥远而且扭曲的关联。鲁柏在想一块蕾丝祭坛桌布，因而导致他产生宗教的连结。我运用他的联想过程，你知道，但这里却短路了。
The two men and the woman were yourself(meaning me) the doctor and your friend Marie Colucci. The seven letters and the A did represent Andy Colucci.两个男人和一个女人是你自己(意思是我)、医师和你的朋友玛莉·克鲁奇。7个字母和A确实是代表安迪·克鲁奇。
(“Is our interpretation of that building data correct?”)(“我们对那栋建筑物的解读正确吗？”)
It is indeed.正确无误。
(See pages 39 and 40, explaining our confusion over this data. Seth’s answer, above, contributed to the confusion, and is in error. The next session has by now been held. It concerns a discussion by Seth of the envelope experiments. He discusses this particular building data and the inaccurate answer in a most interesting manner. He also confirms our idea that Jane picked up the building data from me telepathically.)(见前面的资料，解释了我们对这个资料的疑惑。上述赛斯的回答，更加深疑虑，而且是错的。这时已经举行了下一节课，课间赛斯讨论了这些信封实验。他以一种非常有趣的方式讨论了这一栋建筑物的资料以及这个不正确的答案。他也确认我们的想法，珍确实透过心电感应从我身上接收到建筑物的资料。)
The October connection had to do with the painting already purchased. I believe the music referred to Ruburts subjective feelings about one painting (we had hesitated to credit this when we interpreted the data), and also to some musical leanings on the dentist’s part, or his family.10月份与已经卖掉的画有关联。我相信音乐是指鲁柏对其中一幅画的主观感觉(我们在解读这个资料时，对于要不要纳入这一点很犹豫)，也是指牙医师本人或他家人爱好音乐的倾向。
The opera here though was a legitimate connection, having to do with the way the mass is sung at Mount Saviors. The Gregorian chant is what we were after here. This was quite legitimate.这里的歌剧是一个确实的关联，与救世主山唱诵的弥撒曲有关。我们这里想说的是葛利果圣歌(Gregorian Chant)。这是相当确实的。
(After the session Jane said she should have caught this connection, since she was brought up a Catholic and is quite familiar with the chant, mass, etc. This music is among her favorites. Remember that I mentioned Mount Savior specifically in the letter used as object. The lace data might also Jail into this category.)(课后，珍说她应该要接住这个关联，因为她从小就是个天主教徒，相当熟悉圣歌、弥撒等等。这首乐曲是她的最爱之一。记得我在用作标的物的信上明确提到救世主山。蕾丝资料可能也属于这个类别。)
Now. I am able as usual to carry on for some time. Out of the goodness of my heart, I will however close our session. I would of course stay at your request. My heartiest wishes to you both.好。我一如既往可以继续好一会儿。但是我宅心仁厚，所以要结束我们的课了。你要我留下，我当然会留。给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。
The opera, I might add again, was a good connection, that you would have ordinarily missed.歌剧，我再次补充一下，是一个贴切的关联，不然你们通常会忽略掉。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(End at 11:11. Jane was well dissociated again.)(11:11分结束。珍再一次顺利出离。)

SESSION 286 第286节 思想就是行动 根源梦


SEPTEMBER 14, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年9月14日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking while sitting down, with her eyes starting to open almost at once. Her voice was average, her pace on the slow side.)(珍一边坐下来，一边开始说话，双眼几乎立刻开始睁开。她的声音一般，速度偏慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
There are several points I would like to make concerning our own envelope experiments.关于我们自己的信封实验，有几个重点我想说一下。
There are some things that I do not believe you clearly understand. To me, a thought is an action. It is as valid a reality. There is no basic difference between telepathy and clairvoyance, as you term them. The Emotional feelings connected with an item are as real to me as the item itself. It is these Emotional charges that are interpreted, and finally translated into physical terms.有一些事情我不相信你清楚明了。对我来说，一个思想就是一个行动。它是一样有效的实相。按照你们用的词语，心电感应和千里眼之间没有任何基本的差异。与一个物品相连的情绪感觉，对我来说，与这个物品本身一样真实。被解读的是这些情感电荷，最后再翻译成实质的说法。
In other words, the Emotional charges allow me to hunt for the item that you want me to identify. I do not begin with the item and reach outward. I identify first of all with the Emotional realities, for these are the only basic realities to me. Then I form these into my interpretations of the item itself.换句话说，情感电荷让我能够搜寻你想要我辨认的物件。我并不是一开始先找到物件，再向外延伸。我首先认同情感实相，因为这些对我来说是唯一的基本实相。然后我再用这些形成我对物件本身的解读。
(Both cats were in for the night. Now they began playing noisily about the room.)(晚上两只猫都在屋内。现在它们开始在房间四处跑，声音很吵。)
Sometimes subconsciously Ruburt makes these last connections. You may take a break and care for your pussies.有时候在潜意识里，鲁柏会找出最后这些连结。你可以休息一下，照顾你们的猫咪。
(At 9:071 put the cats in a back room and closed the door, while Jane waited still in trance, her eyes closed.)(9:07分。我把猫放进后面的房间，关上门，这时珍仍在出神中等着，闭着眼睛。)
Now. If a particular question is asked, we attempt to answer it. The answer of course will be picked up in the same manner, through Emotional force. The other evening, you answered your own question in your mind, and we picked up that location. To call this telepathy tells you nothing however, for all such information is the result of Emotional force.好。如果有一个特定的问题被提出来，我们就会尝试回答它。答案当然是以同样的方式被接收，透过情感力量。前天晚上，你在心里回答了你自己的问题，于是我们接收到那个地点。不过，称之为心电感应并没有让你了解什么，因为这样的资讯全部都是情感力量的结果。
(Here Seth refers to the last session, and the confusing envelope data in which Seth told us, in error, that certain data pertaining to a medical building was correct. At the time Jane and I suspected telepathy from me. See page 39.)(这里赛斯指的是上一节，而在那个令人困惑的信封资料中，赛斯告诉我们某个关于一栋医疗建筑物的资料是正确的，但其实是错的。当时珍和我怀疑它出自我的心电感应。)
I did not then distinguish as to whether or not, in this particular case, what you thought was true. It was true enough on certain levels. Your Emotional answer however did prevent me from searching further for the answer.所以，在这个特定的案例中，我没有分辨出你的想法是不是真实。在某些层面上，它够真实。不过，你的情感答案的确妨碍我进一步搜寻答案。
In all these experiments I receive the Emotional and psychic impressions first, and then attempt to name your object.在这些实验当中，我都是先接收到情感和心灵的印象，然后再尝试指出你的物件名称。
Now. You form your dreams on many levels, as you know. In some of them you spread your own root assumptions outward, creating dream images based upon these assumptions. I must use these assumptions in interpreting our data during experiments. If you give me for example a card that was sent with love, then the love is far more real to me than the card. I follow these Emotional charges most minutely, using great discrimination in order to let myself be led to the specific object.现在。如你所知，你在很多层面上形成你的梦。在一些梦当中，你向外散播你自己的根本假设，依据这些假设创造梦意象。在实验期间，我必须使用这些假设来解读我们的资料。比方说，如果你给我一张带着爱寄出的卡片，那这份爱对我来说远比卡片还要真实多了。我非常仔细地跟随这些情感电荷走，运用极大的识别力，以便让我自己被带去特定的物件那里。
Size, you see, means relatively little to me. A note that was quickly written I may interpret as a small piece of paper, you see, though the paper itself may be large. I think in intensities, and curb my tendency in order to focus more specifically.大小，你知道，对我来说不太有意义。一个匆忙写下的笔记，我可能会解读成一小张纸，你看，但是纸本身可能是大张的。我思考的是强度，为了更明确地聚焦，而抑制我的倾向。
I must translate the basic data so that it will fit your root assumptions. Sometimes Ruburts associative abilities help, and I try to guide them for our purposes. The Emotional charge connected with an item may lead me into both your past and present, but I must then distinguish for you between what has happened and what will happen, although for me no such difference exists.我必需翻译基本资料，好让它符合你们的根本假设。有时候鲁柏的联想能力可以帮上忙，我便试着引导它们以便达成我们的目的。与一个物件相连的情感电荷可能同时把我带到你的过去和现在，但我就必须为你分辨什么是已经发生的事，什么又是将会发生的事，尽管对我来说，这里的分别根本不存在。
There are various difficulties. I may quite legitimately receive the impression of unendurable heaviness, for example, but then this must be properly interpreted, does the heaviness apply to a heavy psychic sorrow, or a heavy physical weight?各种各样的困难都有。我可以相当确实地接收到，比方说，不可承受之重的印象，但接着就必须适当地翻译这个印象，沉重适用于一种沉重的心灵哀伤，或是一种沉重的物质重量？
The impression, colon: something presses down. Again, quite legitimate perhaps, but is this a threatening event, or is it perhaps a threatening physical object?印象，加冒号：某个往下压的东西。再一次，也许相当合理，但这是一个令人感觉受到威胁的事件，或是一个令人感觉受到威胁的实物？
The initial impressions are simple, quite elementary, and always correct. It is in the interpretation and refinement that the only difficulties ever arise. The stronger the Emotional charge connected with the item, however, the stronger the impressions received, and the more correct the data as a rule.最初的印象很简单、很基本，而且向来都是正确的。唯一会出现困难的是在解读和琢磨上。然而，与这个物品相连的情感电荷越强烈，接收到的印象也越强烈，而且资料通常比较正确。
Your impression of the building the other evening contained the strongest Emotional charge instantly available, that seemed to offer the needed information.你前天晚上的建筑物印象包含立即可得的强烈情感电荷，因而似乎提供了所需的资讯。
You may now take a brief break and we shall continue.你现在可以短暂休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:31. Jane was well dissociated', she said. Her eyes opened slowly at break, and were darkly circled and bleary. They had opened during delivery at times. She resumed the same way, with pauses, at 9:40.)(9:31分休息。珍说她顺利出离。她的眼睛在休息时缓慢张开，被深色围绕着，朦胧不清。在传述时，它们偶尔会睁开。9:40分，她以同样的方式继续，时而停顿。)
My root assumptions are entirely different, so some interpretation is always involved.我的根本假设完全不同，所以总是会做一些解读。
I mentioned that objects are symbols to express a basic reality, the reality of direct experience. On one level dreams deal with objects and dream images. Here they are still being used as symbols. At deeper levels however in the dream state there is direct experience, and objects are not used.我提过，物体是象征，表达一个基本实相——直接经验的实相。在某个层面，梦与物体和梦意象打交道。在这里它们仍然被当成象征使用。不过，在更深的层面，梦状态当中会有直接的经验，而不会使用物体。
There are root dreams that represent basic inner experiences. Initially no images are involved. If you remember the dreams, you remember them with images however. Flying dreams are an example here. They are not symbolic of anything, basically speaking. They represent direct experience.有代表基本内在经验的根源梦(root dreams)。原本梦是不涉及意象的。然而，如果你记得梦，那你记得的它们是意象。这里飞行梦就是一个例子。基本上来说，它们不是任何东西的象征。它们代表直接的经验。
If you recall the dream it may seem to you that you were in your physical body. Your physical root assumptions in this case would be so strong that you could not imagine yourself, even in a dream, without a physical body. We have discussed the various forms actually used, however.如果你回想这个梦，那么似乎对你来说，你是在你的肉身里。在这个案例中，你肉身的根本假设太强大了，以至于甚至在梦中，你都无法想象你自己没有肉身。不管怎样，我们已经讨论过实际上会用到的各种形式。
Falling dreams also belong to the root dream category. They also represent direct experience, as the inner self once more reenters the physical body. No up or down really exists, you see, but the root assumptions take these directions for granted, and the fear of falling is a learned response. It is learned early, but it is learned.坠落梦也属于根源梦这个类别。它们也代表直接的经验，内我再一次重新进入肉身。上上下下并不真的存在，你知道，但是根本假设认为这些方向是理所当然的，对坠落的恐惧则是一个学习而来的反应。它是早年学习而来的，但它就是学习而来的。
Dreams in which psychic instruction is given: here we have another example of a root dream. Again, not symbolic but actual experience. Past life dreams are root dreams. This is not to say that upon awakening the direct experience is not automatically intermixed with other dream elements.给予心灵指导的梦：这里我们有另一个根源梦的例子。再一次，它们不是象征而是实际的经验。前世梦是根源梦。这并不是说在醒来时，直接的经验不会自动与其他梦元素混在一起。
With some individuals some of these dreams may also represent personal symbolisms, but the original dream in the raw, unembellished, is a root dream. The embellishments are added after the dream is completed, just before the point when you remember it on a conscious level. The embellishments may be portions of other dreams, recalled now out of context, and attached to your memory of the original root dream.对某些个体而言，这些梦可能也代表个人的象征意义，但赤裸裸的原创梦(original dream)，未加粉饰，就是一个根源梦。加上粉饰的时间是在这个梦完成之后，恰好你在意识层面记得它之前。粉饰可能是其他的梦所属的部分，在特定的背景之外被想起，附加在你对原创根源梦的记忆上。
I have only given you a few of the basic root assumptions. Countless minor ones follow from these however, and serve to direct the line of inquiry, exploration and perception. You will remember your own root dreams much more clearly simply because you are familiar, now, with root assumptions, and therefore freer to divest yourself of them within the dream situation.我只给你几个基本的根本假设。然而，有无数的小假设随着这些而来，可以指挥询问、探索和感知的路线。你记得自己的根源梦之所以会清楚很多，只因为现在你熟知根本假设，而在梦情境之内更能够自由地摆脱它们。
Geometric figures represent the most simple and basic root assumptions. When I have perceived the Emotional charges connected with any given experimental object, then my first step in interpretation involves such abstract forms.几何图形代表最简单也最基本的根本假设。当我感知到任何既定实验物件连结的情感电荷时，接着我在解读上的第一步就会涉及到这样的抽象形式。
Within your system however, color, to man, is more important than shape, though this is not true with all species in your system. Color is closer to Emotional experience than shape. It is also, believe it or not, closer to sound. The connections between color and Emotion are too obvious to discuss here.然而，在你们的系统之内，比起形状，颜色对人类来说更重要，虽然对你们系统里的所有物种而言，这并非事实。颜色比形状更接近情感经验。不管你们相不相信，它也更接近声音。颜色和情感之间的连结太明显，这里就不讨论了。
To me, an Emotion will automatically be translated into color in many instances. Here you see—but try this: do you see a connection between the color red and the word quick?对我来说，一种情绪在很多情况下会自动被翻译成颜色。这里你看——但试试这个：你有没有看见红色与快这个字之间的连结？
(Jane stared at me, her eyes wide and very dark.(珍盯着我看，双眼圆睁且颜色很深。
(“Yes.")(“有。”)
This is the sort of thing with which I deal. There is a constant transformation of data from one set of terms to another. (Pause.) The word short, or rather the impression of briefness. Now I must decide in which way this briefness shall be interpreted. Something brief in time, or brief in space, which could lead me for example to the impression of a small building. Do you see?我处理的就是这种东西。从一套说法到另一套说法的转换一直持续着。(停顿)短这个字，更确切地说其实是简短这个印象。此时我必须决定这个简短要用什么方式解读。某个东西在时间上的短暂，还是在空间上的短小，这会把我带到，比方说，一栋小建筑物的印象去。你明白吗？
(“Yes."(“明白。”)
(Pause.) The impression stony: shall I follow this in dimensions of physical matter, shall I interpret stony as a rocky ground, or as a stony expression on someone’s face?(停顿)多石的(stony)印象：我应该在物质维度跟着这个印象走吗？我应该把多石解读成一个多岩石的地面，还是某个人脸上冷若冰霜(译注：stony也有冷酷无情之意)的表情呢？
You may take a brief break.你可以短暂休息一下。
(Break at 10:06. Once again Jane was far-out, her eyes opening slowly. They had been closed much of the time. She said that giving the material tonight was something like taking a test or examination, because Seth wanted her to give voice to his meaning as accurately as possible.(10:06分休息。再一次，珍出去很远，她的眼睛缓慢张开。它们大部分时间都闭着。她说今晚给出这份资料有点像参加测验或考试一样，因为赛斯想要她尽可能精确地说出他的意思。
(Resume at 10:15.)(10:15分继续。)
There is a strong connection between what I have been saying and the way in which you translate inner reality into symbolic form, either in the waking life, as objects, or in the dreaming state as dream images. I am working from the other end, you see.我在说的东西与你在醒时和梦中把内在实相翻译为象征形式的方法之间有一个强烈的连结；在醒时生活中，你把它翻译成物体，在做梦状态里则是梦意象。你看，我是从另一端下手。
("Yes. ”)(“明白。”)
Your outward physical experiences are also symbolic interpretations of inner reality. That sentence can be outlined several times.你的外在物质经验也是内在实相的象征解读。这个句子可以圈个几次。
The physical body as an object is, among other things, a symbolic representation of your own Emotional reality.除了其他物体之外，肉身这个物体也是你自身情感实相的一个象征。
(Long pause.) Your dreams and your waking experiences both closely mirror your psychic condition. Symbols may be individualistic to some small extent, but physical bodies are your main symbols. While they are all amazingly different, the basic symbol within your system is universally accepted as a reality.(长时间停顿)你的梦和你的醒时经验两者贴切地反映你的心灵状况。象征可能因人而异到某种程度，但肉身就是你们的主要象征。虽然它们全都有着惊人的差异，但是在你们的系统之内，基本的象征却被当成普世皆然的公认实相。
The physical state of your world therefore effectively mirrors the inner condition of its inhabitants. You can tell an artist’s abilities from his paintings, as you observe them, can you not?你们世界的物质状态因此有效地反映出住民们的状况。你可以从一名画家的画作判断出他的能力，不是吗？
("Yes.”)(“是的。”)
The world as you know it is mankind’s creation, and his abilities and limitations are all in evidence there. Within the dream state all mankind knows the outcome of any given dilemma. No predestination is involved. The problems have already been worked out on a mental or psychic level, but not yet physically materialized.你所知的世界是人类创造的作品，而他的能力与限制在那里全都明显可见。在梦状态中，所有的人类都知道任何两难困局的结果。与宿命毫无关系。难题已经在心智或心灵层面被解决了，但是在物质上还没有显化。
Precognitive dreams therefore are precognitive only in line with your own accepted root assumptions. Decisions have already been made, but have not yet caught up to you within the physical system.预知性的梦，只是相对于你们所接受的根本假设来说是预知性的。决定早已作出，只是在物质系统还没与你相见。
We are going to begin on an interesting tangent that is however quite connected with this discussion, but it is too late to begin this evening. We shall hold it then for our next session.我们打算岔题一下，开始谈一件有趣的事，但是它和这个讨论也很有关联，只不过今晚来不及开始谈了。那我们就留待下一节再谈。
I will close then, with my heartiest regards to you both.那我要结束了，向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:30. Jane was again far-out, she said. She didn't recall too much of what Seth had said.)(10:30分结束。珍说她再度出去很远。她不太记得赛斯说了什么。)

SESSION 287 第287节 经验以强度和价值完成来感知


SEPTEMBER 21, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年9月21日 星期三 晚上9点
(The regularly scheduled session for Monday, September 19, was not held.(9月19日星期一的定期课没有举行。
(Jane said she had no idea of what Seth would talk about before the session began. She began speaking with a smile, her eyes open and very dark.)(在这一节开始之前，珍说她对于赛斯会说什么一点概念都没有。她带着微笑开始说话，双眼睁开而且颜色很深。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Welcome back.欢迎回来。
(Smile.)(微笑)
Now. Experience is not built up layer upon layer, along the lines of continual moments. Basically, experience has nothing to do with time as you know it. Experience is felt in terms of intensities and value fulfillment. As you should know, an experience lasting only a few moments can outweigh in significance a much more lasting one. The dream experience is rather independent of physical time, and its experience, or rather its intensity—my error—is felt more directly while you are in the dream situation.现在。经验并不是一层一层沿着连续时刻的路线那样累积的。基本上，经验和你所知的时间一点关系都没有。人是从强度和价值完成的角度来感受经验。你应该知道，一个只持续几个片刻的经验可能比一个持续时间长很多的经验更为重要。梦经验相当独立于物理时间之外，而且在梦情境中，你更为直接感受它的经验，或更确切地说，它的强度——我的错。
Later you may not recall it, but you have a more direct connection with reality in the dream state, and the intensity of the dream experience is more completely perceived. I am speaking now in terms of basic reality. It is less camouflaged in the dream state. For this reason, in any projections you may be startled, for here you also enter a less strictly camouflaged situation.后来你可能不记得它，但在梦状态中，你与实相的连结更直接，而且可以更完整感知梦经验的强度。我现在说的是基本实相。它在梦状态中比较没有伪装。由于这个原因，在任何投射中，你可能会被吓到，因为在这里你也进入一个伪装比较不严密的情境。
You will sometimes automatically translate this reality into physical terms. Such images will be hallucinatory, but it may take a while for you to distinguish their real nature. It must be understood however here that all physical objects are also hallucinatory. They may be called mass hallucinations.你有时候会自动从物质的角度翻译这个实相。这样的意象是幻觉，但你可能要过一阵子才能够分辨它们的真实性质。不过这里要了解的是，所有的实质物体也都是幻觉。可能称之为集体幻觉。
There is a constant translation of inner reality into objects in the waking state, and a constant translation of ideas into pseudoobjects in the dreaming state. Within a certain portion of dream reality, ideas or thoughts can be translated into pseudoobjects, and transported. This can only happen within certain ranges of intensities. This is what happens when you adopt a pseudoform in projections, though I am simplifying this considerably.在醒时状态中，把内在实相翻译成物体的过程持续不断，而在做梦状态中，把意念翻译成伪物体的过程也是持续不断。在梦实相的某个部分之内，意念或思想可能被翻译成伪物体，然后传送。这只能发生在某些范围之内。这就是当你在投射中采用一个伪形式时发生的状况，只不过我很大程度简化了这件事。
When you travel, so to speak, beyond a certain range of intensities, even pseudoobjects must vanish. They exist in a cluster about, and connected to, your own system. The lack of even pseudoobjects obviously means that you have gone beyond your camouflage system. If it were possible for you, you would then travel through a range of intensities in which no camouflage existed. Then you would encounter the pseudocamouflage, you see, of the next system. This would or would not be physical matter, according to the system.可以说，当你旅行到某个强度之外的时候，甚至连伪物体都必须消失。它们成群存在你自己的系统四周，并与之连结。甚至是缺少伪物体都意味着你已经越过你的伪装系统。如果你可以做到的话，那么你会穿越一个没有任何伪装存在的强度范围，然后你看，你就会遇见下一个系统的假伪装(pseudocamouflage)。根据这个系统，这会是或不会是实质物体。
You would then encounter the heart of the camouflage area. The completely uncamouflaged areas at the outer edges of the various systems should remind you of the undifferentiated areas between various life cycles in the subconscious. This is no coincidence, as this general setup occurs in all realities.接着你会遇见伪装区域的中心。在各个不同的系统外缘有完全没有伪装的区域，这些区域应该会让你想起潜意识里各个不同生命周期之间没有分化的区域。这不是巧合，因为这个常规设置发生在所有的实相中。
As a rule there is little communication, you see, through those uncamouflaged or undifferentiated areas. They act in fact as boundaries, even while they represent the basic stuff of which all camouflage is composed. Without the camouflage, you see, you would perceive nothing using the physical senses.通常，由于那些没有伪装或没有分化的区域，你看，沟通少之又少。事实上它们的作用是界限，即使它们同时代表构成所有的基本原料。没有伪装，你看，你使用肉体感官就感知不到任何东西。
The sentence is really meaningless however, because the physical senses themselves are camouflage, you see. There would be nothing to translate. It is only use of the inner senses that will allow you to perceive under these circumstances. Theoretically, if you can bridge the gap between various reincarnations, then you can bridge the gap between your system and another.然而这个句子其实是没有意义的，因为肉体感官本身就是伪装，你知道。不会有任何东西可以翻译。在这些情况下，只有使用内在感官，你才能够感知。理论上，如果你能够缩短各个转世之间的差距，那你就能够缩短你的系统与另一个系统之间的差距。
Once more, the undifferentiated layers or areas are composed of the vitality that forms the camouflage of all systems. It is not therefore—that is, such an area is not, therefore—a separate thing in itself, but simply a portion of vitality that contains no camouflage, and is therefore again unrecognizable to those within any given system.再一次，没有分化的层面或区域是由生命力构成的，这个生命力形成了所有系统的伪装。因此它——也就是说，这样一个区域——本身并不是一个分开的东西，而就只是生命力的一部分，其中没有任何伪装，所以，再一次，任何既定系统之内的那些存在体不认得它。
Now, there is a connection between these areas and the idea of infinity, but first take your first break, and we shall continue.现在，这些区域和无限的概念之间有一个关联，但首先开始你第一次的休息，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:29. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her slow pace had increased somewhat by break time. She resumed at 9:39.)(9:29分休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度到了休息时稍微加快。她在9:39分继续。)
You are in touch with infinity in such undifferentiated areas, for it is only camouflage that gives you your conception of time.你们在这样的未分化区域接触到无限，因为它只是伪装而已，你们的时间观念就是出自于它。
Now during some projections you may be aware of nothing as far as surroundings are concerned. There will be only the mobility of your own consciousness. If this ever occurs you will be traveling through such an uncamouflaged area. You could then expect to encounter next a more differentiated environment, that seemed to become more clear as you progressed toward the heart of another system.现在，在一些投射期间，就周遭环境而言，你可能什么都没有觉察到。有的只是你自己的意识而已。如果这真的发生了，你就是在穿行这样一个伪装区域。于是你可以预期接下来会遇见一个比较分化的环境，随着你朝着另一个系统的中心前进，这个环境似乎变得更加清楚。
The completely uncamouflaged layer could be rather bewildering. However you might automatically attempt to project images within it. The images would not take, so to speak, but would appear and disappear with great rapidity. This would be a silent area. Thoughts as a rule would not be perceived here, for the symbols that form them would not be understood.完全没有伪装的层面可能让人相当迷惑。但是你可能自动尝试在它之内投射意象。意象不会停留，而是速度飞快地出现和消失。这会是一个寂静无声的区域。思想在这里通常不会被感知到，因为形成它们的象征不会被了解。
The thoughts would not be perceived if they were present, you see. If a certain intensity is reached here however, a peak of intensity, then you could perceive the spacious present as it exists within your native system. You could, from this peak, theoretically look into the other system, but you would not understand what you perceived. You would not have the proper root assumptions, you see.如果思想在场的话，它们是不会被感知到的，你看。然而，如果这里达到了某一个强度，一个强度的高峰，那么你就可能感知到广阔的现在，就像它存在于你的原生系统之内那样。理论上，你可能从那个高峰探究另一个系统，但你不会了解你感知的东西。你不会有合适的根本假设，你知道。
I have used here the idea of two neighboring systems for simplicity’s sake, as if they were laid out end to end. Obviously such is not the case. The systems are more like the various segments of a tangerine, with the uncamouflaged boundary areas like the white membrane between the tangerine sections.为了简单明了起见，这里我用了两个相邻系统的概念，仿佛它们头尾相接并排似的。显然事实并非如此。系统比较像一个橘子的各瓣，没有伪装的界限区域就像橘瓣之间的白色橘络。
The tangerine then would be compared to a group of many systems, and yet it would represent in itself but one small portion of an unperceived whole. The tangerine would be but one segment, you see, of a larger system. You can see then why projections would lead you in a far different direction from your normal linear sort of travel, and why time as you know it would be meaningless.然后橘子会被比作很多系统形成的一个群组，可是它本身只代表一个未被感知的整体所属的一小部分。橘子只会是，你看，一个更大系统的一部分而已。于是你可以看到为什么投射会带你走向一个不同的方向，迥异于你正常的线性旅行，为什么你所知的时间会毫无意义。
Nor do such projections involve necessarily journeys through space as you know it. There are systems, extremely vivid in intensity, that have no existence in physical reality. It is now thought, I believe, that time and space are basically one, but they are both a part of something else. They are merely the camouflage patterns by which you perceive reality. Space, as you experience it in the dream state, comes much closer to reality.这样的投射也不一定穿行你所知的空间。许多在强度上极为活跃的系统并不存在于物质实相中。我相信，现在人们以为时间和空间基本上是一体的，但它们两者却都是另一个东西的一部分。它们只不过是你据以感知实相的伪装模式而已。空间，如同你在梦状态中体验的那样，更加接近实相。
Projections that deal with your own system will of course involve you in some kind of camouflage. If none is present you know you are out of the system. The dream universe is obviously then strongly connected with your own, since pseudoimages are present. Already you are free to some extent from the space-time reality of your system. Therefore within the dream state you are in the outward areas of your physically-oriented universe, you see.与你们自己的系统打交道的投射当然会让你卷入某种伪装之中。如果什么伪装都没有，那你就知道你在系统之外。所以梦宇宙显然与你们自己的宇宙有着强烈的连结，因为有伪意象的存在。你某种程度已经不受你们系统的时空实相束缚。因此在梦状态之内，你看，你是在你们物质导向宇宙的境外区域。
You may now take a break and we shall continue.你现在可以休息一下，我们再继续。
One point first. There are other systems all about, and within your own.先讲一个重点。在你们自己的系统四周和之内有其他的系统。
(Break at 10:00. Jane was out as usual. Her pace was better, eyes open and closed. Resume at 10:06.)(10点休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度比较好了，眼睛张开又闭上。10:06分继续。)
The undifferentiated layers move out like spirals then, through all reality. Little resistance is encountered with them. They represent inner roads that connect systems as well as divide them.然后没有分化的各层就像螺旋一样往外移动，穿过所有的实相。它们遇到的阻力微乎其微。它们代表既连结也隔开各个系统的内在道路。
The traveler must leave his own camouflage paraphernalia completely behind however, or he will go nowhere. It is possible, theoretically, to travel to any system in this manner, and bypass others you see. Such a traveler would not age physically. His physical body would be in a suspended state. The traveling consciousness would lose all physical conception of time however. A very few individuals have traveled in this manner to any extensive degree. Most of the knowledge gained escapes the physical organism however, for the experiences could not be translated by the physical brain.旅行者必须彻底抛下他自己的全副伪装，不然他哪里都去不了。理论上，以这种方式到任何系统旅行，并且绕过其他系统是可能的，你知道。这样一个旅行者在生理上是不会老化的，他的肉身会处于一种暂停状态。不过，旅行中的意识会丧失物质时间概念。鲜少个体以这种方式进行任何大规模的旅行。然而，物质有机体却忘掉了获得的知识，因为物质头脑无法翻译这些经验。
Now again, theoretically, it is possible to travel under such circumstances and perceive experiences that would ordinarily take you centuries, physically speaking, and in only a flash of your time.现在同样的，在这样的状况下旅行，并且感知通常就物质而言你们要耗费好几百年才会有的经验，理论上是可能的，并且只用了你们的一瞬间。
Practically speaking, this is seldom done, but it has been on occasion. The brain cannot contain such episodes. A portion of the self would retain these experiences. Now in a creative individual, some of these could be expressed symbolically in a painting or other work of art, but the ego could not consider them as actual.实际上来说，这种事很少，但是偶尔会有。头脑无法容纳这样的事件。自己的一部分会保留这些经验。现在，一个创作的个体可能会把这些经验用作象征的方式表现在绘画或其他艺术作品上，但是自我可能不把它们当真。
Now, each brush stroke of a painting represents concentrated experience, and compressed perceptions. In a good painting these almost explode when perceived by the lively consciousness of another. The observer is washed over by intensities. Again, experience that has nothing to do with physical time. The same can be said for a successful poem, though here I speak of Ruburt’s knowledge of poetry, rather than of any of my own.现在，一幅画的每一笔都代表着浓缩的经验和压缩的感知。在一幅好画里，当另一个活生生的意识感知这些的时候，它们几乎是爆发开来的。这个观察者被强度冲刷。再一次，这种经验与物理时间一点关系都没有。一首成功的诗也是如此，不过这里我说的是鲁柏对诗的知识，而不是我自己的任何知识。
The excellent work of art recreates for the observer inner experience of his own also, of which he has perhaps never been aware. As you know, paintings have motion, yet the painting itself does not move. This idea perhaps will help you to understand experience in terms of intensity, and projections, or the movement of consciousness, without necessarily any involvement with space.杰出的艺术作品也为观察者重新创造他自己的内在经验，而他或许不曾察觉。就像你知道的，绘画有动作，可是画作本身不会动。这个概念也许可以帮助你从强度来了解经验，以及投射或意识的活动，不一定牵涉到空间。
True motion has absolutely nothing to do with space. The only real motion is that of the traveling consciousness.真正的动作绝对与空间无关。真实的动作只有旅行中的意识。
(Long pause, eyes closed; one minute.) Spatially, a painting is flat. Its reality leaps out from its physical dimensions, and completely escapes them.(长时间停顿，两眼闭着；一分钟)在空间上，一幅画是平的。它的实相从它的物质维度跳出去，彻底脱逃。
(Long pause.) The depths within the painting do not physically exist, yet they are perceived.(长时间停顿)画作之内的深度在物质上并不存在，可是却被感知到了。
Your physical time is something like this. There is a strong connection here I have been trying to get through, but it is for now too difficult for Ruburt to catch. All of the experience an artist has gained is in any given painting, not physically perceived, but strongly perceived by the inner senses.你们的物理时间与之类似。这里有一个我想要说清楚的强烈连结，但是目前对鲁柏来说太难理解了。一个画家获得的经验全都在任何一幅画作中，虽然肉体没有感知，但内在感官却强烈感知到了。
This is coded, shielded, even from his own ego. Each painting that is successful forces the consciousness to travel into it, in ways that I will more thoroughly explain.这是经过编码的，连他自己的自我都被屏蔽了。每一幅成功的画作都迫使意识流入其中，流入的方式我会更详尽解释一番。
The spacious present is always present(smile)—my pun—in any work of art. As you should know, there is a difference in the type of mobility of an objective painting, and an abstract one. The fluidity or the spacious present pervades the dream state as it pervades a painting, but the images are projected into the spacious present by the dreamer, according to his own understanding and experience.广阔的现在一直都在(微笑)——我的双关语——在任何艺术作品之中。你应该知道，具象画与抽象画各有不同的流动形态。流动性或广阔的现在普遍弥漫在梦状态中，就像它在画作中一样，但是做梦者按照他自己的了解与经验，把意象投射到广阔的现在。
Now, some systems have no basic form, but adopt the form, the forms, thrust upon it. Your own system is obviously one of these. Other systems, by their very nature, set up a resistance, that resists. There is in such cases a constant battle of forms.现在，有些系统没有任何基本形式，而是采用强加其上的一个或多个形式。你们自己的系统显然就是这些系统的其中一个。其他的系统依据它们的本质产生阻力予以抗拒。在这种情况下，形式之战持续不断。
We will save this for another session, however.不过，这件事我们留待下一节再讲。
I give you my heartiest wishes.我衷心祝福你们。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:38. Jane was far-out this time, she said. Her eyes opened slowly, and were heavy and bleary.(10:38分结束。珍说她这次出去很远。她的眼睛缓缓睁开，既沉重又朦胧。
(Jane said Seth had been trying to get through concepts that were difficult. She had an image of spirals, for instance, all interlocked without being regular, that concerned the material on paintings and time, but she couldn't get it clearly nor even describe it adequately. There were images within this concept that were something like an accordion, Jane said, having to do with time opening and closing, etc.(珍说赛斯一直设法说清楚难以理解的概念。比方说，她有一个螺旋的意象，全都不规律地交扣在一起，这个意象与画作和时间的资料有关，但是她无法清楚理解，甚至也无法充分描述它。珍说，在这个概念之内有许多意象，就像手风琴一样，与时间的开始和结束等等有关。
(Janes pace, never fast during the session, became quite slow toward the end. Her eyes opened often.)(珍的速度在课间始终没有加快，在接近尾声时变得相当缓慢。她的眼睛经常睁开。)
(Copy of the verse used as object in the 71st envelope experiment, in the 288th session for September 26, 1966.)1966年9月26日第288节第71次信封实验用作标的物的诗句影本

SESSION 288 第288节 以情感方式学习 珍的出神经验 信封71


SEPTEMBER 26, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年9月26日 星期一 晚上9点
(The object for the 71st envelope experiment was the first draft of a poem Jane and I wrote for Bill Gallagher's birthday, which fell on Friday, July 1st.
