We wrote it first about in the car as we drove about. Jane then typed up what we could remember; we corrected it as shown on page 51. then Jane copied it over to give Bill, along with a cake. This first draft was typed on yellow paper; I folded it as shown to insert it in the usual double envelope, after sandwiching it between two pieces of Bristol. More details later.(第71次信封实验的标的物，是珍和我为了比尔·加拉格的生日写的一首诗，这是初稿，时间正逢7月1日星期五。我们最初是在开车时在车上大声地把它朗读出来。接着珍再把我们的诗句用打字机打出来；我们的修正如上图所示，然后珍影印一份连同一个蛋糕送给比尔。这份初稿打在黄纸上；我如上图所示折叠它，先夹在两片西卡纸之间，再放进普通的双层信封里。细节稍后再详述。
(Jane had no idea of what Seth would talk about during the session, although both of us hoped he would discuss the events of last Friday evening, September 23, at home. Present were Bill and Peggy Galbgher, Barbara Ingold, Jane and myself. Jane has written up an account of her experience, and Peggy took partial notes. Copies of both accounts will be attached to this session. I will also add notes as the session unfolds.(珍对于赛斯在课间会说什么一点概念都没有，但是我们两人都希望他会讨论9月23日上周五晚上家里发生的事件。在场的有比尔和蓓·加拉格、芭芭拉·殷戈尔德、珍和我自己。珍已经为她的经验写好一份记述，蓓也把一部分笔记下来。两份记述的影本都附加在这一节。我也会随着这节课的开展加上注释。
(Seth desired to come through Friday evening, since we had obviously set the stage through our conversation. Jane and Barbara had also helped because of their talk before the arrival of the Gallaghers. Jane denied Seth permission to speak, and he agreed. Later Jane began to give impressions on her own, in trance. All of the data concerned Barbara, who verified several striking points.(周五晚上赛斯想要过来，因为我们显然透过交谈架设了舞台。因为加拉格夫妇到来之前的谈话，珍和芭芭拉也帮了忙。珍不让赛斯说话，而他也同意了。稍后珍在出神中间开始给出自己的印象。资料全部都和芭芭拉有关，而她也证实了惊人的几个要点。
(Jane resumed after a break, and her trance deepened considerably. Later she said it was her deepest trance ever. Jane began to speak in a halting manner, her voice dwindled, and she called my name as if in supplication. She lay on the floor on her back. She called me once again; as I went to her she burst into tears; her crying was strong and highly charged; it seemed obvious she was responding Emotionally to an experience of Barbaras of an early age; Jane seemed to have attained a state beyond words. It took some time for her to come out of the trance, with what little help I could offer.(珍在休息之后继续，出神程度加深很多。稍后她说这是她有生以来最深的一次出神。珍开始讲话，结结巴巴的，声音渐渐变小，而且她叫我的名字像在恳求似的。她仰躺在地板上。她又叫了我一次；我一走过去，她就突然哭了起来；哭得很用力，充满情感；看起来她在情感上显然对芭芭拉早年的一个经验有反映；珍似乎很讨厌处在一种无法言传的状态。她花了一些时间才回过神来，对此我不太帮得上忙。
(Indeed, Jane slipped back into it several times, at brief intervals. Barbara could verify none of this experience, which would be the case were it buried in the subconscious. Bill Gallagher took us on a ride in the hopes the cold night air would help Jane snap out of it; so at 1:00 in the morning we were bouncing through Elmira, Elmira Heights, and Horseheads. The therapy worked however.(实际上，珍又不知不觉回到那个状态几次，间隔时间很短。芭芭拉完全无法证实这个经验，它要是被埋在潜意识里，就会是这种情况。比尔·加拉格开车载我们去兜风，希望夜里冰凉的空气能够帮助珍摆脱它；所以在凌晨一点，我们跑遍埃尔迈拉、埃尔达拉高地村[Elmira Heights]和霍斯黑兹[Horseheads]。不过，这个疗法有效。
(Jane was considerably frightened by this experience, since it was totally unexpected and we were not prepared. I was resentful to some extent, feeling we were on display in some manner, Jane told me that toward the end of the experience she felt as though she were in a deep pit with smooth sides. She had no images all evening.(珍被这个经验吓得不轻，因为它完全出乎预期，我们毫无心理准备。我有某种程度的愤恨不平，感觉我们有点被赶鸭子上架。珍告诉我，在这个经验快结束时，她感觉好像在一个壁面光滑的深坑里。她整晚都没有意象。
Jane began speaking in a rather unusual jerky manner, pausing after every couple of words. Her eyes were closed until otherwise noted. Her voice was stronger than usual, but not loud.)(珍开始以一种断断续续的方式说话，相当不寻常，每讲一两个字就停顿一次。除非另外注明，否则她的眼睛一直闭着。她的声音比平时更强而有力，但音量不大。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, I do indeed have a few words to say, concerning this last episode.现在，我的确有几句话要说，与最后这个事件有关。
It was of course an upsetting one. This does not mean that it was not a rather important occasion. Ruburt did not use his abilities in precisely the same manner in the past, simply because he was unable to do so had he been willing.它当然是一个令人沮丧的事件。这并不是说这个事件不太重要。鲁柏之所以没有完全用过去的方式使用他的能力，只因为他就算有意愿也做不到。
His abilities took in one way a giant step forward. True, you will want to use controls and discipline. The fact remains that the circumstances brought about an imminent development. If those particular circumstances had not occurred, then the next similar set of circumstances would have served the same purpose.他的能力在某一方面往前迈了一大步。不错，你会想要用到控制和纪律。但是状况带来了一个迫在眉睫的发展。如果那些特定的状况没有发生，那么接下来还会发生一连串类似的状况而达到同样的目的。
The development of abilities was necessary, and will show regardless of the particular way in which Ruburt may choose to use the abilities. The choice lies indeed with you both. It took a strong, remarkably strong, set of Emotional conditions before Ruburt allowed himself as much freedom as the other evening.能力的发展是必需的，而且不管鲁柏选择怎样使用能力都会显现。选择其实是落在你们两人身上。在鲁柏允许他自己像前天晚上更加自由发挥之前，会先出现一连串强烈、非常强烈的情绪状况。
Now, freedom does demand discipline. There was on Ruburt's part a much more complete inner concentration, and for this initial indication a strong stimulus was necessary. As Ruburt suspects, granted the circumstances, subconscious controls were used. A time of safety was chosen.现在， 自由的确需要纪律，在鲁柏身上有着更加完整很多的内在专注力，而且为了这个起始的指标，一定要有强烈的刺激才行。正如鲁柏所怀疑的，就算状况如此，还是有用到潜意识的控制。选择了安全无虞的时间。
It was a kind of avalanche, however. This was simply because Ruburt did not know how to handle the new conditions. Uncertainty in such beginnings are understandable. The girl actually helped, as perhaps a midwife might. I realized what was going to occur, and I could have helped, shielding Ruburt to some degree. However the experience was more valuable left alone in any case, since you see what the conditions can be, and you can choose for yourselves.不过，它是一种雪崩。这只是因为鲁柏不知道怎样处理新的状况。在这样的起点上，不确定性是可以理解的。这女孩其实帮了忙，她就像助产士。我意识到有事即将发生，而且本来可以帮忙，某种程度掩护鲁柏一下。但是，无论如何，不要干扰这个经验，它会更有价值，因为你们看见状况的可能发展，而能够自己做出选择。
There are methods of course where the trance can be terminated gradually. It is not good to terminate that kind of trance too quickly.当然有方法可以逐渐中止出神。太快中止那种出神是不好的。
(Gesture, eyes closed.) The reassurance you gave, Joseph, was your best move. The support.(比手势，眼睛闭着)你给的安慰，约瑟，就是最好的一招。支持。
You may take a brief break, and we shall continue.你可以短暂休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:16. Jane was dissociated as usual. Both of us were somewhat surprised at the early break. Jane's eyes had stayed closed, her voice good. The peculiar pauses had more or less continued, although they decreased when she resumed at 9:26.)(9:16分休息。珍一如往常出离。我们两人对于早早就休息都觉得有点惊讶。珍的眼睛依然闭着，声音很好。特殊的停顿或多或少还是有，但是在她于9:26分继续后减少了。)
He has freed himself in order to use the inner senses more completely.他为了更彻底使用内在感官而放开他自己。
The first such episode is bound to be somewhat upsetting. I would have intruded despite the fact that I was not welcome, but then I feared that to do so would confuse the issue for you.第一次碰到这样的事件一定会让人有点沮丧。尽管事实上我不受欢迎，但我本来是会介入的，只不过后来我怕这么做会让你们把问题搞混了。
The initial perceptions were picked up by the inner senses. A journey through time and space was involved. The medium through which Ruburt traveled was the Emotional charge thrown out by the girl.内在感官接收到最初的感知。这涉及到穿越时间和空间的旅程。鲁柏用来旅行的媒介(medium)是这个女孩抛出来的情感电荷。
Now, to avoid contusion, the girl is nor a medium as, say, Ruburt is, according to your use of the term. I dislike the term. But the medium through which Ruburt traveled was the electrical and electromagnetic medium sent out by the girl's highly-charged Emotional condition.现在，为了避免混淆，这个女孩并不是像，就说，鲁柏这样的灵媒(medium)，按照你们对这个字眼的用法。我不喜欢这个字眼。但是用来旅行的媒介是由这个女孩充满情感电荷的状况发送出来的电磁媒介。
There was also a triangle formed by you. Ruburt and the girl, highly charged on a subconscious level, that added to the psychological climate. The Jesuit(Bill Gallagher) and the cat lover(Peggy G.) were balancing factors. All of these conditions, these balancing and propelling factors, were necessary for Ruburts first realization of this particular kind.还有一个由你、鲁柏和这个女孩形成的三角关系，在一个潜意识层面上高度充电，添加在心理气候上。耶稣会士(Jesuit,比尔·加拉格)与爱猫人(蓓·加拉格)则是维持平衡的因子。对鲁柏第一次得到这一种领悟，这些状况、这些维持平衡的因子与推进的因子全都是必需的。
The earlier drinks of course let down his guard, but it was the caffeine in the coffee that allowed the system to alert and direct the inner abilities on this particular evening. (Impatient gesture.) You should not be so fearful that you attempt to hold down the abilities. Neither of course should you let them be used indiscriminately.稍早前喝的饮料当然松懈了他的警戒，但在这一个晚上让系统保持警觉并且指挥内在能力的，却是咖啡里的咖啡因。(不耐烦的手势)你们不应该这么害怕，以至于试图压制这些能力。你们当然也不应该不分青红皂白地使用它们。
(This because Jane and I have vowed since Friday that there will be no more such uncontrolled episodes, even though good material was obtained.)(这是因为从礼拜五开始，珍和我发誓，就算取得很好的资料也不要再发生这种不受控制的事件了。)
Without the experience itself these particular abilities would not have developed—that of course or another similar episode. The same sort of development would not have been initiated here in a session for some time, simply because the Emotional conditions would not be met. We can use the development however very well.没有这个经验本身，这些特定的能力就不会发展——当然是那个或另一个类似的事件——经过一段时间，同一种的发展之所以没有在课间这里启动，就是因为没有达到情感条件。但是我们可以充分运用这个发展。
Subconsciously you went along, Joseph, as indeed you should have. Ruburt had your consent. This does nor mean that more conscious control cannot he used, now that the development is known. It was not possible earlier.在潜意识里，约瑟，你是赞同的，你也的确应该赞同。鲁柏取得了你的同意。这并不是说，既然已经知道这个发展了，就不能够使用更多有意识的控制。这在更早以前是不可能的。
And I can tell you, though neither of you may be pleased, that the incident taught the cat lover and the Jesuit much, and through direct experience. You might call it a visual aid. (Smile, forceful manner, eyes open wide.) You only learn Emotionally. If you do not learn Emotionally, you do not learn.而且我可以告诉你，但是你们两位可能都会不高兴，这个事件教了爱猫人与耶稣会士很多东西，而且是经由直接体验。你可以称之为视觉辅助工具。(微笑，举止有力；双眼圆睁)你只能透过情感来学习。如果你不透过情感来学习，你就学不到东西。
(“Well, why wouldn't we be pleased at that'")(嗯，为什么我们听到这个会不高兴？)
I am speaking of the tendency in you both to completely (underline) disconnect the sessions and any direct psychic display from everyday life. You note I said only tendency. There are limits, of course. I am not concerned that you will set no limits, but a direct and sincere psychic demonstration is of great Emotional validity to those who observe.我说的是，你们两位的倾向是，完全(划线)切断这些课与任何直接的通灵表现和日常生活的连结。你要注意，我说的只是倾向。现在当然有。我不担心你们不设限，但是直接又真诚的通灵展现对旁观者来说有着极大的情感效力。
This does not mean, again, that such demonstrations are overly emphasized, or a regular occurrence. It does not mean they should be indiscriminately adopted. But when they do occur they will in most instances have occurred for a reason, and will affect witnesses in a most direct manner.这并不是说，再一次，这样的展现被过度强调或是经常发生。这并不是说，应该要不分青红皂白地采用它们。而是说，当它们真的发生时，在大部分情况下，它们之所以发生，都是有原因的，而且都会以非常直接的方式影响见证者。
You may take a short break and we shall continue.你可以稍作休息，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:47. Jane was out as usual. Her eyes began to open toward the end of the delivery, her pace was better, her voice still on the stronger side.(9:47分休息。珍一如往常出去了。这段传述快结束时，她的眼睛开始张开，速度更好，声音仍然偏向有力。
(A note: The 71st envelope experiment was to be held this evening. Strange as it seems, I had forgotten the envelope objects identity; I had prepared this envelope for the session due Monday, September 19; that session was not held and I saved the envelope. During tonight’s session I realized I had forgotten what the object was, even though I had chosen it. At least on a conscious level, this made it seem as though a stranger had prepared the envelope.(一个注：今晚将会进行第71次信封实验。奇怪的是，我已经忘了信封标的物的身分；我为9月19日星期一的定期课准备了这个信封；那一节没有举行，于是我保留这个信封。在今晚上课时，我发觉我忘记标的物是什么了，即便选用它的人是我。至少在意识层面，情况看起来就像准备这个信封的是陌生人一样。
(Jane resumed with her eyes closed at 9:57.)(9:57分，珍闭着眼睛继续。)
At our... Are you ready?在我们的……你准备好了吗？
(“Yes.” I had been sneezing.)(“好了。”我在打喷嚏。)
I will explain more clearly the differences in perception that are involved in various trance procedures. You will find this most interesting... Do you want another break?我要更加清楚说明各种不同的出神过程涉及的感知有何差别。你会发现这非常有趣……你想要再休息一下吗？
(“I don’t think so.” The sneezing finally ended.)(“我想不用了。”喷嚏终于打完了。)
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
(“Yes.”(“有。”
(At 9:59 Jane took the envelope for our 71st experiment from me without opening her eyes. She held it to her forehead and paused but briefly.)(9:59分，珍从我手上拿了我们第71次实验的信封，但没有张开眼睛。她把它放在额头上，并且停顿下来，但只是一下子。)
Give us a moment please.请等我们一下。
The impression of something swirling about, as leaves in a wind. And a staircase. A missionary connection. A square object.印象是某个盘旋的东西，就像风中的叶子。还有一座楼梯。一个教会的连结。一个正方形的物体。
Six plus one. A pen. Small wavering blue lines. Something written by an old hand perhaps, with thin wavering lines.6加1。一支圆珠笔。小小的抖动的蓝色线条。也许是一只老老的手写下的东西，有着细线的抖动线条。
A note. A description, perhaps of a house or a building. The impression of something scribbled. A small square, and perhaps a larger one.一张字条。一个描述，也许是描述一间房子或一栋建筑物。某个潦草书写的东西。一个小小的正方形，也许还有一个比较大的正方形。
I have a stable or horse connection.我有一个马厩或马的连结。
(Pause.) Nine, or nine o’clock.(停顿)9，或9点钟。
A circumstance involving a policeman.牵涉到一名警察的一个状况。
(Pause.) To do with a fall, or a seeing something through—passing through it completely you see.(停顿)与一次坠落有关，或是看穿某个东西——你看就是完全穿过它。
Green, perhaps a stamp.绿色，也许是一张邮票。
(Pause.) Four three eight.(停顿)438。
A letter written by an older person. A connection with woods. And a strict accounting. Connection with a leaf or autumn. With a 1964 or ‘65 event.一个年纪较大的人写的一封信。与树林有关联。还有严格的会计。与一片叶子或秋天有关联。与1964或65年的一个事件有关联。(停顿)你被告知的一个新状况，把这些事件连结在一起。
(Pause.) And a new circumstance told to you, that serves to connect these events.你有没有任何问题？
Do you have any questions?(“这只老的手是男性或女性的？”
(“Is this old hand male or female?”(停顿)
(Pause.) I am not sure, though I suspect male. The hand is not a typically male hand however, but more delicate perhaps.我不确定，但我怀疑是男性的。不过这只手不是典型男性的手，而是也许比较秀气。
(Pause.) If you have no more questions I suggest your break.(停顿)如果你没有更多问题，我建议休息一下。
("Okay.”(“好。”
(Break at 10:10. Jane was dissociated as usual, and her eyes remained closed.)(10:10分休息。珍一如往常出离，她的眼睛仍然闭着。
(See the copy of the envelope object on page 51, and the notes on the page 55. As stated there, I had forgotten the contents of the test envelopes. When the time came to ask questions this evening, I decided to consider the data already received as specific enough. Actually one could, ask many questions, whether knowing the object or not. Jane said she had no images while speaking.(见前面信封标的物的影本，以及注释。如该处所述，我已经忘记测验信封的内容物了。到了今晚提问时，我决定把已经接收到的资料想成足够明确具体。其实不管知不知道标的物是什么，都有很多问题可以问。珍说她在说话时没有任何画面。
(Seth gave us a little help after break, and although this was brief it filled in a good deal on some of the data we had been unsure of. For conveniences sake it is better to include Seth’s later data along with our own interpretations, made during break, since Emotional charges explain much concerning the material. For more detailed information on how the Emotional charges sinfluence Seth’s envelope data, see the 286th session.(赛斯在休息过后给了我一点协助，虽然时间很短，但在一些我们不确定的资料上却填补了很多空缺。为了方便起见，最好是把赛斯后来给的资料连同我们自己在休息时所做的解读合在一起看，因为大部分的资料都可以在情感电荷上找到原因。关于情感电荷如何影响赛斯的信封资料，见286节。
(After break Seth said our own interpretations were correct. But we couldn’t be as specific as desired, and felt there were valid things left unsaid.(在休息之后，赛斯说我们自己的解读是正确的。但是我们的具体程度并不如己意，感觉许多有效的事情未能言明。
(“The impression of something swirling about, as leaves in a wind.” Our interpretation here was that the swirling and leaves data referred to the mention of a garden in the poem used as object. See page 51. This may be correct. Also according to Seth after break however, the swirling was to have led Jane to frosting. The birthday cake we gave Bill Gallagher on July 1st was frosted. The poem used as object was written for this occasion.(“印象是某个盘旋的东西，就像风中的叶子。”这里我们解读盘旋与叶子的资料是指用作标的物的诗作中提到的一座园子。见标的物。这可能是正确的。此外，根据赛斯在休息过后说的，盘旋是要引导珍说出糖霜。我们在7月1日送给比尔·加拉格的生日蛋糕上面有糖霜。用作标的物的诗作是为这个场合而写的。
(“And a staircase. Jane at once interpreted this data as referring to the staircase she must climb in order to reach Peggy Gallagher’s office, on the second floor at the newspaper office where Peggy works. Peggy of course was present at the small birthday party we gave Bill on the evening of July 1.(“还有一座楼梯。”珍立刻解读这个资料是指她为了到蓓的办公室而必须爬的楼梯，因为蓓工作的报社在二楼。我们在7月1日为比尔举行生日派对那天，蓓当然在场。
(Another staircase interpretation here may concern our own steep flight of back stairs here at the apartment. We live on the second floor. Since it was a pleasant summer evening on July 1, we held the party out on the back lawn, leaving the cake upstairs in our apartment as a surprise for Bill. When the time came to get the cake Jane and I went upstairs together, lit the candles on the cake while hiding on the stairs, then carried the cake out to the party.(这里另一个楼梯的解读可能与我们自己的公寓后面那座陡峭的楼梯有关。我们住在二楼。由于7月1日是一个令人愉快的夏夜，所以我们在屋后的草地上举行派对，把生日蛋糕留在我们公寓的楼上，要给比尔一个惊喜。到了去拿蛋糕的时候，珍和我一起上楼，躲在楼梯下点了蛋糕上的蜡烛，然后端出蛋糕到派对去。
(“A missionary connection.” We think this very good data. Bill Gallagher's facetious term for the local newspaper office, where he also works, is the Garden of Gethsemane—hence such religious connections in the poem used as object. Also, Seths longstanding term of affection for Bill is ”The Jesuit,”and he so calls Bill in the session tonight. See page 54.(“一个教会的连结。”我们认为这个资料非常好。比尔戏称他也在那里工作的本地报社为客西马尼园[Garden of Gethsemane，译注：据说是耶稣被捕的橄榄园，位于橄榄山的山脚，来以色列耶路撒冷的基督徒必访之处]——因此在用作标的物的诗作里出现了这样的宗教连结。此外，赛斯长期以来一直昵称比尔为“耶稣会士”，而且今晚上课时他也这样称呼比尔。见前面。
(“A square object.” We feel reasonably sure here that this refers to the box we carried the cake in, home from the bakery, the afternoon of July 1. We recall the box as square, of the folding type. Of course there could be many interpretations.(“一个正方形的物体。”此处我们合理地确定这是指7月1日下午我们从烘焙坊装着蛋糕带回家的盒子。我们记得盒子是正方形的，可以折叠。当然也可能有很多解读。
(“Six plus one.” Bill Gallagher's birthday is on July 1—six plus one for a total of seven. The poem used as object was written by Jane and me for the birthday occasion which occurred on July 1.(“6加1。”比尔的生日是7月1日——6加1等于7。用作标的物的诗作是珍和我为了7月1日这个生日的场合写的。
(“A pen.” See the copy of the object on page 51. My corrections on the object were made with pencil. Jane made her corrections with a pen.(“一支原子笔。”见前面的标的物影本。我在标的物上的订正是用铅笔写的。珍则是用一支圆珠笔订正。
(“Small wavering blue lines. Something written by an old hand perhaps, with thin wavering lines.” Jane’s corrections on the object were made with a blue pen, which appears quite dark on the yellow paper upon which the poem was typed. Her corrections are small, but not wavering. The old and wavering data puzzled us, and we missed out here because we did not interpret the Emotional charges involved, as Seth did.(“小小的抖动的蓝色线条。也许是一只老老的手写下的东西，有着细细的抖动线条。”珍在标的物上的订正是用蓝色圆珠笔写的，在诗作的黄色打字纸上看起来颜色很深。她的订正字体虽小但没有抖动。这个老手抖动的资料让我们困惑，而且在这里我们没有找到连结，因为不像赛斯那样解读了牵涉在内的情感电荷。
(Actually this data is quite legitimate, and becomes understandable when we learned after break that, according to Seth, Bill Gallagher felt very old on his 41st birthday, last July 1. Once again, see the 286th session.(其实这个资料相当合理，而且在休息后，根据赛斯所说的，我们得知比尔在去年的7月1日他41岁生日时感觉自己好老，这个资料就变得可以理解了。再一次，见第286节。
(“A note.” We think this a close-enough description of the object, in that the briefness of the poem could resemble a note to Seth's method of perception.(“一张字条。”我们认为这个对标的物的描述够贴切，因为诗作很短，对赛斯的感知方法来说可能像一张字条。
(“A description, perhaps of a house or a building.” This is very good. As explained on the last page, Bill Gallagher calls his place of employment, the newspaper office, the ”Garden of Gethsemane.” As referred to in the poem used as object. See page 51.(“一个描述，也许是描述一间房子或一栋建筑物。”这非常好。如上面的解释，比尔称呼他受雇的报社为“客西马尼园”。在用作标的物的诗作就是这样称呼他的职场。见前面所写。
(“The impression of something scribbled.” We think this a reference to the corrections made on the poem used as object.(“某个潦草书写的东西。”我们认为这是指用作标的物的诗作上的订正。
(“A small square, and perhaps a larger one. ’’ Our interpretation here, without in any way being positive, was that this concerned the square cardboard cake box described earlier—which was square as we recall it—and the smaller birthday card. However we are not sure now whether the card was enclosed in a square envelope or a rectangular one. Taking literally Seth’s blanket notice after break that our interpretations were correct, this would include the above. We wouldn't claim it on our own however.(“一个小小的正方形，也许还有一个比较大的正方形。”虽然一点都不确定，但这里我们的解读是，这与之前描述的正方形纸板蛋糕盒有关——我们记得它是正方形的——以及一张比较小的生日贺卡。但是我们现在不确定贺卡是放在正方形还是长方形的信封内。按照赛斯在休息后所说的字面意思，整体而言，我们的解读是正确的，那这就包括了上述解读在内。然而我们不会自己这样断言。
(“I have a stable or horse connection. ’’ This is another instance where Seth verifies our own interpretation. Jane very nearly did not mention her idea here, thinking at first it was too ”far-out.” She finally told me that when she first looked at the envelope object during break, she read my penciled word ”Man-a-me, ’’ to the right of the poem used as object, as ”Man-O-War,” which is the name of a very famous race horse. It is incidentally the only horse's name that Jane knows, she said.(“我有一个马厩或马的连结。”这是另一个赛斯证实我们自己解读正确的另一个例子。珍这里几乎没有要提起她的想法，因为她一开始认为它太“远”了。她终于告诉我，当她在休息时一看到信封物件时，她把我在用作标的物的诗作右边用铅笔写的字“Man-a-me”读成“Man-O-war”，这是一匹非常有名的赛马的名字。顺便一提，珍说她唯一知道的马匹名字就是这一个。
(This of course implies that Jane translated the same impression on a subconscious basis for Seth, misreading and all. Possible?(这当然意味着，珍根据潜意识为赛斯翻译了同一个印象，误读之类的。可能吗？
(“Nine, or nine o'clock.” We recall that the Gallaghers were somewhat late in arriving for Bill's surprise birthday party last July 1, and that they did come at about 9:00. We expected them before 8:30.(“9，或9点钟。”我们记得在去年7月1日为比尔举办的惊喜生日派对，加拉格夫妇迟到了，大约9点才来。我们期待他们8点半之前就到。
(“A circumstance involving a policeman." This refers to a long and involved story told us by Peggy Gallagher during the evening of the birthday party, for which Jane and I wrote the poem used as object. Pegs news made an impression and Jane and I still remember it. Very briefly, it concerns the behavior of a local psychiatrist and his wife—one of those continuing affairs that have been well known locally for some time, yet never getting into the newspaper.(“牵涉到一名警察的一个状况。”这指的是蓓在生日派对当晚告诉我们的一个又长又复杂的故事，珍和我为了这个派对写了这首用作标的物的诗。蓓说的消息给珍和我留下印象，我们现在还记得它。简言之，它和本地一名精神科医师和他太太的行为有关——在本地已经人尽皆知一段时间的其中一件持续进行的事情，但从来没有上过报纸。
(The specific affair Peg described that evening concerned the arrest of the doctor's wife on a drunken driving charge, speeding, etc.(蓓那一晚描述的特定事件是医生的太太因为酒驾、超速等等而被逮捕。
(“To do with a fall, or a seeing something through—passing through it completely, you see.” We saw no connections.)Later note by Rob: The Garden of Edenthe“Fall？”(“与一次坠落有关，或是看穿某个东西——你看就是完全穿过它。”我们看不到关联。罗后来的注：伊甸园——“亚当的坠落”？
(“Green, perhaps a stamp.” No connections. There was nothing mailed in connection with the birthday party, or the object, etc.(“绿色，也许是一张邮票。”找不到关联。没有任何与生日派对或标的物等等有关的邮寄物。
(“Four three eight.” We think this a close reference to our address, 458 W. Water Street. The birthday party was held at this address and the poem used as object was given to Bill here also.(“438。”我们认为这接近我们的地址，华特街458号。生日派对在这个地址举行，而用作标的物的诗作也是在这里送给比尔。
(“A letter written by an older person." This ties in with the earlier old and wavering data, interpreted at the top of page 57. As Seth tells us after break, the old reference concerns Bill Gallaghers subjective feelings on his birthday last July 1. The letter reference here stems from the resemblance of the typed poem used as object to a letter, and echoes the note data, also discussed on page 57.(“一个比较老的人写的一封信。”这与稍早前的老手抖动资料连结在一起，解读在前面。如同休息后赛斯告诉我们的，老与比尔对他在去年生日的主观感觉有关。这里说的信出自于，用作标的物的打字诗作很像一封信，也和前面讨论过的字条资料互相呼应。
(“A connection with woods." Our own interpretation here is that woods refers to the literal Biblical Garden of Gethsemane, which is spoofed in the poem used as object. Jane says the actual garden was not a formal garden, a cultivated type, but rather contained olive trees, etc., and much growth of this kind. Seth's blanket endorsement after break implies, again, that this is the correct interpretation.(“与树林有关联。”这里我们自己的解读是，树林指的是字面上圣经提到的客西马尼园，用作标的物的诗作拿它开了玩笑。珍说实际的园子并不是一座正式的花园，经过栽培的那种，而是长着橄榄树等等，以及很多这类植物的园子。赛斯在休息之后所做的整体背书意味着，再一次，这是正确的解读。
(“And a strict accounting." This is an excellent reference to the third line of the poem used as object. Penny is mentioned therein and accounting for such would be strict accounting.(“还有严格的会计。”这是绝佳的资料，指的是用作标的物的诗作第三行。其中提到一份钱，账算到这样可说是严格的会计。
(“Connection with a leaf or autumn.” See the data on page 55. L then, we think the leaf data here refers to the garden mentioned in the poem used as object. But also we think the autumn data here grows out of the swirling data on page 55, and Seths attempt to get Jane to give voice to frosting. The autumn data here could have grown out of the interpretation on Janes part of Seth’s frosting impression.(“与一片叶子或秋天有关联。”见前面的资料。如同当时，我们认为这里的叶子资料是指用作标的物的诗作中提到的园子。但我们也认为这里的秋天资料是从前面的盘旋资料衍生出来的，赛斯试着让珍说出糖霜这个词。这里的秋天资料可能衍生自珍对于赛斯的糖霜印象所做的解读。
(“With a 1964 or 65 event. We are not sure, Jane thinks this refers to her writing some poems for Peg's birthday also. She believes she did this in January of 1966 however. Jane thinks the idea of this data is correct, in that she wrote the poems for Peg before she wrote the one for Bill’s birthday six months later.(“与1964或65年的一个事件有关联。”我们不确定。珍认为这是指她也为蓓的生日写的一些诗。不过她相信做这件事的时间是1966年的1月。珍觉得这个资料的想法是正确的，因为她为蓓写诗的时间在她半年后为比尔的生日写这首诗之前。
(“And a new circumstance told to you, that serves to connect these events. ’’ We make no connections here.(“你被告知的一个新状况，把这些事件连结在一起。”我们在这里没有看到关联。
(First Question: Is this old hand male or female? ‘I am not sure, though I suspect male. The hand is not a typically male hand however, but more delicate perhaps.” Seth is correct, in that the old reference here does concern Bill Gallagher and his subjective feelings [the male], on the evening of his birthday party, for which the envelope object was written. Jane and I do not especially see any connection with the delicate hand reference however.(第一个问题：这只老的手是男性或女性的？“我不确定，但我怀疑是男性的。不过这只手不是典型男性的手，而是也许比较秀气。如果你没有更多问题，我建议你休息一下。”赛斯是对的，因为这里的老的确与比尔在生日派对那天晚上的主观感觉有关，信封标的物就是为了他的生日而写的。不过，珍和我并没有特别看到任何与秀气的手有关的连结。
(Jane resumed at 10:46.)(珍在10:46分继续。)
We will now close our session.我们现在要结束这一节了。
Our Jesuit fell very old on his birthday. It was that Emotional feeling that was picked up. The swirling was to have led Ruburt to frosting, and did not. There is no need to go into the rest of the data. Your own interpretations are correct.我们的耶稣会士在他的生日感觉自己非常老。被接收到的就是这个情绪感受。盘旋是要引导鲁柏说出糖霜，但没有成功。没有必要讨论剩下的资料。你们自己的解读是正确的。
My heartiest regards to you both.向你们两人致上我最衷心的问候。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:49. Jane was out as usual, her voice quiet. She commented that she wished the envelope data had been more specific, although it did contain some good points, and there seemed to be no doubt that Seth had tuned in on the correct situation, object, etc.(10:49分结束。珍说她一如往常出去了，她的声音安静。她说她希望信封资料要是更具体一点就好了，虽然其中包含了一些很好的重点，而且赛斯对准了正确的情境、物件等等，这点似乎毋庸置疑。
(Jane said she couldn’t help contrasting this more mundane and quiet and safe approach with the events of the trance of last Friday evening, involving Barbara Ingold, and the quite specific data, including dates and place names, physical descriptions, etc., that manifested itself then.(珍说她忍不住拿这个比较平凡、温和又安全的做法对比上周五晚上涉及到芭芭拉·殷戈尔德的出神事件，以及当时自行显现的那个相当具体的资料，包括日期和地点的名称、实质的描述等等。
(Peggy Gallagher has partial notes on last Fridays events, and a copy of those, as well as Janes own version, will be attached to this session.)(蓓为上周五的事件写了一部分的笔记，那些笔记的副本以及珍自己的版本都附录在这一节。)
JANE’S NOTES珍的笔记
MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 26, 19661966年9月26日 星期一
(These notes concern an incident that happened Friday evening, September A neighbor, Barbara Ingold, came up Friday about 7: with a shaker of stingers, one for Rob, Barb and myself. Rob was working. Barb and I drank our stingers and divided Rob’s. She talked about her past; suicide attempts, miscarriages, operations; very Emotionally charged. I gave myself the suggestion that I would only react to constructive suggestions, to offset her Emotional attitude. When she arrived, I was annoyed. We were going to have company; the dishes were to be done; I wanted to change clothes, etc. Mellowed by the drinks, I figured she might as well stay. She insisted on doing the dishes for me; she wants to buy friendship basically or make sure she is needed or some such.(这些笔记与1966年9月23日星期五晚上发生的一个事件有关。一个邻居，芭芭拉·殷戈尔德，在星期五大约7点时上来：带了一个装了鸡尾酒的调酒器，给罗、芭芭拉和我自己。罗在工作。芭芭拉和我喝了我们的鸡尾酒，并把罗的份也分着喝了。她谈到她的过去；自杀未遂、流产、动手术；充满了情感电荷。我给自己暗示说，我只会对建设性的暗示起反应，以抵消她的情感态度。她来的时候，我很不高兴。我们有客人要来；碗盘要洗；我想要换衣服等等。酒一喝，人也放松了，我想她干脆留下来也好。她坚持帮我洗碗；基本上她想要买友情，或是确保她被需要之类的。
(When Bill and Peg Gallagher arrived, about nine, I drank two cups of strong coffee, rather than the wine that everyone else drank; so it must have been 10:30 or so before I had a glass of wine. Conversation was led by Barb, again, to her own life and so forth. The evening wore on. Somewhere in here I felt that I could have a Seth session regarding Barb. I said this softly to Rob and once to Peg; who knows about the sessions, of course. Barb knows hardly anything, though I think she knows about Seth in a general way. Rob shook his head and I didn’t particularly want to get involved anyway so I said no mentally. After a short while I no longer felt that Seth was around. A poor move. Barb heard me. Bill, it turns out, did not.(当比尔和蓓抵达时，大约9点，我喝了两杯浓咖啡，而不是其他人都在喝的红酒；所以我一定是在10点半左右以后才喝了一杯红酒。再一次，话题被芭芭拉带到她自己的人生之类的。夜越来越深。在这里的某个地方，我感觉我可以举行一节关于芭芭拉的课。我低声对罗说了这件事，也对蓓说过一回；她当然知道课的事。芭芭拉几乎什么事都不知道，但是我知道她大致上晓得赛斯。罗摇摇头，反正我也不是特别想要卷入，所以我在心里打消了念头。过了一小段时间之后，我不再觉得赛斯在身边。一个很糟的举动。芭芭拉听到我了。结果，比尔没有听到。
(Then—to me suddenly—in my own voice and without Seth, I began to give impressions about Barb’s past life. Saw no images at all, and had no idea whether anything made senseto her or was just subconscious fabrication on my part. No hesitancy either, though. The words just came. Very little memory of what I said but when I stopped Barb checked several points out as very good. I mentioned Greenwich, Connecticut; I didn't even know there was a Greenwich, m Connecticut, though I am familiar with Greenwich, NY, and it seems to me I thought there was one in Vermont. Anyway Barb said she lived there some years back. Also mentioned particular initials—now I forget them—Peg took notes and will have them—and these were excellent, referring specifically to Barb's boy fiend, Dick. The first initial was ”G”, however. She told us his first name was really George; of course we were surprised, and had no idea of this. Something about a second child, a male, also hit her; and another point that I forget. There may be others, we haven't checked the notes yet.(然后——对我来说是突然——用我自己的声音，没有赛斯在场，我开始给出芭芭拉的前世印象。完全没有看见画面，也完全不晓得这一切对她来说有没有意义，或只是我自己的潜意识虚构出来的东西。但是，也没有一丝一毫的犹豫。字就这样出来了。不太记得我说过什么，但是当我停下来的时候，芭芭拉核对了几点，说非常好。我提到康乃狄克州[Connecticut]的格林威治[Greenwich]；我甚至不知道在康乃狄克州那里有一个格林威治，但是我熟悉纽约州的格林威治，而且似乎对我来说，我以为在佛蒙特州[Vermont]有一个。总之芭芭拉说她过去在那里住了几年。此外也提到特定的首字母——现在我忘记了——蓓写了笔记，也会保留它们——而且这些都很棒，明确指出芭芭拉的男友迪克。不过，第一个首字母是G。她告诉我们，他的名字其实是乔治[George]；当然我们很惊讶，而且完全不知道这件事。关于第二个孩子的某件事，一个男孩，也说中了；还有另一点我忘了。可能还有其他几点，但我们尚未核对笔记。
(So we talked about this for a few minutes. Then suddenly I was in a very deep trance of which I have no memory—except at the very end, when I was yelling my lungs out, and I believe, flat on the floor crying. What I said I don't know now, though apparently at the end I was reliving some suicide attempt of Bars? Or an operation？Wouldn't know: it was supposed to be afternoon I do recall that.(所以我们谈了几分钟这件事。接着，我突然进入一种很深的出神状态，事后对此毫无记忆——除了在最后，我扯开喉咙大喊大叫，以及我相信我还躺在地板上哭以外。我说了什么，我现在不知道，但是显然在最后我重现了芭芭拉某一次的自杀举动？或者是一次手术？不知道；应该是下午，这我倒是记得。
( The trance was the deepest I have been in. Again I saw nothing; no images; but I was oddly unprotected; the Emotional state was not a bit pleasant as I was screaming over this episode, apparently a past one of Barbs. With Seth, for example. I feel nothing. I yelled out for Rob. He tried to help me break the trance, which was rather difficult. “I’’ was taken over by the Emotional Moodso that it was difficult to snap back. I kept going back in for a while. Finally Bill and Peg took Rob and me for a ride in the cold night are, to snap me out of it.(这次出神是我有生以来最深的一次。再一次，我什么也没看到；没有任何画面，但是我反常地毫无防护；在我为这个事件大吼大叫时，情绪状态让人一点都不愉快，显然是芭芭拉过去的一个事件。比方说，对于赛斯，我没有任何感觉。我大声喊罗。他设法帮我脱离出神，但是很难。有一阵子，我一直回到同样的状态。最后比尔和蓓载着罗和我在冷空气中兜风，好让我摆脱它。
( To me, at least the checked-out information in the first part was excellent; the correct town and state, initials, the point about the second child—Barb just said yes, yes; but didn’t explain; and there was something else. We didn’t check out the information I gave during the second, more Emotional part of the trance. I was too upset and Rob was too worried about me to pick up such precise information—but will be curious as to whether or not any good points were given during the second, more charged segment.(对我来说，至少第一个部分核对过的讯息是很好的；正确的城镇和州名、首字母、关于第二个孩子的重点——芭芭拉就只是说对、对；但没有解释；而且还有别的事情。我们没有核对我在第二个比较情绪化的出神部分给出的。我太沮丧了，而罗太担心我，以致没有接收到这样准确的——但是在第二个情感电荷很强的段落中，有没有给出任何好的重点，我很好奇。
(I had no idea, consciously, that I could go into such a deep trance or for that matter, give such precise information. Certainly the drinks must have lowered my defenses, though I wasn’t tight. Certainly cold sober though I would not have allowed myself to behave in this manner. The experience is a valuable one though. I was quite frightened all in all. At the same time somewhat surprised; didn't realize my abilities were that good or that I could get such specific data. Wouldn't go through that very damn often though; data or no data. The question arises: Would such experiences bring their own discipline and protection? Was it so vivid and frightening because it was my first experience? Or because in such circumstances the Emotions will always be picked up so vividly? Certainly if the Seth sessions had involved this sort of thing—particularly in the beginning—I am pretty sure we wouldn't have continued them. At least I don't believe we would have.(在意识上，我完全不知道自己竟然能够进入这样的深度出神状态，或是就此而言，给出这样准确的讯息。当然酒精肯定降低了我的防卫，但是我并未紧绷。不过这是一个可贵的经验。总的来说，我相当害怕。同时又有点惊讶；没有发觉自己的能力那么好，也不知道自己能够取得这样具体的资料。但是我可不想经常有那样的经验；有没有资料都一样。引发的问题是：这样的经验会不会自行提供纪律和保护？它之所以这么生动又吓人，是因为它是我的第一次经验？还是因为在这样的情况下，情感总是会这么生动地被接收？当然，如果赛斯课卷入这样的事情当中——尤其在一开始的时候——我很确定我们不会继续上课。至少我不相信我们会。
(I don’t believe the performance would have taken place either if I didn't feel basically protected—with Rob of course; and also knowing I would trust the Gallaghers implicitly. At the end I was inside an Emotion; I didn't feel “possessed" by Barb for instance or taken over by another; but I did feel and was immersed in an Emotion not my own, and a very unpleasant frightening one for which I wasn't prepared—again, at least consciously.(如果我基本上没有感觉受到保护——当然是有罗在——我也不相信这场演出会发生；此外我也知道我绝对信任加拉格夫妇。最后我是在一种情绪之内；我并不觉得，比方说，被芭芭拉“附身”或被另一个人接管；但我感觉到一种不是我自己的情绪，而且深陷其中，这种情绪很恐怖，让人非常不愉快，对此我毫无准备——再一次，至少在意识上。
(The whole thing was highly distasteful to Rob I believe; he dislikes Emotional displays to begin with. After it was over it was highly distasteful to me. At the time“I”wasn't aware of anything much on my own in the usual manner. Just this barrage of impressions. But I am not aware and wasn't of the way in which the impressions came; not one image that I recall. Just the words.(我相信整件事对罗来说非常反感；首先他就不喜欢张扬的情绪表现。它结束之后，我对它很反感。当时“我”自己本身对一切都不太有平常的知觉。就只有接二连三的印象而已。但印象是怎么来的，我现在和当时都毫无概念；我连一个画面都不记得。就只有字句而已。
They were mine definitely. No control personality for example of any kind. But where I got the words; or what inner translations happened before I spoke them, I don't know. I wasn't aware of the original perceptions, in other words. There was no hesitancy and little groping around. Giving test data in the sessions, there are translations that I make and I am careful, trying to interpret what I get; here, the interpretations were already made; at a subconscious level? Presumably.它们肯定是我说的。比方说，不是任何一种控制人格。但是我那些话是从哪里来的，或是在我说出它们之前发生了什么内在翻译，我都不知道。换句话说，我对最初的感知没有知觉。丝毫没有犹豫，也没经过什么摸索。在课间给出测验资料，有我做的翻译，而且我很小心，设法解读我接收的东西；这里，解读已经做好了；在一个潜意识层面吗？大概是吧。
(At the last I was frightened enough to yell for help when I got the chance; and Rob came to my assistance. Perhaps—most certainly in fact—the thing would just have ended itself but the Emotional situation could have gotten worse first; if I was reliving an Emotional state I could have gone through the whole thing, granted there was more to it. [Just now, writing this, when I was on the floor sobbing, I did feel that I was on a bed, crying. ](终于我害怕到一有机会就大喊求助；罗过来帮我。也许——事实上很肯定——这件事会自己结束，但是情绪状况首先可能会变得更糟；如果我是在重新体验一种情绪状态，假定它还有后续，那我可能会从头到尾经历整件事。[就在此时，写到这句，当我在地板啜泣时，我的确感觉我在一张床上，哭着。]
(I thought that when I said no to Seth, that was all that was required, as nothing like this has happened before. Rob insists that I must have subconsciously given consent, though, and of course he must be correct though I am certainly not conscious of any moment where I did so. Obviously I will have to protect myself and set up further barriers as this sort of thing could not be allowed to take over whenever the circumstances were favorable.(我以为当我拒绝赛斯时，就只需要说不而已，因为之前从来没有发生过这样的事。然而，罗坚称我一定是在潜意识里表示同意，当然他一定是对的，只不过我确定不管何时，我在意识上并没有同意。显然我必须保护自己，建立更深一层的屏障，因为无论何时，就算状况有利，也不能允许这种事喧宾夺主。
(The next day I began my monthly period, a few days early but not at all unusually early. This leads me to think that during ovulation and just before my period particular caution could be used. It is very possible however that this sort of thing would only happen infrequently in any case. The control must be in our conscious hands, however; regardless.(隔天我的月经来了，提早了几天，但不是早得太不寻常。这让我想到在排卵期间以及就在我的月经开始之前，可以在这方面多加小心。不过，很可能这种事情无论如何只是久久才发生一次。话说回来，控制必定掌握在我们的意识之手里，不管怎样。
(It is important to remember that as far as I know—the first part containing the valid information—was not particularly Emotional-—nor unpleasant—except for the “normal” mechanics of the trance it was not a display. Had it stopped here I don't believe Rob or I would have been nearly as upset as we were after the last episode was over.(务必记得的是，就我所知——包含有效讯息的第一个部分——并没有特别情绪化——也没有令人不快——除了出神的“正常”机制以外，它并不是一场展演。要是它在这里停住，我相信罗或我就不会像最后一个插曲结束后那样沮丧了。
(Again, I’m curious as to whether or not the added Emotional factor ,at the end added anything to the specific information given. If not, then little good can be said of it. Of course it would still be possible that additional information might hare been given if the condition had been allowed to continue.(再一次，对于最后附加的情绪因子有没有为已给出的特定增添了任何东西，我很好奇。如果没有，那它就没有什么好处可言。当然，如果我允许状况继续下去，还是有可能给出额外的讯息。
(Unfortunately it was a display; at least this is our way of looking at it and certainly our way of looking at it must he tin most important one and our attitudes must guide our actions; no one else altitudes. The information in the first part was excellent, to my way of seeing it; but it was gained at the cost of this exhibition. And in order to use the ability it must be disciplined: it could hardly be allowed to run wild. It probably wouldn't in any case certainly mediums who charge for readings and hold regular ones daily, don’t go through that all the time. On the other hand the strength of the ability, also determines the amount of discipline to be used, it has to. You cant clam up so tight in fear that you don't give yourself the opportunity to use or develop the ability surely but you don't use it indiscriminately either。The way it was used the other might does frighten me to some degree surely. I'd even go so far as to say that an overly disciplined attitude would lead to a fairly decent and balanced frame of mind. I permission altitude would make me more frightened. Looking back, I see that the situation actually was strictly supervised; if not I do not think I would have done anything. But the fact is: I’m not sure.(不幸的是，它是一场展演；至少这就是我们看待它的方式，当然我们看待它的方式最重要的，我们的态度引导我们的行动；而不是其他人的态度。在第一个部分的讯息是很棒的，在我看来；但得到它的代价却是这个……展示。而为了要使用能力，就一定要有纪律；不太能够允许它为所欲为。无论如何，它可能不会失控；当然收费算命和每天固定通灵的灵媒不会一直经历那种事。另一方面，能力的强度也决定必须施加的纪律多寡。你当然不能因为恐惧而封闭自己，不让自己有机会使用或发展这个能力；但是你也不能青红皂白不分地使用它。前天晚上使用它的方式某种程度上确实吓到我了。我甚至吓到说出过度自律的态度会产生相当有分寸又平衡的心智架构这种话。纵容的态度会让我更加害怕。回顾此事，我看到这个情况其实是受到严格监督的；若非如此，我认为我根本什么都不会做。但事实却是：我不确定。
Besides I don’t want people coming here looking for that sort of thing certainly. Now I'm sort of sorry that people will know about Seth sessions know what we're doing twice a week; and of course this is partially my fault. It is hard to get a balanced attitude, which is what is needed—and we usually do achieve one, incidentally. Wanted to write down what I am thinking about this as I may want to write about the incident in the future.(此外，我当然也不希望有人带着那种期待来到这里。现在我觉得有点抱歉的是，将会认识赛斯课的人知道我们一周两次在做什么；当然这有一部分是我的错。建立一种平衡的态度并不容易，但这是必要的——顺便一提，我们通常确实有这样的态度。想要记下我现在对此事的想法，因为未来我可能会把这个事件写下来。
(Another point: Barb must be highly neurotic, attempting suicide by her own count, four times. She was sort of flirting with Rob earlier; told us to her he represented the ideal man type and emphasized his “sternness.” I wasn’t angry with her or anything at all, but somewhat embarrassed for her in front of Gallaghers; but I wasn’t particularly amused either. I even wondered later if this had something to do with what happened; though not sure of the connection. Pretty far-out but perhaps in some way it added to the whole thing.(另一点是：芭芭拉一定非常神经质，才会据她自己说的企图自杀4次。稍早前她有一点在跟罗调情；她告诉我们说，他代表理想的男人类型并且强调他的“严厉”。我一点都没有生她的气或什么的，而是在加拉格夫妇面前，我替她感到难为情；但我也不觉得特别好笑。后来我甚至在想，这和发生的事件有没有关联；但是我不确定连结是什么。出去很远，但也许它在某方面为整件事加了分。
(I recall telling Barb she would make another? or other? Attempts on her life, but would die in her early eighties of [pneumonia?]. Maybe I said in Greenwich, Connecticut. Something about another man also that I don’t recall. This is all I remember. I did not remember the Greenwich data or the other points that did check out; I only know of them because we talked about them before the second trance started.(我记得我告诉芭芭拉，她会有再一次？或另一次？自杀未遂，但会活到80出头才死[于肺炎？]。可能我说的是在康乃狄克州的格林威治。我也不记得与另一个男人有关的事。我记得的就这些了。我不记得格林威治资料或其他的确符合的重点；我之所以知道，只是因为我们在第二次出神开始之前谈过。
(I do not know if our attitude toward this type of thing is too rigid; that is, if it would seem so to others; the Gallaghers, for instance. I say that I don't want people to “expect that sort of thing when they come here" and when I think about it I do consider it as somehow unpleasant or exhibitionistic. Of course there must be exhibitionistic tendencies, perfectly all right, in order for any quite legitimate thing like this to happen; yet somehow you still distrust it. Rob I think actively dislikes it. I am afraid of it to some degree. Certainly on occasion I think it would be perfectly okay with Gallaghers, for instance, to try to see what I could pick up. But then, when I think of it, I'm afraid to let go for fear of being wrong; or of making some sort of display with no legitimate information being given. This doesn’t help. The other night the whole thing happened so fast that I didn't even think of such things. It is highly possible that the Emotional part—and perhaps even what we think of as the display— are necessary in some cases—or are of great help. But the other night was just too much, the second episode, even considering these points, as far as I am concerned. Had it ended after the first episode, it might have been okay, or at least less upsetting. Recall; it is only the first less Emotional part that yielded the precise information as far as I know. I do think that when we get the notes, I should just have Barb write out yes or no to the points given; very professional and purposely unEmotional but I do want to know if that Emotional bit added anything data-wise or not.(我不知道我们对这类事情的态度是不是太死板了；也就是说，对别人来说是不是也是如此；比方说，加拉格夫妇。我说我不希望有人“带着那种期待来到这里”，当我想到这件事的时候，我确实认为它不知为何就是令人不愉快或是有自我表现之嫌。为了任何这类相当合理的事得以发生，当然一定有自我表现的倾向，这完全没有问题；可是不知为何还是很反感。我认为罗非常不喜欢。我对它有某种程度的恐惧。当然我想有时候，对比加拉格夫妇来说，看看我能够接收到什么是完全没有问题的。但另一方面，我一想到它就会因为害怕出错，或做了某种演出却没有给出合理的讯息而不敢放手。这样想一点用也没有。前天晚上整件事发生得太快了，我甚至来不及思考这样的事。很可能情感部分——也许甚至还有我们认为的演出——在某些案例中是必需的——或是有很大的帮助。但是在我看来，前天晚上第二个插曲太过火，甚至别说思考这些重点了。要是在第一个插曲之后就结束，可能就没问题，或至少让人比较不那么沮丧。回想起来，就我所知只有第一个比较不情绪化的部分给出精确的资料。我的确认为，当我们拿到笔记时，我应该干脆请罗针对给出的重点写下是或否；非常专业又刻意不带情绪，但我真的想要知道，就资料而言，那个情绪化的部分有没有什么附加作用。
(Did the fact that some of the first information check out then encourage me to continue? Most likely. If it had been all wrong I would have been too embarrassed; and felt like an idiot I suppose—though again this is not the right attitude either—too far in the other direction.(第一个部分的一些讯息确认无误，这个事实后来是不是激励我继续？很有可能。如果它全部都错，我想我就会太难为情而感觉自己像个白痴——但是，话说回来，这种态度也不能——太偏向另一边了。
(Daily life must be maintained at a fairly balanced level however, regardless. If such episodes are upsetting then they are not to be encouraged. Does this mean that I should definitely see to it that such a situation never happens again? Or is that too rigid? I do know that an attitude of permissiveness, generally speaking, is definitely out. It does not seem necessary to refuse to discuss ESP under any conditions with anyone—little ESP was discussed the other evening though Barb asked me to hypnotize her several times and I refused. I think that night it was the charged Emotional climate; Barb’s; and that perhaps it is simply certain individuals that I must protect myself against: I will not for example discuss ESP with Barb now. This might be it: the psychotic individual—and I knew that she was at least highly neurotic—may project so strongly that I pick up too much before I apply guards.(然而每天的生活一定要维持在相当平衡的程度，不管怎样。如果这样的插曲令人沮丧，那就不要助长它们。这是不是意味着，我应该要确保这样的情况永远不会再发生？还是说这样太僵化了？我确实知道，一般而言，纵容的态度绝对是不行的。拒绝在任何状况下与任何人讨论超感官知觉似乎没有必要——前天晚上，没怎么讨论到ESP，但是芭芭拉屡次要求我催眠她，我拒绝了。我认为那天晚上，关键在于充电的情感气候；芭芭拉的；我也认为，或许只有对某些个体，我必须保护自己，以免受到他们的伤害；现在我不会，比方说，和罗讨论ESP。这可能就是重点；精神病患——而我知道她至少非常神经质——的投射可能会强烈到我采取防卫之前就接收到太多了。
(It must be emphasized that I did not know consciously that such an affair could even happen. I didn’t know my abilities were that good, to tell the truth; and had no idea that there was any danger of acting as a medium without Seth. I used to worry that if Seth gave wrong data this would reflect on the legitimate nature of that personality. This time Seth was not present. Did this give me added freedom?(一定要强调的是，我在意识上并不知道这样一件事居然可能发生。老实说，我不知道我的能力有那么好；而且在没有赛斯的情况下充当灵媒有什么危险，我也毫无概念。过去我总是担心赛斯要是给错资料，这就会反映在那个人格的正当本质上，这次赛斯不在场。这是不是给了我更多的自由？
(On some occasions with Gallaghers I tried on my own and was conscious of an annoying restraint on my part; I was afraid of making a fool of myself. One time in particular I recall when I gave some data about Bill's .... (grandmother?) sitting around a table; seance style. This time of course all the lights were on.(与加拉格夫妇在一起的一些场合中，我自己尝试过，意识到我这边有着讨厌的约束；我怕自己闹笑话。尤其有一次我记得大家围坐在一张桌子旁，我给了一些资料，有关比尔的……[祖母？]；降神会的形式。这次当然所有的灯都开着。
(Very possible that subconscious controls were used this time, without my knowledge of course, consciously. Nevertheless there must be conscious control and the ego must be certain of its dominant position—not be afraid of being taken over, willy-nilly.(这次非常有可能使用了潜意识的控制，当然是在就意识而言我并不知情的状况下。虽然如此，有意识的控制一定是有的，而且自我对它自己的主导地位也一定是有把握的——不怕被接管，无论愿不愿意。)
PEGGY GALLAGHER’S NOTES蓓·加拉格的笔记
REGARDING FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 23, 1966关于1966年9月23日 星期五
FIRST PART第一部分
(only took last part of it:(只记了最后一部分)
(Age 3...Greenwich, Connecticut, very strong... GM initials here, someone you knew in the past., who will again become important.. See the child Lisa until the age of 23. I see a marriage for her between the age of 23 & 24. A womans death, not your own, or your daughter in 1968? [Later note added by Jane: Did Barb die in 1968? I think she did & that I blocked, saying it was another woman—would also explain later Emotional bit.] Greenwich, Connecticut, connection very strong within three years. Episode in 6th grade very important... very important year... See 5 years or number 5...I do not understand... A complete change of opinion in family group that did not work to your advantage... Perhaps 1947 or 1943...a disturbance...a connection with another child...initial F & perhaps M...something on an occasion beneath pine trees...& water... CM (?) the M. in Greenwich... 1937 or 1938, another child, a male....(3岁……格林威治，康乃狄克州，非常强烈……这里有缩写GM，你过去认识的某个人……将会再次变重要。看见小孩丽莎，直到她23岁。我看到她在23到24岁之间有一个婚姻。一个女人的死，不是你自己或你女儿的死，在1968年。[后来珍加的注：芭芭拉是否死于1968年？我想她是，但我封锁了，改口说是另一个女人——这也说明了后来的情绪压抑]格林威治，康乃狄克州，在3年之内的连结非常强。6年级的事件非常重要……非常重要的一年……看见5年或数字5……我不了解……在家庭团体里的看法完全改变，并未对你有利……也许是1947年或1943年……一场骚动……与另一个的连结……首字母F，也许还有M……有一次某个东西在松树下……以及水……CM[?]这个M在格林威治……1937年或1938年，另一个，男的……
SECOND PART (complete)第二部分(完整)
(spoken slowly & disjointedly...(说话速度缓慢而且断断续续……
"(We see 1947 afternoon or early evening...an episode...a traumatic one for you.. An S and I believe G...you should understand... the initials and dates may not correspond... 1947 especially important to you... the initials I gave apply either to one individual or first names of two...the second child something different now...February or initial F...a connection with second child...February or FB...I do not know which... a turnabout with the child...a complete change of plan or a turnabout...a 36 connection...someone perhaps 36years old connected somehow with this. I do not know to what this refers... a form or square... I do not know... 17 years old. This is separate and the woman here...a strong school connection again...3 o'clock or late afternoon...number 4l4...now this could be the hour 4:14 or month...I do not know... Green room...202 or 213.. whether this is a month or year or house number I don't know...a grip...a strong grip...in the afternoon...in a room...a woman, gray hair, buck teeth...yellow teeth...She yells out and calls and a young boy comes in blue clothes & bicycle...I think he rides....It’s 1943 or 1947...Room is green...yellow. .. Room is green... no, cream.. .yellow... it's afternoon …"(我们看见1947年下午或傍晚……一个事件……对你来说是一个创伤事件……一个S还有我相信……你应该了解……缩写和日期可能不一致……1947年对你尤其重要……我给的缩写适用于一个人或是两个人的名字……第二个小孩现在有不一样的地方……2月或首字母F……我不知道哪一个……与这个小孩有关的转变……一个计划完全改变或是一次转变……与36的连结……某个或许36岁的人不知为何与这个有关。我不知道这个是指什么……一个形式或正方形……我不知道……17岁。这是分开的，这里的这个女人……再一次与学校有强烈连结……下午3点或更晚……数字414……现在这可能是时间的4:14分或月份……我不知道……绿色的房间……202或213。这个数字是月份或年份或门牌号码，我不知道……紧抓……强力的紧抓……在下午……在一个房间……一个女人、头发灰白……暴行……黄斑牙……她出声大叫喊人，一个穿着蓝衣的小男孩来了，还有脚踏车……我想他骑着……时间是1943年或1947年……房间是绿色的……黄色……房间是绿色的……不，奶油色……黄色……时间是下午……
(Additional notation with no reference as to what it refers to: “I don’t want to...I don't want to.”(没有提到所指为何的额外注释：“我不想要……我不想要。”
(Note: last thing she said was afternoon...one of the first things Jane asked Barbara when she was partially recovered was whether she had ever tried to commit suicide in the afternoon. Then Jane added to Peggy’s notes:(注释：她说的最后一件事是下午……当珍一部分回神时，她问芭芭拉的第一件事，就是她有没有在下午试图自杀过。然后珍在蓓笔记上补充：
(G.M.—George Richard Morris.(CM——乔治理查莫里斯[George Richard Morris])。
(AGE 3—accident in long narrow kitchen. I said pantry.(3岁——在狭长的厨房发生意外。我说食品储藏室。
(Bristly hair & mustache—Barb’s father.(粗硬的头发和胡须——芭芭拉的父亲。
(?” 6th grade important year”—moved from New York to Pleasant ville—[no Emotional reaction though.](?“6年级重要的一年”——从纽约搬到安东乡[Pleasantville]——[但是没有情绪反应。]
( ? 1947 oldest sister went to college. Strong Emotional resentment. Barb couldn't go because she went.(?1947年最大的姊姊上大学。强烈的愤懑情绪。芭芭拉不能去，因为她去了。
(Senior year high—her best friend gave birth to a boy illegitimately. Gave up for adoption in February—Barb recalls whole episode well—Emotionally upset.(高三时——她最好的朋友生了一个私生子。在2月时送人领养——芭芭拉清楚记得整件事——情绪沮丧。
(Had baby in September.(在9月生了小孩。
(She did want to keep it—but pressure by family—agencies—she gave it for adoption February.(她真的想要留下他——但家人施压——政府机构——她在2月时将他送人领养。
(She was 17 or 18—(她当时17或18岁——
(Barb was 17.(芭芭拉17岁。
(Bothered her thru years(困扰了她3年。
(Pines—her house is almost completely hidden by the street.(松树——在街道上几乎看不见她的房子。
(Greenwich, Connecticut—(格林威治，康乃狄克州——
(First she said yes—then no—(首先她说是——然后不——
(Although a friend of family died there—(虽然一个家族世交死在那里——
(Barb dies in 1968 or 1960.)(芭芭拉死于1968或1960年。
(Jane often doodles while concentrating on difficult material.)(珍专注在困难的资料时经常一边涂鸦。)
APRIL 10, 19671967年4月10日
NOTES REGARDING SESSION FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 23, 1966关于1966年9月23日星期五的笔记
(After that session I checked out Pegs notes with Barbara. Unfortunately now I can't put my hands on Barbaras scrawled script but will find it and include it here. A man with a bristly mustache and short bristly hair was mentioned in the first part of the spontaneous session for which no notes were taken; this referred. Barb said, definitely to her father. The main point is that then Barb told me that the male child referred to the illegitimate child of a girl friend and that all the other details given were correct, in reference to this child.(在那一节之后，我核对蓓与芭芭拉的笔记。可惜现在我没办法拿到芭芭拉潦草的手稿，但找到之后会把它放在这里。在自发课上提到一个留着粗硬胡须和粗硬短发的男人，那一节没有记录，芭芭拉说，这肯定是指她父亲。重点是，后来芭芭拉告诉我，男孩指的是一个女性朋友的私生子，而且与这个孩子有关的其他细节也都是正确的。
(Now approximately six months Later, she told me last night that the session had shocked her considerably. The child had been her own illegitimate child, she had not wanted to tell us this at the time and had been too surprised at the session to do anything; she had wanted to leave but hadn't it seems been able to.(现在大约6个月后，她昨晚告诉我，那一节让她颇为震惊。那个孩子其实是她自己的私生子，当时她不想告诉我们这件事，而且在那一节她太惊讶了，以至于不知所措；她本来想要离开但似乎无法离开。
(The child was male as given in the session. The month of February was mentioned; and in February she signed the papers putting the child up for adoption.“Turnabout with the child, a complete change of plan or a turnabout” refers to the fact that she wanted to keep the baby but its father refused to marry her and pushed her into having it adopted; she was a minor also at the time. 1947 is mentioned, the year she met the child's father; the age 17is mentioned; she was 17 when she met him: a school connection mentioned and she was still in school at the time.(正如那一节给出的资料，小孩是男的。其中提到2月；在2月，她签了文件，把小孩送养。“与这个小孩有关的转变，一个计划完全改变或是一次转变”指的是她想要留下孩子但是他的父亲不肯娶她，还逼她送养；她当时也是个未成年人。其中提到1947年，这一年她遇见孩子的父亲；其中提到17岁；遇见他时，她17岁；其中提到学校的关联，而她当时还在学校读书。
(Toward the end of the session, I was in an Emotional turmoil, still in trance and for this Barb told me at the time she had no explanation. I thought I was in a hospital room. Most likely this was my interpretation of her giving birth to the child; she was supposed to have a Caesarean section but didn’t and was in labor 25 hours; a woman is described here gray hair, buck teeth, yellow teeth—this. Barb says, is a description of the man’s mother-she wanted him to marry Barb teeth not really buck but protuberant and yellowed; also gray hair, she does not remember the room number at the hospital or the color of the walls [given as green].)(那一节快结束时，我处于一种情绪混乱状态中，仍然还在出神，当时芭芭拉告诉我，对此，她没有任何解释。我以为我在医院病房里。很可能这是我对她生下那个孩子的解读；她本来要剖腹生产但后来没有，历经25个小时的阵痛；这里描述的女人，灰白头发、暴牙、黄板牙——芭芭拉说，这描述的是男人的母亲——她想要他娶芭芭拉；牙齿不算暴牙，而是凸出来，颜色偏黄；还有灰白头发。她不记得病房的房间号码或墙壁的颜色[给出的资料是绿色]。)

SESSION 289 第289节 外在实相是内在电磁实相的物质显化


SEPTEMBER 28, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年9月28日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down, in an average voice with pauses. Her eyes soon began to open.)(珍坐下来，在出神中开始讲话，声音不高不低，时而停顿。她的眼睛很快就张开了。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. A word concerning the nature of inner perceptions.现在。说一下与内在感知的本质有关的事。
I have told you that exterior reality is a materialization of inner electromagnetic reality. I have told you that all experience is electromagnetically coded. The inner senses pick up this data directly, you see, as in last Friday’s episode. Some translation must occur if you are to become aware consciously of such material, or if it is to impress the physical senses at all.我告诉过你，外在实相是内在电磁实相的物质化。我告诉过你，所有的经验都经过电磁编码。内在感官直接接收这个资料，你看，就像在上周五的事件那样。如果你在意识上觉察到这样的资料，或是要让肉体感官能够留下印象，就一定会出现某种翻译。
You are not aware, or Ruburt is not aware, of the direct inner perception. The physical organism cannot perceive it, hence some necessary transformations. The data may make itself known in visual or auditory forms. Some interpretation is always necessary.你没有觉察到，或鲁柏没有觉察到，直接的内在感知。物质有机体感知它，因此会有一些必要的转变。资料可能以视觉或声音的形式出现。某种解读一向有其必要。
You recall I have told you that the intensity of an experience, rather than its duration in time, determines its effect. The intensity is Emotional. With the inner perceptions there will be a traveling through of intensities. The experience is perceived simultaneously by the inner senses, but it will be translated in terms of physical time.你记得我告诉过你，一个经验的强度，而不是它持续的时间长度，它的效果。强度是情绪性的。由于内在感知，将会有一个行经种种的历程。内在感官同时感知这个经验，但是会按照物理时间翻译它。
An experience in general is composed of electromagnetic pulsations. (Long pause) They contain a kind of depth, having nothing to do with space, an existence dependent upon, again, intensity rather than duration. However, because of your own basic assumptions such experiences, perceived by the inner senses, are played back in such a manner that a traveling through intensities results in a journey through time within your own dimension.一个经验大致上是由电磁脉冲组成的(长时间停顿)它们包含一种深度，与空间一点关系都没有，一种依赖——再一次——强度而不是持续时间长度的存在。然而，因为你自己的基本假设，这样的经验，被内在感知到，以行经种种强度的方式重播，因而在你们自己的维度内产生了一趟时间之旅。
I believe it will be found that differences will occur in the plus and minus charges in the body during such episodes.我相信你们会发现，在这样的事件中，身体里的电荷将出现或加或减的差异。
(One minute pause, eyes closed.) The girls Emotional condition the other evening acted indeed like a psychological bridge, over which Ruburt could pass. Inner perceptions are never basically physical, you see. Basically, no perceptions are physical for that matter. Emotional patterns are quite wordless.(停顿1分钟，眼睛闭着)前几天晚上这个女孩的情绪状况其实具有心理桥梁的作用，你知道。基本上，就此而言，没有任何感知是实质的。情感模式很难言传。
(Long pause.) In other words, if you will forgive a pun, you can never be consciously aware of the basic inner perception, but you can follow backward to that point. You can discover how you use the data, and how you finally recognize it.(长时间停顿)换言之，恕我使用双关语，你永远无法在意识上觉知基本的内在感知，但是你可以往后回溯到那一刻。你可以发现你怎样使用资料，以及你最后怎样认出它的。
The overall climate the other evening was highly charged, and yet well balanced. Had another Emotionally-oriented person been present the balance would have been upset, and nothing would have happened. Had another passive person been present, the same would apply.前几天晚上的整体气候是高度充电的，但是非常平衡。要是有另一个情感导向的人在场，可能会打乱这个平衡，那就什么事都不会发生了。要是有另一个消极的人在场，同样也会如此。
There is always a time scramble, for the inner senses deal with basic data in the spacious present . Then the data must be interpreted in the time scheme of physical existence.时间混乱(time scramble)总是有的，因为内在感官是在广阔的现在与基本资料打交道，
(Long pause.) With training and experience a neutralizing element will be developed that protects Ruburt against the full Emotional charge that he experienced the other evening. The organism itself forms this as a self protective mechanism.一个中和的元素将会发展出来，保护鲁柏免于前几天晚上他所经历的那种情感电荷的全面冲击。有机体本身形成这个自我保护机制。
To some extent this operates with Ruburt now, and has to some extent in the past. You may now take your break.某种程度上，现在这就在鲁柏身上运作，而且过去某种程度上也是。你现在可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:28. Jane had been dissociated as usual. Her pace had been on the slow side, but she expressed surprise when I told her this. She had no idea, she said, of whether she spoke slowly, rapidly, etc., during delivery as a rule.(9:28分。珍一如往常出离。她的速度偏向缓慢，但是当我告诉她这件事时，她表达了她的惊讶。她说在传述时，通常她对自己讲话是慢还是快等等毫无概念。
(During break we engaged in a spirited discussion ourselves, then broke it off when we realized this might influence the session itself. The discussion concerned the spontaneous affair of last Friday, September 23, which Seth has referred to this evening often.(在休息时，我们自己有过一番激烈的讨论，后来我们发觉这可能会影响这节课本身，于是突然住口。这个讨论与9月23日上周五的自发事件有关，今晚赛斯经常提到这件事。
(Jane resumed, still with pauses, her eyes opening at times, at 9:39.)(9:39分，珍继续，还是偶有停顿，双眼有时睁开。)
Now you two upset our balance.现在你们两个打乱了我们的平衡。
(Pause, head down.)(停顿，低下头)
Give us a moment, please... Now we are clear. (Pause.)请等我们一下……现在我们没事了。(停顿)
The episode did involve projection, mainly through intensities. These intensities you interpret as time and space. Now in a different kind of projection, you could face for example the girl’s thought forms as a pseudo physical reality.这个事件的确涉及投射，主要是经由强度。你们把这些强度解读成时间和空间。这时在不同类型的投射中，比方说，你可能面对这个女孩的思想形式，而当它是伪物质实相(pseudophysical reality)。
If Ruburt had done the same thing from the dream state, this could have resulted. A very slight amount of physical weight was lost on Ruburt’s part. This will always occur when any kind of projection is experienced. Much of your intimate existence implies projections of various kinds. Thoughts are indeed small projections of yourself, sent outward.如果鲁柏在梦状态做了同样的事，结果可能就是这样。鲁柏的体重减少了一点点。每当经历任何类型的投射时，这就会发生。你最近的一次存在大部分包含各种不同的投射。思想其实就是你自己向外发送的小投射。
You have yet to experience a complete projection, but this will come. Your fear, Joseph, in the window dream projection, shows that you are proceeding with great caution here.你尚未经历过一次完整的投射，但是这将会到来。约瑟，你对窗户梦投射的恐惧，让你看到你在这里的行动非常小心谨慎。
(See my dream notebook for the very vivid dream-projection experience of August 20,1966.)(详见我为1966年8月20日那次非常生动的梦投射经验所写的梦笔记。)
Now there is a tug and pull, a give and take, between you and Ruburt, as to the amount of Emotional freedom you will allow yourselves. The conflict here, in the overall, results in a good balance, though of course there will be times when this is upset.现在，对于你们允许你们自己有多少的情绪自由，你和鲁柏之间有一场拔河、一种施与受。这里的冲突整体而言产生了一个良好的平衡，不过，这当然有时候也会被打乱。
The conflict itself, you see, results in energy. Your dream projection at the window signaled that you did not want to go further at that particular point. You are afraid of Emotional demonstrations, as you know. At the same time the withheld Emotional energy acts as a propellant, you see.冲突本身，你看，导致的结果是能量。你在窗边的梦中投射表示你在那一刻不想要更进一步。如你所知，你怕情感的表露。同时，压抑的情感能量却充当推进的燃料，你看。
Ruburt is far more cautious than either of you suppose. When you become overcautious, this can at times, momentarily at least, hold you both back; because you do not count upon this less apparent but quite definite cautious part of Ruburt. All in all balance is maintained.鲁柏的小心谨慎远远超过你们两人应有的程度。当你们太过小心谨慎时，这有时候可能会牵制你们两人，至少暂时会；因为你们不信任鲁柏这个谨慎的部分，它虽然比较不外显但相当明确。总之，平衡维持住了。
I do not want to take any more time with this episode. I should emphasize however that full control is possible, and with practice will be achieved rather easily. Ruburt’s personality is so constructed that he would not allow himself to take any real chances.我不想要多花时间在这个事件上。不过，我应该强调，全面掌控是可能的，借由练习，很容易就会达成。鲁柏的人格就是建构成这样，因此他不会允许自己冒任何真正的风险。
The initial experience however almost had to be spontaneous at this time, or it would not have occurred. Your dream activities should accelerate with the change of seasons. I speak of you both here. A feeling of expansiveness and discipline should be maintained, but in that order.然而，最初的经验在这时候几乎一定是自发的，否则就不会发生了。随着季节的转换，你们的梦活动应该会加速。这里我讲的是你们两人。应该维持一种扩展与纪律的感觉，但要按照这个次序。
You may take a break and we will begin on some other material. If you have any questions concerning this evening’s session, I will be glad to answer them. Otherwise after our break we shall leave the subject for now.你可以休息一下，我们会开始讲一些别的资料。如果你有任何关于今晚这一节的问题，我很乐意回答。不然的话， 我们休息之后就要暂时搁下这个话题。
("No questions at the moment, I guess.”(“目前没有问题，我想。”
(Break at 9:59. Jane had been farther-out, she said, while keeping to her slow pace. When her eyes had been open they had been very dark. She remembered little of the material given during this delivery. She resumed at a faster pace at 10:05.)(9:59分休息。珍说她出去更远了，同时保持缓慢的速度。当她的眼睛睁开时，颜色非常深。她记得一点点这段传述期间给出的资料。她在10:05分以比较快的速度继续。)
Now. Have you thought of any questions?现在。你想到任何问题了吗？
("No.”)(“没有。”)
Our own sessions have been most unEmotional for some time. I have been concerned with the material for one thing. For another, there is the nature of the voice, you see.我们自己的课有一段时间很不表露感情了。一来是我忙于资料，另外还有这个声音的本质，你知道。
When I come through in an Emotional manner at all, this is often transformed into the loud voice, an over volume, a static. Ruburt has not learned as yet to transform these elements throughout the whole physical system, you see—要是我以一种带着情感的方式过来，这往往会被转化成响亮的噪音，一种过大的音量、一种静电噪音。鲁柏还没学会转化整个物质系统当中的这些元素，你知道——
(gesturing in a humorous way, Jane rubbed her outstretched arms alternately; eyes wide, smiling)—but focuses them at the vocal cords, which causes difficulty that I understand.(以一种幽默的方式比手势，珍轮流摩擦她伸直的手臂；两眼圆睁、面带微笑)——而是把它们集中在声带上，因此造成我所了解的困难。
After some attempts therefore I have let this rest for now. This does not mean that I do not senseyou Emotionally, that you do not impress me in that manner. For many reasons having to do with such necessary cautions, I have not tried to impress you particularly with my own Emotional existence, nor to communicate in that manner. (Eyes very wide and dark, manner active, gestures.)因此试过几次之后，我暂且善罢甘休。这并不是说我在情感上感应不到你，也不是说你没有用那种方式打动我。因为有很多原因与这种必要的小心谨慎有关系。我并没有试着用我自己的情感存在来打动你，也没有用那种方式来沟通。(眼睛睁得很开而且颜色很深、举止活泼、比了许多手势)
In some ways this is unfortunate. Much of my Emotional energy is used to give you this material, you see. It is behind the material. It forms intensities upon which I can build. Without this reaching out to you the material could not be delivered. When you are more proficient, we may be able to meet in some of your projections, but not for some time.在某些方面，这很可惜。我的情感能量大部分用在给你这份资料，你看。它就在资料的背后。它形成我能够用来当作基础的强度。不这样触及你，根本不可能传述资料。当你更为熟练的时候，我们也许能够在你的一些投射当中相遇，但是还需要一段时间。
Expectation will help you here however if you use it. In these sessions we are translating basic realities into verbal terms, no mean accomplishment. Some evening however, perhaps we can have a session in which more Emotional rapport is possible.不过在这里，预期对你有帮助，如果你利用它的话。在这些课里，我们正把基本实相翻译成口语的说法，这可是很大的成就。不管怎样，看哪一天晚上，或许我们可以有一节在情感上比较能够水乳交融的课。
From my standpoint some limited sessions, with strictly selected witnesses, are perfectly acceptable. I am not necessarily suggesting these, you see. (Lang pause at 10:20),从我的立场看来，一些受限的课，有严选的见证人在场，是完全可以接受的。我不一定是在建议这些，你知道。(在10:20分停顿良久)
There is an interesting similarity and this is the last I will say between last Fridays episode and the ways in which die dream is basically constructed—the same Emotional basis and projection, the same sort of symbolism. (one minute pause.)在上周五的事件与这个梦基本的建构方式之间，有一个相似之处很有意思——我就讲这最后一件事——相同的情感基础和投射，同样的象征意义。(停顿一分钟)
I mentioned the caffeine. I should also note that if coffee does not prevent or inhibit sleep, it will stimulate dream projections, and also aid you in bringing the critical faculties into the dream stare. If the body can achieve a deep state of relaxation, unbothered by the caffeine, then the caffeine does activate the tea soiling processes; and sufficiently enough to help them operate for a while, while the body is in slumber. Alcohol will not help in this particular case.我提到了咖啡因。我也应该指出，如果咖啡没有妨碍或抵制睡眠，那它就会促发梦中投射，也会帮助你把重要的机能带进梦状态中。如果身体能够达到深度的放松状态，不受咖啡因干扰，那么咖啡因的确会启动推理的过程；而且足以在身体沉睡时帮助这些过程运作一阵子。在这个特定的案例中，酒精不会有帮助。
If you are awakened for any reason during the night, the chances for a conscious projection on your return to sleep are somewhat higher than dies would have been had your sleep not been interrupted.如果你在夜里醒来，不管原因是什么，当你再度入睡时，发生意识投射的机率比你在睡眠没有中断的时候还要高一点。
Now, if you have no questions we shall end the session.现在，如果你没有任何问题的话，我们就结束这一节。
(“Did I refuse to project in that dream(“我在那个梦中是不是拒绝投射？”
(See my dream of September It’s in my dream notebook. Jane and I had diseased this before the session. The setting of the dream was the same—my studio—a: the dream of August 20. mentioned on page 69. In the first dream I had found myself outside the studio windows, but not falling. In the second dream I had refused to leave the safety of the studio, which is on the second floor, for fear of falling. It seemed to me to be a clear refusal to project.)(我在9月17日的梦详见我的梦笔记。珍和我在课前讨论过这件事。这个梦的背景——我的画室——与前面提到的8月20日那个梦是一样的。在第一个梦中，我发现自己在画室的窗户外面，但没有掉下去。在第二个梦中，我不肯离开画室的安全保护，它位于二楼，因为怕掉下去。对我来说，这显然是拒绝投射。)
In that dream, and in several others which you have forgotten. This is for the best however. No projection should occur until you are ready, or when you are ready. The dream itself showed your altitude, and you have already begun to change it.在那个梦中，以及在其他几个你已经忘记的梦中。不过，这样最好。除非你准备好了，或是在你准备好时，否则不应该发生任何投射。梦本身透露出你的态度，而你已经开始改变它了。
Even in the dream state, do not try to force yourself to project. You distrust the spontaneous nature, you see, that is at the base of all existence, but you only mistrust it at one level, which is fortunate. It is a learned reaction.甚至在梦状态中，都不要试图强迫你自己投射。你看，你不信任所有存在基础当中的自发本质，但是还好你只是在某一方面有怀疑而已。这是一种后天学习的反应。
(“What do you think of the letter from Dr. Bernard?”(“你对伯纳德医师写来的信有什么想法？”
(On September 28, Jane received a welcome letter from psychologist Eugene Bernard of North Carolina State University. Dr. Bernard suggests a meeting in Elmira over the Thanksgiving holidays.)(在9月28日，珍收到北卡罗来纳州立大学[North Carolina State University]的心理学家尤金·伯纳德[Dr. Eugene Bernard]寄来的一封欢迎信。伯纳德医师建议在感恩节假期于埃尔迈拉见个面。)
You are fine here, and the meeting will take place. Perhaps we shall see what we can do some evening, by giving impressions having to do with the man.这里你们没问题，这场聚会将会发生。或许哪天晚上我们给一些关于这个男人的印象，看看我们可以做点什么。
Is there anything else?还有别的事情吗？
(“I guess not.”)(“我想没有了。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both, and good evening.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福，晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:34. Jane was out as usual.)(10:34分结束。珍一如往常出去了。)
(Front of the empty envelope used as the object in the 290th第290节 细胞意识是内我意识的一部分 信封72
session, the 72nd experiment, for October 3, 1966.)1966年10月3日 星期一 晚上9点

SESSION 290 在1966年10月13日第290节第72次实验用作标的物的空信封正面


OCTOBER 3, 1966 9 PM MONDAY空信封的背面
(The object for the 72nd. envelope experiment was an empty envelope, as shown. I kept the letter that had been enclosed in the envelope for reference, and as expected needed it to decipher some of Seth's data. The object was a standard white business envelope, printed and typed in black. The back was blank. I sealed it in the usual double envelopes after placing it between two pieces of Bristol board. Jane had seen the envelope in a casual way upon its arrival here last May, but not since then.(第72次信封实验的标的物是一个空的信封，如图所示。我保留装在这个信封内的信以备参考，因为预期在解读赛斯的一些资料会需要它。标的物是一个标准的商用信封，用黑色油墨印刷和打字。背面空白。我把它夹在两片西卡纸间，然后密封在普通双层信封里。今年5月它寄到这里时，珍碰巧见过信封，但是在那之后就没有再看过了。
(Perhaps ten minutes before the session began, I showed Jane an article I found in the New York Times for October 3,1966. She read it, then I clipped it for future use. It concerns a study of animals in dreams, conducted by a psychologist at the University of North Carolina School of Medicine.(大约在这一节开始之前10分钟，我给珍看了我在1966年10月3日《纽约时报》发现的一篇文章。她读了，然后我把它剪下来以备未来之用。它是关于梦中动物的一个研究，执行者是北卡罗来纳大学医学院的一名心理学家。
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her pace was rather slow. )(珍坐下来，在出神中开始讲话，闭着眼睛。她的速度相当缓慢。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I have a few comments to make concerning the article on dreams, that you read in the paper. Maturity has nothing to do with the meaning of the reptiles and mammals mentioned as dream images. There is generic imprint stamped within the cells, and at various levels of cell consciousness. These are reactivated. The reptilian images do not represent maturity nor immaturity, but are simply designations natural to a particular level of cellular consciousness.关于你在报纸上读到的那篇谈梦的文章，我有几个意见要说。文中提到爬虫类和哺乳动物是梦意象，成熟与这些梦意象的意义毫无关系。在细胞之内，以及在细胞意识的不同层面上，铭刻着一般的印记。这些再度启动。爬虫类的意象不代表成熟也不代表不成熟，单纯只是对细胞意识一个特定层面的自然指称而已。
(Neither Jane nor I had expected any such quick response to the article, nor had we asked for such before the session.)(珍和我既没有预期到那篇文章这么快就得到回应，而且在课前也没有提出这样的要求。)
The difference noted in this respect between the dreams of men and women are only differences apparent within your own structure of civilization. In your social framework women are afraid of reptiles, and they do not consciously remember dreams involving these. Except in strong nightmare situations, they repress those images. They remember the mammal dreams more easily however because mammals are warm-blooded creatures whose reproductive systems bear similarities to your own.在这方面，男人与女人的梦之间显著的差别，只不过是在你们自己的文明结构之内显见的差别而已。在你们的社会架构里，女人害怕爬虫类，在意识上他们不记得与之有关的梦。除了在强烈的噩梦情境之外，她们会压抑那些意象。但是，她们比较容易记得哺乳动物的梦，因为哺乳动物是混血生物，有着类似你们自身的生殖系统。
Men repress many mammalian images in your particular civilization, because they do not want to be reminded of the female's reproductive advantages. But these apply to your social frameworks alone. The level of sleep is the real indicator. The individual becomes aware of cellular consciousness at certain sleep levels.在你们特定的文明中，男人压抑很多哺乳动物的意象，因为他们不要想起女性的生殖优势。但这些只适用于你们的社会架构。睡眠层次是真正的指标。个体在某些睡眠层次会开始觉察到细胞意识。
Cellular consciousness itself straddles, so to speak, various levels of sleep activity. Various aspects of it come to the forefront at definite times. This consciousness is constant, whether you wake or sleep. It existed before the ego’s formation, and in many cases exists after the ego’s organization is altered. In sleep cellular consciousness often intrudes into the dream process, appearing in the form of dream images. Cellular consciousness is highly codified in actuality, much more Emotional than visual, and the visual dream images are but translations of inner comprehensions.细胞意识本身可以说横跨睡眠活动的不同层次。它的各个面向在一定的时间会来到最前面。这个意识是持续的，不管你是醒是睡。在你的自我形成之前，它就存在，而且在很多案例中，也存在于自我的组织被改变之后。在睡眠中，细胞意识经常侵入梦过程，以梦意象的形式出现。细胞意识实际上是经过严密编码的，情感成分远超过视觉成分，而且视觉的梦意象只不过是内在理解的翻译而已。
(Long pause, nearly one minute.)(停顿良久，将近一分钟)
The bird dreams are in this same category. No generalizations can completely answer these questions however, for despite them individuals, regardless of their sex, will show great variations in the dream images that they recall or forget entirely.鸟的梦也属于这同一种类别。然而，任何概括的归纳都无法完整回答这些问题，因为尽管有这些归纳，个体无论性别为何，在他们记得或完全忘记的梦意象上，都会出现非常大的变化。
Children recall animal dreams more frequently simply because they are closer to cellular consciousness to begin with. Such dreams do carry the individual out away from ego identity, and at the same time closer to an inner identity that the ego usually attempts to deny.孩童之所以更常记得动物梦，只因为他们原先就比较接近细胞意识。这样的梦的确带着个体脱离自我认同，同时更靠近自我通常企图否认的一个内在本体。
Such dreams do not basically imply a return to a distant past, for to the cells all things are present.这样的梦基本上不一定包含回到遥远的过去在内，因为对细胞而言，万事万物都在当下。
(Long pause.) This reality is a basic part of your present existence, and simply represents a dimension of actuality that the ego cannot, by its nature, admit.(长时间停顿)这个实相是你当下的存在中一个基本的部分，而且只代表现实的一个维度而已，由于它的本质使然，自我无法承认这个实相。
Now, the future is also present in cellular consciousness. The ego, again, simply censors dreams from the cellular consciousness level when they deal with time that is not yet physical in your terms. Cellular consciousness is usually considered as simply a repository for past knowledge having to do with personal or racial existence. Because of the spacious present however, cellular consciousness also contains blueprints of the future.现在，未来也存在当下的细胞意识中。当梦与你们所谓尚未变成实质的时间打交道时，自我只不过，再一次，从细胞意识的层面审查它们而已。细胞意识通常被认为单纯只是一个存放处，储存着过去与个人或种族的存在有关的知识而已。然而，因为广阔的现在，所以细胞意识也包含未来的蓝图。
Once again, however, these are of course blueprints of probabilities. As you know, the past itself is constantly changed as your own attitude toward it changes. Therefore you see, even dealing with the past, cellular consciousness does not involve knowledge of a closed and finished time of existence. Obviously then, the future is also constantly changing. Cellular consciousness mirrors these changes, you see.再一次，不管怎样，这些当然是可能性的蓝图。如你所知，随着你自己对过去的态度改变，过去本身也一直持续不断改变。因此你看，甚至在它与过去打交道时，细胞意识都不会把已成定局和已经完成的一个存在时期所属的知识牵扯进来。所以显然未来也一直持续不断改变。细胞意识反映着这些改变，你知道。
The organism is the center of this happening, then, the core. The ego attempts to stand apart and observe, but in order to do so it narrows the available field of perception. Once it has formed its characteristics, it has already become too specialized to do more than observe certain limited fields of activity. It is of course itself observed by the inner ego, which has managed to maintain its position securely within subjective reality, where it has a wider though somewhat less intense viewpoint.有机体是这个事件的中心，所以也是核心。自我试图站到一旁观察，但为了这么做，它就得缩小可得的感知场域。一旦它形成它的特性，它就已经变得太过专门化，以至于除了观察某些有限的活动场域之外，它无计可施。自我本身当然也被内在自我观察着，后者设法在主观实相之内稳固地保住它的位置，它在那里的观点比较宽阔，但也稍微比较不热烈。
The inner ego sees and knows itself as a part of this action or happening, and sees the entire identity existing in various dimensions simultaneously. The outer ego attempts to cut action short, and so its viewpoint is limited by its own attempt. It perceives its birth and its death, but not beyond its birth or its death.内在自我看见也知道它自己是这个行动或事件的一部分，而且它看见整个本体同时存在于各个不同的维度之中。外在自我企图缩短行动，所以它的观点受到它自己的企图限制。它感知它的出生和它的死亡，却没有超越它的出生和它的死亡。
Cellular consciousness is a part of the consciousness of the inner ego or inner self. Very loosely speaking, cellular consciousness is to the inner self what the subconscious is to the outer ego. There are of course many differences however.细胞意识是内在自我或内我的一部分。从非常宽松的角度来说，细胞意识之于内我，正如同潜意识之于外在自我。不管怎样，当然有很多差异。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:39. Jane was pretty well dissociated, she said. Her eyes opened just once, briefly, during the delivery. She had a vague idea of what she had said. She resumed in the same manner at 9:50.)(9:39分休息。珍说她出离得相当顺利。在传述时，她的眼睛只睁开过一次，时间很短。她隐约知道自己说过什么。她在9:50分以同样的方式继续。)
Cellular consciousness is therefore expansive.细胞意识因此是扩张的。
The expansion is in all directions, so to speak. We have not quite completely explained the idea of traveling through intensities to you, simply because words are inadequate. The idea of traveling through intensities gives the result, in your system, of traveling through time, as I have told you.这个扩张，可以说，是在所有的方向。我们还没有很完整地解释行经强度的概念给你听，纯粹是因为语言不足以形容它。我告诉过你，在你们的系统中，行经强度的概念造成行经时间的结果。
You know that this is distortive. You recognize elements from the past, since your ego is familiar with them. You accept them into the organization of your perception on a conscious level, usually. The ego does not recognize elements of the future when they do appear within dreams, and it does not therefore admit them into perceptive patterns. The ego does not perceive their significance. It is only for this reason that certain events seem to be always in your future: this lack of recognition, identification, acceptance and organization into patterns that can be used and manipulated.你知道这是扭曲的。你认出来自过去的元素，因为你的自我熟悉它们。通常，你在意识上接受它们，并把它们纳入你的感知组织里。当未来的元素出现在梦中的时候，自我认不出它们，因此不承认它们，也不把它们纳入感知模式里。自我感知不到它们的重要性。就只是由于这个原因，所以某些事件似乎永远都在你的未来：无法承认、认同、接受和组织成可以利用和操纵的模式。
In your dreams, in other words, you are familiar with images like the mammals and reptiles, that would seem not to belong to the present. These however would seem to belong to the future rather than to the past, and these you forget almost instantly, as a rule. This does not mean that some individuals do not recall them.在你的梦中，换句话说，你熟悉哺乳动物和爬虫类之类的意象，好像它们不属于现在似的。然而，这些似乎属于未来而不是过去，而且通常，你几乎立刻就忘了这些意象。这并不是说，有些个体不记得它们。
Even if they are recalled as dreams however, they may appear meaningless, for they are unfamiliar to the ego. Yesterday’s events reenacted in a dream touch off familiarity. Tomorrow's events in tonight’s dreams do not, not at least to the ego. Generic codes apply in other words to the future as well as to the past, but mankind does not generally perceive them as such for they appear meaningless to the ego, because of the ego’s inherent nature and limitations.但是，即使它们被当成梦而记住了，它们看起来可能毫无意义，因为自我不熟悉它们。在一个梦中重演的昨日事件，勾起了熟悉的感觉。在今晚的梦中出现的明日事件却没有，至少对自我来说没有。换句话说，通则适用于未来也适用于过去，但人类一般感知到它们不是这样，因为在自我看来，它们是毫无意义的，这是由于自我天生的本质和限制所致。
Tonight’s material will take us even further into a study of reality. Read the session over well.今晚的资料将会带我们更加深入实相的研究之中。从头到尾仔细再看一遍这一节。
Do you have an envelope for me, Joseph?约瑟，你有没有信封要给我？
(“Yes.”(“有。”
(At 10:03, her eyes closed, Jane took the double sealed envelope from me for the 72nd envelope experiment. She held it to her forehead in a horizontal position, lightly, without attempting to determine its contents by obvious feel, etc. Early in these experiments Seth announced that he would give no data resulting from Janes sense of touch, and he has stuck to this procedure. Jane's eyes remained closed, her pace average.)(10:03分，珍闭着眼睛，从我手上拿走第71次信封实验的双层密封信封。她把横向的信封放在她的额头上，轻轻地，没有试着用明显的触感来确定它的内容物。在这些实验的初期，赛斯宣称他不会提供因为珍的触感而产生的任何资料，于是一直坚持这个程序。珍的眼睛还是闭着，速度不疾不徐。)
Give us a moment, please.请等我们一下。
(Pause.) These are impressions.(停顿)这些是印象。
A double, or something twice, or a negative. Something standing vertical.双份，或某个两倍的东西，或一张底片。某个直立的东西。
Twin again, or twice. A connection with Michigan. Four star, or something four-starred, as a prize.再一次，成对的，或是两倍。与密西根州(Michigan)有关联。四颗星，或某个四星级的东西，比如一个奖。
It seems some connection with cars or transportation. My fair lady—I do not know to what this refers."似乎与汽车或交通工具有某种关联。我的窈窕淑女—— 我不知道这是指什么。"
(Pause.) A string, as of lights, or pearls, in a string of succession, of items in succession.(停顿)一串像是灯或珍珠，连续的一串，连续的一串物件。
A corridor. A circular corridor or path. Not circular but curved.一条走廊。一圈圆形的走廊或走道。不是圆形而是弯曲。
