(Her eyes still closed, still holding the envelope to her forehead with her right hand, Jane made a large horizontal curving motion with her free left hand. The gesture was gently curving rather than circular.)(珍的眼睛依然闭着，还是用右手拿着信封放在额头上，同时用空着的左手做了一个很大的水平曲线动作。这个手势轻微弯曲，而不是圆形。)
The travel connection again. Now the feeling of trains, or a tunnel, as a train tunnel would be. This is an attempt to get at the curved corridor connection more clearly.再一次和旅行有关联。现在是火车或隧道的感觉，就像火车的隧道那样。这是试图更清楚表达弯曲走廊的关联。
A building, more like an office building than a residence. Something like the Star-Gazette building.一栋建筑物，比较像是一栋办公楼而不是住宅。类似《星报》(Star-Gazette)的建筑物。
(For Elmira's newspaper.)(埃尔迈拉报社大楼)
The number four.数字4。
(Pause.) Some connection with a February event. A scramble. Black and white colors. A photograph. Ruburt here thinks of the photographs taken in your studio, of him.(停顿)与一个2月的事件有某种关联。一团混乱。黑色和白色。一张照片。鲁柏在这里想的是他在你的工作室拍的照片。
The photograph connection is strong (pause) but I do not believe the item is this precisely.照片的连结很强(停顿)但我不相信物件就是这个。
(Pause.)(停顿)
There seems to be a dual impression of printed matter with a photograph.似乎有印刷品与一张照片的一个双重印象
(Jane now spelled the following out:) M-i-s-s-i-n-c or e-n-c. One thirty-five.(珍现在拼出以下的字)M-i-s-s-n-c或e-n-c。一35。
Two again, like a double exposure. It seems a definite connection with your studio. A bottom or middle drawer, next to something financial. And a small round object.又是2，像双重曝光那样。好像和你的工作室有明确的关联。底下或中间的抽屉，在某个财务相关的东西旁边。以及一个小的圆形物品。
Do you have questions?你有问题吗？
(“What’s that connection with a February event?")(“与一个2月的事件有什么关联？”)
I am not sure, though the number 17 seems connected to it, or 14, between the 14th and the 17th of February. And a connection with an older man here.我不确定，但是数字17或14似乎和它有关，介于2月14日和17日之间。这里也和一个老男人有关联。
(“Got any initials on the older man?” )(“有没有老男人的姓名缩写？”)
The letters M and J, though these are not necessarily connected with the man.字母M和J，但是这些不一定和男人有关。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 10:17. Jane said she was dissociated as usual during the delivery. Her eyes remained closed. She reported no images within at first, but memory of a few did return as we discussed Seth’s data.(10:17分休息。珍说她在传述期间一如往常出离。她的眼睛依然闭着。她说一开始内在没有画面，但是在我们讨论赛斯的资料时，有几个画面的记忆的确重现了。
(Jane now opened the double sealed envelopes and examined the object, as she always does at break. At first it had little meaning for her, and as is often the case she said the data obtained pertaining to it was incorrect. True, the data was not as specific as it has often been, but it did contain a number of valid points. Some of these were subjective on our part.(珍现在打开密封的双层信封，检视标的物，她在休息时向来都会这么做。起初它对珍意义不大，就像她经常说取得的标的物相关资料不正确一样。的确，资料不像它常有的那么具体，但它的确包含了一些有效的重点。其中一些是我们自己的主观看法。
(Seth helped us out with our interpretations after break, as sometimes happens. Whenever possible we prefer to make as many connections between the data and the envelope object as we can on our own. Our purpose in conducting these experiments in this manner is to see what Jane, or Seth, can pick up about a concealed object that bears some kind of Emotional charge related to us personally. To this end, envelope objects are often deliberately chosen by me with Emotional involvement in mind, since Seth has said many times that his abilities have an Emotional basis; this primary Emotional basis is then disciplined and given shape by the intellect.(赛斯在休息后帮助我们解读，他有时候会这么做。不管何时，只要有可能，我们比较想要尽可能自己找出资料与信封标的物之间的关联，越多越好。我们以这种方式进行这些实验的目的，是要看看珍或赛斯能够接收到一个密封物件的什么资料，因为这个物件带着某种与我们个人有关的情感电荷。为了这个目的，我经常刻意挑选心里投入情感的信封物件，因为赛斯说过很多次，他的能力有一个情感的基础；接着再由理智来训练和塑造这个首要的情感基础。
(However, Seth has done as well with objects quite separated from the personal Emotional life of Jane and mine. It doesn’t matter; either, whether Jane has ever seen the object before; or whether she saw it ten minutes before the session, or five years ago.(然而，对于距离珍和我的情感生活很远的标的物，赛斯也接收得一样好。不管珍之前有没有见过标的物，也不管她是在课前10分钟或5年前见到它，都没有影响。
(Seth will occasionally comment about the lack of Emotional impetus surrounding an object if I pick one that happens to bear little charge. I cannot be sure that I am choosing an object that carries little charge, however, for Seth’s data will often shoot off at an angle entirely unexpected by me. This data can be related to the envelope object in a variety of quite valid ways. I make no conscious effort to dwell on the object chosen for an envelope experiment, and when I do choose an object it is usually a spur-of the-moment decision.(如果我挑中一个刚好带着很少电荷的标的物，赛斯偶尔会评论围绕标的物的情感动力不足。但是，我没办法确定我正在挑选一个带着很少电荷的标的物，因为赛斯的资料经常朝着完全出乎我预期的角度开展。这个资料可能有相当有效的各个方面与信封标的物有关联。我并没有费力在意识上老是关注信封实验挑选的标的物，而且当我确实挑中一个标的物时，它通常都是临时起意的决定。
(See the tracing of tonight’s envelope object on page 71 and the notes on the next page. The empty envelope used as object was mailed to me last May 26,1966, by an old friend, Wendell Crowley, and contained a letter detailing a reunion of a group of friends, all artists, that Wendell and I worked with in 1941-43. The letter was not in the envelope but was kept separate by me for reference after the session. As I suspected, some of Seth's data referred to the contents of the letter rather than the envelope object itself.(见前面今晚的信封标的物描摹图以及注释。用作标的物的空信封是一位老朋友，温德尔克·罗利[Wendell Crowley]在1966年5月26日寄来给我的，里头装着一封信详述一群朋友重聚的细节，他们全都是画家，我在1941至1943年间与他们一起共事过。信没有放在信封里，但是我把它分开收好，以备课后参考。如我所料，赛斯的一些资料指出信的内容，而不是信封标的物本身。
(Jane and I last saw Wendell Crowley perhaps seven years ago, but we keep up a correspondence on about a twice-a-year basis. We have not seen Wendell since moving here to Elmira, NY, six years ago. When Jane first read the Crowley-Taylor logo on tonight’s object it meant nothing to her, until I mentioned the name Wendell. Neither of us have met Wendell’s business partner, Mr. Taylor, or know anything about him—not even if he is still living.(珍和我也许是在7年前最后一次见到温德尔，但我们一直维持每年通信两次。自从6年前搬到纽约州埃尔迈拉这里之后，我们就没再见过温德尔。当珍第一次在今晚的标的物上面看到克罗利-泰勒[Crowley-Taylor]商标时，它对她没有任何意义，直到我提起温德尔的名字。我们两人都没见过温德尔的合伙人泰勒先生，也不知道他的任何事情——甚至连他是否还活着都不知道。
(Wendell’s letter of May 26 is two typewritten pages long, and at the moment we do not plan to include a copy of it with these notes. If necessary we will do so; in the meantime the letter remains on file with other envelope-related material. Other background material may be necessary to fill in the relationship between Wendell, myself and our friends discussed in the letter, and this will be included in our interpretations of the envelope experiment data. Some geography is involved also.(温德尔5月26日的来信有两页纸长，目前我们还不打算把它的副本加在这些注释上。如有必要，我们将这样做；与此同时，这封信及其他与此有关的资料会一起保存在档案中。其他背景资料可能是必要的，以补充温德尔在信中讨论的我们之间的友谊，这将包括在我们对信封实验资料的解释中。还涉及到一些地理因素。
(There follows the interpretations Jane and I made, at break, of Seth’s envelope data. It is noted where Seth agrees with us, after break. As stated, Seth's comments regarding the data after break definitely help.(接下来是珍和我在休息时对赛斯的信封资料所做的解读。在休息过后，赛斯同意我们的地方都加了注记。如上所述，赛斯在休息后对资料的看法肯定有帮助。
(“A double, or something twice, or a negative. ’’ Relatively little of the data refers to the envelope object itself， Instead the empty envelope from Wendell serves as a springboard. This data is a case in point. After break Seth agrees with Jane and me when we assign the double or twice mentioned here to the frequent use of the numeral 2 on the second page of Wendell’s letter.(“双份，或某个两倍的东西，或一张底片。”这个资料有相对很少的比例是指信封标的物本身。反之，温德尔的空信封却具有跳板的作用。这个资料就是最好的一个例子。休息之后，珍和我把这里提到的双份或两倍归于温德尔信中第二页多次用到的数字2。
(Wendell uses the numeral 2 to indicate the second page of his typed letter. He mentions the 20th anniversary of a friend’s wedding. He discusses the fact that although he is recovered from a heart attack of last year, he cannot lift over 20 pounds, and must take a 2. mile walk each day. The numeral 2 appears once on the first page of the letter.(温德尔用数字2代表他这封打字信的第二页。他提到一个朋友的结婚20周年纪念日。他讨论一个事实，就是他去年心脏病发作，虽然他已经复原，但是不能拿超过20磅的重物，而且每天必须步行两英里。数字2在信的第一页出现一次。
(The negative mention in the data is interesting, and has several connections, both here and in the rest of Seth's data. Jane and I did not think of negative in connection with the word no, for instance, but in relation to pictures or visual images. On page two of his letter Wendell tells about a friend who works for the Neilson TV survey people—having to do with pictures, but also, negative, meaning pictures, is called to mind because Wendell's letter deals with a group of artists who worked together in a studio, drawing comic strips, in 1941-3 In addition I personally have a studio here in the apartment, and the envelope used as object was kept in this studio. These references about studios, pictures, and the object crop up again later in the data also.(资料中提到的底片很有意思，而且这里以及赛斯其余的资料里有几个关联。珍和我认为底片和比方说“不”这个字没有关系[译注：底片的英文negative也有否定、否决之意]，而是和影片或视觉影像有关联。在信的第二页，温德尔说到一个朋友在帮尼尔森电视收视率调查的人做事——与影片/图像有关。但是也有照片之意的negative之所以被想起，是因为温德尔的信说到一群画家，他们于1941至43年间一起在一间工作室工作，画连环漫画。此外，我在公寓这里也有一间工作室，用作标的物的信封就放在这间工作室。这些指涉工作室、影片/图像和标的物的重点后来在资料中又再次出现。
(“Something standing vertical, Jane said this referred to trees. Note that Wendell Crowley, who mailed us the object, is partner in a lumber company. Also, the object was mailed to us from Ridgewood, NJ, as shown by the postmark. After break Seth says this interpretation is correct.(“某个直立的东西。”珍说这指的是树。注意，寄了标的物给我们的温德尔是一家木材公司的合伙人。而且标的物是从纽约州的Ridgewood[瑞吉伍德]寄来给我们的，如邮戳所示。休息之后，赛斯说这个解读是正确的。
(“Twin again, or twice.” A repeat of the double data interpreted above.(“再一次，成对的，或是两倍。”重复了上文解读过的双份资料。
(“A connection with Michigan.” We were able to make no connections here, but Seth does after break.(“与密西根州有关联。”我们在这里找不到连结，但是休息过后，赛斯找到了。
(“Four star, or something four-starred, as a prize.” No connections. Possibly this is related to the My fair Lady data given a little biter.(“4颗星，或某个四星级的东西，比如一个奖。”找不到连结。这可能和稍后给出的我的窈窕淑女资料有关。
(“It seems some connection with cars or transportation. ”As stated, the object contained a letter describing the reunion of perhaps half a dozen artists who worked together in the early 1940's. The reunion was attended by the writer of the letter. All of the reunion participants live in the New York City and New Jersey area just across the Hudson River. In his letter Wendell does not name the town or city in which the reunion, at a restaurant, took place but from following data Jane and I surmise it took place in New York City.(“似乎与汽车或交通工具有某种关联。”如上所述，标的物包含一封信，信上描述了大约6个在1940年代早期曾经一起工作的画家重聚。写信的人参加了这次聚会。聚会的参加者全部都住在哈德逊河[Hudson River]对岸的纽约市和纽泽西[New Jersey]地区。在他的信中，温德尔没有指出聚会是在哪个城镇的一家餐馆举办，但从以下的资料，珍和我推测是在纽约市办。
(In any event travel by various modes from a cluster of surrounding towns in that area would have been necessary for the artists attending the reunion.(无论如何，画家们要去参加这场聚合，就得从那个区域群聚的城镇以各种方式旅行。
(There is another possible travel connection here, depending upon interpretation. The envelope object is postmarked Ridgewood, NJ, which lies on the outer run of the commuter towns attendant to New York City. The letter the object contained, however, was written by Wendell at his home in Edgewater, NJ, which is just across the Hudson from New York City’. The two towns are at least 25 miles apart—a trip Wendell makes daily.(这里有另一个可能涉及旅行的关联，就看如何解读了。信封标的物的邮戳是纽约州的瑞吉伍德，位于伴随纽约市周遭的通勤城镇外围。不过，标的物包含的信件是温德尔在他位于纽约州艾吉华特[Edgewater]家中写的，正好隔着哈德逊河，在纽约市的对面。这两个城镇距离至少25英里——温德尔每天都要来回一次。
(“My fair lady—I do not know to what this refers”. In his letter Wendell makes no reference to this in any way. Seth begins to clear this up after break but an interruption interferes.(“我的窈窕淑女——我不知道这是指什么。”在他的信中，温德尔在任何情况下都没有提到这个。在休息之后，赛斯开始理清这一点，但被一个干扰打断了。
(“A string, as of lights, or pearls, in a string of succession, of items in succession.” We interpreted this as a possible reference to street lights at first, or a theater marquee, since the reunion was held at night, and nighttime travel would involve lights, etc. But “items in succession” could just as well refer to words in succession—i.e., the letter that had been enclosed in the envelope object or the printing and typing on the object itself.(“一串像是灯或珍珠，连续的一串，连续的一串物件。”一开始我们解读这可能是指街灯，或戏院的遮篷，因为聚会在晚上举行，所以夜间旅行就会涉及到灯光等等。但是“连续的一串物件”也很可能是指连续的一串字句——例如装在信封标的物的信，或是标的物本身的印刷字或打字。
(“A corridor. A circular corridor or path. Not circular but curved.” [Gesture.] This would seem to be part of the following data, as Seth/Jane tries to become more explicit.(“一条走廊。一圈圆形的走廊或走道。不是圆形而是弯曲。”[手势]这似乎是以下资料的一部分，因为赛斯/珍试着要让它更清楚。
(“The travel connection again. Now the feeling of trains, or a tunnel, as a train tunnel would be. This is an attempt to get at the curved corridor connection more clearly.” This is difficult to interpret without place names, and I did not think to ask Seth for any at the time. In any traveling Wendell might have done from his home in Edgewater, NJ, to New York City, trains and cars could very well have been involved.(“再一次和旅行有关联。现在是火车或隧道的感觉，就像火车的隧道那样。这是试图更清楚表达弯曲走廊的关联。”没有地点的名称，这很难解读，我当时没有想到问赛斯。在任何旅行当中，温德尔可能是从他在艾吉华特的家中出发到纽约市，很可能用到火车和汽车。
(Tunnels would also be involved going to New York City, but not as far as I know in travel on only the New Jersey side of the Hudson. I lived in that area for a few years, some time ago, and recall no tunnels at the moment.(去纽约市也会经过隧道，但就我所知，只在哈德逊河的纽泽西这一岸旅行，就不会经过隧道。我在那个地区住了几年，此刻想不起有任何隧道。
(Jane had a mental image within while giving this data, but could not put it into words beyond saying she saw something curved, like a tunnel. Driving into New York City by tunnel from New Jersey, I remember a long curving tunnel lit by strings of lights. I cannot now say whether this refers to the Holland or Lincoln Tunnel. Wendell’s home in Edgewater is north of both tunnels. If he drove to New York City by private car, he would presumably head south and take the first tunnel he met—the Lincoln.(珍在给出这个资料时，内在有一个心象，但无法用言语形容，只说她看到某个弯曲、像隧道的东西。从纽泽西开车经过隧道进入纽约市，我记得是一条弯曲的长隧道，有一串串的灯照明。我现在没办法说这是指荷兰[Holland]隧道还是林肯[Lincoln]隧道。温德尔位于艾吉华特的家在两个隧道的北边。如果开着私家车去纽约市，他大概会往南，走他最先遇到的隧道——林肯隧道。
(“A building, more like an office building than a residence. Something like the Star-Gazette building.” Was the restaurant in which the reunion was held located on the ground floor of a building like the Star-Gazette building here in Elmira? A large brick two-story building typical of many we remember in the metropolitan New Jersey-New York City area. This is only speculation on our part. Later note REB: Newspaper comics.(“一栋建筑物，比较像是一栋办公大楼而不是住宅。类似《星报》的建筑物。”举办聚会的餐厅位于一栋像埃尔迈拉这里的《星报》大楼那样的建筑物一楼吗？一栋大型砖造两层楼的建筑物，我们记得这样的建筑物在纽泽西——纽约市地区很多。这只是我们的猜测。罗后来加的注——报纸连环漫画。
(“The number four.” We seldom can make positive connections with single numbers. The number 4 appears three times on the empty envelope object. See the tracing on page 71.(“数字4。”我们很少能够找到单一数字的明确关联。数字4在空的信封标的物上3次，见描摹图。
(“Some connection with a February event.” Wendell’s letter of May 26 was in answer to a letter I wrote him last February. I do not have a copy of my letter, but am sure it was written in February because Wendell discusses my references to snow and poor weather. Our weather last winter was quite peculiar—we had no snow at all until the massive three-day storm of February 1, one of the worst in local history. Seth has more to say about February in answer to my first question.(“与一个2月的事件有某种关联。”温德尔5月26日的信是回应我在2月写给他的信。我没有自己那封信的影本，但我确定是在2月写的，因为温德尔讨论我提到的雪和恶劣天气。我们在去年冬天的天气很奇特——我们这里一直没有下雪，直到2月1日才连刮了3天的暴风雪，是本地有史以来最严重的一次。赛斯在回答我的第一个问题时，对于2月有更多要说的事。
(“A scramble.” No connections we can be sure of.(“一团混乱。”没有任何我们能够确定的关联。
(“Black and white colors.” The envelope object is white, with both the printing and typing on it in black ink. Wendell’s letter is also black and white, though his signature is in blue ink.(“黑色和白色。”信封标的物是白色的，上面的印刷字和打字都用黑色的墨水。温德尔的信也是黑白的，但是他的签名用蓝色墨水。
(“A photograph. Ruburt here thinks of the photographs taken in your studio, of him.” The picture data begins to emerge again. Seth here mentions some test photos I took of Jane in my studio here last week. Studio is the link here with Wendell’s letter, and hence the envelope object. In his letter Wendell specifically mentions the studio we artists shared back in 1941-3.(“一张照片。鲁柏在这里想的是他在你的工作室拍的照片。”照片资料又开始出现。赛斯这里提到一些我上周在工作室为珍拍的一些测试照片。工作室在这里和温德尔的信有连结，因此也和信封标的物产生关联。在他的信上，温德尔明确提到我们几个画家在1941至43年间共用的那间工作室。
(“The photograph connection is strong [pause] but I do not believe the item is this precisely. ’’ [Pause.] Seth tried to help Jane discriminate here, as he often does. Tonight’s object of course is not a picture or photo, but an envelope that contained a letter about people who make pictures. Also, I was taking pictures of Jane last week, as explained. Thus it can be seen how all such related data, even though separated by much time, comes together in these session experiments. This particular chain of association was not anticipated by me when I picked the Crowley envelope as object for tonight. The two studio settings—the studio I worked in with Wendell Crowley in 1941-3, and my present studio, are separated by as much as 23 years.(“照片的连结很强[停顿]但我不相信物件就是这个。”[停顿]这里赛斯试着帮助珍辨别，他经常如此。今晚的标的物当然不是一幅图像或照片，而是一个包含一封信的信封，信和制作图像的人有关。还有之前解释过的，我上周帮珍拍照。因此可以看出这样相关的资料，尽管分隔多时，是如何在这些课间实验里全部兜在一起的。当我挑中温德尔的信封作为今晚的标的物时，这一条联想思绪并不在我的预料之内。两个工作室的背景——我与温德尔在1941至43年间共事的工作室以及我现在的工作室，两者相隔23年之久。
(Let it be noted there is a bridge of sorts here however, in that for most of this intervening time I have had a studio of my own. Jane and I married in 1954, and so she has been strongly aware of studio connections with me, on a steady basis, since then, and has often heard me talk about earlier studios.(但是，请注意这里有某种桥梁，因为在这段间隔时间当中，我大部分时候都有自己的工作室。珍和我在1954年结婚，所以从那时起，稳定不变地，她一直强烈觉察到工作室与我的连结，也经常听我说起以前的工作室。
(“There seems to be a dual impression of printed matter with a photograph.” Seth comes even closer with this data. He deals with the photo-picture-artist impressions on the one hand, and the actual envelope object, containing both printing and typing, on the other. We regard this as good data. Tonights empty object also contained Wendell’s typed letter. In the past Seth, or Jane, has used lettering, typing, writing and printing interchangeably. Thus it is possible that tonight “printing" could refer to both the printing and typing on Wendell’s envelope, and to the letter it had contained.(“似乎有印刷品与一张照片的一个双重印象。”赛斯的这个资料甚至更贴近了。他一方面处理照片——图像——画家的印象，另一方面处理实际的信封标的物，上面有印刷字也有打字。我们认为这个资料很好。今晚的空物件也包含温德尔的信。过去，赛斯或珍交替使用美术字、打字、手写字和印刷字。因此今晚“印刷字”可能是指温德尔信封上的印刷字和打字，以及包含在里面的信。
(Jane spells out: M-i-s-s-i-n-c or e-n-c. At break Jane said this data was actually two impressions, Miss and Inc or Enc. But we still couldn't make connections. According to the object, for instance, the Crowley-Taylor Lumber Company is not incorporated.(珍拼出：M-i-s-s-n-c或e-n-c。在休息时，珍说这个资料其实是两个印象，Miss[小姐]以及Inc[股份有限公司]或Enc[附件]。但我们还是找不到连结。根据标的物，比方说，克罗利-泰勒木材公司并不是一家股份有限公司。
(“One thirty-five.” My hunch was that this referred either to the end of the reunion discussed in Wendell's letter—at 1:35 AM, or the time Wendell himself left the party. Inspection of his letter showed that Wendell states “I left at about 12:30 AM,” but that other member of the party remained after he left. Seth is more specific after break.(“一35。”我的直觉是这要不是指温德尔信中讨论的聚会结束时间——凌晨1:35分，就是指温德尔自己离开派对的时间。检阅他的信，可见温德尔说“我大约凌晨12:30分离开”，但派对上的其他人在他走后继续留下来。赛斯在休息过后说得更明确。
(“Two again, like a double exposure.” See the ”twice” and ”negative" data on page 77, and the listing of Wendell’s use of the numeral 2 on the second page of his letter. Double exposure, above, also has picture and artist connotations.(“又是2，像双重曝光那样。”见前面的“两倍”和“底片”资料，以及温德尔在他信上第二页使用数字2的方式。上述的双重曝光也有图像和画家的言外之意。
(“It seems a definite connection with your studio.” Beside the connotations mentioned just above, the envelope used as object was kept in the studio, at the back of our apartment, for five months, or from its receipt in late May until now, October 3,1966.(“好像和你的工作室有明确的关联。”除了上文提到的言外之意，用作标的物的信封放在我们公寓后方的工作室，从5月底收到至今天，1966年10月3日为止，长达5个月。
(“A bottom or middle drawer, next to something financial. ’’ The object was not kept in a drawer of my desk in the studio, but lay beneath a pile of papers on a shelf of the desk, perhaps a foot above the desk drawer which contains our financial records.(“底下或中间的抽屉，在某个财务相关的东西旁边。”标的物不是放在工作室的书桌抽屉里，而是摆在书桌上一个书架的一堆纸张下面，书架高出书桌抽屉大约一英尺，存放我们的财务资料。
(“And a small round object.” On top of the stack of papers that had accumulated on the desk shelf, and which contained Wendell Crowleys envelope and letter, I had placed a plastic tape dispenser as a makeshift paperweight. This dispenser is composed of round and curving lines, has a circular hole through it perhaps an inch and a half in diameter, a larger round design in red printed about this hole, and of course contains a round roll of Scotch tape perhaps two inches in diameter.(“以及一个小的圆形物品。”在书桌架子堆积的一叠纸张里有温德尔的信封和信纸，而在这堆纸的上方，我放了一个塑胶制的胶台，权充纸镇。这个胶台是由圆形和弧形的线条组成，一个圆形的洞穿过它，直径大约一英寸半，在这个洞的四周有一个更大的红色印刷图案，当然还有一圈胶带，直径可能是两英寸。
(Had Seth stated something about a round design or print, rather than object, we could have considered the circular postmark on the object itself.(如果赛斯是说某个圆形图案或印刷花样，而不是物件，我们可能就会考虑标的物本身的图形邮戳。
(First Question: What’s that connection with a February event? “I am not sure, though the number 17 seems connected to it, or 14, between the 14th and the 17th of February.” As explained, the object for tonight contained a letter written by Wendell Crowley in answer to my letter of last February. My letter could well have been written between February 14 and 17.(第一个问题：与一个2月的事件有什么关联？“我不确定，但是数字17或14似乎和它有关，介于2月14日和17日之间。”之前解释过，今晚的标的物包含一封温德尔·克罗利写的信，回应我2月写给他的信。我的信很可能写于2月14日到17日之间。
(“And a connection with an older man here.” Jane and I felt reasonably sure here that this referred to the boss of the studio at which both Wendell and I worked in 1941-3His name is Jack Binder, and he is in his 60s now—perhaps twenty years older than the crew of artists he had working for him. Seth agreed with our interpretations after break.(“这里也和一个老男人有关联。”珍和我这里相当合理地确定，这是指工作室的老板，温德尔与我在1941至43年间在那间工作室共事过。他的名字是杰克·班德[Jack Binder]，他现在60多岁——也许比他雇用的画家团队大20岁。在休息过后，赛斯同意我们的解读。
(Jack did not attend the reunion, though of course he is mentioned in Wendell’s letter of May 26. A strong connection is that Jack’s younger brother, Otto, did attend the reunion, and is also mentioned in the letter to some extent.(杰克没有出席聚会，但是在温德尔5月26日的信中当然有提到他。一个强烈的连结是，杰克的弟弟奥图[Otto]确实参加聚会，而且信上也某种程度提到了她。
(2nd Question: Got any initials on the older man?” The letters M and J, though these are not necessarily connected with the man. ’’ The J here could apply to Jack. Seth began to comment on the M after break, but unfortunately was interrupted, as will be shown.(第二个问题：有没有老男人的姓名缩写？“字母M和J，但是这些不一定和男人有关。”这里的J可能适用于杰克。赛斯在休息之后开始评论M，但可惜被打断了，稍后会看到。
(Seth called for break after the second question, taking me by surprise. Usually I can ask more questions, and attempt them without being leading about it. I owe Wendell a letter, and may ask him to clear up some of the points mentioned in the data, and by Seth after break. It is however difficult to explain briefly in a letter just why such questions are necessary, and so Jane and I usually forego trying. But any additional information obtained will be attached to this session at a later date.(赛斯在第二个问题之后喊了休息，让我很惊讶。通常我可以多问几个问题的，而且在试着提问时不会被牵着鼻子走。我应该写信给温德尔，可以请他理清资料中提到的一些重点，而赛斯在休息过后也这么做。不过，在一封信里简短解释这样的问题为什么有必要，并不容易，所以珍和我通常放弃尝试。但是任何额外取得的讯息改天会附加在这一节。
(See the 286th session for Seth's discussion of these envelope experiments—why and how he presents the data, etc.(见第286节，赛斯讨论了这些信封实验——他为什么以及怎么呈现资料等等。
(Jane resumed at 10:47.)(珍在10:47分继续。)
We will shortly end the session.我们不久就会结束这一节。
The i-n-c was a distortion or misrepresentation of ink, i-n-k, for inking comic strips.I-n-c是墨水[ink]的扭曲或错误解读，i-n-k，连环漫画用的墨水。
(This is a good description of my main job in Jack Binder 's studio in 1941-3 I do not recall now whether I had ever described it to Jane in this manner, but may have.)(对于1941至43年间我在杰克·班德的工作室主要的工作，这是一个很好的描述。现在我想不起来我有没有用这种方式向珍描述过它，但可能有。)
Your friend left nearly an hour alter he imagines, hence the time.你的朋友比他想像的时间晚了将近一个小时才离开。
(See the one thirty-five data on page 80.)(见前面的相关资料。)
The interpretations that you have made are correct.你的解读是正确的。
(“What’s the Michigan data?”(“密西根州的资料是什么？”)
(See page 78.) Too disconnected, I am afraid. Your friend wrote a letter to a man in Michigan, immediately before or after writing this letter. This was the M also—a name something like Murray. No, more like Musach—很遗憾，连线断得太厉害了。你的朋友写了一封信给一个在密西根州的男人，时间就在他写这封信之前或之后。这也就是那个M——像Muray(墨瑞)之类的名字。不是，比较像是Musach(慕沙奇)——
(We of course have no idea whether Wendell wrote someone in Michigan just before or after writing us on May 26,1966, nor do we know anything about the names given above. These will be points to ask him about if I decide to explain the envelope material to him.(我们当然完全不知道温德尔在1966年5月26日写信给我们之前或之后有没有写信给密西根州的某个人，对上面给出的这些名字也是一无所知。这些就是要问他的重点，如果我决定向他解释信封资料的话。
(Jane was interrupted here, unfortunately. One of our cats jumped up on her lap as she sat in trance. She did not leave trance, but her delivery was disrupted. Her eyes remained closed. I left my chair to put the cat in another room.)(遗憾的是，珍在这里打被断了。她在出神中坐着，我们的一只猫跳上她的大腿。她没有脱离出神状态，但是她的传述中断了。她的眼睛仍然闭着。我离开椅子，把猫放进另一个房间。)
Also, unfortunately, the ”My fair lady” connection... The lights, a tunnel... He intended to travel by car. Did so, part way through the tunnel, but then he parked the car and went by subway.还有，不幸的是，“我的窈窕淑女”这个关联……灯光、一条隧道……他打算开车上路。的确这么做了，但是过了隧道一半时，他停下车，改搭地铁。
(This passage may be somewhat distorted. I do not know that it is possible to travel part way through a tunnel, then park. Seth/Jane may have meant that Wendell drove to New York City via one of the tunnels, then parked at the tunnel exit, which is possible, and took a subway to the restaurant, rather than one in New Jersey. Another point to check out with Wendell.)(这一段可能有点扭曲。我不知道过了一半隧道时可以停车。赛斯/珍的意思可能是说温德尔开车经过其中一个隧道去纽约市，然后在隧道出口停下车，这是可能的，再搭地铁去餐厅，而不是纽泽西那个隧道。这是要跟温德尔核对的另一个重点。)
The studio connection was legitimate, but Ruburt associated it with you primarily when two studios were involved. These are the main points.工作室的关联是合理的，但是在涉及两间工作室的时候，鲁柏首先把它跟你联想在一起。这些是主要的重点。
(Two studios, meaning the studio of 1941-3 and my present one.(两间工作室，意指1941至43年间的工作室，以及我现在的工作室。
(“Do the two studios account for the twin data?” See page 78.)(“双倍的资料是不是和两间工作室有关？”)
This, and also the frequent 2 mentioned on the same page.这个，还有前一页我多次提到的2。
(“How successful was Jane's projection attempt, that we made the drawings for?”(“珍的投射尝试有多成功？我们为此作了一些画。”
(Referring to Jane's projection attempt to reach Dr. Bernard on September 29. She wrote him describing the experiment shortly afterward, and enclosed drawings of some things she picked up.)(指的是珍为了联系伯纳德医师在9月29日尝试投射。事后不久，她写信给他，描述了这个实验，并附上一些画，描绘她接收到的一些东西。)
It was fairly successful.相当成功。
(“Is there anything there the doctor can recognize?")(“其中有没有这个医师认得的东西？”)
There may be, though I believe at the college rather than at home. There could be some question here however, in the entryway data. My heartiest wishes to you both, and good evening.可能有，但我相信是在大学里而不是在家里。不过，这里的入口资料可能有些问题。我衷心祝福你们两位，还有晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:55. Jane was out as usual.)(10:55分结束。珍一如往常出去了。)

SESSION 291 第291节 通用意象


OCTOBER 5, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年10月5日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane had no idea of what Seth would discuss during the session. She began speaking in trance while sitting down, in an average voice and with many pauses. Her eyes opened often and were very dark.)(珍对赛斯在课间会讨论什么一点概念都没有。她坐下来，同时开始在出神中讲话，声音不高不低，多次停顿。她的眼睛经常张开，而且颜色很深。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Returning to our last discussion, I want to make it clear that these generic images, activated during certain levels of consciousness, are then interwound into dream drama.回到我们最后的讨论，我想要讲清楚，这些通用意象，在某些意识层面之中被激发之后，就和梦戏剧交织在一起。
They are not pure, as they appear within the dream, therefore. They will be charged with Emotional energy according to the individual's own experience, but they will form the base from which such a dream at that particular level is formed. (Long pause.) Take for example the generic image of a bull. It will in this case be seen as the dream's basic form, but it will be used in the dream drama according to the makeup of the dreamer.因此，它们不像它们在梦中看起来那样单纯。它们会根据个体自己的经验而被注入情感能量，但是它们会形成这样一个梦在那个特定层面据以成形的基础。(长时间停顿)以一头公牛这个通用意象为例，它在这个情况下被看成是梦的基本形式，但它在梦戏剧中却是按照做梦者的构造来使用。
Now. Some females will identify in the dream with the bull. In dreams many females will have what you would call male reactions. Some males in dreams will have what you would call female reactions. The bull could come also to represent a person the dreamer considers bullheaded. A bullfighting dream might be formed. The variations are endless. Some generic images will have strong personal significance because of past life experiences. The generic image does not only color the dream state, however. These images are the first basis from which thought evolved. This would almost amount to a cellular thinking process, but it is actually a gestalt of relatedness in which cellular comprehension was, and is, passed throughout the physical organism.现在。有些女性会在梦中认同公牛(bull)。在梦中，很多女性有你们会称为男性反应的表现。有些男性在梦中有你们会称为女性反应的表现。公牛也可能代表做梦者认为是牛脾气(bullheaded)的人。一个斗牛的梦可能就会形成。变化是无止境的。因为前世的经验，有些通用意象具有强烈的个人意义。然而，通用意象不只渲染了梦状态。这些意象是思想据以进化的第一个基础。这几乎等同于细胞的思考过程，但它实际上是一个相互关系的完形(gestali of relatedness)，细胞的理解在过去和现在都发生于此，并且传遍物质有机体。
This process continues beneath conscious and even subconscious awareness. It is not dependent upon the ego, but predates it. These are the first and the last images. The individual cells are the first animals possessing innate awareness of their environment with rudimentary sensemechanisms, to your way of thinking.这个过程在有意识以及甚至潜意识的觉知之下持续进行。它不依赖自我，而是比它更早。这些是最初也是最后的意象。按照你们的想法，个别的细胞就是最早的动物，拥有天生对其所在环境的觉知，具有原始的感觉机制。
Actually, through the generic system each cell possesses capsule comprehension , (pause) that is a certain kind of visualizing, and an Emotional charge. Before cellular specialization occurred each cell could combine with another indiscriminately. What are now your five senses were once sensemechanisms or possibilities, existing through the entire surface of any individual cell.其实，透过这个通用系统，每一个细胞都拥有胶囊理解，(停顿)也就是某一种视觉化，以及一种情感电荷。在细胞专门化发生之前，每一个细胞都能够与另一个细胞任意结合。你们现在的五种感官曾经是感觉机制或可能性，存在任何个别细胞的整个表层。
These still exist, but latent. Your knee can see, every portion of the body responds to light. The specialized development of animal life led to and brought about specialization of function. The brain’s necessary focus required more specific, less diffused and more concentrated methods of perception.这些仍然存在，但潜伏着。你的膝盖是看得见的，身体的每个部位都会回应光线。动物生命的专门化发展导向也导致功能的专门化。大脑不可或缺的焦点需要有更加明确、更不扩散也更为集中的感知方法。
The other, older perceptive mechanisms still linger on however. The ego does not and cannot make use of them. Indeed the ego is almost entirely formed by the physical senses method of perception. Other layers of the self biologically respond to the older, more generalized but less limited perceptive mechanisms.然而，另一种比较古老的感知机制依然存留。自我没有也无法利用它们。事实上，自我几乎完全是由肉体感官的感知方法所形成的。自己的其他层面在生理上回应着比较古老、比较广泛但也比较没有限制的感知机制。
The organism, physically speaking, can hardly exist without them.就肉体而言，有机体没有它们几乎无法存在。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace was very slow. She resumed at a faster rate, her eyes again opening often, at 9:37)(9:25分休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度非常缓慢。9:37分，她以比较快的速度继续，双眼再度经常张开。)
These generic images are not, however, simple.然而，这些通用意象并不简单。
They are composites, built up by the cells, and held in a suspended memory. They color much of your subjective life. Now, my dear friend Joseph, it is partially because of this that some paintings, you see. generate strong Emotional response, and outlast the artist.它们是由细胞合成、积累而成的，保存在一个悬浮的记忆中。它们渲染了你大部分的主观生活。现在，我亲爱的朋友约瑟，有些画作，你看，之所以引起强烈的情感反应，而且比画家还要经得起时间考验，有一部分原因就是这个。
These generic images have been captured and built upon. These images also color physical perception. We are speaking now entirely of your own system. The basic assumptions of which I spoke are thought processes of a subconscious variety, based upon these generic images.这些通用意象一直被捕捉和积累。这些意象也渲染了肉体感知。我们现在完全是在讲你们自己的系统。我说过的基本假设就是在潜意识里具有多样性的思考过程，这些通用意象是他们的基础。
Inhabitants of other systems have their own generic image patterns. Even within your own system these genetic images vary. The predominating image for an individual is that of his own species, but die ancestral patterns are strongly supportive. You are not only male or female as you know, but both, with one temporarily predominating. Almost (underlined) without exception, there are male and female lives either in your past or future. Dreams at the deepest level will not respond necessarily then to your present sex identity.其他系统的居民有他们自己的通用意象模式。甚至在你们的系统之内，这些通用意象都是多样化的。一个个体的支配意象就是他自身种族的支配意象，但是祖先的模式是强大的支持。你不只是你所知的男性或女性，而是两者皆是，只不过暂时有一个支配的性别而已。几乎(划线)没有例外，有男性和女性不是活在你的过去就是活在你的现在。所以，在最深的层面，梦不一定会回应你现在的性别身分。
(Jane took a long pause, sitting quite still with her hands raised to her face.)(珍停顿良久，几乎一动也不动地坐着，双手举到她的面前。)
I am giving you a brief session since you have both been so busy. If you have any questions however I will be glad to answer them. Otherwise you may have a rest for a change.我给你一节短课，因为你们两人太忙了。不过，如果你有任何问题，我很乐意回答。要不然你可以改变一下，就休息吧。
(“Well, I feel all right if you want to continue for a while.”)(“嗯，如果你想要继续一会儿，我觉得可以。”)
Then we shall.那我们就继续。
(Pause.)(停顿)
These generic images are coded, as I have said. They are electromagnetic realities and part of your identity. As such they will still be yours when physical existence is finished. They are your memory banks in a most profound sense.我说过，这些通用意象是经过编码的。它们是电磁实相，也是你本体的一部分。因此，当肉体存在结束时，它们本身偏角还是你的。就最深远的意义而言，它们是你的记忆库。
In time, you see, the(smile) various ego memories will become part of these. As such, incidentally, they can also be activated.在时间当中，你知道，(微笑)各个不同自我的记忆将会变成这些的一部分。因此，顺便一提，它们也可能被启动。
(Long pause.) The ego is not snuffed out, however. Now in some cases it continues to operate, though in a slightly different fashion, at its own levels, closely connected to but apart from, physical existence. I am speaking now of survival situations.(长时间停顿)然而，自我并没有被消灭。现在，在一些案例中，它持续运作，但方式有一点不同，在它自己的层面，与肉身存在密切连结但又分开。我现在所说的是死后犹存的情形。
This incidentally is the least acceptable survival pattern. The ego may be strong enough to insist upon its old prerogatives of control, yet too inflexible to adjust to the new conditions. It may accept the challenge of great change on the other hand, and allow a reorganization of psychological processes, in which case identity is not only saved but renewed. The ego is then in command after some struggle of generic frameworks, in a way not possible to it earlier.这恰巧是最不被接受的死后模式。 自我可能足够强大，以坚持旧有的操控特权，然而又过于僵化，无法适应新的状况。 另一方面，它可能接受巨大变化的挑战，允许心理程式的重新组织，在这种情况下，身份不仅被保存，而且被更新。挣脱了某种通用架构之后，自我此时以一种之前不可能的方式发号施令。
It can then build upon these, willingly submerge part of itself, and emerge with a more vigorous identity. In other words it can accept larger portions of action, and adapt itself in ways not possible when it was connected with the physical organism.然后它可以建立在这些上面，自愿隐没它自己的一部分，并且带着更强健的本体出现。换句话说，它能够接受行动更大的部分，并且以种种方式调整自己以便适应，当它与物质有机体连结在一起时，那些方式是不可能的。
The generic images are like lifelines.通用意象就像生命线。
(Long pause) They seem to lead into your past, but these lifelines are spirals, and only the limitations of physical perception lead you to think of them in that manner.(长时间停顿)它们似乎通往你的过去，但这些生命线是螺旋状的，只不过肉体感知的限制导致你把它们想成那样。
I will now close. My best wishes to you both.我现在要结束了。给你们两位我最好的祝福。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:00. Jane was out as usual. Her pace had again been slow. Neither of us felt bad, merely sleepy.)(10点整结束。珍一如往常出去了。她的速度一梯级慢。我们两人都没有觉得不舒服，只是想睡而已。)
(Drawing of a draft beer can. One of these from a six pack supplied by Don Wilbur on the evening of Friday, October 7,1966, furnished1966年10月10日 星期一 晚上9点
the cap used as envelope object for the 73rd experiment.)一罐生啤酒的描摹图。唐韦伯在1996年10月17日星期五晚上提供的一打啤酒当中的一罐，罐上有第73次实验用作标的物的拉环

SESSION 292 第292节 通用影像由电磁复合体构成 信封73


OCTOBER 10, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年10月10日第292节第73次信封实验用作标的物的啤酒罐拉环和我的笔记描摹图正面和背面
(See the previous pages for tracings of the two envelope objects used in the 73rd experiment this evening. The beer can cap was enclosed within my folded note; the note was written on white paper in the same color ink used to make the tracings. Both items came from a gathering of friends at our apartment last Friday evening, October 7. The dark color on the end of the tab is carbon block from a candle flame. I did this deliberately on Friday evening during the gathering, in full view of everyone, for at that moment I decided to use this cap as the envelope object for the session tonight. Other details later.(今晚的第73次实验使用的两个信封标的物描摹图见上图。啤酒罐的拉环放在我折叠的笔记里面；笔记写在白纸上，使用的墨水颜色与用来画描摹图的墨水一样。两个物件都来自10月7日上星期五晚上在我们公寓举行的一场朋友聚会。上周五聚会时，我刻意这么做，好让每个人都看得一清二楚，因为当时我就决定用这个拉环当作今晚这一节的信封标的物。其他细节稍后再叙。
(As usual I placed the objects between two pieces of heavy Bristol, to preclude any identification by touch, then sealed this sandwich in two envelopes. Seth has said before that he does not give any envelope data that could have resulted either from Jane's sense of touch, or sight, and this has never been a problem in these experiments.(一如往常，我把标的物夹在两块厚的西卡纸之间，避免因为碰触而被认出来，然后把这个纸板三明治密封在两层信封内。赛斯之前说过，任何可能因为珍的视觉或触觉而产生的信封资料，他一律不给，而在这些实验当中，后来没有发生过这个问题。
(Jane was sleepy before the session, but did not tell me until after the envelope data had been obtained.(珍在课前昏昏欲睡，但没有告诉我，直到取得信封资料以后才说。
(She began speaking in trance while sitting down, and with her left hand raised to her closed eyes. Voice average, pace slow with many pauses.)(她坐下来，同时开始在出神中讲话，她的左手高举到闭着的眼睛上面，声音普通，速度缓慢，多次停顿。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. These generic images are composed of highly complicated electromagnetic complexes. They have nothing to do with physical vision. They are built up through cellular memory, and are to some extent activated replicas of previous forms.现在。这些通用意象是由极度复杂的复合物组成。它们与肉体的视力一点关系都没有。它们是经由细胞记忆建立而成，而且在某种程度上是先前形式的活性化复制品。
They are not one-dimensional images therefore, nor for that matter are they static. They are vital, full of their own energy reality, living composites. In dreams as a rule you only perceive them as images. They possess a psychic identity however that is biological to some extent as far as you are concerned. In other words, at this time various biological changes must occur in order for you to tune in upon them directly.因此它们不是单一维度的意象，而且它们其实也不是静止的。它们是有生命的，充满它们自己的能量实相，活生生的合成物。在梦中，通常你只感知它们是意象。然而它们拥有一个就你而言某种程度是生理性质的心灵本体。换句话说，在这时期，必须发生各种生理上的改变，你才能直接收看它们。
I use the word directly loosely, for only the inner senses can really contact them without the necessity of distortions. To some extent, on their own level they have an awareness of the dreams in which they participate. They function to some extent independently. However your Emotional Moods become their psychological climate.我以宽松的态度使用直接这个词语，因为只有内在感官才能够真的接触它们而没有扭曲的必要。某种程度上，在它们自己的层面，它们对它们参与的梦是有觉知的。它们在某种程度上是独立运作的。然而你的情绪状态变成它们的心理气候。
They are aware of your egotistical self, but very dimly. You are their environment, so to speak, and they are aware of your health and vitality as it affects them and their own well being. Some are stronger than others. Some are intrusive.它们对你以自我为中心的自己是有觉知的，但是非常模糊。可以说，你就是它们的环境，而它们对你的健康和活力是有觉知的，因为它影响着它们以及它们自己的福祉。有一些比另一些更强而有力。有些会入侵。
Your whole physical system contains these generic patterns and images. They are held together and unified by the higher organizations of the self.你的整个物质系统包含了这些通用模式和意象。自己当中的更高组织把它们凝聚和统合在一起。
(Jane had been quite restless since the session began, shifting often in the rocking chair she always uses. Now she kicked off her shoes. Her eyes began to open, and were much darker and more luminous than in everyday life.)(珍从这节一开始就一直颇为坐立难安，经常在她向来使用的那把摇椅上动来动去。现在她踢掉鞋子。她的双眼开始睁开，颜色比平常生活中还要深很多，也比较亮。)
When these organizations break down or collapse, for any reason, these generic patterns are no longer held in their subordinate position, and become more highly activated. In some cases this gives rise to the hallucinations of the mentally ill.当这些组织瓦解或崩溃时，不管原因为何，通用模式就不会留在它们的从属位置上，而变得高度活化。在某些案例中，这引发了心理疾患的幻觉。
The generic patterns set up certain organizations among themselves, maintaining direction over some cellular functions, and are closely allied with the movement and purifying agencies of the blood, and also with kidney function. Their vitality is influenced by the seasons, and runs in cycles of ten to fifteen days, followed by a more relaxed period. They are also connected with your ability to utter vowels, and they are themselves sensitive to sound.通用模式在它们自己之间建立某种组织，维持某些细胞功能的方向，与血液的流动和净化作用，还有肾脏功能密切连结。它们的活力受到季节的影响，每10到15天循环一次，接着是一般比较放松的时期。它们也与你发出母音的能力有关联，而且它们本身对声音很敏感。
You understand that these are units of electromagnetic patterns, highly codified, and not active little animals in your blood.你了解这些是电磁模式的单位，经过高度编码，而不是你血液里活跃的小动物。
(Dry humor; smile, eyes open.) Indeed, they take up no space, as the dream within your head takes up no space. They are the results of interactions, and still they exist in reality whether or not those interactions activate them.(冷笑话，微笑，眼睛睁开)事实上，它们不占据空间，就像梦在你的脑袋里也不占据空间一样。它们是互动的结果，无论那些互动有没有活化它们，它们仍然存在实相里。
They are more obvious in the voting child. The adult is hardly aware of them, except in some dreams, and then their meaning is misinterpreted.它们在年幼的小孩身上更为明显。成人对它们几乎是毫无知觉，除了在一些梦里以外，它们的意义因此被错误解读。
We shall leave this discussion for now, however, and return to a study of projections.不过，我们暂且搁下这个讨论，回到投射的研究上。
In some trance stages however, you may become aware of these generic patterns, you see, project them outward, and think you are perceiving some strange apparition. This kind of experience could take place immediately before a projection, you see, though this is not usual.不管怎样，在某些出神阶段，你可能开始觉察到这些通用模式，你知道，向外投射它们，而以你正在感知奇怪的幽魂。这种经验可能发生在投射的前一刻，你知道，但这并不常见。
You may take you first break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:27. Jane was dissociated as usual. She had continued to be restless, shifting about often. Her eyes opened frequently, her pace was slow, and she had little memory of what she had said.(9:27分休息。珍一如往常出离。她继续坐立难安，经常变换姿势。她多次张开眼睛，速度缓慢，而且不太记得自己说过什么。
(She resumed at a little faster pace at 9:37.)(她在9:37分继续，速度稍微加快一点。)
Now, projections do involve variations in intensities on your part.现在，投射的确涉及你这边的强度变化。
There are definite strains connected here. On a conscious level you must gain confidence as you did learning to walk. It is quite possible however to project without any alarming physical symptoms whatsoever. Often suggestion itself changes the symptoms.这里有明确的张力与之相连。在一个意识层面上，你必须增强自信，就像你学走路那样。不过，投射也很有可能没有任何令人惊慌的肉体症状。往往暗示本身就会改变症状。
In dreams, when you expect none, none appear. Out of body experiences indeed can be a health boon. Your system is automatically relaxed and free of pressure. Also, incidentally, free of time. It does not age during a projection; that is, the body does not age. It is in suspension. Any interpretations that are made are made by consciousness itself. The physical senses are not， underline not, utilized. At the moment of perception the traveling consciousness perceives through the inner senses, and by itself automatically makes the necessary adjustments so that the ego can perceive the data in its accustomed way.在梦中，当你什么都不预期时，就什么都不会出现。出体经验其实是有利健康的。你的系统自动放松，摆脱压力的束缚。还有，顺便一提，也不受时间的约束。在投射期间，它不会老化；也就是说，身体不会老化。它在暂停中。任何解读都是意识本身所做的解读。没有用到肉体感官，没有两字画线。在感知的当下，旅行中的意识透过内在感官来感知，并且靠它自己自动做出必要的调整，好让自我能够以它习惯的方式感知资料。
This is done automatically. The data is not radioed back (gesture, eyes closed) to the physical body, so to speak, for interpretation. Consciousness can adapt physical methods of procedure even when separated from the body. It forms its own pseudo physical apparatus, even as it originally forms the physical image itself. The consciousness is aware of seeing and observing more or less in physical terms, and so it is.这是自动完成的。可以说，资料并不是用无线电传送回去给肉体解读。甚至与身体分开时，意识都能够调整物质的程序方法。它形成它自己的伪肉体感官，甚至就像它最初形成它自己的肉体形象一样。意识对于或多或少以肉体的方式看见和观察是有觉知的，而且它的确如此。
Now, do you have an envelope for me, Joseph?现在，你有没有信封要给我？约瑟。
("Yes.”(“有。”
(Her eyes now closed, Jane reached out to take the double sealed envelope for the 73rd experiment from me. As usual, she held it to her forehead in a horizontal position.)(珍的眼睛现在闭着，她伸手从我这里拿了第73次实验的双层密封信封。一如往常，她拿着横向的信封，把它放在额头上。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
(Pause.)(停顿)
An advantage. Something to do with an advantage. A big A.一个优势。某个与一个优势有关的东西。一个大写的A。
The impression of a maze(or amaze?). A Friday. A vertical format.一个迷惑(或惊奇？)的印象。(译注：一个迷惑的英文是a maze ,惊奇的英文则是amaze)一个星期五。一个垂直的格式。
(Jane now lowered the envelope to her lap.) Three. This could be 3 PM, I do not know, but a trio or three.(珍现在把信封拿下来，放在她的大腿上)三。这可能是下午三点，我不知道，但是有三个一组或三。
(Pause.) And a connection with time mentioned. A scale of sorts.(停顿)以及一个与上述时间的关联。某种尺度。
Connection with a large city. This Minneapolis connection, I do not know to what it refers. Again, a capital letter impression, a large M. Minneapolis, Mississippi—that length of word, with a place description connected.与一座大城市有关联。这个与明尼亚波利斯(Minneapolis)的关联，我不知道它是指什么。再一次，一个大写字母的印象，一个大写的M。明尼亚波利斯、密西西比州(Mississippi)——这个长度的字，与一个地方的描述连结在一起。
A 36 and 46. Printed matter and a design. Something small and round, like a ring, or small circular shape. Placed fairly high on the item. Perhaps to the right, and small.36和46。印刷字和一个设计图案。某个圆形的小东西。像是拉环或圆形。放在物件上相当高的位置。也许是在左边，而且是小小的。
The color red. An achievement. Two men, yourself and another connected here. An armchair also. A skirmish.红色。一个成就。这里和两个男人，你自己和另一个有关联。还有一张扶手椅。一个小冲突。
Forty-six or 1946. Square patterns. Gray, black, white. A calendar, or series of numbers. Blue. Perhaps the color of a garment.46或1946。正方形的图案。灰色、白色。一个日历，或一连串的数字。蓝色。或许是一件衣服的颜色。
Do you have any questions? A broken-up note.你有没有任何问题？一张零碎的字条。
(“What’s that about a Friday?’’)(“与一个星期五有关的事情是什么？”)
A Friday connected with the item. Perhaps a 7, or 17, day of the month. Or 7 PM. Connection with a stranger also.与物件有关的一个星期五。也许是一个7，或17，当月的一天。或者是晚上7点。也和一个陌生人有关联。
("What does the big A refer to?')(“一个大写的A是指什么？”)
I do not know. A large A impression. Whether it is symbolic or literal I am not aware. A chimney shape also.我不知道。印象就是一个大写的A。我不知道它是一个象征符号或是字面上的意思。还有一个烟囱的形状。
(“Who is the other man mentioned besides myself?"(“除了我自己以外，上述另一个男人是谁？”)
(Pause.) We will try on this in a moment.(停顿)我们等一下会试试这个。
(“What's that about a skirmish?"(“一个小冲突是什么？”)
(Pause.) Having to do with an argument. Also with a past war connection. A connection with a diamond also, and a woman. Ruburt thinks there of your mother.(停顿)与一场争执有关。也和过去的一个战争有关联。此外，与一颗钻石，以及一个女人有关联。鲁柏在那里想到了你的母亲。
(“Do you want to go back to that other man now?")(“你现在想要回去谈另外那个男人吗？”)
We are having difficulty. Ruburt thinks of your father, but is afraid of distorting the information.我们遇到困难了。鲁柏想到你的父亲，但是他怕扭曲了资料。
(Pause.) If you have no more questions you may take a break.(停顿)如果你没有问题了，可以休息一下。
(“Okay.”)(“好。”)
Oval also. Something oval.还有椭圆形。某个椭圆形的东西。
(“How about its color?” )(“它是什么颜色？”)
We gave you colors, also 1861 or 1961. Something old-fashioned, as a horse and buggy.我们给你颜色了，还有1861年或1961年。某个老式的东西，像是一匹马和轻便马车。
(Break at 10:01. Jane had been out as usual, she said. Her eyes had remained closed during the experiment. Her pace had been much faster during the experiment than during the rest of the session. She said she was not aware of any of the data while she was giving it, or what it might mean, whether it was valid, etc.(10:01分休息。珍说她一如往常出去了。她的眼睛在实验期间仍然闭着。她的速度在实验期间比这一节的其他时间快了许多。她说她在给出资料时，对于内容，或是可能的意思、是否有效等等，她都毫无知觉。
(Jane had some images and these will be mentioned in place. This is a case where Jane had seen one of the two items making up the envelope objects very recently—the beer can cap, on Friday, October 7, three days ago. She had never seen my penned note bearing the date and identifying the brand of beer, Draft Beer. See pages 86-88 for tracings of the two envelope objects, and the beer can. I might add that Jane saw the beer can cap only in a casual way. There were quite a few lying about our living room Friday evening. Our candle was not lit until late that evening. When I picked up a cap to blacken in the flame I thought this would focus Janes conscious attention on this particular one, but she told me at break tonight that she hadn't noticed my heating the cap, or else had forgotten it.(珍有一些画面，这些会在适当的地方提到。这次的情况是，珍最近不久见过构成信封标的物的两个物件的其中一个——啤酒罐的拉环，在三天前，10月7日星期五。她从未见过我手写的字条，上面记着日期和啤酒的品牌：生啤酒[Drart Bear]。两个信封标的物的描摹图以及啤酒罐见前面所示。我可以补充，珍是在不经意间看到这个啤酒罐。星期五晚上，我们的客厅里随处放了好几个。我们到了那天很晚才点上蜡烛。当我捡起一个被火焰烧黑的啤酒罐拉环时，我以为这会让珍有意识的注意力集中在这一个拉环上，但是今晚她在休息时告诉我，她当时并没有注意到我在加热拉环，不然就是已经忘了。
(Two other couples visited us last Friday evening. Bill and Peggy Gallagher, and Marilyn and Don Wilbur. Jane and I furnished wine, so did the Gallaghers, and the Wilburs brought two six-packs of beer—one of Draft Beer, the other of Carling Black Label.(上周五晚上有另外两对夫妻来看我们，比尔和蓓·加拉格以及玛丽莲和唐·韦伯。珍和我提供了葡萄酒，加拉格夫妇也是，韦伯夫妇则带了两打啤酒——一打是生啤酒，另一打是卡琳黑标[Crling Black Label]。
(Jane read aloud to the gathering an article in the November 1966 Fate Magazine titled Table Up! or How To Tilt a Table, by Georgia Mae Fields. This is an old childrens game, and we deicidcd to try it with a card table. Our experiences of the evening involving this game enter into the envelope data, although neither of the envelope objects refer to it directly. This is often the case, the often innocuous envelope object reflecting whatever strong Emotional charges surround it at the physical time Jane and Seth are trying to get back to.(珍在聚会上大声朗读1966年11月《命运杂志》[Fate Magazine]刊载的一篇文章，篇名是〈桌子起来〉[Table Up!]或〈如何让桌子翅起来〉[How To Tilt a Up]，作者是乔治雅·梅·菲尔德斯[Georgia Mae Fields]。这是一个小孩子玩的老游戏，我们决定用一张桥牌桌试试看。我们那天晚上玩这个游戏的经验进入了信封资料，虽然两个信封标的物与它似乎都没有直接相关。情况经常是这样，在珍和赛斯尝试回溯的物理时间中，往往无关痛痒的信封标的物就会反映出围绕着它的强烈情感电荷。
(There are more details to our evenings fun, and these will develop as we go through the data. Seth helped us out a little after break, but Jane and I made most connections on our own.(我们今晚的趣事还有更多细节，在我们爬梳资料的同时，这些细节也会随之开展。在休息过后，赛斯帮了我们一点，但大部分的连结都是珍和我自己找出来的。
(“An advantage. Something to do with an advantage.” Jane read the article aloud to us, then Bill, Don and I tried tipping the table first. We sat at the south end of the table and made the vacant north end rise as we chanted away, per instructions in the article. What the three women didn't know at the time was that the three of us were helping nature out a little, making the free end of the table rise by conscious physical pressure from our hands.(“一个优势。某个与一个优势有关的东西。”珍大声朗读文章给我们听，然后比尔、唐和我先尝试让桌子倾斜。我们坐在桌子的南边，按照文章的说明，一边唱诵一边让空着的北边升高。当时三个女人有所不知的是，我们三个人稍微帮了自然一把，有意识地用手施压，让桌子空着的那一边升高起来。
(We did this twice. In between the three women tried to do the same thing, and failed. Our knowledge that we were faking certainly gave us an advantage over them. More follows from this.(我们这样做了两次。在这中间，三个女人也尝试做同样的事，结果失败。我们知道自己作假，这当然给了我们超越她们的优势。这之后还有更多。
(“A big A.”Jane and I could make no connections, even after I asked a question about this. But Seth explains after break.(“一个大写的A。”珍和我找不到关联，甚至在我问了一个相关问题之后也没办法找到。但是在休息之后，赛斯解释了原由。
(“The impression of a maze.” This is a case where variations are possible in writing down sounds. At first I wrote this data as two words, so let it stand, but soon reconsidered and realized I could just as well have written down “amaze". I could not tell which version to use, actually, from Janes pronunciation.(“一个迷惑的印象。”在写下声音时，可能会有各种变化，这就是其中一例。起初我用两个字[a maze]写下这个资料，就这样随它去，但是不久又重新思考而发觉，我要是写成“amaze”也无妨。其实，从珍的发音，我分不清用哪个版本才对。
(When Bill, Don and I tipped the table deliberately and were not detected doing so, we certainly got an amazed reaction from the three women. Peggy’s jaw literally dropped. Jane and Marilyn were also very surprised, and Jane later told me that after the first shock of seeing the north end of the table rise, seemingly of its own volition, she thought Bill, Don and I actually succeeded in accomplishing this.(比尔、唐和我故意倾斜桌子，而且没有被看穿，我们当然从三个女人那里得到一个惊奇的反应。蓓的下巴真的掉下来了。珍和玛丽莲也非常惊讶，而且珍后来告诉我，一开始看到桌子的北边，仿佛出于它自己的意愿而升高，感觉很震惊之后，她以为比尔、唐和我真的成功做到了。
(“Maze”, meaning puzzlement, can also apply here, for when the three women tried tipping the table they did not succeed. Jane said this was very vexing and puzzling to them.(“迷惑”，意思是困惑不解，在这里也适用，因为三个女倾斜桌子却没有成功。珍说她们很佃租脑筋、很困惑。
(“A Friday.” See the tracing of the note I enclosed with the beer can cap in the double envelopes, on page 86. The first line of my copy reads “Used Friday, Oct. 7/66.” This little note was written on Friday, October 7 also, after company left. [This session was held on Monday, October 10.](“一个星期五。”见前面，我连同啤酒罐拉环一起放进双层信封里的字条描摹图。我的文稿第一行是写着：“1966年10月7日星期五使用过。”这一小段笔记也是写于10月7日，在访客离开之后。[这一节在10月10日星期一举行]
(“A vertical format.” Seth didn't help us out here and I neglected to ask him to after break, but in view of later data Jane and I believe this applies to the design on the Draft Beer can, furnishing the cap used as one of the envelope objects. See page 88. Due to its nature a beer can would bear a vertical format. The card table we used had a plain brown top; but perhaps Seth referred to something else.(“一个垂直的格式。”这里赛斯帮不上我们的忙，而在休息之后我也忘了问他，但基于后来的资料，我相信这适用于生啤酒罐上的设计，罐上有用作信封物件之一的拉环。由于它的性质，啤酒罐都会有一个垂直的格式。我们使用的桥牌桌有着朴素的褐色桌面；但也许赛斯是指别的东西。
(“Three. This could be 3 PM, I do not know, but a trio or three. ”As far as we know 3 PM doesn’t figure in the envelope data, but a trio, meaning Bill, Don and me, does. Another trio featured during List Friday evening would be Jane, Peggy and Marilyn. Both trios worked at tipping the table several separate times, for many minutes at a time.(“三。这可能是下午三点，我不知道，但是有三个一组或三。”就我们所知，下午三点并没有出现在信封资料上，但是有三个一组，意思是比尔、唐和我。星期五晚上出现的另一个三人组是珍、蓓和玛丽莲。两个三个组都试过几次倾斜桌子，一次持续好几分钟。
(Obviously, one could search out many threes in the course of an evening, although we think the trio connection listed above is a strong Emotional and valid one.(显然 ，在一个晚上的过程中，可以找出很多个三，但是我们认为上述三个一组的关联有着强烈又有效的连结。
(“And a connection with time mentioned.” We are not sure. We mentioned time many times during the evening, of course. A prominent written source of time last Friday evening lay in the Fate article on table tipping, which we all read in turn: twenty seconds; after midnight; twelve years; a month later; four months later; three minutes; since I960, etc. My envelope note on page 86 says Friday.(“以及一个与上述时间的关联。”我们不确定。当然，我们在当晚提过很多次。上周五晚上有一个书写时间的显著出处是《命运杂志》那篇谈倾斜桌子的文章，我们全都轮流看过它：20秒；午夜过后；12年；一个月之后；4个月之后；3分钟；自从1960年以来，等等。在前面，我的信封字条写着星期五。
(Jane felt subjectively sure this was the correct interpretation.(珍在主观上很确定这是正确的解读。
(“A scale of sorts." Again, Jane said this referred either to the schedule of instructions given in the article on table tipping, or to our own working at the table last Friday evening; our rubbing our hands, chanting, etc.(“某种尺度。”再一次，珍说这不是指倾斜桌子那篇文章给的操作指南时间表，就是指上周五晚上我们自己倾斜桌子的尝试；我们摩搓双手、唱诵等等。
(We thought an apt connection with scale would be the ”balancing" of the table on its two south legs as the male and female trios sat before it. As stated, the first two times Bill, Don and I sat at the table we deliberately made the table tip; the last time however, with Jane added to the group, the table really tipped through subconscious pressure.(我们认为与尺度有关的一个恰当连结是，在男生三人组与女生三人组坐在桌子前面时，桌子自行靠它南边的两只脚“保持平衡”。如上所述，前两次比尔、唐和我坐在桌子前面时，我们故意让桌子倾斜；但是最后一次，珍加入我们，桌子就真的透过无意识的压力而倾斜了。
(“Connection with a large city. This Minneapolis connection, I do not know to what it refers. Again, a capital letter impression, a large M. Minneapolis, Mississippi—that length of word, with a place description connected.” Jane said she was sure these long names beginning with an M reflected her attempts to come through with Milwaukee, rather than Minneapolis. She tied up the Milwaukee name to our having beer to drink at the gathering Friday evening: and of course a beer can furnished the metal object used in the experimental envelope. See page 88.(“与一座大城市有关联。这个与明尼亚波利斯的关联，我不知道这是指什么。再一次，一个大写字母的印象，一个大写的M。明尼亚波利斯、密西西比州——这个长度的字，与一个地方的描述连结一起。”珍说她确定这些M开头的长名反映出，她试图传述密尔瓦基[Milwaukee]，而不是明尼亚波利斯。她把密尔瓦基与我们在星期五晚上的聚会有啤酒喝连结在一起；当然，啤酒罐上面有实验信封使用的金属物件。
(Jane has a personal association here. The only city that she knows advertises beer is Milwaukee—” The beer that made a city famous," etc. Milwaukee is a word of about the same length as Minneapolis, etc., and also is connected to a place.(这里珍有一个私人的连结。推广啤酒的城市，她只知道一个，就是密尔瓦基——“让一个城市广为人知的啤酒”等等。Milwaukee这个字的长度与Minnespolis之类的字差不多，而且它也和一个地方有关联。
(“A 36 and 46.” We believed this to be jumbled data, an effort to be specific. No one of either age, for instance, was present. Jane and I were closest at 37 and 47. Bill is 41, Peggy 38, Marilyn and Don in their early 20s, etc. We were not sure Seth even intended a reference to age. There is a 10 difference between the two numbers, and also between the ages of Jane and me.(“36和46。”我们相信这是错杂的资料，为了具体所做的努力。比方说，两个年纪的人都不在场。珍和我最接近，37和47。比尔是41，蓓38，玛丽莲和唐则是20出头等等。我们甚至不确定赛斯的意思是不是指年纪。两个数字之间的差距是10，这也是珍和我的年龄差距。
(In regard to the Minneapolis-Milwaukee data above, it should be added that the Iroquois Draft Beer can that furnished the cap used as object in tonights experiment，did not come from Milwaukee or anywhere in the Midwest. See the sketch on page 88. The can and contents originated in Buffalo, NY, as indicated.(关于上述明尼亚波利斯——密尔瓦基资料，应该要补充的是，今晚实验用作标的物的拉环出自依洛奎[Iroquis]生啤酒罐，这款啤酒并非来自密尔瓦基或中西部的任何一个地方。见前面的素描。如图所示，这罐啤酒及其内容物源自纽约州的水牛城。
(“Printed matter and a design.” Again, see the tracings of the two envelope objects on page 86. The note enclosed with the beer can cap bears my handwriting. This is not printing, although Seth has often intermixed the terms printing, writing, lettering, typing, etc. We think this good data. And that ”design” can refer to the metallic, cleanly-designed beer can. Seth goes on from here.(“印刷字和一个设计图案。”再一次，见前面两个信封标的物的描摹图。与啤酒拉环一起密封的字条上面有我的手写字迹。这不是印刷字，不过赛斯经常混用印刷字、手写字、美术字、打字等等。我们认为这个资料很好。而且“设计图案”可能是指金属制、设计简洁的啤酒罐。从这里继续说。
(“Something small and round, like a ring, or small circular shape.” The beer can cap used as object is small and round, like a ring. Jane pointed out also that the word ”Ring” appears twice in blind emboss on top of Draft Beer cans, one of which furnished the cap. See page 88.(“某个圆形的小东西，像是拉环或圆形。”用作标的物的啤酒罐拉环是圆形的小东西，像一个拉环。珍也指出，“ring”[拉环]这个字以无墨压印的方式出现在生啤酒罐顶端两次，标的物就是其中一罐的拉环。
(“Placed fairly high on the item. Perhaps to the right, and small.” Jane said this was a reference to the position of the cap-ring against my note, while the two items were sealed between the two Bristol stiffeners and in the double envelopes. She had an image of their position while giving this data. It will be remembered that by this time Jane held the envelope in her lap; earlier she had held it against her forehead as she often does. To the right is a rough indication of the position she refers to, and which she was able to verify to some extent as she opened the envelopes at break. Remember the note was actually folded over the cap, like a sandwich; evidently the pressure of the two Bristol stiffeners and the two envelopes held the cap in the same position relative to the note.(“放在物件上相当高的位置。也许是在左边，而且是小小的。”珍说这是指两个物件同时夹在两片加固用的西卡纸板间，一起密封在双层信封内，拉环摆放在我那张字条上的位置。在给出这个资料时，她有一个画面是它们的位置。记得这时候珍把信封放在她的大腿上；之前她是拿着信封放在额头上，她经常这样做。下图是她指出的大略位置，而且在休息时，她打开信封后，也得到某种程度的验证。记得字条其实是折叠在拉环上，像一个三明治那样；显然两片硬纸板和两个信封的压力，让拉环留在相对于字条的同样位置上。
(“The color red.” We cannot be sure. There could be many sources of red that Friday evening; for instance, the candle I used to deposit a coat of carbon black on the cap used as object, was a brilliant red; this was a large fat candle, and one we have used in previous experiments. We used it toward the close of the evening last Friday as an object upon which the six of us focused our attention. Half humorously, we attempted to increase the height of the candle flame by concentration, with no success. This was after we had finished the table tipping.(“红色。”我们无法确定。在那个周五晚上，红色有很多可能的出处；比方说，我用过的蜡烛是鲜红色，它在当作标的物的拉环上留下一层碳黑；这是一支粗大的蜡烛，我们在之前的实验也用过它。我们在上周五快结束时点了它，用来当作我们六个人集中注意力的物件。半开玩笑地，我们试图透过专注力拉长蜡烛的火焰，结果功亏一篑。这是在我们玩过倾斜桌子之后。
(I blackened the cap in the candle flame in order to tie the evenings activities more closely to the cap, for the beer had been consumed during the table tipping. As stated I held the cap in the flame without pretense, before everyone, but of course told no one why I did so. Nor did anyone ask. It also developed that Jane did not notice my doing so.(我用烛火熏黑拉环是为了增强今晚的活动与拉环的连结，因为啤酒在倾斜桌子时已经喝完了。如上所述，我在众人面前，拿着拉环放在火焰里，毫不矫饰，但我当然没有把原因告诉任何人。也没有人问。此外也发现珍并没有注意到我这么做。
(Red also appears on the Draft Beer can, one of which furnished the cap, in the words “by Iroquois,” and in the design of the Indian head at the bottom of the can. See page 88.(红色也出现在生啤酒罐上，其中一罐的拉环是标的物，就在“依洛奎制造”[by Iroquois]和罐底的印地安人头像上。见前面描摹图。
(“An achievement.” As stated, the last time we sat at the table, [Jane, Bill, Don and myself] we did succeed in tipping it in the correct manner, according to the Fate Magazine article. A some what weird feeling to watch the north end of the table rise, seemingly without help. Actually pressure exerted by us subconsciously did the job. We wouldn't know about any other agencies being involved, as the magazine article says is possible.(“一个成就。”如上所述，最后一次坐在桌旁，[珍、比尔、唐和我自己]我们的确按照《命运杂志》文章所说的正确方式，成功让桌子倾斜了。看着桌子的北边似乎在无人帮助之下升高，感觉有点怪异。实际上发挥作用的是我们在潜意识里施加的压力。我们不知道任何牵涉在内的其他动力，据那篇杂志文章说其他动力是有可能的。
(“Two men, yourself and another connected here.” I am of course connected to the envelope objects, having authored the note. See page 86. This data called for a good amount of vexation on Jane's part as soon as she opened the envelopes and saw the initials RFB on the note. Her confusion is also apparent in the series of questions I asked, as I usually do following the delivery of the data.(“这里和两个男人，你自己和另一个有关联。”我当然和信封标的物有连结，因为字条是我写的。珍一打开信封，看到字条上的姓名缩写RFB，这个资料立刻勾起她那边很多的烦恼。对于我提出的一连串问题，她显然也很困惑，通常在资料传述之后，我就会开始发问。
(Jane said at break that she had had an image of the initials RFB, and she wished mightily now that she had said so. As it is she gives several excellent pieces of data on the note, and the initials would have made her achievement even better. Jane said she didn’t speak the initials aloud because she thought they might refer to my father, and that this was a distortion. She knew she had already mentioned me, as ”yourself”. My initials are the same as my father's; but although I am a Junior, I seldom use it after my name. When I do I abbreviate it as Jr.(在休息时，珍说她有一个画面是姓名缩写RFB，现在她非常希望当时有把它说出来。看样子她给出几则有关字条的绝佳资料，而姓名缩写本来可以让她的成就好上加好。珍说她没有说出姓名缩写，是因为她以为它们可能是指我的父亲，而这是一个扭曲。她知道她已经提过我，以“你自己”称之。我和我父亲的姓名缩写一样；不过，我虽然是二世[Junior]，却很少在我的姓名后面加二世。要是我加了，也是用缩写字Jr.。
(Giving this kind of data calls for fine discrimination on Janes part while in trance, and often she has to make up her own mind, she has often said, as to which course to choose. At times in the past also, she has withheld data she later wished she had given voice to. But we regard it as very encouraging that she had mentally perceived the initials.(给出这种资料需要珍那边在出神中细加分辨，她常常说，选择哪一条路往往必须她自己决定。过去也有时候会这样，她保留资料但后来却希望当时有说出来。但是她在心智层面已经感知了姓名缩写，我们认为这鼓舞人心。
(“An armchair also.” This is interesting, and we believe refers to a wicker upright armchair that one of us sat in when at the table tipping game the List time of the evening. We have three black wooden kitchen chairs that ordinarily we press into service in the living room when company comes. These three chairs were used by the male and female trios as they sat at the table. When a fourth member was added to the last table tipping of the evening, featuring Jane, Bill, Don and myself, the wicker armchair was pressed into use since it was the only one available except for a Kennedy rocker. Neither Jane or I recall who sat in the armchair.(“还有一张扶手椅。”这很有意思，我们相信这是指一把柳条编织的直立式扶手椅，那天晚上最后一次玩倾斜桌子游戏时，我们其中一人就在那张椅子上。我们有三张厨房用的黑色木椅，通常客人来了，我们就会暂时拿到客厅来用。当第四个成员加入当晚最后一次倾斜桌子游戏时，分别是珍、比尔、唐和我自己，就会征用柳条扶手椅，因为除了肯尼迪摇椅之外，只有这一张椅子可用。珍和我都想不起谁坐了那张扶手椅。
(“A skirmish.” There were several verbal skirmishes in the course of the evening, stemming from the suspicions of the three women that Bill, Don and I might be faking the lifting of the table the first couple of times we tried it. Also between Jane and me after company left, when I told Jane we had assisted nature during the early attempts. A little more data comes out on this during the question period.(“一个小冲突。”在当晚的过程中，有过几次口头上的小冲突，起因是三个女人怀疑比尔、唐和我在头两次尝试让桌子升高时作假。此外，珍和我在客人离开后也起了冲突，当时我告诉珍，我们在刚开始尝试时帮了自然一把。在提问期间，又出现了一点点这件事的相关资料。
(“Forty-six or 1946s.” Jane and I made no connections. Seth helps out after break.(“46或1946。”珍和我找不到关联。在休息过后，赛斯帮了忙。
(“Square patterns.” We made no connections.(“正方形的图案。”我们找不到关联。
(“Gray, black, white.” Jane suggested these connections: The gray, or aluminum, color of the metal cap; the black section of the cap I heated in the candle flame; the white paper upon which I wrote the date and other data concerning the cap.(“灰色、黑色、白色。”珍提出以下的连结：灰色，或铝，金属拉环的颜色；我放在烛火上加热而变黑的那一部分拉环；我写下这个资料和其他拉环相关资料的白纸。
(“A calendar, or series of numbers.” I wrote a series of three numbers on the note used as one of the envelope objects, indicating the date. See page 86. There are also numbers on the beer can shown on page 88. There could be many other references to numbers.(“一个日历，或一连串的数字。”在用作信封标的物之一的字条上，我写了一连串数字，标示日期。在啤酒罐上也有日期，如前面所示。与数字有关的可能有很多其他事物。
(“Blue. Perhaps the color of a garment.” Jane wore her favorite blue sweater Friday evening, October 7,1966, the evening which furnished the two objects used in tonights envelope experiment.(“蓝色。或许是一件衣服的颜色。”1966年10月7日星期五晚上，也就是提供两个用作今晚信封实验标的物的那天晚上，珍穿了她最喜欢的蓝色毛衣。
(She is quite positive of this. The sweater is one handmade by her mother, who is an invalid. We checked Jane's memory on the rest of her wardrobe Friday evening. She wore tan Wrangler pants, white sneakers, and a tan sleeveless blouse. She pressed the pants before company came. The sleeveless blouse was a little too chilly and she put the blue sweater on. Jane had planned to wear this sweater Friday evening, and had already applied blue eye shadow to match.(她对这一点相当确定。毛衣是她卧病在床的母亲手工制作的。我们核对珍记忆中她在周五晚上穿的其余衣物。她穿了棕褐色的蓝哥[Wrangler]长裤、白色球鞋和一件棕褐色的无袖上衣。在访客来前，她烫了长裤。只穿无袖上衣有点太冷了，她便套上蓝色毛衣。周五晚上珍本来就打算穿这件毛衣，所以她已经涂上蓝色眼影来搭配它。
(Jane is not sure, but she believes Marilyn could have worn a blue Poor boy sweater Friday evening, one of very dark blue. Jane knows Marilyn owns such a garment.(珍不确定，但她相信玛丽莲周五晚上很可能穿了一件蓝色的罗纹紧身毛衣，很深的蓝色。珍知道玛丽莲有这样一件衣服。
(1st Question: “What’s that about a Friday?” A Friday connected with the item. Perhaps a 7, or 17, day of the month. Or 7 PM.” Seth is quite correct. See the copy of the note on page 86. Friday, October 7,1966 is specifically mentioned on the note which was one of the two envelope objects. 7 PM doesn’t enter in however. Later note by RFB: Very good.(第一个问题：与一个星期五有关的事情是什么？“与物件有关的一个星期五。也许是一个7，或17，当月的一天。或者是晚上7点。”赛斯相当正确。见前面的字条副本。在两个信封标的物之一的字条上明确提到1966年10月7日星期五。不过，没有写晚上7点。罗后来的注：非常好。
(“Connection with a stranger also.” Last Friday evening was connected with a stranger, in that a stranger, Georgia Mae Fields, wrote the article on table tipping in the November 1966 issue of Fate Magazine. The comments and instructions given in the article dominated the evening, certainly. Jane had been especially aware of the article since the previous Wednesday, October 5, when she first read it and decided to use it on Friday evening.(“也和一个陌生人有关联。”上周五晚上与一个陌生人有关联，因为一个陌生人，乔治雅·梅·菲尔德斯，写了《命运杂志》1966年11月号，一篇谈倾斜桌子的文章。文章中的评论和操作说明，当然是当晚的主角。珍尤其注意这篇文章，因为上周三，10月5日，她第一次读到它，就决定周五晚上要来用用它。
(2nd Question: What does the big A refer to?” “I do not know. A large A impression. Whether it is symbolic or literal I am not aware.” The meaning is symbolic, and Seth explains after break.(第二个问题：一个大写的A是指什么？“我不知道。印象就是一个大写的A。我不知道它是一个象征符号或是字面上的意思。”意义是象征性的，赛斯在休息过后做了解释。
(“A chimney shape also.” Perhaps connected to the big A, as will be seen. However Jane says that last Friday evening when we experimented with the candle flame, she thought that we should have the flame enclosed in a glass chimney, to obviate any chance of the flame being influenced by a draft.(“还有一个烟囱的形状。”也许和大写的A有关联，之后会看到。然而珍说，上星期五晚上，当我们在实验烛火时，她想到我们应该用一个玻璃烟囱包住火焰，消除气流对火焰造成影响的任何可能性。
(3rd Question: Who is the other man mentioned besides myself? “ We will try on this in a moment.” See the interpretation of the ”two men” data at the top of page 96. As stated, Jane had an image of my initials on the note used as test object; but since my father's initials are the same she feared she would distort the data by voicing the initials. Yet she knew that I was also connected with the envelope data.(第三个问题：除了我自己以外，上述另一个男人是谁？“我们等一下会试试这个。”见前面“两个男人”资料的解读。如上所述，珍有一个画面是我的姓名缩写在用作测验标的物的字条上；但是，因为我父亲有相同的姓名缩写，所以她怕她要是说出姓名缩写，就会扭曲资料。可是她知道我也和信封资料有关联。
(4th Question: What's that about a skirmish?“ Having to do with an argument.” Again see page 96. There were several skirmishes during the evening over whether the three men were faking the table tipping. There was also one between Jane and me after company left. This was not an argument, but Jane forcefully presented her idea to the effect that she and I were obligated not to clown around with effects in the psychic field. I agreed.(第四个问题：一个小冲突是什么？“和一场争执有关。”再一次，见前面相关资料。对于三个男人玩倾斜桌子有没有作假，当晚起过几次小冲突，在访客离开后，珍和我也有一次。这不是争执，而是珍强力表达她的看法，大意是她和我有义务不拿通灵场域的效应开玩笑。我同意了。
(“Also with a past war connection." This is not as definite, but we think it applies to Bill Gallagher more than Don and me. All three of us have had military service, Bill and me in World War Two on active duty. Bill is quite a historian on the subject of war, and often discusses it. We believe the subject is almost always mentioned when we are together. The connection with the envelope objects being that Bill was of course present last Friday, October 7,1966.(“也和过去的一个战争有关联。”这没有那么明确，但我们认为它适用于比尔·加拉格，胜过唐和我。我们三个人都当过兵，比尔和我在第二次世界大战时是现役军人。在战争这个主题上，比尔颇有历史学家的研究精神，经常讨论它。我们相信，每次我们在一起，总会提起这个主题 。与信封标的物的关联是，比尔在上周五，1966年10月7日，当然是在场的。
(“A connection with a diamond ... Later note by RFB: Ring? ... also, and a woman. Ruburt thinks there of your mother." This is another method Jane used to approach the idea of my father, and the RFB initials she saw mentally. Seth has more to say in answer to the next question.(“与一颗钻石有关联……后来罗的注：拉环？……以及一个女人有关联。鲁柏在那里想到了你的母亲。”这是珍为了接近我父亲的这个意念而使用的另一个方法，而且她在心智里看见了姓名缩写RFB。在回答下一个问题时，赛斯还有更多要说的。
(5th Question: “Do you want to go back to that other man now?” We are having difficulty. Ruburt thinks of your father, but is afraid of distorting the information.” At break Jane said she again had the image of the RFB initials, and was more confused than ever. Later, she said, she realized the initials were meant to be taken literally, but instead she tried to interpret them: hence getting the idea of my father into the picture.(第五个问题：你现在想要回去谈另外那个男人吗？“我们遇到困难了。鲁柏想到你的父亲，但是他怕扭曲了资料。”在休息时，珍说她又有姓名缩写RFB的画面了，而且感觉到前所未有的困惑。后来，她说，她发觉姓名的用意本来照字面看就可以，但她反而试着解读它们；因此把我父亲的这个意念带入画面中。
(“Oval also. Something oval.” Jane said that while giving this data she knew a small object was referred to, but did not say so. She thinks Seth was trying to get across the idea of the elongated egg shape of the ring and cap, thus:(“还有椭圆形。某个椭圆形的东西。”珍说在给出这个资料时，她知道这是指一个小物件，但没有这么说。她认为赛斯试着传递的意念是，拉环和罐盖的形状是拉长的蛋形，因此：
(6th Question: How about its color? “We gave you colors.”(第六个问题：它是什么颜色？“我们给你颜色了。”
See the gray, black and white data at the top of page 97. In asking this question I wondered whether Seth might give other colors, in the event he referred to some other oval object than the tab.见前面的灰色、黑色和白色资料。提出这个问题时，我想知道赛斯会不会给出不同的颜色，结果他却指出另外一个椭圆形的物件而不是拉环。
(“Also 1861 or 1961.” See page 88. In small numerals there is the date 1842, within the circle enclosing the Indian head. Jane was fairly sure Seth was trying to get at this data; and she now felt that the 46 or 1946 data on page 96, and the 36 and 46 data on page 94, all reflected Seth's attempts in this direction. Seth agrees after break.(“还有1861年或1961年。”见前面所写。在围绕着印地安人头像的圆圈内有1842这个年份，数字很小。珍相当确定赛斯试着传达这个资料，而且她现在感觉前面说的46或1946，还有36和46资料，全都反映了赛斯试图往这个方向走。赛斯在休息后表示赞同。
(“Something old-fashioned, as a horse and buggy.” Again, note the Indian head, plus the name Iroquois, on the beer can shown on page 88. Jane said the old fashioned data is her attempt to get at this. Her personal associations run to horses and-wagons-and-Indians-and-fighting-in-westerns, in the movies and on TV. Although subjective, she regards this as good data.(“某个老式的东西，像是一匹马和轻便马车。”再一次，注意啤酒罐上的印地安人头像，还有依洛奎这个名称，如前面所示。珍说这个资料是她想要表达这个的尝试。她个人的联想跑到电影和影视中，马匹和马车以及印地安人与西方人打斗去了。虽然主观，但她认为这个资料很好。
(Just before Seth resumed Jane said she also thought she knew what the big A data, listed on page 93, meant, and that it had an old-fashioned connection also.(就在赛斯继续之前，珍说她也认为她知道大写A的资料是什么，如前面所述，还说它也和老式有关联。
(Jane resumed in trance, her eyes opening and closing, at 10:55.)(10:55分，珍在出神中继续，双眼张开又闭上。)
We will end the session.我们将结束这一节。
The big A, distorted, referred to a tepee, you see. I tried to get the 1842 through, but there was some distortion from Ruburt in the separate 46 data. I was trying for 42. The 18 you see came out separately also.大写的A，被扭曲了，指的是印地安人的圆锥形帐篷，你看。我试着把1942传过来，但是在分开的46资料上，有一些来自鲁柏的扭曲。我设法传递的是42。你知道，18也是分开传过来的。
(See the note starting at the bottom of page 97.)(见前面的相关注释。)
My best wishes to you both.给你们两位我最好的祝福。
If it were not a work night I would speak to you longer.如果这不是工作日的夜晚，我会跟你说久一点。
(“What do you think of the report of Jane's publisher on the sale of her ESP book? “By telephone today Jane learned from her publisher, F. Fell , that the small first printing of her ESP book has sold out, even before publicity on the book has been launched. We were very surprised to learn this. The next 1500 copies are now being bound。”(“对于珍的出版商为她的ESP书[译注：《实习神明手册》]所做的销售报告，你有什么想法？”透过电话，今天珍从她的出版商费尔那里得知，她这本ESP书少量的第一刷已经售罄，甚至是在书还没有公开上市就卖完了。得知此事，我们感到非常惊讶。接下来的1500本现在正在装订。)
It is exactly what I told you, you see.我跟你们讲的就是这样。你看。
(Jane leaned forward, eyes wide and very dark.(珍往前倾，双眼圆睁，颜色非常深。
(“Yes.")(“是啊。”)
Neither of you took me at my word. I told you the profit you would make, I believe.你们俩都没有把我的话听进去。我相信，我跟你们讲过你们会赚到多少利润。
(“Yes, I still remember.”(“有，我还记得。”
(In the 217th session for December 13,1965, Seth told us Jane would earn about $3,500.00 on the ESP book this first year, and that this amount was to double within two years from this and other books. See Volume 5 of these sessions.(在1965年12月13日第217节，赛斯告诉我们，珍在这一年会从ESP书赚到大约3500美金，还说从这一年开始的两年内，这个数额会变成两倍。见这些课的第五册。
(Nor is it true that we didn't believe him; merely that along the way the slow daily passage of time, with its inevitable delays, etc. makes such ultimate, somewhat removed predictions seem unreal until one forcibly reminds oneself of them.)(说我们不相信他，这也不是事实：只不过一路走来，由于不可避免的延误，每天的时间过得很慢等等，使得这样一个终极、有点压时久远的预测，看起来似乎不真实，直到自己用力提醒自己它的存在为止。)
Basically, it is not necessary that Ruburt work out, but because you both believe that it is, then it becomes so, you see. This is your doing; that is, the doing of you both, and none of mine.基本上，鲁柏不一定达成目标，但因为你们两人都相信会，所以结果就变成这样，你知道。这是你们的作为；也就是说，这是你们两人做的，完全不是我做的。
You make your reality from your expectations, and this is one of the greatest truths. I can tell you no better. You must deal with the realities that you have made, or change them. There are no alternatives. I cannot make you believe anything, and I would not if I could. This is not my purpose.你们从你们的预期创造出你们的实相，这是最大的真相之一。我没办法用更好的方式告诉你们。你们必须和你们已经创造的实相打交道，不然就是改变它们。没有任何替代的选项。我没办法让你们相信任何事情，就算我有办法，我也不会这么做。这不是我的目的。
The data in our own experiments will progress with Ruburts confidence. He will learn to believe in himself and in me. Regardless of what you think I am, or am not, I have given evidence, surely, in all these sessions, of my own individuality, and evidence of my concern and feeling for you both.我们自己的实验取得的资料将会与鲁柏的信心一起提升。他将学会相信他自己以及相信我。不管你们认为我是什么或不是什么，在这些课的每一节当中，我当然都已经给出证据，证明我的个体性，也证明了我对你们两人的关怀和感觉。
And now I wish you both good evening.而现在我祝你们两位晚安。
(“Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 11:04. Jane was well dissociated. She said Seth could have continued indefinitely. She had that sense of energy she gets under such circumstances, when she knows “the energy is not mine.”)(11:04分结束。珍顺利出离。她说赛斯本来可以不限时间继续讲下去的。她感应到那种在这样的状况下出现的能量，当时她知道“这股能量不是我的”。)

SESSION 293 第293节 鲁柏的能量及身体症状


OCTOBER 12, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年10月12日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane said she had no idea of what Seth would talk about this evening, as she lay her glasses on the table at 9 PM. She then went into trance.)(晚上9点，珍把她的眼镜放在桌子上，这时她说赛斯今晚会说什么，她一点概念都没有。然后她就进入出神状态。)
Ruburt may have no idea, but I have several.鲁柏可能没有任何概念，但我倒是有几个。
Now. The concentration that he used in teaching should tell him something. He literally brought a tremendous amount of energy to bear. Automatically he drew upon this energy and focused it for his own purposes.现在。他用在教学上的专注力应该让他有所了解。他名副其实让一大股能量派上用场。他自动利用这股能量，并且为了他自己的目的对准它的焦距。
(On Tuesday, October 11, Jane put in her first day as a substitute teacher; she later said she was aware of using a great amount of energy.)(10月11日星期二那天，珍开始她担任代课老师的第一天；她后来说她觉察到一股很大的能量。)
There was no nervousness. Everything else was forgotten as he strove to project himself to those students.没有丝毫紧张。在他努力投射自己到那些学生身上时，其他的一切全都遗忘了。
This same kind of energy can be utilized most handily in projections of another sort. The same amount of energy focused in an out-of-body experience would have resulted in some venture indeed. It is the same kind of energy he utilizes in his poetry.这同样一种能量可以用在另一类的投射上，非常容易。等量的能量被聚焦在一次经验中，结果的确会是某种冒险。他用在诗作上的，就是同一种能量。
It is this energy that he must utilize now to finish the two books he has begun. Quite literally again, all he has to do is demand that the energy is available, and it shall be. He uses this energy quite subconsciously in his psychic work. He must demand of himself that the energy be used however under various circumstances. When he does not do this he lets himself down.要完成两本他已经起头的书，他现在必须利用的就是这股能量。再一次相当名副其实地，他唯一必须做的，就只是要求这股能量可供他取用，那它就会照办。在他的通灵工作上，他以相当潜意识的方式利用这股能量。他必须要求他自己，在各种各样的情况下，不管怎样都要使用这股能量。当他没有这样做的时候，他就对自己感到失望。
He also punishes himself rather unkindly, with sore muscles, incidentally. When he is working at full power he is quite beyond such physical symptoms. He is outside of them. This energy, the use of it, is a natural ability that is part of his personality, and he must use it. For him it results in a smooth performance, for when he does not use it fully then he is besieged by false starts and interruptions.顺便一提，他也很不仁慈地用肌肉酸痛来惩罚他自己。当他火力全开在工作的时候，这样的身体症状就不太会困扰他。他在它们之外。这股能量，它的用法，是一个天生的能力，属于他人格的一部分，他必须使用它。对他来说，它的结果是一次顺畅的表现，因为当他没有充分利用它的时候，他就会被起步失误和中途打断围攻。
These are reflected in the physical system, for it is geared, and naturally so, for intense action, and here he functions best. I am speaking now of his ideal performance. When he is working well his rest is in his work. When he demands less of himself and then more, and then less, the physical system, geared for steady highly-focused action, becomes confused; the glandular systems upset, and the nervous system as well. The unused energy ties him up in knots, you see.这些都反映在肉体系统中，因为它的配备就是为了密集的行动而设计的，而且天生如此，在这里他运作得最好。我现在讲的是他的理想表现。当他工作顺利时，他的休息就在他的工作中。当他对自己要求比较少，然后比较多，再来又比较少的时候，专为稳定又高度聚焦的行动设计的肉体系统就会变得混乱；腺体系统紊乱，神经系统也一样。
(Her eyes open, Jane gestured by clapping her upper arms; she has experienced muscle cramps and spasms in both deltoids recently.) He must now concentrate that same energy into three main fields or endeavors: poetry and the two books. When he is home working the same energy utilized in his teaching must be used for his own work. This will effectively relieve him of all physical symptoms.没有被使用的能量被他打结了，你看。(珍的眼睛张开，以拍击她的两只上臂示意；她最近经历过三角肌的肌肉抽筋和痉挛)他现在必须把那股能量用在三个主要领域或努力的事情上：诗作和两本书。当他在家工作时，他用在教学上的同一股能量必须被用来做他自己的工作。这将会有效缓解他所有的身体症状。
If my suggestions here are followed the results will be almost immediate. Yet using more energy he will have more left. Success with his dream work depends precisely upon this excess energy still available at day's end. His whole physiological structure is geared to high activity. I am not speaking of nervous, erratic or undisciplined action of course.如果采用我在这里的建议，结果将会是几乎立即见效。可是使用越多能量，他剩下的能量就越多。他为梦所下的功夫要有所成，正好就得仰赖这股在一整天下来到最后还有剩余而可以取用的能量。他整体生理结构是因应高度活动而生的配备。我在说的当然不是神经紧绷、飘忽不定或毫无纪律的活动。
The energy, that propelling supportive energy, used in out-of-body projections, will give astounding results. Ruburt’s image is indeed imprinted most strongly in the mind of every child in his classes yesterday, and this focused energy made this possible. Used in a projection, the same intensity of energy would allow results that could be proven without doubt, and accepted without reservation.能量，这股支持和推动的能量，用在投射上，将产生令人惊叹的结果。昨天，鲁柏的意象其实非常强烈地铭印在他班上每一个孩子的心智里。同样的能量强度用在投射上，结果就有可能不证自明而没有怀疑，同时被人接受而毫无保留。
Put to my service during a session they would allow—the energies would allow—us to explain various principles with utmost clarity, and greatly improve our experimental data.
