He must learn to call upon this energy when he wants to. In the past he has accepted it but not understood it, nor known how to recall it. His system is simply equipped more than most to handle and utilize high energy intensities.在一节课里，用它们来为我服务，它们就会允许——这些能量就会允许——我们把各式各样的原理解释得清晰至极，大大提升我们的实验资料。他一定要学会在他想要的时候就能够召唤这股能量。过去，他接受它却不了解它，不知道如何召回它。比起大部分的人，他的系统完全是专为操控和利用高能量强度而生的配备。
In his very early adulthood there was the matter of discipline. The energy frightened him because he could not control it. Now he can. Used properly and to advantage, it will be responsible for several major breakthroughs resulting from your joint work.在成年后的最早期，他有纪律的问题。这股能量吓到他了，因为他控制不了它。现在他可以了。要是运用得当又从中获益，它就会在你们共同的工作中促成几个重大的突破。
Erratic use of high intensity energy can be disruptive to the system however, for the change of pace can be too abrupt. The system will automatically pace itself, but he must learn to demand that he himself use the energy. It is not available to all to this degree, and he has a tendency to fall back, so to speak, and not to demand the most of himself. This is when physical difficulties arise. I am not suggesting that he run full steam ahead at every moment. I am suggesting that he use the full force of his available energy for every task at hand. He does not know as yet the full strength inherent in this energy. He is a converter, his system tuned toward converting psychic energy.不过，以飘忽不定的方式使用高强度能量，可能会对系统造成破坏，因为步调的改变可能太突兀了。系统会自动调整它自己的步调，但他必须学会要求他自己使用这股能量。并非所有人都是到这种想用就有的程度，而且可以说，他有一种退却的倾向，不要求自己竭尽所能。这是在身体出现问题的时候。我并不是建议他无时无刻都要全力以赴。我是建议他把可得的能量充分运用在他手边的每一个工作上。他还不知道这股能量与生俱来的力道有多强。他是一个转化者，他的系统对准的是转化心灵能量的调频。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:34. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. She spoke while sitting down, eyes open often, pace slow with many pauses, faster toward the end of the delivery. She remembered some of the material. Resume at 9:41.)(9:34分休息。珍说她一如往常出离。她一边讲话，一边坐下来，眼睛常常睁开，速度缓慢，多次停顿。到了这段传述最后，速度变得比较快。她记得一些资料。9:41分继续。)
This is nothing you do not know, but he should be reminded.这你们都知道，但是需要提醒他。
Momentarily poor habits stopped him from focusing this energy fully into his books. Now his system will always work in this same manner. It is built to use, handle and convert high energy intensities.一时的坏习惯阻止了他，而没有把这股能量完全聚焦在他的书上。现在他的系统将会一直以同样这一种方式运作。它就是被建构来使用、操控和转化高能量强度的。
Through personal interests and background this is done through his work. When this is not done the unconverted energy is literally stopped up, and causes definite physical symptoms that represent a blockage of energy. This can lead to general nervousness as well. A vicious circle is then formed. He broods because he knows he is not working correctly, and then because he broods he cannot work correctly.凭借个人的兴趣和背景，这件事经由他的工作来完成。当这件事没有完成时，未转化的能量就会名副其实停滞不动，而造成明确的身体症状，这些症状代表能量的阻塞。这也可能导致广泛的神经质。然后一个恶性循环就成形了。他之所以郁闷，是因为他知道自己的工作方式不对，接着，因为他的郁闷，所以无法用正确的方式工作。
Circumstances or a general letdown actually lead to a point where he loses touch, you see, with this energy, and this is the basic difficulty. When this is realized then he has only to demand of himself that this energy again be used, and the system will automatically adjust itself. He has in the past changed his working area or conditions. This often was an aid, you see, simply because he set up circumstances for concentration.境况或整体的每况愈下，其实会发展到他与这股能量失去连系的节骨眼，你知道，而这就是基本的难关。如果了解这一点，他只须要求自己再一次使用这股能量就行了，系统本身便会自动调整。他在过去已经改变了他的工作区域或条件。这往往是一个助力，你知道，原因就是他为专心打造合适的环境。
The proper use of this energy is the basis for his success however in all fields of his endeavor. The teaching experience was excellent. The energy caught him quite unaware, you see, so that he could study it with some objectivity afterward.然而，在他付出努力的所有领域里，适当使用这股能量，是他成功的基础。教学经验好极了。能量对他的影响相当出乎他的意料，你看，这样一来，他就可以在事后用客观一点的态度研究它。
Your own system, Joseph, handles this energy in an entirely different fashion, and there is with you a certain feedback that works to your advantage, a certain withholding of energy that is then released. With you it leads to a maturation of images, you see. At the same time you have an alternating current, also of high intensity energy, with this maturating tendency however. You have been slower in your projection attempts, yet you will do very well when these twin currents are in harmony. I am using the current idea simply to explain. I do not mean literally two currents.约瑟，你自己的系统操控这股能量的方式完全不同，在你身上，有某种对你有利的反馈，某种程度保留之后被释放的能量。不过，由于这个逐渐成熟的倾向，同时你也有一股高强度能量的交流电。你尝试投射的行动速度比较缓慢，可是当这两股能量和谐一致时，你就会做得非常好。我用电流这个概念纯粹是为了解释而已。我并不是说真的有两股电流。
Your inner pace however depends upon alternating high energy activity. Followed by a slower period of maturation, before final conversion of energy to another form. These individualistic ways of using energy will mark your activities throughout your lifetimes. When your slower period lengthens beyond a certain point, then with you there is difficulty. However you have largely understood this on a subconscious basis, and now almost automatically make necessary inner adjustments.然而，你的内在速度取决于高能量活动的交替。接下来是一个比较缓慢的熟成期，最后能量才转化成另一种形式。终其一生，个人特有的能量使用方式都会在你们的活动上留下痕迹。当比较缓慢的时期拉长到超过某一点时，你就会遇到困难。不过，在潜意识上，对此你大部分都了解，而且现在几乎是自动做出必要的内在调整。
The level and period of your energy can be seen from a study of your dreams. Clairvoyant dreams and dreams of intuitive natures will occur in high level periods. They will also be more vivid, and the pseudo sensual impressions will appear more concrete. Projections will also be excellent. Your influence over others will be heightened, and during such periods you will project Emotions and ideas with great clearness. Negative ones, you see, as well as positive ones, so some discipline is necessary.研究你的梦，就可以看到你的能量层级和时期。千里眼的梦以及直觉性质的梦将会发生在高层级时期。它们也会比较生动，而且伪感官印象看起来会比较具象。投射也会非常好。你对其他人的影响力将会增强，而且在这样的时期，你将会投射非常清晰的情感和意念。有负面的，你知道，也有正面的，所以一定要有一些纪律才行。
Incidentally, the grandfather of your friend was legitimately connected with your light-hearted experiment the other evening.顺便一提，你朋友的祖父确实与你前几天晚上随便玩玩的实验有关联。
(Jane took a long pause, her eyes closed. Seth here refers to our table tipping experiments of Friday, October 7. That evenings fun led to the successful 73rd envelope experiment of October 10. Three couples were involved on October 7—Jane and I the Gallaghers, and Marilyn and Don Wilbur.(珍停顿良久，闭着眼睛。这里赛斯指的是我们在10月7日星期五的倾斜桌子实验。那天晚上的娱乐促成10月10日第73次信封实验的成功。10月7日那天有三对夫妻在场——珍和我、加拉格夫妇以及玛丽莲和唐·韦伯。
(When Bill, Don and I first tried tipping the table on October 7 we faked the results; this led to some rather vehement reactions on the part of the three women. Later in the evening we obtained legitimate results with the table; during one of these experiments the table told us that the communicator was Don Wilbur 's grandfather.)(当比尔、唐和我在10月7日第一次尝试倾斜桌子时，我们假造了结果；这让三个女人产生一些相当强烈的反应。那天晚上稍后，我们的桌子实验得到合理的结果；在其中一个实验期间，桌子告诉我们，通讯者是唐·韦伯的祖父。)
The whole affair would never have worked unless the belief was there, as you saw for yourself. You might ask the table for evidence some evening, and if there is a strong communicator you might get something of interest.这整件事永远不会成功，除非有信念，就像你自己看到的那样。找一天晚上，你可以要求桌子给出证据，如果有一个强大的通讯者，那你可能会得到某个有利的收获。
I also suggest that you yourselves concentrate upon the success of Ruburt’s book. It is still sailing along on the original psychic energy with which you both invested it. I believe that the figures I gave you are correct almost to a penny—at least they are very close.我也建议你们自己把注意力集中在鲁柏出书成功上。它仍然乘着最初的心灵能量航行，而且你们两人都充满了这种能量。我相信我给你们的数字正确到几乎分毫不差——至少非常接近。
(See page 99 of the 292nd session, and the 217th session.)(见第292节，以及217节。)
You may have a short break and we shall continue briefly.你可以短暂休息一下，然后我们再继续一会儿。
(Break at 10:10. Jane was out as usual, eyes open, etc. She said the cramps in her arms had seemingly disappeared; she felt much better since the start of the session. Resume at 10:21.)(10:10分休息，珍一如往常出去了，眼睛张开等等。她说她两只手臂的痉挛似乎消失了；她从这一节开始就感觉好多了。10:21分继续。)
We will be delighted to keep track of your friends when they are gone.当你们的朋友离开时，我们很高兴能够掌握他们的动态。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher leave on vacation for two weeks, beginning Monday, October 17.)(比尔和蓓从10月17日星期一开始外出度假两个星期。)
Now I have given our friend Ruburt a boost. However the suggestions must be followed for it to be permanent. If the suggestions are followed there will be no return of symptoms, nor new ones adopted. He should stay away from your friend Piper(the chiropractor) for a while at least. The problems must be solved at their basic level, and once these lessons are learned they are of benefit for the rest of your lives.现在我已经给我们的朋友鲁柏打了气。但是一定要听从建议，效果才会持久。如果有听从建议，症状就不会复发，新的症状也不会发作。他应该远离你的朋友派普尔(Piper，整脊师)至少一阵子。问题一定要从根本解决，而且一旦学会这些课，它们对你们往后的人生都是有益的。
The foot symptom is also connected here. But as it began to improve, you see, the arm symptom developed. Both will vanish, and immediately, when the proper steps which I have taken the time to outline, are followed.这里也和脚的症状有关联。但是随着它开始改善，你看，手臂的症状就出现了。只要照着我花了时间描绘的正确步骤来做，两者都会消失，而且是立刻消失。
As you know now, Ruburt handled himself well in a new situation, and that maturity gained these past two years was instantly felt. He would have hit upon the proper solution to his physical symptoms eventually on his own. This evenings session has already intuitively made great senseto him, and will save him several months of difficulties. And I take no fee.现在如你所知，鲁柏在一个新的情况中把他自己控制得很好，而且过去两年培养的成熟立刻就被感觉到了。他最终会在无意间自己发现解决方法，疗愈他的身体症状。今晚的课在直觉上已经让他觉得很有道理，接着还会帮他省掉几个月的艰苦。而且我没有心取任何费用。
(Gesture, smiling, eyes open. Then long pause, eyes closed.)(比手势，面带微笑，眼睛张开。然后长时间停顿，闭着眼睛)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
Your nieces child. (Pause.) An unfortunate circumstance will occur when she is 13, but she will recover from it. An automobile will be connected with it. There will be, I believe, two boys to join the family. At least she will have two boys.你侄女的小孩。(停顿)当她13岁的时候，一个不幸的状况将会发生，但是她会从中复原的。一辆车将会与此事产生关联。我相信，将会有两个男孩加入这个家庭。至少她将会有两个儿子。
There seems to be a divorce or separation however, and a coming back together. Something at age 8 for this new baby, a minor operation, perhaps tonsils or appendix—this sort of thing. She will have a lot of design, and a tendency toward painting. Whether it will be developed I do not know. The child will have a son who will be a professor in a subject having to do with dirt or the earth.不过，似乎有一次离婚或分居，以及一次复合。这个新生儿在8岁时发生一件事，一个小手术，也许是扁桃体或盲肠——这种事。她将会有很多设计，还有一个作画的倾向。会不会发展出来，我不知道。这孩子会有一个儿子，这个儿子将会成为教授，研究主题与土壤或土地有关。
Some animosity between the child and I believe the grandmother at a later date. Or with the child and the mother about the grandmother, on the mothers side. Brownish hair as an adult, approximately five, five, and with a love of the color red, even as your own mother. The initials SAG will be important to the child at a later date. They may represent the man she marries. An accident around an oven, about age three, with no serious aftereffects.我相信以后有一天孩子与祖母间有某种敌意。或是这孩子与母亲对祖母有敌意，母亲那一边，亦即外祖母。像成人那样的褐色头发，大约5岁，很喜欢红色，甚至和你自己的母亲一样，首字母SAG以后对这孩子很重要。它们可能代表她嫁的男人。一个发生在烤箱周围的意外事故，大约3岁的时候，没有造成任何严重的后果。
I bid you a fond good evening. My best wishes to you both. And Ruburt, I accept your thanks, now, for I have saved you much effort.我祝你们有一个惬意美好的夜晚。给你们两位我最好的祝福。还有鲁柏，我接受你的感谢，现在，因为我帮你省掉很多工夫。
(End at 10:39. Jane was out as usual. Pace slower, eyes open often. On Saturday October 8 Jane and I saw Linda's day-old baby girl, Eileen Elizabeth, at the hospital near Tunkhannock, PA. We hadn’t asked Seth for any material on the baby.)(10:39分结束。珍一如往常出去了。速度比较缓慢，双眼经常睁开。在10月8日星期六晚上，在靠近宾州特和纳[Tunkhannock ,PA]的医院里，珍和我见到琳达刚出生一天的女儿伊琳·伊丽莎白[Eileen Elizabeth]。我们并没有向赛斯询问这个婴儿的任何资料。)

SESSION 294 第294节 预测加拉格夫妇旅行的景象


OCTOBER 17, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年10月17日 星期一 晚上9点
(Ordinarily an envelope experiment would have been held this evening. Instead most of the session was devoted to Seth’s tuning in on Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who are on vacation this week in Nassau.(按照惯例，今晚原本会进行一次信封实验。但是这节大部分时间都投注在赛斯接收比尔和蓓加拉格的状况上，他们两这星期在拿骚[Nassau]度假。
(We were not supposed to know where the Gallaghers were to spend their vacation, but Peggy mentioned Nassau last Friday evening. The Gallaghers left Elmira by airplane this morning.(我们本来不知道加拉格夫妇在哪里度假，但蓓上周五晚上提到拿骚。加拉格夫妇今天早上搭机离开了埃尔迈拉。
(Jane put in her second day as a substitute teacher today, and was obviously tired by session time. She wanted to hold the session. I suggested she demand plenty of energy, as Seth said she could do in the last session. Also, Janes hip and foot had bothered her a good deal, and she told me that she had not been consistent yet in demanding the energy available to her, and in channeling it upon her books as suggested by Seth.(今天是珍当代课老师的第二天，到了这节开始的时间，她显然已经累了。她想要上课。我建议她要求很多的能量，就像赛斯在上一节说她可以做的那样。此外，珍的臀部和一只脚让她非常难受，她告诉我，她还没有按照赛斯的建议，持续要求她可用的能量，也没有一直把它引导到她的书上面。
(Jane began speaking in trance at a very slow pace; many of her pauses were relatively long; she sat with a hand raised to her closed eyes.)(珍开始在出神中讲话，速度非常缓慢；她停顿的时间有很多次相当久；她坐着，一只手举起来，放在闭着的眼睛上。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(Pause, long.) We find a nervous situation in the hip area. The recommendations I gave the other evening still strongly apply, and they have not been followed. Those recommendations represent steps that will lead to the disappearance of all symptoms. Otherwise, one disappears to be replaced by another.(停顿，时间长)我们在臀部发现一个神经的状况。我前几天晚上给的建议依然非常适用，但是没有被采纳。这些建议代表步骤,将导致所有症状的消失。否则，一个消失了，另一个又会来代替。
(Long pause at 9:06. See the 293rd session.)(9:06分长时间停顿，见第293节)
The energy must be directed toward the personality’s main work, the two books at hand, if the personality is to progress along its chosen lines.如果人格要沿着其选择的方向发展，能量必须导向人格的主要工作，即手头的两本书上。
(Long pause.) The inner conflict, you see, appears in imbalances now within the system, where sets of muscles (pause) battle with other sets: this setup, the nervous hip disorders. The recommendations I gave, faithfully followed, will completely cure the system. Half measures will not work.(长时间停顿)内在冲突，你看，现在显现于系统之内的不平衡当中，几群肌肉(停顿)与另外几群肌肉交战：这个组织结构，臀部神经失调。要是完全遵照我给的建议去做，它们就会疗愈系统。只做一半是没有用的。
Now, once again, I will help the personality relieve the symptoms. In this case, clear the left hip and leg area, and a small area in the front portion of the left shoulder. This is only a temporary benefit however, unless and until the suggested recommendations are followed completely.现在，再一次，我会帮助人格缓解症状。在这个情况下，清理左侧的臀部和腿部区域，以及左肩前方的一个小区域。不过，这只是一个暂时的助益，除非而且直到建议的方法被完全照办，否则无效。
Now as for your friends, give us a moment, please.现在，至于你们的朋友，请给我们一点时间。
(Pause at 9:11.) A charade of sorts. Could this be a night club act? I do not know. A table beside them. A man in a dark suit stands up. Something strange about the suit, as if it is the only dark-colored one close by, at least.(9:11暂停)某种比手划脚的猜谜语游戏。这有没有可能是夜店的一个活动。我不知道。他们旁边有一张桌子。一个穿着深色西装的男人站起来。那件西装有点奇怪，至少它好像是旁边唯一一件深色的西装。
A connection with M I C H, or Michigan. Have they met someone from there? A couple. Five people.与MICH或密西根州(Michigan)有关联。他们是不是遇到那里来的某个人？一对夫妻。5个人。
(Pause. Jane spoke with many pauses.) A 4 7 5, or 1475. Bill of some kind, connected with an item.(停顿。珍在讲话中停顿多次)475或1475。某种账单，与一个物件有关。
Something red connected with snorkeling. A twin advantage. The name Gert, I believe. A connection with small balls, but not made of rubber.某个与浮潜有关联的红色东西。一个双重的优势。葛特(Gert)这个名字，我相信。与许多小球有关联，但不是橡胶做的。
A hilltop with a cross on top. A building or part of a building where they stay now, where there is a long narrow section, a roof supported, a flat roof I believe, long and narrow, supported by posts with a floor not of wood. Perhaps of cement—but of a stone, definitely a stone顶端有一个十字架的山丘。他们现在住的一栋建筑物或一栋建筑物的局部，其中有一个狭长的部分，一个有支撑的屋顶，一个平坦的屋顶，又长又窄，由柱子支撑着，还有一面地板，不是木地板。也许是水泥地板——一定是石头地板，绝对是石头地板
(Jane gestured, eyes closed, as though trying to pin down her thought) or sand-colored stone floor.(珍比了手势，闭着眼睛，好像设法要确定她的想法似的)或是沙子颜色的石头地板。
This could be a verandah.这可能是一个凉台。
Outside of their door, I believe, a large bucket of sorts filled with sand for cigarettes. Fairly good size. This verandah sticking out, with some rocks beneath, and beyond that the ocean or bay.在他们的门外，我相信，有一个桶子之类的东西，装满熄烟用的沙子。相当不错的尺寸。这个凉台往外突出，底下有一些岩石，在那之外是海洋或海湾。
Right at the shore, perhaps directly down and ahead, a scooped-out circular(gesture) indention, where there is swift current because of rocks. And at this particular point, by this indention, no beach, though there is a beach to the left and right. Rather wide ones.就在岸右边，也许在前面的正下方，有一个被挖空的圆形(比手势)凹地，因为岩石的关系，那里水流急速。而且就在这一个地点，在这个凹地旁边，没有海滩。但是在左右两边都有一片海滩。相当宽广的海滩。
A twist or something twisted. 7 o'clock and dinner where there are many boats close by. Some of these sailboats.一次扭转，或某个被扭转的东西。7点钟在附近有很多船的地方晚餐。这些船有些是帆船。
(Pause.) A waitress with some mark visible on the arm. A dark mark or bruise perhaps, (pause) or this could be a parch of dark freckles. But very noticeable; or a scar.(停顿)一名手臂上有某个可见标记的女服务生。或许是一个深色的标记或瘀青，(停顿)这也可能是一片深色的雀斑。但是非常显眼；或者是一道疤痕。
Eight-fifteen, again by water, but this time in a more Spanish sort of environment. A green cabaret(gesture), a nuisance there. A half-completed structure with many windows. 18 shrubs. I do not know to what this refers. And some small natural items that look like coal, perhaps deposits of some sort.8——15，又是在水边，但这次是比较西班牙式的环境。一间绿色的歌舞秀夜总会(比手势)，那里有人闹事。一个半完成的结构，有很多窗户。18棵灌木。我不知道这是指什么。还有一些天然的东西，看起来像煤炭，也放是某种矿床。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:28. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes had begun to open fairly often, and had been very dark. She said her tense hip already felt better.(9:28分休息。珍一如往常出离。她的眼睛已经很常睁开，而且颜色非常深。她说她紧绷的臀部感觉已经比较好了。
(Jane had mental images of some of the above material and that to follow, and these will be summarized at the end of the session. We could only hope that on some of the specific details given by Seth, the Gallaghers had noticed also. I asked Jane if she thought it possible for her to be more specific about place names, initials, etc. in the data, since anything like this would help when we checked this material with the Gallaghers.(针对上述资料的其中一些有许多心象，接下来，在这节最后会概述这些心象。我们只能希望赛斯给的一些具体细节，加拉格夫妇也注意到了。我问珍，她认为自己有没有可能让资料中的地点名称、缩写等等更加明确，因为在我们与加拉格夫妇核对资料时，任何像这样的东西都会有帮助。
(We arrived at the idea of similes for some of the specific material, in case the idea of being exact scared Jane off, and she said she thought the”green cabaret” data might be a case in point.(对于一些具体的资料，我们一致认为是明喻，以防万一珍被精准这个想法吓跑，而且珍说她认为“绿色的歌舞秀夜总会”资料可能就是最好的一个例子。
(Janes pace had picked up somewhat as break approached, and she resumed in this new manner, though still with pauses, at 9:35.)(珍的速度在接近休息时开始稍微加快，在9:35分，她以这个新的方式继续，但还是时而停顿。)
The name of one establishment has to do with twin, or two.一个机构的名称一定和双重或二有关系。
One has to do with a cluster of things, and a group or a group like a nest, for example. One to do with green.一定是和一大堆东西，以及一群或比方说，像一个巢那样一群有关系的一个。与绿色有关系的一个。
A J R or a J B, not having to do with Ruburt.一个JR或一个JB，和鲁柏没有关系。
A missionary place. 1671, to do with scrolls. With a dungeon or somewhat dungeon like area connected. In a north section, though not strictly due north, and perhaps 125 for a tour.... This is not the name but it is a connection: it is not the name: Abbe La Blanc.一个传教的地方。1671，和卷轴有关。与一个地牢或有点像地牢的区域有关联。在北边的一个部分，但不见得是正北，而且也许导览一次125……这不是一个名称，而是一个连结：它不是一个名称：阿贝·拉·白朗(Abbe La Blanc)。
(Jane pronounced this haltingly, and Abbe La Blanc is my interpretation of what she said.)(珍发这个字的音结结巴巴的，阿贝·拉·白朗是我自己对她说的字所做的解读)
Red globular objects there, and another language.那里有红色球状物体，以及另一种语言。
(Pause.)(停顿)
A connection here I do not understand, concerning cold, frigid or frosty. Drafty. And with many deaths in the past. A particular grown woman’s ensemble in a store with an orange awning, or in the window with a high price tag. A three-piece outfit.这里有一个我不了解的连结，与冰冷、寒冷或严寒有关。通风良好。在过去有很多人死亡。某一套成年女人的服装，在一间有橘色遮雨篷的商店里，或是在橱窗内，挂着高价的吊牌。一套三件式的服装。
(See the 286th session, in which Seth discusses the ways in which he picks up experimental data, translates it, etc.)(见第286节，赛斯讨论他接收实验资料、翻译它等等所用的方法。)
I pick up one two five again here, and I believe our friend the cat lover(Peggy Gallagher) enters the shop, and that the ensemble is in the window. (Pause.) La Rue(my interpretation), I do not know, a street, or does she rue having entered the shop, you see. The street having to do with flowers, this particular street. Flowers in the name perhaps. And with a traffic problem in the heart of a town, with a crystal connection.这里我再一次接收到两个5，我相信我们的朋友，那个爱猫人(蓓·加拉格)进入那家店，那一整套服装就在橱窗里。(停顿)拉·吕(我的解读[La Rue ,译注：在法文中，rue是路、街的意思])，我不知道，一条街，或是她后悔进了那家店(译注：在英文中，rue是后悔的意思)，你看。这条街和花有关系，这条特定的街。也许花就在街名当中。而且和一个城镇市中心的一个交通问题，以及和水晶有关联。
(Jane's pace was now good, her eyes open often.) 1781 and a jail. 1842 and a museum. 1589 and an evacuation of people. A hole in terms of a structure, or the ruins of a structure. 1461 and a fountain with steps leading to it. (Seth rattled these dates off rapidly.) A circular formation(gesture) surrounded by flowers I believe, with closely-crowded, old, at least second-story structures to the left side of the street, or close to the street and nearly identical in rows.(珍的速度现在很好，眼睛经常睁开)1781年和一座监狱。1842年和一座博物馆。1589年和一次撤离。我不知道撤离是一个洞还是一次人民的集体撤离：就一个结构而言的一个洞或一个结构的废墟，1461年和一个有台阶通向它的喷泉。(赛斯连珠炮似地快速说出这些年代)一个圆形的格式(比手势)，我相信四周围绕着花，街道左边或靠近街道，有几排简直一模一样，至少两层楼的结构。
A commemoration of a stabbing. A statue. I do not know here. It is connected with a general, but I believe the man whose image is represented by the statue stabbed the general. It would seem to be the commemoration of a murder to me. Either 1861 or 16, I am not sure.一次刺杀事件的纪念。一座雕像。这里我不知道。它和一个将军有关联，但我相信雕像所代表的男人刺杀了将军。在我看来，它好像是纪念一个谋杀事件。不是1861年就是16年，我不确定。
Metal connected with the statue (pause) and it seems a modern street light very close nearby. (Pause.) Connected with this, very dim here: Concordiant. (Pause; my interpretation; her eyes closed, Jane attempted to write in the air with a finger the words she tried to pronounce.) De, I believe, seven—Savrantinos (halting pronunciation) I said concordi—Concordiat de Savrantino.与雕像有关联的金属(停顿)，而且在很近的地方似乎有一盏时髦的街灯。(停顿)与这个有关，非常模糊：康寇迪安特(Concordiant[停顿：我的解释；珍的眼睛闭着，试图找一根手指在空中写出她设法发音的字])。De(德)，我相信，7——Savrantinos(萨弗兰提诺斯[结结巴巴的发音])我说康寇迪(concordi)——康寇迪尔特·德·萨弗兰提诺斯(Concordiat de Savrantino)。
Date. We are still trying for dates, you see. Sixteen eight three. Two, 1724, 1721. San Josius (my interpretation) san,’s A N.... (Pause.)日期。我们还在设法接收日期，你知道。16、8、3。2，172——1721。圣荷西奥斯(San Josius[我的解读])圣，SAN……(停顿)。
A memorial commemorating the beginning of a revolution or a war. The San Joseo is not correct exactly.纪念一场革命或战争的一个纪念物。圣荷西欧(San Joseo)也不太对。
(My interpretation.) San Juan? Question mark there.圣胡安(San Juan)？那里加个问号。
A battle fought originally by the sea. (Gesture of puzzlement.) Is the term galleons... ships?最初在海边开打的一场战役。(表示困惑的手势)galleons(译注：15到18世纪间用作商船或军舰的大型帆船)这个字是……船只吗？
(“Yes.” The word galleon appeared to be strange to Jane.)(“是的。”galleon这个字在珍看来有点奇怪。)
A queen who dies on Friday in another land, had something to do with the battle.在另一个国家，一位于周五死亡的皇后与这场战役有关系。
(Pause.) The hero, represented in a statue, had once been a cobbler, and came from a place that sounds like Guatemala, though this is not precise. The name is like this: San Guatama?(My interpretation.) San Guatgma?(停顿)由一座雕像代表的英雄曾经是鞋匠，来自一个听起来像瓜地马拉(Guatamala)的地方，但这不准确。地名是像这样：圣瓜地马拉？(San Guatamala，我的解读)圣瓜地马拉？
(Pause.) And had two brothers. One brother working against him in these politics.(停顿)而且有两个兄弟。一个兄弟在这些政治活动中与他作对。
Now. This statue, with the row houses to the left and the street light: Following around the curve to the left, you run into a better-sectioned area, up a hill on a broad street now.现在。这个雕像，左边有成排的房间和街灯：顺着弯曲处转向左边，现在你就来到一个地段更好的区域，在一条宽阔大街的斜坡上面。
(Pause, eyes closed. Later Jane was to say she was seeing this within, while yet being aware of still sitting in her chair. )Then the street curves again to the left, and beneath it are rocks—that is, a rocky ledge down to the sea, I believe.(停顿，眼睛闭着。后来珍说她在内心里看见这个，可是同时又知道她还坐在椅子上)然后这条街又再次弯向左边，而且它的底下是岩石——也就是说，一座往下延伸到海边的石矶岩坡，我相信。
To the right just before this last left-hand turn and hill, is a fairly low building where I believe our friends eat, or at least they visit here. This place is fairly modern, and fairly it would seem American by contrast to other places they visit. But only by contrast.就在最后这个左弯处和斜坡的右边，有一栋相当低矮的建筑物，我相信我们的朋友在这里用餐，或至少来访过。这个地方相当时髦，而且对比他们去过的其他地方，这里似乎也颇有美国风。但只是对比的效果而已。
Further on at the top of the hill, at the left-hand turn, is another white building at the curve, that is a new building. Now I believe our friends stay somewhat further up this same road, for the night. A saint here, and a gorge. Or perhaps this is Saint George.在山顶上再过去，在左手边的转弯处，有另一栋建筑位于弯角，那是一栋新的建筑物。现在我相信我们的朋友就住在同样这条路更上面一点的地方。这里有一个圣人(saint)，还有一个峡谷(gorge)。或者，这也许是圣乔治(Saint George)。
(Smile.)(微笑)
Now you may take a break or end the session.现在你可以休息一下，也可以结束这一节。
(“Well end it then.”)(“那我们就结束吧。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both. My friend will feel much better for the evening, and if my suggestions are followed the improvement will be permanent.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。我的朋友今晚会感觉好多了，如果照着我的建议做，就会有持久的改善。
(“Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:06. Jane was well dissociated this List delivery. Her pace had been faster, her eyes open often. She said her hip felt much better. It is now Wednesday as I write this; yesterday Jane began putting Seth’s suggestions into effect; she was pleased to report no trouble yesterday or today, in contrast to her unhappy state of Monday, October 17. She is back at work on her dream book.(10:06分结束。珍在最后这段传述中顺利出离。她的速度一直都比较快，双眼经常睁开。她说她的臀部感觉好多了。我现在写这个的时间是星期三；昨天珍开始实行赛斯的建议。她高兴地说，对比她在10月17日星期一的不快乐状态，昨天或今天都没有问题。她又开始提笔写她谈梦的那本书。
(Jane had some images while speaking in trance. She felt”really in" during the last delivery especially. While talking about the road going up the hill she saw it pretty well, she said, as though she were more there than here. However she was still aware that she sat in a rocking chair; she wasn't floating along the road in Nassau, fully separated from her physical body.(珍在出神中讲话时有一些画面。尤其是在最后的传述时，她感觉“真的身在其中”。在叙述那条上坡路的同时，她很清楚地看见它，好像她在那里而不是在这里。不过，她仍然知道她坐在一张摇椅上；她没有沿着拿骚的那条路漂浮，完全脱离她的肉体。
(She said the time was approximately early evening—at least neither bright daylight or fully night. The road showed up white. While talking about the statue opposite the row houses, she did not see the statue, she said, but was aware of it nevertheless. She thought the statue might have been on an “island" in the center of the road. She could follow the road around the curves, etc., and saw it in correct perspective as it went up the hill.(她说时间大约是傍晚——至少天不是很亮但也非全黑的时候。路出现时是白色的。她说，在叙述成排房屋对面的雕像时，她没有看见雕像，但对它还是有觉知。她认为雕像可能是在路中央的一座“安全岛”上。她能够沿着路转弯等等，在它往山坡上延伸时，她也从正确的视角看见它。
(The building, a restaurant or whatever, at the foot of the hill was fairly American, she said, compared to the large white building at the top of the curving road and hill. The Gallaghers stayed beyond the large white building, and Jane had the impression that there the buildings were sparser.(她说，在山脚下的建筑物，一家餐厅之类的，相较于弯路和山丘顶端的白色大型建筑物，颇为美式风格。加拉格夫妇住在白色大型建筑物再过去的地方，而珍的印象是，那里的建筑物比较稀少。
(I tried to pin her down on details of the hill, since this would be somewhat unusual on an island like Nassau, which as far as I know is quite low-lying. Neither of us have ever been there. For that matter we do not have Seth’s word for it, in so many words, that the Gallaghers are on Nassau; we surmise this because of what Peggy said last Friday night, October 14.(我试着让她说出山丘的细节，因为在拿骚这样一个岛上，这是不寻常的，因为就我所知，这个岛多半是低地。我们两个都没去过那里。就此而言，我们不相信赛斯说的，用这么多字句说的，加拉格夫妇在拿骚；我们会这么推测，是因为蓓在10月14日星期五晚上说的话。
(The closest Jane could come on the hill details, then, is that it was a longer and gradual incline rather than a short upright climb; and that it raised up perhaps the height of a one-story building in the course of its climb. The best we can say is that this geography sounds possible for those islands.(所以，在山丘的细节上，珍可以给出的资料，最接近的就是，它是一座比较长的缓升坡，而不是短的陡升坡；在它爬升的路径上，上升高度也许有一层楼建筑那样高。我们能说的最多就是，听起来那些岛是可能有这种地形的。
(Jane emphasized that she knows nothing of the history of the Caribbean islands, or their geography. I have a fair general knowledge, but know little about Nassau in detail, for instance. I am good at map reading, Jane very poor; if the place names were eliminated from a map of the Caribbean, Jane would be unable to fill them in, whereas I could do this easily. On the other hand Jane has an unerring sense of local direction, and mine is not very good.(珍强调她对加勒比海群岛的历史或地理环境一无所知。我有相当笼统的认识，但是对拿骚的相关细节所知甚少。我擅长阅读地图，珍很不在行；如果在加勒比海的地图上消除地名，珍就没办法一一对上了，但是我却可以轻松做到。另一方面，珍的方向感很准，但是我的不太好。
(Jane said again that although she talked about the statue she never did see it for some reason. But she had images of the row houses behind or beside it. Jane pointed out also that one would expect such dates as she gave in connection with island history in the Caribbean, and that such things as dungeons, galloons, etc., would be involved. The interpretation of much of this data will also depend on what the Gallaghers remember.(珍再一次说，虽然她谈到雕像，但基于某种原因她从来没有见过它。不过她倒是有雕像后方或旁边一排排房屋的画面。珍也指出，讲到加勒比海群岛的相关，大家预期的就是她给的这种资料，而且也会涉及像地牢、大帆船等等这样的东西。这个资料的解读大部分也将取于加拉格夫妇的记忆。
(On a few occasions in the past we have had instances where Seth insisted a certain sight, or object, was there for the seeing, at a location visited by one of our friends taking part in an experiment; the friend however, with no memory of whatever Seth happened to be talking about, simply could not verify Seth.)(在过去的几个场合中，我们有过许多实例是，赛斯坚持在一个我们某一位参加过实验的友人拜访过的地点那里，可以看见某一个景象或物体；然而这位友人对赛斯刚好说到的事物却毫无记忆，根本无法证实赛斯的说法。)

SESSION 295 第295节 疾病与记忆


OCTOBER 19, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年10月19日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking in a quiet voice and with many brief pauses. Her eyes began to open almost at once.)(珍开始以一种安静的声音讲话，有很多次短暂停顿。她的眼睛几乎立刻开始睁开。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
A brief note to Ruburt.给鲁柏一个简短的提醒。
He saw how the annoying hip condition vanished when he followed the outlined recommendations. This is not because I made the recommendations. It is because I knew the conditions that his own system demanded.当他听从已经概述的建议时，他看到臀部的恼人状况消失了。这并不是因为我提出了建议，而是因为我知道他的系统要求的这些状况。
The symptoms are being reduced, and are vanishing in reverse order. So to speak, the last ones vanishing first you see. I am mentioning this in line with an article you both read on memory.症状正在减轻，而且正以反向的顺序消失中。可以说，最后消失的就是你最先看到的。我提起这个是基于你们两人读过一篇谈记忆的文章。
(“Pills to Help Us Remember”, by Isaac Asimov. The New York Times Magazine, October 9,1966.)(伊萨克·阿斯墨[Isaac Asimov]〈帮助我们记忆的药丸〉[Pills to Help Us Remember]。1966年10月9日的《纽约时报》[New Your Time]。)
Illness in many ways is a learned response, and it follows patterns set up in the system having to do with memory banks, though we shall find a better word here.疾病在很多方面是一种后天习得的反应，遵循系统中建立的模式，与记忆库有关系，不过这里我们应该找一个更好的字。
Habitual illness will follow the lines of learned response and memory. Definite molecular substructures are formed biologically in response to inner electrical charges. The inner electrical charges are not a part of the physical system as such, you see. But they act within the physical structure, forming then definite changes in the RNA patterns.习惯性的疾病会沿着后天习得的反应和记忆路线走。在生理上形成明确的分子次结构，以因应内在的电荷。内在电荷并不是肉体系统的一部分，你知道。但是它们在身体结构之内行动，形成RNA(译注：核糖核酸[Ribonucleic acid]，可以比喻成DNA的双胞胎分身，两者结构非常相似，基因所要传递的讯息实际上由RNA负责运作，并具有调控基因表达的作用)模式当中的明确变化。
There was some question in the article about long-term and short-term memory. Now basically the original intensity of the charge determines its duration in your time structure. The intensity of particular charges can completely reorganize the personality structure through changes in the RNA formations.文章中有某个问题与长期记忆和短期记忆有关。现在，基本上电荷的原始强度决定它在你们的时间结构中历时多久。特定电荷的强度可能透过RNA的形态变化完全重组人格结构。(9:10分长时间停顿)存在电磁层面的前世记忆可能携带如此高强度的电荷，以至于叠加在当下的身体结构中，形成了记忆模式，而与当下自我人格的记忆模式颇为格格不入。
(Long pause at 9:10.) Previous life memories, existing electronically and magnetically, may carry such intense charge that they superimpose themselves in the present physical structure, and form memory patterns quite alien to those of the present ego personality.我们在这些方面有很多要说的，而且不久就会讨论到疾病与记忆。
We will have much to say along these lines, and a discussion of illness and memory will be shortly given.不过，一旦身体症状实际出现在这个系统之内，某种程度上，它们就已经如同任何其他已经建立的模式被接受了，至少被人格的一个部分接受了。在一些案例中，身体症状可能实际上构成一个略微独立的次人格(subpersonality)结构。很多慢性病人的情形就是这样。
Once physical symptoms actually appear within this system however, they are to some extent accepted as any other established pattern, at least by a portion of the personality. In some cases physical symptoms can actually make up a somewhat independent supersonality structure. This is the case with many chronically-ill individuals. The destructive tendencies are collected about a particularly Emotionally charged group of reactions, and cut off from the dominant personality.破坏倾向聚集在一组充满情绪电荷的反应四周，与支配人格隔绝。
These portions operate almost like a secondary personality, sometimes in actual conflict with the dominant one. Finally, you see, cases develop where the dominant personality is not in control of the physical image at all. Certain classic cases of hysteria can show this in a limited but dramatic fashion.这些部分运作得几乎像是一个第二人格(secondary personality或译次人格),有时候与支配人格会有实际的冲突。最后，你看，在支配人格根本无法控制肉体形象时，病情就发展出来了。某些典型的歇斯底里病例可能以一种有限但戏剧性的方式显示这个现象。
I am not denying at all that physical changes do occur, for this is all the more the pity. But the basic causes must be uncovered, and in some such cases, in many in fact, these causes lie to a large degree in faulty or inadequate memory functions. I am simply using Ruburts minor symptoms as a springboard here. They are now being erased, the latest ones the first to go.我完全不是在否认身体确实会产生变化，因为这样就更令人遗憾了。但是基本的病因一定要揭露才行，而在某些这样的病例中，事实上在很多病例中，这些病因很大程度出在有缺陷或无法胜任的记忆功能上。我在这里只是利用鲁柏的小症状作跳板。它们现在正在消除中，最后到的，最先走。
This would imply short-term memory you see, but this is not the case, for it is intensity and not duration that makes the difference. Once the symptoms become physical however, then they follow physical patterns, and it takes the physical system some time to heal usually, (underlined). In terms of intensity alone, both the foot and the hip symptoms were highly charged, representing of course degrees of immobility and withdrawal—learned, you see, from the mother: a memory reaction adopted without conscious thought.这暗指短期记忆，你看，但这个案例并非如此，因为造成差别的是强度和持续时间。然而，一旦症状变成实质，它们就会遵循身体模式，如此一来，身体系统通常(划线)必须花上一些时间才能疗愈。单单就强度而言，脚部和臀部两者的症状都高度充电，当然代表不同程度的行动不便和退缩——你看，从母亲身上学来的；不曾经过有意识的思考就采纳的一个记忆反应。
The recommendations automatically set up readjustments, and, you will note, almost instantly. In the case of the foot the muscles have been misused and will take a while to completely repair themselves. Suggestion however will speed the process. An instant cure is possible, but he is not at that point.这些建议自动产生调整，而且，你会注意到，几乎是立即有效。在脚部的状况中，肌肉一直被误用，它们需要一阵子才会完全修复。无论如何，这些建议将会加速此一过程。立刻治愈是可能的，但他现在还不到那个时候。
At the very latest however, with these recommendations faithfully followed, all symptoms should leave the foot at the end of a two-week period, completely. The hip symptom is gone for good, if the recommendations are followed. The less annoying arm difficulties are a result of the muscular tension caused by the foot difficulty, but these should disappear completely now within two or three days.不过，要是切实遵守这些建议，所有的症状最晚应该在两周过后就会彻底消除。比较不恼人的手臂问题是脚部问题造成肌肉紧绷的一个结果，但现在不出两三天，这些症状应该都会全部消失。
Now each personality has set up conditions for itself, under which it can operate at its best. When these are upset various difficulties show themselves, until the conditions are met again, or until a new system of adequate conditions are settled upon. In Ruburts case the conditions mentioned earlier, in our last sessions, operate to his best advantage. Every effort should be made to maintain them, for they will bring about the highest conditions of maturity possible for his personality structure.现在每个人格都会自己设定了条件，它在那之下可以尽其所能运作。当这些条件被扰乱了，各种不同的难题就会自行出现，直到条件再一次被满足为止，或直到一个条件充足的新系统被建立为止。在鲁柏的病况中，之前在我们上一节提到的条件为了发挥他最大的优势而运作。应该要付出每一分努力来维持它们，因为它们将会造就出他的人格结构能力所及的最高成熟状态。
Once symptoms are accepted they can return, for the memory pattern is never completely erased, but only bypassed. For various reasons having to do with past-life experiences, writing has become a structure within which the personality best operates. Psychic development has been welded onto this. As long as he faithfully and consistently follows these lines he will operate at maximum levels. When he falters he lets himself in for difficulties.一旦症状被接受了，它们就会回来，因为记忆模式永远不会完全抹灭，只能绕过。基于种种与前世经验有关的原因，写作已经变成一个结构，人格在其中运作得最为顺畅。心灵的发展已经与这个结构融合。只要他始终如一地切实沿着这些路线走，他就会在最大的层面上运作。当他动摇时，他就会遇到难关。
Every personality operates in this manner. These are simply his peculiar psychological necessities. This obviously does not mean he need never take time out. It does mean that his overall identity will not stand for a protracted period when concentration is not primarily locused within this work framework.每一个人格都是以这种方式运作。这些只不过是他特有的心理需求而已。这显然不是说他永远不需要暂停。这是说，当专注力主要不是集中在这个工作架构之内时，他全部的本体不会拉长停滞的时间。
I had forgotten your hands. You may of course take your break.我忘了你的手。你当然可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:34. Jane was pretty far-out, she said. Her pace had become fast, her eyes open often. She said the concepts had been piling up ahead of her, and that Seth was all set to talk even faster. Resume at 9:42.)(9:34休息。珍说她出去得相当远。她的速度变得比较快，两眼经常张开。珍说概念在她面前一直堆叠，赛斯都准备好了，打算讲得更快。9:42继续。)
For Ruburts benefit, there is indeed no danger of immobility as in his mother's case.为了鲁柏好，的确没有任何像他母亲那样不良于行的危险。
His personality structure is different, and he has other qualities to counteract against the obsessive tendencies inherited from his mother. The turning point has been reached and passed however in this last episode. He learned from it, and what he has learned will stand him in good stead. Because of the lesson his peaks of achievement will be higher, and his overall physical condition instantly will show improvement.他的人格结构是不同的，而且他拥有其他的特质，可以反制遗传自他母亲的强迫倾向。不管怎样，在最后这一个事件中，转折点已经到了，也过了。他从中学到教训，而且学到的东西将会让他站稳脚步。因为这个教训，他的成就高峰将会一山比一山高，而且整体身体状况的好转也会立刻显现。
I will say only that he did have a dream experience of deep therapeutic nature; since we have other things in mind for the session we shall proceed to them.我只会说他确实有过一个深层疗愈性质的梦经验；由于我们这一节还有其他事情要做，所以我们要开始处理它们了。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
(“No. ’’)(“没有。”)
Then we shall see what we can do with your friends. Give us a moment, please.那我们就来看看我们可以为你们的朋友做什么。请等我们一下。
(Seth refers to Bill and Peggy Gallagher, on vacation on Nassau this week.)(赛斯是指这周在拿骚度假的比尔和蓓加拉格。)
Motorcycles through streets, or bicycles. But many other vehicles beside cars—instead of cars, that is. 4758. I do not know to what this refers just now.机车穿梭街道，或自行车。但是有很多其他的交通工具，除了汽车之外——也就是说，不是汽车。4758。目前我不知道这是指什么。
A loaf of bread. Do they bring a loaf of bread to their room? Something they intended to do today and did not do. A particular journey I believe, planned but not taken.一条面包。他们是不是带了一条面包到他们的房间？某件他们今天打算做但没有去做的事。一趟特定的旅程，我相信，计划了但没有实行。
They receive a message of sorts today. The name Veronica. This is not necessarily connected with the message. Some dim connection with Ovid.他们今天收到某种讯息。薇若妮卡(Veronica)这个名字。这不一定和讯息有关联。与奥维德(Ovid)有模糊的连结。
A private estate that catches their eye, with an iron fence about it, or gate—and a gate. A strange marketplace that does not sell vegetables. A Spanish woman with a young son. A tour taken to the south, perhaps by boat and bus. A place that sounds like Grenada(my interpretation), that has a connection with nuts. Exports nuts, I believe.一座私人庄园吸引了他们的目光，周围有铁制篱笆，或栅栏门——以及一扇大门。一个奇怪的市场，不卖蔬菜。一个带着一名幼子的西班牙女人。一趟往南走的旅程，也许是搭船和巴士。一个听起来像格瑞那达(Gernada)的地方(我的解读)，与坚果有关联。外销坚果，我相信。
A group of six, and a small room that looks like an elevator. They are crowded. A serious disagreement between the Gallaghers. Perhaps concerning a purchase.一堆6，以及一个小房间，看起来像一个电梯。他们很拥挤。加拉格夫妇之间有一连串争执。也许和购物有关。
A 7 o’clock appointment at a place with mainly white decor—white tablecloths, white waiters uniforms. A stage for a band. A girl wearing a skirt with long red fringe dances. The place is close to the road. A sign lit up in the center of a palm tree out front. Somehow the letter U is prominent. For example, though this is not the name: U-bango, with the large U.一场7点的约会，在一个装潢以白色为主的地方——白色桌布、服务生的白色制服。一个乐园的一座舞台，一个女孩穿着一条有红色长流苏的裙子在跳舞。这个地方靠近马路。在门前的一棵棕榈树正中央有一个招牌亮着灯。不知为何U这个字母很显眼。例如，但名称不是这个：U-bango，有一个大写的U。
(Gesture.)(比手势)
A grip, G-R-I-P, connected here. Places close by seem to be somewhat on stilts. Brown colored. They seem to be shingled, ramshackle, stilted from the back but level at the front to the street. These to the right of the building just mentioned. And sand or a beach behind them. Several of these ramshackle like structures. At least they are far from new.一个抓握，G-R-I-P，与这里有关联。附近许多地方似乎不知为何坐落在支柱上。颜色是棕色。它们的屋顶似乎是木瓦。这些就在刚才提过的建筑物右边。而且它们的后面有沙子或一座海滩。这些有几间像是快要解体的结构。至少它们谈不上是新的。
They do not seem to have much unity, though they are all closely connected.它们似乎不太统一，但它们全都紧密相连。
(Long pause.) I do not understand. Here I pick up an Osborne connection. I do not know to what it refers. Perhaps to a discussion of the Kennedy assassination. Ruburt has been reading about this again however, so we are not sure on this.(长时间停顿)我不了解。这里我接收到一个与奥斯本(Osborne)的关联。我不知道它是指什么。也许是指肯尼迪遇刺的一场讨论会。可是鲁柏又在读与之相关的东西，所以对此我们不确定。
An eleven, or one one one designation. A small shack by the water, with some red on it, by some rocks, where the Jesuit(Bill Gallagher) goes underwater. A sign on it with four letters, five at the most.一个11，或111的名称。水边的一个小屋，上面有些红色，靠近某些岩石，耶稣会士的潜水之处。它上面的招牌有4个字母，最多5个。
(Long pause.)(长时间停顿)
Something added to the schedule that had not been planned for the day. Perhaps involving a northeast location, or a northeast section of another location. A center room with pale walls, first floor, where they stay a night.加在行程表上的某件事，不在当天的计划中。也许和东北方的一个地点，或另一个地点的东北区域有关。一个正中央的房间，有着灰白的墙壁，在一楼，他们在此住了一晚。
You may take a break, or we shall end the session as you prefer.你可以休息一下，或者你更想要结束这一节的话，我们就结束。
(“We’ll take the break.”(“我们休息一下。”
(Break at 10:07. Jane was again well dissociated, her eyes open often. Her pace was not quite as fast, since I asked her to slow down at last break.(10:07分结束。珍再一次顺利出离，她的双眼经常睁开。她的速度不如之前那么快，因为我在上一次休息时要求她慢一点。
(In the last session Jane had many images to report while giving the Gallagher data. Tonight she recalled one main image. This was of the brown structures on stilts, she said. When Seth mentioned shingles, Jane felt she was so far away from these buildings that she could ”see” only a roughened surface. This scene was also at night.(在上一节，珍有很多她在给加拉格夫妇资料的同时出现的画面。今晚她想起主要的一个画面。这是架在支柱上的棕色结构，她说。当赛斯提到木瓦时，珍感觉她距离这些建筑物如此遥远，以至于她能够“看到的”只有一个粗糙的表面。此外这个景象是在夜间。
(There was some kind of light, Jane said, perhaps from the building next door. The dark brown color of the buildings was hard for her to see. The night wasn’t pitch black, but not as bright as under a full moon. Jane could see stilts in the back of the shacks, as dark lines against a lighter background. She saw a mass of buildings in together, close together, and it was difficult to distinguish detail.(珍说，有某种灯光，也许来自隔壁的建筑物。建筑物的深棕色让她难以看清。夜色并非漆黑，但也不像满月之下那么清亮。珍看得到那些小屋后面的支柱，在一个比较淡的背景衬托下的黑色线条。她看见一大堆建筑物聚集在一起，靠得很近，难以分辨细节。
(Jane resumed at a more leisurely pace at 10:17.)(10:17分，珍以更加从容不迫的方式继续。)
A torn page of a pad or notebook, with numbers written on it, either for the Jesuit or in his handwriting. A page number 397 connected with him. A brown book. An invasion in the place to the south mentioned earlier. In 1471 and 1732. Connection with small nuggets here. The Jesuit thinks strongly how computers could change the islands, and discusses this with some heat or enthusiasm with another man, I believe, who wears a gray or white jacket, and a sporty hat.从一本便条簿或笔记簿撕下的一页，上面写着数字，不是写给耶稣会士，就是他自己的笔迹。与他有关联的一个页码397。一本褐色的书。之前提过的一个南部地方有一场入侵。在1471年和1732年。这里与小金属块有关联。耶稣会士强烈认为电脑可以改变这些群岛，而与另一个男人为这事发生有些激烈或热血的讨论，我相信，那个男人穿着一件灰色或白色的夹克，戴了一顶运动帽。
A calendar. Does someone give him a calendar? Some connection with a stolen item. The word severin. (My interpretation) I do not know to what this refers. A chain and a rocket.一个日历。是不是有人给了他一本日历？与一个被偷的物件扔某种关联。severin这个字。(我的解读)我不知道这是指什么。一条链子和一个火箭。
We will now end our session. My heartiest regards to you both.我们现在要结束我们的课了。向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:25. Jane was not as far-out this delivery, she said, as during the two previous ones. She was conscious of various sounds in the house while speaking.(10:25分结束。珍说她这次传述不像前两次出去得那么远。她在讲话时对房子里各式各样的声音是有意识的。
(She reported no more images. She confirmed that Seth had said a chain and a rocket. I had wondered if a chain and a locket had been intended.)(她说不再有任何画面。她确认赛斯说一条链子和一个火箭。我想知道一条链子和一个火箭是不是他的本意。)

SESSION 296 第296节 核对加拉格夫妇旅行中的景象 信封74


OCTOBER 24, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年10月24日 星期一 晚上9点
(The envelope object was a bill I had received this afternoon for art supplies, and which Jane had never seen. Jane does know the proprietor of the Art Shop, Marjorie Buck, who made out the bill. The object is printed in dark blue ink on yellow paper, with the writing in carbon blue. The large number at the bottom is in red; the back of the bill is blank. I placed the object, folded once, as indicated, between the usual two pieces of Bristol, then sealed it in double envelopes.(信封标的物是我今天下午购买美术用品的一张账单，珍从来没见过。珍的确认识艺术商店[The Art Shop]的店主玛裘莉·巴克[Marjorie Buck]，账单就是她开出的。标的物是用深蓝色印刷在黄色纸张上，手写字则是碳蓝色。底部的大型数字是红色；账单背面是空白。如图所示，我把标的物折叠一次之后放在两片普通西卡纸之间，然后密封在双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking in trance in a quiet voice with many brief pauses. Her eyes soon began to open.)(珍开始在出神中讲话，声音相当安静，有很多次短暂的停顿。她的眼睛很快就开始睁开。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We will keep our session fairly brief for your convenience, Joseph.为了你的方便，约瑟，我们这一节的时间会相当短。
Now. We are speaking of probabilities, my friend. Your own wishes, expectations and attitudes gave rise to this assignment from your acquaintance, Ward. You did this quite unconsciously, and you made the contact in a dream, to your friend Crowley, sometime ago approximately three months I believe.现在。我们正在谈可能性，我的朋友。你自己的希望、预期和态度，导致你的熟人沃德指派了这个任务。你并不是在完全无意识的情况下做这件事，而且前一段时间，你在梦中联系了你的朋友克罗利——我相信大约是在3个月前。
He then mentioned your name when an opportunity for you was presented. This is as far as you went. You wanted the opportunity. You wanted to see if you could find work that was not dependent upon this locality. You were curious also as to whether or not this kind of commercial art could pay off, and yet be held in check.然后在一次介绍你的机会中，他提到了你的名字。这是就你而言。你想要这个机会。你想要看看你能不能找到不用依赖这个地区的工作。你也好奇这种商业艺术能不能带来好结果，可是却退缩了。
In one particular dream, you created the circumstances. The dream was loaded with psychic energy, and literally produced reality. In one dream you saw yourself moving closer to New York. This was not the same dream however.在一个特定的梦中，你创造了这个境遇。这个梦充满了心灵能量，而且实际上创造了实相。在一个梦中，你看见自己搬到更靠近纽约的地方。不过，这不是同一个梦。
(To my surprise last Friday, October 21, I received a call from an old fiend, Bill Ward, with whom I used to do comic books about 1940-2. He asked me to help him, probably on a regular basis, with some work, and I said yes. The work, involving inking, arrived Sunday. Wendell Crowley is a boy hood friend of Wards, and also an old friend of mine; he was my editor in New York City for some years after World War 11. I was working with him in the early 1950s. Also, see Session 290.(出乎我意料的是，上周五，10月21日，我接到一通老朋友比尔·沃德[Bill Ward]打来的电话，他和我在1940年至42年间一起做过漫画书。他请我帮他做一些可能是固定的工作，我说好。这个涉及到著墨的工作在星期天来了。温德尔·克罗利是沃德小时候的一个朋友，也是我的老友；第二次世界大战之后有几年，他是我在纽约市的编辑。我在1950年代早期与他共事过。另外参见第290节。
(See my dream notebook. I had a dream in which I returned to comic work on September 13,1966—about five weeks ago. This dream also involved a fiend at my present job, at Artistic Card Co., and that part of the dream also worked out.(详见我的梦笔记。我做过一个梦，我在梦中回去画漫画，时间是1966年9月13日——大约5个星期以前。这个梦也涉及我目前在艺术卡公司一个工作上的朋友，而且那部分的梦也有不错的结果。
(On October 15, 10 days ago, I dreamed Jane and I moved closer to New York Cityi so I could sell my paintings or so I wrote, rather than comics for instance. In the dream I saw a big city skyline in the distance, beyond the small town we moved to. Bill Ward—not in the dream—lives in Ridgewood, NJ, a commuter town for New York City.)(10月15日，10天以前，我梦见珍和我搬到更靠近纽约市的地方，以便我可以卖我的画——或我这么写道，而不是，比方说，画漫画。在这个梦中，我看见远处一个大城市的天际线，在我们搬去的小镇那一边。比尔·沃德——不在这个梦中——住在纽约州的瑞吉伍德，一个纽约市的通勤城镇。)
Give us a moment here.这里等我们一会儿。
All you wanted was the opportunity, once again you see, to decide whether or not you could use commercial art for your own purposes, and you created the opportunity for trial. Now, simply write this down. S. Period. C. Period. These are capitals. An office on 42nd street in New York City. A man with short gray hair, somewhat portly, but with a boyish-type face. He could end up as a Dutch uncle, as you say, if you continue with this sort of endeavor.你想要的只是有机会，再一次你看，确定你能不能利用商业艺术达到你自己的目的，而为了测试，你创造了这个机会。现在，只要把这个写下来就可以了。S。句号。C。句号。这些是大写字。在纽约市42街的一间办公室。一个留着灰白短发的男人，稍胖，但是有一张娃娃脸。就像你说的，如果你继续再这样努力下去，他最后可能会变成一个吹毛求疵的人。
Now. The Crowley girl, for various reasons, sacrificed herself for her father. At one time she was his mother, and she did this with full inner knowledge. There is something that he must still do, that is not done, that will greatly advance his own development.现在。克罗利的女儿，由于各种原因，为了父亲而牺牲她自己。有一世，她曾经是他的母亲，她是在心知肚明的情况下这么做。有某件还没做完而他一定还要做的事，那件事会大大促进他的发展。
(I was greatly surprised Friday to have Bill Ward tell me that Wendell Crowley's 10. year-old daughter died of a heart attack while playing softball. Wendell himself underwent open-heart surgery last year, and now feels well.)(星期五我大为吃惊的是，听到比尔·沃德告诉我，温德尔·克罗利的10岁女儿在打垒球时死于心脏病发作。温德尔本人去年历经开心手术[又名心内直视手术]，现在身体感觉很好。)
Take into consideration now probabilities. But I do not believe you are finished with Ward and his friends. There are even some possibilities for relationships with a second generation. You brought about this opportunity, and you will now deal with it, in your own way, in physical terms.现在把可能性列入考虑。但是我不相信你和沃德以及他的朋友已经了结了。甚至与第二代的关系都有一些可能性。你造成这个机会，现在你要用你的方式，在实际面处理它。
Had you not requested it you would never have received it.若不是你要求这个机会，你是永远得不到它的。
(Bill Wards letter accompanying the artwork mentioned his recent attendance at a dinner gathering of many of the group of friends we worked with in the early 1940s. Oddly enough, the last letter I received from Wendell Crowley, in May 1966, also described a similar event.)(比尔·沃德连同画作一起寄来的信上提到，他最近出席一次晚间聚餐，我们一群在1940年代早期一起工作的朋友有很多都去了。奇怪的是，在1966年5月，我收到温德尔寄来的最近一封信也描述了一个类似的事件。)
You may take a very brief break, and I shall continue. And Ruburt incidentally can relax. He is well on his way now. And yes, he did allow his old shoes to adopt a certain symbolism, and I should have mentioned this.你可以稍作休息，我再继续。而鲁柏也可以顺便放松一下。他现在正在达成他的目标。是的，他的确允许他自己的旧鞋采用某一个象征意义，这一点我应该已经提过。
(Break at 9:17. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had picked up considerably; her eyes opened often. She resumed in the same manner at 9:23.)(9:17分休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度加快相当多；眼睛经常睁开。9:23分，她以同样的方式继续。)
Now give us a moment, please. We will deal with your friends.现在请给我们一点时间。我们将会讨论你的朋友们。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher, who have been on vacation in Nassau. Supposedly they are on their way home to Elmira now. See the last two sessions.)(比尔和蓓·加拉格，他们在拿骚度假。现在应该在返回埃尔迈拉途中。见前两节。)
Something twirls and goes past. 3 7 8. This could be time, in connection with an airplane. A dismissal of some kind. Someone dismisses them abruptly, perhaps, or dismisses the Jesuit某个东西快速旋转而过。378。这可能是时间，与一架飞机有关联。某种打发。也许，有人突然打发他们，或打发耶稣会士。或者是飞机在这时降落，然后乘客被打发走。
(Bill Gallagher) or he has this impression. Or the plane lands at this time and the people are dismissed then.计划的改变。我不知道这是不是指航班计划。
A change in plans. I do not know if this refers to flight plans or not.另一个与一间教堂有关的事件。
Another episode concerning a church. This I believe still out-of-country, and before this hour of the session. Small boys connected with that episode, and a complete turnabout. Something takes an inordinate amount of time. They fidget, stew. I do not know if they stew or if they eat stew, you see.我相信这还是在国外，而且是在这一节上课时间之前。与那个事件有关的许多小男孩，以及一个彻底的转变。某件事花了过多的时间。他们坐立难安、焦急万分(stew)。我不知道他们是否焦急万分，还是他们吃了炖菜(stew，译注：这个字既有焦急、不安之意，也有炖煮食物之意),你知道。
An amphitheater in evening or early evening, before the trip home. Either they see a bullfight, or someone behaves in a bullish manner; but very strongly I believe is this the case.今晚或傍晚时分的一个圆形露天剧场，在启程回家之前。他们要不是看了一场斗牛，就是有人发了一顿牛脾气；但是我强烈相信情况就是这样。
SAG. Large letters, capitals. This seems to have something to do with the plane. 1936 and 1966 in connection with the type of plane, I believe. Or the pilot is connected with a man who in 1936 conceived ideas not used until this planes construction.SAG。大型字母，大写。这似乎与飞机有关联。19、6以及19、66，与那一型的飞机有关联，我相信。或是机师与一个男人有连结，那个男人在1936年想出许多点子，但是直到飞机建造为止都没有被采用。
They visited another place with important historical connections, about 1437 or 1473. A lighthouse there. Three o’clock in the afternoon when they visited, I believe. A large pennant or such with red, white and blue. Another with gold and blue, and either green or white. These like Hags.他们拜访了另一个有着重要历史连结的地方，大约是1437或1473年。那里有一座灯塔。我相信他们是下午3点钟去那里的。一面大型的三角旗之类的，有着红、白、蓝三色。另一面则是金色和蓝色，以及不是绿色就是白色。这些像旗子。
A woman vocalist or pianist. Dark-skinned but with blonde hair. A white sequined dress. One evening unusually cool and brisk. Something to do with block formations now. Not buildings at all, perhaps models or buildings.一个女性声乐家或钢琴家。深色皮肤但有着金色头发。一件白色亮片连身裙。一个异常凉爽的夜晚。现在与区块形态有关联。根本不是建筑物，也许是建筑物的模型。
Something four by five. 1886, and 1742.某个4乘5的东西。1886，以及1742。
Do you have an envelope to me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(At 9:35 Jane took the envelope for the 74th experiment from me without opening her eyes. She held it to her forehead in a horizontal position.)(9:35分，珍从我这里拿了第74次实验的信封，没有睁开眼睛。她把横向的信封放在额头上。)
Give us a moment, please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
A hole or grave or something deep. Four plus one. April. 196 (pause), 3 or 5 connection.一个洞或坟墓或某个很深的东西。4加1。4月。196(停顿)，3或5的关联。
A mistake or error. An obvious appeal. Cardboard . A small square.一个错误或失误。一种明显的吸引力。硬纸板。一个小正方形。
Connection with an old house; with another location; with two women and a man in particular. The color blue, as a background, I believe.与一间老屋有关联；与另一个地点有关联；尤其是与两个女人和一个男人有关联。蓝色，我相信是一个背景的颜色。
A connection with a particular event that was social. And perhaps (underlined) had a connection with a school or sports.与一个特定的社会事件有关联。而且也许(划线)和一间学校或运动有关联。
A rather airy design, with cubes predominating, and thin lines. These reminding Ruburt of a child’s Jungle Gym. Flowers that bloom late. A written note, with an appeal for an answer, or implied request.一个留白很多的字条，以立方体为主角，还有细细的线条。这些让鲁柏想到儿童攀爬架。晚开的花。一张手写的字条，恳求一个答案或隐含着要求。
The colors gray and/or white. With a rather rough, rather than perfectly smooth texture. An article that opens up. Writing on the inside and outside. Or at least the inside and outside are covered. Some distant connection with a child.灰色和/或白色。与一种相当粗糙而不平滑的纹理有关联。一篇翻开的文章。里面和外面都写了字。或至少里面和外面都被覆盖了。与一个小孩有遥远的关联。
Six. Now perhaps April 6. Also a November circumstance. A border. Blacks that speak loudly. Vivid verticals. Some connection with, is it—ablutions or washings, and with some kind of festival type thing.6。现在也许是4月6日。还有一个11月的状况。一条边界。显眼的黑色。生动的垂直线条。是不是与——洗礼或洗涤有某种关联，而且与某种庆典之类的事情有关联。
The entrance of an outsider. A rectangular package, covered with white tissue paper, and divided in fours by a slim blue ribbon.一个局外人的入口。一个长方形的包裹，覆盖着白色的棉纸，用一条蓝色的细缎带分成四等分。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
(“What color is the object itself?"(“标的物本身是什么颜色？”)
(Pause.) I am not sure. I will say on the order of a gray or silver metallic color, mainly. Some orange or red appears.(停顿)我不确定。我会说主要是类似灰色或银色的金属色。有某种橘色或红色出现。
(“Who are the two women you mentioned? Initials?” )(“你提到的两个女人是谁？姓名缩写？”)
We are having difficulty with Ruburt here, for he thinks of Vivian and your mother. The impression of a round orange object, or representation.这里我们与鲁柏有点问题，因为他想到薇薇安(Vivian)和你的母亲。一个圆形橘色物体或圆像的印象。
(“Can you give me some more on that design with the cubes?” )(“关于那个有着立方体的设计，你能不能给我更多资料？”)
Airy and open. Connection with the outdoors, or green. The image also, hard to describe, of thin lines, coming down you see this way, almost in a flowerlike movement.留白与敞开。与户外或绿色有关联。还有细线条的意象，很难描述，你看这样子下来，几乎像一朵花似的移动。
(Jane gestured with the fingers of her right hand spread and pointed downward; she made vertical motions with the hand. She still held the envelope to her forehead with the other hand, as usual in a horizontal position, or nearly so.(珍张开她右手的手指，朝着下方比手势；她用手比了许多垂直的动作。她的另一只手仍然把信封放在额头上，一如往常是水平方向，或几乎是这样。
(“What is that written note?” )(“那张手写的字条是什么？”)
Perhaps having to do with November, and blue. An initiation or something for the first time.或许与11月以及蓝色有关联。一个开始或某件第一次做的事。
(“Who is that child you referred to?” )(“你说的那个小孩是谁？”)
The vague impression that it is a boy rather than a girl, and an initial R or B. Or, this is an image of someone, male, as a youngster who was born in 1936, or who is now 36 years old. A review, you see.模糊的印象是，那是男孩，不是女孩，而且有一个首字母是R或B。或者，这是某个人小时候的画面，男孩，生于1936年或是现年36岁。一个回顾，你知道。
(Jane lowered the envelope to her bp.)(珍拿下信封，放在她的大腿上。
(“What shape is the object?” )(“物体的形状是什么？”)
I am confused between a metallic image, or the feeling of metal. The cube shapes , and the impression of a rectangular shape also.我难以分辨这是一个金属般的意象，还是金属的感觉。立方体的形状，还有一个长方形的印象。
The metal image or feeling seems to predominate with the cubes. These, of course, could be on a rectangular object. The letter M in caps here.立方体似乎以金属意象或感觉为主。当然，这些可能是在一个长方形的物体上。这里有大写的字母M。
(“A capital M?” )(“一个大写的M?”)
And perhaps two S’s, and a 1961.也许还有两个S，以及一个1961。
I suggest your break.我建议休息一下。
(Break at 9:54. Jane was out as usual. Her eyes had remained closed through the envelope experiment, and had opened little during the Galbgher material. She said she didn't know if she had any mental images; as we went through the material she recalled a few.(9:54分休息。珍一如往常出去了。在整个信封实验期间，她的眼睛一直闭着，只有在传述加拉格夫妇的资料时，稍微张开一下。她说她不知道她有没有任何金属的意象；在我们讨论资料时，她想起了几个。
(See the copy of the envelope object on page 115 and the notes on the next page. As stated the object was a bill for art supplies from The Art Shop. Jane had never seen the object; I obtained it today, October 24, from Marjorie Buck, the proprietor, when I bought pencils and paper stumps with which to do the job my old friend, Bill Ward, mailed to me over the weekend. The job arrived yesterday. See the notes on page 116 for an explanation here, since these facts enter into the envelope data, we believe.(见前面信封标的物副本及下一页的注释。如上所述，标的物是艺术商店开出的一张美术用品账单。珍从未见过标的物；今天，10月24日，我从店主玛裘莉·巴克那里拿到它，当时我买了铅笔和素描纸擦笔，打算用来做我的老友比尔·沃德上周寄给我的工作。工作昨天寄达。这里的解释见前面的注释，因为我们相信这些事实进入了信封资料。
(The object is printed on bright yellow paper in dark blue ink, with the large serial number at the bottom in red. The back is blank. The bill was folded once for insertion into the double envelopes. The bill is not dated by Marjorie; when I obtained it I had no notion of using it as the object. I did want something that Jane had never seen however.(标的物是用深蓝色的油墨印刷在鲜黄色的纸张上，最底下有红色的序号。背面空白。为了放入双层信封内，账单是对折的。玛裘莉没有在账单上标注日期；当我拿到它的时候，我并没有要用它当标的物的念头。不过，我的确想要某个珍从未见过的东西。
(This data was not as wholly precise as we would like, but we made the connections we could. Seth did not go over it after break, mentioning distortions and telepathic static instead. But we feel that more than enough points were made to establish that Seth/Jane had picked up the correct scent. Again, see the 286th session for an explanation of the way Seth receives envelope data.(这个资料的精确度不如我们希望的完整，但我们尽力找出连结。赛斯在休息后没有重新检视一遍，而是提到扭曲和心电感应的静电。但我们觉得重点已经足以证实赛斯/珍接收到正确的线索。再一次，见第286节，赛斯解释信封资料的接收方式。
(“A hole or grave or something deep.” Marjorie Buck is the proprietor of The Art Shop, where I obtained the bill used as object. Jane knows her fairly well. Marjories husband died—we do not know when and Marjorie bought The Art Shop earlier this year. Jane has used the hole/grave nomenclature several times in the past to refer to deaths; it is a regular association of hers.(“一个洞或坟墓或某个很深的东西。”玛裘莉·巴克是艺术商店的店主，我在那里取得用作标的物的账单。珍和她很熟。玛裘莉的丈夫死了——我们不知道是什么时候——玛裘莉在今年稍早前买下艺术商店。珍过去有几次用洞/坟墓这个命名方式指称死亡；这是她常用的联想。
(“Four plus one. April. 196, 3 or 5 connection.” We saw no obvious connections for this data, and do not know if any or all of it is valid.(“4加1。4月。196[停顿]，3或5的关联。”我们看不到这个资料的明显关联，所以不知道它的任何一部分或全部是否有效。
(“A mistake or error. 'Jane said this stems font the last time she personally saw Marjorie; this was perhaps five weeks ago when Jane was job hunting; this activity of Jane crops up later in the data also. Jane stopped at The Art Shop to buy me a pint can of gesso. Marjorie told Jane to help herself because she was not too familiar with the location of all the stock.(“一个错误或失误。”珍说这起源于上一次她个人见到玛裘莉；也许是5个星期以前，当时珍正在找工作；珍的这个活动后来也出现在资料中。珍顺道去了艺术商店，帮我买一罐一品脱的打底剂。玛裘莉请珍自己找，因为她不太熟悉所有存货的位置。
(Jane went to the usual place in the stockroom where the gesso was kept, and found only quart cans. She took this, then found pint cans on another shelf and took one of those instead. There are no errors on the object itself, for instance.(珍去了仓库平常摆放打底剂的地方，只找到两品脱的罐子。她拿了这个，然后发现一品脱的罐子在另一个货架上，于是改拿那些罐子的其中一罐。比如说，没有任何错误出现在标的物本身。
(“An obvious appeal. Cardboard." I believe these two go together, and they also reflect the conditions described relating to the error data just above. This afternoon, October 24, Marjorie asked me to locate the pencils and stumps I wanted in The Art Shop storeroom. I did so. The two items were both kept in cardboard boxes, small, and in separate places.(“一种明显的吸引力。硬纸板。”我相信这两个是相符的，而且它们也反映了上文描述过，与失误资料有关的状况。今天下午，10月24日，玛裘莉要我在艺术商店的仓库里拿出自己想要的铅笔和纸擦笔。这两个物件都存放在小型的硬纸盒里，分开放在不同的地方。
(“A small square.” We do not know. There are several connections we could make.(“一个小正方形。”我们不知道。有几个我们可以想到的关联。
(“Connection with an old house; with another location; with two women and a man in particular。” Jane says Marjorie Buck lives in an old house, at 655 Logan Street. I personally am not familiar with it. The house of course obviously is at another location than our apartment, The Art Shop. etc. later Note by RFB: Also, The Art Shop moves next year to an old house.(“与一间老房子有关联；与另一个地点有关联；尤其是与两个女人和一个男人有关联。”珍说玛裘莉·巴克住在罗根街[Logan Street]655号的一间老房子里。我个人对它不熟悉。当然这间房子明显位于我们的公寓、艺术商店等等以外的另一个地点。罗后来的注：此外，艺术商店隔年搬到一间老屋。
(We believe this data is an example of the distortions Seth refers to. In my second question an attempt is made to get more specific data. Possibly the above data refers to Marjorie as proprietor of The Art Shop, and her two helpers, my first cousin Ruth Gridley, and the framemaker Roy Fox. All of these people are friends of ours, bespeaking Emotional involvement. But in answer to the second question, Seth cites Jane’s difficulty, and the thought of my mother, her cousin Vivian, and Vivians husband Bill. Vivian and Bill, from Virginia, visited my parents last weekend, and Jane and I saw much of them.(赛斯所说的扭曲，我们相信这个资料是其中一例。在我的第二个问题当中，我试图问出更多具体的资料。有可能上述资料是指艺术商店的老板玛裘莉，以及她的两名助手，我的表姊妹露丝·葛瑞德利[Ruth Gridiey]和表框师罗伊·法克斯[Roy Fox]。这些人全都是我们的亲友，表示其中一定涉及情感。但是在回答第二个问题时，赛斯转述珍遭遇困难，并且想到我的母亲、她的表姊妹薇薇安和薇薇安的丈夫比尔。薇薇安和比尔上周末从维吉尼亚州来探望我的父母，珍和我经常见到他们。
(“The color blue, as a background, I believe.”No connections. As stated I had no idea of using the bill as object when I obtained it from Marjorie. My thought is that Marjorie wore a print dress with a blue background today, but of course I cannot be sure.(“蓝色，我相信是一个背景的颜色。”没有连结。如上所述，我拿到玛裘莉给的账单时，完全没想到会用到它。我的想法是，玛裘莉今天穿了一件印花连身裙，底色是蓝色，但当然我不确定。
(“A connection with a particular event that was social. And perhaps had a connection with a school or sports.” This is good data, and is related to the object through Marjorie Buck. As stated on page 120 after the “mistake” data, the last time Jane saw Marjorie was when job hunting. Before stopping in at The Art Shop to buy the gesso for me, Jane had applied at the local YWCA for a job. The job involved teaching children various games, for the school or sports connection.(“与一个特定的社会事件有关联。而且也许和一间学校或运动有关联。”这个资料很好，而且透过玛裘莉与标的物产生关联。如前面“错误”资料之后所述，珍上一次看到玛裘莉是她出去找工作的时候。在珍顺道去艺术商店帮我买打底剂之前，她在本地的YWCA应征了一份工作。这个工作涉及教小孩子玩各种各样的游戏，所以这和学校或运动有关联。
(Jane was also quite amused when the management of the YWCA asked her if she wanted to volunteer her services, when they learned of my family connections here in Elmira; for the social connections.(当YWCA的管理阶层得知我的家族在埃尔迈拉这里的连结时，他们问珍想不想要自愿提供服务，珍觉得很好笑；所以这和社会有关联。
(“A rather airy design, with cubes predominating, and thin lines. These reminding Ruburt of a child’s Jungle Gym.”See the copy of the bill used as object on page 115. This also is good data. It could be said the bill is of airy design; Jane also said that to her way of thinking it contains cubes and rectangles. The thin line data is accurate, since on the original the lines are very thin and straight.(“一个留白很多的设计，以立方体为主角，还有细细的线条。这些让鲁柏想到儿童攀爬架。”见前面用作标的物的账单副本。这也是一个很好的资料。它可能是说账单有着留白的设计；珍也说，就她的思考方式而言，它包含了立方体和长方形。细细的线条资料是精确的，因为在正本上，线条非常细而且直。
(The Jungle Gym reference is another example of one of Jane’s favorite associations, since she was much attached to playground jungle gyms as a child. The abstract idea of a Jungle Gym is apparent enough in the object.(攀登架是珍最喜欢联想之一的另一个例子，因为她小时候很喜欢游乐场的攀爬架。在这个标的物中，立方体方格铁架的抽象概念是显而易见的。
(“Flowers that bloom late.” No connections.(“晚间的花。”找不到任何关联。
(“A written note, with an appeal for an answer, or implied request.” I believe this is a reference to the letter Bill Ward sent me with the art work I received Sunday, October 23. Again, see the notes on page 116. Also keep in mind that the bill used as object represents pencils and paper stumps I bought in order to finish the job Bill sent to me.(“一张手写的字条，恳求一个答案或隐含着要求。”我相信这是指比尔，沃德连同我在10月23日星期天收到的美术作品一起寄来的信。再一次，见前面相关的注释。此外也别忘了，用作标的物的账单代表我为了完成比尔寄给我的工作而购买的铅笔和纸擦笔。
(Bill’s letter outlined the steps necessary to finish the job, which consists of five pages of a comic type story, in pictures and text, for a men's magazine. My job is to do the backgrounds and to add gray, black and white halftones with the pencils. Bill refers to any problems in his letter, how to get in touch with him, etc., and implies that I answer it. I have already done so.(比尔的信概述了完成工作所需的步骤，那是为一本男性杂志创作的一则漫画类型的故事，一共5页，图文都有。我的工作是处理背景，用铅笔加上灰色、黑白色的半色调。比尔在信上提到遇到任何问题、如何与他联络等等，暗示我回信给他。我已经回了。
(“The colors gray and/or white.” Another reference to the work Bill Ward sent to me. The art is to be done in shades of black to white, without other colors, and will be so printed.(“灰色和/或白色。”又是指比尔·沃德寄给我的工作。这是一个指用黑到白的各种色调完成的作品，没有其他颜色，届时也是这样印刷。
(“With a rather rough, rather than perfectly smooth texture.” This is also good data, and refers to the surface characteristics of the illustration board upon which the job is executed. The board has a pleasing grainy texture typical of such material, and is far from smooth.(“与一种相当粗糙而不十分平滑的纹理有关联。”这也是很好的资料，指的是执行这个工作所用的插画板表面的特征。这块板子有着讨人喜欢的颗粒质地，那是这类材质典型的特征，一点都不光滑。
(Note that in here Seth gives three blocks of data relating to one facet of the events connected to the bill used as object. This involved Bill Ward and his product. Before that, Marjorie Buck was involved, with the object itself and its origin.(注意赛斯在这里给出的三段资料与许多事件的其中一面有关系，这些事件与用作标的物的账单有关联。这涉及到比尔·沃德和他的创作。在那之前，牵涉在内的是玛裘莉·巴克，标的物本身和它的源头与她有关。
(“An article that opens up.” I believe there are two choices of interpretation here. I favor the first one: that the data refers to the large flat package in which Bill Ward mailed me the artwork to be finished.“Writing on the inside and outside.” The package of course contained writing both inside and outside. “Or at least the inside and outside are covered.” This may refer to the package in a somewhat distorted manner. Or it may refer quite accurately to the envelope object itself, which would be the second possibility for this block of data.(“一篇翻开的文章。”我相信这里的解读有两个选择。我偏好第一个：资料是指比尔·沃德寄给我帮忙完成的作品所用的扁平大型包裹。“里面和外面都写了字。”包裹的里面和外面当然都写了字。“或至少里面和外面都覆盖了。”这可能是以有点扭曲的方式指称比包裹。或者，这段资料的第二个可能性就是，它可能相当精确地指出信封标的物。
(As indicated on page 115, the bill was folded once before insertion into the double envelopes. This would make it an article that opens up but with writing on the inside only; hence some distortion would be present with this interpretation also.(如前面所述，账单是先对折一次，才放入双层信封内。这会让它变成一篇翻开的文章，只有里面有写字；因此这个解读可能也有一些扭曲。
(“Some distant connection with a child.” No connections. Extra notation by Jane: Bill Ward, while asking Rob to do the job over phone, told him of death of Wendell’s child, a school boy. [Jane wrote boy but a girl died.(“与一个小孩有遥远的关联。”找不到任何关联。珍另加注释：比尔·沃德，在电话中要求罗做这个工作，还告诉他温德尔的孩子死了，他是一个在学生。[珍写的是男孩，但死去的是一个女孩]
(“Six. Now perhaps April 6.” We don’t know. Marjorie Buck took over ownership and operation of The Art Shop early this year. Was it in April? We received a formal notice of the change in management in June 1966, and this was used as the envelope object in the 268th session. See Volume 6 of The Early Sessions.(“6。现在也许是4月6日。生动的金属线条。”我们不知道。玛裘莉·巴克在今年初接手经营艺术商店。是在4月吗？我们在1966年6月收到经营者换人的正式通知，而这份通知在第268节被用来当作信封标的物。见早期课第六册。
(“Also a November circumstance." No connection.(“还有一个11月的状况。”找不到任何关联。
(“A border.” The envelope object contains a definite border. See the tracing on page 115.(“一条边界。”信封标的物含有一条明确的边界。见前面的图。
(“Blacks that speak loudly. ”Again see page 115. The heavy type for The Art Shop on the bill is prominent; when Jane opened the double envelopes and saw this she said it was black printing. Actually it is in dark blue ink against yellow paper, appearing almost black.(“显眼的黑色。”再一次见前面的描摹图。账单上“艺术商店”的粗黑字体很显眼；当珍打开双层信封看到这个时，她说它是黑色印刷字。其实它是深蓝色油墨，在黄色纸张的衬托下，看起来几乎是黑色。
(“Vivid verticals”. The bill used as object contains verticals and horizontals.(“生动的垂直线条。”用作标的物的账单包含垂直线条和水平线条。
(“Some connection with, is it ablutions or washings, and with some kind of festival-type thing.” This is good data, we believe, and refers again to the artwork Bill Ward mailed me over the weekend. Again, see the notes about this on page 116. Jane of course saw this artwork when I opened it up today, and when I began work on the backgrounds today.(“是不是与——洗礼或洗涤有某种关联，而且与某种庆典之类的事情有关联。”这是很好的资料，我们相信，再一次指出比尔·沃德上周寄给我的作品。再一次，见前面所述。当我今天打开它时，以及当我今天开始处理背景时，珍当然看到这个作品了。
(Bear in mind that the connection between the artwork and tonight’s envelope object, the bill from The Art Shop, would be the pencils and paper stumps I bought at The Art Shop in order to do the art.(别忘了作品与今晚的信封标的物——艺术商店的账单之间的连结是，我为了作画而在艺术商店购买的铅笔和纸擦笔。
(The connections with washings and the art comes about because on the first two pages of the comic story sent to me by Bill Ward, the heroine is shown taking a shower, using a towel, etc. This is a prominent part of the first two pages, not just a panel on each. The heroines act of showering is important to the story because of the steps taken by the enemy to destroy her while she is so occupied.(洗涤与画作之间之所以产生连结，是因为在比尔·沃德寄给我的漫画故事头两页，女主角正在淋浴、使用毛巾等等。这是头两页的一个重要部分，不只是一页一格而已。画中女主角的淋浴行为对这个故事很重要，因为敌人趁她正忙，正一步步准备毁灭她。
(The festival-type thing is also good, and refers I think to the letter from Bill Ward that accompanied the art. In the letter Bill dwells upon a dinner attended by himself, Wendell Crowley, and several other old friends of mine; the dinner being held just a few days ago; at this dinner Wendell mentioned my availability to Bill Ward for free-lance artwork, and this in turn led Bill to ask me to help him out.(庆典之类的资料也很好，我想它指的是比尔·沃德连同画作一起寄来的信。在信上，比尔详述他自己、温德尔·克罗利以及我的其他几个老友参加的一场晚宴；晚宴是在几天前举行的；在这个晚宴上，温德尔向比尔·沃德提起我有时间接自由创作的案子，接着比尔就来找我帮忙了。
(I am also of the opinion that the three pieces of data just preceding this: A border; blacks that speak loudly; and vivid verticals; might be said to apply to the artwork as much as to the envelope object itself. Legitimate connections would still apply.(我也认为在这之前的三则资料：一条边界；显眼的黑色；以及生动的垂直线条；可以说既适用于画作，也适用于信封标的物本身。仍然有着合理的连结。
(“The entrance of an outsider.” This is good data, and quite literal as far as the artwork is concerned. While our heroine is shown taking a shower on the first two pages of the comic story, the villain is shown skulking outside her apartment window via a fire escape, then reaching in through an open window to tamper with some of the heroines personal effects. He is so shown on several panels on the first two pages.(“一个局外人的入口。”这是很好的资料，而且就作品而言，相当符合实情。在漫画故事的头两页，当我们的女主角在淋浴时，坏人躲在她公寓窗外的逃生梯上，然后经由一扇开着的窗户爬进来，捣乱女主角的私人物品。他以这样的方式出现在头两页的几个画格里。
(“A rectangular package, covered with white tissue paper, and divided in fours by a slim blue ribbon.” Jane had an image here. She saw mentally the four divisions, and had the feeling of blue---of a white package with blue lines or ribbons dividing it.(“一个长方形的包裹，覆盖着白色的棉纸，用一条蓝色的细缎带分成四等分。”珍在这里有一个画面。她在脑海里看见四个部分，还有蓝色的感觉——是一个白色包裹，被蓝色线条或缎带分成四等分。
(Distortion probably operates here. Note that the bill used as the object has blue lines upon it. Bill Ward’s artwork arrived in a large rectangular package, but contained no tissue paper and bore no ribbons or string; it was instead sealed with tape. Nor did it contain any blue. Jane thinks she may have received accurate-enough data from Seth about a package, and constructed perhaps the ribbons herself because that is symbolic of packages. She used blue ribbons perhaps through a distortion of the blue pertaining to the envelope object.(这里可能出现了扭曲。注意用作标的物的账单上面有蓝色的线条。比尔·沃德画作寄来时，是在一个长方形的大包裹里，但没有棉纸也没有缎带或绳子；而是用胶带密封。它也没有包含任何蓝色。珍认为她可能从赛斯那里接到够精确的包裹资料，然后也许自己建构了缎带，因为那是包裹的象征。她之所以用蓝色缎带，也许是因为与信封标的物有关的蓝色。
(1st Question: “What color is the object itself” I am not sure. I will say on the order of a gray or silver metallic color, mainly.” See the gray and white data on page 122. It appears that the above is another reference to the art work Bill Ward sent me, since it contains grays done in pencil as well as black ink; the grays can easily look metallic when a certain density is reached, for the graphite in the pencils acquires a dull sheen, similar to an aluminum look.(第一个问题：标的物本身是什么颜色？“我不确定。我会说主要是类似灰色或银色的金属色。”见前面的灰色和白色资料。看起来上述资料也是指比尔·沃德寄给我的画作，因为它包含铅笔画的灰色和黑色墨水；灰色到了一定的密度时很容易看起来像金属色，因为铅笔里面的石墨带有一种隐约的光泽，看起来像铝。
(We regard this as good data, in that the art work is strongly linked to the bill used as object. But of course off the mark as far as naming the bill itself goes.(我们认为这也是很好的资料，因为画作与用作标的物的账单有着强烈的连结。但是，就账单本身的名称而言，当然相差很多。
(“Some orange or red perhaps.” In light of the data obtained in answer to the second question, it is quite possible that the red reference here concerns my mother. Red is very definitely her favorite color, a fact of which Jane is well aware. Seth has also commented upon this quite a few times.(“有某种橘色或红色出现。”根据从第二个问题的答案得来的资料，这里的红色很有可能与我母亲有关。红色很肯定是她最喜欢的颜色，这是珍非常清楚的一个事实。赛斯对此也发表过好几次的评论。
(2nd Question: “Who are the two women you mentioned? Initials?” We are having difficulty with Ruburt here, for he thinks of Vivian and your mother.” See the interpretation of the” two women and a man" data at the bottom of page 120. I tried to clarify that data here. My thought was that the two women and a man Seth referred to were Marjorie Buck, Ruth Gridley, and Roy Fox, all connected directly to The Art Shop, which furnished the bill used as envelope object. Jane evidently had in mind my mother, and Vivian and Bill Crowder, relatives from Virginia whom we saw this weekend. Seth apparently wanted to lead Jane away from the relative connection; but still volunteered no more specific information.(第二个问题：你看到的两个女人是谁？姓名缩写？“这里我与鲁柏有点问题，因为他想到薇薇安和你的母亲。”见前面所述“两个女人和一个男人”资料的解读。这里我试着理清那个资料。我的想法是，赛斯说的两个女人和一个男人是指玛裘莉·巴克、露丝·葛瑞德利和罗伊·法克斯，全部都和艺术商店有直接的关联，用作标的物的账单就是这家店提供的。珍显然想到我的母亲，以及来自维吉尼亚州的亲戚薇薇安和比尔·克劳德[Bill Crowder]，我们在这个周末见过他们。赛斯显然想要把珍从亲戚连结带开，但仍然没有主动给出更加具体的资料。
(“The impression of a round orange object, or representation.” We offer no connections. Possibly another distorted reference to my mother's love of red?(“一个圆形橘色物体或图像的印象。”我们找不出任何关联。可能是与我母亲喜爱红色有关的另一个扭曲。
(3rd Question: Can you give me some more on that design with the cubes? “ Airy and open. Connection with the outdoors, or green. The image also, hard to describe, of thin lines, coming down you see this way, almost in a flowerlike movement.” Jane’s gesture, indicating vertical lines.(第三个问题：关于那个有着立方体的设计，你能不能给我更多资料？“留白与敞开。与户外或绿色有关联。还有细线条的意象，很难描述，你看这样子下来，几乎像一朵花似的移动。”珍的手势比出垂直的线条。
(See the Jungle Gym data, interpreted on page 121. Here I sought to get more information. As stated, and seen on page I IS, the bill used as object contains vertical lines as well as horizontal, and these are quite thin on the actual object. The outdoors reference above stems from Janes original mention of a Jungle Gym on page 121, and this would lead to the green data.(见前面解读的攀爬架资料。这里我试图问出更多资料。如上所述，并参见前面所述，用作标的物的账单包含直线条以及水平线条，而且这些线条在实际的物体上都相当细。上述的户外源于珍最初提到的一座攀爬架，而这进而引出绿色资料。
(There is another possible green connection, one obvious to anyone familiar with printing or commercial art, although I do not think it applies here. But the paper the object is manufactured from is a bright yellow, and the yellow is printed upon with blue ink. Blue and yellow ordinarily would print green. But in this case the blue ink is so dense and strong that it prints as blue on the object. No hint of green is to be seen. Jane is not aware of these mechanical points.(绿色有另一个可能的关联，一个对任何熟悉印刷或商业艺术的人显而易见的关联，虽然我认为这里并不适用。但制作标的物的纸张是鲜黄色，而且有蓝色油墨印刷在黄色上面。蓝和黄经过印刷通常会变成绿色。可是在这个情况中，蓝色油墨太浓太重了，所以印刷在标的物上变成蓝色。看不到一点绿色的痕迹。珍对这些机械方面的特点一无所知。
(Seth referred to flowers toward the bottom of page 118.(见前面，赛斯指出花朵。
(4th Question: “What is that written note?” Perhaps having to do with November, and blue.” See the note data in the middle of page 119; it was stated that referred to Bill Ward 's letter. The above could also refer to the letter. The artwork discussed in the letter is due in November 1966, and the letter itself is handwritten by Bill in two shades of blue ink. I believe this data also ties in with the next:(第四个问题：那张手写的字条是什么？“或许和11月以及蓝色有关系。”见前面的字条资料；说明这指的是比尔·沃德的信。上文也可能是指这封信。信上讨论的画作于1966年11月寄达，信本身是比尔·沃德用两种蓝色调的墨水写的。我相信这个资料也和下一个资料有连结。
(“An initiation or something for the first time. ’’ The job sent to me by Bill is an initiation, since it is the first of its kind I have received from him—with the promise of more to come, incidentally. This also makes doing the art something for the ”first time, ’’since I've never done this particular kind before. Many years ago, perhaps more than 15, I did other kinds of comic work; that was ”serious" comic work.(“一个开始或某种第一次做的事。”比尔寄给我的工作是一个开始，因为这是我从他那里接到的第一个此一类型的工作——附带一提，他承诺后面还有。这也让画这个作品变成一件“第一次”做的事，因为我以前没有做过这一类的创作。很多年前，也许15年，我画过其他类型的漫画作品；但那是“严肃”的漫画作品。
(5th Question: “Who is that child you referred to?” The vague impression that it is a boy rather than a girl, and an initial R or B. Or, this is an image of someone, male, as a youngster who was born in 1936, or who is now 36years old. A review you see.” We can still offer no connections here. But see page 117, regarding the death of Wendell Cowley's daughter at the age of 10. Year unknown.(第五个问题：你说的那个小孩是谁？“模糊的印象是，那是男孩，不是女孩，而且有一个首字母是R或B。或者，这是某个人小时候的画面，男性，生于1936年或是现年36岁。一个回顾，你知道。”这里我们还是找不出任何关联。但是见前面所述，有温德尔·克罗利的女儿在10岁过世的资料。不知道是哪一年。
(6th Question: “What shape is the object?” I am confused between a metallic image, or the feeling of metal. The cube shapes , and the impression of a rectangular shape also. The metal image or feeling seems to predominate with the cubes. These of course could be on a rectangular object. ’’Interpretations have already been given for the cubes, Jungle Gyms, metallic data, and the rectangular package, and Jane still cannot quite sort them out here.(第六个问题：物体的形状是什么？“我难以分辨这是一个金属般的意象，还是金属的感觉。立方体的形状，还有一个长方形的印象。立方体似乎以金属意象或感觉为主。当然，这些可能是在一个长方形的物体上。”立方体、攀爬架、金属资料和长方形包裹的解读都给了，但这里珍还是理不出头绪。
(All are apparently linked with the envelope object in some fashion. The Art Shop bill used as object is rectangular in shape, but Jane mentioned a rectangular package earlier so we are not sure of what interpretation to assign here.(全部显然都以某种方式与信封标的物产生关联。用作标的物的艺术商店账单形状是长方形，但之前珍提到一个长方形的包裹，所以这里我们不确定要用什么解读才对。
(“The letter M in caps here. ’’ Possibly good data, and a strong link with the bill used as object. The bill was made out by Marjorie Buck, proprietor of The Art Shop. We are often unsure as to what, or how much, meaning to give initials like this. There are other M's, both upper and lower case, on the bill. See page 115Actually Marjorie’s name doesn’t appear on the bill at all.(“这里有大写的字母M。”可能是很好的资料，而且和用作标的物的账单有很强的连结。账单是艺术商店的老板玛裘莉·巴克填写的。像这类的首字母缩写，我们常常不知道要给它们什么或多少意义。在账单上，框上和框下还有其他的M。见前面描摹图。其实玛裘莉的名字根本没有出现在账单上。
(7th Question: “A capital M?” And perhaps two S's, and a 1961. ’’ By repeating Seth's data I hoped he would furnish more information on the M. We can see no definite connections with two S's or 1961. Two of the capital Ms on the object itself are in the words Must, in a line at the bottom concerning claims, and in Moore Business Forms, Inc.(第七个问题：一个大写的M？“也许还有两个S，以及一个1961。”就由复述资料的资料，我希望他会提供更多有关M的讯息。我们看不出有关两个S或1961的明确连结。标的物本身的两个大写M出现在Must这个字当中，在下方有关理赔的那一行，以及在Mooore Business Forms, Inc.里面。
(Jane resumed at 10:48, sitting across the table from me.)(珍在10:48分继续。隔着桌子，坐在我的对面。)
