There is no reason to go through all the data.没有理由讨论全部的资料。
There were several distortions, and some telepathic static, so to speak. We will therefore close the session. My heartiest regards to you both.有几个扭曲，还有可以说某种心电感应静电。因此我们要结束这一节了。我衷心问候你们两位。
(“Good night, Seth. ’’(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:51. Jane was out as usual.)(10:51分结束。珍一如往常出去了。)
MY EVALUATION OF GALLAGHER NASSAll TESTS我对加拉格拿骚测验的评估
(At least 40 correct impressions were given, more actually since some of them consisted of several points. Of these, 22 [a few more taking the above into consideration] seem excellent to me. In one place, page two of the results, nine impressions in a row were correct and highly specific, and these added up to a complete picture of the place where the Gallaghers stayed. Some points might have been legitimate, but were uncheckable; the Gallaghers simply didn't know.(给出的印象至少有40个是正确的，其实是更多，因为其中有一些包含了几个要点。在这些印象当中，有24个[把上文考虑在内，又多了几个]在我看来似乎好极了。在一个地方，结果的第二页，一连9个印象都是正确的，而且非常具体，这些合在一起的完整画面，描绘出加拉格夫妇逗留的地方。一些要点可能是合理，但无法核对 ；加拉格夫妇根本不知道。
(During the Seth sessions involved, I felt as if I were actually in a few locations, but these meant nothing to the Gallaghers. I had whole scenes before my eyes and some freedom of movement within them. Either a partial projection was made to places which were not visited by the Gallaghers on the islands, or these were distortions, highly dramatized.(在相关的赛斯课期间，我感觉自己仿佛实际置身几个地点，但这些对加拉格夫妇却一点意义也没有。在我眼前，我看到整个景象，而且在它们之内还有一些移动的自由。这些要不是局部投射到了加拉格夫妇在群岛上没有拜访过的地方，就是非常戏剧化的扭曲。
(It is difficult to get good perceivers in any case, people who notice many things and remember them clearly. There was some slight disagreement between the Gallaghers written notes and remarks made during conversation about the Seth impressions, which I took down on the spot. Two of these at least made the difference between hits and failures, and they are noted in the test results.(总之，很难找到优秀的感知者，注意到很多事情而且清楚记得它们的人。加拉格夫妇写的笔记与在谈论赛斯的印象时所发表的意见之间略有出入，后者我在当场就记下来了。其中至少有两个区别了说中的点与没说中的点，这些都记录在测验结果上。
RESULTS OF GALLAGHER TESTS, OCTOBER 1966珍·罗柏兹(Jane Butts)1966年10月，加拉格测验的结果
(Peg and Bill Gallagher left for Nassau, Monday, October 17, and returned Tuesday, October 25. Seths impressions were given in sessions 294, 295, 296, and 297 on October 17, October 19, October 24, October 26.(蓓与比尔·加拉格在10月17日星期一启程前往拿骚，并于10月25日星期二返回。赛斯在10月17日、10月19日、10月24日、10月26日的第294、295、296和297节给出印象。
(On Friday, October 28, I [ Jane ] saw Peg for the first time since her return, and went over the Seth notes. That evening Rob and I checked the material with both Peg and Bill and I took notes of their answers. I typed up Seth’s impressions and gave them to the Gallaghers and together they wrote in their comments. These were returned to us November 4, and this copy is taken from the Gallaghers joint comments. There were some small differences in a few results between the Gallaghers comments October 28, and in their returned written copy, and this is noted upon by me when it occurs. Both copies are in our files.(在10月28日星期五，我[珍]从蓓回来以后第一次见到她，从头到尾再看一遍赛斯的笔记。那天晚上罗和我与蓓和比尔核对资料，我负责记录他们的答案。我把赛斯的印象打好字，给了加拉格夫妇，然后他们一起写下评论。这些在11月4日送回给我们，这个副本出自加拉格夫妇合写的。加拉格夫妇在10月28日的评论与他们送回的画面副本之间的几个结果有一些小小的差异，当它出现时，我加了注释。两份副本都在我们的档案里。
(A note by RFB: Jane's punctuation in her copies of Seths Gallagher materials varies at times from the originals —but only in small ways, and not at all in content. )(罗的注：在赛斯的加拉格资料副本上，珍的标点符号有时候与原稿不符——但只在一些小地方，完全不影响内容。)
RESULTS OF THE GALLAGHER TEST加拉格测验的结果

SESSION 294 OCTOBER 17, 1966 9 PM MONDAY 出自第294节 1966年10月17日 星期一 晚上9点


A charade of sorts. Could this be a night club act? I do not know.某种比手划脚的猜谜语游戏。这有没有可能是夜店的一个活动。我不知道。
(“At about this time Monday night, we were in a nightclub, although I don't know whether or not this could be called a charade, mostly singing and limbo dancing.”)(“星期一晚上大约这个时间，我们在一间夜店，虽然我不知道这能不能叫作比手划脚的猜谜游戏，主要是唱歌和舞动四肢。”)
A table beside them. A man in a dark suit stands up. Something strange about the suit, as if it is the only dark colored one close by, at least.他们旁边有一张桌子。一个穿着深色西装的男人站起来。那件西装有点奇怪，至少它好像是旁边唯一一件深色的西装。
(“Several men by us with dark suits.”)(“我们旁边有几个男人穿着深色西装。”)
A connection with M-l-C-H, or Michigan. Have they met someone from Michigan? A couple?与MICH或密西根州(Michigan)有关联。他们是不是遇到那里来的某个人？一对夫妻。
(“Not on this date, but on October 23, we met a man originally from Detroit, Michigan. Not a couple. He was a sponge trader and made an impression on us.”)(“不是在这一天，而是在10月23日，我们遇见一个老家在密西根州底特律[Detroit]的男人。不是一对夫妻。他是做海绵贸易的生意人，给我们留下深刻印象。”)
Five people... A 4 7 5, or 1475. Bill of some kind, connected with an item.... Something red connected with snorkeling... A twin advantage, the name Gert, I believe, connection with small balls, not made of rubber.5个人。475或1475。某种账单，与一个物件有关……某个与浮潜有关联的红色东西……一个双重的优势。葛特(Gert)这个名字，我相信。与许多小球有关联，但不是橡胶做的。
(“No to all of these.”)(“这些全都没有。”)
A hilltop with a cross on top顶端有一个十字架的山丘。
(“We did stop at a church on a hill with a cross on top of the church.”)(“我们的确顺道去过山丘上的一座教堂，那座教堂顶端有一个十字架。”)
A building, or a part of a building where they stay, now, where there is a long narrow section, a roof supported, a flat roof, I believe, long and narrow, supported by posts—他们现在住的一栋建筑物或一栋建筑物的局部，其中有一个狭长的部分，一个有支撑的屋顶，一个平坦的屋顶，又长又窄，由柱子支撑着——
(“Verandah, long and narrow, flat roof, supported by posts, where we stay.”)(“我们住的地方有凉台、又长又窄，平坦的屋顶，由柱子支撑着。”)
With a floor not of wood, perhaps of cement, but of a stone, definitely a stone or sand colored stone floor.还有一面地板，不是木地板。也许是水泥地板——一定是石头地板，绝对是石头地板或是沙子颜色的石头地板。
(“Concrete [cement] floor.”)(“混凝土[水泥]地板。”)
This could be a verandah.这可能是一个凉台。
(“Yes, there was a verandah.”)(“是的，有一个凉台。”)
Outside of their door, I believe, a large bucket of sorts, filled with sand for cigarettes, fairly good size.在他们的门外，我相信，有一个桶子之类的东西，装满熄烟用的沙子。相当不错的尺寸。
(“Outside there were huge flower pots resembling these, but not filled with sand for cigarettes. [Presumably, they were filled with sand or dirt for the plants.])(“外面有几个和这些很像的花盆，但没有装满熄烟用的沙子。”[大概装满植物用的沙或土])
With this verandah sticking out with some rocks beneath.这个凉台往外突出，底下有一些岩石。
(“There were rocks near the verandah.”)(“凉台附近有岩石。”)
And beyond that, the ocean or bay.在那之外是海洋或海湾。
(“The ocean or bay was directly across the road.”)(“路的对面就是海洋或海湾。”)
Right at the shore, perhaps down and ahead, a scooped out circular indentation, where there is swift current because of rocks—就在岸右边，也许在前面的正下方，有一个被挖空的圆形(比手势)凹地，因为岩石的关系，那里水流急速——
(“There was an indentation like this, don't know about current.”)(“有一个像这样的凹地，水流就不知道了。”)
—And at this particular point, by this indentation, no beach———而且就在这一个地点，在这个凹地旁边，没有海滩——
("Right. No beach here near these rocks [and indentation].)(“没错。这里的这些岩石[还有凹地]附近没有海滩。”)
—Though there is a beach to the left and right, rather wide ones.——但是在左右两边都有一片海滩。相当宽广的海滩。
(“Yes [beach to left and right].”)(“是的[在左右两边]”)
A twist or something twisted.一次扭转，或某个被扭转的东西。
("Don't know.”)(“不知道。”)
7 o’clock and dinner where there are boats close by. Some of these sailboats.7点钟在附近有很多船的地方晚餐。这些船有些是帆船。
(“Never went to dinner at 7 PM.")(“从来没有在7点钟去吃晚餐。”)
A waitress with some mark visible on the arm. A dark mark or bruise perhaps, or this could be a patch of dark freckles, but very noticeable: or a scar.一名手臂上有某个可见标记的女服务生。或许是一个深色的标记或瘀青，这也可能是一片深色的雀斑。但是非常显眼；或者是一道疤痕。
(“Bill thinks he remembers seeing a waitress with a scar on her arm. ’’)(“比尔认为他记得见过一个女服务生的手臂上有一道疤痕。”)
8:15, again by water, but this time in a more Spanish sort of environment. A green cabaret. A nuisance there. A half completed structure with many windows. 18 shrubs, I do not know to what this refers.8：15，又是在水边，但这次是比较西班牙式的环境。一间绿色的歌舞秀夜总会，那里有人闹事。一个半完成的结构，有很多窗户。18棵灌木。我不知道这是指什么。
(“Visited a nightclub, called Drumbeat, that was green. Definitely a nuisance there, a loudmouthed Englishman who annoyed everyone by whistling and singing with the band, not many windows, but some shrubs. ’’)(“去过一间夜店，名叫鼓声，是绿色的。那里肯定有人闹事，一个大声喧哗的英格兰人有时吹口哨，有时跟着乐团一起唱歌，惹火了每一个人，没有很多窗户，但有一些灌木。”)
And some small natural items that look like coal, perhaps deposits of some sort.还有一些天然的东西，看起来像煤炭，也放是某种矿床。
(?)(“？”)
The name of one establishment has to do with twin, or two.一个机构的名称一定和双重或二有关系。
(“Could be a restaurant-club we visited, strange name, Charley Charley La Fins.”)(“有没有可能是我们去过的一家餐酒馆，奇怪的名字，查理·查理·拉·芬[Charley Charley La Fin's]。”)
One(name) has to do with a cluster of things, and a group or a group like a nest for example.一定是和一大堆东西，以及一群或比方说，像一个巢那样一群有关系的一个。
(?)(“？”)
One(name of establishment) has to do with green.与绿色有关系的一个(场所的名字)。
(“We discussed going to dinner several times at Worry's Green Shutters Inn, but decided against it because they specialized in Italian food, and Bill doesn’t like it.”)(“我们讨论过几次要不要去“成瑞的绿百叶窗餐馆”[Warys Green Shutters Inn]吃饭，后来决定不去，因为他们专攻意大利菜，但比尔不喜欢。”)
A J R or J B, not having to do with Ruburt.一个JR或一个JB，和鲁柏没有关系。
(“No.’’) ’(“没有。”)
A missionary place, 1671, to do with scrolls, with a dungeon or somewhat dungeon-like area connected. In a north section though not strictly due north, and perhaps 125 for a tour.一个传教的地方。1671，和卷轴有关。与一个地牢或有点像地牢的区域有关联。在北边的一个部分，但不见得是正北，而且也许导览有关的125。
(“We went by Fort Charlotte, in the north section. There is a dungeon there, but don't know whether or not it had anything to do with missionaries and took no tour.”)(“我们短暂拜访过夏洛特碉堡[Fort Charlotte]，在北边一个部分。那里有一个地牢，但不知道它和传教士有没有任何关系，而且没有参加导览。”)
This is not the name bur it is a connection, it is not the name, Abbe La Blanc. (Robs interpretation of my pronunciation.)这不是一个名称，而是一个连结：它不是一个名称：阿贝·拉·白朗(Abbe La Blanc罗对我的发音所做的解读)。
(“No.')(“不是。”)
Red globular objects there and another language.那里有红色球状物体，以及另一种语言。
“No.”(“没有。”)
LA connection here I do not understand, concerning cold, frigid or frosty. Drafty. And with many deaths in the past.这里有一个我不了解的连结，与冰冷、寒冷或严寒有关。
(“Maybe Fort Charlotte, where prisoners died.”)(“可能是夏洛特碉堡，有囚犯死在那里。”)
A particular grown woman’s ensemble in a store with an orange awning or in the window, with a high price tag. A three-piece outfit... I pick up one two five here again and I believe our friend, the cat lover, enters the shop and that the ensemble is in the window... La Rue... I do not know, a street or does she rue entering the shop? The street having to do with flowers, this street, flowers in the name perhaps. And with a traffic problem in the heart of town. With a crystal connection.某一套成年女人的服装，在一间有橘色遮雨篷的商店里，或是在橱窗内，挂着高价的吊牌。一套三件式的服装。这里我再一次接收到两个5，我相信我们的朋友，那个爱猫人(蓓·加拉格)进入那家店，那一整套服装就在橱窗里。拉·吕(La Rue)……我不知道，一条街，或是她后悔进了那家店，你看。这条街和花有关系，这条特定的街。也许花就在街名当中。而且和一个城镇市中心的一个交通问题，以及和水晶有关联。
("No to all of these.”)(“这些全都没有。”)
1781 and a jail... 1842 and a museum. 1589 and an evacuation. I do not know if the evacuation is a hole or a mass evacuation of people: a hole in terms of a structure or the ruins of a structure.1781年和一座监狱。1842年和一座博物馆。1589年和一次撤离。我不知道撤离是一个洞还是一次人民的集体撤离：就一个结构而言的一个洞或一个结构的废墟。
(?(？
(In notes taken from discussion October 28, Bill said 1781 was when the Americans sailed into Nassau and were captured in Revolutionary War.)(在10月28日的讨论笔记里，比尔说1781年美国人航行到拿骚，在革命战争中被俘虏。)
1461 and a fountain with steps leading to it. A circular formation surrounded by flowers I believe, with closely-crowded, old, at least second-story structures to the left side of the street, or close to the street and nearly identical in rows.1461年和一个有台阶通向它的喷泉。一个圆形的格式，我相信四周围绕着花，街道左边或靠近街道，有几排简直一模一样，至少两层楼的结构。
(Peg and Bill note that if you substitute water tower for fountain, then everything else is correct, except that the date means nothing to them. Because of the water connection between water tower and fountain, this may be perfectly legitimate. 1461 means nothing, but we [Gallaghers] visited a water tower, circular, surrounded by flowers, we had to climb what is called the Queens staircase [steps] to get there. These were carved by slaves. Two story houses were to the left, in rows.)(蓓和比尔写道，如果你用水塔取代喷泉，那么其他一切就都说对了，除了年份对他们来说毫无意义以外。因为水塔与喷泉之间有水的连结，所以这可能十分合理。1461年没有意义，但我们[加拉格夫妇]去看过一个水塔，圆形，周围都是花，我们必须爬上所谓的女王阶梯[台阶]才能到那里。这些台阶是由奴隶凿切而成的。左边有些成排的两层楼房屋。)
A commemoration of a stabbing.一次刺杀事件的纪念。
(On leaving Nassau October 31, we passed a memorial, though not a statue, dedicated to Sir Harry Oakes, who was murdered. This made a very big impression on us, because Peg has always been interested in the murder, and Peg and Bill asked questions about it of several people. [Discussion of the murder and the landmarks was one of the important parts of their trip.])(10月31日要离开拿骚时，我们经过一个纪念物，但不是雕像，题献给被人谋杀身亡的哈利·奥克斯爵士[Sir Harry Oakes]。这之所以让我们印象非常深，是因为蓓对这个谋杀事件向来很感兴趣，而且蓓和比尔向几个人问过与他有关的问题。[这个谋杀以及重大事件的讨论是他们此行的一大重点。])
A statue, I do not know here. It is connected with a general, but I believe the man whose image is represented by the statue, stabbed the general.一座雕像。这里我不知道。它和一个将军有关联，但我相信雕像所代表的男人刺杀了将军。
(“No general. Sir Harry Oakes was bludgeoned to death, I think, though he may have been stabbed too, I don't know.”)(“没有将军。我认为，哈利·奥克斯爵士是被乱棍打死的，但他也有可能是被刺杀的，我不知道。”)
It would seem to be the commemoration of a murder to me.在我看来，它好像是纪念一个谋杀事件。
(“Commemorates Oakes, who was murdered.”)(“纪念被谋杀的奥克斯。”)
Either 1861 or 16, I am not sure.不是1861年就是16年，我不确定。
(“No. “)(“不是。”)
Metal connected with the statue...与雕像有关联的金属……
(“No.')(“不是。”)
And a modern street light very close nearby而且在很近的地方似乎有一盏时髦的街灯。
(?)(“？”)
Connected with this, very dim here, de, I believe, seven—Savrantinos与这个有关，这里非常模糊：康寇迪安特。De(德)，我相信，7——Savrantinos(萨弗兰提诺斯[结结巴巴的发音])
(halting pronunciation) I said concordi—Concordiat de Savrantino.我说康寇迪(concordi)——康寇迪尔特·德·萨弗兰提诺斯(Concordiat de Savrantino)。
(?)(“？”)
Date. We are still trying for dates, you see. 16 eight three. Two, 1724, 1721, San Josius... San... San..日期。我们还在设法接收日期，你知道。16、8、3。2，172——1721。圣荷西奥斯(San Josius[我的解读])圣，SAN……。
(?)(“？”)
A memorial commemorating the beginning of a revolution or a war. The San Joseo is not correct exactly. San Juan?纪念一场革命或战争的一个纪念物。圣荷西欧(San Joseo)也不太对。圣胡安(San Juan)？
(?)(“？”)
A battle fought originally by the sea. Is the term, galleons... ships?最初在海边开打的一场战役。galleons(译注：15到18世纪间用作商船或军舰的大型帆船)这个字是……船只吗？
(“Numerous battles by the sea.”)(“在海边有很多场战役。”)
A queen who dies on Friday in another land has something to do with the battle.在另一个国家，一位于周五死亡的皇后与这场战役有关系。
(?(“？”
(in earlier discussion noted, Bill mentioned there was a statue of Queen Victoria.)(“在稍早的讨论记录中，比尔提到有一座维多利亚女王[Queen Victoria]的雕像。”)
The hero, represented in a statue, had once been a cobbler and came from a place that sounds like Guatemala, though that is not precise. The name is like this: San Guatama? San Guatama? And he had two brothers, one brother working against him in politics.由一座雕像代表的英雄曾经是鞋匠，来自一个听起来像瓜地马拉(Guatamala)的地方，但这不准确。地名是像这样：圣瓜地马拉？(San Guatamala，我的解读)圣瓜地马拉？而且有两个兄弟。一个兄弟在这些政治活动中与他作对。
(?(“？”
(In earlier discussion. Bill said there was a statue of Columbus and there was a connection in his mind between him and cobbling.)(“在稍早的讨论记录中，比尔说有一座哥伦布[Columbus]的雕像，而且在他心中，他与圆石铺路之间有关联。”)
Now. This statue, with the row houses to the left and the street light: Following around the curve to the left you run into a better sectioned area, up a hill on a broad street now, then the street curves again to the left, and beneath it are rocks, that is, a rocky ledge down to the sea, I believe. lo the right just before this last left hand turn and hill is a fairly low building where I believe our friends eat, or at least they visit here.现在。这个雕像，左边有成排的房间和街灯：顺着弯曲处转向左边，现在你就来到一个地段更好的区域，在一条宽阔大街的斜坡上面。然后这条街又再次弯向左边，而且它的底下是岩石——也就是说，一座往下延伸到海边的石矶岩坡，我相信。就在最后这个左弯处和斜坡的右边，有一栋相当低矮的建筑物，我相信我们的朋友在这里用餐，或至少来访过。
(?)(“？”)
This place is fairly modern, and fairly, it would seem, American by contrast to other places they visit, but only by contrast.这个地方相当时髦，而且对比他们去过的其他地方，这里似乎也颇有美国风。但只是对比的效果而已。
(?)(“？”)
Further on, at the top of the hill, at the left hand turn, is another white building at the curve, that is a new building. Now I believe our friends stay further up this same road for the night.在山顶上再过去，在左手边的转弯处，有另一栋建筑位于弯角，那是一栋新的建筑物。现在我相信我们的朋友就住在同样这条路更上面一点的地方。
(''No.”)(“不是。”)
A saint here, and a gorge. Or perhaps this is Saint George.这里有一个圣人(saint)，还有一个峡谷(gorge)。或者，这也许是圣乔治(Saint George)。
(“A Prince George Hotel is right near the docho.”)(“一间乔治王子旅馆[Puince George Hotel]就在这附近。”)

SESSION 295 OCTOBER 19, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY 出自第295节 1966年10月19日 星期三 晚上9点


Motorcycles through streets, or bicycles. But many other vehicles beside cars: instead of cars, that is.机车穿梭街道，或自行车。但是有很多其他的交通工具，除了汽车之外——也就是说，不是汽车。
(“Many motorcycles, bicycles and surreys. We rent scooter or cycle.”)(“很多机车、自行车和四轮浏览马车。我们租了摩托车或脚踏车。”)
A loaf of bread. Do they bring a loaf of bread to their room?一条面包。他们是不是带了一条面包到他们的房间？
(“Yes. We buy a loaf of bread for trip mentioned next. Trip by motorcycle.”)(“是的。我们为了接下来提到的旅程买了一条面包。机车之旅。”)
4578. I do not know to what this refers just now.4758。目前我不知道这是指什么。
(?)(“？”)
Something they intended to do today and did not do. A particular journey, I believe, planned but not taken.某件他们今天打算做但没有去做的事。一趟特定的旅程，我相信，计划了但没有实行。
(“Yes. Planned to rent scooter on Friday but didn't do so till Saturday.”)(“是的。本来计划星期五租摩托车，但直到星期六才去。”)
They receive a message of sorts today.他们今天收到某种讯息。
The name Veronica. This is not necessarily connected with the message. Some dim connection with Ovid.薇若妮卡(Veronica)这个名字。这不一定和讯息有关联。与奥维德(Ovid)有模糊的连结。
(“No.”)(“不是。”)
A private estate that catches their eye, with an iron fence about it or gate, with a gate.一座私人庄园吸引了他们的目光，周围有铁制篱笆，或栅栏门——以及一扇大门。
(“Many private estates, with gates.”)(“很多私人庄园，都有大门。”)
A strange marketplace that does not sell vegetables.一个奇怪的市场，不卖蔬菜。
(“Yes. We visited a straw market, native women weaving baskets and bags and selling them a loaf of bread. Do they bring a loaf of bread to their room? Yes. We buy a loaf of bread for trip mentioned next, trip by motorcycle.)(“是的。我们去过一个稻草市场，原住民妇女编织篮子和袋子，并且卖了一条面包给他们。他们是不是带了一条面包到他们的房间？是的。我们为了接下来提到的旅程买了一条面包，机车之旅。”)
A Spanish woman with a young son.一个带着一名幼子的西班牙女人。
(“Yes. Bill thinks he remembers noticing a woman he thought was Cuban, with a baby.”)(“是的。比尔认为他记得当时注意到一个他觉得是古巴人的女人，带着一个婴儿。”)
A tour taken to the south, perhaps by boat and bus.一趟往南走的旅程，也许是搭船和巴士。
("Did go to a nearby island [tour] by boat and vehicle referred to as bus, but it is to the north.”)缺
A place that sounds like Grenada that has a connection with nuts, exports nuts, I believe.一个听起来像格瑞那达(Gernada)的地方(我的解读)，与坚果有关联。外销坚果，我相信。
(“Discussed Caribbean with an English woman and asked her her favorite island. She said, without question, Grenada.” Note by Rob: Grenada is way south of Nassau.)(“与一个英格兰女人讨论过加勒比海，并且问她最喜欢哪个岛。她说，毫无疑问是，格瑞那达。罗的注：格瑞那达在拿骚南边。”)
A group of 6, and a small room that looks like an elevator. They are crowded.一堆6，以及一个小房间，看起来像一个电梯。
("No. ”)(“不是。”
A serious disagreement between the Gallaghers, perhaps concerning a purchase.他们很拥挤。加拉格夫妇之间有一连串争执。也许和购物有关。
("No.”(“不是。”
(But Bill overheard a serious argument)(但是比尔无意中听到一场严重的争执。)
A seven o’clock appointment at a place with mainly white decor, white tablecloths, white waiters uniforms. A stage for a band. A girl wearing a skirt with long red fringes.一场7点的约会，在一个装潢以白色为主的地方——白色桌布、服务生的白色制服。一个乐园的一座舞台，一个女孩穿着一条有红色长流苏的裙子在跳舞。
("No.')(“不是。”)
This place is close to the road. A sign lit up in the center of a palm tree out front. Somehow the letter U is prominent. For example, though this is not the name: U-bango, with the large letter U.这个地方靠近马路。在门前的一棵棕榈树正中央有一个招牌亮着灯。不知为何U这个字母很显眼。例如，但名称不是这个：U-bango，有一个大写的U。
("No.")(“不是。”)
A grip, GRIP, connected here. Places close by seem to be somewhat on stilts, brown colored. They seem to be shingled. Ramshackle, stilted from the back but level at the front to the street. These to the right of the building just mentioned.一个抓握，G-R-I-P，与这里有关联。附近许多地方似乎不知为何坐落在支柱上。颜色是棕色。它们的屋顶似乎是木瓦。这些就在刚才提过的建筑物右边。
("No. )(“不是。”)
And a sand or beach behind them. Several of these ramshackle like structures. At least they are far from new. They do not seem to have much unity, though they are all closely connected.而且它们的后面有沙子或一座海滩。这些有几间像是快要解体的结构。至少它们谈不上是新的。它们似乎不太统一，但它们全都紧密相连。
(None of this meant anything to the Gallaghers.)(“这对加拉格夫妇全都毫无意义。”)
I do not understand. Here I pick up an Osborne connection. I do not know to what this refers. Perhaps to a discussion of the Kennedy assassination. Ruburt has been reading about this again, however, so we are not sure on this.我不了解。这里我接收到一个与奥斯本(Osborne)的关联。我不知道它是指什么。也许是指肯尼迪遇刺的一场讨论会。可是鲁柏又在读与之相关的东西，所以对此我们不确定。
("No.")(“不是。”)
An eleven, or one one one designation. A small shack by the water, with some red on it, by some rocks, where the Jesuit(Bill) goes underwater(snorkeling). A sign on it with four letters, five at the most.一个11，或111的名称。水边的一个小屋，上面有些红色，靠近某些岩石，耶稣会士的潜水之处。它上面的招牌有4个字母，最多5个。
("Could be Paradise Island, where Bill went snorkeling. There was a thatched hut near, but don't know about 11 or a sign.”(“可能是天堂岛[Paradise Island]，比尔去那里浮潜。附近有一个茅草屋，但不知道11或一个招牌是什么。”
(In our earlier discussion, Bill said that the hut had something red on it, though it isn’t mentioned here. This could also refer to the red connection with snorkeling mentioned in the first part of this material.)(在我们稍早前的讨论中，比尔说这个茅屋上面有个红色的东西，但这里却没有提到。这也可能是指这个资料第一部分提到，与浮潜有关的红色。)
Something to do with a schedule that had not been planned for the day. Perhaps involving a northeast location, or a northeast section of another location.加在行程表上的某件事，不在当天的计划中。也许和东北方的一个地点，或另一个地点的东北区域有关。
(“Yes. On Friday we went to Paradise Island which is northeast of Nassau, and we hadn't planned to go there.”)(“是的。星期五，我们去拿骚东北方的天堂岛，本来没有计划要去那里。”)
A center room with pale walls, first floor, where they stay a night.一个正中央的房间，有着灰白的墙壁，在一楼，他们在此住了一晚。
(“No.”)(“不是。”)
A torn page of a pad or notebook, with numbers written on it, either for the Jesuit(Bill) or in his handwriting.从一本便条簿或笔记簿撕下的一页，上面写着数字，不是写给耶稣会士，就是他自己的笔迹。
(“Yes. Bill tore a page out of his notebook to write down the addresses of people we met.”)(“是的。比尔从他的笔记本撕下一页，把我们要碰面的人所在地址写在上面。”)
A page number 397 connected with him. A brown book.与他有关联的一个页码397。一本褐色的书。
(“No.”)(“不是。”)
An invasion in the place to the south mentioned earlier. In 1471 and 1732.之前提过的一个南部地方有一场入侵。在1471年和1732年。
(“No.")(“不是。”)
Connection with small nuggets here.这里与小金属块有关联。
(?)(“？”)
The Jesuit(Bill) thinks strongly how computers could change the islands and discusses this with some heat or enthusiasm with another man, I believe, who wears a gray or white jacket and a sporty hat.耶稣会士强烈认为电脑可以改变这些群岛，而与另一个男人为这事发生有些激烈或热血的讨论，我相信，那个男人穿着一件灰色或白色的夹克，戴了一顶运动帽。
(“Bill discussed this with a man we met, but he didn't wear a coat or hat.”)(“比尔与我们遇见的一个男人讨论过这件事，但他没有穿夹克也没有戴帽子。”)
A calendar. Does someone give him a calendar?一个日历。是不是有人给了他一本日历？
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
Some connection with a stolen item.与一个被偷的物件扔某种关联。
(“No. ’)(“没有。”)
The word severin.severin这个字。
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
A chain and a rocket一条链子和一个火箭。
(“No.” In discussion Bill mentions that plane changed course because of rocket launching at Cape Kennedy; this seems legitimate to me.)(“没有。”在讨论中，比尔提到飞机更改航线，因为在肯尼迪角[Cape Kennedy]有火箭发射；这在我看来似乎是合理的。)
RESULTS OF THE GALLAGHER TEST加拉格测验的结果

SESSION 296 OCTOBER 24, 1966 9 PM MONDAY 出自第296节 1966年10月24日 星期一 晚上9点


Something twirls and goes fast.某个东西快速旋转而过。
("No. ’)(“没有。”)
Three seven eight. This could be in connection with an airplane.378。这可能是时间，与一架飞机有关联。
("No. ”)(“没有。”)
A dismissal of some kind, someone dismisses them abruptly, perhaps, or dismisses the Jesuit or he has the impression. Or the plane lands at this time and the people are dismissed then.某种打发。也许，有人突然打发他们，或打发耶稣会士。或者是飞机在这时降落，然后乘客被打发走。
("No.")(“没有。”)
A change in plans. I do not know if this refers to flight plans or not.计划的改变。我不知道这是不是指航班计划。
("As noted above, there was a change in flight plans because of rocket launching. )(“如上所述，由于火箭发射，航班计划有改变。”)
Another episode concerning a church. This, I believe, still out of the country, and before this hour of the session. (Session held October 24, 9 PM) Small boys connected with that episode, and a complete turnabout.另一个与一间教堂有关的事件。我相信这还是在国外，而且是在这一节上课时间之前。(10月24日9点举行的那一节)与那个事件有关的许多小男孩，以及一个彻底的转变。
("At a church where we stopped, we listened to choir practice, were surprised that so many young adults were in the choir, instead of small boys or children, commented on the turnabout from what you would expect.”)(“我们在一座教堂停下来，听了唱诗班练唱，惊讶的是，唱诗班里居然有这么多年轻的成人，而不是小的男孩或儿童，对你预期的转变发表评论。”)
Something takes an inordinate amount of time. They fidget, stew. I do not know if they stew or if they eat stew, you see.某件事花了过多的时间。他们坐立难安、焦急万分(stew)。我不知道他们是否焦急万分，还是他们吃了炖菜,你知道。
("No.")(“没有。”)
An amphitheater in evening, early evening, before trip home.今晚或傍晚时分的一个圆形露天剧场，在启程回家之前。
("No.")(“没有。”)
Either they see a bullfight or someone behaves in a bullish manner.他们要不是看了一场斗牛，就是有人发了一顿牛脾气；但是我强烈相信情况就是这样。
("No.")(“没有。”)
SAG. Large letters. Capitals. This seems to have something to do with the plane.. 19 three six, or nineteen six six in connection with the plane, type of plane, I believe, or the pilot is connected with a man who in 1936 conceived ideas not used until this particular planes construction.SAG。大型字母，大写。这似乎与飞机有关联。19、6以及19、66，与那一型的飞机有关联，我相信。或是机师与一个男人有连结，那个男人在1936年想出许多点子，但是直到飞机建造为止都没有被采用。
(?)(“？”)
They visited another place with important historical connections, about 1437 or 1473. A lighthouse there. Three o’clock in the afternoon when visited, I believe. A large pennant or such with red, white, blue. Another with gold and blue and either green or white. These are like flags.他们拜访了另一个有着重要历史连结的地方，大约是1437或1473年。那里有一座灯塔。我相信他们是下午3点钟去那里的。一面大型的三角旗之类的，有着红、白、蓝三色。另一面则是金色和蓝色，以及不是绿色就是白色。这些像旗子。
(“Passed an old lighthouse but don't know about flags or the rest.”)(“经过一座老灯塔但不知道旗子或其他东西。”)
A woman vocalist or pianist. Dark skinned but blonde hair. A white sequined dress.一个女性声乐家或钢琴家。深色皮肤但有着金色头发。一件白色亮片连身裙。
(“No. ’)(“没有。”)
One evening unusually cool and brisk.一个异常凉爽的夜晚。
(“Most evening cool.”)(“大部分晚上都凉爽。”)
Something to do with block formations now, not buildings at all, perhaps models of buildings.现在与区块形态有关联。根本不是建筑物，也许是建筑物的模型。
(“No.”)(“没有。”)
Something four by five某个4乘5的东西。
(?)(“？”)
1886 and 1742.1886，以及1742。
(?)(“？”)
FROMSESSION 297 OCTOBER 26, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY出自第297节 1966年10月26日 星期三 晚上9点
A vibrant encounter with the cat lover’s father.一次热情洋溢的邂逅，与爱猫人的父亲有关。
(“No.” Peg visited him of course on their return.)(“不是。”蓓在回程当然去探望过他。)
An unpleasant episode and a matter of money.一个不愉快的事件以及一个和钱有关的问题。
(“No.” At our first discussion, though, Peg told me that a brother-in-law had just come into a tremendous amount of money as a result of lawyers fees, he is a lawyer, and a rich account. She then tied this in with an unpleasant episode in the past where there was trouble with another sister-in-law, and this brother-in-law, and thought that the money would now make this sister-in-law sit up and wonder about her own actions in the past.)(“不是。”不过，在我们第一次的讨论中，蓓告诉我，她的一个姻亲由于律师的缘故，刚刚继承了一大笔钱，他是一名律师，还有一个丰厚的账户。然后她把这件事跟过去一个不愉快的事件连在一起，这个男性姻亲与另一个女性姻亲有纠纷，但是这笔钱现在会让这个女性姻亲大吃一惊，而怀疑她自己过去的行为。)
Something to do with a fabric also.也和一种布料有关。
(“No. )(“不是。”)
And a piece of paper, this may or may not be a legal paper.还有一张纸，这可能是也可能不是一张法律文件。
(“No.” Again, this could refer to the account mentioned above, which was legal. These are my comments; Jane's.)(“不是。”再一次，这可能是指上文提到的账户，与法律有关。这是我的评论；珍的。)
A grab bag.一个摸彩袋(grab bag,译注：grab的原意是抓。)
(“No.” Again, Jane's comments. This could refer to grab in terms of greed, definitely in Peg's account of the sister-in-law.)(“不是。”再一次，珍的评论，这可能是指贪婪的抓取，蓓描述的女性姻亲肯定是如此。)
A Pennsylvania connection, distant, and a hospital perhaps, Ruburt knows of this circumstance.与宾夕凡尼亚州有一个遥远的关联，也许还有一家医院，鲁柏知道这个状况。
(Refers to another sister-in-law of Peg’s, who was ill; no connection in particular though.)(“指的是蓓的另一个女性姻亲，她生病了；但是没有特别的关联。”)
A fly by night outfit.一套不可靠的设备。
(Peg has a poor opinion of the hospital above.)(“蓓对上述医院的评价很差。”)
8 PM last night, this very significant.昨晚8点，这非常重要。
(“No.")(“不是。”)
An unknown circumstance concerning your friends which will not be discovered until later, perhaps middle of next week.一个与你们的朋友有关的未知状况，但他们稍后才会发现，也许下周三左右。
(“No.")(“不是。”)

SESSION 297 第297节 恐惧


OCTOBER 26, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年10月26日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down; her eyes soon began to open; her pace was fairly good.)(珍坐下来，同时开始在出神中讲话；她的眼睛很快就开始睁开，她的速度相当好。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Finally Ruburt discovered for himself, this morning precisely, his basic problem—the problem that eventually everyone must face.现在。终于鲁柏自己发现了，正好就是今天早上，他的根本问题——每个人最终都必须面对的问题。
He knows it now in the only real way it can be known. You learned it some time ago, and he knew it intellectually. He did not understand however that fear is not practical. I am speaking of course generally, and of anticipatory fear, not the fear, quite healthy, with which a man faces a ferocious beast.以一种唯一能够真正知道的方式，他知道了这件事。前些日子，你就得知此事了，而他是在理智上知道。然而，他不了解恐惧是不实际的。我说的当然是一般状况，也就是恐惧的预期，而不是一个人面对一头凶猛野兽而产生的恐惧，那是相当健康的恐惧。
，，He has indeed now learned one of the most basic lessons of his life. Had he not learned it, there would have been further difficulties. A man uses his abilities according to the extent of this realization. The notes he wrote should be faithfully read, as he intends each morning, for some time.他现在确实得知他生命中最根本的课题。要是他不知道，就会有更多的难题。一个人是按照他这种了悟的程度来使用能力的。他应该要忠实地阅读他写的笔记一段时间，像他打算每天早上这么做一样。
(Seth here speaks of Jane's intuitive and Emotional realization of the basic causes behind the foot and other muscular troubles that have plagued her since early summer. She wrote notes on the experience, which took place this morning.)(赛斯这里讲的是，珍在直觉和情感上了悟脚部和其他肌肉毛病背后的根本原因，这些毛病打坐初夏就开始困扰她。她把今天早上发生的经验笔记下来。)
Our poor results in the last experimental data were directly the result of the fear which he finally faced. Fear under normal circumstances is immobilizing, as he most certainly now realizes.我们上一次实验资料的糟糕结果，是他终于面对的恐惧所造成的结果。在正常情况下，恐惧会让人无法行动，这一点他肯定十分明白。
The symbolic journey of the spirit, and the finding finally of the self always involves the journey of the self through fear, and its emergence. To the extent that this journey is faced, the greater the perils, but the greater the rewards.这趟象征性的灵性之旅，以及最终发现自己，是一趟自己穿越恐惧并且从中脱身的旅程。面对这趟旅程到某种程度，危险就会越大，但是报酬也越大。
He has been going through such a time. He decided to make the journey. He is now returning, and he has learned much. Without the experience his abilities would not fully develop. You went through your own journey and also emerged some time ago.他历经了这样一段时期。他决定踏上这个旅程。他现在正在返回，而且已经学到很多。没有这个经验，他的能力就不会充分发展。前一段时间，你经历了你自己的旅程，而且也脱身了。
Fear cannot be ignored. It must be faced and conquered. It always leads to retreat when it is not faced. The physical image is indeed a replica in many ways of the inner self. When a man is ill it is not necessarily because he wants to be ill subconsciously. It is not necessarily because he is receiving some hidden psychological benefit, or because the illness fulfills some need. He is ill often—always in fact—because of a distortion that is occurring within the self, and materialized in physical form.不能无视于恐惧的存在。一定要面对它，并且征服它。如果不面对恐惧，它就会一再导致逃避和退缩。肉体形象在很多方面的确是内我的一个复制品。当一个人生病时，不一定是因为他在潜意识里想要生病。不一定是因为他在心理上正得到某个隐藏的好处，也不见得是因为这个病满足某个需求。他之所以生病往往——事实上，一直都是——因为一个发生在自己之内并且具体化为物质形式的扭曲。
You and I were quite right in advising Ruburt to face this through without the treatment of a doctor or chiropractor. I(Jane pointed to herself) you see, would not necessarily give this same advice to someone else. He was on several occasions about ready to visit your Piper. (The chiropractor.) I wanted him to face the symptoms for what they were, and to find the cause. Apparent causes came and went, and would continue to do so had he not—with, my friend, your help and mine—found the master cause.我和我劝鲁柏彻底面对这个问题而不找医生或整脊师治疗，是对的。我(珍指着她自己)你看，不见得会给别人同样的忠告。他有几次准备要去看你们的吹笛人(Piper，整脊师)。我想要他如实面对症状，找出原因。外显的原因来来去去，他要是不面对的话，它们还是会继续来来去去——借着我们的朋友，你的帮助和我的帮助——找到主要原因。
There are always ample apparent causes behind symptoms. Various upsetting events for example. I am going into this as I go into your own psychological circumstances when I feel it advisable.在症状的背后永远都会有大量外显的成因。比方说，各式各样令人沮丧的事件。当我感觉时机对的时候，我就要来讲讲你自己的心理状况，届时我会谈这件事。
Fear, and a complete, if sometimes momentary loss of confidence, was the basic cause that led to retreat and the physical symptoms. Fear itself is damaging as such, particularly when it is anticipatory. He knew enough so that this was partially counterbalanced. Otherwise he literally would have been in worse shape.恐惧，以及完全——如果有时候是暂时——失去自信，是导致退缩和身体症状的根本原因。恐惧本身具有破坏力，尤其是预期性的恐惧。他够明了这点，因此有一部分透过平衡作用已经抵消了。否则的话，他的状况真的会更糟。
But this lesson, learned, is a valuable achievement. He understood it, it would seem, of a sudden, but this was only a crystallization of knowledge. The habit of fear would have finally been reflected here in our sessions. I have to a large degree kept my eye upon him, but you see the lesson had to be learned by him.但是这个教训，学到了，是一个可贵的成就。他了解它，好像是突然间，但这只不过是知识的清晰化而已。恐惧的习惯最终会反映在这里，在我们的课上。我非常仔细注意他的状况，但你知道他必须自己学到教训。
You can be grateful also. The winter of the spirit must be journeyed through, and it must not only be conquered but the benefits used. Yet without it maturity cannot arrive. The immobility showed itself physically in faithful replica to the inner immobilization caused by fear. You could see, in other words, the exact extent of the distortion in quite physical terms.你也可能满怀感激。心灵的冬天一定要被当成旅程那样度过，并且它一定不可以只是被征服，而是要利用它的好处。但是没有它，成熟就不会到来。无法动弹显现在肉体上，忠实复制了内在由恐惧造成的无法动弹。换句话说，你可以从相当实质的角度看到确切的扭曲程度。
A lifelong chronic illness of course is the same thing carried to extremes. The completely unattractive person represents the same results in a different manner. The person whose abilities are never utilized is another example.一个终生的慢性病当然是发展过了头的同一件事。完全没有吸引力的人以不同的方式重现同样的结果。从来不曾使用过自身能力的人是另一个例子。
This response to fear is a danger to psychic work, where freedom is necessary. In projections most of all the self must be mobile. Rapidity of perception, mobility of consciousness, openness of Emotional response, are prerequisites for our work. The fearful spirit fears to leave the body, and fears to reside in it also. Ruburt has my congratulations, for he has now successfully passed a period of trial. He tried without involving you except when he grew more than usually discouraged.对恐惧的这种反应会危害需要自由的心灵工作。在投射中，最重要的是，自己必须行动自如。感知的迅速、意识的流动、情感反应的开放，是我们的工作必需的要件。恐惧的心灵既害怕离开身体，也害怕住在身体里。我要恭喜鲁柏，因为他现在成功度过试炼期。他自己尝试，没有让你涉入，除了在他变得比平常更加泄气的时候。
He is now released because he has released himself as much as possible from fear. The fearing habit is highly destructive.他现在解脱了，因为他尽斯所能摆脱了恐惧的束缚。恐惧的习惯有很强的破坏力。
As for your performance today, you have my congratulations also. I was present, for that matter.至于你今天的表现，我也要恭喜你。就那件事而言，我当时在场。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下了。
(Break at 9:29. Jane was fairly well dissociated. Her pace had become fast, her eyes open often. She has a complete record of her experience this morning in a notebook kept for such purposes.(9:29休息。珍相当顺利出离。她的速度已经变快，双眼经常睁开。为了这样的目的，今天早上她在笔记簿上完整记录了她的经验。
(Seth, above, refers to my hypnotizing myself before going to the dentist this afternoon. The effort was very successful and I felt no discomfort. There is a full record of this experience in my prediction notebook.(赛斯在上文指的是我今天下午去看牙医之前先催眠自己的事。这个努力的结果非常成功，我没有感觉任何不适。在我的预测笔记上有这个经验的完整记录。
(Jane resumed at 9:42.)(珍在9:42分继续。)
Now. In projections the inner self is free to travel within its capabilities—underlined, within its capabilities.现在。在投射中，内我是自由的，可以在它的能力范围内旅行——画线，在它的能力范围内。
The inner senses are an attribute of consciousness. The outer senses make this information meaningful to the physical organism, and the body consciousness, the ego. This is for Ruburt’s book.内在感官是意识的一个属性。外在感官使得这个资讯对物质有机体，以及身体意识、自我而言是有意义的。这是为了鲁柏的书。
There are many other experiences encountered in projections and in ordinary living, you see, that are not translated into physical terms, for in physical terms they would have no meaning. The basic assumptions behind them would not be understandable in physical terms.在投射以及日常生活中会遇到很多其他的经验，你知道，没有被翻译成物质的说法，因为从物质角度来看，它们没有任何意义。从物质角度来看，在它们背后的根本假设是无法理解的。
Only some of the data in projections is thus translated. Now, it is possible but difficult to catch your own consciousness in the act of its own natural perception, before impressions become crystallized in physical terms. Even the survival personality must translate perception into terms jt can understand.在投射中的资料只有一些是这样翻译的。现在，要在印象具体化为实质之前，当场逮到你自己的意识正在自然地自行感知，虽然有可能但是不容易。甚至死后犹存的人格也必须把感知翻译成它能够了解的说法。
None of us are ever equipped, for general purposes, to perceive reality in all of its forms. The pyramid gestalts can do this, and we help the pyramid gestalts perform this feat. But as a rule we must pick and choose. There is too much for any consciousness to digest except those so highly developed that even I know little of them.我们没有一个人始终都有配备，为了一般的目的，可以感知每一种形式的实相。金字塔完形能够这么做，我们帮助金字塔完形展现这个技术。但是，在多数情况下，我们必须挑拣和选择。对任何意识来说，要消化的东西太多了，除了那些非常高度发展的意识以外，但是连我对它们都知之甚少。
We are scarcely beginning our work. It will grow through the years, and we shall achieve much. We shall in probability continue it in other existences.我们几乎还没有开始我们的工作。它会一年又一年增长，我们会完成很多工作。我们在其他的存在可能也会继续这个工作。
(Smile.) Basically however you see perception has nothing to do with the outer senses at all. These are dim receivers at best. Some of your dreams tell you far more about the nature of reality than the most vivid physical experience.(微笑)不过你看，基本上感知与外在感官一点关系都没有。这些充其量只是模糊的接收器而已。关于实相的本质，你的一些梦告诉你的远比最生动的肉体经验还要多。
You are at the point of a new and higher plateau. (Jane pointed at me, eyes wide open and dark.) You have not yet reached it however. It has taken you this time to consolidate your gains, and you have helped Ruburt these months also. The interaction between you results you see in a higher form of consciousness, for which both of you are responsible. For you do indeed operate as a gestalt also. Your joint abilities add up to more than your joint abilities.你就要来到一个更高的新高原。(珍指着我，双眼圆睁，颜色很深)不过你还没有抵达。你花了这些时间巩固你的所得，而且这几个月来你也帮了鲁柏。你们之间的互动，你看，产生的结果是一个更高的意识形式，这是你们两位的贡献。因为你们的确也是以一个完形的方式运作。你们共同的能力合起来的力量超过你们共同的能力。
(One minute pause.)(停顿1分钟)
Now, for your friends.现在，为了你们的朋友。
(The Gallaghers, who have been on vacation.)(去度过假的加拉格夫妇)
A vibrant encounter, concerning the cat lovers father. An unpleasant episode, and a matter of money. Something to do with a fabric also, separately, and a piece of paper. This may or may not be a legal paper.一次热情洋溢的邂逅，与爱猫人的父亲有关。一个不愉快的事件以及一个和钱有关的问题。还有某个和一种布料有关东西。分开的，以及一张纸，这可能是也可能不是一张法律文件。
A grab bag. I do not know to what this refers. A Pennsylvania connection, distant. A hospital perhaps. Ruburt knows of this circumstance. A fly-by-night outfit. 8 PM last night, or this evening significant.一个摸彩袋。与宾夕法尼亚州有一个遥远的关联。也许有一家医院。鲁柏知道这个状况。一但对可靠的设备。昨晚8点，或今晚非常重要。
Also an unknown circumstance to your friends, that will not be discovered until later, perhaps the middle of next week.还有一个你们的朋友不知道的状况，他们稍后才会发现，也许下周三左右。
Ruburt will get his money from his magazine, and will hear from them by next Tuesday.鲁柏会从他的杂志得到钱，而且下周地方官就会听到他们的消息。
(One minute pause.(停顿1分钟。
(It is Monday, October 31, as I write this. On Thursday, October 27, the day after this session, Jane heard from the magazine in question, Topper. There has been a mix-up over a period of almost a year, concerning a story of Janes that was almost printed twice, and for which she has yet to be paid. Topper promised payment within a week.)(我写下这个注释的时间是10月31日星期一。在10月27日星期四，上这节课的隔天，珍听到上述杂志《高礼帽》[Topper]的消息。在将近一年的时间里出了一个差错，珍写的一个故事几乎印刷了两次，而她还没有收到钱。《高礼帽》承诺一周内付款。)
A matter of importance approximately next Wednesday. I am trying to tell him about the college position, but for the moment I am unable to.大约下周三会发生一件重要的事。我正试着跟他说大学职位的事，但目前没办法。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Now. He will receive it.现在。他将会得到它。
(This concerns a teaching position Jane has been seeking at Elmira College. She is supposed to get final word the week of October 31 through November 4.)(这和珍在埃尔迈拉学院征求的一个教职有关。她本来应该在10月31日到11月4日这一周收到结果的通知。)
I will end the session early for your convenience.为了你的方便，我将提早结束这一节。
John Bradley and another man in a bar discuss Viet Nam now. The man has a mustache, light brownish or gray. The initials C M enter in here.约翰·布莱德利和另一个男人此时在一家酒吧讨论越南的事。这个男人留胡子，头发是浅棕色或灰白色。这里姓名缩写CM进来了。
My heartiest wishes to you both, and indeed my blessings.向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候，以及更确切地说，我的祝福。
If you have no questions I will end the session.如果你没有任何问题，我就结束这节课。
(“I have no questions, but you can talk a little more if you want to.”)(“我没有任何问题，但你想要的话，可以再多说一点。”)
The book will sell as I have said. Ruburt is doing well now on the book on which he is working. You should sell two more paintings within a relatively brief time.我说过这本书会卖出去。鲁柏目前正在写的书进行得很顺利。你在一段相对来说很短的时间内应该会再卖掉两幅画。
(Sunday evening, October 30, I was approached by a friend who expressed interest in buying a small painting, and I promised to show it to him. At the moment it is in another’s home on loan.)(10月30日星期天晚上，一个朋友来找我，表达他有兴趣买一幅小型的画作，我答应给他看这幅画。目前它被另一个人借放在家里。)
A small remark to Ruburt. His dream about Miss Callahan was a legitimate projection, and they did both meet.给鲁柏的一小段话。他那个关于卡拉汉小姐的梦是一次确实的投射，而且他们两人的确碰面了。
(Jane has a full record of this experience.)(珍完整记录了这个经验。)
Perhaps we shall give some impressions concerning the Bernards before we meet them.也许我们应该在见到伯纳德夫妇(Bernards)之前，先给一些与他们有关的印象。
(Pause. Jane amused; cigarette.)(停顿。珍一脸开心；抽着烟)
Give us a moment.给我们一点时间。
Odd green walls, and something the color of wine. This is textured. They serve some drinks this evening that has a sweet aftertaste, like a liqueur. Four to five people there, closely after 4:30 this afternoon, I believe. Among them perhaps the initials M C or G.奇怪的绿色墙壁，以及某个颜色像葡萄酒的东西。这是有纹理的。他们今晚准备了一些带有甜味的饮料，像利口酒。那里有4到5个人，接近今天下午四点半，我相信。在他们之中也许有人姓名缩写是MC或G。
A mirror. (Pause.) She—T—Sarah, attended a school with a small store nearby; an S is strongly connected, perhaps with the street name. A connection with her and something that begins with Sus, I believe, or that sound, like the first sound in Susquehanna.一面镜子。(停顿)她——T——莎拉(Sarah)上过一所附近有家小商店的学校；与一个S有强烈的关联，也许是街道名称。她和某个我相信开头是Sus，或这个发音的东西有连结，像是Susquehanna(萨斯克汉纳)的第一个音节。
Connection with a pirate.与一个海盗有关联。
For him, connection with a tall white-haired woman, with a slight mustache. This is difficult to explain. The tall person here mentioned could be female. If it is male, he has strong feminine characteristics or manner. This person, you see, not Bernard. It is a relative, fairly close.至于他，他与一名高个子、白头发的女人有连结，她有一点点胡须。这不容易解释。这里提到的高个子可能是女性。如果是男性，那他就是有强烈的女性特质或举止。这个人，你看，不是伯纳德。而是一个亲戚，相当亲近。
An uncle important to him is someone else, I believe. An October 6 incident important, perhaps 1937, though I am not certain. Some kind of a missionary connection, and a two-story house that gives the impression somehow of another story. On her part some connection with mathematics or figures, or a liking of figures. Are these figures or figurines? Enough for now. My best wishes to you both.一个对他很重要的叔叔(伯伯)是别人，我相信。一个10月6日的事件很重要，也许是1937年，但我不确定。与传教有某种关联，以及一栋两层楼的房子，不知为何给人一种还有一层楼的印象。在她的部分，与数学或数字有某种关联，或是对数字的喜爱。这些是数字(figures)还是小雕像(figurines)？暂且够了。给你们两位我最好的祝福。
(“Good, night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:18. Jane was dissociated as usual, she said. Her eyes had remained closed during the Bernard data. We hadn’t expected this. Her pace had been slower, with some long pauses. We were discussing the session when Jane resumed briefly at 10:20.)(10:18分结束。珍说她一如往常出离。她的眼睛在传述伯纳德资料期间一直闭着。我们正在讨论这节课的时候，珍又在10:20分短暂继续。)
A grouping that is somehow geometrical, and the frame of an A, or an A frame structure.一个不知为何是几何形的群组，以及一个A框架，或一个A形框架的结构。
A low room, where lower portions of trees show a yard, (pause) fairly deep, but more narrow at the sides. A porch-type thing that is up somewhat as on stilts.一个低矮的房间，在树木较低的部分露出一个庭院，(停顿)相当深，但是侧面比较窄。一个门廊类型的东西在上面，有点像支柱。
(End at 10:23. Pace quite slow, eyes closed.)(10:23分结束。速度很慢，眼睛闭着。)
(Tracing of the pay record used as the object in the 75th envelope experiment, in the 298th session for October 31,1966.)在1966年10月31日第298节的第75次信封实验用作标的物的薪资记录描摹图

SESSION 298 第298节 旅行意识 信封75


OCTOBER 31, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年10月31日 星期一 晚上9点
(The 75th envelope experiment used as object the employee record stub from Janes first check as a substitute high school teacher. Jane had of course seen it several times since receipt on October 28. The object is printed in black on green paper which contains a faint pattern. The green is itself a light tint. The large numeral in the upper right corner is in red. The back is blank. I placed the record between the usual double Bristols, then sealed it in double envelopes.(第75次信封实验用作标的物的员工记录存根，是珍担任中学代课老师的第一张支票。自从10月28日收到以后，珍当然见过它几次。标的物是黑色油墨印刷在绿色纸张上，包含一个模糊的图案。绿色本身是浅色调。右上角的大型数字是红色的。背面空白。我把这张记录放在普通的双层西卡纸之间，然后密封在双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking in trance with her eyes closed, her pace quite slow with some long pauses.)(珍闭着眼睛，开始在出神中讲话；她的速度很慢，有些长时间的停顿。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. So far, with Ruburt, so good.现在。到目前为止，鲁柏还不错。
He should go to the gallery two hall-days if necessary, not one full day you see.必要时，他应该去画廊两个半天， 而不是一整天，你知道。
(Tonight Jane was asked to do some mailing work at the gallery where she used to work.)(今晚在珍以前上班的画廊，她被要求做一些寄信的工作。)
He may now, if he wants, visit his Piper friend, giving himself constructive suggestions when doing so.如果他想要的话， 他现在可以去看他那个吹笛人朋友，在这么做的时候，给他自己建设性的暗示。
A friendly circumstance arising I believe approximately the middle of next week. (Long pause.)我相信大约下周三左右，一个友善的状况会出现。(长时间停顿)
Your friend, Marian, subconsciously needs to feel that she is needed. It is becoming a mania, and she is courting these problems, or bringing them about. It is a phase however, and she will make her way out of it.你们的朋友，玛丽安，需要感觉她是被需要的。这变成一种狂躁，她正在追着这些问题跑，或正在引发这些问题。不过，这是一个阶段，她会自己找到出路的。
(Our landlord's wife, Marian Spaziani, visited us this evening, and told us tales of the people who call her with long histories of their own illnesses, etc. These episodes have begun to leave Marian herself in a nervous state, etc.)(我们的房东太太，玛丽安·史帕日尼，今晚来拜访我们并且告诉我们一些人的故事，那些人打电话跟她说他们自己的漫长病史等等。这些事件开始让玛丽安本人处于一种紧张的状态等等。)
There are indeed financial changes for the better about to happen on your part. These is a further financial connection to occur within six months, I believe. (Long pause.)在你的部分，财务上的确即将发生更好的变化。这些是一种进一步的财务连结，我相信即将在6个月内发生。(长时间停顿)
Now. We will return to other material.现在。我们要回来谈其他的资料了。
The traveling consciousness as you know it often experiences the feeling of motion and movement through space. This is because there is still translation through the physical senses. You are moving more effectively within camouflage reality, but you are still dealing with it. The focus of your attention has changed somewhat, but you are still strongly relating to the physical field.旅行中的意识，如你所知，它经常体验穿过空间的旅行和移动感。这是因为还有透过肉体感官所做的翻译。你正在伪装实相之内更有效地移动中。你的注意力焦点已经有点改变，但你仍然与物质场域维持强大的连结。
Ruburt’s experience with your Miss Callahan recently was quite legitimate. He used a most advantageous method of projection without knowing that he did so, and I highly recommend this method to you both. When you awaken, or seem to in the middle of the night, try simply to get out of the physical body. Simply try to get out of bed, you see, and to walk into another room while the physical body stays where it is.鲁柏最近邂逅卡拉汉的经验是相当确实的。他在自己完全不知情的状况下，使用了一个有利的投射方法，我非常推荐你们两人使用这个方法。当你醒来，或似乎在半夜时，就干脆尝试出体。只要试着离开床，你看，在肉体留在原处时，走进另一个房间。
If you keep this in mind, generally speaking, then you will find yourself able to do so within a brief time. It is a pleasant and easy way to achieve a projection, and with some experience you will discover that you can maintain good control, walk out of your apartment, and outside. You may then attempt normal locomotion, or levitation.如果你把这件事记在心里，一般而言，你会发现自己在很短时间内就能够做到。这是一个达成投射的方法，既愉快又容易上手，有了一些经验之后，你就会发现你可以控制得很好，走出你们的公寓，到外面去。然后你可以试试正常的移动或漂浮。
There is little strain with this method, and it has benefits from several viewpoints. Simply keep the method in mind so that you are alert to the initial favorable circumstances. You may be half awake. You may be in a false awakening. The method will work in either case. It offers good possibilities in another direction: you can, if you want to do so, look back at your own body.这个方法几乎一点都不费力，而且从几个观点看来有许多好处。只要把这个方法牢记在心，如此一来你对一开始的有利状况会就有警觉。你可能是半睡半醒，你可能是假醒。这个方法在两种状况下都管用。它提供另一个方向的可能性：你可以，如果你想要这么做，回头看看你自己的身体。
You must want to do this however. Often you do not want to see the body by itself, so to speak, and so you choose methods that make this more difficult. Just this one exercise will sharpen your control greatly. It is an ABC you see.然而，你必须想要做这件事才行。常常你并不想要看见可以说独自一个身体，所以你选择让此事更难办到的方法。单单这一个练习就会大大增强你的控制力。你知道，这是入门基础。
The experience will be must less startling to the ego than an abrupt projection, and the ordinary nature of the activities, walking into the next room for example, will be reassuring. You are more calm, and in your own surroundings. Of course Ruburt was out of his body when he saw Miss Callahan, who was in the same condition.这个练习一定比突如其来的投射更不会吓到自我，而且活动的日常性质，比方说，走进隔壁房间，也会比较令人安心。你比较冷静，而且是在你自己的环境里。看到卡拉汉小姐的时候，鲁柏当然是出体了，而卡拉汉小姐状况也是一样。
(A note: Miss Callahan was taken to a home for the elderly a few weeks ago, and has given up her apartment in this house, etc. A couple of days ago Jane and I heard through a fiend that Miss Callahan has twice been found walking along Route 17, a main highway here, as she tried to get back to this house. Her mind is ，failing. Miss Callahans first mention is in the first session of Volume 1.)(一个注：几周前，卡拉汉小姐被带到一间养老院，放弃了她在这栋房子的公寓等等。一两天前，珍和我听一个朋友说卡拉汉小姐有两次被人发现她沿着17号公寓走，那条路是这里的一条主要道路，当时她想要回到这间房子。她的心智在衰退中。第一次提到卡拉汉小姐是在第一册的第1节。)
Now it is possible for someone within the physical body to perceive someone who is not, but it is not usual. And the perceiver must then be a person of strong psychic abilities, whether or not he realizes this. Or the projecting personality must be either driven by high Emotional intensity to make himself known, or be of exceptional ability.现在，在肉体之内的人感知不在肉体之内的人是可能的，但是不常见。而且感知者当时必须是一个心灵能力强大的人，不管他自己知不知道这一点。或者，投射的人格一定是被高情感强调驱使而让他自己为人所知，不然就是具有非比寻常的能力。
The desire to make himself known need not be conscious of course. The projectionist may instead want to deliver a message for example, and to show himself may seem the only way to do so.让他自己为人所知当然不需要有意识。反之，投射者本身可能想要，比方说，传送一个讯息，而让他自己为人所知，可能是唯一可行的方法。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:28. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her eyes began to open and her pace picked up quite a bit. She resumed at 9:40.)(9:28休息。珍一如往常出离。她的眼睛开始睁开，而且她的速度加快不少。她在940继续。)
I did not recommend that Ruburt call off the substitute job because he would not have faced this through if he had done so earlier.我不建议鲁柏停掉代课工作，因为他要是更早之前这么做，他就不会彻底面对这件事。
(Jane has called up the school board and taken her name off the list of teachers on call for substitute duty. Today, October 31.)(珍打电话给学区教育委员会，把她的名字从待命的代课老师清单删除。今天，10月31日。)
I am pleased with our results with the Jesuit and the cat lover.我很满意我们的耶稣会士和爱猫人测验结果。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher have a copy of the material given by Seth regarding their Nassau vacation. Many hits were scored. When Jane has the material and their notes collected in readable form, copies will be attached to a session.)(比尔和蓓有一份赛斯针对他们的拿骚之旅而给的资料副本。很多细节都说中了。当珍收集到可读的资料和他们的笔记时，我们会把副本附加上来。)
Now, do you have an envelope for me?现在，你有没有信封要给我？
(“Yes.” Jane knew that I would have one tonight.(“有。”珍知道今晚我有一个。
(At 9:42 she took the envelope for our 75th experiment from me and pressed it to her forehead in a horizontal position. Her eyes remained closed. Her pace was quite fast.)(9:42分，她从我手上拿了我们第75次实验的信封，把它横放在她的额头上。她的眼睛一直闭着。她的速度很快。)
Give us a moment please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
Connection with an encounter. The number 6-6 PM, 6 as a date, we shall see.与一次邂逅有关联。数字6，6是一个日期，我们以后就知道了。
A connection with greed—a grasp. With an article, an article of clothing. A four plus one, and an initial—initials—I believe three, JAB.与贪婪有关联——紧抓不放。与一件，一件衣服有关联。4加1，以及一个首字母——几个首字母——我相信是三个，JAB。
(Pronounced almost as a question.) Masculine. Playground. Squares. Toreador. Rectangular with stripes.(发音方式几乎像在发问)男子气概。操场。正方形。斗牛士。有条纹的长方形。
A call. The color black. Four numbers. A one and a nine. A date. Perhaps 1963, and a scroll of sorts. Connection with three people and a fourth, separated.一通电话。黑色。四个数字。一个1和一个9。一个日期。也许是1963年，以及一个卷轴之类的。与3个人以及另外第四个人有关联。
Horizontal lines (envelope still to forehead horizontally) with a small square. Piccadilly Square. A city. Very distant connection with something like Cincinnati, Ohio.水平的线条(信封仍然横放在额头上)有一个小正方形。皮卡迪利广场(Piccadilly Square)。一座城市。与某个像俄亥俄州辛辛那提(Cincinnati, Ohio)的地方有非常遥远的关联。
Four seven one. A center upright. Six again, I do believe referring to time. An address and a connection with wood. With a momentous occasion of some kind; not usual occasion. Somehow different.471。正中央一条垂直线。又是6，我确实相信是指时间。一个地址，以及与木头的一个关联。与某种重大场合有关联；不是平常的场合。不知为何就是不一样。
The color yellow. Numbers or mathematics. Nine. An object having to do with a knife, and a pen. Sharp and pointed. A room with something missing. A C and a J. And an abstract design. Metallic connection, and warmth.黄色。数字或数学。9。与一把刀子和一支笔有关的一个物品。锐利而且尖尖的。有东西不见了的一个房间。一个C和一个J。还有一个抽象的设计。与金属有关联，以及温暖。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
(“What's that connection with greed or grasp?”)(“那个贪婪或紧抓不放的关联是什么？”)
I am not sure. Holding onto, reaching out toward, with some urgency. An unassailable position. A Q. A great deal of fuss. A small rectangular object, perhaps of metal, with numbers upon it. Such as, for example, a small license plate, that would carry numbers and notations, and be metallic and connected with travel. And the color orange and black, and an automobile perhaps.我不确定。有点迫切地抓着、向外伸出手。一个固若金汤的位置。一个Q。一大堆麻烦。一个小的长方形物体，也许是金属做的，上面有数字。举例来说，像是一个小型牌照，上面记载数字和批注，而且是金属制的，与旅行有关联。有橘色和黑色，也许还有一辆汽车。
(“Are you saying this is the object?”)(“你是说这就是标的物吗？”)
No. I am saying that the image I see gives me this impression. It may or may not be the actual object, but seems to be strongly connected with it. And something raised up from a surface, as something embossed.不是。我是说我看到的画面给我这个印象。它可能是也可能不是实际的标的物，但似乎与它有强烈的关联。而且有某个东西从表面浮上来，就像某个有浮雕的东西。
(“The object isn't embossed.”)(“标的物没有浮雕。”)
I did not say the object was. Something lifted up.我没有说标的物有浮雕。某个被抬起来的东西。
(“Can you say something about the initials J A B ?” )(“你能不能谈谈首字母JAB？”)
A connection with several circular shapes , rather oval.与几个圆形，更确切地说是椭圆形有关联。
(“The oval shapes are related to J A BT)(“椭圆形与JAB有关联？”)
No.不是。
(Pause.) I simply see the large capitals JAB, and do not know their precise meaning. Perhaps four connected here.(停顿)我只是看到大写的JAB，不知道它们的确切意义。也许这里和4有关联。
(“Can you give the color of the object itself’’(“你能不能指出标的物本身的颜色？”)
(Pause. Jane still held the envelope horizontally to her forehead, but by now she had shifted hands several times while doing so. Eyes closed.)(停顿。珍仍然把信封横放在她的额头上，但是到此刻为止，她这么做的同时已经换手过几次。)
No, except that it is not dark. A dim color. With perhaps dim dark overtones, or dim gold overtones in a lighter color, with a gray white. A schedule of events, and an accounting.不能，除了它不是深色以外。一个黯淡的颜色。也许泛着黯淡的深色光泽，或是一个更浅的颜色，泛着黯淡的金色光泽。一个事件时间表，以及账目。
(“What kind of events?” )(“哪一种事件？”)
Future events. Connected with past events.未来的事件。与过去的事件有关联。
(“What does that call and the color black refer to?” )(“那通电话和黑色是指什么？”)
Ruburt here has a phone connection, of course.这里鲁柏有一个电话的连结，当然。
(“What’s that toreador connection?” )(“那个斗牛士的关联是什么？”)
A red and violent connection. High activity connected with a male, of repressed violent tendencies, in the situation.与红色和暴力的关联。与一名男性有关联的强力活动，具有压抑的暴力倾向，在这种情况下。
(“You mentioned three people. Initial?’)(“你提到三个人。姓名缩写是？”)
Masculine overtones. Perhaps two males in particular and a female. S.男性特质的弦外之音。也许特别是两个男性和一个女性。S。
(Pause.) G. (Pause.) Or J. These are, I believe, separate.(停顿)G。(停顿)或J。我相信，这些是分开的。
(“What’s the 1963 mention?” )(“提到1963年是什么意思？”)
I do not know. Connection with a past incident at about that time, and a seeming connection with a 1967 incident yet to occur. February and October. And a foreign element of some kind.我不知道。与过去一个大约那时候发生的事故有关联，而且与一个在1967年发生的事故好像有关联。2月和10月。还有一个某一种的外国元素。
(“You mentioned Piccadilly before.”)(“你之前提过皮卡迪利。”)
That was a result of a square impression. But this also has to do with a connection out of country.那是正方形印象造成的结果。但这也和一个国外的连结有关系。
(“Do you want to try naming the object now?")(“你现在想不想要尝试说出标的物的名称？”)
I have come as close as possible this evening.今晚我已经尽可能接近了。
(“Okay. I guess that’s it then.”)(“好的。那我想就到这里为止吧。”)
A long locomotive, and a connection with a note mentioning time.一个长长的火车头，而且与一张提到时间的字条有关联。
(Break at 10:04. Jane was very well dissociated, she said. She did not lower the envelope from her forehead until just before break. Her eyes remained closed. None of the data made any sense to her, she said. She could not recall specific images at the moment, saying that she saw them when Seth said she did.(“10:04休息。珍说她非常顺利出离。一直到快要休息时，她才把信封从额头上拿下来。她的眼睛一直闭着。这个资料对她来说没有任何意义。此刻她想不起任何特定的画面，来说明她在赛斯说自己看见的时候就看过它们。”
(This proved to be the end of the session although we did not realize it at the time. We made our own connections however as usual.(后来才知道这一节到此为止就结束了，但当时我们不知道。不过，我们一如往常自己找出关联。
(See page 141 for a copy of the envelope object, and the notes on the next page. As stated the object is the stub from Jane's first paycheck as a substitute teacher, received on Friday October 28. It is made of green paper. Light in color, with a pale green pattern throughout. The printing is in black, with the large number in the upper right corner in red. The back is blank. The stub contains the amount of the check, tax deductions, the date, etc.(信封标的物的副本见前面描摹图及注释。如上所述，标的物是珍当代课老师的第一张薪水支票存根，在10月28日星期五收到的。它是由绿色纸张制成，颜色很浅，整张布满淡淡的绿色图案。印刷字是黑色的，右上角的大型数字是红色。背面空白。存根包含了支票的金额、扣缴税额、日期等等。
(“Connection with an encounter.” Jane said this is definitely a reference to her first day of teaching, October 11,1966. The object is from the paycheck for this days work. Jane said that although she liked teaching, the first encounter with a class is one to be remembered. She has had odd jobs teaching in the past, but never in a school system, in a formal classroom, etc.(“与一次邂逅有关联。”珍说这肯定是指她教书的第一天，1966年10月11日。标的物来自支付这一天工作的薪水支票。珍说，虽然她喜欢教书，但是与一个班级的第一次邂逅令人难忘。以前她做过零星的教学工作，但从来不是在学校体制内，在正式的教室里等等。
("The number 6-6 PM, 6 as a date, we shall see. ”Jane said this refers to the fact that in order to keep the job as a substitute teacher she must begin taking 6 credits a year at Elmira College, after she has taught a total of 40 school days. This is a New York State law.(“数字6。傍晚6点，6是一个日期，我们以后就知道了。”珍说这是指为了代课老师的工作，她必须在教完一共40天的课之后，开始在埃尔迈拉学院一年修完6个学分。这是纽约州的法律规定。
(“A connection with greed—a grasp.” Jane took the teaching job for the high pay given; this is the main reason she accepted it. It is the highest paying job she has ever had, $25.00 a day.(“与贪婪有关联——紧抓不放。”珍去教书是因为薪水高；这是她接受这份工作的主要原因。这是她做过的工作当中薪水最高的一个，一天美金25元。
("With an article, an article of clothing.” Too vague. Jane said there is a chance this refers to her second day of teaching. She was called late, and while rushing to get dressed caused a run in her last pair of stockings. She had to wear them on the job, run and all.(“与一件，一件衣服有关。”太模糊了，珍说有可能这是指她教书的第二天。她很晚才接到通知，因为匆忙更衣而勾破了她的最后一只丝袜。她不得不穿着勾破的丝袜去工作。
(“A four plus one”. No connections in particular, although there are several fours and ones on the envelope object. There are also fives. But no 41. Speculation.(”4加1”没有任何特别的关联，但是在信封标的物上有几个4和1。也有几个5。但没有41。猜测。
(“and an initial—initials— I believe three, JAB.” Jane believes this refers to herself, and if so it is a strong connection with the object of course. Jane has no middle name now; her name used to be Dorothy Jane Roberts but she dropped the Dorothy when we were married 11 years ago. She chose the saint’s name of Ann however, as a Catholic girl at about age 12. But she puzzled over why the A would crop up now, since she never uses it. Nor did she particularly.(“以及一个首字母——几个首字母——我相信是三个，JAB。”珍相信是指她自己，如果是的话，那它与标的物当然有强烈的关联。珍现在没有中间名；她的名字曾经是桃乐丝·珍·罗伯兹[Dotothy Jane Roberts]，但在大约11年前我们结婚时，她就去掉桃乐丝了。不过，身为天主教女孩，她在12岁左右选了圣人的名字[Ann]。但是她不明白为什么A这时会出现，因为她从来没有用过它。她也没有特别想用它。
(“Masculine.” No connections.(“男子气概。”找不到任何关联。)
(“Playground.” This is good personal data as far as Jane is concerned, since from early childhood she has had a strong association between playgrounds and schools. This has cropped up before in these experiments also. [Jane's note: Donna Taylor had shown me the playground for her 1st graders, during my 2nd teaching job.](“操场。”就珍而言，这是一个很好的私人资料，因为从很小的时候，她就一直把操场和学校联想在一起。在这些实验之前，这也已经出现过。[珍的注：在我的第二个教书工作期间，唐娜泰勒[Donna Taylor]让我看了她一年级学生的操场]
(“Squares.” See the copy of the object on page 141. Jane said that by squares she meant the little boxes strung out along the horizontal lines on the object. There are four rows of these.(“正方形。”见前面标的物副本。珍说她讲正方形的意思是，在标的物上面，沿着水平线条按间隔排开的小格子。这些格子有四排。)
(“Toreador.” We made no connection here, but a legitimate one developed during the question-and-answer period.(“斗牛士。”这里我们找不到任何关联，但是在问答期间发展出一个合理的连结。
(“Rectangular with stripes. ’’Another reference to the object itself See page 141.(“有条纹的长方形。”再次指涉标的物本身。
('A call. The color black.” Seth adds a bit of data during the questioning, and verifies my first thought here, that this data refers to our having a telephone—black—installed because of Jane 's teaching job. Also, Jane insisted on a black phone.(“一通电话。黑色。”赛斯在问答期间补充了一点资料，并且证实我在这里的第一个想法，这个资料是指我们请人安装了一支电话——因为珍的教书工作。此外，珍坚持要黑色的电话。
(“Four numbers. A one and a nine.” There are many numbers on the object, but we don’t know what is meant by this data.(“4个数字。一个1和一个9。”标的物上面有很多数字，但我们不知道这个资料的意思是什么。
(“A date. Perhaps 1963, and a scroll of sorts.” We believe this data goes together, although there is a date, October 27,1966, on the object. The scroll we think of as symbolic of education or school. In 1963, Jane talked to a class conducted by Mr. Clauss, at Elmira College, subject poetry. The college connection arose recently, because Jane also applied for a teaching job there, as well as in the Elmira school system.(“一个日期。也许是1963年，以及一个卷轴之类的。”我们相信这个资料是合在一起的，但是在标的物上有一个日期，1966年10月27日。我们认为卷轴是教育或学校的象征。1963年，珍在埃尔迈拉学院的克洛斯老师的课上讲主题诗。由于珍也申请了那里的一份教师工作，以及埃尔迈拉的学校系统，所以最近她和大学的联系开始了。
(“Connection with three people and a fourth, separated.” Too vague. Jane said one interpretation could be that we know three other teachers personally; the fourth, separated, would be Mr. Clauss whom Jane met twice perhaps a couple of years ago. I have never met him.(“与3个人以及另外第四个人有关联。”太模糊。珍说可能有一个解读是，我们认识另外三个老师本人，分开的第四个应该是克劳斯先生[Mr. Glauss]，也许在一两年前，珍见过他两次。
(“Horizontal lines with a small square. ’’Another reference to the object itself. The word square here may refer to the next data.(“水平的线条有一个小正方形。”再次指涉标的物本身。这里的正方形一词可能是指下一个资料。
(“Piccadilly Square.” We don't know. Piccadilly Square, London, England, might refer to the fact that a professor at Elmira College, with whom Jane would like to work as an assistant, teaches English Literature and specializes in Victorian English. At this writing Jane is to hear from him any day about the job.(“皮卡迪利广场。[译注：正方形和广场的英文都是Square。]”我们不知道。位于英格兰伦敦的皮卡迪利广场可能是指以下的事实：埃尔迈拉学院有一位教授，珍想要当他的助理，他教英国文学，专攻维多利亚时代的英语。在写下这段对话的时候，珍任何一天都可能收到他通知是否录用她的消息。
(“A city. Very distant connection with something like Cincinnati, Ohio.” A possible distant connection: At the end of her second day of teaching Jane was given a ride home by a next-door neighbor who is also a teacher. The neighbor is from Ohio, but not Cincinnati, which could account for Seth's reference to ”something like” Cincinnati. In addition, the neighbor had just returned to Elmira from a trip to Ohio, so the Ohio thought was mentioned in the conversation more than once. City is also mentioned on the object itself-—City School District, etc.(“一座城市。与某个像俄亥俄州辛辛那提的地方有非常遥远的关联。”一个遥远的可能关联：在珍教书的第二天，一个也是老师的隔壁邻居开车载她回家。这个邻居来自俄亥俄州，但不是辛辛那提，所以不算是赛斯指的“某个像”辛辛那提“的地方”。此外，这个邻居也刚从俄亥俄州旅行回来，所以在交谈间提到俄亥俄州的想法不止一次。标的物本身也有提到城市——城市校区等等。
(“Four seven one.” No connections, other than the many numbers on the object.(“471。”找不到任何关联，除了标的物上面有很多数字以外。
(“A center upright.” Jane said this is a reference to the fold in the object, made when I inserted it in the double envelopes. See page 141. Note that Jane held the envelope to her forehead in a horizontal position, as she almost always does; this means the fold in the object would be vertical in relation to the long dimension of both the object and the envelopes. The long dimension of the folded object paralleled that of the envelopes.(“正中央一条垂直线。”珍说这是指标的物上面的折痕，我在把它放进双层信封的时候折的。注意珍把信封放在额头上的位置是横向的，她几乎每一次都是这样拿；这意味着相对于标的物和信封的长边，标的物上面的折痕是垂直的。标的物折过之后的长边与信封的长边平行。
(“Six again, I do believe referring to time.” Another reference to the fact that Jane must begin taking 6 credits a year at Elmira College, after she has taught in the public school system 40 days. Thus there is a time connection.(“又是6，我确实相信这是指时间。”再一次指涉及珍在公立学校教完40天的课之后，必须开始在埃尔迈拉学院一年修完6个学分的事实。因此有一个时间方面的关联。
(“An address and a connection with wood.” No connections.(“一个地址，以及与木头的一个关联。”找不到任何关联。
(“With a momentous occasion of some kind; not usual occasion. Somehow different.” Jane also had the idea of an initial occasion here, and regretted not saying it aloud. She said this data refers to her first day of teaching; to her it was certainly momentous, not usual, and different. The envelope object is the employee pay record from her check for this first days work.(“与某种重大场合有关联；不是平常的场合。不知为何就是不一样。”这里珍也有一个初始场合的概念，后悔没有开口把它讲出来。她说这个资料是指她教书的第一天；对她来说，它当然是重大、不平常也不一样。信封标的物是支付她这第一天工作的薪水支票。
(“The color yellow.” No connections.(“黄色。”找不到任何关联。
(“Numbers or mathematics.” The object contains many numbers. A mathematics connection that is possible: a friend of Janes who is also a substitute teacher told Jane that she had a lot of trouble trying to teach the ”new mathematics.”(“数字或数学。”标的物包含很多数字。可能与数学关联的是：珍的一个朋友也是代课老师，她告诉珍，她在设法教“新数学”时遇到很多困难。
(“Nine.” No connections.(“9”找不到任何关联。
(“An object having to do with a knife, and a pen. Sharp and pointed.” These data seem to go together. Jane recalled a connection with a pen, but nothing for a knife. She made a special effort to always have a pen with her when teaching, since she required one so often.(“与一把刀子和一支笔有关的一个物品。锐利而且尖尖的。”这些资料似乎是合在一起的。珍想起一支笔的关联，但没有刀子的关联。她特别努力在教书时总是带一支笔，因为她常常需要用到笔。
(“A room with something missing.” Jane said this refers to the taking of attendance in class. It was stressed to her that she attend to this job above all others, she said, so she was careful about this. Since all the students were new to her each time, she had to depend on their help to keep her records straight. Sometimes she took attendance every period of the day.(“有东西不见了的一个房间。”珍说这是指课堂上的点名。她说，校方强调，点名这个工作要先做之后再做其他事情，所以她对此小心翼翼。因为每一次上课的学生对她来说都是新的，所以她不得不依赖他们的帮助，才能够不出错。有时候她一天每节课都会点一次名。
(“A C and a J. ' Jane said this is valid data, if not as good as we would like. The J refers to herself. The C can refer to either Gene Cesari, an assistant dean at Elmira College, or to Bill Cieri, of the public school night-course system. Jane also cited the similarity in sound between Gene and Jane.(“一个C和一个J。”珍说这是有效的资料，就算不像我们想的那么好。J是指她自己。C不是埃尔迈拉学院的一个副院长吉恩·赛沙瑞[Gene Cesari]，就是指公立学校夜间课程制度的比尔·希瑞[Bill Cieri]。珍也举出吉恩和珍在发音上的相似之处。
(“And an abstract design.” Jane said this is a valid reference to Bert Ryerson, superintendent of art in the Elmira school system. Bert first got Jane interested in teaching; he is also an artist, and paints abstracts.(“还有一个抽象的设计”珍说这是有效的资料，指的是埃尔迈拉学校制度的艺术教育局长伯特·莱尔森[Bert Ryerson]。伯特最先引发珍对教书的兴趣；他也是一个艺术家，画抽象画。
(“Metallic connection, and warmth.” Both sections of this data are dealt with in answer to the first question.(“与金属有关联，以及温暖。”在第一个问题的答案中处理了这个资料的两个部分。
(1st Question: What’s that connection with greed or grasp? “I am not sure. Holding onto, reaching out toward, with some urgency. An unassailable position. A Q. A great deal of fuss. ”As stated, this data applies to Janes taking the teaching job, and her grim determination to keep it at all costs. She felt it urgent that she do so. A great deal of fuss was involved, also. We saw no particular connection for Q.(第一个问题：那个贪婪或紧抓不放的关联是什么？“我不确定。有点迫切地抓着、向外伸出手。一个固若金汤的位置。一个Q。一大堆麻烦。”如上所述，这个资料适用于珍担任教职，以及她不计代价非要保住这个工作不可的坚定决心。她感觉她迫切需要这么做。这牵涉到一大堆麻烦。我们看不到Q有任何特别的关联。
(“A small rectangular object, perhaps of metal, with numbers upon it. Such as, for example. a small license plate, that would carry numbers and notations, and be metallic and connected with travel. And the color orange and black, and an automobile perhaps. ’’All of this refers to Jane's taking a taxi to the various schools in town, whenever she was called. I was not available to take her, having already left for work except on the first occasion. The taxi she used was orange and black.(“一个小的长方形物体，也许是金属的，上面有数字。举例来说，像一个小型牌照，上面记载数字和批注，而且是金属制的，与旅行有关联。有橘色和黑色，也许还有一车汽车。”这一切都是指珍一接到征召，就会搭计程车到城里各个不同学校的事。我没时间载她去，除了第一次以外，我已经出门工作去了。
(2nd Question: Are you saying this is the object? “No. I am saying that the image I see gives me this impression. It may or may not be the actual object, but seems to be strongly connected with it. And something raised up from a surface, as something embossed.” More on the taxi-auto connection regarding Jane's teaching, from whence comes the envelope object: Probably the multitude of numbers on the object also related it closely in the data to the license and auto ideas. By asking this question I hoped to lead Seth to be more specific about the object itself.(第二个问题：你是说这就是标的物吗？“不是。我是说我看到的画面给我这个印象。它可能是也可能不是实际的标的物，但似乎与它有强烈的关联。而且有某个东西从表面浮上来，就像某个有浮雕的东西。”更多与珍的教学有关的计程车——汽车关联，信封标的物就是来自这份工作：可能标的物上面的一大堆数字也让它与牌照和汽车的概念产生紧密关联。借由提出这个问题，我希望引导赛斯更具体地给出标的物本身的资料。
(3rd Question: The object isn't embossed.“I did not say the object was. Something lifted up. ’’Another reference to a license plate. By telling Seth the object wasn’t embossed, I once again hoped to get more specific data about the object itself.(第三个问题：标的物没有浮雕。“我没有说标的物有浮雕。某个被抬起来的东西。”再一次指涉一个牌照。借由告诉赛斯标的物没有浮雕，我再一次希望与标的物本身有关的资料能够更具体。
(4th Question: “Can you say something about the initials J A B?” A connection with several circular shapes , rather oval.” Here Seth was still considering the previous questions pertaining, Jane thought, to the automobile or taxi idea.(第四个问题：你能不能谈谈首字母JAB？“与几个圆形，更确切地说是椭圆形。”珍认为，这里赛斯还在思考之前与汽车或计程车的概念有关的问题。
(5th Question: The oval shapes are related to J A B?“No.I simply see the large capitals JAB, and do not know their precise meaning. Perhaps four connected here.” See the JAB data at the bottom of page 146. The question was an attempt to get more data on them. We see no connection with four here, particularly.(第五个问题：椭圆形与JAB有关联？“不是。我只是看到大写的JAB，不知道它们的确切意义。也许这里和4有关联。”见前面JAB资料。这个问题的企图是取得更多它们的资料。我们没有特别看到与4有关的连结。
(6th Question: “Can you give the color of the object itself” No, except that it is not dark. A dim color. With perhaps dim dark overtones”, can be said to apply to the object. See page 141. The object is printed on paper of a pale green, which could also be called dim. The black printing is of course dark on this.(第六个问题：你能不能指出标的物本身的颜色？“不能，除了它不是深色以外。一个黯淡的颜色。也许泛着黯淡的深色光泽，”可以说适用于标的物。见描摹图。标的物是印刷在一种浅绿色的纸张上，也可以说它是黯淡的。黑色的印刷字在这上面当然是深色的。
(“Or dim gold overtones in a lighter color, with a gray white.” Seth is off here.(“或是一个更浅的颜色，泛着黯淡的金色光泽，有着灰白色。”赛斯在这里偏离了。
(“A schedule of events, and an accounting.” Good data. Seth gets back on the track in the next sentence. The object is an accounting of Jane's earnings, and a schedule of when she earned the money, etc., since it is an employee's pay record from the Elmira school system.(“一个事件时间表，以及账目。”好资料。赛斯在下一句又回到正轨。标的物是珍的收入账目，以及它赚到这笔钱的时间表等等，因为它是埃尔迈拉学校制度的员工薪资记录。
(7th Question: What kind of events? “Future events. Connected with past events.” This could apply to the object, since this employee pay record has boxes or spaces on it for the entry of moneys toward retirement, savings bonds, credit union, etc., for steadily-employed teachers. Jane had no entries in these spaces. Later note by Jane: Unknown to us at this time I was to end up with another teaching position, in answer to an ad I had not yet read.(第七个问题：哪一种事件？“未来的事件。与过去的事件有关联。”这可能适用于标的物，因为在这个员工薪资记录上面有格子和空白处，用来填写稳定就业教师的退休、储蓄债券、信用合作社等等金额。珍后来的注：这时我们还不知道我后来会有另一个教职，因为回复了此时我尚未看到的一则启事。
(8th Question: What does that call and the color black refer to? “Ruburt has a phone connection, of course. ”Jane had to have a phone put in for the teaching job, since she would be on daily call. She insisted on a black wall phone, in the face of the company's efforts to sell her more expensive colored phones, etc. We regard this as good data.(第八个问题：那通电话和黑色是指什么？“这里鲁柏有一个电话的连结，当然。”珍为了教书工作不得不安装一支电话，因为她每天都得待命。面对电话公司费力想要卖给她更贵的彩色电话等等，她坚持要黑色的壁挂式电话。我们认为这是好资料。
(9th Question: What's that toreador connection? “A red and violent connection. High activity connected with a male, or repressed violent tendencies, in the situation.” This is also good data, and related to the envelope object in that it refers to an event taking place in Janes classroom on her second day of teaching. [The object represents Janes first day of teaching] Briefly, a very violent scene was enacted before Jane and her class. A male teacher entered with a young male student in tow, and literally threw the student across the classroom in a violent fit of anger. The bout resulted from the student's misbehavior in the hall.(第九个问题：那个斗牛士的关联是什么？“与红色和暴力的关联。与一名男性有关联的强力活动，具有压抑的暴力倾向，在这种情形下。”这也是好资料，与信封标的物有关联，因为它指的是一个在珍的教室发生的事件，时间是她教书的第二天。[标的物代表珍教书的第一天]简单说，一幕非常暴力的景象在珍和她的班级面前扮演。一名男老师拖着一个年轻的男学生进来，在暴力的盛怒之下，名副其实把这名学生丢到教室另一头。大发雷霆的原因是这名学生在走廊上行为不检。
(Jane said the teacher 's face was very red with anger, and that it was obvious he had a strong temper. Later that day she overheard two of her students talking, and they discussed the teacher's bad temper, it being a well-known fact in the school. Jane discussed the incident with me the day it happened. It had made quite an impression on her, and of course took her by surprise.(珍说那个老师气得满脸通红，显然脾气很大。那天后来她在无意间听到她的两名学生讲话，他们讨论那个老师的坏脾气，这是学校人尽皆知的事实。在事发那天，珍和我讨论过这个事件。它给了他很深刻的印象，当然也让她吃了一惊。
(1Oth Question: You mentioned three people. Initials?“Masculine overtones. Perhaps two males in particular and a female. S, G, or J. These are I believe separate.” See the” three people" data on page 147, and the 6 and J data on page 148. Both of these deal possibly with teachers. Possibly the above data does also, though we cannot be sure. If so the initials do not tally.(第十个问题：你提到三个人。姓名缩写是？“男性特质的弦外之音。也许特别是两个男性和一个女性。S、G，或J。我相信，这些是分开的。”见前面“三个人”资料，以及G和J资料。这两个资料可能都与老师有关。可能上述资料也是，但我们无法确定。如果是的话，姓名缩写并不吻合。
(Two male teachers and a female were involved with Jane while she sought work as a teacher—Mr. Don Hennigen and Mr. Albert Ryerson. Jane cannot now recall the name of the female supervisor, whom she met but once, but doesn’t think the initials tally. Others could be involved here as on page 148.(珍在找教师工作时，有两名男老师和一名女老师涉入其中。唐·亨尼根和阿尔伯特·瑞尔森先生。珍现在想不起那个女主任的名字了，她只见过她一次，但她觉得名字的首字母不相符。其他的可能也涉及其中。
(11th Question: What's the 1963 mention? “ I do not know. Connection with a past incident at about that time, and a seeming connection with a 1967 incident yet to occur.” See the 1963 data on page 147. As stated the date could very well refer to the time Jane lectured a class at Elmira College on poetry. The connection would be the teaching activity as related to the envelope object.(第十一个问题：提到1963年是什么意思？“我不知道。与过去一个大约那时候发生的事故有关联，而且与一个在1967年发生的事故好像有关联。”见前面1963年资料。如上所述，日期很可能是指珍在埃尔迈拉学院的一个班级教诗词的时间。关联应该是与信封标的物有关的教学活动。
("February and October.” Jane thinks it quite possible she spoke to the class at Elmira College in February, 1963. There is an October date, October 27,1966, on the object itself.(“2月和10月。”珍认为这很可能是指她于1963年2月在埃尔迈拉学院对班上讲话。在标的物本身有一个10月的日期，1966年10月27日。
(“And a foreign element of some kind.” Jane now said she thought this data somewhat distorted, and that by foreign she meant something new and strange to her, rather than literally out of the country. Yet Seth appears to think the Piccadilly connection, next, a valid one.(“还有一个某一种的外国元素。”珍现在说她认为这个资料有点扭曲，她说外国的意思是某个对她而言的新奇东西，而不是字面上的国外。可是看起来赛斯似乎认为下一个皮卡迪利广场的关联是有效的。
(12th Question: “You mentioned Piccadilly before.” That was a result of a square impression. But this also has to do with a connection out of country.” See our speculations regarding the Piccadilly data on page 147.(第十二个问题：你之前提过皮卡迪利。“那是广场印象造成的结果。但这也和一个国外的连结有关系。”我们对皮卡迪利相关资料的猜测见前面所述。
(13th Question: “Do you want to try naming the object now1” I have come as close as possible this evening.”(第十三个问题：你现在想不想要尝试说出标的物的名称？“今晚我已经尽可能接近了。”
(“A long locomotive, and a connection with a note mentioning time.” We saw no obvious connections with locomotive. The object is concerned with a specific amount of time; although not a note, it is printed, and the printing conveys a message in detail.(“一个长长的火车头，而且与一张提到时间的字条有关联。”我们看不到任何与火车头有关的明显关联。标的物与特定的时数有关系；虽然不是字条，但它是印刷品，而且印刷字详细传递一个讯息。
(End at 11 PM.)(11点整结束。)

SESSION 299 第299节 珍的私人短课


NOVEMBER 2, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年11月2日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down, her eyes closed. I noticed her yawning at 8:45 and knew she was tired, but she didn’t want to call off the session.)(珍坐下来，同时开始在出神中讲话， 她的眼睛闭着，我注意到她在8:45分打了哈欠，知道她累了，但她不想要取消这一节。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We will indeed give you a rather brief vacation this evening.今天晚上我们真的会给你一个很短的假期。
Ruburt is completing the final stages of his recovery, and is in a state of lassitude. It is a healthy condition of almost complete relaxation, signifying the release of his physical system from the mental hold of fear that has made it comparatively rigid up until now.鲁柏正在完成他最后的康复阶段，而处于一种疲乏状态。这是几近于全然放松的健康状况，意味着他的身体系统从心智透过恐惧的掌控中脱困了，这种束缚使得它一直到现在都相当僵化。
The rigidity is literally draining away. The ordinary evening’s rest will just about complete his cycle he began this morning. The body is now conditioning itself as it returns to normal—normal health and function. This release, you see, had to come gradually. The system was too wound up to be allowed sudden complete relaxation.僵化实际上正在耗尽能量。平日夜间的休息差不多完成他今天早上开始的循环。身体现在正调理它自己，回归正常——正常的健康和功能。这种松绑，你看，一定要循序渐进。系统绷得太紧了，因此不能突然让它全然放松。
Even the electrical charges have changed, and his chemical properties. All of this is now returning to normal. We will therefore give you a rest, and to Ruburt, I am very pleased at last with his progress in this respect. It should be noted that during this period he did not fall considerably below his usual performance with me in our sessions.甚至电荷也改变了，他的化学属性也是。这一切目前都在回归正常当中。因此我们将会让你休息，而对鲁柏，我很高兴他在这方面终于有了进展。值得注意的是，这段期间，他在我们的课当中的表现并没有比往常落后太多。
My heartiest regards to you both. I do peek in at you now and then, and will be in contact with you certainly before Monday.向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候。我偶尔的确会偷看你们一下，在星期一以前，我当然会与你们保持联系。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(9:13 PM. Jane was out as usual, her eyes both open and closed, and very dark.)(“9:13分。珍一如往常出去了，她的眼睛时张时闭，而且颜色很深。”)

SESSION 300 第300节 期望躲在感官资讯背后并形成资讯 信封76


NOVEMBER 7, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年11月7日 星期一 晚上9点
(The 76th envelope experiment was held tonight. The object was torn by me from pages 11 and 12 of the New York Times’ first news section for Sunday, November 6,1966. See the two previous pages. I chose the object at random by a method which will be explained later. Suffice it to say here that I did not see the object until Jane opened the usual double-sealed envelopes after giving the data. I did however know the object came from the New York Times. Results were good.(第76次信封实验在今晚举行。标的物是我从1966年11月6日星期日的《纽约时报》新闻头版撕下来的。见上面图示。我随机选择标的物，稍后解释我的方法。这里只说，在珍给了资料以后、打开普通双层信封之前，我没有见过标的物，就够了。
(Jane began speaking while sitting down and in trance. Her eyes began to open at once. Her manner was active; she was smoking and sipping wine. Her pace was good.)不过，我的确知道标的物出自《纽约时报》。实验结果很好。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, my dear friend Joseph: Reincarnation and projection, you see, are one and the same thing.现在，我亲爱的朋友约瑟：转世所投射，你知道，是同一件事。
They simply appear to be different. As a rule the ego is not aware of its departure from one physical organism and its growth into another. This is a projection. The years of growth, as I have told you, are illusion. Value fulfillment is the law of the universe, and it appears as growth within your system.它们只是看起来不一样而已。在大多数情况下，自我觉察不到它离开一个物质有机体，在另一个里面成长。这是一次投射。我跟你说过，成长的年岁是幻相。价值完成是宇宙的法则，它在里面的系统之内看起来像是成长。
The journey itself is as instantaneous as a projection from here to, say, Puerto Rico. You are simply delving more deeply into the moment point in the reincarnational instance. In your (underlined) terms you are staying there longer.这趟旅程本身发生在一瞬间，就像从这里到波多黎各的一次投射那样。你只不过是在转世的情况中更深入片刻点而已。按照你们的(划线)说法，你在那里停留更久。
When you are attached to the physical organism your projections are not as complete—the difference between a reincarnational instance and a simple projection from the physical state. Obviously the Sense data appears the same. In both instances you appear to be physically perceiving, and so you are.
