In a projection you are still within the physical system as a rule, though there are definite exceptions here.当你依附着物质有机体的时候，你的投射并不完整——转世的情况以及从物质状态出发的简单投射之间差别就在这里。显然感官资料看起来是相同的。在两种情况下，你看起来是有肉体感知的，而你是这样没错。在投射时，你通常还在身体系统之内，但是这里有明确的例外。
Whenever you are attached in any way, whenever consciousness is attached to a physical organism, then inner data will be interpreted in physical terms. You can indeed learn to perceive reality in other terms, and you are both doing so.每当你以任何方式依附的时候，每当意识依附着物质有机体的时候，内在资料就会从物质的角度被加以解读。你确实能够学会从其他角度感知实相，而且你们两个正在这么做。
You must still deal with physical reality, for it is definitely the representation of inner data. I have said this constantly: Expectation is behind all Sense data, and forms it. I have told you—and incidentally my lovely skeptics I have told you in the past—that you create your own physical environment and universe. Your physical condition in every way is a reflection of your inner expectations, accomplishments, and failures, and I have told you that any illness is the result of an inner distortion.你仍然必须和物质实相打交道，因为它绝对是内在资料的重现。我不停地说这件事：预期不但在所有的感官资料背后，而且形成了感官资料。我跟你说过——顺便说一下，我可爱的怀疑论者，以前我告诉过你——你创造你自己的物质环境和宇宙。你的物质状况在每一方面都反映着你内在的预期、成就以及失败，而且我也告诉过你，任何疾病都是一个内在扭曲造成的结果。
Now this distortion may possibly be a hangover from a previous existence, but it is a distortion. Projections in fact should give you an excellent idea of the reality of reincarnations. In an excellent projection you forget the self on the bed. You are in an entirely new environment, but you are still beset by certain personality tendencies that are yours.现在，这个扭曲可能是某个前世的残留物，但它是一个扭曲。投射事实上应该会让你对转世的实相非常有概念。在一次绝佳的投射中，你忘记了床上的自己。你置身在全新的环境中，但是你的某些人格倾向仍然围困着你。
In reincarnations also you carry along many of these tendencies. In the middle of a projection you may suddenly remember the self on the bed, and in the middle of a given existence you may suddenly remember a previous self. I have also told you that the term previous in this connection is used only for your convenience.在转世中，你也带着很多这些倾向一起走。在一次投射的中途，你可能突然想起床上的自己，而在一个既定的存在中途，你可能突然想起以前的一个自己。我也告诉过你，在这个关系当中之所以使用以前这个词组。只是为了你的方便着想。
There is no past and present, and therefore one life is not before or after another. None of this should be new to you.没有过去和现在，因此一世并不在另一世之前或之后。这些概念对你来说应该都听过了。
Now, we shall indeed mention the book Ruburt is reading.现在，我们真的应该提一下鲁柏正在读的书。
(The Power of Universal Mind, by Muriel Noyes Gillchrest. Parker Publishing Co. Inc., West Nyack, NY.)(《宇宙心智的力量》[The Power of Universal Mind]，作者是穆瑞儿·诺斯·吉尔克瑞斯特[Muriel Noyes Gillchrest]，纽约州西奈亚克[West Nyack, NY]的帕克出版公司[Parker Publishing Co. Inc.]发行。)
He is a personality. I am a personality. You are a personality. I find it most advantageous to discuss his experiences, to elaborate upon them, to point out benefits and fallacies in them.他是一个人格。我是一个人格。你是一个人格。我发现讨论他的经验、详尽说明它们、指出它们的益处和谬误，是非常有利的。
It should be remembered that the intellect, in the light of this book, is as perfect then as any other manifestation of what is termed divine spirit. The intellect has been trained unfortunately to deal almost exclusively with the results of Sense data. This does not mean that it cannot and should not do more.应该记住，按照这本书来看，智力(intellect)和所谓神圣之灵(divine spirit)的任何其他显化一样完美。不幸的是，智力一直被训练成只处理感官资料的结果而已。这并不是说它无法或不应该做更多。
I have given it a whacking many times. Nevertheless I have always maintained its beauty and necessity. I will tell you that in the most important respects, that woman’s book is legitimate. This is her last reincarnation in your terms, and she is making her final contribution in your system. But there are many who will need a more intellectual approach, and I hope we shall supply it.我痛击它很多次。虽然如此，我向来都在维护它的美与必要性。我要告诉你，在最重要的方面，那个女人的书是合理的。按照你们的说法，这是她的最后一次转世，而且她正在你们的系统中做出她最后一次的贡献。但是有很多人需要一个比较理智的方法，我希望我们可以提供。
I will tell you the book, in what Ruburt thinks of as its somewhat inane simplicity, is very profound. Nevertheless for others there are steps that must be followed through, and following these steps through brings the whole personality, including the intellect, to a more balanced understanding, which is my goal. The author, while basically correct, ignores for example the reality of reincarnation; and Ruburts protests to the contrary, reincarnation belongs both with metaphysics and psychology, and cannot be ignored.我要告诉你，在鲁柏认为它有点言之无物的简单之中，这本书是非常深奥的。虽然如此，对其他人来说，有一定非遵循不可的步骤，按照这些步骤循序渐进会把包含智力在内的整个人格带到一个更加平衡的理解境界，这就是我的目标。作者虽然基本上是正确的，却忽略了，比方说，转世的实相；而鲁柏的抗议与之相反，转世既归类于形而上学也归类于心理学，不可忽略。
There are points in that book which we have not yet discussed, for the ground has not been prepared sufficiently. Reincarnation and projection are as real and as difficult for the ego to grasp, as the nature of dreams. You can begin to understand the effect of dreams at least upon your daily life. Reincarnations and projections of which you are not consciously aware have an equal effect, a stronger effect, upon your daily existence.在那本书里面有几个重点我们还没有讨论过，因为基础尚未准备充分。转世和投射就跟梦的本质一样真实，而且对自我而言也一样难以理解。你至少能够开始了解梦对你的日常生活产生的效应。你在意识上觉察到的转世和投射，对你每天的存在有着同等的效应，而且是一种更强大的效应。
Your cat was hit, in your terms, at 10:30 in the morning. It was no coincidence that Ruburt took the flashlight and decided to check the clothes. In this case the cat’s accident was not caused by you in any way. But there is still a chance for you to insure his recovery.按照你们的说法，你们的猫在早上10点半被撞到。鲁柏拿着手电筒，决定去检查衣服，绝不是巧合。在这个情况当中，猫的意外不管在哪一方面都不是你们造成的。但你们还是有机会确保它的复原。
The greater your understanding the more you can uphold and support without depleting yourself. The cat was not hurt, now, simply to give you a chance to support it, but the chance is there.你越是了解，就能够在不耗尽你自己的状况下给予更多的维护和支持。猫受伤，现在，并非只是为了让你有机会支持它，但机会是有的。
A man in a gray sedan took out his momentary resentment upon the cat. The cat accepted this simply because the resentment was too huge for him, and he was snowed under. The man, seeing the results, was subconsciously but clearly brought face to face with the size of his own problem.一个在灰色轿车里的男人把他一时的怨气发泄在猫身上。猫接受了，因为这股怨气对他来说太大了，他不堪负荷。看到结果，促使这个男人在潜意识里但却是清楚地面对了他自身问题的规模。
Is your hand tired?你的手累了吗？
("I guess it is a little.” )(“我想有一点。”)
We will take a break, and continue.我们休息一下再继续。
(Break at 9:35. Jane was well dissociated, her pace good, her manner active, eyes open often. I had thought she might continue on without a break.(9:35休息。珍顺利出离，她的速度很好，她的举止活泼，眼睛经常睁开。我以为她会继续下去而不休息。
(We found our cat, Catherine, in a next-door backyard after dark on Sunday evening. His right pelvic joint was broken. We had been away Sunday. Upon our return that evening at supper time, Jane began to go outside to look for the cat perhaps every fifteen minutes. She does not usually do this. As it happened our washing had been hung in the basement the day before because of rain.(星期天傍晚，天黑之后，我们在一个隔壁邻居的后院找到我们的猫，凯瑟琳。它的右侧骨盆关节断了。星期天我们出门了。那天傍晚回到家，在晚餐时间，珍开始每隔15分钟左右就去外面找猫。她通常不会这么做。碰巧前一天因为下雨，我们把衣服凉在地下室。
(Jane resumed in the same active manner at 9:45.)(9:45，珍以同样活泼的方式继续。)
Now my dear friend, the technique involved in projections will be literally invaluable to you.现在。我亲爱的朋友，投射所用的技巧实际上对你来说是无价之宝。
You will learn through experience many and excellent methods that can be utilized for your advantage. Through projections you will become acquainted with the mobility and stability of the inner self, as separate from the physical apparatus.你将会透过经验学到很多绝佳的方法，可以用来利益自己。经由投射，你将会逐渐熟悉内我的行动力和稳定性，有别于肉体器官。
Literally, death will no longer appear frightening. You will already be acquainted and trained to leave the physical body. From a conversation I overheard, so to speak, neither of you properly understand the importance of that material. For best benefits it had to be given before serious projections on your part, and not after.实际上，死亡看起来将不再吓人。届时你已经熟悉而且受过离开肉体的训练。从我可以说无意间听到的一次对话得知，你们两个都不太了解这个资料的重要性。为了得到最大的助益，在你们认真投射之前，这个资料一定要先给，而不是之后再给。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
(“Yes.”(“有。”
(Jane took from me the sealed double envelopes for our 76th experiment. Then, her eyes open and very dark, she got to her feet. Smiling broadly she slapped my hand with the envelope, and paced back and forth briefly as she used to do many sessions ago.)(珍从我手上拿了第76次实验的密封双层信封。然后，她站了起来，张开眼睛，颜色很深。她满脸笑容，用信封拍了我的手，像她在很多节以前那样，来回踱步一小段时间。)
And I will say precisely what you both said I would say.我要说的，正好就是你们两个说我会说的话。
("What's that.?(“那是什么？”)
(Emphatically:) The Gibbs material was indeed unabashedly distorted by my friend, Ruburt.(强调语气)吉布斯(Gaibbs)资料其实被我的朋友鲁柏脸不红气不喘地扭曲了。
(See page 139 of the 297th session. A prediction was given that Jane would receive a teaching job she had applied for at Elmira College. This was on October Wednesday, and predicted for November 2, the following Wednesday. On November 7, Jane was notified that she would not get the job.(见第297节。赛斯给了一个预测，说珍会得到她在埃尔迈拉学院应征的一个教职。这是在1966年10月26日，为11月2日，下星期三所做的预测。在11月7日，珍接到她没有录取的通知。
(Now Jane sat down. She held the envelope to her forehead, horizontally as usual, eyes closed.)(此时珍坐下来。她把信封放在额头上，像以往一样横着拿，眼睛闭着。)
Now. Give us a moment.现在。等我们一下。
A seven times six, or 42. These are impressions.一次7乘以6，或42。这些是印象。
A method of disposal. An impression I do not understand. Gubatorial.一种处置方法。一个我不了解的印象。Gubatouial
(Jane pronounced this as though groping a bit.)(珍发音时好像摸索了一下)。
Blue. Something in the vernacular.蓝色。方言里的某个东西。
The impression of small squares with orange, I believe, circles in the center. One eight four one. Connection with a monstrosity, as of a monstrous building, perhaps old Victorian. The first impression was of monstrosity, the rest is interpretation.小正方形的印象，我相信，中间有橘色的圆圈。一个841。与一个巨大丑陋之物有关联，有如怪物般的一栋丑陋建筑物，也许是老式的维多利亚风格。第一个印象是巨大丑陋之物，其余的是解读。
Liberal giving two—two of a kind—two a date, or 2:00 o’clock.自由给出2——一种2——日期的2，或两点钟。
A mission with unforeseen consequences. Connection with something green as a meadow. With a telephone or telephone call. Four by five. An initial explosion. A gray view. A determination and a disadvantage.一个后果出乎意料的任务。与像是草地一样绿的东西有关联。与一支电话或来电有关联。4乘以5。最初的一次爆炸。一幅灰色的景象。一个决心与一个不利之处。
A note. Early November or late October. A scribble. Some figures. Connection with a disturbance, and a distant connection with a skull or skull shape. J B.一个笔记(note,译注：note也有字条、便条，或注记、注释的意思)11月初或10月底。一个涂鸦。一些数字(或人物)。(译注：figuer有数字或人物之意)与一个骚动有关联，而且和一个头骨或头骨形状有遥远的关联。JB。
Illia. (My interpretation. Jane waved the envelope. Her eyes opened briefly.) I do not know to what this refers, and perhaps an F and R.伊利亚(Illia)。(我的解读。珍挥了一下信封，她的眼睛张开一下子)我不知道这是指什么，或许还有一个F和R。
Four divided. The explosive impression again. A date above, connection with black small squares. Something identical to something else. Connection with a February event. One nine four three.分成四份。又是爆炸的印象。一个日期在上方，与黑色小正方形有关联。与别的东西一模一样的某个东西。与一个2月的事件有关联。1943。
The scribble again. An inadequate performance. And something to do with a name. And some word like January or Januarious.又是涂鸦。一个不够好的表现。以及某个与一个名字有关的东西。不家某个像January(1月)或Januarious的字。
Something like a toy that is misplaced. Brass. I am not sure here. The connection leads to buttons. A party. 1731. An actual replica, or something happening all over again, as a commemoration. Orange and purple. A paper item, but rougher rather than smooth, background. Perhaps a colored paper. Purple.某个记错地方像玩具的东西。黄铜，这里我不确定。这个连结通往纽扣。一个派对。1731年。一个实际的复制品，或再度发生的某件事，像是一个纪念日。橘色和紫色。一个纸制物件，但是背景比较粗糙，而不是光滑。也许有一张彩色的纸。紫色。
The impression of some round shapes on it, or connected with it, of orange. And a child.印象是一些橘色的圆形在它上面或与它有关。以及一个小孩。
Do you have questions? 1961.你有没有问题？1961年。
("What’s that Gubatorial connection?” )(“那个Gubatorial的关联是什么？”)
I am not sure on this. A magistrate. An election of sorts. Either of these. An authority.这个我不确定。一个最高统治者。某种选择。这两个的其中一个。一个当权者。
(“Okay, I guess that's it then.” )(“好，那我想这样就够了。”)
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:03. Jane said she was well dissociated. Her eyes opened briefly a few times. She said she might have had images but couldn’t recall them until she came to the appropriate data as we made our connections.(10:03休息。珍说她顺利出离。她的眼睛短暂张开过几次。她说她可能有过画面，但是想不起来，直到我们自己找出关联时，她才想到适当的资料。
(Since this experiment was a little different, I had decided not to ask many questions, preferring to see what results were obtained without them. See the drawings on pages 152 and 153. When Jane came up with the Gubatorial data, I asked a question about this data only, and as I hoped she cleared it up.(因为这个实验有一点不同，所以我决定不要问太多问题，比较想要看看不问会有什么结果。见前面的素描。当珍提出Gubatorial的资料时，我只问了一个关于这个资料的问题，我希望她解释清楚。
(I chose the object in the following manner. In my studio was a pile of old newspapers. Most of them were of the New York Times, daily and Sunday. I removed a few local papers from the stack. Backing up to the pile I pulled out a section without looking at it and tore off a portion of a page. I folded this behind me until I was sure it would fit between the regular double Bristols, and into the double envelopes.(我选择标的物的方式如下。在我的工作室有一堆旧报纸。它们大部分是《纽约时报》，有日报也有周日报。我从这堆报纸当中拿走几份当地报纸。转身回到报纸堆，我连看都没看就拉出一张版面，撕下其中一页的一部分。我在身后把它折起来，直到我确定它可以夹在一般的双层西卡纸，再放进双层信封内为止。
(Still without looking at the paper I had chosen as object, I sealed it in the envelopes. Then I picked up the section from which the object had been taken, my eyes closed, groped over to a floor-to-ceiling bookcase in the studio, and placed the newspaper on a high shelf so that I would not see it ordinarily.(仍然不看我选来当标的物的报纸，我将它密封在双层信封里。然后我拿起标的物原先所在的版面，闭着眼睛，摸索着走到工作室的落地书架，把报纸放在高处的一个隔板上，这样我大概就不会看到它了。
(This procedure left me knowing only one thing about the object: that it came from some section of the New York Times, date unknown. Jane and I have often speculated on what part telepathy plays in the envelope experiments, since I usually am consciously aware of the object in detail. I thought the method used tonight might make ordinary telepathy harder to divine on Janes part. As it was we think the results were good; Seth evidently clairvoyantly read the object. If he got any help from me it was telepathy twice removed.(这个过程让我只知道标的物的一件事：它来自《纽约时报》的某一版，日期不详。珍和我经常思索心电感应在信封实验中扮演什么角色，因为我在意识上通常对标的物知之甚详。我认为今晚使用的这个方法可能会让珍更难透过平常的心电感应来推测。事实上，我们认为结果很好；赛斯显然透过千里眼来阅读标的物。如果他得到我的任何帮助，那就是消除过两次的心电感应。
(When these experiments began Seth told us he operated well clairvoyantly. He also cited a few examples where telepathy from me had helped out. [I lost this sessions envelope object years ago, so can only show the Times's full page on pages 151 and 152. June 2000.](当这些资料开始进行的时候，赛斯告诉我们，他透过千里眼运作得很好。他也举了几个例子，说明我传递的心电感应帮了忙。[我在多年前遗失了这一节的信封物件，所以只能展示《纽约时报》的一整页。2000年6月。])
(After the experiment was over Jane opened the envelopes, and I picked up the newspaper from which the object had been taken. It turned out that I had chosen Section One of the New York Times for Sunday, November 6,1966, and from this had torn the object from pages 11 and 12. It also developed that I had leafed through this section of the paper in a casual way—without remembering the pages in question, 11 and 12—and that Jane had never seen it.(实验结束之后，珍打开信封，我拿起标的物原先所在的报纸。结果是我选了《纽约时报》1966年11月6日星期天的第一版，从第11和12页撕下标的物。后来也发现我随意翻阅过报纸的这一版——不记得上述页面，第11和12页——珍从未见过它。
(Seth did not return to help us out; in the meantime we made our own connections. Section One of the Times was many pages thick, as is usual on a Sunday. Therefore Jane and I arbitrarily decided to limit the interpretations and connections to the object itself, and the one page—11/12—-from which it was torn. These two items are on file along with the front page of the section.(赛斯没有回来帮我们忙；在此同时我们自己找出关联。《纽约时报》的第一版有数页之厚，周日通常都是如此。因此珍和我任意决定把解读和关联限定在标的物本身，以及它被撕下之前所在的这一页——第11和12页。这两个物件与这个版的首页一起归档。
(“A seven times six, or 42.” There are many numbers on both sides of the object and its parent page, 11 and 12, since the page features sales of bedding, blankets, sheets, cases, etc., all by size and color and dimension. There is a 42 on page 12 of the newspaper page from which the object is taken. See page 153. In the upper right area of an ad, pillowcases are quoted: 42 x 36 inch, etc.(“一次7乘以6，或42。”在标的物两面以及它原本所在的第11和12页都有很多数字，因为这页的主题是寝具、被毯、床单、枕套等等的拍卖，全都标上尺寸、颜色和长宽高等等。在撕取标的物的报纸页面上有一个42。见描图。在一则广告的右上角，枕套的规格是：42×36英寸等等。
(“A method of disposal.” Sales certainly are methods of disposal, and sales are dealt with on both sides of the object itself, including use of the word sale, several times. [2,000. I wish I had the object to show. I lost it years ago!](“一种处置方法。”拍卖肯定是处置方法，而且标的物本身的两面都刊登拍卖，包括使用拍卖这个词组好几次。[2000年。我希望我可以展示标的物，但我多年前就遗失它了！])
(“An impression I do not understand. Gubatorial, blue. Something in the vernacular.” This we regard as excellent data. Jane groped a bit on gubatorial, although I had no trouble putting down her pronouncement here. The data is made even clearer in answering the one question asked. The object features election day sales on both sides. Since the New York State elections, including that for the governorship, were due on November 9, it is apparent that Jane was trying for the word gubernatorial, with which she is not particularly familiar on a conscious level.(“一个我不了解的印象。Gubatorial，蓝色。方言里的某个东西。”这在我们看来是绝佳的资料。珍摸索了一下Gubatorial这个字，但是这里我写下她的发音并没有任何困难。在回答我提出的唯一一个问题时，这个资料甚至更清楚了。标的物本身的两面都是选举日拍卖的消息。因为纽约州的选举日，包括州长选举在内，是11月9日，所以显然珍试着说出gubernatirial[州长]，在意识层面，她不太熟悉这个字。
(See pages 152 and 153. Election Day sales are mentioned specifically in the headings for the sales described on both pages 11 and 12, from which the object was torn. Gubernatorial is a word in the vernacular. Blue is referred to both on the object itself on the page 11 side in the line: Norwegian natural blue fox... etc.; and is torn through on the page 12 side in the line referring to a sale of thermal blankets: White, green, pink, blue, gold. Blue also appears on page 12 of the full sheet, in a list of colors for imperfect sheets on sale, and in other places on page 11/12.(见标的物。在第11和12页，也就是在标的物被撕下的页面所描述的拍卖标题上，特别提到选举日拍卖。Gubernatorial是方言中的一个字。蓝色是指标的物本身的第11页那一面句子提到：挪威天然蓝色狐狸……等等；以及第12页被撕下来的部分句子提到保暖被的拍卖：白色、绿色、粉红色、蓝色、金色。蓝色也出现在整张报纸的第12页，在床单瑕疵品拍卖的颜色清单上，以及第11和12页的其他地方也有。
(“The impression of small squares with orange, I believe, circles in the center.” We are not sure. There is no orange on the object, or page 11/12, for instance. Jane had an image here but cannot describe it now.(“小正方形的印象，我相信，中间有橘色的圆圈。”我们不确定。比方说，在标的物或第11和12页都没有橘色。这里珍有过一个画面，但是现在描述不出来。
(“One eight four one.” On the page 11 side of the object there is a sequence of numbers: 189.95 at the bottom of the illustration, and one: 18, 14- 1/2 to 22, at the bottom of a box to the left of this on the same side.(“一个841。”在标的物的第11页那一面，有一串数字：189.95，位于示意图的底部，而且在同一面，这行数字左边的一个方框底部也有一串：18，14½to22。
(See the article indicated to the upper left on page 12 of the full sheet, page 153. The article concerns the efforts of a priest to build a seminary in Portugal. The priest's order, the Dominicans, had been expelled from Portugal in 1834, and was readmitted in 1940.(见前面描图所示，在整张报纸的第12页左上方有一篇文章。该文与一名神父在葡萄牙建一间神学院的努力有关。神父的教团，多明尼加人，在1834年被逐出葡萄牙，并于1940年再度准入境。
(Since Seth did not return we are not sure if any of these three interpretations may apply in a distorted way to the 1841 data.(因为赛斯没有再回来，所以我们不确定这三个解读的任何一个有没有可能以一种扭曲的方式适用于1841年的资料。
(“Connection with a monstrosity, as of a monstrous building, perhaps old Victorian. The first impression was of monstrosity, the rest is interpretation.” See the article indicated to the upper left on page 11 of the full sheet from which the object was torn, page 152. This concerns the prison population of Portugal 's prisons, and the prison system itself. Discussed in the article is the building of a network of modern establishments, to “replace a few big antiquated prisons,” etc. Other references include such phrases as “prisons were of very low standard,” etc.(“与一个巨大丑陋之物有关联，有如怪物般的一栋丑陋建筑物，也许是老式的维多尼亚风格。第一个印象是巨大丑陋之物，其余的是解读。”见前面所示，在标的物被撕下的整张报纸第11页左上方那篇文章。这是关于葡萄牙监狱的囚犯人数，以及狱政制度本身。文中讨论的是，建立现代机构的一个网络，以“取代几个老旧的监狱”等等。其他提及之处包括“监狱的条件很差”等等句子在内。
(There can also be a connection with monstrosity and the general idea of crime, perhaps, which is discussed at length in the article.(也许，与巨大丑陋之物以及一般的犯罪概念可能有关联。这在文章中有冗长的讨论。
(“Liberal giving two—two of a kind—two a date, or 2:00 o’clock.” To the far left of the page 11 side of the object is the bottom section of a help-wanted ad by Macy's in New York City. One of the headings in larger type is: Want a job with liberal discounts?(“自由给出2——一种2——日期的2，或两点钟。”标的物的第10页那一面最左边是纽约市梅西百货[Macy's]一则征人启事的底部。字体较大的标题之一是：想要一个享有自由折扣的工作吗？
(There are many numerals 2 on both sides of the object. See pages 152 and 153, plus the [missing] object, etc. On the page 11 side of the object is the line in heavier type: Prime quality 2. skin natural male mink, etc. On the page 12 side of the object is the word twin.(在标的物的两面有很多数字2。见前面所示，还有[遗失的]标的物等等。在标的物的第11页那一面，有一行字体较黑的句子：高级二层[2-skin]真皮男性貂皮大衣等等。在标的物的第12页那一面有twin[双]这个字。
(“A mission with unforeseen consequences.” The article on page 12 of the newspaper, dealing with the Dominican seminary in Portugal, has to do with the journey to the United States each year of a priest, Rev. Fernandes, on a fund-raising mission. The subtitle of the article also reads:“Project in Portugal Aided by Funds Raised in U.S.(“一个后果出乎预料的任务。”在报纸第12页报导葡萄牙多明尼加神学院的文章，与一名教士，费南德斯牧师[Rev. Fernandes]，每年来到美国旅行，进行募款任务有关。文章的副标也写道：“葡萄牙的计划由美国的募款赞助。”
(“Connection with something green as a meadow.” The same article describes in some detail how the Dominican order in Portugal now has converted an old farm into a new seminary, which is“largely self supporting, having its own kitchen, laundry, reservoir, farm, fruit and vegetable garden, and vineyards,” etc.(“与某个像草地一样绿的东西有关联。”同一篇文章颇为详尽地描述现在葡萄牙的教团如何将一间旧农场改建成一座新的神学院，它“大部分自给自足，有自己的厨房、洗衣间、储水池、农场、果园和菜园，以及葡萄园”等等。
(In the large ad to the right of the article on page 12 is a reference to mint green sheets, in rather heavy type, also.(在第12页的文章右边一则大型广告里，也以相当粗黑的字体提到薄荷绿床单。
(“With a telephone or telephone call” On the page 11 side of the object is a line of type below the illustration and just above the List line: Sorry, no mail or phone. On the page 12 side of the object, at the bottom, are three lines of small type containing many New York City phone numbers and addresses. Above this is the line: Mail and phone orders filled. etc.(“与一支电话或来电有关联。”在标的物的第11页那一面，示意图下方有一行铅字就在上一行上面：抱歉，不接受邮购或电话订购。在标的物的第12页那一面，底下有三行小字的内容是很多支纽约市的电话号码和地址。在这上面的一行字是填写邮购与电话订单等等。
(“Four by five." We don't know. There are many 4's and 5's both on the object itself and the full page font which it was taken.(“4乘5。”我们不知道。在标的物以及它原来所在的整个页面有很多4和5。
(“An initial explosion,” Jane said she is subjectively sure this is a personal association of hers, leading to the ad on the full page 12 for thermal blankets, just above the object to the right. Note the word: Warmth!, with thermal just below it. To Jane, the heat implication leads to explosion, etc.(“最初的一次爆炸。”珍说她在主观上确定，这是她个人的联想，导向第12页的保暖被广告，这则广告就在标的物正上方靠右边。注意这个词组：暖和！而它的正下方就是保暖。对珍来说，其中隐含热的意思导致爆炸等等的联想。
(“A gray view.” On both sides of the object can be seen portions of illustrations in halftone, or gray. The dishes advertised on the page 12 side of the object are also white dinnerware with a blind embossed, or raised, decoration around the border. Thus they cast gray shadows.(“一幅灰色的景象。”在标的物的两面可以看到一部分半色调或灰色的示意图。在标的物第12页那一面的餐盘广告也是白色餐具，边缘有着无色压花或浮雕装饰。因此它们投射出灰色的阴影。
(Perhaps the view reference in gray view refers to a short article on the page 11 side of the full page, in column one. It concerns an eye bank in Ceylon to aid South Vietnamese civilians. Could gray view refer to clouded vision, dim color perception? See page 152.(也许灰色的景象提到的景象是指整张报纸第11页那一面第一栏的一篇短文。它是关于锡兰[Ceylon，译注：斯里兰卡的旧称]一个帮助南越平民的眼库。灰色的景象有没有可能是指模糊的视力、朦胧的色觉？见前面描图。
(“A determination and a disadvantage.” Jane said this is a reference arising out of the set of dishes shown on the page 12 side of the object. It concerns the fact that we are buying a set of dishes of our own at Loblaw’s supermarket; Jane said she was determined to get a set of dishes adequate for our needs. The disadvantage however is that obtaining the set in this fashion is much more expensive than she had figured on.(“一个决心与一个不利之处。”珍说这是出自标的物第12页那一面展示的那组餐具。它关系到我们买了一组足够我们所需的餐具这个事实。不过，坏处是，以这种方式买到这组餐具，比她料想的还要贵很多。
(“A note.” Too general? The object is covered with words on both sides, of course. Note, re mail, is referred to in the mail and phone lines of type on both sides of the object, as noted under the telephone data interpreted on page 159.(“一个笔记。”太笼统了？标的物的两面当然布满了字句。注意，在标的物两面的几行邮寄和电话的铅字里面提到了关于邮寄，如前面解读电话资料所示。
(“Early November or late October.” The object was torn from page 11/12 of the New York Times for November 6,1966. The object also contains references to the election day sales due November 9.(“11月初或10月底。”标的物是从1966年11月6日《纽约时报》第11和12页撕下来的。标的物也提到11月9日的选举日拍卖。
(“A scribble.” No connections.(“一个涂鸦。”找不到任何关联。
(“Some figures.” Both sides of the object contain many numbers. also on the page 11 side of the object can be seen portions of two female figures—a foot, and the hemline and knees of another model. On the full page 11 are the figures of five women, modeling new styles of fall coats. See page 152.(“一些数字[或人物]。”标的物的两面有很多数字。在标的物的第11页那一面也可以看到两个女性人物的局部——一只脚以及另一个模特儿的裙边和膝盖。在第11页整页有5个女性人物，展示秋季新款大衣。见描图。
(“Connection with a disturbance” , is, Jane said, a possible reference to the article on the prison system in Portugal, in column one on page 11 of the full page. Many statistics are given in the article, dealing with various types of crime, etc., as well as the new prison system that is replacing the old buildings, etc.(“与一个骚动有关联。”珍说，可能是指葡萄牙狱政制度的那篇文章，在第11页全页的第一栏。文中给出很多统计数据，探讨各种不同类型的犯罪等等，还有取代旧建筑的新型狱政制度等等。
(“And a distant connection with a skull or skull shape.” This, Jane said, is a reference to the faces of the five models shown on the full page 11, with the lower portions of two of them visible on the object itself. In the photos all the women wear the new close-fitting hats that cover up the hair. These hats throw their faces into bold relief, and give a skull-like or egg-shaped look.(“而且和一个头骨或头骨形状有遥远的关联。”珍说，这是指第11页全页那5个模特儿的脸，在标的物本身可以看到其中两个的下半身。在照片中，所有的女人都戴着紧贴的新帽子，盖住了头发。这些帽子让她们的脸显得特别突出，样子看起来像头骨或蛋形。
(“]. B.” No connections.(“JB。”找不到任何关联。
(“Illia. I do not know to what this refers.” I Ilia is my interpretation of what Jane said, with some emphasis. The only word remotely approaching this is Aldeia Nova, meaning New Village, and is found in the article on page 12 of the full sheet, dealing with the Dominican Seminary in Portugal. See page 153.(“伊利亚。我不知道这是指什么。”伊利亚是我对珍的话所做的解读，她在说的时候语带强调。唯一接近这个词的是阿尔德亚诺瓦[Aldeia Nova]，意思是新村，在第11页全页报导葡萄牙多明尼加神学院那篇文章可以找到它。
(A possible distortion of aqua blue, found on the same page to the right, in a list of sheet colors?(在同一页右边的色系中，可能有一个水蓝色的扭曲。
(“Four divided.” Four divided gives two, if this is the correct interpretation. There are references involving two on both sides of the object, and the sheet from which it was torn. For instance on the page 11 side of the object: 2- skin natural male mink; on the page 12 side: Twin size, etc.(“四被除过。”四被除过等于2，如果这是正确解读的话。在标的物的两面以及它原来所在的那张报纸上都有提到2。比方说，在标的物的第11页那一面；高级二层真皮男性貂皮大衣；在标的物的第12页那一面：twin[双]尺寸等等。
(“The explosive impression again.” See the interpretation of Initial Explosion on page 157.(“又是爆炸的印象。”见前面所示，对最初的一次爆炸所做的解读。
(“A date above, connected with small black squares.” See pages 152 and 153. Note that the object was torn from the bottom portion of the newspaper page, thus placing the date, November 6,1966 of course above it.(“一个日期在上方，与黑色小正方形的关联。”见前面所述。注意，标的物是从报纸页面的底部撕下来的，因此日期，1966年11月6日，当然是在上方。
(Perhaps the small black squares refer to type? Also—Macy 's Herald Square is mentioned twice on the page 11 side of the object.(也许黑色小正方形是指铅字？还有——在标的物的第11页那一面提到梅西百货哈德广场两次。[译注：square有正方形或广场之意。]
(“Something identical to something else.” There could be various interpretations. Sales, as indicated on both sides of the object, would imply many identical items on sale, in each category. And again, there is the twin reference on the page 12 side of the object.(“与别的东西一模一样的某个东西。”可能有各种不同的解读。如标的物的两面所示，拍卖可能意味着在每一个类别当中，有很多一模一样的商品正在拍卖。而且在标的物的第12页那一面再一次提到双[twin]。
(Or the identical reference could simply concern the fact of a sale mentioned on both sides of the object.(或者一模一样也可能只和标的物两面都提到一次拍卖有关而已。
(“Connection with a February event.” No connections.(“与一个2月的事件有关联。”找不到任何关联。
(“One nine four three.” The year date, 1943, is mentioned in the article on the Dominican Seminary, on page 12 of the full sheet from which the object was torn: It was started in 1943, three years after the Dominican Order was readmitted, etc.(“1943。”在标的物原先所在的第12页全页，报导多明尼加神学院的文章中提到1943这一年。从1943年开始，在多明尼加教团获准再度入境3年之后等等。
(“The scribble again.” No connections.(“又是涂鸦。”找不到任何关联。
(“An inadequate performance,” Jane said she thought this a reference to the article on prisons of Portugal, in column one of page 11 of the full sheet. The article presents some of the history of Portuguese prisons, mentioning their past low standards, overcrowding, etc.(“一个不够好的表现。”珍说她认为这是指葡萄牙监狱的那篇文章，在整张报纸第11页的第一栏。文章谈到葡萄牙监狱的历史，提到它们过去的条件太差、过度拥挤等等。
(“And something to do with a name. And some word like January or Januarious.” This is good subjective data to Jane, and refers to the article on the Dominican Seminary on page 12 of the full sheet. Jane is well informed regarding religious matters. As a Catholic youngster, she had a teacher named Sister Januarious in grade school. She still remembers the sister quite well, for she made a good impression.(“以及某个与一个名字有关的东西。还有某个像January[1月]或Januarious的字。”这对珍来说是很好的主观资料，指的是整张报纸第12页报导多明尼加神学院的文章。关于宗教方面的事务，珍博学多闻。在小学时，身为天主教徒的她有一位老师叫做Januarious[贞努雅瑞尔丝]修女。她还清楚记得这位修女，因为她给珍留下了很好的印象。
(Jane and I wonder about the coincidence involved in my selecting, by the blind method on page 158, a newspaper page that features an article about religion, and the Catholic religion at that. See page 153. Religiosity is one of Jane's strong points.(珍和我在想的巧合是，我用前面描述的盲选法，挑了一张报纸，上面有一篇谈宗教以及天主教的文章。宗教是珍的强项之一。
(“Something like a toy that is misplaced. This could imply something lost, and toy could imply a gift or children perhaps. We speculate whether this data refers to the short article about the Ceylon eye bank, in column one on page 11 of the full sheet, from which the object was tom. See page 152.(“某个放错地方像玩具的东西。”这可能意味着某个遗失的东西，而玩具或许可能隐含礼物或小孩的意思。我们在想这个资料是不是指谈锡兰眼库的短文，在整张报纸的第11页第一栏，标的物就是从这张报纸撕下来的。
(The article states that a gift of eyes for cornea grafts... for South Vietnamese civilians, mostly children... with no discrimination... and some Viet Cong... would be made. Can there be a connection between misplaced and the fear of discrimination as detailed in the article?(文章说角膜移植用的眼睛捐赠……给南越平民，大部分是儿童……毫无差别待遇……以及一些越共……会发生。放错地方与文中详细描述的差别待遇之间是不是可能有关联？
(“Brass. I am not sure here. The connection leads to buttons.” See page 152, for a sketch of the full page from which the object was tom. Five female models wear coats, and many buttons are visible on the coats. The buttons appear to be cloth-covered however, in the photographs.(“黄铜，这里我不确定。这个连结通往纽扣。”标的物被撕下的全页素描见前面所示。5名模特儿穿着大衣，在大衣上可以看到很多纽扣。不过，在照片中纽扣看起来包着布料。
(“A party.” There is a party, meaning company, reference on page 12 of the sheet from which the object was torn, in the lower left-hand comer. The copy here concerns the white dinnerware set, part of which is shown on the object itself also. The ad copy extols the virtues of Rosemont White dinnerware: ...you won't think twice about using it every day, and you’ll show it off when company comes, too.(“一个派对。”在标的物被撕下的第12页左下角提到一个派对，意思是访客。这里的文章写的是白色餐具组，标的物本身也展示了它的一部分。广告文案赞美罗丝蒙白色餐具的优点……你毫不犹豫，肯定会天天使用它，还会向来访的客人炫耀它。
(A perhaps less likely party reference can be found on page 11 also, again in the lower left-hand comer. See page 152. Here the word Christmas is used in connection with a Christmas job at Macy 's.(在第11页的左下角也可以找到一个不太可能的派对参考。这个词与梅西百货的圣诞工作有关。
(“1731.” No connections. The earliest year date on either page 11 or 12 is 1834, in the article on the Dominican Seminary, page 12. There is a $15.96 price given for one of the coats shown on page 11.(“1731年。”找不到任何关联。在第11或第12页，最早的年代是1834年，出现在第12页的多明尼加神学院那篇文章。在第11页展示的其中一件大衣标价是美金15.96分。
(“An actual replica, or something happening all over again, as a commemoration.” This is good data, and refers to the Dominican Seminary article on page 12. Among other things the article describes how the seminary leader, Father Fernandes, will organize a pilgrimage of Americans to Fatima in May 1967. The group will also assist at the inauguration of a chapel at the seminary at Aldeia Nova, which will be finished early next year. The article then states: The date happens to coincide with 50th anniversary celebrations at Fatima, when the Pope may possibly preside.(“一个实际的复制品，或再度发生的某件事，像是一个纪念日。”这是很好的资料，指的是第12页的多明尼加神学院那篇文章。文中描述的事情之一是，神学院的院长，费南德斯神父，在1967年5月将筹办一次美国人到法蒂玛[Fatma]的朝圣。这群人也会在阿尔德亚诺瓦的神学院，为一座教堂的启用典礼提供协助，该教堂将在隔年的年初完工。然后文章写道：这个日子碰巧与法蒂玛的50周年庆典同一天，所以教宗可能会莅临主持。
(“Orange and purple. ’’Again no connections, unless one can make them from the list of sheet colors on the full page 12: Soft beige, pastel blue, pastel pink, mint green, orchid mist [Jane said this would be a purple], aqua blue, yellow. Or the colors listed for the thermal blankets, the list being partially visible on the page 12 side of the object: White, green, pink, blue, gold.(“橘色和紫色。”再一次找不到任何关联，除非是从第12页的床单颜色清单上找：柔米黄色、粉蓝色、粉红色、薄荷绿色、兰雾色[珍说这是一种紫色]、水蓝色、黄色。或是在标的物第12页那一面可以看到一部分的保暖被颜色清单：白色、绿色、粉红色、蓝色、金色。
(Jane thought it possible but not likely that the idea of the thermal blanket advertisement gave rise to the orange, or hot, color.(珍认为保暖被广告的概念可能引出橙橘或热的颜色，但可能性不大。
(“A paper item, but rougher than smooth, background. ’’ The object is a paper item. And being from a newspaper it is of a rougher, rather than smooth, background or stock. That is, the coarse newsprint versus say a coated magazine type of paper stock.(“一个纸制的物件，但是背景比较粗糙，而不是光滑。”标的物是纸制的物件。因为来自报纸，所以它的背景或用纸比较粗糙，而不是光滑。也就是说，粗糙的新闻用纸相对于，比如，杂志用的一种铜板纸。
(“Perhaps a colored paper.” As stated the object is in black and various shades of gray, printed on white. Colors are mentioned on the page 12 side of the object, in the thermal blanket ad, and of course on both sides of the full sheet from which the object was torn.(“也许有一张彩色的纸。”如上所述，标的物是用黑色以及各种不同灰色调印刷在白纸上。在标的物的第12页那一面提到颜色，保暖被的广告，当然还有整张报纸的两面，标的物就是从中撕下来的。
(“Purple. ’’Again, not sure.(“紫色。”再一次，不确定。
(“The impression of some round shapes on it, or connected with it, of orange.” The dish photo on the page 12 side of the object contains round shapes , for instance, but in shades of gray and in black only.(“印象是一些橘色的圆形在它上面或与它有关。”比方说，在标的物的第12页那一面，餐具的照片包含了圆形，但是只有灰色调和黑色。
(“And a child.” As stated before, children are mentioned in the Ceylon eye bank article in column one on page 11, of the full page from which the item was taken. See page 152. Quote from the article: the ophthalmologist... said the recipients would be... Vietnamese civilians, mostly children, etc.(“以及一个小孩。”如之前所述，在取得物件的整张报纸第11页，第一栏刊载的锡兰眼库文章提到了小孩。引述这篇文章：眼科医师……说受赠者是……越南平民，大部分是小孩等等。
(Jane speculated that the mention of Christmas, just below this article on page 11, in connection with a Christmas job at Macy's, might have given rise to the associative child data.(珍推测，在第11页这篇文章正下方提到圣诞节，与梅西百货的一个圣诞节工作有关，可能因此导致小孩资料的联想。
(1961. No connections. There are various recent and old year dates mentioned in the news articles on both pages 11 and 12 of the newspaper, but not 1961. Nor are there any $19.61 prices on any advertised items, or sizes of that figure, on either the item itself or the full page.(“1961。”没有连接。在报纸的新闻中，说到了各种年月但没有1961。
(1st Question: “What’s that gubatorial connection?” I am not sure on this. A magistrate. An election of sorts. Either of these. An authority. ’’Jane came through with flying colors on this, as I sought more data on her “ Gubatorial—vernacular” data interpreted on page 159. See page 152 and 153. It can be seen that election day sales are mentioned in large type on both sides of page 11 and 12 of the New York Times for November 6,1966. The New York State elections were due the next Tuesday, November 8, and included the governorship contest.(第一个问题：那个Gubatorial的关联是什么？“这个我不确定。一个最高统治者。某种选举。这两个的其中一个。一个当权者。”我想要得到更多她说的“Gubatorial——方言”资料，珍传述得十分出色，该资料的解读在前面。可以看到1966年11月6日《纽约时报》第11和12页的两面都提到选举日拍卖，字体很大。纽约州的选举预定10月8日星期二举行，其中包含州长的角逐在内。
(Omitted earlier, after the Illia data:” And perhaps an F and R.” We can find F and R references on both the object and the page from which it was torn, without knowing if any of these would be correct. These would include phone letters, personal names, etc. In the article on the Dominican Seminary alone we find: Father Fernandes; Fatima; St. Francis Xavier; Padre Abel Faria, etc.(在伊利亚资料之后，稍早前略过：“也许还有一个F和R。”在标的物以及撕下它的那一页，我们都可以找到F和R，但不知道哪一个是正确的。这些包括电话字母、个人姓名等等。单单在多明尼加神学院的文章中，我们就找到：费南德斯神父；法蒂玛；方济·沙勿略[Francis Xavier]；帕德烈·阿贝尔·法利亚[Padre Abel Faria]等等。
(End at 11:17. I do regret losing the envelope object for this session.)(11:17结束。遗失了这一节的信封标的物，我确实觉得遗憾。)

SESSION 301 第301节 最高的自己


NOVEMBER 16, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年11月16日 星期三 晚上9点
(The sessions regularly scheduled for November 9 and 14 were not held because we were too busy.(11月9日和14日的定期课没有举行，因为我们太忙了。
(Jane began speaking in trance in a quiet voice with short pauses, her eyes opening at times.)(珍开始在出神中用一种安静的声音讲话，间或短暂停顿，她的眼睛偶尔张开。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
We spent many sessions in the past discussing the nature of action.我们在过去用了几节课讨论行动的本质。
You understood, when we were done, that you perceive but a very brief glimpse of a small part of action as it exists. On a conscious level you perceive less than this.当我们讲完时，你了解你感知的行动，只是对它当下存在的一小部分有了极其短暂的一瞥。在一个意识层面，你感知的比这更少。
Action and consciousness are forever bound together, and we discussed the structure of the personality from this viewpoint. Action is perceived within your system electromagnetically, in terms of intensities. The personality as you know it is merely the result of action as you perceive it in certain groupings at any given time.行动和意识永远连结在一起，我们从这个观点讨论过人格的结构。在你们的系统之内是依据强度在电磁层面上感知行动。如你所知，人格只不过是你于任何既定时间在某些群组中感知行动的结果。
As you become aware of the larger dimensions of action, so you will become more aware of what personality is. I have told you that you exist in more dimensions than you know. Now, these have been referred to by some as astral planes. They simply represent realities with which you are not consciously familiar, and they span the distortions of your time elements so that larger portions of the spacious present become apparent.当你觉察到行动的更大维度时，你就会对人格是什么更有觉知。我告诉过你，你存在的维度比你知道的还多。现在，有些人称这些为星光层(astral planes,或译为灵界)。它们只是代表你在意识上不熟悉的实相而已，它们也跨越你们的时间元素当中种种的扭曲，好让广阔的现在显现出更大的部分。
You can within them often perceive both your past and present simultaneously, but this has always been a characteristic of the whole self in any case. The whole self is not bound by any system. At various times more of the abilities of the whole self intrude, so to speak, upon the ego system. You then become conscious of action that escaped you earlier. This often occurs with the help of the dream state.你可能在它们之内经常同时感知你的过去和现在，但在任何情况下，这向来都是全我的一个特质。全我不受任何系统的束缚。在不同的时候，更多全我的能力，可以说，侵入自我的系统中。然后你意识到之前没注意的行动。在梦状态的帮助下，这经常发生。
Communications exist between all portions of the self, and all parts of the personality; or parts of the whole self, rather, operate as what you may call a supraself. Ruburt has referred to this as a supraconsciousness. This is the identity, the whole identity, of the various portions of the self that operate within various systems. To this supraself, of course, your ego future can be easily viewed.沟通存在于自己的所有部分以及人格的所有部分之间；或更确切地说，全我的各个部分是以你可称之为一个最高的自己(译注：supraself的supra为拉丁语，意思是在上或在前)这样的形式运作。鲁柏称之为最高的意识(supraconsciousness)。这是自己(self)在不同系统之内运作的各个本体(identity)，完整的本体。对这个最高的自己来说，当然，你的自我(ego)未来如何，可能是一览无余的。
All portions of course exist simultaneously. The supraselfunder certain conditions is made known to you, sometimes in dreams. Often it is the you who takes over in projection states.所有的部分当然都同时存在。最高的自己在某些状况下会让你知道它，有时候是在梦中。通常它就是在投射状态中接管的那个你。
It is very close to the entity. Largely due to its abilities are the creative processes used, but hardly understood by the ego. In many cases this supraselfis already, so to speak, moving into completely new systems. It is, of course, aware of your reincarnations on the individual's part, but these are not present nor future to the self.它非常接近存有。多半因为它的能力就是创造过程所使用的能力，但自我几乎不了解。在很多情况中，这个最高的自己已经——可以说——完全移入新的系统了。当然，它对你个人方面的转世是有觉知的，但是这些对这个自己而言既不是现在也不是未来。
In one way the self represents what you shall be in your time terms, represents your highest potential. Basically however the supraselfalready does exist, you see, for all potentials are fulfilled. The supraselfcan be sensed at times, almost as you might senseanother presence. You are already part of it, of course.一方面，这个自己代表你将来所是，按照你们所谓的时间来讲，代表你最高的潜力。不过，基本上最高的自己其实已经存在，你知道，因为所有的潜力全部都充分发挥了。有时候可以感应到最高的自己，几乎就像你可能感应到另一个存在体一样。
There is an inherent knowledge within each individual of the supraself’s existence, and its image is indelibly imprinted. It is the desired and sought-after model against which you psychically measure your present self.在每一个人之内，天生就知道最高的自己是存在的，而且铭印着它的形象，永不磨灭。它是你渴望和追求的榜样，在心灵上依据它来衡量你现在的自己。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace had picked up, her eyes opening often, and she resumed in the same manner at 9:34.)(9:25休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度已经加快，眼睛经常睁开，在9:34分，她以同样的方式继续。)
When you perceive merely the present personality, you are simply perceiving a small portion of action.当你仅仅感知现在的人格时，你就只是在感知一小部分的行动而已。
To perceive more of action immediately involves mobility, and I am not speaking in terms of space. The act of perception itself involves mobility through intensities, and the many facets of consciousness can only be experienced as a direct result of this inner mobility.要立刻感知更多行动，关键是流动性，我说的不是空间。感知这个行为本身是历经种种强度的流动，而且在意识的很多面向上，唯一能够经验的也只有这种内在流动性的直接结果。
Now you are looking at the personality with the ego as your starting point. Other portions of the personality however perceive, or attempt to perceive, the whole self from their own starting point. The ego is seen in quite a different light when it is viewed by other portions of the self. It is not viewed—this was a poor term—as much as it was experienced, for no portion of the personality can be viewed as an object.现在你看着人格，而自我是你的起点。不管怎样，人格的其他部分都是从它们自己的起点感知或试图感知全我。自己的其他部分是从相当不同的角度看待自我。与其说看待——这样说不好——不如说是经验，因为人格没有任何部分能够被当成一个客体来看待。
The ego is the only part of the self that regards physical objects as anything but symbols. It is highly difficult for other parts of the self to experience the ego for this reason. The ego, while always changing, is one of the most rigid aspects of identity. To the inner self neither house nor walls exist. They are perceived only as vague self limiting ideas on the ego’s part.自我是自己当中唯一把实际物体看成一切，就是不当成象征的一部分。由于这个原因，其他部分的自己很难经验自我。自我虽然一直在改变，却是本体最僵化的一个面向。对内我来说，既没有房子也没有墙壁的存在。它们只是自我感知到的种种模糊不清又作茧自缚的概念。
Death simply does not exist to the whole personality. Only the physically oriented portions of the self accept this as a finality. (Long pause.) Whenever you use abilities that to you seem supernormal, you are drawing upon the ability of the supraself. It is the whole I and yet more than the sum of its parts. It is action highly aware, and quite able to change its components. It consists also of course of the probable selves of which we have spoken, and it unites and directs infinitely larger portions of action than possible for the physical personality.对整体人格而言，死亡根本不存在。只有自己当中那些物质导向的部分接受这是终结。(长时间停顿)无论何时，只要你使用对你来说似乎超乎正常的能力，你就是从最高的自己汲取能力。它是整体的我(whole I)，但又不只是它所有部分的总和。它是高度觉知的行动，而且颇有能力改变它的成分。当然它也是由可能的自己组成的，这我们谈过了，而且它统一并指挥行动的更大部分，无限大到肉身人格(physical personality)不可能应付的部分。
Now, it directs and organizes this action, as for example your physical personality directs and organizes large portions of your physical image.现在，它指挥并组织这个行动，比方说，就像你的肉身人格指挥并组织你大部分的肉体形象一样。
(Long pause.) It can eventually be given a mathematical identity, or it can be discovered mathematically. All the personalities within it are independent, and survive as themselves, yet it is only part of a larger identity—which is to say that it itself is within the sphere of another psychological organization system or gestalt.(长时间停顿)它最终可能被赋予一个数学恒等式(mathematical identity，译注：根据维基百科的定义，在数学上，恒等式是无论其变数在给定的取值范围内取何值，等式永远成立的算式：identity与本体是同一个英文字)，也可能在数学上被发现。在它之内的所有人格都是独立的，而且自行存活着，但它只是一个更大本体的一部分而已——也就是说，它本身是在另一个心理组织系统或完形的范围之内。
It however retains its identity, you see, while partaking to the extent of its desire and ability in the superior aspects of this greater gestalt. Even as you, according to your desire and ability, can partake of the superior qualities of your supraself.然而，它保有它的本体，你看，同时依据它的欲望和能力，享有这个更大完形的高阶面向到某种程度。甚至是你，按照你的欲望和能力，也可能拥有你最高的自己所属的高阶品质。
You may take a brief break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:53; resume at 10:07.)(9:53休息；10:07继续。)
Now. This supraselfcan be called upon. Its abilities can be used—they are to some extent in projections, from either the waking or dream state.现在。这个最高的自己是可以召唤的。它的能力是可以被使用的——它们某种程度是在投射中，从醒时或梦状态投射。
An awareness of the existence of the supraselfis in itself of great benefit. The author of Ruburt’s new book calls this God, and I am simply telling you what it is. The supraselfis indeed a portion of a higher gestalt, which is part of yet another higher consciousness-gestalt. This is true. But this supraselfis you in a highly personal way, and it is superior in many aspects. It controls and organizes larger portions of action.觉知最高自己的存在，这本身具有极大的好处。在鲁柏的新书里，作者称之为神，而我只是在告诉你它是什么而已。最高的自己的确是一个更高完形的一部分，可是这个更高完形又是另一个更高意识-完形的一部分。这是真的。但是在非常个人的方面，这个最高的自己就是你，而且它在很多面向里都是高居在上的。它控制并组织行动的更大部分。
It operates for your benefit almost automatically in any case, for your benefit is its benefit, you see, and its energies are always at your disposal. This does not mean that you are dependent. You are independent as far as the actions you choose to take. You are however a part of your supraself, for it is a self which you will become, in your time terms. In other terms it is the self which you are; you can call upon your own supraconsciousness therefore, though there should be no reason to do so.在任何情况下，它几乎都会自动为了你的利益而运作，因为你的利益就是它的利益，你看，而且它的能量永远任凭你处置。这并不是说你依赖。就你选择采取的行动而言，你是独立的。然而你是你最高自己的一部分，因为按照你们所谓的时间，它就是你将会变为的一个自己。换句话说，它就是你现在的自己；因此你可以召唤你自己的最高意识，但是应该没有理由这么做。
It operates within you and for you in any case. The awareness of its existence however has strong reassuring elements on a conscious level. You see you are not the low man on the totem pole however. There are lesser, so to speak, personalities within every dominant physical personality, and lesser identities quite independent within each personal system. To these the physical personality would seem like a supraself.在任何情况下，它都在你之内并且为了你而运作。不管怎样，对它的存在有觉知，这在意识层面上有着强大的安心成分。你看无论如何你都不是微不足道的人。在每一个支配的肉身人格之内，可以说，都有次要人格，而在每一个个人的系统之内也都有相当独立的次要本体。对这些来说，肉身似乎就是一个最高的自己。
Now, we will close our session. My warmest wishes to you both. And my congratulations. You have helped your cat to progress so well.现在，我们要结束这一节了。给你们两位我最温暖的祝福。还有祝贺。你们帮助你们的猫复原得很好。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:15. Jane said she was fairly well dissociated, and had been for the evening. As far as she was aware, she said, she hadn't been reading any material lately that would have given rise to the content of the session.)(10:15结束。珍说她相当顺利出离，而且整晚都是如此。她说，就她所知，她最近并没有读任何足以引出本节内容的新资料。)
(Rough copy of the newspaper article used as the envelope object, in the 77th experiment in the 302nd session, for November 21,1966.)在1966年11月21日第302节的第77次实验用作信封标的物的报纸文章副本草图

SESSION 302 第302节 思想 行动 身体 信封77


NOVEMBER 21, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年11月21日 星期一 晚上9点
(The object for the 77th envelope experiment was a copy of an article from The Saratogian, the daily newspaper of Saratoga Springs, NY; it was printed in September, 1950 and was saved by Jane as a souvenir, and also because she wrote it. It describes her election as president of the Day Students Council for Skidmore College, in Saratoga. See the rough copies on pages 168 and 169.(第77次信封实验的标的物是纽约州撒拉托加温泉市的日报，《撒拉托加人》[Saratogian]上面的一篇文章；刊登于1950年9月，珍留下它，一方面是做纪念，此外也因为那是她写的。她描述她当选撒拉托加的史基摩学院[Skidmore Colliege]日间部学生会主席一事。见上面的草图。
(I have indicated the highlights of both sides of the object by typewriter; actually it was printed in two columns, instead of the one I have indicated. Jane saw the object about three weeks ago when she was sorting out some papers. I picked this item after finding it lost among some newspapers, and about to be thrown out. I placed it between the usual two pieces of Bristol, then sealed it in the regular double envelopes.(我用打字机打出标的物两面的重点；其实它是印成两栏，而不是我打出的一栏。大约3周前，珍在整理一些报纸时见过标的物。我发现它遗失在一些报纸堆，差一点就被丢掉之后，我把它拿起来。把它放在一般的纸板之间，然后密封在普通的双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking in trance with her eyes closed, her pace and voice average.)(珍闭着眼睛开始在出神中讲话，她的速度和声音中等。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
All action is generated behind and yet within all that you seem to see.所有的行动都是在你似乎看见的一切背后，但也是在它们之内产生的。
It is not generated from the objective world. The objective world is the end result of inner action. You can indeed manipulate the objective world from within, for this is the means and the definition of manipulation.它不是从客观世界产生的。客观世界是内在行动的最终结果。你确实可以从内在操纵客观世界，因为这就是操纵的手段和定义。
You do this in the dream state. You do it in the waking state. There must be therefore definite connections between inner energy and the world of objects. There are methods and means, hidden to the ego, whereby the physical universe as you know it is constantly created and maintained. Underline as you know it.你在梦状态做这件事。你在醒时状态做这件事。因此内在能量与客观世界之间必定有明确的连结，有许多自我不得而知的手段和方法，一直不断在创造和维持你所认识的物质宇宙。你所认识的，画线。
We have in the past discussed some of these methods briefly. We hinted at them when we discussed mental enzymes, but you were not ready for a more thorough discussion.我们在过去短暂讨论了这些方法的其中一些。我们在讨论精神酵素时约略提过，但你还没有准备好。所以没有进行更透彻的讨论。
(Seth talked about mental enzymes in the very early sessions almost three years ago now. See Volume One on The Early Sessions.)(赛斯在很早以前的课里谈过精神酵素，距今大约3年前。见《早期课一》。)
Thoughts and images are formed into physical reality and become physical fact. They are propelled chemically. A thought is energy. It begins to produce itself physically at the moment of its conception.思想和意象形成物质实相而且变成实体事实。它们是透过化学来推动的。一个思想就是能量。在构想成形的当下，它就开始在物质上创造出它自己了。
Mental enzymes are connected with the pineal gland. Chemicals as you know them, body chemicals, are physical, but they are the propellants of this thought energy, containing within them all the codified data necessary for translating any thought or image into physical actuality. They cause the physical body to reproduce the inner image. They are sparks, so to speak, initiating the transformation.精神酵素与松果体是相连的。你知道的化学物质，身体的化学物质，是实质的，但它们却是这个思想能量的推动者，把任何思想或意象翻译成物质实体所需的编码资料全都包含在它们之内。它们导致肉体复制内在意象的原因。可以说，它们是引发这种转化的火花。
Chemicals are released through the body through the skin and pore systems, in an invisible but definite pseudo-physical formation. The intensity of a thought or image largely determines the immediacy of its physical materiaizationl. There is no object about you that you have not created. There is nothing about your physical image that you have not made.化学物质以一种看不见却又明确的伪物质形态，从身体、皮肤和毛孔系统释出。一个思想或意象是否立即化为实体物质，大部分是由它的强度来决定。围绕在你身边的物体没有任何一件不是你创造出来的。你的肉体形象没有任何一点不是你制造出来的。
The initial thought or image exists within the mental enclosure of which I have spoken. It is not yet made physical. It appears within the physical system, but apart from it. Then it is sparked into physical materiaizationl. This is the general procedure. All thoughts or images are not completely materialized, however. The intensity may be too weak. There is a struggle of sorts among ideas for expression. The chemical reaction sparks certain electrical charges, some within the layers of the skin. There are radiations then through the skin to the exterior worlds containing highly codified information and instructions.最初的思想或意象存在我讲过的精神围场之内。它还没有转化为物质。它出现在物质系统之内，但两者是分开的。然后它有如电光火石一般转化为实体物质。这是大致的程序。不过，所有的思想或意象都不会完全物质化。强度可能太弱了。意念得经过一番挣扎，才能够表现出来。化学反应启动某种电荷，有一些是在各层皮肤之内。然后有辐射穿过皮肤散到外面的世界，其中包含了高度编码的资讯和指令。
The physical environment can be seen in many ways as direct extensions from the physical self. Physical formations of other images, you see, radiating outward; these subject to continual change, as is the physical image, and all of this reflecting the inner and basic action.物质环境在很多方面都可以被看成是肉身自己的直接延伸。其他意象的物质形态，你看，向外辐射；这些可能会持续变化，就像肉体形象那样，而这一切全都反映了内在的基本行动。
The physical environment is as much a part of you, then, basically you see, as the physical image. Your control over it is quite effective, for you create it as you create your fingertip. You are not consciously aware, consciously underlined, of your control over the physical object that may be touched by that fingertip.所以，你看，物质环境基本上与肉体形象一样，也是你的一部分。你对它的控制相当有效，因为你创造它就像你创造你的指尖一样。你在意识上没有觉察到，在意识上划线，你控制着那个指尖可能碰触到的实质物体。
The physical objects are made or constructed of the same pseudomaterial that radiates outward from the physical image, only the higher intensity mass is different. When it builds up enough, you recognize it as an object. At low intensity mass it is not apparent to you.实质物体一样是由肉体形象向外辐射而出的伪物质所制造或建构而成的，只不过更高的强度质量(intensity mass)不同而已。当它增强到足够的程度时，你就会认出它是一个物体。在强度质量太低时，它对你来说并不明显。
You may take a brief rest and we shall continue.你可以短暂休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:27. Jane was dissociated as usual. Her pace picked up some, and her eyes opened occasionally as the delivery progressed. She resumed at 9:34.)(9:27休息。珍一如往常出离。她的速度加快了一些，眼睛在进行传述时偶尔张开。她在9:34继续。)
Every nerve and fiber within the physical image has an inner purpose that is not seen, and that serves to connect the inner self with physical reality—in other words, that allows the inner self to create physical reality.在肉体形象之内的每一条神经和纤维都有一个不被看见的内在目的，作用是连结内我与物质实相——换句话说，让内我能够创造物质实相。
The physical image is a part of objective reality. This should not be overlooked, when speaking of the self. In one respect the physical image and physical objects go flying out in all directions from the inner core of the whole self. There is always impetus, action, and motion; that is, of intensities and not of space.肉体形象是客观实相的一部分。说到自己的时候，不应该忽略这一点。一方面，肉体形象和实质物体从全我的内在核心朝着四面八方飞出去。冲力、行动和动向一直都有；也就是说，在强度上，而不是空间里。
A thought is indeed faster than a locomotive. Or a rocket.一个思想的确比一辆火车头，或是一枚火箭，还要快速。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes."(“有。”)
(Her eyes closed at 9:38, Jane took the envelopes from me for the 77th experiment. She held it lightly against her forehead as usual, in a horizontal position.)(珍的眼睛在9:38分闭上，她从我手上拿了第77次实验的信封。她一如往常把横向的信封紧紧地压在她的额头上。)
Give us a moment, please. (Pause.) These are impressions.请等我们一下。(停顿)这些是印象。
Seven. A connection with many small colored squares. This reminding Ruburt however of your op painting.7。与很多彩色的小正方形有关联。不过，这让鲁柏想到你的欧普绘画(op，译注，op是optical[光学的、视觉的]的缩写，欧普艺术是在艺术作品上利用光学的技术营造出奇幻的视觉效应)。
A circumvention. Something going around. To do with a particular week, or a seven or fourteen-day period. Connection with a mountain. Or high peak.一次绕行(circumvention，译注：除了绕行、绕过，这个字还有逃避、规避之意)。某个绕圈的东西。与特定的一周，或一个7天或14天的期间有关联。与一座山有关联。或是高峰。
(Pause.) And a triangle.(停顿)以及一个三角形。
A note. Four events, closely related. Perhaps mentioned in the note. Or four people connected with one event, mentioned in a note.一则纪律。4个事件，密切相关。也许在纸条上有提到。或是与一个事件有关联的4个人，在纸条上有提到。
Connection with July or January, I believe; perhaps with 1963. With a bear. I do not know to what this refers.与7月或1月有关联。我相信；也许与19、6、3有关联。与一只熊有关联。我不知道这是指什么。
A name or place beginning with a D. Connection with a barrister or lawyer. An initial attempt, followed by others. A light or wall switch. An immediate engagement connected with another engagement. Mention of a time, perhaps 2 or 12.D开头的一个名字或地方。与一个出庭律师或律师有关联。一个最初的尝试，接着还有其他的。一个灯或墙的关联。与另一个参与有关联的一个立即参与。提到一个时间，也许是2或12。
(Pause.) With civil, or civil rights. Distant connection with a train, and also with a serial number.(停顿)与公民，或公民权利有关联。与一列火车有遥远的关联，而且与一串编号有关联。
Do you have any questions?你有没有问题？
("What color is the object?")(“标的物的颜色是什么？”)
Connection with an orange yellow white. With something inept perhaps. Not formalized. Perhaps poorly done, though I do not believe this impression should be carried precisely that far. More ill-defined, perhaps.与一种橘黄白色有关联。也许与某个无能的东西有关联。没有定型。也许是做得很差，但我不相信这个印象应该被带到刚好那么远。比较定义不清，也许。
("Can you give us some more on the 7 or 14. day period?")(“你能不能给我们更多7或14天期间的资料？”)
Strongly connected with, or mentioned, on the item.与物件有强烈的关联，或是在物件上有提到。
("What's that lawyer connection?"(“那个律师的关联是什么？”)
(Pause.) I am not sure. Laws or edicts.(停顿)我不确定。法律或法令。
("Can you say some more about the four people?")(“你能不能多说一点4个人的事？”)
Two male and two females, I believe.两名男性和两名女性，我相信。
("What's that about a triangle?")(“一个三角形是什么？”)
I was after this mountain shape, which seemed to be triangular, a triangle with the feeling of height, or the apex or high point of an episode.我在搜寻这个山的形状，它好像是三角形，带着高度感，或一个事件最高潮或最高点的一个三角形。
("Do you want to name the object?")(“你想要说出标的物的名称吗？”)
It seems like a note, with something else on it—like a note in combination with something else. Pictures or symbols on a note.它好像是一则记事，上面还有别的东西——就像一则与别的东西组合起来的记事。在一则记事上的图画或符号。
("What is that name or place beginning with D?")(“D开头的那个名字或地方是什么？”)
Ruburt here of course would think of Delmer. I can say no more on the D.这里鲁柏当然会想到德尔默(Delmer)。关于D，我没办法再多说什么。
("Can you say anything more about the colored squares?")(“你能不能说一点彩色正方形的事？”)
Purples and yellows—many colors. Orange and red.紫色和白色——很多颜色。橘色和红色。
("What are they?")(“它们是什么？”)
On a larger object.在一个更大的物体上。
("What's the shape of the object?")(“物体的形状是什么？”)
I believe rectangular.我相信是长方形。
("Can you say anything about the two females?")(“你能不能说一点两名女性的事？”)
An apparent misdeed, connected with one of them. Younger rather than older.一个明显的不当行为，与其中一个有关联。比较年轻的，而不是比较年长的。
("Any initials?")(“有没有任何姓名缩写？”)
B or C.B或C。
("Okay, I guess that’s it then.”(“好，那我想就到此为止吧。”
(Break at 9:55. Jane was out as usual and her eyes remained closed. She held the envelope to her forehead until almost the end of the experiment. She said she had no images except for the profusion of small colored squares. Her pace had been good, the pauses brief.(9:55分休息。珍一如往常出去了，而且她的眼睛一直闭着。她把信封放在额头上，直到实验快要结束为止。她说她没有任何画面，除了大量的彩色小正方形以外。她的速度很好，停顿时间短暂。
(See the rough copy of the envelope object on pages 168 and 169, and the notes on page 170. Seth did not return after the break, so Jane and I were left to make our own connections between the object and the data. In fact, we cut the session short because I was not feeling well. But we feel Jane did well.(见前面信封标的物副本草图，以及注释。赛斯在休息之后并没有回来，所以珍和我只好自己找出标的物与资料之间的关联。事实上，我们之所以缩短这一节，是因为我觉得不太舒服。但我们感觉珍做得很好。
(As stated, the object is an article taken from The Saratogian of September 1950. Jane wrote it, since she had a part-time job with the newspaper while attending Skidmore College in Saratoga Springs, New York. The object concerns the election of Jane as president of the Day Students Council in her junior year, and the photo at the top of the article shows Jane and the other three female members of the council. They wear the “uniform” in style then—blue jeans.(如上所述，标的物是从1950年9月的《撒手托加人》摘取的一篇文章。珍写了它，因为她在纽约州撒拉托加温泉市史基摩学院就学期间，同时在这家报社兼职。标的物与珍在大一那年当选日间部学生会主席一事有关，文章上方的照片是珍与另外3名学生会女性成员的合影。她们穿着当时流行的“制服”——蓝色牛仔裤。
(The typing below the photo and on the back sums up the content of the news stories on the object. Jane last saw the object about three weeks ago, but did not know it was in my possession particularly, when I decided to use it as an object. I folded it once as indicated on page 168 before inserting it in the usual double envelopes.(照片下方和背面的打字总结了标的物上那篇新闻报道的内容。珍最后一次看到标的物大约是三周以前，但是在我决定用它当作标的物的时候，她并不知道它就在我手上。如前面所述，我把它对折，再放进一般的双层信封里。
(There follow the connections Jane and I made:(以下是珍和我找出的关联：
(“Seven. ’’See the copy below the photo of the object, page 168. There is a seven in the address of one of the four council members, Orlyn Barron,., daughter of... etc., 78 Court, Saratoga.(“7。”见前面草图，标的物的照片下方文案。在4名学生成员之一的地址里有一个7，欧林·贝隆[Orlyn Barron]……的女儿……等等，撒拉托加，78街。
("A connection with many small colored squares. This reminding Ruburt however of your op painting.” As stated, Jane had images of small colored squares. We cannot connect them with the object however; although it is easy to connect them with my optical painting of last year, which hangs here in the apartment. The painting is made up of many three-quarter-inch squares of brilliant color.(“与很多彩色的小正方形的关联。不过，这让鲁柏想到你的欧普绘画。”如上所述，珍有彩色的小正方形画面。然而我们没办法找出它们与标的物的关联，但是把它们与我去年的欧普画作连结在一起倒是很容易，它就挂在公寓这里。那幅画是由¾英寸的正方形组成的，颜色鲜艳。
("A circumvention.” My interpretation involves the article on the back of the object. See page 169, and my insert, originally omitted and added with this typing. The news article concerns the Feinberg Law, which spells out the intent of the New York State Legislature in the Education Law, concerning the removal of any school employees for treasonable or seditious acts. The pertinent lines in the story being:” This law in no way violates the constitutional rights of freedom of speech, press or assembly. The Constitution was meant to preserve our gov't., not to serve as a protecting screen for those who would seek to destroy it..."(“一次绕行。”我的解读涉及到标的物背面的文章。而且我的补充，原本删除而后又加进打字里。新闻报道与芬伯格法则[Feinberg Law]有关，对于任何学校员工因叛国或煽动行为而撤职一事，文中详述纽约州议会在教育法上的意向。报导中的相关字句是：“这条法律绝对没有违反宪法保障的言论自由权利，无论是报刊或集会。宪法的用意是维持我们的政府，而不是充当一面防护网，保护那些想方设法破坏它的人……”
(Jane believes circumvention can also relate to these interpretations: the circular effect obtained in the photo on the object, by the placement of the four girls, as shown on page 168; and the word GLOBE in caps in the ad in the lower left corner on the back of the object.(珍相信绕行也可能与这些解读有关：在前面的标的物上，照片中可见4个女孩的位置所造成的环状效果；以及在标的物背面左下角的广告中，“GLOBE”[球形、地球]这个大写的字。
("Something going around." Possibly the same three interpretations can apply here, as for circumvention.(“某个绕行的东西。”可能绕行的3个解读在这里都适用。
("To do with a particular week. Or a seven or fourteen-day period,” Jane said this data is Seth’s attempt to get at the “day” references which are prominent on the front of the object. Note the headline indicated on page 168: “ Skidmore Day Students Elect Council members," plus other day students and council references in the article.(“与特定的一周，或一个7天或14天的期间有关联。”珍说这个资料是赛斯为了接近“day”[日期]这个字所做的尝试，在标的物的正面，这个字很显眼。注意前面标的物所示的标题：“史基摩学院日间部学生当选学生会成员”，再加上文章中其他提及日间部学生和学生会之处。
("Connection with a mountain. Or high peak. And a triangle.” Jane, again, says this is a reference to her election as president of the Day Students Council—it represents her top achievement in college, as far as honors went, she said.(“与一座山有关联。或是高峰。以及一个三角形。”珍再次说这是指她当选日间部学生会主席一事——她说，就荣誉而言，它代表她在学院里的最高成就。
("A note.” The object, being a newspaper item, contains printing and consequently is closely related to a note.(“一则记事。”标的物是一个报纸的物件，包含印刷字，因此与一则记事有密切的关联。
("Four events, closely related. Perhaps mentioned in the note. Or four people connected with one event, mentioned in a note." Seth is very close indeed here, since the article on the front of the object deals with the election of four women to the Skidmore College Day Students Council.(“4个事件，密切相关。也许在纸条上有提到。或是与一个有关联的4个人，在纸条上有提到。”这里赛斯其实非常接近了，因为标的物正面文章写的就是4个女人当选史基摩学院日间部学生会的事。
(Omitted as a possible interpretation of the Mountain, or high peak data, above: Jane noted that on the front of the object one of the girl's names is Patricia McFarland. Jane's thought being that McFarland could be broken into” far land" and the idea of a mountain.(略去上述山或高峰资料的一个可能解读：珍提到在标的物正面，其中一个女孩的名字是派翠西亚·麦克法兰[Patricia McFarland]。珍的想法是McFarland可以拆解成“far land”[远达之地]以及山的概念。
("Connection with July or January I believe; perhaps with 1963." No connections.(“与7月或1月有关联，我相信；也许与19、6、3有关联。”找不到任何关联。
("With a bear. I do not know to what this refers.” Jane pointed out that, as in the case of McFarland, bear could be derived from the name of one of the girls mentioned on the front of the object: Orlyn Barron. She also appears in the photograph.(“与一只熊有关联。我不知道这是指什么。”珍指出，和麦克法兰的案例一样，在标的物正面提到的女孩当中，熊[bear]可以从其中一个的名字衍生出来：Orlyn Barron。她也出现在照片中。
("A name or place beginning with a D." One of the four women elected to the council, and shown in the photo, was Frances Donahue. Jane also thought the several references to Day Student Council might bear on the data.(“D开头的一个名字或地方。”获选入学生会的4个女人之一，如照片所示，是法兰西斯·康纳修[Frances Donahue]。珍也认为几个提到日间[Day]部学生会的地方可能也和这个资料有关。
("Connection with a barrister or lawyer.” The whole of the news story indicated on the back of the object, as shown on page 169 concerns law, statues, the Constitution, overthrow, rights, government, etc., plus the mention of two names: Feinberg, and Aronowitz. Feinberg sponsored a law bearing his name, and possibly is, or was, a New York State legislator. We do not know the profession of Mr. Aronowitz, who is quoted in the article via a lecture delivered about the law. Evidently he is connected to New York State in some official capacity.(“与一个出庭律师或律师有关联。”如前面所示，标的物背面的整个新闻报道关系到法律、雕像、宪法、推翻、权利、政府等等，另外还提到两个名字：芬伯格与亚罗维茨[Aronowitz]。芬伯格提出的一条以他为名的法则，而且可能他现在是或过去曾是纽约州议员。我们不知道亚罗诺维茨先生的职业，在该篇文章中引述了他对这条法则发表的一次演说内容。显然他以某种官方身分与纽约州有连结。
(On the front of the object, the article about the Day Students Council also concerns law and government, connected with Skidmore, etc.(在标的物的正面，有关日间部学生会的文章也涉及法律与政府，与史基摩有关联等等。
("An initial attempt, followed by others.” Jane was a bit dubious here, but said the photo heading up the article on the front of the object pictured the first meeting of the newly-elected Day Students Council; this meeting of course was followed by others.(“一个最初的尝试，接着还有其他的。”这里珍有一点没把握，但她说标的物正面的文章上方那张照片拍的是，新任日间部学生会的第一次会议；这次会议之后当然还有其他的会议。
("A light or wall switch.” See the photo indicated on the object on page 168. A table lamp is visible directly in back of Jane. On the back of the object—page 169—in the lower left comer, see again the ad for Globe electrical fixtures, etc.(“一个灯或墙的开关。”见前面标的物上的照片。可以看见一盏桌灯在珍的正后方。在标的物的背面左下角，再看一次地球电气设备的广告等等。
("An immediate engagement connected with another engagement.” Jane was not sure, unless this data was another reference like the initial attempt, above.(“与另一个参与有关联的一个立即的参与。”珍不确定，除非这个资料再次提到上文最初的尝试那样的关联。
("Mention of a time, perhaps 2 or 12.” No connections as far as time goes on the object. The number 2 is shown in the address of one of the women council, members on the front of the object:” ...daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James W McFarland, 2 Glenbrook Rd..." etc.(“提到一个时间、也许是2或12。”就标的物上面的时间而言，找不到任何关联。在标的物正面，一名女性学生会成员的地址当中有数字2：“詹姆斯·W·麦克法兰夫妇的女儿，格兰布鲁克[Glenbrook]路二号……”等等。
("With civil. or civil rights.” Again see the article on the back of the object, shown on page 169. The whole tone of the news story about the Feinberg law and the Education Law of New York State concerns the protection of civil rights, and protection by the Constitution; but without using the constitution as a hiding place for subversives, etc. We regard this as excellent data.(“与公民，或公民权利有关联。”再一次，见前面标的物背面的文章。那篇关于芬伯格与纽约州教育法的新闻报道，整体调性与公民权利的保护以及宪法提供的保护有关；但是没有利用宪法作为颠覆分子的一个隐匿之处等等。我们认为这是一个绝佳的资料。
("Distant connection with a train.” We are not sure. If train means travel, the article on the front of the object mentions that one of the newly-elected council members, Frances Donahue, has returned to Skidmore after two years practice nursing in New York City.(“与一列火车有遥远关联。”我们不确定。如果火车意味着旅行，那么标的物下面的文章有提到，新任学生会成员法兰西斯·唐纳修在纽约市担任护理师两年之后回到史基摩。
("and also with a serial number.” Again not sure. On the back of the object, in the Globe electrical ad, there are two series of numbers: 449 Broadway, and phone 1505. In the news article above, is a mention of section 3021 of the New York education law.(“而且与一串编号有关联。”再一次不确定。在标的物背面的地球电气广告中，有两串编号：百老汇449，以及电话号码1505。在上述新闻报道中提到纽约州教育法的第3021款。
(1st Question: What color is the object?“ Connection with an orange yellow white. With something inept perhaps. Not formalized. Perhaps poorly done, though I do not believe this impression should be carried precisely that far. More ill-defined perhaps.” Again, we made no connections as far as colors go with the object. However, the rest of this data can refer to the last paragraph of the news story on the back of the object. See page 169. “There was also a dispute over whether or not a secondary school teacher would have the freedom to teach even the concepts of Communism, without being afraid of misinterpretation. This seemed to involve interpretation, and the final answer is left to the people.” Something ill-defined, not formalized, etc., applies here.(第一个问题：标的物的颜色是什么？“与一种橘黄白色有关联。也许与某个无能的东西有关联。没有定型。也许是做得很差，但我不相信这个印象应该被带到刚好那么远。比较定义不清，也许。”再一次，就标的物的颜色而言，找不到任何关联。不过，这个资料的其他部分可能是指标的物背面那篇新闻报道的最后一段。“关于中学老师有没有教授共产主义观念的自由，而不怕错误的诠释一事，也有争议存在。这似乎涉及到诠释的问题，而最终的答案则交由民众决定。”某个定义不清、没有定型的东西适用于这里。
(2nd Question: Can you give us some more on the 7 or 14. day period?“Strongly connected with, or mentioned, on the item.” Again, Jane says this refers to the day concept, in the article on the front of the object, concerning the election of Jane and others to the Skidmore Day Students Council, etc.(第二个问题：你能不能给我们更多7或14天期间的资料？“与物件有强烈的关联，或是在物件上有提到。”再一次，珍说这是指日间的概念，在标的物正面的文章中，与珍和其他人获选为史基摩日间部学生会成员等等有关。
(3rd Question: What’s that lawyer connection1 7 am not sure. “Laws or edicts." As stated earlier, both the news items on the front and back of the object concerns laws, edicts, etc.(第三个问题：那个律师的关联是什么？“我不确定。法律或法令。”如前文所述，标的物正面和背面的新闻与法律、法令等等有关。
(4th Question: “Can you say more about the four people?“Two males and two females, I believe." The four people indicated in the photo—see page 168—are female. Jane speculated that two of the first names mentioned in the article on the front of the object, could be taken as male names by some: Frances, and Orlyn.(第四个问题：你能不能多说一点4个人的事？“两名男性和两名女性，我相信。”照片中的4个人是女性。珍推测标的物正面的文章中提到的名字，有两个可能会被一些人当成是男性的名字：法兰西斯与欧林。
(5 th Question: What’s that about a triangle?“I was after the mountain shape, which seemed to be triangular. A triangle with a feeling of height, or the apex or high point of an episode.” As stated, Jane felt this referred to her election as president of the Day Students Council—the high point of her college tenure as far as honors went. It was, Jane said, a big deal. This election is the subject of the article on the front of the object.(第五个问题：一个三角形是什么？“我在搜寻这个山的形状，它好像是三角形，带着高度感，或一个事件最高潮或最高点的一个三角形。”如上所述，珍觉得这是指她当选日间部学生会主席一事——就荣誉而言，这是她在学院就读期间的最高点。珍说，它是一件大事。这个选举是标的物正面那篇文章的主题。
(6th Question: Do you want to name the object?“It seems like a note, with something else on it—like a note in combination with something else. Pictures or symbols on a note.” This is excellent data and Seth is very close. See pages 168 and 169. The object, as stated, bears many of the characteristics of a note, since it contains news stories. It also bears pictures and/or symbols, on both the front and the back.(第六个问题：你想要说出标的物的名称吗？“它好像是一则记事，上面还有别的东西——就像一则与别的东西组合起来的记事。在一则记事上的图画或符号。”这是一个绝佳的资料，而且赛斯非常接近。见前面标的物。如上所述，标的物具有一则记事的很多特征，因为它包含了新闻报道。在正面和背面，它也有图画和/或符号。
(7th Question: What is that name or place beginning with D?“Ruburt here of course would think of Delmer. I can say no more on the D." As stated on page 174, possibly the D refers to Day Students Council, or the name Donahue; both references on the front of the object.(第七个问题：D开头的那个名字或地方是什么？“这里鲁柏当然会想到德尔默(Delmer)。关于D，我没办法再多说什么。”如前面所述，D可能是指日间部学生会，或唐纳修这个姓氏；两者都出现在标的物的正面。
(8th Question: Can you say anything more about the colored squares?“Purples and yellows—many colors. Orange and red.” As stated, no connections unless Jane refers to my op painting. It contains all of these colors; and no connections with the object as far as we know.(第八个问题“”你能不能说一点彩色正方形的事？“紫色和白色——很多颜色。橘色和红色。”如上所述，没有任何关联，除非是珍所说的，我的欧普画作。它包含了以上这些颜色；就我们所知，它与标的物毫无关联。
(9th Question: What are they?“On a larger object." Yes, but ????(第九个问题：它们是什么？“在一个更大的物体上。”没错，但是????
(10th Question: “What's the shape of the object?” I believe rectangular." Here I meant the shape of the envelope object; Seth could have referred to the larger object containing the colored squares, however, because I did not make any distinction. As it happens, both the object and the op painting which contains the small colored squares are rectangular.(第十个问题：物体的形状是什么？“我相信是长方形。”这里我说的是信封标的物的形状；但是，赛斯指的可能是包含彩色正方形的更大物体，因为我没有做任何区分。碰巧，包含了彩色小正方形的标的物和欧普画都是长方形。
(11th Question: “Can you say anything about the two females?” An apparent misdeed, connected with one or them. Younger rather than older.” This can be a reference to Jane herself She appears in the photo on the front of the envelope object, and the news story thereon concerns her election as president of the Skidmore College Day Students Council. See page 168.(第十一个问题：你能不能说一点两名女性的事？“一个明显的不当行为，与其中一个有关联。比较年轻的，而不是比较年长的。”这可能是指珍本人。它出现在信封标的物正面的照片，而且上面的新闻报道与她当选史基摩学院日间部学生会主席有关。见前面所示。
(Jane was elected to this post in her junior year at Skidmore. She was expelled from college at the end of her junior year, through being blamed for something of which she was innocent. Thus the words 'apparent misdeed" in the above data are important. She was in her early twenties at the time of course.缺
(12th Question: “Any initials?” B or C." Again I put the question poorly since I was thinking of the initials of one of the two females. The actual phrasing of the question allowed too much latitude. Even so, there is no personal name on the object, front or back, with a C, initial. There is a B, for Orlyn Barron.(第十二个问题：有没有任何姓名缩写？“B或C。”再一次，我没有把问题讲清楚，因为我在想的是两名女性之一的姓名缩写。这个问题的实际措辞方式有太多想像的空间。即便如此，标的物的正面或背面都没有任何个人的姓名有C这个首字母。有一个B，欧林·贝隆的姓氏Barron。
(End.)(结束。)

SESSION 303 第303节 临时课


ELMIRA, NEW YORK NOVEMBER 26, 19661966年11月26日 纽约州埃尔迈拉
(Unscheduled—Jane and I and the Bernards—Saturday. Typed by Sarah Bernard from her notes.(临时课——珍、我还有伯纳德夫妇——星期六。依据莎拉·伯纳德的笔记打字成文。
(Began about 8:30 PM, though by 12 Midnight. Short breaks. Seth voice good at times. Pace fast—sometimes Sarah left behind. She used speed writing.(大约晚上8:30开始，但是到午夜12点结束。短暂的停顿。赛斯的声音有时候很好。速度快——莎拉偶尔跟不上。她使用速记。
(General conversation among the four of us, touching on [Meher] Baba.)(我们4个人之间的一般对话，与梅赫·巴巴[Meher Baba]有关。)
Now good evening. You can hardly be in the middle because there is no beginning or end. I am pleased to meet you both. He(referring to Baba) is not who he says he is; nevertheless he speaks the truth. He is a part of who he says he is, as indeed I am. When you read our material, there will be one issue in particular on which you will not agree. You will later agree. I am coming in softly, you see. I am coming in very quietly indeed, so that I do not startle or frighten Ruburt. He is very easily startled.现在，晚安。你们几乎不可能在中间，因为没有开始也没有结束。我很高兴见到你们两位。他(指巴巴)不是他说他是的那个他；虽然如此，他说的是事实。他是他说他是的那个他的一部分，正如我实际上是我说我是的那个我的一部分。当你阅读我们的资料时，将有一个你会意见相左的特定议题。你以后会同意。我轻手轻脚地进来，你看。我其实是非常安静地进来，这样才不会吓到鲁柏或让他害怕。他很容易受到惊吓。
Give me a moment on your seminar. We are not precisely in the same class, you see. There is nothing there in your seminar that is not here now and that is not wherever you are. This does not mean that that which is, is readily accessible. It is there for the taking, but you must learn how to take it; for if you try to take it, you lose it, you see.给我一点时间处理你的研讨会。我们没有正好在同一班，你知道。在你们的研讨会那里，没有任何此时不在这里的东西，也没有任何不在你们所在之处的东西，不管你们在哪里。这并不是说那所是(that which is)唾手可得。它在那里等你们来拿走，但你们必须学会怎么拿走它；因为，如果你们试着拿走它，就会失去它，你看。
I am speaking now for your convenience simply. There are four cornerstone personalities involved in your seminar. Now three of these personalities are yours: one is not yours. One is not“yours" in your terms as of this time. When you look up and recognize, you will accept that which you do not now recognize as yourself, as yourself. If you looked up now, you would not recognize the self that you will recognize. Because the Spacious present exists as it is, the recognition has already been made. You have not yet caught up with it, you see. You are slowpokes. My friend Ruburt in many respects is also a slowpoke. The environment is not where you think it is. I refer to these seminars. The voice that does not“speak" in your terms is yours, but the instructor is not yourself as you know yourself. It is a self you do not as yet know in your terms.我现在这样讲只是为了你们的方便而已。有四个基石(cornerstone)人格参与了你们的研讨会。现在这些人格的其中三是你的：一个不是你的。按照你们的说法，一个这一次不是“你的”。当你去找而认出时，你就会接受，你现在认不出是你自己的那个自己，是你自己。如果你现在去找，你会认不出你将会认出的自己。因为广阔的现在已经存在，认出这件事已经完成了。你还没有跟上它，你知道。你们是慢郎中。我的朋友鲁柏也是个慢郎中。环境不是在你以为它在的地方。我指的是这些研讨会。按照你们的说法，不“讲话”的声音是你的，但讲师不是你认识的自己。按照你们的说法，它是你还不认识的一个自己。
Now I speak from several layers, though the word” speak" is a poor one, I turn myself, you see, into steps down which I walk and the steps represent what you would term personality fragments, though the term is distortive. I speak on a level that you can all understand. I have been to your seminar—not your seminar—but ones much like them in what you would term the past. I attend my own and I give my own. I am broken up into highly energized personality fragments of my own accord, you see. The breaking up itself is an illusion. Those who wish to learn will be found by others like me—individualized and equipped because of their own internal structures to communicate and to receive communications from them. You must have your own circuit through.现在我是从几个层面来讲，但是“讲”这个字并不贴切。我把自己变成，你看，我沿着走的台阶，而台阶代表你们所谓的人格片段体，但是这个用词是扭曲的。我在你们全都能够了解的一个层面上讲话。我去过你们的研讨会——不是你们的研讨会——而是在你们所谓的过去，与它们很像的一些研讨会。我参加我自己的研讨会，也举办我自己的研讨会。我自己决定分解成能量充沛的人格片段体，你知道。分解本身是一个幻相。其他像我这样的人——个体化而且因为他们自身内在结构而具备沟通能力，也有能力接收他们传来的讯息——将会找到那些想要学习的人。你必须接通你自己的回路。
Now I will not be any old fogy this evening. I would prefer some lively conversation and I am indeed open to any questions that you might have.现在，我今天晚上不要当什么老古板。我比较想要畅快交谈一番，而且我真的欢迎你们有问题就问。
([Gene]:“Seth, can you tell me more about who is running the seminar?")(吉恩[Gene]：“赛斯，关于举办这场研讨会的人，你能不能跟我多说一点？”)
It is extremely difficult to pinpoint an answer. For you the seminars are run by a self belonging to you that you do not yet know or recognize. For others the seminars are run by selves they do not yet recognize and yet the seminar is run by one and not many.要说出一个精确的答案，是极为困难的。对你来说，研讨会是由一个属于你但你还不知道或不认得的自己举办的。对其他人来说，研讨会是由他们还没认出的自己举办的，不过，研讨会是由一个，而不是由很多个自己举办的。
([Gene]: ’'And would it not be true to say that we are all running the same seminar for ourselves since we are all one?")(吉恩：“既然我们是一体的，要是说我们全都为自己举办同一个研讨会，难道不是事实吗？”)
It would, as long as you realized that the self you are as you know yourself now does not run the seminar. I speak in terms of your time.是，只要你明白举办研讨会的不是你现在认识的这个你所是的自己。我是从你们的时间角度来说。
([Gene]:“Is it possible for one to be aware of the larger self ，the universal self that exists apart from what I here and now call time?")(吉恩：“一个人有没有可能觉知更大的自己、宇宙的自己，存在我此时此地所谓时间之外的那个自己？”)
It is indeed.的确有可能。
([Gene]:“Can we teach ourselves to be guided by that larger self?)(吉恩：“我们能不能教会自己接受更大的自己指引？”)
You are already.你们已经是了。
([Gene]:“Among all of us is the same self in this larger sense ?” )(吉恩：“从这个更大的角度来看，我们全都是同一个自己吗？”)
It is indeed. The separation process is illusion; nevertheless in this way a depth perception is achieved. You are all one self, but you are all individuals and no individuality is lost. There is no merging. There is no need for merging, since what you are already is a part of all else.确实是。分离的过程是幻相；虽然如此，深度感知却也透过这个方式实现。你们全都是一个自己，但你们也都是个体，没有失去任何个体性。没有任何融合。没有任何融合的必要，因为你所是已经是其他一切的一部分。
([Gene]:“Then is it right to respond to this man Baba in the following way—you and I are one and the only thing which keeps us apart is my not knowing that we are one?")(吉恩：“那么，用以下的方式回应巴巴这个人对不对？——你和我是一体的，分离我们的只有一件事，就是我不知道我们是一体的。”)
He as he is now would not agree.他身为现在的他是不会同意的。
([Gene]:“But as he really is, would he not agree?")(吉恩：“但是作为真正的他，他会不会同意？”)
He is who he says he is and yet he is not. There is a deception. One might call it an honest deception there.他是他说他是的那个他，但他不是。其中有欺骗。可以说它是诚实的欺骗。
([Gene]:“Is that deception a version of what many people call good-naturedly the dance of Shiva?")(吉恩：“那种欺骗是不是很多人宅心仁厚地称之为湿婆[Shiva,译注：印度教三世神之一，既代表灭生，同时也是重生的力量]之舞的一个版本？”)
Not precisely. The deception of which I speak involves a distortion and emphasis applied too strongly—and a tragic one.不完全是。我说的欺骗牵涉到一个扭曲以及太过用力的强调——而且是一个不幸的扭曲。
([Gene]:“How so?")(吉恩：“何以见得？”)
He who knows who and what he is need not say so.知道他是谁和他是什么的他不需要这么说。
([Gene]:“Unless it is his intent to teach.” )(吉恩：“除非他的意图是教学。”)
Saying so in those terms will not help teaching. Example—yes; existence —yes. You need not say who you are, when you know who you are; and if you say who you are, you do not know who you are. Beware who speaks in those terms. There may be distortion.用那些字眼这么说，对教学是不会有帮助的。榜样——是的；存在——是的。当你知道你是谁的时候，你不需要说你是谁；如果你说你是谁，那你并不知道你是谁。留意用那些字眼说话的人。可能会有扭曲。
(Too fast to follow.) It is dangerous to have highly distorted truth. If you know who you are, you do not need these words.(讲太快，跟不上)高度扭曲事实是危险的。如果你知道你是谁，你就不需要说这些话。
You are all pieces, you see, of the whole; but you are not all the same pieces of the whole, but rather individualized pieces of the whole.
