You do not all fit together like a crossword puzzle that any idiot can put together. You are still highly individualized portions of the whole. You are the whole, but you are all highly unique. You fit into different portions of the whole. The self or structure or personality travels outward and inward and (if you will forgive me) in all directions. It is action. It constantly changes. Each self as you know it has its own abilities and inclinations and sympathies. It has its own particular place within the Pyramid Gestalt. It can contact that whole self which in your terms does not yet exist, but which is of course always present. In your search you must contact that whole portion of yourself toward which you are growing—toward which I hope you are growing. This is your individual circuit, so to speak. All ways are one way, but your way is your own way. And you can travel no other. He is—Baba—highly advanced indeed. He is a way, however; he is not the end. He is not completed. He is right, but he is wrong in taking pleasure in his rightness. (I have never been known for my own Humilitye. It ill-behooves me to speak.) Nevertheless he who is and knows that he is, is. He has no need for words and he has no need to proclaim himself, for he speaks without the necessity for words and he is heard. Those who are really heard have no need for words. I speak to you now in words because without words now, there would not be the necessary understanding that must be reached before I can become wordless.你们全都是，你看，整体的片段；但你们并非全部都是整体的相同片段，而是整体的个体化片段。你们不是像一个连傻瓜都会组合的填字游戏那样全部刚好组合在一起。你们依然全部都是整体的个体化片段。你们就是整体，但你们全部都非常独特。你们刚好嵌入整体的不同部分之内。自己，或说结构或人格，向外也向内，而且也(请恕我直言)向四面八方旅行。它就是行动。它持续不断改变。每一个自己，如你所知，都有它自己的能力以及倾向和理解(sympathy)。它在金字塔完形(Pyramid Gestalt)之内有它自己特定的位置。它能够联系全我，在你们看来，全我尚未存在，但其实当然一直都存在。在你的追寻当中，你必须联系你自己正在长成它——我希望你正在长成它——的那个整体部分。可以说，这是你个人特有的回路。所有的路都是一条路，但你的路是你自己的路。你没办法走别条路。他——巴巴——确实是非常先进。不过，他是一条路；他不是终点。他不是已完成的。他是对的，但他以他的对(rightness)为乐却是错的。(我从来不是以我自己的仁慈闻名)虽然如此，他是而且知道他是谁的他，就是他。他不需要言语，他也不需要自吹自擂，因为不需要言语就说出来了，而且他也被听见了。那些真的听见的人不需要言语。我现在用言语跟你说，是因为在我能够变成一切尽在不言中之前，一定要用必不可少的了解，现在不用言语，那是无法达成的。
([Gene]:“What, pray tell, is rightness other than pleasure in the sensein which you used the term?")(吉恩：“请告诉我，除了按照你用乐[pleasure]这个字所指的意思以外，什么是对[rightness]?”)
Rightness is indeed pleasure, yes. All pleasure—all true pleasure—is indeed right. However, pleasure in the terms of which I spoke referred, unfortunately, to a smug and rather unpleasant satisfaction at having attained a certain position. The position has been attained, but beneath it all the attitude denies it and prevents its fruition. Far be it from me to shatter idols.对确实是乐，没错。所有的乐趣——所有真实的乐趣——确实都是对的。然而，按照我所说的意思，很遗憾乐趣指的是，在得到某个位置时沾沾自喜而且令人不愉快的一种满足。位置已经得到了，但是在它之下，所有的态度都否定它，并且阻碍它开花结果。我绝对不是要打倒偶像。
([Gene]:“There are no idols to shatter.” )(吉恩：“没有任何要打倒的偶像。”)
You should give your own sessions.你应该自己开课。
([Gene]:“I do. May we pursue that point a bit? We would like to create a sort of school—a very simple kind of school—to help anyone who seeks for it, without presuming that we have any answers, but going on the assumption that the way which has been proclaimed by many men is a good way namely the simple way of love. I presume that you know about the idea that we have for creating such circuits. Will they work? If not, what are their major shortcomings? What would you recommend?")(吉恩：“我有。我们可以稍微探讨一下这一点吗？我想要创造某种学校——非常简单的一种学校——来帮助任何追寻它的人，不自以为我们有任何答案可言，而是按照一条很多人宣称很好的路——讲白了就是简单的爱的道路——这个假设来进行。我想你知道我们想要创造这类回路的概念。它们行得通吗？如果行不通，它们主要的缺点是什么？你会推荐什么？”)
You are talking about your utopia?你在说你的乌托邦吗？
([Gene]:“I would prefer not to call it a utopia.” )(吉恩：“我比较不想要说它是乌托邦。”)
There is much involved. Your proposals may be achieved without your realizing that they have been achieved.牵涉到的东西很多。你的提案可能会在你没发觉它们已经实现的情况下实现。
([Gene]:“That is very astute.")(吉恩：“这样说很狡猾喔。”)
You will judge what you see and you will not perhaps see enough. If you perceive results using the inner senses, you will perhaps gain better knowledge of progress. Give us a moment again, please.你会批判你看到的东西，而且你看到的东西也许不够多。如果你用内在感官感知结果，你对进展也许就会有更清楚的认识。请再给我们一点时间。
These are impressions: two people in particular. (Am not sure here.) One older than the others—perhaps (now, perhaps) 48—some difficulty and misunderstandings connected with him. A” D" and an” H". The project can succeed if purity of intent is retained. There is someone I believe approximately 23 years old who would be dropped.这些是印象：特定的两个人。(这里我不确定)其中一个比另一个老——或许(现在，或许)48岁——某些困难和误解与他有关联。一个“D”与一个“H”。计划可能会成功。如果意图能够保持纯正的话。有一个我相信大约23的人会被开除。
([Gene]:“Why?")(吉恩：“为什么？”)
The person will cause strong difficulties through overenthusiastic reactions and through some connections on which I am not clear with the person's parent—1 believe a mother.由于过度热衷的反应，以及与这个人的父母——我相信是母亲——有关但我不清楚的某些连结，这个人会造成很大的困难。
([Gene]:“Is this person male or female?")(吉恩：“这个人是男性还是女性？”)
We will try on this shortly. I pick up strong tendencies in each area and cannot at this moment specify. A legal process, connected with this individual—perhaps now.我们很快会设法查明这件事。我接收到每一个区域的强烈倾向，所以在这一刻无法具体说明。一个法律程序，与这个人有关联——也许是现在。
([Gene]:“To come?")(吉恩：“将来吗？”)
To come if he is(he—a male) if he is connected with the project. These are impressions connected with the individual. You will have to piece them together. The color brown. Now this could be an impression arising from his name or from the color of his hair. Some connection with Miss—perhaps your state of Mississippi. This is all I can get through here now.将来，如果他与这个计划有关的话。这些是与这个人有关的印象。你必须把它们拼凑起来。褐色。现在这可能是从他的名字或从他的发色产生的一个印象。与Miss——或许是你那一州，Mississippi(密西西比)——有关联。此时在这里我能够接收到就是这些。
([Gene]:“Would it be a fair guess that it would be a garbled pronunciation of the last name?”)(吉恩：“如果说它是搞混的姓氏发音，这个猜测合不合理？”)
Ruburt blocks me here ever so gently. You will have to go with what I have given you here now. I will give you a short rest and we can continue, if you so desire.这里鲁柏非常小心地挡住我。你只得将就此时在这里我已经给你的资料，不然也没办法。我让你短暂休息一下，如果你想要的话，我们可以继续。
([Gene]:“I'd like to.” )(吉恩：“我想要。”)
I find it a most enjoyable encounter.我觉得这是一次非常愉快的邂逅。
([Gene]:“Still here?")(吉恩：“还在这里吗？”)
I am indeed.我确实在。
([Gene]:“Could we discuss some broader issues about the project? The truth is simple, is it not? Is it necessary to make it complicated? Do we really have to play complicated games, and if so, why?")(吉恩：“有关这个计划，我们能不能讨论一些比较广泛的议题？事实很简单，不是吗？有必要把它弄得很复杂吗？我们真的一定要玩复杂的游戏吗？如果是的话，为什么？”)
You do not have to play complicated games. There will be those who will expect them and you will feel their pressure.你们不必玩复杂的游戏。那些预期它们的人是会有的，而你会感觉到他们的压力。
(All of the Seth data verified by Gene Bernard at work, Smith—Miss, etc. Smith, a 23. year-old, feminine characteristics, dominating mother. Smith has brown hair, is overenthusiastic, according to Gene he could very well cause trouble, and if so the trouble would be legal. Gene didn't say what type of legal trouble, that I recall. Gene surprised and pleased, as Jane was, at this data.(赛斯给的资料全部都由吉恩·伯纳德在工作时确认过了，Smith[史密斯]——Miss等等。史密斯，23岁、具有女性特质、有个强势的母亲。史密斯有褐色的头发、过度热衷，据吉恩说，他很有可能惹麻烦，而且果真如此的话，惹出的可能是法律方面的麻烦。我记得，吉恩没有说是什么类型的法律问题。和珍一样，这个资料让吉恩既惊讶又高兴。
(Interlude—discussion among the four of us. Seth breaks in.)(中场休息——我们4个人在讨论。赛斯闯入。)
It is enough to be. It is enough to be.存在(to be)就够了。存在就够了。
([Gene]:“Enough for you or me?")(吉恩：“对你或对我来说够了？”)
And others. To be speaks louder than words.还有其他人。存在说得比言语更大声。
([Gene]:“To those who can hear.” )(吉恩：“对那些听得见的人来说。”)
They hear without ears and they know directly when they are in contact with he who knows who he is. To be communicates instantaneously and directly and is instantly translated into truths that the inner self can understand. The communication speaks to the whole system of the self.他们不用耳朵听，当他们与知道自己是谁的他接触时，他们直接知道。存在立即直接沟通，而且马上被翻译成内我能够了解的事实。这种沟通是对着自己的整个系统说话。
([Gene]:“Doesn't this presume that the hearer is accustomed to listening to the inner voice?")(吉恩：“这不就是假设听见的人习惯倾听内在声音吗？”)
The inner voice does not need to be listened to. It is instantly translated into action and experience. It is known directly.内在声音不需要被倾听。它立刻被翻译成行动和经验。它直接被知道。
([Gene]:“—Unless I misunderstand you, is this to say that you do not need to be trained to recognize the inner voice?")(吉恩：“除非我误解你，这是说你不需要经过训练就能够认出内在声音吗？”)
You know that you know. You do not have to listen to know that you know. This telling is not necessary. You know instantly without having to listen. The process is eliminated.你知道你知道。你不必倾听就知道你知道。这种叙述是不必要的。你立刻就知道，不必倾听。这个过程被消除了。
([Gene]: Suppose someone has yet to learn who they are? I am afraid we are quibbling over teaching techniques. Let me put a question bluntly. What would you do in my shoes?")(吉恩：“想必有人还得认识他们是谁？恐怕我们是在对教学技巧进行诡辩。让我坦率提出一个问题。换做你是我的话，你会做什么？”)
About your project? You must continue with it.关于你的计划？你一定要继续做下去。
([Gene]:“As a teacher, what advice would you give on pedagogical techniques?")(吉恩：“身为一个老师，对于教学技巧，你会给出什么建议？”)
You must use the methods that you have begun, for you must find that they are useless. You must discover this for yourself.你必须运用你已经开始的方法，因为你一定要发现它们没有用。你非得自己发觉这件事不可。
([Gene]:“And what will I know then besides that?(吉恩：“那么，除此之外，我还会知道什么？”)
You will know that methods make no difference. To you they must make a difference now. The attempt to use them is important. Those yet to come will understand, despite the method.你会知道方法没有任何影响。对你来说，它们现在必须要有影响。尝试运用它们是重要的。那些即将到来的人会了解的，不管方法是什么。
([Gene]:“I wish I had your confidence.")(吉恩：“我希望我有你这种信心。”)
You are not in my position.你不是在我的位置上。
([Gene]:“I'm more than willing to take your word for it.")(吉恩：“我非常愿意相信你说的话。”)
You must try these patterns out, because you think you must.你一定要试用这些模式，因为你认为你非试不可。
(Too fast to follow—something perhaps about sensory awareness .(速度太快，跟不上——或许是说感官觉知之类的。)
([Gene]:“Very interesting. Is that the kind of comment which I could hear Tim Leary making?")(吉恩：“很有趣。这是我会听到提姆·李瑞[Tim Leary，译注：全名为Timothy Lrary，有人说他是迷幻史上最传奇的人物。他曾是哈佛大学的心理学教授，因宣扬迷幻药对精神成长与治疗，在1960年到70年备受争议，同时也是当时许多年轻人的嬉皮教主]发表的那种看法吗？”)
With reservations. On my part, not his. He leaps like a jackrabbit.有所保留。是我这边，不是他。他像一只野兔跳来跳去。
([Gene]:“I agree.")(吉恩：“我同意。”)
There is a certain protection(?) in his method. He doesn't understand the chasms over which he so blithely flies. Therefore he does not fear (?) them and his wings are not strong wings.在他的方法当中有某种程度的保护。他不了解他在浑然不知的状况下飞越过去的深渊。因此他不怕(?)它们，而他的翅膀不是强壮的翅膀。
([Gene]:“Would you agree with the following? As Krishna says to Arjuna: There is no place to go; you’re already there. There are no chasms -only a crack which is trivial. There is nothing to do. It is already done.")(吉恩：“你会同意以下的说法吗？就像奎师那[Krishna，译注：梵文的意思是黑天，是印度教三大神之一毗湿奴的第八个化身，很多教派认为祂是最高的神，黑天在《摩诃婆罗多》中向阿周那讲述的《薄伽梵歌》是印度教的最高经典之一]对阿周那[Arjuna]说：没有任何地方要去；你已经在那里了。没有任何深渊——只有一个微不足道的裂缝而已。没有任何事情要做。事情已经做完了”)
Where do you find a contradiction?你在哪里找到矛盾之处？
([Gene]:“I don’t. But I don't understand how the chasm over which Tim Leary is so blithely flying can be anything other than a figment of my imagination.")(吉恩：“我没有。但是我不了解提姆·李瑞如此浑然不觉就飞跃而过的深渊，除了是一个我想像的虚构之物以外，怎么可能是任何东西。”)
Indeed you form the patterns in the senseuniverse, but when you have formed them, you must know them not only as your own creations. You must know their nature for the physical chasm represents a mental chasm within the self.的确，你在感官宇宙形成模式，但是当你形成它们时，你应该知道它们不只是你自己的创造物。你应该知道它们的本质，因为实质的深渊代表自己之内的一个心智深渊。
([Gene]:“And all that, in spite of which you’re already home?")(吉恩：“那么，不管你已经回家了也是这样吗？”)
You are indeed. The self who teaches the seminar already exists.你的确是。教专题讨论的自己已经存在了。
([Gene]:“Kind of a colossal and lovely joke, isn't it?")(吉恩：“有一点像一个妙不可言的笑话，不是吗？”)
Ruburt saw my viewpoint here. It is indeed no joke. It is a means for the whole to know itself. But in knowing itself, more of itself is constantly created. You follow me here, Joseph. The“moment presents" are constantly created by you and then probed and yet they have existed and will exist. You make the divisions. You are part of the whole, but you constantly enlarge the experiences of the whole. It is not done and finished in the terms of which you think.这里鲁柏看到我的观点。它一点都不是笑话。它是整体认识它自己的一个手段。但在认识它自己时，有更多的它自己持续不断被创造出来。这里你听懂我的意思，约瑟。你持续不断创造“当下的片刻”，然后探索，可是它们已经存在了，而且也将会存在。你做了区分。你是整体的一部分，但你持续不断放大整体的经验。你认为它尚未完成。
([Gene]:“Enlighten me. I don't understand.” )(吉恩：“开导我一下。我不懂。”)
It will take a while. To begin with in your terms: What is, is not static. Therefore it cannot in those terms be considered complete and done with.这要花点时间。先用你们的话开始说起：当下存在的，并不是静止的。因此在那些用语当中，无法把它想成完整无缺并且已经完成。
([Gene]:“But always becoming?")(吉恩：“而是一直在变为中。”)
But always in a state of becoming. However in the Spacious present , All That Is does exist. The becoming can never be completed and yet wherever you choose to draw a line, you will think of it as an end.而是一直在一种变为的状态中。然而在广阔的现在，一切万有确实存在。变为永远都不会完成，但是无论你选择在哪里画一条线，你都会把它想成是一个终点。
([Gene]:“The earlier seminars were on the theme of co-creation and an image of a vessel kept reappearing. The idea of the seminar was essentially that the act of co-creating was to provide a vessel out through which something could be continually becoming. What was it, do you think, that flowed through this vessel? What is the way? This is the thing I’m looking for.” )(吉恩：“更早以前的研讨会研究的主题是共同创造，一个容器的意象一直重复出现。这场专题讨论的概念基本上是为共同创造的行为提供一个容器，某个东西可以从中持续不断变为。你认为，从这个容器流出来的是什么？这就是我在寻找的东西。”)
You already possess it, of course.你已经拥有它了，当然。
([Gene]:“What would you call it?")(吉恩：“你会怎么称呼它？”)
To give it a name is unfortunate. We have not used a name in our sessions.给它一个名称并不恰当。在我们的课当中，我们没有用过名称
I would call it IGNAPTHA, which is a poor approximation of the term I am trying to express. In your terms perhaps the whole self constantly expressing itself and that which is knowing itself in all its possibilities.。我会称它是伊格纳帕(IGNAPTHA)，这个字眼离我想要表达的意思还很远。按照你们的说法也许是，全我持续不断表达它自己，以及在它所有的可能性当中认识它自己。
([Gene]:“Is this not also an Emotional expression?")(吉恩：“这不也是一种情感的表达吗？”)
You must indeed read our early sessions. You recall the basis of those sessions, Joseph.你真的应该读一读我们的早期课。你记得那些课的基础吧，约瑟。
([Gene]:“What Emotion should I call this?")(吉恩：“我应该怎么称呼这种情感？”)
You should indeed call it love.你真的应该称之为爱。
([Gene]:“And the thing to which you referred—IGNAPTHA—is that what I should understand Baba to mean by the word” love"?")(吉恩：“还有你提到的这个东西——伊格纳帕——就是我对巴巴用“爱”这个字的意思应该要用的了解吗？”)
This is what he would have you believe he refers to. Indeed. And if I have ever given a double-tongued answer, I have given it now. For I know him, you see.他要你相信他说的就是这个意思。没错。如果我曾经给过口是心非的答案，那现在我给的这个就是了。因为我认识他，你知道。
([Gene]:“Aren’t we making the simple very difficult?")(吉恩：“我们是不是把简单弄得很复杂？”)
I have merely answered the questions as you gave them.我只不过是回答你提出的问题而已。
([Gene]:“Touche.” )(吉恩：“说得对。”)
I have been answering your questions in the spirit in which you asked them.我是本着你发问的精神在回答你的问题。
([Gene]:“May I try one more now?")(吉恩：“我现以可以再试问一个吗？”)
You may indeed.你当然可以。
([Gene]:“Yes. You've been giving me difficult answers to difficult questions. Now let's try the most difficult. I would like to state a proposition and get your response to it. We have been chasing a point—you and I—and it is my feeling that at the level at which we have been chasing it, it is not possible for me to really understand the point and moreover that at the level at which I should like to understand the point, there is indeed nothing to discuss. Does this make any sense?")(吉恩：“现在。你针对困难的问题给了我困难的答案。现在让我来试试最困难的。我想要陈述一个主张，看看你的回应是什么。我们一直在追究一个重点——你和我——而我的感觉是，在我们一直追究它的层面上，要真正了解这个重点对我来说是不可能的，此外在我不想要却应该要了解这个重点的层面上，其实根本没有什么好讨论的。这样说可以理解吗？”)
There never was anything to be said. You have been asking questions from an inadequate level.从来就没有什么要说的。你是从一个无法胜任的层面在发问。
([Gene]:“Right. Okay. I agree. Fine.” )(吉恩：“没错。好的。我同意。没问题。”)
You have not been taking full advantage of your opportunities with me. You have been speaking to me in words only and I have responded as best I can.你没有充分利用你跟我在一起的机会。你一直只用言语在对我讲话，而我已经尽我所能回应你。
(Sarah asked if we could receive nonverbal communication from him and Seth said he'd try. The three of us felt some simultaneous sense of expanded awareness .(莎拉问说我们能不能接收到他传来的非口语通讯，赛斯说他会试试看。我们三个人同时体验到某种觉知扩展的感觉。
(Interlude.)(中场休息。)
GENE ASKS ABOUT PAST LIVES克恩问前世
I have given much material concerning past lives.我已经给了很多相关前世的资料。
([Gene]:“Could you tell us something about ours?")(吉恩：“你能不能告诉我们一些与我们有关的事？”)
He(to Gene) Fifteenth century—both France and Italy—a brief journey to Spain—the name however would seem to be Italian. Grabalani or Gribliani or Gribiliani—1423-1473. Makes of items from hides—cutting from hides. Trip to England. Final settlement in France. Difficulties with the left ear. Trouble with this finger(4th on left hand). Player of an instrument like a bugle. Otherwise difficulties with communication. Difficulties with the male parent; some reflection of this in this existence. A blonde sister—D A R. For now let that rest. Family from Florence. Bakers. A list on a gate toward the left. Strong inclination toward exaggeration. A family name connected with St. Anne. A brother who is a soldier. One a priest. A sister named Philipina. Death at the age of 38 from a farm animal. A life in the I 3th century. Very close. None alter the existence just spoken of until 18th century a rural area—Spain. Previous sister is now his mother. An awakening of psychic ability and enlarging. Misuse of these abilities. I am not sure here now. We will see. A rural town perhaps 49th parallel. A stone monastery. A brother who is unsure as to his sex. Asks our friend for help. An invasion from another country. Our friend leaves the monastery without leave. There is a trip to Africa. An accident—trouble in the right shoulder. And the setting up in Africa of some establishment much like the one now planned. Let us pursue this. For there were records left. I used the word“utopia" earlier and this was meant to be a utopia. The land was not jungle, a barren area, a dry river, members recruited from an army. Now some brief reference to this in a book. This may not be the precise title: Stolen Lands or Islands, published or distributed or whatever by Mission House, Ltd. Subtitle: A Recording of Utopias and their (perhaps) Results. Book published in England. The group composed of renegade army deserters or dropouts. Too ambitious a project. 73 in all. The whole band entirely wiped out by local tribes. (Incidentally we are much more in contact now. However, I suggest a rest in pure sympathy for our note taker.)他(指吉恩)15世纪——在法国以及意大利——去西班牙短暂旅行过——不过名字好像是意大利文。葛拉巴拉尼(Grabalani)或葛瑞伯里安尼(Gribilani)或葛瑞比里安尼(Gribiliani)——1423至1473年间。用兽皮制作物件——从兽皮切割下来。去英格兰旅行。最后定居在法国。左耳有问题。这根手指有毛病(左手第四根)。会弹奏一种像号角的乐器——除此之外，沟通有困难。与父亲之间有问题；这有一些反映在这一世。一个金发的姊妹——DAR。目前那件事暂且说到这里为止。来自佛罗伦斯(Florence)的家族。烘焙师。在朝向左边的一个大门上有一份清单。有强烈的夸大倾向。与圣安娜(Saint Anne)有关联的一个家族姓氏。一个兄弟是军人。一个是神职人员。一个姊妹名叫菲莉品娜(Philipina)。因为一只农场动物而在38岁那年死亡。在13世纪的一世。非常接近。在刚刚讲的那一次存在之后没有任何前世，一直到18世纪——一个农村地区——西班牙。前世的姊妹现在是他的母亲。心灵能力的觉醒与扩大。这些能力的误用。现在这里我不确定。之后我们再看看。也许是北绕49度的一个农村小镇。一间石头盖的修道院。一个不确定自己性别的兄弟。请我们的朋友帮忙。另一个国家的一次侵略。我们的朋友没有请假就离开修道院。有一趟前往非洲的旅程。一个意外——右肩有问题。在非洲设立某个机构，与现在计划中的这一个很像。让我们继续探究这件事。因为有记录留下来。我之前用了“乌托邦”这个字眼，这本来的用意就是一个乌托邦。这块地不是丛林，一个贫瘠的地区，一条干涸的溪流，从军队招募的成员。现在，在一本书上简短提到这件事。这可能不是正确的书名：被偷走的土地或岛屿，由传教书屋(Mission House)出版或发行之类的。副书名：乌托邦及其(也许)结果的记录。书在英格兰出版。这个团体是由叛变的军队逃兵或中途辍役者组成的。一个野心太大的计划。总共73人。这一整群全部被当地部落消灭。(附带一提，我们现在的联系多了很多。不过，我建议休息一下，单纯只是因为同情帮我们写笔记的人。)
(Interlude—discussion.)(中场休息，讨论。)
Two points. The joke is highly relevant. If you realized thoroughly that your physical world was an illusion, you would not be experiencing Sense data.两个重点。这个笑话是很有意义的。如果你彻底了悟你的物质世界是一个幻相，你就不会体验到感官资料。
([Gene]:“Can't I experience an illusion that I create for myself")(吉恩：“我不能体验我为自己创造的幻相吗？”)
You can experience the illusion, but when you experience the illusion as an illusion, you no longer experience it. You are running ahead of yourself.你可以体验幻相，但当你把幻相不再当成幻相来体验时，你就不会再体验它了。你跑到自己前面了。
([Gene]:“But there's nowhere to go.” )(吉恩：“但是没有任何地方可去。”)
You do not know. You think it. You will not be where you are.你不知道。你以为没有。你将不会在你现在的所在之处。
([Gene]:“Is there anywhere else to be?")(吉恩：“还有别的地方可去吗？”)
No and yes.没有而且有。
([Gene]:“Is there anywhere else to be that is not illusion?")(吉恩：“还有别的地方不是幻相吗？”)
I say this to you and I tell you, yes.我这样跟你说而且我告诉你，有。
([Gene]:“How would I know the difference? Is there any way to distinguish between illusion and reality other than by a creation of my own mind?")(吉恩：“我怎么知道差别是什么？有没有办法可以分辨幻相和实相，而不只是根据我自己心智的创造？”)
You do not know it now. When that point is reached, you will be able, if you prefer, to experience any“Reality-illusion" at your will, but the self who experiences these“reality-illusions" will know itself as reality. There is no place for it to go, because it is the only reality and will create its own environment.你现在不知道。当那一刻来到时，如果你想要的话，你就能够随心所欲体验任何“实相-幻相”，但是体验这些“实相-幻相”的自己将会知道它本身就是实相。没有它将要去的地方，因为它是唯一的实相而且将会创造它自己的环境。
([Gene]:“But that is a discussion of the me here and now.” )(吉恩：“但这是在讨论此时此地的我。”)
In your terms.用你的话来说。
([Gene]:“In yours too.")(吉恩：“用你的话来说也是。”)
In your terms.用你的话来说。
([Gene]:“In yours too.") Look at the last statement then carefully.(吉恩：“用你的话来说也是。”)那就仔细看一下最后那一番话。
([Gene]:“We have come full circle. I am one with what reality I create. There is nowhere to go.” )(吉恩：“我们兜了一大圈又回到原点。我就是创造实相的那个人。没有任何地方可去。”)
You must still be able to experience any one of these illusions. Knowing they are illusory with full knowledge of their nature and still know that the basic reality is yourself. There is no place to go, because you are the place, in those terms, and all places. But the joke is relevant. The most important thing I have said to you this evening is that the joke is relevant.你还是必须能够体验这些幻相的任何一个。对它们的本质有着充分的认识，因而知道它们是幻相，然而也知道基本实相是你自己。没有任何地方可去，因为就这些字眼来说，你就是那个地方，而且你也是所有的地方。但这个笑话是有意义的。今天晚上我对你说过最重要的事情就是，这个笑话是有意义的。
([Gene]:“Yes, I would agree.” )(吉恩：“是的，我同意。”)
You must be free enough to explore the nature and experience of every living thing within your own system knowing that it is yourself and then leave your system. These must be direct experiences.你一定要够自由，才能在你自己的系统之内探索每一样活生生的东西，同时知道它就是你自己，然后再离开你的系统。这些必然是直接的经验。
([Gene]:“But I can't leave the system because I am in all systems simultaneously.” )(“吉恩：“但是我无法离开这个系统，因为我同时在所有的系统之中。”)
I am speaking in physical terms. Even in physical terms, in very limited physical terms, you are still dealing with other systems.我在说的是物质方面。甚至在物质方面，在非常有限的物质方面，你仍然和其他系统打交道。
([Gene]:“I have no choice.")(吉恩：“我别无选择。”)
I am using terms of continuity now simply for explanation. First there must be a period, and then it has passed, when you are completely immersed in a given system as if no other existed. Value fulfillment AS A RULE being achieved in this manner. This does not mean you are not dwelling in other systems simultaneously. The illusion must be probed to its depth.我现在之所以用连续的说法，只是为了解释而已。首先一定有一段时间，然后它就过去了，这时你完全沉浸在一个既定的系统里，仿佛其他系统全都不存在似的。价值完成，一般来说，是以这种方式实现的。这并不是说你没有同时存在其他系统之中。而是说一定要探索这个幻相到它的深处。
([Gene]:“Of which it has none.")(吉恩：“它没有任何深处。”)
You create the depth.你创造深处。
([Gene]:“Right, and in so doing the probing has been done. There is nothing to probe.” )(吉恩：“对，而且在这么做的时候，探索已经完成了。没有任何可以探索的东西。”)
The probing is necessary. Some games are necessary and always relevant.探索是必要的。有一些游戏是必要的而且一直都是重要的。
([Gene]:“Isn’t the object of the game to play the game—not to create or probe?")(吉恩：“这个游戏的目的不就是玩这个游戏——而不是创造或探索吗？”)
You are yourself in these terms the game.就这些方面来说，你自己就是这个游戏。
([Gene]:“In all other terms also.” )(吉恩：“就其他方面来说也全部都是。”)a
You are creating your own limitations.你正在创造你自己的限制。
(Too fast to follow word for word. Seth admits he is part of the game and was, in a sense, created by Gene. He says that Gene is dealing in artificial terms, not real ones.) You and I are part of the same reality.(太快了，无法逐字记录。赛斯承认他是这个游戏的一部分而且就某方面来说是吉恩创造出来的。他说吉恩打交道的方式是人为的，而不是真实的。)你和我都是同一个实相的一部分。
(Interlude.(中场休息。
([Gene]: 'Is there really more than one viewpoint?")(吉恩：“真的是不止一个观点吗？”)
Yes. You are not granting the diversity which exists.是的。你不承认确实存在的多样性。
([Gene]:“I would be willing to grant it multiplicity of illusory forms of the same thing—namely you and I. All one.")(吉恩：“我愿意承认同一个东西——说白了就是你和我——有多重的幻相形式。全都一样。”)
The experience is in every way real.这个经验在每一方面都是真实的。
([Gene]:“Yes indeed. We’re all Buddhas, but we won't admit it.” )(吉恩：“的确是。我们全都是菩萨，但我们不会承认。”)
This is a tragedy. The game is different.这是一个悲剧。这个游戏是不一样的。
([Gene]:“Is there tragedy in this game?")(吉恩：“在这个游戏当中有没有悲剧？”)
Overall there will be none, speaking in terms of continuity.整体而言不会有任何悲剧，就连续的角度来说。
([Gene]: ?“The discontinuous tragedy is an illusion, isn't it?")(吉恩：“不连续的悲剧是一个幻相，不是吗？”)
Overall, there is no tragedy. There must be an overall commitment.整体而言，没有悲剧。必须有一个整体的承诺。
([Gene]:“To what?")(吉恩：“对什么而言？”)
There must be an overall commitment to the self.对自己的一个全面承诺是一定有的。
([Gene]:“Which is to everyone else too, of course.” )(吉恩：“当然，对其他每一个人也是。”)
And there can be no self betrayal.但是自我背叛的意念可能会导致扭曲。
([Gene]:“Right. Nor any betrayal of others.” )缺
But the idea of self betrayal can lead to distortions.缺
([Gene]:“But these distortions are part of the game that Shiva plays with yourself [me] and conversely.” )(吉恩：“但这些扭曲可能是湿婆与你自己[我]玩的游戏一部分，而且反过来也是。”)
I would prefer to call it a loving endeavor.我比较喜欢称它是爱的努力。
([Gene]:“Of course. Think of the classical statue of Shiva standing on the crushed baby—a loving participation in the illusion of tragedy. Even in the illusion of self delusion.” )(吉恩：“当然。想想湿婆的传统雕像，站在压碎的婴儿身上——一个爱的参与，在悲剧之中。甚至是在自欺的幻相之中。”)
You are trying to cut out many steps for yourself.你正试着为你自己铲除很多台阶。
([Gene]:“But there aren't any steps, are there?")(吉恩：“但是没有任何台阶，有吗？”)
For you, now, there are steps.对你来说，现在，是有许多台阶。
([Gene]:“Aren't they illusory?")(吉恩：“它们不是幻相吗？”)
They are indeed.它们的确是。
([Gene]:“If they are artificial barriers which I create in my own path, surely I can remove them.” )(吉恩：“如果它们是我在自己的道路上创造的人为障碍，那我肯定能够除掉它们。”)
Theoretically it is so indeed. Practically it would behoove you to watch your footing.理论上的确是如此。实际上你应该要留意你的脚步。
([Gene]:“Yes. That was the comment to Siddhartha.” )(吉恩：“是的。这是给悉达多[Siddhartha]的意见。”)
These are tender children we lay to rest. We should mourn for them though they be but(blank space, missing word? ) We must feel for them though they be cow dung.这些是我们安葬的年幼孩子。我们应该哀悼他们，尽管他们只有(空白，漏字？)我们一定要心疼他们，尽管他们是牛粪。
([Gene]:“We must love them for they are ourselves.” )(吉恩：“我们一定要爱他们，因为他们就是我们自己。”)
You cannot do less. You can hardly do more.你无法做更多。你几乎无法做更少。
([Gene]:“To do that is to have opened an eye and to see that there is but one short step to take.” )(吉恩：“这么做就是，张开一只眼睛，看见要跨出的只有一小步而已。”)
You are playing a game.你正在玩一个游戏。
([Gene]:“Of course. So are you. We say that Shiva is playing a game and who is Shiva besides yourself")(吉恩：“当然。你也是。我们说湿婆正在玩一个游戏，除了你自己以外，谁是湿婆？”)
You are indeed now playing a game with yourself, but it is not relevant, and it may be irrelevant. But you had better play it reverently.你现在的确在跟你自己玩一个游戏，但它并不重要，而且它可能不相干。但你最好恭恭敬敬地玩这个游戏。
([Gene]:“With reverence for whom?")(吉恩：“对谁恭敬？”)
With reverence indeed toward the self.当然是对自己恭敬。
([Gene]: O.K We're not talking at cross purposes.")(吉恩：“好的。我们不是在各说各话。”)
There is a holy irreverence and a flighty irreverence. You are playing a game. They are both one. But you had better be certain that you know this thoroughly. Now I suggest you rest.有一种神圣的不敬和一种轻浮的不敬。你正在玩一个游戏。它们两者是一体的。但你最好确定你彻底了解这件事。现在我建议你休息。
(Copy of the list Jane made out Tuesday morning to supplement my list, which had been used as envelope object the night before, November 28. Jane's list was on yellow paper, in dark ink the same color as mine.)在1966年11月28日第304节的第78次信封实验用作标的物的购物清单珍在星期二早上为了补充我的清单而列出的清单副本，在前一天11月28日晚上，我的清单被用来当作信封标的物。珍的清单写在黄纸上，用的深色墨水颜色和我的一样

SESSION 304 第304节 出体的益处 信封78


NOVEMBER 28, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年11月28日 星期一 晚上9点
(The 78th envelope object was a shopping list I had written out earlier today for Jane, but which Jane did not see. On a sheet of white paper torn from a pad, same color ink as the tracing on page 189, folded as indicated, placed between two pieces of Bristol and then sealed in double envelopes. Results were not particularly good. See Jane's supplementary list, this page also.)(第78次信封实验标的物是一份购物清单，我在今天稍早前写给珍，但她没有看到。在一张从一本笔记簿撕下的白纸上，墨水颜色和珍的副本一样，先如上面图所示对折，再放进两片西卡纸之间，然后密封在双层信封之内。结果不是太好。另外参见珍的补充清单。
(The 303rd session, held Saturday evening, November 26, with Eugene and Sarah Bernard, was a long and active one. The whole week had been a very busy one for Jane and me, and we were left somewhat short of sleep.(11月26日星期六晚上举行的第303节，出席的有尤吉恩[Eugene]莎拉·伯纳德夫妇，是时间很长又互动积极的一节。珍和我一整个星期都非常忙碌，因此我们都有点睡卢不足。
(Jane began speaking in trance this evening at a rather slow pace; her eyes opened at times; she was smoking; voice average.)(今晚珍开始在出神中讲话，速度相当缓慢，眼睛偶尔张开；她在抽烟；声音普通。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. We are by ourselves again.现在。再一次只有我们自己上课了。
There were topics discussed at our last session which have not been discussed in those terms earlier.我们上一节讨论的话题有的之前没有用那些字眼讨论过。
Let us in our own way consider some of them. The physical universe is real and not real, as you know. You create physical matter and then perceive it. If there were no purpose in the creation of physical matter, it would not exist and you would not perceive it. That is, it would not exist even as an illusion.让我们按照我们自己的方式来思考其中一些主题。如你所知，物质宇宙是真实的也是不真实的。你创造实体物质并且感知它。如果在实体物质的创造中没有任何目的，那它就不会存在，而你也不会感知它。也就是说，它甚至不会以幻相的形式存在。
There are some fine points here. We shall try to tackle some of them. (Long pause.) For those who may seem like gods to you, killing is no crime, for there is no such thing as even the illusion of death. On one level then it is true that death, like life as you know it, is an illusion. You cannot rid yourselves completely of the illusion while you are within physical bodies.这里有一些细节。我们应该试着处理其中一些。(长时间停顿)对那些在你看来似乎是神的人而言，杀人不是罪，因为甚至连死亡这样的幻相都是不存在的。所以在一个层面上，死亡，就像你所知的生命一样，是一个幻相。当你们还在肉体之内时，你们不可能完全摆脱这个幻相。
Therefore, within this context you trust treat your living things gently. They are actualities within your system. Philosophical tenets at your level must be carefully filled in by constructive Emotions. There is strong value fulfillment to be gained where you are. It is good to know where you are, and the nature of your reality. You must still operate within its framework, however.因此，在这个脉络之中，你们必须温柔对待活生生的东西。它们是你们系统之内的现实。在你们的层面上，一定要小心翼翼把建设性的情感注入哲学信条之中。在你所在之处，有极大的价值完成将会实现。知道你在哪里以及你的实相本质，这是好事。但是，你仍然必须在它的架构之内运作。
The self, the whole self, the entity, that is your true self, does indeed exist now. You are even in contact with it now. It is true that in one sense you have never left this self. It is also true that in another sense you have indeed. Your have purposefully explored other systems as you explore this one.自己、全我、存在，就是你的真我，确实存在当下。甚至你当下正与它联系中。在某一方面，你真的从来没有离开过这个自己。而在另一方面，你也确实离开了。你带着目的在探索其他系统，就像你探索这个系统一样。
The exploration is also a creation, and a continuing creation. There is no finality or completion. There is indeed no place to go, as your friend is fond of saying. But the very word is brings forth a multiplicity of existences. They are quite real(smile) psychologically and psychically.探索也是一种创造，而且是一种持续的创造。没有终结也没有完成。确实没有任何要去的地方，就像你朋友喜欢的那样。但是，是(is)这个字带来了多重的存在。在心理和心灵上，它们是相当真实的(微笑)。
Philosophy should allow you to deal with them and not to avoid them. In one case of course there is nothing to avoid. Moment points, as I have discussed them, will clear up many of these points for you. There is every reason to explore inner reality, but this exploration should lead you to understand the nature of physical reality also. Perhaps your physical existence could be compared with an excellent book, given to you by a teacher.哲学应该让你能够应付它们，而不是逃避它们。当然在一种情况下，没有任何要逃避的东西。我讨论过的片刻点将会为你理清很多这些重点。探索内在实相有着充分的理由，但这个探索应该也会让你了解物质实相的本质。或许你的物质存在可以与一个老师给你的一本超棒的书相提并论。
You are completely immersed in it. Because you realize that you are reading such a book and acting out the part of the main character, and plunged into a three-dimensional existence, this does not mean that you can afford to throw the book away nor that you should refuse to read it.你完全沉浸在书中。因为你发觉你正在读这样一本书，并且把主角的部分演出来，投入一个三维的存在中，这并不是说你可以把书弄掉，也不是说你应该拒绝读它。
You may of course realize its nature, and this is a step forward. The teacher who gives you the book is reading another book, and acting another part. There are some shortcomings in Zen philosophies that we shall discuss at another time. The system is basically a good one but the flaw, one in particular, is a tragic one. And within your system such flaws can lead many astray.你当然可能明了它的本质，而这是往前迈进一步。给你这本书的老师正在读另一本书，并且演出另一个角色。在禅学的哲理当中有一些不足之处，改天我们再来讨论。这个系统基本上是好的，但是缺点，特别是其中一个，却是可悲的。而且在你们的系统中，这样的缺点可能导致很多误入歧途的情形。
I do not like the word joke indeed, relevant or irrelevant, for that matter. It can lead to unfeeling.因为那个原因，我其实不喜欢笑话(joke)这个词，无论相关不相关。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:25. Jane was dissociated as usual. She resumed at the same rather slow pace, eyes again opening at times, at 9:31.)(9:25休息。珍一如往常出离。她在9:31以同样相当缓慢的速度继续，眼睛再次偶尔张开。)
When you have out-of-body experiences, you can become aware of the nature of inner reality more directly.当你有出体经验时，你可能开始更加直接觉知内在实相的本质。
This knowledge helps you use and direct physical laws, not ignore them. You use them more efficiently, and for the purposes of the inner self. You begin to create physical matter so that it does indeed reflect the inner self, and in so doing, you effect changes that are noticed by others and serve as an example.这个知识有助于你利用和指挥物质法则，而不是忽略它们。你更加有效率地利用它们，而且是为了达成内我的目标。你开始创造实体物质，以便它确实反映内我，而且在这么做的同时，你也有其他人注意到并且当作范例的改变。
Through exploring inner reality you are indeed in contact with All That Is. The experience must be primarily a solitary one however on your part. You are both correct in assuming that you maintain your relative isolation. Specifically you should not now join a community of the sort that is being planned.透过探索内在实相，你确实与一切万有保持联系。然而就你而言，基本上这个经验一定是独自的体会。你们两人以为自己维持着相对的孤立，这样想是正确的。具体来说，你们现在不应该加入那种计划中的社群。
Ruburts abilities, and your own, will develop as they will. They follow their own inner nature. There will be spontaneous expansions, but the work must be private. This does not mean you cannot join in experiments.鲁柏的能力，以及你自己的能力，将会自然而然发展。它们跟着它们自己的内在本质走。将会有自发的扩展，但是在私底下运作。这并不是说你们不能参加实验。
Now this is indeed a personal seminar that you attend, and in the terms used by Bernard. I am speaking to you from a particular point of my personality, the part which you can easily understand. I believe my way of teaching to be the best one for our purposes. Ruburt’s abilities are very strong. They must be nurtured in such a way that stability is maintained.现在你们出席的这个集会确实是一个私人研讨会，而且这是按照伯纳德的说法。我是从我的人格当中一个特定的点，一个你们易于了解的部分，在对你们讲话。对我们的目的而言，我相信我的教学方式是最好的。鲁柏的能力很强。一定要用这样的方式滋养，它们才能维持稳定。
You hear me now. You recognize my personality as it is presented to you. Other aspects of it will become apparent as you are ready. I protect you both in psychic matters, if you ever wondered, and of course in other affairs when I think protection necessary.你们现在听见我了。你们认得我呈现在你们面前的人格。在你们准备好的时候，它的其他面向就会显现。在通灵方面，如果你们有疑问，我会保护你们两人。当然还有在其他事情上也是，如果我觉得保护有必要的话。
You may take a break or give me your envelope, as you prefer.你可以休息一下，或把你的信封给我，由你决定。
("We 'll take the break."(“我们休息一下。”
(Break at 9:45. Jane out as usual. Pace slow, eyes open at times. Resume with eyes closed at 9:53.)(9:45休息。珍一如往常出去了。速度缓慢，眼睛时而睁开。在9:53闭着眼睛继续。)
It is better, as I have said often, that the ego not be shunted aside.就像我经常说的，不要让自我往旁边偏离比较好。
It is true the division is arbitrary. Nevertheless the ego is a part of the self. We are acquainting it with other portions of the self. It is still the director of physical activities. Properly trained and intuitively governed this portion of the self can be of benefit in survival circumstances.这个区分是任意断定的。虽然如此，自我就是自己的一个部分。我们正在让它熟悉自己的其他部分。它仍然是肉体活动的指挥者。经过适当的训练以及透过直觉加以管理，自己的这个部分就能够在存活的境况中带来助益。
Now your envelope.现在来看你的信封。
(Her eyes closed, Jane took the envelope from me for our 78th experiment at 9:55. She held it to her forehead in a horizontal position.)(珍的眼睛闭着，在9:55分从我这里拿了第78次实验的信封。她把横向的信封放在她的额头上。)
We shall see what we can do. A moment please. These are impressions, connected with the object.我们看看我们可以做什么。请等一下。这些是印象，与标的物有关联。
A scramble, as of events. Blues and yellows, strong colors.乱成一团(sctamble)，例如一堆事件。蓝色和黄色，强烈的色彩。
An oval, the shape of an oval rug, for example.一个椭圆形，例如一张椭圆地垫的形状。
The impression of a rectangular shape. Perhaps the object has been in a book or album. In any case the corners seem to have been connected to something else—something dark, I believe; or there is something dark on the corners, perhaps black.一个长方形的印象。也许标的物曾经在一本书或相簿里。无论如何边角似乎与别的东西相连在一起——某个深色的东西，我相信；或是在边角某个深色的东西，也许是黑色。
Also a white border. The impression is certainly of some kind of photograph here. Ruburt now thinks of a woman and child, and of a photograph of Marie Tubbs and a baby, in Florida.还有一个白色的边界。这里的印象当然是某种相片之类的。鲁柏现在想到一个女人和小孩，以及在佛罗里达州，玛莉·塔伯斯(Marie Tubbs)与一个婴儿的一个照片。
I feel we are off here, but that the connection is valid.我感觉我们在这里偏离方向了，但是这个关联还是有效的。
("Yes.")(“是的。”)
I do have the impression of dark color and white, small handwriting perhaps on the back, in ink.我的确有深色和白色的印象，也许是用墨水手写在背面的小字。
(Pause.(停顿)
("Yes.")(“是的。”)
Smaller shapes , fairly dark perhaps like leaves in shadow. A connection with a note or letter. At least a connection with writing that is not on the object itself. That is, other writing, either in a note or beneath these images which I believe are on the object.比较小的形状，颜色相当深，也许就像阴影中的叶子。与一张字条或一封信件有关联。至少与不是写在标的物本身的字迹有关联。也就是说，其他的字迹，要不是在一张字条上，就是在我相信是标的物上面的这些画面里。
("What kind of images?")(“什么样的画面？”)
The small leaf like shapes , for example.比如说，小小的叶片形状。
("Any others?")(“还有别的吗？”)
These are further impressions. A turn up or tune-up. Disconnected lines. A distant place that is rather distant, not close by. Water. Connection with a book. Perhaps mention of Ruburt's book.这些是另外的印象。突然出现(turn up)或调整(tune-up)。不相连的线条。一个遥远的地方，相当遥远，不是在附近。水。与一本书有关联。也许有提到鲁柏的书。
ATS and perhaps an L.ATS，也许还有一个L。
I believe the object has images on it of people.我相信标的物上面有人的画面。
("No, Seth."(“没有，赛斯。”
(Pause, eyes closed, envelope still to forehead.)(停顿，眼睛闭着，信封仍然放在额头上)
I have the image of people. Let us see. Of four adults. Do you have questions?我有人的画面。让我们看一下。4个成年人的画面。你有没有问题？
("How about that scramble?")(“那个乱成一团是怎样？”)
I do not know if it refers to a scramble of lines, events, or perhaps eggs. The term scramble is my impression.我不知道它是不是指乱成一团的线条、事件或也许是炒蛋。Scramble这个字是我的印象。
("Well, Id say it referred to events... You said strong colors—blues and yellows. These are not on the object. I was wondering what the connections are.” )(“嗯，我会说它指的是事件……你说强烈的色彩——蓝色和黄色。标的物上没有这些颜色。我在想关联是什么。”)
To do with paintings.与画作有关。
("That may be possible.” )(“有可能。”)
Also the impression of something divided into four divisions fairly equally. This way, you see.还有印象是某个东西被相当平均地分成四等分。这样子，你看。
("Yes."(“是的。”
(Eyes closed, Jane drew in the air a sign like this:)(闭着眼睛，珍在空中画了一个像这样的符号：)
(My next quick sketch as Jane continued speaking for Seth: Is this sign, +, a reference to the string wrapped around the Bernard package? Thus: )(在珍继续替赛斯说话时，我画了下一个速写：这个符号＋是指绑在伯纳德的包裹上那条绳子吗？这样：)
An inadequate or unfinished circumstance also. And a connection with transportation.还有一个不够充分或没有完成的状况。以及一个与交通运输有关的连结。
("Transportation on whose part?")(“谁那边的交通运输？”)
On the part of guests.客人那边。
("Well, it's more likely to be transportation on your part. As Jane, that is.” )(“嗯，比较可能是你那边的交通运输。也就是说，珍那边。”)
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 10:14. Jane out as usual. Eyes remained closed, pace okay with short pauses.(10:14休息。珍一如往常出去了。眼睛仍然闭着，速度还好，有几次短暂的停顿。
(See the tracing on page 189. The envelope object was a shopping list I made out with the intention of giving it to Jane earlier today, but did not do so. She never saw it before the test. It was written in a dark pen on white paper torn from a pad the same size, and was folded once before insertion into the double envelopes. The back was blank.(见前面的描摹图。信封标的物是我列出的一份购物清单，原本今天稍早前要给珍，但后来没给。在测验之前，她从未见过它。它是用深色笔写在白纸上，纸是从相同尺寸的记事簿撕下来的，对折之后放入双层信封内。背面空白。
(The list represented numerous small things we had needed for some days, but Jane had been prevented from picking them up because of steady rain while I was at work. The list grew and indeed Jane was to get some items and perform some chores I had forgotten to put on the list. These too play a part in test results, since she had these equally strongly in mind this evening. She was to do all the chores tomorrow, Tuesday. See Jane's list on page 190.)(清单上列出很多我们好几天以来需要的小东西，但是我在上班，而雨个不停，珍也无法出门采买。清单变长了，而珍确实要去买几样东西并且办几件我忘记列在清单上的事。这些也在测验结果中起了作用，因为今天晚上她心里也一样牢记得这些事。明天，星期二，她把全部的事情办妥。珍的清单见前面描摹图。
(I tried something a little different during the experiment and Jane said now that she didn’t know whether it helped or not. The idea being simply to offer Seth encouragement when he was right, or close, or to ask a question at the moment to develop a bit of data further. She was aware that the approach was different. With the exception of an image of a photo of her school day friend, Marie Tubbs, Jane said she did not know if she had any images or not.(我在实验期间做了一点点不同的尝试，珍现在说她不知道它有没有帮助。想法就只是，在赛斯说中或接近时，给他鼓励，或是在当下提出问题，以便进一步开发多一点的资料。她有觉察到我的对话方式不一样。除了有一个意象是她学生时代的朋友玛莉·塔伯斯的一张照片以外，珍说她不知道她有没有任何意象。
(Seth didn't comment specifically on the experimental results and Jane and I made our own connections.(赛斯没有具体评论实验结果，珍和我自己找连结。
("A scramble as of events." This is good data. The object, the shopping list, represented quite a scramble on Jane's part. She walked downtown Tuesday after the items, and these along with others made up a load that was all she could carry home.(“乱成一团(sctamble)，例如一堆事件。”这个资料很好。标的物，购物清单，就珍而言代表颇为乱成一团。星期二，她走到市中心采购这些物品，再加上其他东西，就是她拿得动的重量。
("Blues and yellows, strong colors.” Later Seth links these with paintings. The object contains items I use to do artwork with, although no paint. Jane did visit the art shop where I buy my paints. I thought another connection might apply also. Not on the list, but bought by Jane Tuesday were four transistor radio batteries. I had forgotten them but she remembered. The batteries are covered with a strong red, blue, and yellow design, very bulk y. See Jane's list, page 190, also.(“蓝色和黄色，强烈的色彩。”后来赛斯把这些色彩和画作连在一起。虽然没有颜料，但是标的物包含我用来作画的物件。珍的确去了我购买颜料的美术用品店。我认为另一个关联也可以适用。不在清单上，但珍在星期二买了4颗电晶体收音机的电池。我忘了它们但她记得。电池是用鲜艳的红、蓝、黄设计包着，非常笨重。珍的清单见前面描摹图。
("An oval, the shape of an oval rug, for example.” See page 189. There are several ovals on the shopping list. The most prominent is the one I drew after the line” small tacks” , with the size of the tack I needed indicated within the oval. Jane: I think rug is a literal interpretation of” matte” finish—see object.(“一个椭圆形，例如一张椭圆地垫的形状。”见前面清单。在购物清单上有几个椭圆形。最显著的是我画在“小圆钉”后面那一个，在椭圆形之内标示了我需要的圆钉大小。珍：我认为地垫是字面上对“matte”[雾面的。译注：与垫子的英文mat发间一样]效果的一个解读——见标的物。
("The impression of a rectangular shape.” The object is rectangular, either opened up or folded. It was folded inside the double envelopes.(“一个长方形的印象。”标的物不管打开或折起来都是长方形。它是对折放在双层信封里。
("Perhaps the object has been in a book or album.” The object was not in a book, but had been part of a book or pad of paper in that sense.(“也许标的物曾经在一本书或相簿里。”标的物不在一本书里面，但就这个意思来说，它曾经是一本书或笔记簿的一部分。
("In any case the comers seem to have been connected to something else—something dark, I believe.” The object was of course the top sheet on the pad, which I tore off after making out the list. There is no dark particularly connected here however; the gum binding on the pad is a middle blue, and the pad is backed up with cardboard of the usual middle value gray.(“无论如何边角似乎与别的东西相连在一起——某个深色的东西，我相信。”标的物当然是笔记簿最上面那一页，我在列出清单之后把它撕了下来。不过，这里没有特别相关的深色；笔记簿的胶装是中间蓝，而笔记簿则是用中度灰阶值的普通硬纸板做背衬。
("or there is something dark on the corners, perhaps black.” See above. Seth here appears to be drifting into a photo interpretation, as below.(“或是在边角某个深色的东西，也许是黑色。”见上文。赛斯在这里看起来好像陷入一张照片的解读里，见下文。
("Also a white border. The impression is certainly of some kind of photograph here. Ruburt now thinks of a woman and a child, and of a photograph of Marie Tubbs and a baby, in Florida... I feel we are off here, but that the connection is valid.” There is a Florida connection, and this led Seth to the Tubbs connection for our friend Marie also lives in Florida.(“还有一个白色的边界。这里的印象当然是某种相片之类的。鲁柏现在想到一个女人和小孩，以及在佛罗里达州，玛莉·塔伯斯(Marie Tubbs)与一个婴儿的一个照片。我感觉我们在这里偏离方向了，但是这个关联还是有效的。”与佛罗里达州有关联，而这把赛斯带到塔伯斯的连结上，因为我们的朋友玛莉也住在佛罗里达州。
(One of Jane's chores Tuesday, not on the list but performed along with the listed items, was to mail a package to Sarah Bernard, who along with her husband visited us from North Carolina over last weekend. See the last session. The package contained a sweater Sarah forgot. The Bernards had visited Florida a few weeks ago. Jane had made her own list of errands to run Tuesday, and this included a visit to the post office to buy stamps, as well as mail the package. See Jane's list, page 190 also.(珍在星期二办的杂事之一不在清单上，但也跟着清单项目一起完成，那就是寄一个包裹给莎拉·伯纳德，上周末她和她的丈夫一起从北卡罗莱纳州来探望我们。见上一节。包裹里面是莎拉忘记带走的一件毛衣。伯纳德夫妇在几个礼拜以前去过佛罗里达州。珍在星期二列了她自己的代办事项清单，而这包括去邮局买邮票，还有寄这个包裹。珍的清单见前面描摹图。
("I do have the impression of dark color and white, small handwriting perhaps on the back, in ink." See page 189. The object does contain small dark handwriting on white. The back impression could have been picked up by Seth because the object was folded inside the sealed double envelopes.(“我的确有深色和白色的印象，也许是用墨水手写在背面的小字。”标的物确实是在白纸上有深色的小型手写字。赛斯之所以接收背面的印象，可能是因为标的物在密封的双层信封内是对折的。
("Smaller shapes , fairly dark, perhaps like leaves in shadow. A connection with a note or letter. At least a connection with writing that is not on the object itself. That is, other writing, either in a note or beneath these images which I believe are on the object." This is good data, and refers to the list Jane made out herself to supplement my list. See page 190. Jane made her list out Tuesday morning, November 29, after I had given her a copy of the list used as envelope object Monday, November 28.(“比较小的形状，颜色相当深，也许就像阴影中的叶子。与一张字条或一封信件有关联。至少与不是写在标的物本身的字迹有关联。也就是说，其他的字迹，要不是在一张字条上，就是在我相信是标的物上面的这些画面里。”这是一个很好的资料，指的是珍补充我的清单而自己列出的那份清单。珍在11月29日星期二上午列出那份清单，在我于11月28日星期一给了她这份用作标的物的清单之后。
(The two lists were linked in Jane's mind of course by images, common goals, etc., of many kinds. One item of similarity showing up on both lists is the” cash check" data, referring to a check I had received for a painting recently.... The mail package data on Jane’s list refers to the errand package discussed on page 195 under the Florida data. I had forgotten to add this item to my list.(经由很多种画面、共同目标等等，两份清单在珍的心智里当然是相连的。在两份清单上有一个类似的项目是“兑现支票”资料，指的是一张我最近因一幅画作而收到的支票……在珍的清单上，邮寄包裹的资料指的是寄出前面说的佛罗里达州资料下面讨论的包裹。我忘了把这一项写在我的清单上。
(1st Question: What kind of images?“The small leaf like shapes , for example." Evidently this is a reference to handwriting.(第一个问题：什么样的画面？“比如说，小小的叶片形状。”显然这是指手写的字迹。
(2nd Question: Any others?“These are further impressions. A turn up or tuneup.” Possibly a reference to the sweater left behind by Sarah Bernard, turning up after the Bernards had driven away. This is referred to on Jane's list under the mail package data; Jane did this on the same trip downtown during which she ran the errands listed on my list, used as envelope objects.(第二个问题：还有别的吗？“这些是另外的印象。突然出现(turn up)或调整(tune-up)。”可能是指莎拉·伯纳德忘记带走的毛衣，在夫妇俩开车离去之后才突然出现。在珍清单上的邮寄包裹资料之下，指的是这个；珍为了采买我用作标的物的那份清单列出的物品，而到市中心的同一趟行程中，她的确做了这件事。
("Disconnected lines." The object contains disconnected lines of handwriting. See page 189.(“不相连的线条。”标的物包含手写字迹不相连的线条。见前面所示。
("A distant place, that is rather distant, not close by. Water." Probably a reference to the Bernards and their trip to Florida a few weeks ago. See page 195 and the Tubbs data. The Bernards live in North Carolina, which is also a rather distant places and the package was mailed to that address. We don't know whether much water is close to Raleigh, NC.(“一个遥远的地方，相当遥远，不是在附近。水。”可能是指伯纳德夫妇以及他们几个星期以前的佛罗里达之旅。伯纳德夫妇住在北卡罗莱纳州，那也是一个相当遥远的地方，而包裹就是寄到那个地址。我们不知道北卡罗莱纳州的罗利[Rlaeigh]附近有没有很多水。
("Connection with a book. Perhaps mention of Ruburts book." This links the Bernards with Jane's list through the package data, and in turn with the object itself. The Bernards had a copy of Jane’s ESP book with them; we had mailed it to them some weeks ago.(“与一本书有关联。也许有提到鲁柏的书。”这透过包裹资料连结了伯纳德夫妇和珍的清单，进而连结了标的物本身。伯纳德夫妇有一本珍的《如何开发你的超感官能力》；我们在几周前把这本书寄给他们。
("A T S and perhaps L.” Jane felt subjectively that here she tried to get at the word Alexis on the object.(“ATS，也许还有一个L。”珍的主观感觉是，她在这里试着说出标的物上的Alexis[亚历克西斯]这个字。
("I believe the object has images on it of people." When I told Seth the object did not, Jane said it bothered her but not Seth. She said she thought it a good idea to continue the experiments in this vein however. I was trying to see what answers along the way would do to help spur Seth on towards more data, when I noted that he was off the track.(“我相信标的物上面有人的画面。”当我告诉赛斯标的物上面没有人时，珍说这干扰了她，而不是赛斯。不过，她说她认为在这方面继续实验，是个好主意。当我注意到赛斯偏离主题时，我在尝试看看过程中什么答案有助于刺激赛斯给出更多资料。
("I have the image of people. Let us see. Of four adults." It can of course be said that Jane and I and the Bernards are linked rather strongly to the list used as object, and through that to Jane's list, as already explained.(“我有人的画面。让我们看一下。4个成年人的画面。”当然可能说珍和我以及伯纳德夫妇与用作标的物的清单相当强烈地连结在一起，进而与珍的清单连结，这已经解释过了。
(3rd Question: “How about that scramble?” I do not know if it refers to a scramble of lines, events or perhaps eggs. The term scramble is my impression.” I told Seth it referred to events. See also page 195. A scrambled-egg connection also enters in, somewhat removed, since the Bernards and Jane and I had scrambled eggs for breakfast Sunday November 27.(第三个问题：那个乱成一团是怎样？“我不知道它是不是指乱成一团的线条、事件或也许是炒蛋。Scramble这个字是我的印象。”我告诉赛斯它指的是事件。见前面所述。与炒蛋的关联也进来了，有点离题，因为伯纳德夫妇以及珍和我在11月27日星期天的早餐吃了炒蛋。
(I then asked Seth to elaborate on the strong color impression about the blues and yellows. See also page 195.” To do with paintings.” This has been explained. A more distant connection might arise from the fact that Jane‘s shopping list, shown on page 190, was written on yellow paper with a dark blue pen. The battery interpretation is listed on Jane‘s list; and my own list, which was used as object, contained items to be purchased having to do with art.(然后我请赛斯详谈与蓝色和黄色有关的强烈色彩印象。见前面所述。“与画作有关。”这在之前解释过了。一个比较遥远的关联可能出自于以下的事实：显示在前面所示的页面上，珍的清单是用深蓝色的笔写在黄纸上。电池的解读条列在珍的清单上；我自己的清单被用来当作标的物，上面包含许多与艺术有关的物品。
("Also the impression of something divided into four divisions fairly equally. This way you see.” At the time Jane made a sign like this:(“还有印象是某个东西被相当平均地分成四等分。这样子，你看。”当时珍比划出一个这样的符号：
(Later I wondered whether Seth had been trying to get at the idea of string crossing itself around a package. A package of course is mentioned on Jane’s list, page 190. The cross effect can be easily found in the way I habitually wrap packages with strings and in the way I specifically wrapped the package to be mailed to the Bernards, thus:(后来我怀疑赛斯一直设法表达的概念是不是十字交叉在包裹四周的绳子。在珍的清单上当然提到了一个包裹，见描摹图。在我习惯用绳子捆绑包裹的方式中，以及在我打包邮寄给伯纳德夫妇那个包裹的方式中，很容易发现这种十字交叉的结果，就像这样：
("An inadequate or unfinished circumstance also.” A reference to the list used as object. The shopping list reflected a list of undone or unfinished chores which Jane performed Tuesday November 29. She had intended doing them Monday but had been stopped from doing so by a heavy rain. Her own list can also enter in here.(“还有一个不够充分或没有完成的状况。”指的是用作标的物的清单。购物清单反映了一连串没有做完或没有完成的日常事务，珍在11月29日星期二把它们办完了。她本来打算星期一去办这些事，但是因为一场大雨而没去。这里她自己的清单也进来了。
("And a connection with transportation.(“以及一个与交通运输有关的连结。”
(4th Question: “Transportation on whose part?]” On the part of guests.” I had told Seth it might more likely be trans-portation on Jane’s part, making the rounds to do the list of errands. There are links with the Bernards and transportation also of course, since they visited us over the weekend from North Carolina, then headed for a TV program in Philadelphia. The package data on Jane’s list is also connected to them.[第四个问题：谁那边的交通运输？]“客人那边。”我告诉赛斯，比较可能是珍那边的交通运输，为了清单上的待办事项而跑来跑去。伯纳德夫妇与交通运输当然也有关联，因为他们在周末从北卡莱纳州来探望我们，然后又为了一个电视节目去了费城。珍清单上的包裹资料也与他们有关联。
(Jane regarded the experiment as a poor one, although there were good points in it. She resumed briefly at 10:43.)(珍认为这个实验很糟，但是其中有一些不错的重点。她在10:43继续。)
Very briefly, I would suggest a specific dedication on Ruburt's part, before our sessions, to our sessions. And a few moments at least to turn himself inward.非常简短地说一下，我建议在我们的课前与课间，鲁柏这边能够特别专注。而且至少用一点时间把他自己的焦点转向内在。
Now, do you Joseph have any particular questions not concerning the test? When you will gain from additional test discussion I will always give it.现在，约瑟，你有没有任何与测验无关的问题？当你们能从测验的额外讨论中得到收获时，我一定会给的。
("No, I guess not.” )(“没有，我想没有。”)
We will close the session.我们要结束这一节了。
("Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:44.)(10:44结束。)

SESSION 305 第305节 预期形成物质环境


NOVEMBER 30, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年11月30日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane began speaking in a fairly strong voice. Her eyes were both opened and closed during the session.)(珍开始用一种相当有力的声音讲话。她的眼睛在课间时而张开时而闭上。)
Good evening晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, other planes and systems are as real and as unreal as your own. They are all formed from inner vitality, which is the basic or ground reality. Many other systems reflect inner reality more clearly, with less distortions, but the distortions themselves are creations. All systems are then formed mentally, including your own.现在，其他层面和系统与你们自己的层面和系统一样真实，也一样不真实。它们全都是由内在生命力形成的，而内在生命力就是基本或基础实相。很多其他的系统更加清楚反映内在实相，有着更少的扭曲，但扭曲本身就是创造。所有的系统于是在心智里形成，包括你们自己的系统。
This does not mean that they are imaginative in those terms usually used. There is an electromagnetic connection within and beneath all systems indeed, but this is only the result of inner mental connections. In each system you test inner knowledge by checking it against the unique and particular rules of that system.这并不是，就那些字眼的一般用法而言，它们是想像的。在所有的系统之内以及之下，其实是有一种电磁连结的，但这只是内在心智连结的结果而已。在每个系统当中，你依据那个系统独特且特有的规则核对内在知识，借此测试它。
Within your system expectation indeed forms your own physical environment. This does not mean that the rich, for example, have attained to spiritual status necessarily. The personal environment taken as a whole, with interpersonal relationships, is an indicator of the inner situation, however.在你们的系统之内，预期的确形成你们自己的物质环境。这并不是说，例如，越有钱就必然越有灵性。然而，个人环境就其整体而言，加上人际关系，却被当作是内在状况的一个指标。
In projections, you see, you must dispense with normal psychological root assumptions. You must momentarily realize that doors are not solid. The assumption is only a convenient one within your physical system. Doors are solid: This is not a basic truth, you see, but a convenient root assumption.在投射中，你看，你一定得抛开正常的心理根本假设。你一定随时会发觉门不是坚实的。这个假设只是在你们的物质系统之内一个方便的假设而已。门是坚实的；这不是一个基本的事实，你看，而是一个方便的根本假设。
It is a most difficult one for you to dispense with. As convenient aids you will find yourselves imagining, for example, open windows through which you will seem to travel. This is an aid to the ego only. Electromagnetically all living things are connected, yet each retains individuality. There is no nirvana in those terms, in which individuality will be vanquished.对你们来说，这是很难舍弃的一个假设。作为方便的辅具，你们会发现自己在想像，比方说，开启的窗户，你们似乎将会从中穿行而过。这只是给自我用的一个辅具而已。在电磁上，活生生的万物都是相连的，可是每一个都保有个体性。就那些字眼来说，根本没有会彻底击溃个体性的涅槃。
Individual selves will retain identity. They will be able to participate at a high level of awareness with the whole of which they are part. The whole is far more infinite than you can conceive. In a basic sense, the whole is aware of all of its parts, and in a basic senseall of its parts are aware of the whole. But each self must go its own way and develop its own abilities and explore the possibilities which it creates itself, otherwise the whole would stagnate.个别的自己将会保有本体。它们将会在一个高度觉知的层次上得以分享它们身为其中一份子的整体。整体的无限远远超出你们能力所及的想像。基本上来说，整体对它的每一个部分全都有觉知，而且基本上来说，它的每一个部分对整体也都有觉知。但是每一个自己必须走它自己的路，发展它自己的能力，探索它自己创造的可能性，否则整体会停滞不前。
The whole gains vivid experience through the life of its parts. The whole needs its segments. The vitality must constantly create itself in new patterns and each new pattern, of course, brings forth new possibilities of development.整体透过它每一部分的生命获得生动的经验。整体需要它的各个部分。生命力必须持续不断用新的模式创造它自己，而每一个新的模式当然带来新的发展可能性。
Infinity has nothing to do with space or time as you know it. Infinity is the state of becoming and can never have an end for it is never completed. Infinity has to do with value fulfillment, and the unfoldings of ever new possibilities, the exploration of moment points, the traveling through dimensions that ever creates the illusion of time. But since there is no time, what is there to end?无限与你所知的空间或时间一点关系都没有。无限是变为的状态，而且永远不可能结束，因为它永远不会完成。无限与价值完成，以及全新可能性的开展、片刻点的探索、穿越不断创造时间幻相的维度之旅有关系。但是，既然没有时间，有什么好结束的呢？
The experience of projection will give you some small glimmering of infinity. Pretend that in an exploration during a projection you found yourself beside a tree. You entered the tree. You stayed there and followed it through the seasons. Then you grew restless and entered a bird who perched upon the branches and you flew merely several feet away. A child stands nearby and you entered the child.投射经验将会让你一瞥无限(infinity)的模样。假装你在一次投射的探索中，发现自己在一棵树旁边。你进入这棵树。你留在那里，跟着它度过四季。然后你越来越焦躁不安，而进入栖息在枝条上的一只鸟之内，你只是飞了几英尺之远。一个孩子站在附近，你进入这个孩子之内。
You intruded upon the child in no way. You were there within the child like air. All of this seemed to take no time at all. The child became old. You traveled to a nearby lake and became a fish. In succession you entered many things and finally returned to your body. You had experienced centuries, yet only an hour of your time had passed. The feeling that you would have inside this highly improbable projection would give you some idea, though a very weak one, of the feeling of infinity.你绝对没有侵占这个孩子。你像空气一样在孩子之内。这一切似乎一点都不花时间。孩子变老了。你旅行到附近一个湖，变成一条鱼。接二连三，你进入很多东西之中，最后回到你的身体里。你历经了好几世纪，可是你们的时间只过了一小时。你在这个可能性很小的投射中会产生的感觉，可以让你对无限的感觉有一点概念，尽管只是一点非常微弱的概念。
Now, in one sense, all selves are projections of the whole or that which is. New universes such as your own constantly come into existence. Systems and planes far different develop and in turn form other systems. Infinity has meaning only in subjective and psychic terms. The physical brain cannot contain the idea of infinity. The concept will not fit into three dimensional terms. The whole self, the inner self moves within the concept of infinity as you move within physical reality through space. Infinity contains all that will ever be known, and, of course, all that will ever be known is known within the spacious present .现在，一方面，所有的自己都是整体或当下所是(that which is)的投射。新的宇宙，比如你们自己的宇宙，持续不断进入存在中。迥异的系统和层面发展出来，进而形成其他系统。只有从主观和心灵的角度来说，无限才有意义。肉体的头脑无法容纳无限的概念。这个概念与三维的说法不相容。全我、内我在无限的概念之内移动，就像你在物质实相的空间之中行动一样。无限包含未来成为已知的一切，当然，未来将成为已知的一切在广阔的现在之内是已知的。
Yet these very terms, all that will ever be known, are distortive, for they suggest an ending of knowledge and experience and there is none.可是这些字眼，未来将成为已知的一切，是扭曲的，因为它们暗示着知识和经验是有止境的，其实并没有。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 9:35. Jane was dissociated as usual, a bit more toward the end. Her eyes were closed for the most part.)(9:35休息。珍一如往常出离，在快结束时又更出离一点。她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着。
(Resume at 9:45).9:45继续。)
Now,“There is no place to go" if you know what is truly meant by that statement. It is also true that there are as many places to go as you wish to find. You always create the places and the destinations at which you arrive. There are no places, and there are infinities of places. The inner self forms all systems and all places. On the one hand you can indeed call them illusion. On the other hand, these illusions are quite real. They are the clothing over the basic reality.现在，“没有要去的地方”，如果你知道这句话真正的意思。你希望找到的地方有多少，你要去的地方就有我少，这也是真的。你总是在创造地方以及你抵达的目的地。没有任何地方，也有无限多的地方。内我形成所有的系统以及所有的地方。一方面，你的确可以称之为幻相。另一方面，这些幻相相当真实。它们是基本实相的外衣。
The basic reality is indeed within the illusions. Look beneath them and within them and you will feel it. But they are themselves composed of it, and you cannot really separate the two. Words are inadequate to explain what I mean here.基本实相的确在幻相之内。看看它们之下和它们之内，你就会感觉到基本实相。但幻相本身是由基本实相组成的，你无法真的分开两者。言语不足以说明我这里要表达的意思。
Basic reality cannot know itself without creating diversity. The diversity is the various forms that reality takes, the various systems within which it expresses itself through projecting itself into infinite individualized experience. Now that sentence is an important one.要是没有创造多元性，基本实相无法认识它自己。多元性是实相采用的各种不同形式、各种不同系统，在它们之内，它把自己投射到无限的个体化经验中，借由表达它自己。现在这一句很重要。
Each inner self is a portion of the basic inner reality. It cannot know itself however, except through experience, and it must create in order to experience. The experience constantly deepens the value fulfillment of basic reality itself. There is no alternative between diversity and nothingness.每一个内我都是基本内在实相的一部分。然而除非透过经验，否则内我无法认识它自己，而且为了经验，它必须创造。经验持续不断深化基本实相本身的价值完成。在多元性与空无之间别无选择。
That which is, is constantly aware of its growing, surging existence, through the diversity of experience which it creates constantly and simultaneously. You are part of that which is, you are that which is. It is impossible for any part of that which is not to be individualized. Every part of that which is, is alive, and knows itself.当下所是持续不断而且同时创造经验，透过经验的多元性，持续不断觉知它突习猛进的存在。你就是当下所是的一部分，你就是当下所是。当下所是的任何一部分不可能不个体化的。当下所是的每一部分都是活着的，而且认识它自己。
There is what you may call a god, but hardly in terms of which you can conceive. Using your terms, you are indeed a part of this god. You are indeed infinite. You have immediate, instant personal (underlined) connection with this god, using your terms. You are directly connected to this god. You cannot be disconnected because this god is what you are made of.你可以称为神的东西是有的，但根本不是你能够想到的说法。用你们的话来说，你确实是这个神的一部分。你的确是无限的。你与这个神有着立即、即刻的个人(划线)连结，用你们的话来说。你直接连结这个神。你不可能失去连结，因为你就是由这个神制造而成的。
This is as simply put as possible and highly simplified. The knowledge here gives you benefits that are beneficial in highly (underlined) and significant ways; and do indeed enable you to draw upon abilities that you did not realize you possessed.这是尽可能简单的说明，非常简化。这里，这个知识给你的好处，在非常(划线)重要的许多方面都有助益；而且的确让你能够汲取你不知道你拥有的能力。
Now: This is a personal god, in your terms. It is a personal god because this god represents the part of that which is, which is yourself, you see. No one else can speak to this particular portion of this god. You are your own entity. The part of you that is formed from All That Is, is this god; is aware of all your needs because god is also, in this respect, yourself. Though hardly the self that you will recognize in a mirror.现在：这是一个私人的神，用你们的话来说。它是一个私人的神，因为这个神代表当下所是的这个部分，也就是你自己，你知道。别人无法跟这个神的这个特定部分说话。你就是你自己的存有。你的这个部分是从一切万有形成的，它就是这个神；你的这个部分对你所有的需求都是有觉知的，因为在这方面，神也是你自己。然而它几乎不是你会在镜中认出的自己。
Now: In your time scheme you see yourself at a certain age, within a given set of circumstances. When you realize that you are also a portion of All That Is, then you will see that this concept is erroneous and limited.现在：在你们的时间里，你看见某个年纪的自己，在一组既定的情况之内。当你明白你也是一切万有的一部分时，你就会看见这个观念是错的，而且是有限的。
There are also portions connected with your identity, however, within other systems, and these are more advanced than your own psychological self Again, I am speaking in your terms. These can be compared in this context, you see, to minor gods, and your mythologies are full of these. They are also obviously in contact with All That Is.不过，在其他系统之内，也有许多与你的本体连结的部分，这些部分比你自身那个心理的自己更为先进。再一次，我是从你们的角度来说。在这个脉络中，你看，这些部分可以比作小神，而这些神在你们的神话里俯拾皆是。它们与一切万有显然也是有连结的。
Some of these have been within your system, in your terms of continuity, and are now beyond it. They also represent your personal connection with All That Is. At times these personalities do aid their own and give instructions.就你们所谓的连续性而言，这些部分有一些曾经在你们的系统之内，现在则是在它之外。它们也代表你个人与一切万有的连结。有时候这些人格的确会自助也会给予指导。
Take the minor god connection lightly as the term is a poor one but brings out the idea I want to portray, though it is somewhat distorted. Their value fulfillment is considerably deeper than yours: their experience fuller and their knowledge at a higher level.不要太认真看待小神的连结，因为这不是一个贴切的字眼，但它带出我想要描绘的概念，只不过有点扭曲了。它们的价值完成比你的价值完成深入相当多：它们的经验更加充实，它们的知识层次也比较高。
I have avoided such discussions mainly in the past, until I thought you were ready for them. And now you are. These personalities are a part of your particular entity. Entities are obviously subdivisions of the whole, or All That Is. You retain your individuality as part of an entity, and the entity retains its individuality as a part of an energy gestalt.过去我大部分避开这样的讨论，直到你们做好了解它们的准备为止。而现在你们准备好了。这些人格是你专属存有的一部分。存有显然是整体或一切万有的从属单位。你身为一个存有的一部分，同时保有你的个体性，而存有身为一个能量完形的一部分，同时也保有它的个体性。
An energy gestalt maintains its individuality as a portion of All That Is. These are not impersonal energy forms. They are very highly individualized psychological entities. Their psychological development however is far different than any that you know.一个能量完形维持它身为一切万有一部分的个体性。这些并非没有人格的能量形式。它们是高度个体化的心理存有。但是，它们的心理发展迥异于你知道的任何一种。
There are simply psychological realities of which you are completely ignorant, and these are interwoven into energy frameworks containing dimensions you cannot understand.就是有你们完全一无所知的心理实相，而且这些实相与能量架构交织在一起，在那些架构里包含了你们无法了解的维度。
You may take a break.你可以休息一下了。
(Break at 10:14. Jane was dissociated as usual. At the last portion of this section she said that she felt Seth pushing at her; pushing her understanding as far as he could. She started to feel or experience directly the concept concerning the advanced psychological entity realities, but fell somewhat short.(10:14休息。珍一如往常出离。在这个段落的最后一部分，她说她感觉赛斯推动着她，尽他所能促进她的了解。她开始感觉或直接体验先进心理存有实相这个概念，但是力有未逮。
(Resume at 10:20.)10:20继续。)
You do indeed have access, you see, and a direct line, so to speak, with all the energy and experience you desire.你的确真的是有途径可行，你看，而且可以说是一条直线，连结所有你想要的能量和经验。
Now: One point here before we close. I would like to give some hint as to the psychological realities that form personality structures on higher levels than your own. These personalities are able to deepen value fulfillment amazingly through an expansion of consciousness that allows them to focus into many areas within the systems and planes simultaneously.现在：在我们结束之前，这里有一个重点。关于在比你更高的层次形成人格结构的心理实相，我想要给一些提示。这些人格能够经由意识的扩展，深化价值完成到令人惊叹的程度，因为意识扩展使它们得以同时聚焦在系统和层面之内的很多领域里。
That is, not only would they be aware of what seems to you to be past, present and future within your system, but they would be aware of several other systems and be able to function within them simultaneously, gaining and creating experience within all of these systems, even while maintaining overall identity. They would be conscious, for example, of themselves as, say, an entity, and simultaneously they would be aware of separate existences as individuals in various systems. This is as far as we can carry this at present.也就是说，它们不只对你们系统之内对你而言似乎是过去、现在和未来的现象有觉知，而且对几个其他系统也有觉知，还能够同时在它们之内运作，在这些系统当中的每一个之内获得并且创造经验，甚至同时维持整个本体。它们对于——比方说，它们自己，就说，身为一个存有，是有意识的，而且同时它们对于身为个体在不同系统当中分开的存在也是有觉知的。目前我们最多就只能说到这里。
There is far more to be said. I will return to this subject at the beginning of our next session. I will now close. My heartiest wishes to you both. I am often with you. I will help you in your projections. You must go so far alone, however. I have given you the instructions to enable you to do this.要说的东西还有很多。我们的下一节一开始，我会回来谈这个主题。现在我要结束了。给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。我经常与你们同在。我会在你的投射中协助你。但是，目前为止你一定要自己一个人摸索才行。我已经给你许多指导，让你可以做这件事了。
When you have learned enough on your own, then my active assistance will be of benefit as a guide. I want to develop your own abilities. I do not want to make it too easy for you. There are some lessons I will give you when you are projecting. I watch you during your projections, and look out for you. And now, good evening.当你自己学到够多东西的时候，我身为一个向导的积极协助就会带来好处。我想要开发你自己的能力。我不想要你一蹴而就。当你在投射时，我会给你上一些课。在你投射时，我会看守着你，留意你的状况。好了，晚安。
("Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(Session ended at 10:33. Jane was 'pretty far-out" all night.)(课在10:33结束。珍整个晚上“出去相当远。”)
(Copy of the drawing by me, used as the object in the 79th envelope experiment, in the 306th session for December 5,1966.)我的图画副本，在1966年12月5日第306节的第79次信封实验用作标的物

SESSION 306 第306节 任何系统的存在，必定带有某些铭印 信封79


DECEMBER 5, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年12月5日 星期一 晚上9点
(The 79th envelope object was a drawing made by me on Friday, November 25th, at work. It was a joke on Don Wilbur; Don and his wife, Marilyn, visited us that Friday evening and I showed them the sketch. I thought also that Jane saw the object that evening, but as it developed she did not. Thus, she had never seen the drawing until after the experiment. This evening I placed it between two pieces of Bristol, then sealed it in the usual double envelopes.(第79次信封标的物是我在11月25日星期五画的一张图。画它是跟唐·韦伯闹着玩；唐和他的太太玛丽莲那个周五晚上来拜访我们，我给他们看这幅速写。我也以为珍那天晚上见过标的物，但结果是她没见过。因此，她从未看过这张图，直到实验之后。今天晚上我把它放在两片西卡纸中间，然后密封在普通的双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down; she was smoking; her eyes began to open soon; her pace was rather fast and her voice quite loud, comparatively—the loudest it has been in some time.)(珍在出神中一边坐下来，一边开始讲话；她抽着烟；她的眼睛很快就开始张开；她的速度相当快，声音相对来说颇为响亮——这一段时间以来最大声的一次。)
Now, good evening.现在，晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Ruburt has been reading about drugs that induce the so-called psychedelic experience.鲁柏一直在读的东西是关于诱使所谓迷幻经验的毒品。
Now I have been speaking about psychological structures that are far more complicated than those with which you are familiar. We can tie these two subjects together very nicely, dear friends. For in a very dim manner, the psychedelic experience can give you some glimmerings as to the nature of these more advanced psychological structures.现在我一直在讲的是远比你们熟悉的那些结构还要错综复杂的心理结构。我们可以把这两个主题非常贴切地扣在一起，亲爱的朋友们。因为，迷幻经验以一种非常模糊的方式，让你们能够一瞥这些更先进的心理结构。
As I have mentioned many times, at present you focus your attentions and consciousness within the physical system. This alone can be compared to what Leary calls imprinting. Existence within any system will necessitate some imprinting. The imprinting simply involves an adjustment whereby consciousness is attuned to a particular station, so to speak.我提过很多次，目前你们把你们的注意力和意识集中在物质系统之内。单单这件事可以比作是李瑞(Leary)所说的铭印(imprinting)。在任何系统之内的存在都需要某种铭印。铭印涉及的就是一种调整，可以说，意识借此适应一个特定的站台。
The consciousness so attuned however is only a small portion of the individual's total consciousness. In your system it is now fashionable to refer to this as the ego. The psychological structures are indeed so imprinted. However they are also aware and conscious of huge portions of themselves that are not so imprinted. They are aware of themselves simultaneously as individuals imprinted so as to react within several systems.然而，如此适应的意识只不过是个体全部意识的一小部分而已。在你们的系统中，现在流行用自我来称呼它。心理结构确实是这样铭印的。但是它们对它们自己巨大的部分也有觉知和意识，那些部分并不是这样铭印的。它们同时觉知它们自己是在几个系统之内这样铭印以便起反应的个体。
They maintain overall identity however, and follow through, or keep track of, these individuals which are themselves. A very small case in point would be an individual who is as aware simultaneously, of all his incarnations within your system, aware of them happening at once, and yet aware of himself as the whole who experiences these existences.然而，它们维持着整个本体，并且跟进或追踪这些就是它们自己的个体。一个很小的好例子是，一个个体同时觉知他在你们系统之内的所有转世，觉知它们同时发生，可是也觉知他自己是经历这些存在的整体。
The separate incarnated personalities however are still separate identities. This is no contradiction at all. The personality structures of which I am speaking are far more advanced than this example. They are aware of many existences within many systems. They organize the basic ground reality into many patterns, and then operate and manipulate within them.但是，个别的转世人格依然是个别的本体。这一点都不矛盾。我在说的人格结构远比这个例子还要先进很多。它们对很多系统之内的很多存在都有觉知。它们把根本的基础实相组成很多模式，然后在其中运作和操纵。
You are as a rule aware of one system only and not generally conscious of yourself as anything but a creature of that system. I refer here to humanity at this time. These psychological structures through value fulfillment, ever enlarge their abilities to form new realities and to act within them. It should not be forgotten that these environmental systems are directly created by those who dwell within them, and this includes your own.你通常只对一个系统有觉知，而且一般只会意识到你自己除了是那个系统的一个生物以外，什么都不是。我这里指的是目前的人类。这些心理结构经由价值完成不断扩增它们的能力，形成新的实相并且在它们之内行动。不应该忘记的是，这些环境系统是由它们之内的居民创造的，而这包含你们自己的系统在内。
Basic reality is not a chaos. It is a raw material. All diversity implies a whole, and if you theorize a whole then you must also imply diversity. These personality structures are like you a portion of basic reality, or All That Is. They are simply able to use and express and act within a larger framework of it.基本实相并非一团混乱。它是一个原料。所有的多元性都隐含一个整体，如果你从理论上说明一个整体，那么你一定也暗指多元性。这些人格结构像你一样也是基本实相或一切万有的一部分。它们就是能够在它的一个更大架构之内利用、表达和行动。
Your idea of a god, in fact any concept held by humanity, represents at best a very small and insignificant idea, based upon the root assumptions of your own system. This does not mean such ideas are not legitimate as far as they go. Simply taking your own physical system and its physical universe, all intelligent life is simply not humanoid. Even in this limited conception of yours then, the concept of a human god is almost meaningless, and there are many other systems in which the word humanoid would have no real meaning at all.你们对神的想法，事实上人类抱持的任何观念，充其量只代表一个非常小而且微不足道的概念，根据的是你们自身系统的根本假设。在一定程度上，这并不是说这样的概念是不合理的。就拿你们自己的物质系统以及它的物质宇宙来说，所有的智能生物根本就不是类人类(humanoid)。所以，甚至在你们的这个有限概念当中，一个人类的神这个观念都几乎是无意义的，而且在很多系统当中，类人类这个词根本连一点真正的意义都没有。
This does not mean that the word indeed would have no meaning. Psychological frameworks and psychic gestalts form the basis for individual reality regardless of system. All of these do imply a whole, but the very term whole would again be meaningless if the whole, through self conscious individual parts, were not conscious of itself.这并不是说这个词事实上没有意义。心理架构和心灵完形构成个别实相的基础，不论是什么系统。这些全都隐含一个整体，但是再一次，整体这个词是没有意义的，如果整体，透过自觉的个别部分，对它自己没有意识的话。
Now you may take a break for your fingers' sake, and we shall continue.现在为了你的手指着想，你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:25. Jane said she was” pretty far-out.” The strong voice had swept her along, with few short pauses. Eyes open often, delivery active. Resume in the same manner at 9:33.)(9:25休息。珍说她“出去得蛮远的”。有力的声音把她带着走，只有少数几次停顿。眼睛常常睁开，传述活泼。在9:33分以同样的方式继续。)
Now. Your LSD and similar drugs do to some extent lift the imprinting process, though never completely.现在。你们的迷幻药和类似的药物的确提升铭印过程到某种程度，但是永远不会完全。
In some personalities they will lead to what you call a mystic experience. They will carry the personality into new realms of perception. They will momentarily break up usual patterned organizations of perception. You will see with new inner eyes. To some extent you will view some aspects of reality apart from the usual physical structures that you impose upon it as a whole. There is therefore a freedom for the inner self.在一些人格当中，它们会导致你们所谓的神秘经验。它们会带人格进入新的感知界域。它们会暂时打破平常的感知模式组织。你们会用新的内在之眼来看。在某种程度上，除了你们在它的整体上强加的一般物质结构之外，你们会看见实相的一些面向。因此内我有一种自由。
There may be a strong feeling of oneness with All That Is. This is of course much to those who have been primarily ego oriented, and it represents a meaningful breakthrough that can indeed provide the opportunity and impetus for a far more fulfilling earthly existence.可能会有一种与一切万有合一的强烈感觉。这对于那些主要是自我导向的人来说当然是很了不起的，它代表一个有意义的突破，确实能够提供机会和动力，成就一个更加充实很多的人生。
Of itself (underlined), however, it will not carry you further than this. Of itself, it will not give you insight into past lives or future existences. Of itself it will not lift you out of the framework of the physical system, but merely allow you to see that system as it is. It will allow you to experience your relationship with the system, and the system's relationship with the whole.但是，它本身(划线)不会自行带你更进一步，超越这个。它本身不会自行让你洞悉前世或来生。它本身不会自行把你从物质系统的架构拉出来，而只会让你看见那个系统的现况。它会让你体验你与系统的关系，以及系统与整体的关系。
It will not of itself transport you to other systems. Your friend's seminars(Gene Bernard’s) are within this system, in that they are composed of personalities who have been, and may again be, connected with it.它本身不会自行把你运送到其他系统。你朋友(吉恩·伯纳德)的研讨会是在这个系统之内，因为它们是由曾经而且可能再次与它连结的人格组成的。
(Long pause.)(长时间停顿)
Of itself such an experience will not give you psychological mobility through other portions that compose your own becoming psychological structure. I say here “of itself" because certain personalities will be advanced enough to use such an experience as a springboard into precisely these discoveries.这样的经验，它本身不会自行给你心理动能，经历你自己在变为中的心理结构内其他的组成部分。我在这里之所以说“它本身”是因为某些人格不够先进，而无法利用这样的经验当作跳板，正好一跃而入这些发现之中。
(Long pause.)(长时间停顿)
The ego indeed is a fiction, but a highly useful one. It is an artificial division, indeed ever changing, and yet the illusion of its existence must be maintained while you are in this existence. It need not be inflexible, with training. With training it will be willing to grant you much more freedom, and yet it will remain intact.自我的确是一个虚构之物，但是非常有用。它是一种人为的划分，实际上一直在改变，可是你在这一世的时候，它的存在也是一个必须维持的幻相，自我不需要毫无弹性。经过训练，它愿意给你的自由会多出很多，但它依然还是完整无缺。
The psychedelic experience is a most fruitful one. Drugs are not a prerequisite however. In an experience without drugs, the ego loses its substantial quality momentarily. It remains however as a protection. In all our work we have been allowing the nonphysical self more and more freedom. We have been and we are expanding consciousness, and this consciousness includes the ego.迷幻经验是一种非常有成效的经验。然而毒品并不是先决条件。在一个没有毒品的经验中，自我暂时失去它的实质，但是它仍然具有保护作用。在我们所有的工作中，我们向来允许物质的自己拥有越来越多的自由。我们一直在而且现在也正在扩展意识，这个意识包含自我在内。
We are bringing the ego inward, so to speak. It is partaking of this consciousness expansion. In the past the ego has been over exaggerated. It has ruled the roost. This does not mean that the changing pendulum must now attempt to eliminate the ego. Any expansion of consciousness must also include this portion of the self.可以说，我们正把自我带向内在。它正参与这个意识的扩展。在过去，自我被过度夸大了。它当家作主，支配一切。这并不是说摇摆不定的局面现在必定会试图排除自我。意识的任何扩展一定也包含自己的这个部分在内。
You may take your break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:54. Again Jane was well dissociated. Her delivery had again been forceful, the voice loud, the eyes open often, but the pace had slackened somewhat near the end. Resume in about the same manner at 10:00.)(9:54休息。珍再度顺利出离。她的传述再一次非常有力，声音响亮，眼睛常常睁开，但是在告一段落前，速度稍微慢了下来。10点整，以大约相同的方式继续。)
Now. Another point. The ego will act as a translator of inner experience for you. If such translations contain distortions, they are better than no translations at all, and intuition will allow you to see through the distortions.现在。 另一个重点。自我会担任你的译者，为你翻译内在经验。如果这样的翻译有扭曲，它们还是比什么翻译都没有好，而且直觉会让你能够看穿扭曲。
These will also be sifted of course through the layers of personal subconscious. The experience will still be meaningful without the ego, but it will not be as meaningful, and you will not be able to utilize in efficient manners. It must become a part of the organization of the whole present identity, you see.这些当然也会渗透到个人的一层层潜意识里。没有自我，这个经验还是有意义，但不是那么有意义，而且你无法有效利用。它一定要变成整个当下本体这个组织的一部分才可以，你知道。
It is precisely because the ego is excluded from the psychedelic experience with drugs that difficulties are encountered afterward. Given the opportunity the ego can and does merge with other portions of the self, and yet loosely maintains a psychological framework within which the experience can be translated in your terms.正因为自我被排除在使用毒品的迷幻经验之外，所以事后才会遭遇到困难。要是给自我机会，它就能够而且确实与自己的其他部分融合，但又松散地维持一个可以用你们的说法翻译这个经验的心理架构。
The psychedelic experience under these circumstances transforms the ego also in beneficial ways. Otherwise the ego is left behind, unable to perform, as a rule now, its primary functions. The ego can organize the old data when it undergoes a psychedelic experience as a part of the whole self. Then it can also organize the new data.在这些情况下的迷幻经验也以有益的方式转化自我。不然的话，自我就被抛在后头，无法执行——现在作为一个规则——它的主要功能。当自我作为全我的一部分经历一个迷幻体验时，它能够组织旧的资料。然后它也可以组织新的资料。
A trained and flexible ego will be able to momentarily relinquish its dominancy during the experience itself. We will have more to say here in connection with these advanced psychological structures, and what is called the psychedelic experience. At our next session, I will begin also to answer Ruburt's questions concerning such an experience without drugs. You have many hints, and I will give you further instruction.一个经过训练而且有弹性的自我，能够在经验本身发生期间暂时放开它的支配。这里关于这些先进的心理结构，以及所谓的迷幻经验，我们还有更多要说的。在我们的下一节，我也会开始回答鲁柏的问题，讨论如何不使用毒品而有这样的经验。你有很多提示了，而且我会给进一步的指导。
Now do you have an envelope for me?现在你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes."(“有。”
(At 10:08, Jane took the envelope for our 79th experiment from me. Her eyes closed, she raised it to her forehead in a horizontal position, as usual. Her delivery was rather fast.)(10:08分，珍从我这里拿了第79次实验的信封。她闭着眼睛，把横向的它高举到她的额头上，和往常一样。她的传述相当快。)
Give us a moment. A string of numbers. Either four numbers, the number four many times, or four separate indications on the item or object.等我们一下。一串数字。不是4个数字，就是有好几次数字4，或是在一个物件或物体上有4个分开的读数。
A spread or miscellany also. Connection with a picture. 4321 or 43111. Connection with a physical turnabout, or turnover.还有一大片或各式各样杂物。与一张图片有关联。4321或4312。与一个实质的回转或反转有关联。
