A rectangle and a square. Perhaps the square within the rectangle. And a solid horizontal line, black or dark.一个长方形和一个正方形。也许正方形是在长方形之内。还有一条水平的实线，黑色或深色。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Something by itself in the low left-hand corner. The impression is of a small image or drawing某个东西单独在左下角。印象是一个小小的画面或图画(摇头眼睛闭着)，可能代表一个地基、房子、联邦大楼或教堂，或是纪念像。印刷或压凸。
(shakes head, eyes closed) that might represent a foundation, house, federal building or church, or monument. Printed or embossed.缺
Connection with the mails, and postmark. Connection with November 6. A small round form that seems to be like a postmark or vaccination mark.与邮件和邮戳有关联。与11月6日有关联。一个小的圆形，似乎像邮戳或疫苗接种疤痕。
I do not believe the following is precisely correct here: something like tottle (my interpretation) or turtle. Perhaps having to do with a name or address.这里我不相信以下是完全正确的：像是tottle(我的解读[走路不稳])或turtle[乌龟]之类的。也许和一个名字或地址有关联。
Some indications of disaster, though this may be strong.灾难的一些征兆，但是这可能很强烈。
Connection with colored paper, I believe. An envelope. Dissonance. U.S.A. Connection with a lake or water, or a bowl.与彩色的纸张有关联，我相信。一个信封。不和谐。U.S.A(美国)。与一个湖或水域，或一个碗有关联。
A note, somehow connected with a dissatisfaction. An inordinate amount of time taken. Too many of something to hold. JB, or Ruburt; that is, Jane Butts here.一张字条，不知为保与一种不满有关联。花费过多的时间。要抓住的某个东西太多了。JB或鲁柏；也就是说，这里的珍·罗伯兹。
Connection with advice or an advisor. Four plus one. Violet or purple, and an agreeable solution to be found. A perpendicular arrangement with dots.与忠告或一个顾问有关联。4加1。紫罗兰色或紫色，以及将会找到的一个合适的解决方法。圆点的垂直排列。
The object—an envelope or letter and some reference to a third party. Connection with MG.标的物——一个信封或信件而且提到一个第三方。与MG有关联。
Do you have any questions? A connection with newspaper also.你有没有问题？也和报纸有关联。
(Jane still held the envelope to her forehead.(珍仍然把信封放在她的额头上。
("Can you say anything more about the third party?” )(“你能不能多讲一点第三方的事？”)
There seems to be a connection with your neighbor Leonard [Yaudes].似乎和你们的邻居雷那[奥迪斯]有关联。
("In what way?")(“在哪方面？”)
This could be a result of the newspaper connection. Something opened up symbolically, I believe.这可能是报纸关联导致的一个结果。在象征上有什么东西揭开了，我相信。
("Can you say anything more about the drawing?")(“你能不能多说一点图画的事？”)
In the corner?在角落？
("Yes.” )(“对。”)
I am not certain that this is a literal drawing. It may be. An organization. If you have no more questions you may take your break. If you do I will answer them.我不确定这是一幅真实的图画。它可能是。一个组织。如果你没有更多问题要问，那你可以休息了。如果你有，我会回答。
(Break at 10:27. Jane was again well dissociated. Her eyes bad remained closed, her pace good. She could recall a few images she d had while speaking, and said more would come to mind as we went over the data. At the moment she remembered something small in a left-hand corner on an envelope; of a building of some kind; and of something round like a postmark or vaccination. Note that these are vague.(10:27休息。珍再一次顺利出离。她的眼睛一直闭着，她的速度很好。她记得在讲话时有过几个画面，而且她说在我们重看资料时，会想起更多。在那一刻，她想起一个信封的左上角有某个小东西；有某种建筑物一栋；还有像邮戳或接种疤痕的某个圆形。请注意这些画面是模糊的。
(I asked Jane to handle the envelope carefully as soon as she came out of trance, and to lay it flat on the table while opening both envelopes, etc., in order to see if the small object was in a left-hand corner. Apparently it had been centered however, although shifting might have taken place.)(珍一回过神来，我就请她小心处理信封，在打开两个信封时，把它平放在桌子上等等，以便看看这个小标的物是不是在左下角。不过，它显然是在正中央，但是可能移动过了。
(See page 203for a copy of the object. As stated, it is a mock postage stamp I drew on Friday, November 23, 1966, at work. It is a spoof on Don Wilbur—” Young Donny"—and I showed it to Don and his wife, Marilyn, when they visited us that evening. The Gallaghers were also present. I thought the drawing had been passed around that evening and that Jane had seen it, but she said tonight that she had not. At any rate she had no recollection of seeing it before, to my surprise.(标的物的副本见前面所示。如上所述，它是我在1966年11月25日星期五画的一个假邮戳，用来取笑唐·韦伯——“小唐尼”——而且唐和他太太玛丽莲那天晚上来访，我把画拿给他们看。加拉格夫妇也在场。我以为那天晚上大家传着看这张画，所以珍看过它；但她今晚说她没看过。不管怎样，她一点都不记得之前见过它，出乎我的意料之外。
(Seth did not return, so Jane and I made our own connections.(赛斯没有回来，所以珍和我自己找出关联。
("A string of numbers. Either four numbers, the number four many times, or four separate indications on the item or object." The only connection we see with the object here is that a number on it is repeated—I cent is shown twice. See page 203There is a string of symbols across the bottom of the object, but mainly of letters, rather than numbers.(“一串数字。不是4个数字，就是有好几次数字4，或是在一个物件或物体上有4个分开的读数。”这里我们只看到唯一一个与标的物的关联，那就是它上面有一个重复的数字——一美分，出现了两次。见前面图所示。标的物的底部有一串符号，但主要是字母，而不是数字。
("A spread or miscellany also."(“还有一大片或各式各样杂物。”
("Connection with a picture." The object is a drawing, or picture.(“与一张图片有关联。”标的物是一幅图画，或图片。
(“4 3 2 I or 4 3 1 1 1”. No connections, except that I cent appears twice on the object.(“4321或4312。”找不到关联，除了一美分在标的物上出现两次以外。
("Connection with a physical turnabout, or turnover.” No connections.(“与一个实质的回转或反转有关联。”找不到关联。
("A rectangle and a square. Perhaps the square within the rectangle." This we think very good data. See page 203. As indicated by the pencil line on the object, the object was assembled from two pieces of white paper, with the inside piece pasted in position. The larger piece is obviously a rectangle. Actually the smaller piece is also, but inclines in proportion toward the square to a much greater degree. And this piece is within the rectangle.(“一个长方形和一个正方形。也许正方形是在长方形之内。”我们认为这是非常好的资料。见前面图。如标的物上的铅笔线条所示，标的物是由两张白纸组成的，里面那一张贴在位置上。比较大的那一第显然是一个长方形。其实比较小的这一张也是，但比例上倾向正方形的程度大很多。而且这张纸在长方形里面。
("And a solid horizontal line, black or dark". Perhaps close here. There are solid black lines on the object—both the border and the pattern on the shirt. When Jane carefully opened the double envelopes experiment, I found the object positioned thus far as I could tell:(“还有一条水平的实线，黑色或深色。”这里也许很接近。标的物上面是有黑色的实线——边框与衬衫上的图案。当珍小心翼翼展开双层信封实验时，我发现标的物的位置是：
(It has been noted that Jane held the sealed envelopes to her forehead in a horizontal position, or with their long axes parallel to the floor. Thus part of the black border on the object, or the pattern on the shirt, would appear horizontal if Seth picked this data up in a somewhat literal way.(注意珍是把密封的信封横向放在她的额头上，它们长轴与地板平行。因此，如果赛斯是以一种有点实际的方式接收这个资料的话，标的物上的一部分黑色边框，或衬衫上的图案，看起来就会是横向的。
("Something by itself in a low left-hand comer.” As noted earlier, when the double envelopes were opened the object appeared to have been centered within them. Jane said she d had an image of a small object in a comer of an envelope, however.(“某个东西单独在左下角。”之前说过，当双层信封被拆开时，标的物看起来是在它们的正中央。不过，珍说她有一个画面是，在一个信封的一处角落有个小物件。
("The impression is of a small image or drawing that might represent a foundation, house, federal building or church, or monument.” This is excellent data. The object is a drawing, and is small. See page 203.(“印象是一个小小的画面或图画，可能代表一个地基、房子、联邦大楼或教堂，或是纪念像。”这是很棒的资料。标的物是一幅图画，而且小小的。见标的物。
(In addition, the idea of a federal building enters in, in that the object is a pseudopostage stamp. Monument can also apply, for in the U.S. only deceased persons are shown on stamps; thus an appearance on a stamp is a kind of tribute and a sort of monument. Jane said she did not know of this policy. I was familiar with it through collecting stamps years ago. Telepathy here?(此外一栋联邦大楼的意念之所以进来，是因为标的物是一张假邮票。纪念像也可能适用，因为在美国只有已故的人物才会出现在邮票上；因此，在邮票上露面既是一种尊崇，也是一种纪念。珍说她不知道这个政策。我集邮多年，所以很熟悉。这里是心电感应吗？
("Connection with the mails, and postmark." More excellent data.(“与邮件和邮戳有关联。”更多绝佳的资料。
("Connection with November 6.” No connections.)(“与11月6日有关联。”找不到任何关联。
("A small round form that seems to be like a postmark or vaccination mark.” Here again Seth/Jane explores the mail connection with the object, which is a pseudopostage stamp. Jane had an image of a small round shape.(“一个小的圆形，似乎像邮戳或疫苗接种疤痕。”这里赛斯/珍再一次探索邮件与标的物的连结，标的物是一张假邮票。珍有一个画面是一个小圆形。
("Printed or embossed.” Yes. Jane said by printing here she meant my hand printing on the object, versus handwriting. Also, stamps of course are printed in production.(“印刷或压凸。”是的。珍说，这里说印刷的意思是我在标的物上的手工印染，对比手写字迹。此外，邮票的制造当然是用印刷。
(Jane also said the embossed data is legitimate, and stemmed from two things on the object: the” squiggly” frame I indicated in the drawing, and the fact that the center portion of the object had added dimension or thickness because of the two pieces of paper—actually one-ply drawing paper—being pasted together.(珍也说压凸资料是合理的，源自于标的物上的两样东西：我描在图画上那个“歪七扭八”的框，以及标的物中央部分因为两张纸的关系——其实是胶合的一层绘图纸——黏贴在一起而增加面积或变厚这个事实。
("I do not believe the following is precisely correct here: Something like tottle or turtle. Perhaps having to do with a name or address.” Jane said this was her way of getting at a connection with Don Wilbur's wife, Marilyn. The connection being that Don was spoofed on the object.(“这里我不相信以下是完全正确的：像是tottle(我的解读[走路不稳])或turtle[乌龟]之类的。也许和一个名字或地址有关联。”珍说这是她试图说明一个与唐·韦伯的太太玛丽莲的关联所用的方法。关联是，唐被标的物戏弄了。
(Jane said she went through high school with a girl named Marilyn Tuttle. She had forgotten about Marilyn Tuttle until this data cropped up.(珍说她与一个名叫玛丽莲·塔托[Marilyn Tuttle]的女孩一起读完中学。她已经忘了玛丽莲·塔托，直到这个资料出现。
("Some indications of disaster, though this may be strong." Humorously, Jane said the caricature of Don Wilbur could be called a disaster. Especially the unbeautiful features and the red eyeballs. See page 203. Actually the drawing bears no resemblance to Don, purposely being done in that manner.(“灾难的一些征兆，但是这可能很强烈。”珍语带幽默地说，唐·韦伯的卡通画像可以说是一个灾难。尤其是不好看的五官和红色的眼球。见前面图。其实这张图本来就是故意画得一点都不像唐。
("Connection with colored paper.” Both pieces of paper making up the object are white. The color red also appears on the drawing, the data may be distorted.(“与彩色的纸张有关联”组成标的物的两张纸都是白色的。红色也出现在图画上，这个资料可能扭曲了。
("An envelope." The object, being a parody of a postage stamp, calls an envelope to mind.(“一个信封。”戏谑地模仿一张邮票的标的物让人联想到信封。(“不和谐。”珍说标的物不和谐而不是和谐。我是故意把它画成这样的。
("U.S.A.” This is excellent data. See page 203. The initials U.S. appear in the line of copy across the bottom of the object: I cent U. S. Postage I cent.(“U.S.A[美国]。”这是很棒的资料。见前面图。缩写字U.S出现在标的物底部的那行文字里：一美分U.S.邮票一美分。
("Connection with a lake or water, or a bowl.” Again, very good. Marilyn and Don Wilbur live in Wellsburg, NY.(“与一个湖或水域，或一个碗有关联。”再一次，非常好。玛丽莲和唐·韦伯住在纽约州的Wellsburg[威尔斯伯格；译注：此处的well是井的意思]。
("A note, somehow connected with a dissatisfaction. An inordinate amount of time taken. Too many of something to hold. JB, or Ruburt; that is, Jane Butts here." We don't know. Without Seth’s help we cannot see connections. As stated, Jane was present when the envelope object was shown to the Wilburs on their visit here; perhaps Seth was getting at the fact that Jane didn't actually see the object that evening.(“一张字条，不知为保与一种不满有关联。花费过多的时间。要抓住的某个东西太多了。JB或鲁柏；也就是说，这里的珍·罗伯兹。”我们不知道。没有赛斯的帮忙，我们看不到关联。如上所述，当韦伯夫妇在这里作客，我给他们看信封标的物的时候，珍也在场；或许赛斯想要表达的是，那天晚上珍其实没有看到标的物的这个事实。
("Connection with advice or an advisor.” Jane said this is legitimate, and refers to my being considered a help to young people such as Marilyn and Don, who are in their early 20 s. I’m 47.(“与忠告或一个顾问有关联。”珍说这是合理的，指的是我在考虑帮助像玛丽莲和唐这样的年轻人，他们是20岁出头，我是47岁。
("Four plus one." No connections.(“4加1。”找不到任何关联。
("Violet or purple". There is red on the object.(“紫罗兰色或紫色”标的物上面有红色。
("and an agreeable solution to be found.” No connections.(“以及将会找到的一个合适的解决方法。”找不到任何关联。
("A perpendicular arrangement with dots." As noted in the sketch at the top of page 209, some of the lines on the object would be perpendicular as Jane held the envelope to her forehead. She said the dot data referred to the tiny red lines on the eyeballs of the drawing; to her they appeared to be dots, being quite small.(“圆点的垂直排列。”如前面的图所示，在珍把信封放在她额头上的时候，标的物上面的一些线条会是垂直的。她说圆点资料是指画中眼球里小的红色线条；在她看来它们像红色圆点。相当小。
("The object—an envelope or letter, and some reference to a third party." The object is not an envelope or letter; see page 203. But being a drawing of a postage stamp, it is closely related to both such data. We are not sure about Seth's reference to a third party; there could be several possibilities.(“标的物——一个信封或信件而且提到一个第三方。”标的物不是一个信封或信件；见前面所示。而是一张邮票的图画，与这两个资料的关系密切。我们不确定赛斯所说的第三方；也许有几个可能性。
("Connection with MG.” Again we are not sure. No one with those initials for instance was present on the evening the object was shown about. A possible reference: M for Marilyn Wilbur, wife of the young Don Wilbur shown on the object; and G for the Gallaghers. The Wilburs and Gallaghers being present that Friday night, November 25,1966.(“与MG有关联。”再一次我们不确定。比方说，有这些首字母的人在标的物被传阅的那天晚上没有一个在场。有一个可能是：M代表玛丽莲·韦伯，年轻的唐·韦伯之妻，标的物上面画的就是他；G是指加拉格夫妇。1966年11月25日星期五那天晚上，韦伯夫妇和加拉格夫妇在场。
("A connection with newspaper also." Quite possibly this refers to both Bill and Peggy Gallagher being employed by the local paper, The Elmira Star-Gazette. Neither of the Wilburs are connected with it.(“也和报纸有关联。”很可能这是指受雇于本地报纸《埃尔迈拉星报》的比尔和蓓·加拉格。韦伯夫妇与它没有关联。
(1st Question: Can you say anything more about the third party?“ There seems to be a connection with your neighbor Leonard [Yaudes].” As far as we know Leonard, who lives across the hall from us, has no connection with the object or Friday, November 25. We think this is a bit of data arising from the newspaper item, as will be seen below.(第一个问题：你能不能多讲一点第三方的事？“似乎和你们的邻居雷那[奥迪斯]有关联。”就我们所知，住在我们走廊对面的邻居雷那与11月25日星期五的标的物毫无关联。我们认为这是出自于报纸物件的一点资料，详见下文。
(2nd Question: “In what way ?” This could be a result of the newspaper connection. Something opened up, symbolically, I believe.” Possibly Leonard's name arose here because of the earlier newspaper data which calls the Gallaghers to mind. Leonard does have a newspaper connection with Jane and me, in that he obtains the New York Times at work, then gives it to us each day after he finishes reading it. He also gives us the Sunday edition, and various news magazines on a regular basis, so in this sensehe has a strong” news” connection with us. His name may have arisen in this data however through distortion, since it would appear the Gallaghers have a more direct newspaper connection with the object, through me.(第二个问题：在哪方面？“这可能是报纸关联导致的一个结果。在象征上有什么东西揭开了，我相信。”可能雷那的名字之所以在这里出现，是因为之前让人想起加拉格夫妇的报纸资料。雷那与珍和我的确有一个报纸的关联，因为他每天从上班的地方拿到《纽约时报》，然后看完之后给我们。他也给我们周日特刊，还定期给我们各式各样杂志，所以就这方面来说，他和我们有一个强烈的“新闻”连结。不过，他的名字出现在这个资料当中可能是由于扭曲，因为看起来经由我，加拉格夫妇与标的物有一个更直接的关联。
(Newspapers of course come up. We do not know what symbolic meaning Seth may have had in mind.(报纸当然被提到了。我们不知道赛斯想到的象征意义是什么。
(3rd Question: Can you say anything more about the drawing? “In the corner?" As noted on page 209, apparently the object was centered inside the double envelopes. Jane however had an image of a small object in a comer of an envelope.(第三个问题：你能不能多说一点图画的事？“在角落？”如前面所述，标的物显然位于双层信封的正中央。但是珍有的一个画面是，一个小物件在一个信封的一角。
("I am not certain that this is a literal drawing. It may be.” The object is a drawing. See page 203. Excellent data.(“我不确定这是一幅真实的图画。它可能是。”标的物是一幅图画。见前面所示。很棒的资料。
("An organization." Again, good data. The object is a parody of a postage stamp, which calls to mind the country’s postal organization. See the foundation data on page 209.(“一个组织。”再一次，很好的资料。标的物是一张邮票的搞笑画，让人联想到美国的邮政组织。见前面所述的基础资料。
(End.)(结束。)

SESSION 307 第307节 乱用迷幻药投射的危险性


DECEMBER 7, 1966 9 PM WEDNESDAY1966年12月7日 星期三 晚上9点
(Jane was dissociated as usual.)(珍一如往常出离。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Consciousness cannot be separated from mobility. It is true that you focus within the physical system mainly, yet the inner self is highly mobile and embarks simultaneously upon a variety of projections. The closest example in your experience of this mobility is the dream situation. These dreams make little impression upon the waking consciousness unless you train it and take it with you as far as it can go. It is then able to translate the dream reality at least in part. In the psychedelic experience the ego can be trained to act in the same manner. Later it can serve as an interpreter.意识与流动(Mobility)是无法分开的。你主要聚焦在物质系统之内，这是真的，可是内我是高度流动的，而且同时开始各式各样的投射。在你的经验中，最接近这种流动的例子就是梦中情境。
It will indeed translate the data into terms that it can understand, but without such translation the normal waking consciousness might have no record of it at all. Much of such experiences will remain untranslated. The intellect simply will not be able to contain the data. There is a point where the ego will be left behind but each time it will go further.这些梦留给醒时意识的印象很浅，除非你训练它，它能走多远，你就带着它走多远。然后它就能够至少翻译一部分的梦实相。在迷幻经验中，可以训练自我以同样的方式行动。之后它就可以担任通译。
What you must understand is that the psychedelic experience represents but a glimmering of the constant state of the inner self: not constant in terms of something static, however. With drugs, there are some dangers. There are dimensions in which you are completely incapable, and if through some molecular disturbance you fell into one of these it is possible that you could not find your way back. You do not understand me here, and it is difficult to explain. Your vocabulary is not equipped to deal with the concept. I will try.它真的会把资料翻译成它能够了解的说法，但是，没有这样的翻译，正常的醒时意识可能根本不会有任何记录。这样的经验很多将不会有翻译。理智就是容纳不了这个资料。有一个时间点是自我被留在后头，但每一次它都会再前进一步。
There are electromagnetic systems that make up experience. These may have counterparts, though not exact identities, within other systems totally alien to you as you know yourselves. Given certain unusual circumstances, you could leapfrog, so to speak, and end up within an energy gestalt from which you could not return. The personality structure simply would not take the transition.你必须了解的是，迷幻经验仅仅代表内我这个持续状态的短暂一瞥；然而持续的并不是某个静止的东西。使用毒品，是有一些危险的。有一些维度是你完全无能为力的，而且，如果经由某种分子的骚动，你落入这些维度的其中之一，你是可能找不到路回去的。这里你不了解我，而且解释起来并不容易。你认识的字汇不足以应付这个观念。我会试试看。
Very vaguely indeed, this could be compared to a voice from one station suddenly being captured by another. There is much more here, almost impossible at present to explain. There are, from your standpoint, minutely sized systems that within themselves are infinite. You could be drawn into an entirely different value fulfillment system. All of this is very improbable, but it is possible and under drugs such experiences could result.有组成经验的电磁系统。在其他对你们所知的自己完全陌生的系统之内，这些可能有对等之物，但不是一模一样的本体。如果有某些不寻常的状况，你可能会——可以说——青蛙跳，最终跳进一个能量完形之内而回不来。人格结构根本承受不了这个转变。
Thoughts, as you know, contain their own electromagnetic reality. This means that each thought is an electromagnetic system in fact and not just in theory. Such a system is the basis for your physical system and these are highly valid. Theoretically only, with drugs it would be possible to be lost within an idea, caught in its electromagnetic reality, and forced to follow the ramifications and developments of the idea in various guises. The value fulfillment system would be changed. There would be development within that system, but you would be lost to your own system.关联的确微乎其微，但这还是可以比作是来自一个站台的声音，突然被另一个站台捕捉到。这里还有很多东西，当下几乎不可能解释得了。从你的位置看来，是有尺寸微小的系统，但在它们之内却是无限的。你不可能被拉进一个完全不同的价值完成系统里。这一切很难置信，但是有可能，而且在毒品的作用下，这样的经验是可能发生的。
I mention such possibilities because such situations have not been dreamed of, and they should be taken into consideration. Such experiences without drugs could happen not at all. The alarmed personality would quickly return. In the case of drugs however the chemical framework might delay such a return until it was too late.如你所知，思想包含它们自己的电磁实相。这意味着每一个思想事实上都是一个电磁系统，而且不只是理论。这样一个系统是你们物质系统的基础，而且这些是非常有效的。只是在理论上，使用毒品，是有可能迷失在一个意念之中，陷入它的电磁实相之内，被迫跟随这个意念在各式各样伪装下产生的后果与发展。价值完成系统会为之改变。在那个系统之内会有发展，但你会把你自己的系统抛在脑后。
The chemicals you see alter the system that you inhabit, as well as your own perceptions of it. It is speeded up in many respects, and the problem is almost like returning to a moving ship in space, only the motion involved is consciousness. You would not have a stationary station to return to.我之所以提到这样的可能性，是因为这样的情况没有被梦见过，而且它们应该被纳入考虑。没有毒品，这样的经验根本不可能发生。受到惊吓的人格会快速返回。不过，在使用毒品的案例中，化学架构可能会耽搁这样的返回，直到为时已晚。
In trance states, there is a more or less stationary system waiting, so to speak. In trance states, consciousness itself brings about the chemical changes within it as it, consciousness, travels. Changes do occur within the body. When consciousness alters its direction it automatically alters the physical system. When it is ready to return the physical system is automatically prepared to receive it.你知道化学物质会改变你所在的系统，以及你自己对它的感知。它在很多方面加快了速度，问题在于，几乎就像返回一艘太空中行进的飞船一样，只不过移动的意识。你不会有一个停住不动的站台可以返回。
Now in the drug situation the state of consciousness desired is brought about by altering chemical properties. Consciousness, travelling, cannot automatically manipulate the physical station. Consciousness must stay out, you see, until the chemical situation has changed.在出神状态中，可以说，或多或少有一个停住不动的系统等着。在出神状态中，当它——意识——在旅行时，它本身会带来化学变化。变化的确会在身体之内发生。当意识改变它的方向时，它会自动改变身体系统。当它准备要返回时，身体系统就会自动准备接收它。
If difficulties arise, there is no stable station to receive the returning consciousness. This does not seem to be a problem now, for the travelers are new at this. As their members increase, however, some of these difficulties may bring problems.现在，在毒品的情境中，借由改变化学属性而带来渴望的意识状态。意识，在旅行中，无法自动操纵身体站台。意识必须待在外面，你看，直到化学情况改变为止。
You may take a break and we shall continue.如果发生困难，就没有任何稳定的站台接收返回的意识。现在这似乎不是问题，因为旅行者在这方面是新手。然而，随着成员的增加，这些困难有些可能带来问题。
(Break at 9:35.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Resume at 9:44.)(9:35休息。9:45继续。)
The chemical doorway into inner reality is indeed a doorway. In one regard, this is a projection from a molecular standpoint. What is not understood is that worlds exist between one molecule and another, and worlds that you do not understand. You could get lost in the life and death of a molecule under such conditions, and I am speaking in literal terms.进入内在实相的化学门户确实是一个门户。一方面，这是从一个分子的立场所做的一次投射。没有被了解的地方是，存在于一个分子与另一个分子之间的世界，以及你们不了解的世界。在这样的状况下，你们可能迷失在一个分子的生与死之中，而且我在说的是实际的状况。
The chemical changes propel consciousness outward, or far inward. This is aside: A small dose of salt, regular salt, taken with the drugs would help maintain a certain stability. It has a binding action on consciousness and acts as a cohesive.化学变化把意识往外推，或往内推到很远的地方。这是悄悄话：一小撮盐巴，一般的盐巴，与毒品一起吸食，有助于维持某种程度的稳定。它会对意识产生约束力，而具有黏着的作用。
The chemical changes brought about by such outside agents as drugs to some degree rob the inner self of its usual directive abilities, for the changes occur before the inner self has gathered itself together. It is not as psychically organized as it is in such experiences without drugs.像毒品这种外在媒介带来的化学变化，某种程度让内我丧失它平常的指挥能力，因为在内我把它自己集合起来之前，变化已经发生了。它不像在没有药物的情况下经验的那样有精神组织。
This is somewhat like drugging a child about to be born as a side effect of drugging the mother to make the birth easier, you see. Without drugs, the psychedelic experience will not occur unless circumstances are excellent from all aspects. There is little danger involved, as a rule. The chemical changes are automatically byproducts of the mobility of consciousness in such situations.这有点像是为了让生产更容易而对产妇下药，你知道，结果副作用之一就是即将出生的孩子也被下药了。没有毒品，迷幻经验不会发生，除非每一方面都具备绝佳的条件。在一般的状况下，涉及的危险不大。化学变化是意识流动在这样的情况下自动产生的副产品。
The inner self is highly capable and follows certain electromagnetic routes which it knows, and avoids other routes. Signals from the body reach it constantly. It is in immediate contact with the body on certain levels: survival levels. With these conditions satisfied, it can indeed travel further, so to speak, than in such an experience with drugs. I am comparing now the drug and drugless experiences at their best.内我很有能力而且也会跟着它知道的某些电磁路径走，避开其他的路径。身体发出的信号持续不断传送到它那里。在某些层面，亦即存活层面上，它与身体是直接联系的。这些条件一旦达成，可以说，比起使用毒品而获得这样的经验，它确实能够旅行到更远的地方。我此刻在做比较的是，使用毒品与不使用毒品在最佳状态下的经验。
I am not denying that the drug experience can be excellent, however. There is a nitrogen balance that is disturbed in the drug experience. There is an ingredient in nuts also that will aggravate certain conditions if nuts are consumed within ten hours before the drug experience. If this happens, then the individual may be tossed back into a similar drug experience when nuts are consumed, even though no drug is given. There are other substances that also have this effect.不过，我并没有否认吸毒经验有可能很棒。在吸毒经验中，有一种氮的平衡受到干扰。还有，在吸毒经验之前10个小时之内，如果食用了坚果，坚果当中有一个成分会让某些状况恶化。如果发生了这种事，那么就算没有使用毒品，个体可能也会被扔回类似食用坚果的吸毒经验中。还有其他的药物也有这种作用。
I suggest your break.我建议你休息一下。
(Break at 10:05. (Resume 10:14.)(10:05休息，10:14继续。)
Now, I do intend to give you further instructions and I will. The drugs now given allow experience in one main direction only. We will have more maneuverability. Different drugs yet to be discovered will allow consciousness travel in some other directions, but when a chemical is used, it will largely determine the systems that may be explored.现在，我的确打算给你进一步的指导，而且我一定会给。现在已给的毒品只允许一个主要方向的经验。我们将会有更多的机动性。还没有被发现的不同毒品将会使意识能够往一些其他的方向旅行，但是，一旦使用化学物质，大部分将会由它来决定哪些系统可能被探索。
Consciousness on its own has a larger choice. The North-South position is still the best body position, though other positions may be used. This applies to either the drug or drugless experience. For various reasons, the time of the full moon is most beneficial. Rainy weather is an aid. For Ruburt, the time of ovulation is good.单独靠它自己，意识有更大的选择。身体的最佳位置仍然是头朝北、脚朝南，但是其他的位置也可能会用到。使用或不使用毒品的经验，这都适用。由于各种不同的原因，满月的时候最有利。雨天是一个辅助。对鲁柏来说，排卵期是好时机。
There should not be any rubber on or near the body, nor on the legs of the bed, for example. Citrus fruits are an aid. The acid here, has electrical properties that help. I am not speaking now you see necessarily of projections, though these may occur. That is, the experience may or may not deal with projection in another image. Aspirin is a detriment, incidentally, usually.身体上面或附近以及北方说床脚，都不应该有任何橡胶物品。柑橘类的水果是一个辅助。这里果酸具备的电子属性是有帮助的。你知道，我现在不一定是在说投射，但是投射是有可能发生的。也就是说，这个经验可能是可能不是和另一个形象的投射打交道。顺便说一下，通常，阿司匹林是一种有害之物。
These are very simple suggestions. At our next session we shall go into this more deeply and define the psychedelic experience for you. There are many reasons why” illumination” (in quotes) occurs in the third and fourth decade. Such illumination represents the first contact of the ego with its inner self, and is only a beginning.这些是非常简单的建议。在我们的下一节，我们会更深入说明这件事，以为你定义迷幻经验。为什么“启发”(加引号Illumination)会发生在第三和第四个10年，有很多的原因。这样的启发代表自我与它的内我第一次接触，而且这只是一个开始而已。
If you have no questions, we will close the session.如果你没有任何问题，我们就结束这一节。
("I guess not.")(“我想没有。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。
("Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(Jane was dissociated as usual. When talking about leapfrogging from molecule to molecule she said that she began to feel the concept; experienced it to some degree as she spoke for Seth.)(珍一如往常出离。谈到用青蛙跳从一个分子到另一个分子的时候，珍说她开始感觉到这个概念；在她为赛斯说话的同时，某种程度体验到它。)
(Copy of the memo slip used as the 80th envelope object, in the 308th session for December 12,1966.)便条副本，在1966年12月12日第308节的第80次信封实验用作标的物

SESSION 308 第308节 迷幻体验 意识的扩展 信封80


DECEMBER 12, 1966 9 PM MONDAY1966年12月12日 星期一 晚上9点
(The memo pad slip used as the 80th envelope object is printed in a dark chocolate brown on a paper that is a rather bright orange brown of middle value. It was folded once horizontally as indicated, although there were vertical fold marks in it also. It was placed between the usual double Bristols and sealed in the usual double envelopes.(第80次信封实验使用便条本的一张纸当作标的物，它是用深巧克力棕色印刷在纸上，纸张本身是一种亮度中等的橘褐色，相当鲜艳。如图所示，它是横向对折一遍，但是也有纵向的折痕。它被夹在一般的两层西卡纸中间，密封在双层信封里。
(Jane began speaking in trance at an average rate.)(珍在出神中开始讲话，速度不疾不徐。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. The psychedelic experience is primarily the expansion of consciousness. This implies inner mobility.现在。迷幻经验主要是意识的扩展。这意味着内在的流动。
With training some direction can be given, so that the information can be effectively used by the normal waking personality. With such training these experiences will lead you to other portions of your own entity. This is rather important.借由训练，可以给出某个方向，如此一来，正常的醒时人格就能够有效利用资讯。借由这样的训练，这些经验会把你带到你自己存有的其他部分。这是相当重要的。
The personality becomes aware of parts that deal with other dimensions. It learns to manipulate with other root assumptions. The mobility experience automatically adds value fulfillment. Memory of past lives can be achieved under some circumstances.人格逐渐觉知那些与其他维度打交道的部分。它学会用其他的根本假设来操纵。流动的经验自动增进价值完成。在某些情况下，前世的记忆是可以取得的。
Our sessions are experiences in the expansion of consciousness. There will be questions as to whether or not some images in some such periods are legitimate or imaginary. The questions of course will be meaningless. The images will be quite valid in their own system, and if you travel within it you will see them.我们的课就是在意识扩展当中的经验。将会有许多问题是关于在一些这样的期间，某些形象是否确有其人或是想像。当然问题是毫无意义的。形象在它们自己的系统里是相当有效的，如果你在它之内旅行，就会看见它们。
This does not mean that they will appear within your own system however. They are as real and as unreal as physical objects. Little attention has been given to the pathways opened, even in the physical brain, as the result of psychedelic experiences. Those portions of the brain, seemingly unused, deal with these other dimensions, and physically (underlined), you begin to use these portions, though minutely, for the first time, under psychedelic situations.然而，这并不是说它们会出现在你自己的系统之内。它们和实质物体一样真实，也一样不真实。太少注意力放在开启的门户上，甚至在肉体的大脑里也是一样，那是迷幻经验造成的结果。大脑当中那些看似没有被使用过的部分，与这些其他部分的维度打交道，而且在生理上(划线)，你第一次在迷幻的情况下开始使用这些部分，尽管程度微小。
Once these physical pathways are opened, the way becomes easier. The pineal, pituitary, and thalamus are important here. The salt mentioned earlier has a connection with the thyroid. The physical brains alone, the unused portions, have it within their ability, for example, to hear color, to smell sound; in other words, these portions contain among other things functions, unused mainly, that would allow you to perceive physical reality in various other fashions. These undifferentiated areas existed first before the specialized senseapparatus was uniformly adopted. As a species you could just as easily have smelled color rather than viewed it, you see. These portions of the brain, once activated, then allow you to switch sense impressions from one sense mechanism to another, you see.一旦开启这些生理门户，路就比较好走了。松果体、脑垂体和丘脑在这里是重要的。之前提过的盐巴和甲状腺有一种关联。单单是肉体的大脑，没有使用过的部分，在它们的能力之内就有它，比方说，听见颜色、闻到声音；换句话说，这些部分的功能，主要是没有使用的部分，还包含让你能够以各种其他方式感知物质实相的功能。早在专门化的感觉器官被统一采用之前，这些未分化的部位就已经存在。
It is like your stereophonic reality from many levels. You are operating on mono, you see, as a rule. There is no doubt that this sort of experience is new to the ego, which is used to interpreting Sense data in highly rigid and specialized terms.作为一个族类，你们本来一样能够轻松闻到而不是看见颜色，你知道。脑部的这些部位一旦启动，就会让你能够从一个感官机制到另一个感官机制，转换感官印象，你知道。
With our methods the ego is taken into confidence, you see.它就像你的立体声实相，来自很多层面。你在单声道运作，你知道，一般而言。毫无疑问，这类经验对自我来说是前所未有的，但它却被用来翻译感官资料，而且说法非常死板又专门化。
(Long pause.) Insanity, as it is labeled, is sometimes merely the result of a strange situation, in which certain individuals use the ordinarily dormant portions of the brain as well as, or sometimes largely in place of, the recognized portions. The perception of reality is therefore largely alien to society.借由我们的方法，自我被当作知己，你看。(长时间停顿)贴在它身上的标签——精神失常，有时候仅仅只是一个陌生情况造成的结果，某些个体在其中会使用大脑平常休眠的部分，也会使用已经认得的部分，或有时候大部分取代了后者。实相的感知因此与社会多半格格不入。
It is possible (underlined) that the psychedelic experience for these individuals would involve consciousness expansion directed toward (underlined) usual physical reality, and bring about a more unified personality structure from society's standpoint. Insanity as a term means nothing. All mental life is characterized by divergent perceptions of any given set of Sense data that is recognized as Reality, with a capital R.对这些个体而言，迷幻经验是有可能(划线)涉及到意识扩展的方向朝着(划线)惯常的物质实相，而产生一个从社会立场看来比较统一的人格结构。精神失常这个字眼没有任何意义。所有心智生活的特征都来自于，在任何一套被认为可为实相(Reality)——R用大写——的既定感官资料当中各有不同的感知。
Those who perceive this set of data in such a way that agreement is reached are called sane. But none of you perceives the same reality. Those whose ideas and perceptions of reality are completely out of line with the general agreement are called insane. The terms only show that reality as you know it is the result of private perceptions. Reality is built up as a result of these private perceptions.那些以这样一种达成协议的方式感知这套资料的人被称为神智正常。但是你们没有一个人感知相同的实相。那些意念和感知完全与一般协议脱节的人被称之为精神失常。这些字眼只表示你们所知的实相是私人感知的结果。实相的建立是这些私人感知的一个结果。
The Emotional impact behind them determines their strength. They are passed on telepathically. You recall however that individuals receive in certain electromagnetic patterns, or pattern ranges, far better than they do in others. Some individuals therefore will simply not telepathically receive the dominating reality assumptions, but will be tuned to different ranges, highly unsatisfactory to them. It becomes quickly apparent that their view of reality is entirely different from their neighbors.在它们背后的情绪冲击决定它们的强弱。它们透过心电感应传送。不过你记得，个体在某些电磁模式或模式范围当中，远比在其他模式当中接收得更好。因此有些个体根本不会透过心电感应接收主导的实相假设，而是对准不同的范围，这让他们非常不满意。很快就显而易见的是，他们对实相的观点完全不同于他们的邻居。
I suggest your break and we shall continue.我建议你休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:27. Jane out as usual; pace good, eyes open, etc. Resume at 9:35.)(9:27休息。珍一如往常出去了；速度不错，双眼睁开等等。9:39继续。)
Now. On other terms psychedelic experience, with or without drugs of course, enlarges the range of electromagnetic realities that you perceive.现在。换句话说，迷幻经验，使用或不使用毒品，当然都会扩大你们感知的电磁实相范围。
Barriers are cut away, and once you become used to receiving within a larger range you will be able to do so in your future. These ranges, once opened up, then do not entirely close up to you. It becomes easier for you in your future to receive within them. A disciplined but intuitive ego then becomes a necessity in order that such new experience may be brought under useful control, in your (underlined) terms. The ego become more necessary you see, not less, for it must learn to synthesize the gained experience in recognizable terms within your system. Otherwise if the ego is pushed aside it will rise up in arms and in opposition, and can be highly dangerous.障碍被铲除，一旦你习惯在更大的范围之内接收时，你在你的未来也能够这么做。这些范围一旦打开，往后就不会对你完全封闭。在你的未来，你会更容易在它们之内接收。一个自律但直觉的自我接着会变成必要，好让这样的新经验可以得到有用的控制，按照你们的(划线)话来说。自我变得更有必要，你看，而不是更没必要，因为它必须学会在你们的系统之内用可以辨认的方式合成已有的经验。否则，自我要是被晾在一旁，它就会武装起来，进行反抗，所以可能非常危险。
It goes without saying that in our methods the ego is changed rather completely but gradually in many cases, and only through its own willingness to do so. It recognizes its identity as a part of. underlined, the inner self. Therefore basically it has no need to fight the inner self, since it knows its survival is dependent upon this inner framework.不用说也知道，用我们的方法，在很多的案例中，自我是逐渐而不是彻底改变，而且是按照它自己的意愿这么做。它认清它的本体是内我的一部分，划线。因此基本上，这不需要与内我抗争，因为它知道它的生存仰赖这个内在架构。
The ego to some large extent, you see, has extended its functions and performance. Since our sessions began, for example, it has expanded in both of your cases. It has expanded not because it has grown more egotistic but because it has accepted as a part of itself, intuitional realizations and inner psychic responsibilities in a way that it did not consider before.自我在很大的程度上，你知道，扩展了它的功能和表现。打从我们开始上课，比方说，它在你们两人身上都扩展了。它之所以扩展，并不是因为越来越以自我为中心，而是因为它以它之前不曾考虑过的方式，接受直觉的领悟与内在的心灵责任是它自己的一部分。
In other words, portions of the inner self have joined the strictly egotistical functions. The ego in such cases is so attuned that it becomes almost something else. We are coming here toward a definition of illumination in psychic terms. The ego is not, underlined, banished. It joins with portions of the inner self previously unconscious, and illuminates the whole personality. It is no longer primarily physically oriented. Therefore it is no longer an ego in the terms usually meant.换句话说，内我的许多部分与完全以自我为中心的功能结合了。在这样的案例中，自我是如此的通情达理，以至于几乎脱胎换骨。自我不——划线——是被放逐。它与之前内我中无意识的许多部分结合，启发了整个人格。它不再是主要以物质为导向了。因此按照一般说法的定义，它不再是一个自我。
Again, this is an important point. The ego has accepted the goals of the inner self. Its identity has already changed, so that its main concern, underline main, is no longer primarily with physical manipulation, but with inner growth and development.再一次，这是重要的一点。自我已经接受内我的目标。它的本体已经改变，如此一来，它主要的关注，主要的画线，不再是以物质操纵为主，而是内在的成长和发展。
This does not mean that it ignores its earlier functions. In true expansion of consciousness then, you become more and more aware, more conscious, underlined, of inner realities that were previously never realized on a conscious level. Since the ego is presently your main vehicle of consciousness, it will not be obliterated. It will indeed be resurrected. It simply changes not only its form, but its inner core, accepting as a part of itself realities which it previously ignored out of fear, ignorance and insecurity.这并不是说它无视于它之前的功能。所以在真实的意识扩展中，你对于之前在意识层面上从来不曾了解的内在实相变得越来越有觉知，越来越有意识，划线。因为自我目前是你主要的意识载具，所以这不会被消灭。它事实上会复活。它根本不只是改变形式而已，还改变它的内在核心，接受它之前出于恐惧、无知与不安全感而忽视的实相是它的一部分。
It becomes more and more a portion of the supraconsciousness. Its new function is to help direct the overall personality so that inner abilities and illuminations can also reach physical reality.它变得越来越是超意识的一部分。它的新功能是帮忙指挥整体人格，好让内在的能力和启发也能够影响物质实相。
You may take a brief break and we shall continue.你可以短暂休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:54. Resume at 10:05. Pace good.)(9:54休息。10:05继续。速度不错。)
The material in tonight’s session is highly relevant, and we shall continue it.今晚这一节的资料是非常有意义的，我们会继续下去。
The ego has completely changed its structure. It has changed its electromagnetic identity in your cases, since our sessions. It has learned, to some extent, to assimilate your inner experiences. In the long run this is the most effective method. And in the long run no consciousness expansion can occur unless the ego structure is so altered.自我完全改变了它的结构。在你们的安全中，因为我们的课，它改变了它的电磁本体。到某种程度，它已经学会消化吸收你的内在经验。长期来看，这是最有效的方法。而且长期来看，没有任何意识的扩展能够发生，除非自我的结构改变了。
There are other methods that also alter it, but our methods are the most advantageous from many standpoints.有其他方法也会改变它，但是我们的方法从很多观点看来都比较有利。
Now. Do you have envelope?现在。你有没有信封？
("Yes."(“有。”
(At 10:09 Jane took the envelope for the 80th experiment from me. Her eyes open, she gestured with the envelope as she held it in a plainly horizontal position. I could see the folds on its back. After speaking she held it to her forehead as usual, eyes closed.)(10:09分，珍从我这里拿了第80次实验的信封。她的眼睛睁开，拿着明显是横向的信封，用它比手势。我可以看到它背面的折痕。讲了话之后，她一如往常把信封放在额头上，闭着眼睛。)
Give us a moment, please. For your benefit, you can see from the back of the envelope the position in which I hold it. Now these are impressions.请给我们一点时间。为了你好，你可以从信封背面看到我拿着它的位置。现在这些是印象。
A capital G. I am reaching for a word that sounds like grow, or Gomez. Green.一个大写的G。我正在抓一个听起来像grow(成长)或Gonez(戈梅兹)的字。Green(绿色)。
Ananaliation.Ananaliation(译注：此字无意义，纯粹按照发音拼字)。
(Searching for a word evidently, Jane rolled this one off quickly. This is my interpretation of it. I asked her to repeat it.)(珍显然是在搜寻一个字，很快冲口而出这个字。这是我对它的解读。我请她再读一遍。)
Analeation. Alienate. Things separate from another. A going apart.Analeation(译注：此字无意义，纯粹按照发音拼字)。Alienate(离开)。事物彼此分离。一种分开。
Something by proxy.经由代理的某件事。
(Pause.) Music or Muzak. Connection with a mission or missionary. One eight four one. One seven three one.音乐或罐头音乐。与一个任务或肩负任务者有关联。1841。1731。
Squares that are interconnected, and the color black.彼此相连的正方形，以及黑色。
Connection with a grocery, and vegetables.与一家食品杂货店以及蔬菜有关联。
A minus sign. A circumstance with unknown ending. Someone wonders how something will come out.一个减号。一个结局未知的状况。有人想知道某件事将会如何发展。
Orange, and a blemish. Four plus one, and an initial explosion, or first-time happening.橘色，以及一个污点。4加1，以及一个最初的爆发，或是第一次发生。
A note and a sender who is not feeling well. This is vague. A mid-thirty connection here, or three five perhaps.一张短信以及一个感觉不适的寄信人。这很模糊。这里有一个35的连结，也许是35。
A great variety, or overall picture. An arrangement that has similarity to a calendar page. A small calendar page.种类繁多的变化，或全貌。类似一张日历的一种安排。一小张日历。
Dark green. A bill. 1631. Stringy, or to do with string.深绿。一张账单。1631。状似绳子，或与绳子有关。
(Pause.) Several occurrences with a star.(停顿)与一颗星星有关的几个事件。
An unforeseen circumstance involving three or three dollars approximately. One large dark numeral or initials towards the top, perhaps in a corner.一个预料之外的状况，牵涉到大约三或三元美金。靠近最上面有一个深色的大型数字或首字母，也许是在一个角落。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Something with dimension and depth suggested—that is, the object. The feeling now, about the object, of something transparent, or that opens up without actually opening up.某个暗示尺寸和深度的东西——也就是说，标的物。现在，关于标的物，感觉是某个透明，或没有真的打开却打开了的东西。
Something that is mine, and to do with a group accomplishment. A calendar date.属于我，而且和一个团体成就有关的某个东西。一个日历上的日期。
Do you have questions?你有没有问题？
("Can you give me a date connected with the object?")(“你能不能给我一个与标的物有关的日期？”)
The number four. I do not know. Some future connection it would seem—January or February perhaps.数字4。我不知道。它似乎与未来有某种关联——也许是1月或2月。
("Can you elaborate upon the capital G?")(“你能不能详细说明大写的G？”)
No. Ruburt thinks now of Grumbacher.不能。鲁柏现在想到Grumbacher(格朗姆巴却尔，译注：颜料画材的品牌品)。
("How about several occurrences with a star?")(“与一颗星星有关的几个事件是怎么回事？”)
Toward a starred event.关于一个加上星号的事件。
("What material is the object made of?")(“标的物是用什么材质做的？”)
Paper, but with a fabric feel.纸，但是有一种布料的触感。
(Jane finally lowered the envelope to her lap; eyes closed.(珍终于把信封拿下来，放在她的大腿上；闭着眼睛。
("How about color?")(“那颜色呢？”)
Some we have mentioned. Dark. Like a photograph; in shadow, but for this fabricky connection. Then if you have no more questions, I suggest your break.有些我们已经提过了。深色。像一张照片；在阴影中，但是就类似布料的关联而言。那么，如果你没有更多问题要问，我建议你休息一下。
("Can you say a little something about the group accomplishment?")(“你能不能说一点团体成就的事？”)
Just that my impression is of heads, and four of them, in silhouette.只不过就是我的头部，而且是四颗头，在剪影中的印象。
("Okay”(“好。”
(Break at 10:25. Jane was well dissociated, she said. Her eyes remained closed, her pace good.(10:25休息。珍说她出离顺利。她的眼睛依然闭着，她的速度不错。
(See page 216. The object was a memo slip from the Jewish Community Center in Elmira; from the desk of Gladys H. Austin, secretary to the Center's director, Mr. Miller. It is printed in a dark chocolate brown on rather bright orange brown paper. It was folded once horizontally in the double envelopes, as indicated, although there were also vertical fold marks in it.(见前面描图。标的物是一张便条纸，来自于埃尔迈拉的犹太社区中心[Jewish Community Center,简称JCC]；来自于该中心主任米勒[Miller]先生的秘书葛蕾蒂丝·H·奥斯汀[Gladys H. Austin]的桌上。它是用深巧克力棕色印刷在相当鲜艳的橘褐色纸张上，横向对折之后放在双层信封内，如图所示，但是它上面也有纵向的折痕。
(I found the object in my jacket pocket on December 1, without knowing how it got there. I decided to use it as an object, then forgot about it. That evening when we did the wash the jacket was included in the bad. Jane emptied the jacket's pockets, and so handed the object; but it was folded and she did not recognize it. To the best of her recall she hadn’t seen the object, or needed it, since shortly after November 8,1966.(12月1日，我在我的夹克口袋里发现了标的物，却不知道它怎么跑到那里的。我决定用它当标的物，然后就忘了。我们那天晚上洗衣服时，夹克也在待洗衣物中。珍清理夹克口袋，所以碰触过标的物，但它是对折的，所以她不认得。就她记忆所及，打从1966年11月8日，她就没有见过标的物，也不需要它。
(On Friday, November 4, Jane cabled about a job teaching nursery school at the JCC. She was given an appointment with Mr. Milbr for Tuesday, November 8, by Gbdys Austin. On November 8, Gbdys wrote out the memo slip used as object, bearing the name of Mrs. Methinitus, another teacher with whom Jane would work. The name is written in ordinary black pencil. Jane met Nancy Methinitus on Wednesday, November 9, and began teaching Monday, November 14 at the JCC. Sometime after Gladys Austin wrote out the memo slip on Nov. 8, the folded slip found its way into my jacket pocket.(11月4日星期五，珍打电话询问在JCC幼儿园教书的工作。葛雷蒂丝·奥斯汀安排她在11月8日星期二与米勒先生见面。11月8日当天，葛蕾蒂丝写了这张用作标的物的便条，上面是莫辛尼特斯太太的名字，她是将会与珍一起共事的另一个老师。这个名字是用一般的黑色铅笔写的。珍在11月9日星期三与南希·莫辛尼特斯[Nancy Methinitus]见到面，并于11月14日星期一开始在JCC教书。葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀在11月18日写了这张便条之后某一天，对折的纸条神不知鬼不觉地跑到我的夹克口袋里。
(Seth did not return after 10:25, so Jane and I made our own connections. Jane said she had images while giving the data, but as usual could not pinpoint them until we began going over the data item by item.(赛斯在10:25之后没有再回来，所以珍和我自己找出关联。珍说她在给出资料时有一些画面，但一如往常无法确定它们，直到我们开始逐条检视资料。
("A capital G." See the copy of the object on page 216. The name Gladys H. Austin is seen in the upper right-hand corner of the memo slip; in capitals.(“一个大写的G。”标的物的副本见前面。在便条的右上角有葛蕾蒂丝·H·奥斯汀这个名字；大写字母。
("lam reaching for a word that sounds like grow, or Gomez.” Jane said that here she thought of Gomez Addams, a character in the Addams Family TV program— and that the similarity lay in the initials G A, for both Gomez Addams and Gladys Austin.(“我正在抓一个听起来像grow[成长]或Gonez[戈梅兹]的字。”珍说这里她想到Gonez Addams[戈梅兹·亚当斯]，电视节目《阿达一族》[Addams Family]的一个角色——她还说，在Gomez Addams和Gladys Austin两者当中，也有缩写都是GA的情形。
(I think it possible this data came to mind because of the phonetic or sibilant similarity between the names Gladys and Gomez.缺
("Green.” Jane said that strange as it seems, green reminds her of lettuce, and lettuce in turn reminds her of Gladys Austin, whose name appears on the object. Jane doesn't know why, but when she met Gladys for the first time she thought of lettuce. Jane considered the possibilities in rhyme, since she is a poet: Gladys, lettuce, etc., as perhaps calling up such an association.(“Green[绿色]”珍说尽管看似奇怪，但绿色让她想到莴苣[lettuce]，而莴苣又让她想到名字出现在标的物上的葛勒蒂丝·奥斯汀。珍不知道为什么，但是她第一次见到葛勒蒂斯，就想到莴苣。珍认为可能是押韵的关系，因为她是诗人：Gladys[葛勒蒂丝]、lettuce[译注：发音为雷特斯]等等，引发了这样的一个联想。
("Alienate. Things separate from another. A going apart. Something by proxy." Jane thought all this data an attempt to get at the name Gladys Austin on the memo used as object. Gladys, as Mr. Miller 's secretary, served as a go-between, Jane said, between Jane, Nancy Methinitus, and Mr. Miller. It was Gladys who finally informed Jane she had the job at the JCC, for instance.(“Alienate[离开]。事物彼此分离。一种分开。经由代理的某件事。”珍认为这个资料全部都是要表达用作标的物的便条上葛蕾蒂斯·奥斯汀这个名字的尝试。珍说，米勒先生的秘书葛蕾蒂斯担任珍、南希·莫辛尼特斯和米勒先生的中间人。比方说，最后通知珍JCC录取了她的人就是葛蕾蒂丝。
("Music or Muzak.” Music is involved in Jane's job at the JCC. In the downstairs playroom at the JCC, Jane and Nancy play a record player for their young charges, which is similar to the Musak recorded sound system. On a Friday afternoon Jane and Nancy took the class to an upstairs room at the JCC, where Nancy played the piano. This room was next door to the office of Gladys Austin who came in to listen.(“音乐或罐头音乐。”珍在JCC的工作牵涉到音乐。在JCC楼下的游戏室，珍和南希为她们照顾的幼童播放电唱机，这和罐头音乐录音系统类似。在一个星期五的下午，珍和南希把全班带到JCC楼上的一个房间，南希在那里弹钢琴。这个房间就在葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀的办公室隔壁，她也进来聆听。
("Connection with a mission or missionary.” Jane said this is good data, in that the Jewish Community Center is a sufficiently religious organization, and so quite conscious about the celebration of Christmas, etc., being strict about how this is done. This week also Jane read the class a story about Hanukkah. In addition, the center is located on Church Street, in Elmira.(“与一个任务或肩负任务者有关联。”珍说这是好资料，因为犹太社区中心是一个宗教色彩十足的组织，所以相当重视圣诞节等等的庆祝活动，对于如何安排态度严肃。这周珍也为全班说了一个光明节[Hanukkah]的故事。此外，该中心就位于埃尔迈拉的教堂街[Church Street]。
("1841, 1731." No connections; unless, as Jane speculates, these figures are an attempt to get at her wages from the job at the JCC. The job is a part-time one and Jane is paid twice a month. The figures vary, consequently. Jane's pay statement for November 30,1966for instance shows a total of $36.00-1841 and 1731 added together total 3572.(“1841。1731。”没有任何关联；除非，像珍推测的，这些数字试图传达的是她在JCC工作的薪资。这是一个兼职工作，珍一周领两次薪水。因此，数目不一。比方说1966年11月30日，珍的薪资单显示总额是36美金。1841和1731加在一起的总额是3572。
(The address of the JCC is 115 East Church Street.(JCC的地址是东教堂街115号。
("Squares that are interconnected, and the color black.” Jane said this is a reference to the three big windows in the playroom where she teaches at the JCC. Each window is divided up into many small panes a few inches on a side, and all have black molding or frames. The panes themselves are not colored.(“彼此相连的正方形，以及黑色。”珍说这是指她在JCC教课的游戏室里面那三片大窗。每个窗户都用线条隔成一边几英寸长的小空格，而且全都有黑色的线板或方框。镶条本身没有上色。
("Connection with a grocery, and vegetables.” Again, possibly a reference to the lettuce/Gladys association on Jane's part. Also, on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, November 24, Thursday Nancy called Jane and asked her to bring some vegetables to class for a special project. Jane forgot to buy the vegetables hence her memory of the incident. Nancy's name appears on the object.(“与一家食品杂货店以及蔬菜有关联。”再一次，可能是指珍的莴苣/葛蕾蒂斯联想。还有，在11月24日星期二感恩节之前的星期三，南希打电话给珍，请她为一个特别的教案带一些蔬菜到课堂上。珍忘了买蔬菜，所以她记得这件事。南希的名字出现在标的物上。
("A minus sign.” No connections.(“一个减号。”没有任何关联。
("A circumstance with unknown ending.” Jane said this is represented quite well by the object. When Gladys gave Jane the memo bearing Mrs. Methinitus’s name on November 8, arrangements were made for Jane to sit in on a class the next day, and to thus meet Nancy M., etc. Naturally Jane wondered how things would work out, etc., which bears on the next data also:“Someone wonders how something will come out.” Jane discovered that she and Nancy were very compatible.(“一个结局未知的状况。”珍说标的物很能代表这件事。当葛蕾蒂丝在11月8日给了珍这张写着莫辛尼特斯太太姓名的便条时，就已经安排好，让珍隔天到一个班级去旁观，因而见到了南希·莫辛尼特斯等等。当然珍想知道事情会怎么发展等等，而且下一个资料也指出：“有人想知道某件事将会如何发展。”
("Orange, and a blemish.” As stated, the paper the object is printed on is of an orange brownish color that is quite novel and attractive. The blemish data could be a distortion, resulting from the fact that the orange paper is printed upon with a darker brown ink.(“橘色，以及一个污点。”如上所述，标的物是印刷在一种橘褐色的纸张上，很新奇又吸引人。污点资料可能是扭曲，起因是橘色纸张上面的印刷是用颜色更深的褐色油墨。
("Four plus one,” No connections.(“4加1”没有任何关联。
("and an initial explosion, or first-time happening.” Jane said this refers either to her trial run on November 9, or her first formal day at school on November 14. The explosion reference is amusing, and quite possibly refers to the blast of sound coming from 18 children under the age of five. Jane said the children are very noisy. A tape recording she has made confirms this amply.(“以及一个最初的爆发，或是第一次发生。”珍说这不是指她在11月9日的试教，就是指11月14日她在学校正式上班的第一天。爆炸这个说法很好笑，而且很可能是指18个5岁以下的小孩子发出的震天价响。珍说孩子们非常吵。她录的一卷录音带充分证明这一点。
("A note and a sender who is not feeling well." This is very good data. The note refers to the memo page used as object. It was written by Gladys Austin on November 8, at a time when she was not feeling well. She described this to Jane in some detail, explaining that the JCC had been so busy recently that the staff had been working weekends also. Jane remembers that Gladys also worked the weekend following—November 12-13, and then took Monday, November 14, off because of fatigue.(“一张短信以及一个感觉不适的寄信人。”这是一个非常好的资料。短信指的是用作标的物的便条。它是11月8日葛蕾蒂斯·奥斯汀写的，当时她身体不太舒服。她向珍仔细描述了这件事，解释说JCC最近太忙了，工作人员周末也要加班。珍记得葛蕾蒂斯下一个周末——11月12和13日——也加班，然后在11月14日星期一因为过劳而请假。
("A mid-thirty connection here, or three five perhaps." See page 216. Mrs. [Nancy] Methinitus, whose name appears on the object, is in her thirties, and quite possibly 35 years old. Gladys Austin is about 45 according to Jane.(“这里有一个35的连结，也许是35。”见前面。[南希]莫辛尼特斯太太的名字出现在标的物上，她30多岁，很可能是35岁。据珍说葛蕾蒂斯·奥斯汀约45岁。
("A great variety, or overall picture." Too vague. Jane says it is possible this data refers to her first day on the job at the JCC, when she learned something of the variety of programs sponsored, and more of what her own duties as a teacher would be, etc.(“种类繁多的变化，或全貌。”太模糊了。珍说这个资料可能是指她在JCC工作的第一天，当时她得知一些各式各样的赞助计划，以及她自己身为教师的职责是什么等等。
("An arrangement that has similarity to a calendar page. A small calendar page." Subconscious memory evidently plays a part here. Jane said the memo page used as object is much like ones she saw when she worked for an art gallery a few years ago. It was a book arrangement, with a calendar on one side and the memo pages opposite. She thought at first that the object might also come from such an arrangement; upon close examination, however, we can only tell that the object came from a pad that was bound at the top of the page; the edge there is slightly roughened, as though torn loose.(“类似一张日历的一种安排。一小张日历。”潜意识记忆显然在这里扮演一个角色。珍说用作标的物的那张便条与她几年前在画廊工作时见过的那些很像。它是一种书籍编排，一边是日历，另一边是便条。她起初以为标的物也是出自这样的编排；但是，仔细端详之后，我们只能分辨标的物是出自页面上方黏合的便条本；边缘变得有点粗糙，好像是被撕下来的。
(At this time Jane cannot recall if Gladys Austin’s memo pad is part of such a calendar arrangement. She remembers a lot of papers on Gladys Austin's desk, with the memo pad among them, but paid no particular attention to it.(这时候珍想不起来葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀的便条本是不是这样一种日历编排的一部分。她记得葛蕾蒂丝的桌上有很多纸，便条本就在其中，但是没有特别注意它。
(Thus also she has no idea of what size calendar page might be involved.(因此她对于日历的页面大小也完全没有概念。
("Dark green." No connections.(“深绿。”没有任何关联。
("A bill.” Jane believes this data is connected with the three-dollar data to come below. A bill here refers to art supplies Jane picked up on the way to work at the JCC one day, and charged to the JCC. Gladys Austin, whose name is on the object, makes out the checks to pay bills.(“一张账单。”珍相信这个资料与接下来的三元美金资料有关联。这里的一张账单指的是珍有一天去JCC上班途中顺便采购的美术用品，记在JCC的账上。名字在标的物上面的葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀开出支票来支付账单。
("1631." No connections.(“1631。”没有任何关联。
("Stringy or to do with string." Possibly, according to Jane, a reference to her borrowing string from Gladys Austin one class day at the JCC. The class members were to string Cheerios to make necklaces, etc., but the string was too flimsy and deteriorated too easily; knots couldn’t be tied in it, etc.(“状似绳子，或与绳子有关。”据珍说，可能是指她有一天在JCC上课时向葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀借了绳子。班上学生要用绳子把喜瑞尔[Cheerios]圈圈饼串起项链等等，但是绳子太细，太容易磨损；无法打绳结等等。
("Several occurrences with a star." Vague. Jane speculated about the Star of David being connected here with her place of employment, the Jewish Community Center.(“与一颗星星有关的几个事件。”含糊不清。珍推测这里大卫之星与她的工作场所犹太社区中心有关联。
("An unforeseen circumstance involving three or three dollars approximately.” See the bill data above. One class day, Nancy Methinitus picked Jane up at the house because it was raining. Nancy parked by the Art Shop on the way to work and asked Jane to run in after some art supplies for class. This errand was unforeseen by Jane; this event took place during one of Jane's first classes, when she did not know about plans for classes, etc.(“一个预料之外的状况，牵涉到大约三或三元美金。”见上述的账单资料。有一个上课日，因为下雨，南希·莫辛尼特斯来家里接珍。途中南希在美术服务器店停车，请珍进去为上课买一些美术用品。珍预想不到这个差事；这个事件发生在珍最初上课的其中一次，当时她不知道上课的教案等等。
(The items, paste, scissors, etc., for the class came to about three dollars, and were charged to the JCC. Thus Gladys Austin, whose name is on the object is connected with this data, since she makes out checks to pay bills for the JCC, etc.(上课要用的物品，糨糊、剪刀等等，总共大约三元美金，而且是记在JCC的账上。因此，名字在标的物上的葛蕾蒂丝与这个资料有关联，因为她为JCC开出支票付了账单等等。
("One large dark numeral or initials, towards the top, perhaps in a comer” Excellent data. See page 216. The large capital M of the word memo is in the upper left comer of the object, printed in a dark chocolate brown.(“靠近最上面有一个深色的大型数字或首字母，也许是在一个角落。”绝佳的资料。见前面所示。Memo[便条]的大写字母M在标的物的左上角，用深巧克力棕色印刷。
("Something with depth and dimension suggested—that is, the object. The feeling now, about the object, of something transparent, or that opens up without actually opening up.” As stated, the object was folded once upon insertion into the double envelopes. See page 216, and the indication of the horizontal fold used. The object also bore earlier crease marks from a vertical fold. The folding here could give rise to the transparent, depth and dimension, and opening-up data, etc.(“某个暗示尺寸和深度的东西——也就是说，标的物。现在，关于标的物，感觉是某个透明，或没有真的打开却打开了的东西。”如上所述，标的物是对折之后再放入双层信封里。见前面图所示，以及横向折痕。标的物也有之前纵向折叠的痕迹。这里的折叠可能引出了透明、深度和尺寸以及打开的资料等等。
("Something that is mine, and to do with a group accomplishment. A calendar date.” This is good data. In the sensethat Seth and Jane stem from the same entity, as explained in certain sessions, the object would be Jane's. Gladys Austin gave it to her.(“属于我，而且和一个团体成就有关的某个东西。一个日历上的日期。”这是很好的资料。就某几节解释过，赛斯和珍源于同一个存有的这层意义来说，标的物是珍的。葛蕾蒂丝把它给了珍。
(The object does have to do with group accomplishment, since it introduced Jane to Nancy Methinitus, and the two women work together teaching nursery school.(标的物确实和团体成就有关系，因为它把珍介绍给南希，而这两个女人一起工作，在幼儿园教书。
(The calendar data would be another reference to the memo pad and calendar idea explained earlier. In a more literal interpretation, as explained Gladys Austin wrote the memo to Jane on November 8, with the specific intention that Jane would meet Nancy Methinitus on November 9. This she did. See page 216.(日历资料也是指之前解释过的便条本和日历概念。在较为按照字面的解读中，之前解释过葛蕾蒂丝在11月8日写了这张便条给珍，带有明确的意图，就是珍会在11月9日见到南希。她的确见了。见前面所述。
(1st Question: Can you give me a date connected with the object?“The number four.” As stated, on Friday November 4, Jane called the JCC the first time about the teaching job. There could be other interpretations. Jane started the job on November 14, for instance.(第一个问题：你能不能给我一个与标的物有关的日期？“数字4。”如上所述，在11月4日星期五，珍第一次打电话给JCC询问教书工作。可能有其他的解读。比方说，珍在11月14日开始上班。
("I do not know. The future connection it would seem—January or February perhaps.” It is possible that a number four connection also applies here, for Jane is on Christmas-New Year’s vacation from her job, until Wednesday January 4. This data would be legitimate, in that the envelope object refers to the teaching job at the JCC.(“我不知道。它似乎与未来有某种关联——也许是1月或2月。”数字4的关联这里也可能适用，因为珍正在休圣诞节到新年的假，到10月4日星期三为止都不用工作。这个资料是合理的，因为信封标的物与JCC的教职有关联。
(2nd Question: Can you elaborate on the capital G?“No. Ruburt now thinks of Grumbacher.” See the data on page 221. It is stated there that the capital G refers to the name on the memo pad used as object, Gladys H. Austin, etc.(第二个问题：你能不能详细说明大写的G？“不能。鲁柏现在想到Grumbacher[格朗姆巴却尔]。”见前面的资料。如该处所述，大写的G指的是用作标的物的便条上面那个名字葛蕾蒂丝·奥斯汀等等。
(The Grumbacher data can also apply, in that Grumbacher is the manufacturer of some of the art supplies Jane picked up for class one day when being given a ride by Nancy Methinitus, whose name is also on the object. See pages 216 and224; the unforeseen circumstance and three-dollars data.(格朗姆巴却尔资料也可能适用，因为有一天南希载珍去上班，珍为班级购买的美术用品当中有一些的制造商是格朗姆巴却尔，而南希的名字也在标的物上面。预料之外的状况和三元美金有关。
(3rd Question: How about several occurrences with a star? “Toward a starred event.” We are not sure. Jane’s idea here is that starred event could refer to her liking the job after a good deal of trouble finding one that proved suitable.(第三个问题：与一颗星星有关的几个事件是怎么回事？“关于一个加上星号的事件。”我们不确定。这里珍的想法是，加上星号的事件可能是指她喜欢这个工作，在她历经重重困难之后，终于找到一个事后证明合适的工作。
(4th Question: What material is the object made oft“Paper, but with a fabric feel.” The object is of paper. See page 216. It is a smooth paper however, and we don't know where the fabric idea came from.(第四个问题：标的物是用什么材质做的？“纸，但是有一种布料的触感。”标的物是纸做的。不过，它是一种平滑的纸张，我们不知道这个材质的想法出自何处。
(5th Question: “How about color?” Some we have mentioned. Dark. Like a photograph; in shadow but for this fabricky connection.” No connections. The chocolate brown ink printed on the object is dark; perhaps this gave rise to the dark photo data.(第五个问题：那颜色呢？“有些我们已经提过了。深色。像一张照片；在阴影中，但是就类似布料的关联而言。”没有任何关联。印刷在标的物上的巧克力棕色油墨是深色的；也许这映出了深色照片的资料。
(6th Question: Can you say a little something about the group accomplishment?“Just that my impression is of heads, and four of them, in silhouette." This reply makes the data on page 225 a little clearer, although we believe the more general idea on page 225 applies as legitimately as the above.(第六个问题：你能不能说一点团体成就的事？“只不过就是我的头部，而且是四颗头，在剪影中的印象。”这个回答让前面的资料稍微清楚了一点，但是我们相信前面那个比较笼统的想法也和上文一样合理而适用。
(The head and silhouette mentioned here reminded Jane that one of the projects she and Nancy planned for the nursety school class involved the students making silhouette drawings of their heads, as Christmas gifts for their respective parents. The plan was for Jane and Nancy to do the actual tracing of profile, with the students filling them in, etc.(这里提到的头部和剪影让珍想到她和南希为幼儿园筹划的一个教案，要学生画出他们的头部剪影，当作送爸妈的圣诞礼物。计划是，珍和南希先描摹出实际的轮廓，再由学生填色等等。
(This data was obtained on December 12, 1966. The head silhouette idea wasn’t carried out however by December 21, the last class before Christmas vacation. Again, the connection is a good one, in that the data has to do with the class referred to through the memo slip used as object. See page 216.(这个资料是在1966年12月12日取得的。到了12月21日，圣诞节假期之前最后一天上课日，头部剪影的点子并没有付诸实现。再一次，这是一个贴切的关联，因为这个资料与经由用作标的物的便条产生连结的班级有关联。
(End.)(结束。)

SESSION 309 第309节 迷幻体验(续)


DECEMBER 14, 1966 9PM WEDNESDAY1966年12月14日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now I will say more concerning the changes worked in the ego as a result of our sessions, and from the psychedelic experience in general. The ego structure as such remains, of course. The responsibility of dealing with manipulation within the physical universe remains, but in some respects the nature of this manipulation changes. It becomes more direct: Physical properties are manipulated more and more on a mental level.现在，我会再多谈谈许多对自我有作用的改变，这是我们的课造成的结果，也是一般的迷幻经验所致。当然，自我的结构就其真正的意义来说依然留存。在物质宇宙之内处理操纵的责任依然如故，但在某些方面，这个操纵的本质改变了。它变得更加直接；越来越在心智层面操纵物质属性。
Many actual physical intervening steps are cut out. The ego becomes more similar to the inner ego than to its old self, comparatively speaking. This altered ego is aware of large portions of inner reality that were previously denied. Structurally it remains intact, and yet it has changed chemically, and electromagnetically. It is able to open up so that inner experience can be received.很多实际的物质干预步骤被删除了。相对来说，自我变得越来越像内在自我，而不是它旧有的自己。之前内在实相的众多部分曾被否定，但是现在这个改变的自我对它们是有觉知的。在结构上，它依然完整无缺，可是在化学和电磁上，它已经改变了。它有能力敞开了，这样才能够接收到内在经验。
In the past, for example, the ego accepted only knowledge that came through the senses through the physical surroundings. Now it is open to inner data to a large degree. Granted, certain interpretations must be made. Nevertheless, once this freedom is achieved, the ego can never return to its former state.比方说，过去，自我只接受感官透过物质环境传来的知识。现在它很大程度愿意接受内在资料。的确，某些解读是一定要有的。虽然如此，一旦得到这种自由，自我永远不可能再回到它从前的状态。
The personality is more integrated, yet through its acceptance of inner data, the ego, to use the term lightly, has expanded. It has not shrunk. It is now composed of more various elements from the whole personality. Retaining its own consciousness of reality it can now afford to step out of itself momentarily in order to gain further experience.人格更为整合，可是经由它对内在资料的接受，自我，轻描淡写地说，已经扩展了。它没有缩小。它现在是由更多来自整体人格的各种元素所组成。保有它自己对实相的意识，它现在有能力暂时走出它自己之外，以便获得更多经验。
I have told you that the ego, generally speaking, is self conscious action that attempts to set itself apart from action and to consider action as an alien object. Now this altered ego retains its highly specialized self consciousness, and yet it can now experience itself as an identity within and as a part of action.我告诉过你，自我，一般而言，是自觉的行动，企图使它自己有别于行动，并且把行动当成是一个外来物。现在这个改变的自我有它高度专门化的自我意识，可是它现在既是一个本体在行动之内体验它自己，也是行动的一部分。
This is a cornerstone for consciousness and for personality development. It is only a first step, however. Without it, no further development of consciousness can occur. This particular step is not attained by all within your system. You are at this point now. This state has been called cosmic consciousness, but it is hardly that.这是意识也是人格发展的一个基石。不过，它只是第一步而已。没有它，意识就不可能有进一步的发展。并非全部的人都在你们的系统之内完成这特定的一步。你现在就在这一点上。这种状态被称之为宇宙意识(cosmic consciousness)，但根本不是那样。
The next step is taken when identity is able to include within itself the intimate knowledge of all incarnations. Yet in this state the independence of the various reincarnated selves is not diminished. Each of these steps of consciousness involves identity with the inner recognition of its whole identity with All That Is.踏出下一步的时候，是本体能够在它之内涵纳所有转世的详尽知识之时。可是在这个状态中，各个转世的自己并不会失去它们的独立。意识的这些步骤，每一个都让本体专注于它与一切万有完全是一体的内在认知上。
As each separate identity then seeks to know and experience its other portions then All That Is learns who and what it is. Action never ceases its own exploration of itself. All That Is can never know itself completely, since action must always act and each action creates a new unknown.然后在本体试图和体验它其他的部分时，一切万有因此知道了它是谁以及它是什么。行动从来不曾停止它自己对自己的探索。
Action must then travel through itself from every conceivable point, and yet the journey, you see, itself being action, will create new paths.一切万有永远不可能完全认识它自己，因为行动必须一直行动，而且每一个行动都会创造一个新的未知。
I suggest your break and we shall continue.缺
(Rest at 9:25. (Resume at 9:35.)(9:25休息，9:35继续。)
Now, in dealing with such matters, I have to explain them from the standpoint of psychological structures with which you are familiar. When your own projections improve and grow more frequent, it is at least possible, with your abilities, that you will come into contact with some different psychological structures, and then I can tell you more.现在，在处理这样的主题时，我必须从你熟悉的心理结构这样的立场来解释。当你自己的投射变得更好而且越来越频繁的时候，借着你的能力，至少你可能会接触到一些不同的心理结构，到时候我就可以告诉你更多事情。
One thing you should know: action cannot stop. It is powerless in this respect only. It cannot destroy itself. It can change form. It often changes direction. It is so many-dimensional that it must experience itself as individuals. Individuality is a direct result of the overall oneness of this action. Action is also a direct result of individual identities, for without these psychological dimensions, oneness could not multiply itself.有一件事你应该知道：行动无法停止。它只有在这一方面是无能为力的。它无法毁灭它自己。它能够改变形式。它经常改变方向。它的维度如此之多，以至于它必须以个体的形式体验它自己。个体性是这个行动全面合一的一个直接结果。行动也是个别本体的一个直接结果，因为没有这些心理维度，一体不可能让它自己成倍增加。
Other psychological structures beside your own have their being in realities you will find difficult to comprehend, even though they may be connected with your own, and you unknowingly, may be part of them. What you may term the reality of possibilities is an example. There are many yous in that system, and each you is related psychologically in a personality structure. The you that you know is a part of this. In this system, all the other yous seem to exist in a probable reality.除了你自己的结构以外，其他心理结构在你觉得难以理解的实相中有它们的存在，即便它们可能与你自己的结构有连结，而你在不知不觉中也可能是它们的一部分。你怎么称呼可能性的实相也许就是一个例子。在那个系统里有很多个你，每一个你就心理而言，在一个人格结构中都是相互关联的。你认识的你是这里头的一分子。在这个系统中，其他所有的你似乎都存在一个可能的实相里。
To any of them, the others would seem to exist in a probable universe. Yet all of you are psychologically connected. This is literally endless. All of you did not have the same parents, for example, and these are portions of probable situations existing in your own parents' separate lives, as you think of their lives.对它们任何一个来说，其他的似乎都存在一个可能的宇宙里。但是全部的你在心理上都是相连的。这名副其实是无止无尽的。比方说，全部的你并没有相同的父母，而且在你想到你自己父母的生命时，这些都是存在他们个别的生命当中种种可能情况的一部分。
In two probable realities, your mother, for example, did not have children. You do not exist in these. In some she married but not the man you know as your father. A psychological connection exists between the first son in that reality, and yourself.在两个可能的实相里，比方说，你的母亲没有孩子。你不存在这些实相当中。在某个实相里，她结了婚但对象并不是你认识的父亲。那个实相里的长子与你自己之间存在一个心理连结。
In some probable systems, you and your mother would both exist, do both exist, but as complete strangers, you see. Now these psychological connections are valid and not merely symbolically so. This self that you know has also set up and initiated probable realities of its own. I mean this literally, you see. I want to make this clear.在某些可能系统里，你和你母亲两人都存在，两人的确都存在，但你们却是素昧平生的陌生人，你知道。现在这些心理连结是有效力的，不是只有象征意义而已。这个你认识的自己也开创它自己的可能实相。我说的是实际面，你知道，我想要理清这一点。
Emotional charged feeling immediately sets up what you may think of as a tangent. It is expressed in some reality system. This is the inner nature of action. Those inner thoughts or desires, impulses not made physically real in your terms, will be made real within other systems.充满情感电荷的感觉立刻开辟一条你可能想成是切线的路线。它在某个实相系统之中被表达出来。这是行动的内在本质。按照你们的说法，那些没有化为物质的内在思想或欲望、冲动，将会在其他系统之内化为真实。
You may take your break.你可以休息一下了。
(Rest 9:58. (Resume session at 10:07.)(9:58休息，10:07继续上课。)
Now, the inner self is psychologically influenced by these probable personalities, for they are all psychologically connected and represent a whole personality structure, a whole personality gestalt with which you as you know yourself are utterly unfamiliar.现在，内我在心理上受这些可能人格的影响，因为它们在心理上全都是相连的，代表一个整体的人格结构，一个整体的人格完形，你自己知道你对它极不熟悉。
Your psychologists are dealing with one-dimensional psychology at their best. In the dream state, the portions of the larger structure sometimes communicate, in highly codified symbols. It would be highly improbable to imagine that you could decipher these so as to be easily aware of them now.你们的心理学家尽其所能与一维的心理学打交道。在梦状态中，更大结构的许多部分有时候会沟通，用高度编码的象征。很难想像你现在为了轻易觉察到它们而能够破解这些密码。
There is even a certain feedback system that operates here, and yet you must understand that all of these other identities are independent and fully individual. They exist in codified psychological structures within your personality, as you exist in the same manner within each of their personalities.这里甚至有某一种回馈系统在运作，可是你必须了解，这些其他的本体全部都是独立的，而且是完整的个体。它们存在你的人格之内经过编码的心理结构里，正如你以同样的方式存在它们的每一个人格之内一样。
They remain latent within you and unexpressed within this system. You have their abilities, unused. You remain latent in their personality structures, and your main abilities are unused within their systems. Yet all of you are a part of one self, you see, in a multidimensional psychological structure.它们潜伏在你之内，没有在这个系统之内表达出来。你拥有它们没有使用的能力。你潜伏在它们的人格结构里，而且你的主要能力在它们的系统之内没有被使用。可是在一个多重维度的心理结构之中，你知道，全部的你都是一个自己的一部分。
All action will be expressed. Now to some degree you have a root nature, then, and many of your dreams will be similar. You are far from identical with these probable selves, and yet if you met them you would instantly know that you had found unknown portions of yourself.所有的行动都会被表达出来。此外，现在你某种程度上具有一个根源本质，你会有很多梦是类似的。你根本还谈不上认同这些可能的自己，但是，如果你遇见它们，你立刻就会知道你已经找到你自己的未知部分。
Now, these do not represent more highly evolved selves, necessarily at all. Certain abilities will be more developed in them than in you, but certain of your abilities are more developed than theirs. In other words, I am not now speaking of portions of yourself that exist in your so-called future.现在，这些根本不一定是代表更加高度进化的自己。某些能力在它们之中，比在你之内发展得更好，但是你的某些能力却比它们的能力发展得更好。换句话说，我现在讲的并不是你自己存在于你们所谓未来之中的部分。
Each probable self you see also has future selves. This multidimensional identity is a psychological structure with which we shall be dealing in our discussions. The term includes the whole self as it consists of the self that you know, probable selves, reincarnated selves, and selves more highly developed than the self that you know.每一个可能的自己，你看，也都有未来的自己。这个多重维度的本体是一个我们在讨论中将会谈到的一个心理结构。这个字眼包含全我，因为它是由你知道的自己、可能的自己、转世的自己，以及比你认识的自己更加高度发展的许多自己组成的。
These make up the basic identity structure of one whole self. Again, this does not mean that the portions are not independent and individual. Also, the divisions are arbitrary to a large degree, for they can indeed be carried further, for example, to the entity.这些构成一个全我的基本本体结构。再一次， 这并不是说各个部分不是独立的个体。此外，种种区分有很大程度是随意的，因为它们其实可以被进一步带到，比方说，存有。
The psychedelic experience then represents a first necessary step, and that is all. My heartiest wishes to you both. I could continue for some time. I bow, most graciously, to the limitations set upon your time.迷幻经验因此代表必要的第一步，就这样而已。向你们两位致上我最衷心的祝福。我可以继续上一段时间。我向你们的时间所受的限制，非常优雅地，鞠躬。
One small note to my friend, Ruburt: I have told him this before, it seems, on several occasions: he is not pregnant. Only with ideas. On evenings like this, I do regret the necessary limitations, for I could indeed enjoy speaking with you longer.给我们朋友鲁柏一个小提示：好像，我以前就告诉过他这件事，在几次不同的场合中；他没有怀孕。怀的只是点子而已。像这样的一个夜晚，我确实为必要的限制感到遗憾，因为我真的可以开心地跟你们讲更久。
("Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(Session ended 10:30. (Jane said that she got a strong feeling of peace as Seth spoke his last words for the evening. She smiled.)(课在10:30结束。珍说，在赛斯为今晚道别时，她接收到一种强烈的平静之感。她面露微笑。)
(Copy of the card used as the envelope object in the 81st experiment, in the 310th session for January 9, 1967.)卡片副本，在1967年1月9日第310节的第81次信封实验用作标的物

SESSION 310 第310节 可能实相 能量焦点 信封81


JANUARY 9, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年1月9日 星期一 晚上9点
(During the holiday break two spontaneous sessions were held. The first was on Friday evening, December 23,1966, at the home of the Gallaghers, with the four of us present. Seth presented some very interesting material on flying saucers, time, other systems, etc. Peggy took notes that were somewhat incomplete because of Seth’s rapid pace. A copy of them will be attached to a later session.(在休假期间举行了两节自发课。第一节是1966年12月23日，在加拉格夫妇家中，我们4个人在场。赛斯针对飞碟、时间、其他系统等等，提出一些非常有趣的资料。蓓做了笔记，但是不太完整，因为赛斯速度很快。其中一个副本会附加在后面一节。
(The second session was held at our apartment Friday evening, December 30, with Jane and me, Wesley Swan, Bill Macdonnel, Pat Norelli and Claire Crittenden present. Seth discussed computers and their future use; Wesley Swan agreed with the data. Seth also gave a good deal of personal data concerning a Brian Houlihan, a friend of Pat's and some data concerning Claire and Pat, and answered questions from all of us. Evidently a good amount of the data was correct, being called so by Pat and Claire, although without notes we cannot check. One interesting bit: Seth named Claire's birthday correctly—as falling on February 13, but missed the year by one. He said 1948 when the correct year is 1947.(第二节是12月30日星期五在我们的公寓举行，在场有珍和我、卫斯理·史汪[Welsey Swan]、比尔·麦唐纳、佩特·诺瑞利[Pat Norelli]以及克莱儿·克芮坦顿[Clair Crittenden]。赛斯讨论了电脑和它们的未来用途；卫斯理认同这个资料。赛斯也给了很多有关佩特的一个朋友，布莱恩·胡立汉[Brian Houlihan]的私人资料，以及一些有关克莱儿与佩特的资料，并且回答我们每个人的问题。显然资料有很多是正常的，佩特和克莱儿是这么说的，但是没有笔记，我们无法核对。有趣的一点是：赛斯正确说出克莱儿的生日——是在2月13日，但年次差了一年。他说是1948年，但正确的年次是1947年。
(The envelope object for tonight was a card sent to Jane by Caroline Keck, conservator of paintings for the Brooklyn Museum, in 1964. See page 230.(今晚的信封标的物是一张卡洛琳·凯克[Caroline Keek]在1964年寄给我们的卡片，她是布鲁克林博物馆[Brooklyn Museum]的绘画修复师。见上图。
(Jane began speaking in trance while sitting down. Her eyes opened often; her voice was on the quiet side, with brief pauses as a rule.(珍坐来下，同时在出神中开始讲话。她的眼睛经常张开；她的声音偏向安静，在多数情况下有短暂的停顿。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
A few brief remarks. Your food is too greasy of late. Ruburt should definitely take up his yoga again, as he plans.几个简短的评论。你们的食物最近太油腻了。鲁柏绝对应该按照他的计划，再次开始练瑜珈。
I have a few matters to discuss here. The probable realities of which I have spoken are separated from your own, not in terms of space but in terms of energy focus. Survival personalities, as you term them, are not separated from you in space either, but in terms of energy focus.You do not perceive them physically. The direction of focus for them has changed. In the case of probable realities the focus of energy has always been different from your own. It is quite possible, as you should know, under certain circumstances, to contact survival personalities. It is highly difficult however for you to contact your own probable personalities.这里我有几件事情要讨论。我已经讲过的可能实相与你自己的实相，并不是在空间上，而是在能量焦点上，是分开的。你们所谓死后犹存的人格与你们也不是在空间上，而是在能量焦点上，是分开的。你在身体上感知不到他们。它们的焦点已经改变了方向。就可能的实相而言，能量的焦点向来不同于你自己的实相。你应该知道，在某些状况下，与死后犹存的人格接触是很有可能的。但是，对你来说，与你自己的可能人格接触却是非常困难。
This is done to some extent in the dream state, but it is not a deliberate contact. It is a spontaneous coming together.这在某种程度上是在梦状态中完成的，但它并不是刻意的接触。它是一种自发的相聚。
(Pause.)(停顿)
For Ruburt, incidentally, a good date approximately January 13.顺便提醒一下，对鲁柏来说，一个好日子大约是1月13日。
(Pause.)(停顿)
These probable realities exist within what may be generally termed your own sphere of activity, your own plane. There are many other realities that are far divorced from your own however. Every thought, as I have told you, is an action and must seek to fulfill itself. It is a fragment, therefore. You are literally surrounded by other realities that you do not perceive consciously. Some of these are perceived by the inner self, but all are not.这些可能的实相存在一般所谓你自己的活动范围、你自己的层面之内。不过，有很多其他的实相与你自己的实相分隔遥远。我告诉过你，每一个思想都是一个行动，必须寻求它自己的实现。因此，它是一个片段体。你名副其实是被其他实相围绕着，但在意识上你没有感知。内我感知其中一些，但不是全部。
I can perceive much that you do not for example, but I hardly perceive all, and what I do perceive is but a fraction of All That Is. Survival personalities exist both as they were and as they are. This is an important point. What they were still exists, and under certain conditions can be perceived.比方说，我可以感知很多你感知不到的实相，但是我根本感知不到全部，而且我的确感知到的也只不过是一切万有的吉光片羽而已。死后犹存的人格既是以过去它们所是，也是以现在它们所是的样貌存在。这一点很重要。过去所是的它们依然存在，而且在某些状况下是可以被感知到的。
What they are now, so to speak, also exists, and as something distinct and different from what they were. The personality has experienced new realities since death, and is no longer precisely the person that was. The person that was exists as a sort of psychological unit, however. The person, the survival person that is, contains all that he was, and more.现在所是的它们，可以说，也存在，而且与过去所是的它们截然不同。人格自从死后已经体验了新的实相，再也不完全是过去那个人了。然而，过去那个人以一种心理单位的形式存在着。现在所是的这个人、这个死后犹存的人，除了包含了它过去的一切，还有更多。
As his own experiences grow the previous earth experiences become less important and dreamlike, though they can be activated most vividly at any time. When I speak in terms of continuity here, and before and after, I speak for simplicity's sake only, since the survival personality that is, always existed, of course.随着它自己的经验越来越多，之前的地球经验变得越来越不重要，越来越如梦似幻，但是它们在任何时间都可以非常鲜活地触发。这里当我用连续的说法讲话时，以及之前和之后，我只是为了简单起见才这么说，因为现在所是的死后犹存人格过去当然一直都存在。
The psychedelic experience, or any mystical experience, is sometimes apt to put you in touch with what may seem to you to be a future self. This self of course, again, always existed. The inner self has the ability to delve beneath all your camouflage data to perceive these other reality systems. For the fullest development however these perceptions must be made conscious. Even the ego must become aware of them.迷幻经验或任何神秘经验，有时候容易让你与对你来说似乎是一个未来的自己接触。这个自己当然——再一次——过去一直都存在。内我具有钻进你所有的伪装资料之下，感知其他这些实相系统的能力。然而，为了最充分的发展，这些感知一定要浮上意识的柜面。甚至连自我都必须对它们有觉知。
You may take your break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:22. Resume at 9:30.)(9:22休息，9:30继续。)
Now. Give me a moment here.现在。这里等我一下。
Ruburt does not have arthritis. For the present, the following substitutes or changes of diet are recommended for him.鲁柏没有关节炎。目前，以下的饮食替代品或改变是推荐给他的。
Black coffee or tea, or coffee with sugar and no milk. More fresh fruits and vegetables. Less fried foods. More water and less other liquids.黑咖啡或茶，或是咖啡加糖不加奶。更多新鲜水果和蔬菜。少吃油炸物。多喝水，少喝其他液体。
(Long pause.)(长时间停顿)
Give us another moment.再等我们一下。
Wine rather than the grain beer. The chiropractic adjustments now, underlined, are of benefit. The yoga exercise for the sinuses substituted largely, though not necessarily exclusively, for his medication. A serious return to his book, with instructions to the subconscious here.喝葡萄酒而不要喝谷物酿造的啤酒。现在，划线，整脊是有益的。为了鼻窦而做的瑜伽运动，虽然不一定完全，但大部分取代了他的药物。认真回到他的书上，运用这里给潜意识的指示。
An immersion into the new book, you see. Suitable instructions given to the subconscious that the original book will sell well and be accepted. Poetry again as a part of the day's normal activity. A walk or outside activity on those days when he does not work outside. Some window open during the yoga exercise.沉浸在新书之中，你知道。给潜意识适当的指示，原来的书将会卖得很好，为人接受。再一次，诗是一天当中活动的一部分。当他不在外面工作时，去散个步或从事户外活动。练瑜珈时，有些窗户要打开。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes."(“有。”
(At 9:39 Jane took the sealed double envelope from me for the 81st experiment. Her eyes closed she held it to her forehead in a horizontal manner.)(9:39分，珍从我这里拿了第81次实验的密封双层信封。她闭着眼睛，把横向的它放在额头上。)
Give us a moment, please. You can I see how I hold this. These are impressions.请给我们一点时间。你可以看到我怎么拿这个。这些是印象。
A yellow square. Black print or lettering or writing in a right-hand corner, extending outward toward the center.一个黄色的正方形。在右手边的角落有黑色印刷字、艺术字或手写字，朝着中心向外延伸。
A rectangular item of paper, perhaps the shape of a postcard and the size. A framework within a framework.一个纸质的长方形物件，也许是一张明信片的形状和大小。在一个架构之内的一个架构。
Four plus one, and an equalization, or equal elements of design. Connection with a 1962 date, or 1964, or both. A connection with a telephone call, and a stone framework. Rocky. And a JB.4加1，以及一种均衡，或设计中的相等元素。与1962或1964或是两者的一个日期有关联。与一通电话和一个石制架构有关联。岩石的。还有一个JB。
("A JB or D?")(“是JB还是D？”)
B And a G. A distant Minneapolis, Minnesota connection I do not understand. A long word, at least, that looks like that. Or Mississippi or such. With some foreign element, it seems, connected with the word. This leads Ruburt, now, toward a connection with the woman with whom she works.B。以及一个G。与明尼苏达州的明尼亚波利斯(Minneapolis)有一个我不了解的遥远关联。至少看起来像那样的一个很长的字。或密西西比(Mississippi)之类的。某个外国元素似乎与这个字有关联。这把鲁柏，现在，带到一个与他一起工作的女同事有关的连结上。
A connection with light. Several small letters or numbers, and a stamped card, from a distant place. A hole in one. I do not know if this is a golf connection or to what it refers.与光有关联。几个小小的字母或数字，以及一张贴了邮票的卡片，来自一个遥远的地方。一个有洞。我不知道这与高尔夫球有关联，还是指什么。
A connection with something bound, as a book.与某个像一本书那样胶装的东西有关联。
A very small image, such as the square or rectangle on the item. An invitation to attend. A fence or framework connection with the item. Connection with a man also. With you and another man, and some connection with the date I 1492, perhaps leading to an historical event.一个非常小的影像，好比在物件上的正方形或长方形。一个出席的邀请。与物件有一个篱笆或架构的关联。和一个男人也有关联。与你和另一个男人有关联，与1，1492这个年份有关联，也许通往一个历史事件。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
(Jane lowered the envelope briefly.(珍把信封放下来一会儿)
("What's that connection about a book?"(“与一本书的关联是什么？”)
(Pause.) It seems to be an old book. A bound one, with a dark color such as brown on the cover. The side of pages when the book is closed seem dusky in color, like old gold color. The book having a connection with a desk, and another location.(停顿)好像是一本旧书。一本胶装的书，封面上有一种像是褐色的深色。在书合起来的时候，书页的侧面似乎是灰濛濛的颜色，像老旧的金色。这本书与一张书桌以及另一个地点有关联。
("Who does JB refer to?")(“JB是指什么？”)
Here, to Ruburt.这里，指鲁柏。
("And the G?")(“那G呢？”)
