A large capital G is the impression. A fancy G.印象是一个大型的大写G。一个花哨的G。
("Who is the other man referred to besides myself?")(“除了我自己以外，另一个男人是指谁？”)
Something to do with an animal in a tree, that I do not understand.与一棵树上的一只动物有关联，这我不了解。
The other man, a friend rather than a relative.另一个男人，一个朋友而不是亲戚。
("Initials?")(“姓名缩写？”)
This may be your friend Gallagher, or your friend Mark, for the first name would seem to be William.这可能是你的朋友加拉格，或你的朋友马克，因为名字似乎是威廉(William)。
(Mark is Seth’s “entity name’’ for Bill MacDonnel.(马克是赛斯称呼比尔麦唐纳的存有名)
("Anything else you want to add?")(“你有没有要补充什么？”)
A small box, and that is all.一个小盒子，就这样。
(Break at 9:52. Jane eyes remained closed for most of the experiment. She recalled some images, which will be discussed in place as they occurred.(9:52休息。珍的眼睛在实验期间大部分都闭着。她记得一些画面，将会在它们出现的正确时机进行讨论。
(As usual I placed the object between two pieces of Bristol, then sealed it in two envelopes. Jane had not seen it since August 1964, since it has been in my files.(一如往常，我把标的物放在两片西卡纸中间，然后密封在双层信封里。珍自从1964年8月就没再见过它，因为它一直放在我的档案里。
(See page 230. The object is a card, blank on the reverse side, written to Jane by Caroline Keck, conservator of the Brooklyn Museum; it was mailed to Jane in early August, along with a copy of the book, Is Your Contemporary Painting More Temporary Than You Think? and a mimeographed list of various addresses furnishing technical help and supplies regarding the conservation of paintings. The list was also compiled by Caroline Keck; the book by Louis Pomerantz.(见前面图示。标的物是一张卡片，反面空白，是布鲁克林博物馆的绘画修复师卡洛琳·凯克写给珍的；在8月初寄到珍的手上，附带一本书《当代绘画的寿命是不是比你以为的更短暂？》[Is You Contenporary Painting More Temporary Than You Think?]以及一份条列不同地址的油印清单，那些地方提供绘画修复的技术协助与用品。编列这份清单的也是卡洛琳·凯克；书的作者是路易斯·波美蓝兹[Louis Pomerantz]。
(Caroline Keck sent Jane the items to give to her in appreciation for a pen and ink drawing of a pigeon I gave to Caroline Keck. In July 1964Jane worked at the Arnot Art Gallery, and Caroline Keck and her husband Sheldon spent some time there then, putting the gallery’s collection in shape. Jane liked Caroline Keck, and the two got along well. The drawing of the pigeon was among a group I had exhibited at the gallery at the time the Kecks were present; they saw it and admired it. I never met the Kecks, but told Jane to give the drawing to them.卡洛琳·凯克寄这些物件给珍，是为了答谢我送给她的一幅鸽子的钢笔墨水画。在1964年7月，珍在阿诺画廊工作，卡洛琳和她的丈夫谢尔登当时在那里待过一些时间，修整艺廊的收藏品。珍喜欢卡洛琳，而且两人很合得来。鸽子画是我与凯克夫妇两人在艺廊期间展出的一批画作之一；他们看到它，很欣赏它。我从未见过凯克夫妇，但我告诉珍，我要把这幅画送给他们。
(Seth did not return after we had made our connections with the data. We finished at 10:26.(在我们自己找出资料的关联之后，赛斯没有再回来。我们在10:26分结束。
("A yellow square." No connections. The object is printed on card stock with a light cream tint, but not yellow. Jane, oddly enough, said she had an image of a yellow square.(“一个黄色的正方形。”没有任何关联。标的物印刷在一张卡片纸上，带着淡奶油色调，而不是黄色。很奇怪的是，珍说她有一个黄色正方形的画面。
(Caroline Keck's mimeographed list is also printed on cream-tinted paper the size of this page. Louis Pomerantz's small book has a rust red cover; the title is in reverse lettering, and this too has a cream tint.(卡洛琳的油印清单也是印刷在奶油色调的纸张上，大小与这一页相同。路易斯·波美蓝兹的小书有锈红色的封面；书名用反向艺术字，而且这也带有一种奶油色调。
("Black print or lettering or writing in a right hand corner, extending outward toward the center." See page 230. Jane said this data is correct, in that it referred to the Brooklyn Museum and Caroline Keck by name on the object, in the upper left corner. To Jane, this reading matter does project toward the center of the object.(“在右手边的角落有黑色印刷字、艺术字或手写字，朝着中心向外延伸。”见前面图示。珍说这个资料是正确的，因为它是指标的物上布鲁克林博物馆与卡洛琳·凯克的名字。
(As noted on page 230, this copy is in a rusty red, much the same color as on the cover of Louis Pomerantz’s book. Caroline Keck's handwriting on the object is in blue; hence no black appears on the object. Perhaps Seth interpreted the blue as black, however, then substituted it in the upper left corner.(如前面的标注，这个副本是锈红色，与路易斯·波美蓝兹的书封颜色大致相同。卡洛琳在标的物上的手写字是蓝色的；因此在标的物上没有任何黑色。不过，或许赛斯把蓝色解读成黑色，所以替代了左上角的它。
("A rectangular item of paper, perhaps the shape of a postcard and the size." Again see page 230. The object is a rectangular item, of heavy paper or light card stock. It is also the shape of a postcard, and nearly the same size. Actually a bit smaller.(“一个纸质的长方形物件，也许是一张明信片的形状和大小。”再一次见前面所示。标的物是一个长方形的物件，用重磅纸或轻量卡片纸做成。它也是一张明信片的形状，而且大小几乎一样。其实是比较小一点。
("A framework within a framework.” Somewhat vague, but we believe legitimate. Jane said the Kecks worked with fames and pictures while at the gallery in July 1964. A painting could be a framework, fitting within another framework—the frame. Could also be a generalization, referring to either the Arnot Gallery here in Elmira, or the Brooklyn Museum mentioned on the object, or both.(“在一个架构之内的一个架构。”有点模糊，但我们相信它是合理的。珍说1964年7月凯克夫妇在艺廊期间处理的是画框和图画。一幅画可能是一个架构，套在另一个架构——画框——之内。也可能是一个笼统的说法，不是指埃尔迈拉这里的阿诺艺廊，就是指标的物上提到的布鲁克林博物馆，或者皆是。
(” Four plus one, and an equalization, or equal elements of design." No connections for four plus one.(“4加1，以及一种均衡，或设计中的相等元素。”4加1没有任何关联。
(The equalization, Jane believes, refers to the book by Louis Pomerantz, that along with the object and the mimeographed list were mailed to her by Caroline Keck from Brooklyn, NY, in August 1964. All three of these items refer to the conservation of paintings. The title page of Louis Pomerantz’s book shows that it was published by A Chicago Chapter Artists Equity Publication, 332 South Michigan Avenue, Chicago 4, Illinois. Artists Equity Association is dealt with in the book’s forward also.(珍相信，均衡是指路易斯·波美蓝兹的书，卡洛琳在1964年8月从纽约州布鲁克林连同标的物和油印清单一起寄给珍。这三样物件都与绘画的修复有关系。路易斯·波美蓝兹的书名页显示，它是由芝加哥一家章节艺术家权益出版社[Chapter Artists Equity Publications]发行的，地址为伊利诺州，芝加哥市，南密西根大道332号。书的前言也提到艺术家权益协会[Artists Equity Association]。
(The equal elements of design reference is another general interpretation of the nature of the data tonight—the art background.(设计中的相等元素这个关联是另一个笼统的解读，指的是今晚的资料性质——艺术背景。)
("Connection with a 1962 date, or 1964, or both." Seth is correct with both dates. See page 230. The object is dated August l, 1964—Caroline Keck 's mimeographed sheet is also dated 1964. Louis Pomerantz ’s book’s copyright is in 1962.(“与1962或1964或是两者的一个日期有关联。”赛斯说的这两个日期都是正确的。见前面。标的物上面注记的日期是1964年8月1日——卡洛琳的油印表单也是注明1964年。路易斯·波美蓝兹那本书的版权注记是1962年。
("A connection with a telephone call," General data. Remember that the Kecks were called long distance in Brooklyn, NY, from Elmira, by the Arnot Gallery before they made the trip to Elmira to do conservation work, for instance.(“与一通电话[有关联]。”笼统的资料。比方说，记得凯克琳夫妇是在接到阿诺艺廊打到纽约州布鲁克林的长途电话，才启程来到埃尔迈拉进行修复工作的。
("and a stone framework. Rocky.” Probably another general reference to the object, in that the object's author, Caroline Keck, was associated with both the Brooklyn Museum and the Arnot Art Gallery. Both edifices being made of stone, as well as with additions of brick, etc.(“和一个石制架构有关联。岩石的。”可能是另一个与标的物的笼统关联，因为标的物的作者卡洛琳与布鲁克林博物馆和阿诺艺廊都有关系。这栋大厦都是用石头，另外还有砖块等等建筑造的。
(The framework data may be associative, coming from the earlier framework references having to do, we think, with paintings and frames.(架构资料可能是联想，出自于，我们认为，之前与画作和画框有关的架构。
("And a JB.” Later Seth confirms that JB refers to Ruburt or Jane. Good data. The object is addressed to Jane. See page 230.(“还有一个JB。”后来赛斯证实JB是指鲁柏和我。好资料。标的物是寄给珍的。
("And a G.” The illustrations for Louis Pomerantz’s book are done by Paula Gerard. But we think the G data a distortion, referring to our friend Bill Gallagher, as brought out in the question period.(“以及一个G。”路易斯·波美蓝兹那本插图是宝拉·杰拉德[Paula Gerard]画的。但我们认为G的资料是一个扭曲，指的是我们的朋友比尔·加拉格在发问期间说到了他。
("A distant Minneapolis, Minnesota connection I do not understand. A long word, at least, that looks like that. Or Mississippi or such. With some foreign element it seems, connected with the word.” This a good data that at first eluded us. We believe it refers to the book by Louis Pomerantz; the author himself; Paula Gerard, the illustrator; and the Artists Equity Association, discussed in the book’s forward.(“与明尼苏达州的明尼亚波利斯(Minneapolis)有一个我不了解的遥远关联。至少看起来像那样的一个很长的字。或密西西比(Mississippi)之类的。某个外国元素似乎与这个字有关联。”这是一个好资料，但一开始把我们难倒了。我们相信它是指路易斯·波美蓝兹的书，作者本人，插画家宝拉·杰拉德；以及书的前言讨论到的艺术家权益协会。
(On the page opposite the title page is a long detailed list of Louis Pomerantz’s previous experience, places of study, etc. He has studied extensively overseas, and worked there and in Canada as an art expert, and in Brooklyn with the Kecks. He has also been employed in various Midwest locations, Chicago, etc. Thus the foreign element mentioned above.(在书名页的对面那页上详细条列路易斯·波美蓝兹一长串先前的经历、就学地点等等。他跑遍海外各地学习，并在那里和加拿大担任艺术专家，也在布鲁克林与凯克夫妇一起工作。他也曾经在中西部很多不同的地方、芝加哥等等受雇过。所以有了上文提到的外国元素。
(Below this on the same page a brief resume of Paula Gerard's professional career is given. Minneapolis, Minnesota, is mentioned here by name.(在同一页的这段下面是宝拉·杰拉德的专业生涯简历。这里提到明尼苏达州明尼亚波利斯这个地名。
(Below this the Artists Equity Association is listed, with the president's address as the University of Minnesota. Both Pomerantz and Gerard are members.(在这之下条列了艺术家权益协会，包含主任的地址是明尼苏达州立大学。波美蓝兹与杰拉德两人都是会员。
(Another longish word beginning with M is found in the publisher's address on the title page—332 South Michigan Avenue, etc.(另一个M开头的长字在书名页的出版社地址当中——南密西根大道332号等等。
("This leads Ruburt, now, toward a connection with the woman with whom she works.” This is valid data, we believe. Jane’s present working situation is much like that she worked in at the gallery in July-August 1964. Now, as then, she worked with a woman superior. Both women had M initial also for the last name—Masters at the Gallery, Methinitus now at the nursery school at the Jewish Community Center.(“这把鲁柏，现在，带到一个与他一起工作的女同事有关的连结上。”我们相信，这是有效的资料。珍目前的工作状况与她于1964年7月到8月间在艺廊的工作很像。现在，如当时一样，她与一位女性主管一起工作。两个女人的姓氏首字母都是M——艺马斯特[Masters]，此时在犹太社区中心幼儿园的是莫辛尼特斯[Methinitus]。
(The object itself also refers to a situation where Jane worked closely with another woman—namely Caroline Keck, when doing conservation work at the gallery in July 1964. See page 230.(标的物本身也和珍与另一个女人——名叫卡洛琳·凯克，1964年7月在艺廊从事修复工作——密切共事的情况有关第。见前面所述。
，("A connection with light.” A reference to Caroline Keck, author of the object, and her husband, Jane said. The Kecks brought special equipment to the Arnot with them to examine the gallery 's paintings; among this equipment was a certain kind of light. Probably ultraviolet or infrared, though at this date Jane is not sure.(“与光有关联。”珍说，这是指标的物的作者卡洛琳·凯克与她的丈夫。凯克夫妇带了特殊设备到阿诺检测艺廊的画作；在这个设备当中有某种光。可能是紫外线或红外线，但这时珍并不确定。
("Several small letters or numbers, and a stamped card, from a distant place." See page 230. The object contains small printed letters in the address in the upper left corner. It also contains numbers in the date. It is a card, but is not stamped; instead of being mailed alone it was enclosed in a small package or envelope with Louis Pomerantz’s book and the mimeographed list described earlier; and all addressed to Jane.(“几个小小的字母或数字，以及一张贴了邮票的卡片，来自一个遥远的地方。”见前面。标的物包含左上角地址当中的小型印刷字母。还包含日期当中的数字。它是一张卡片，但没有贴邮票，而是连同一个小包裹或信封一起寄出，包裹内有路易斯·波美蓝兹的书以及之前描述过的油印清单；全部都是寄给珍的。
(The distant place would be Brooklyn, NY.(遥远的地方应该是纽约州的布鲁克林。
("A hole in one. I do not know if this is a golf connection or to what it refers." We know of no literal connection here. We speculate that it might refer to the Keck’s job as painting conservators, to repair damaged art.(“一个有洞。我不知道这与高尔夫球有关联，还是指什么。”这里我们不知道任何名副其实的关联。我们推测它可能是指凯克身为绘画修复师的工作，修复损坏的艺术品。
("A connection with something bound, as a book." Possibly the book by Louis Pomerantz, mailed with the object to Jane. Some distortion possible, as seen by Seth's answer to the first question.(“与某个像一本书那样胶装的东西有关联。”可能是路易斯·波美蓝兹的书，连同标的物寄来给珍。可能有某种扭曲，从赛斯针对第一个问题的回答可以看出。
("A very small image, such as the square or rectangle on the item." This could be distortion arising from the object being similar to a postcard. But as stated the object was not mailed alone, and bears no stamp, etc., nor any marking like a square or rectangle.(“一个非常小的影像，好比在物件上的正方形或长方形。”这可能是因为标的物类似明信片而产生的扭曲。但是如上所述，标的物不是单独邮寄过来的，所以没有贴邮票等等，也没有任何正方形或长方形之类的标记。
("An invitation to attend.” At this date Jane cannot recall. The Kecks are well known in their field, and it is possible some social affair was held for them while they were in Elmira and at the gallery doing their work. Jane could have been invited to attend. She knows she attended no such affair in their honor, but doesn’t know, now, whether she was asked to.(“一个出席的邀请。”到今天为止珍都想不起来。凯克夫妇在他们的领域里很有名气，所以他们待在埃尔迈拉期间以及在画廊工作时，可能会有一些为他们举办的社交活动。珍可能受邀出席过。她知道她没有出席过任何以他们为名义举办的这类活动，但现在我们不知道她有没有受邀过。
("A fence or framework connection with the item." Again, framework can refer to frames, paintings, etc., as explained. A fence can also enter in, in a more literal way: The Arnot Art Gallery, where Caroline Keck, the author of the object worked, is surrounded by a black iron fence.(“与物件有一个篱笆或架构的关联。”再一次，如之前解释过的，架构可能是指画框、画作等等。一个篱笆也进来了，按照字面上的意思；标的物的作者卡洛琳·凯克工作所在的阿诺艺廊，围着一道黑色的铁篱笆。
("Connection with a man also. With you and another man,” Some distortion develops here, but we think this legitimate data. See the copy of the object on page 230. Note that Caroline Keck writes Jane that her son Larry appropriated my drawing for his own use. Jane looked at me when she gave this data, incidentally.(“和一个男人也有关联。与你和另一个男人有关联”这里发生了某种扭曲，但我们认为这个资料是合理的。见前面标的物副本。注意卡洛琳·凯克写给珍的卡片说，她儿子赖瑞占用了我的画。顺便一提，珍在给这个资料时看着我。
(Below, she seems to veer into distortion a bit:(下文，她似乎有点转向扭曲。
("and some connection with the date I 1492, perhaps leading to an historical event.” With the date 1492 I thought Bill Gallagher cropped up in the data; this reference growing out of the other man reference; Bill and I had been discussing old sailing ships the other evening, and various dates, etc., some of the time in Jane's presence.(“与1，1492这个年份有关联，也许通往一个历史事件。”因为1492这个年份，我认为比尔·加拉格无意间出现在这个资料中；这是从另一个男人这个关联活衍生出来的；前几天晚上以及另外几天等等，当珍在场时，比尔和我有些时间一直在讨论老式帆船。
(The word “museum" has historical connotations, and the Kecks deal with old paintings, often of historic interest, so Jane is correct when she asserts that old paintings such as those the Kecks handled while in Elmira in August 1964, are also historical events.(“博物馆”这个词有历史意涵，而凯克夫妇处理往往具有历史意义的老画作，所以当珍声称像凯克夫妇在1964年于埃尔迈拉修复的那些老画作也是历史事件时，她是对的。
(1st Question: What's that connection about a book? “ It seems as to be an old book. A bound one, with a dark color such as brown on the cover. The side of pages when the book is closed seem dusky in color, like old gold color. The book having a connection with a desk, and another location.” Again, distortion. Jane said that here she confused old paintings and old gilded frames, such as the Kecks worked with at the Amot, with old books. Quite possibly the book is Louis Pomerantz’s modern one, as described. The cover of this book is a rusty red. also it may have laid on a desk, and it was sent to Jane from another location—Brooklyn, NY.(第一个问题：与一本书的关联是什么？“好像是一本旧书。一本胶装的书，封面上有一种像是褐色的深色。在书合起来的时候，书页的侧面似乎是灰濛濛的颜色，像老旧的金色。这本书与一张书桌以及另一个地点有关联。”再一次，扭曲。珍说这里她把老画作与镀金老画框，就像凯克夫妇在阿诺艺廊处理的那些，与旧书混淆了。很可能书是指之前描述过的，路易斯·波美蓝兹写的这本现代的书。这本书的封面是绣红色。而且，它可能被放在一张书桌上，并且从另一个地点——纽约州布鲁克林——寄来给珍。
(2nd Question: Who does JB refer to? “Here, to Ruburt.” Correct. The object is addressed to Jane. See page 230.(第二个问题：JB是指什么？“这里，指鲁柏。”正确。标的物是写给珍的。见前面标的物。
(3rd Question: And the G? “A large capital G is the impression. A fancy G.” Again, some distortions evidently. As will be seen Jane here thought of our friend Bill Gallagher, hence the capital G.(第三个问题：那G呢？“印象是一个大型的大写G。一个花哨的G。”再一次，显然有一些扭曲。之后会看到，这里珍想到我们的朋友比尔·加拉格，因此出现大写的G。
(4th Question: Who is the other man referred to besides myself? “Something to do with an animal in a tree, that I do not understand.” I had been hoping Seth, or Jane, might come up with Caroline Keck's husband, Sheldon, or her son Larry, who is named on the object itself See page 230. Of course I was involved with another man, and this involvement Seth picked up—since my drawing was appropriated by Larry Keck, as noted on the object.(第四个问题：除了我自己以外，另一个男人是指谁？“与一棵树上的一只动物有关联，这我不了解。”我一直希望赛斯，或珍，想到卡洛琳·凯克的丈夫谢尔金，或她的儿子赖瑞，物件本身写出了他的名字，见前面标的物。当然我和另一个男人有关联，而且赛斯接收到这个关联——如标的物所示，因为我的画被赖瑞·凯克据为己有。
(This in turn leads Seth to some excellent data which is also amusing. The drawing I gave the Kecks was of a pigeon—the” animal in a tree.” The drawing merely showed a pigeon, no tree, and a pigeon is not an animal. Yet the data is very good.(这某种程度也进而让赛斯提出一些也很有趣的绝佳资料。我送给凯克夫妇的画是一只鸽子——“一棵树上的动物”。画里只有一只鸽子，没有树，而且鸽子不是动物。可是这个资料非常好。
("The other man, a friend rather than a relative." Here Seth, or Jane, veers toward Bill Gallagher again, it seems. I had not met either Caroline or Sheldon Keck, nor Larry who was in Brooklyn.(“另一个男人，一个朋友而不是亲戚。”这里赛斯，或珍，似乎再一次转向比尔·加拉格。我没见过卡洛琳或谢尔金，也没见过人在布鲁克林的赖瑞。
(5th Question: Initials? “This may be your friend Gallagher, or your friend Mark, for the first name would seem to be William.” A miss here. As far as we know, neither Bill Gallagher or Bill Macdonnel (Mark) are involved with the object. Bill Macdonnel may have seen the pigeon drawing when it was on exhibit at the gallery; I do not know for sure. Could William have come from Larry, on the object.(第五个问题：姓名缩写？“这可能是你的朋友加拉格，或你的朋友马克，因为名字似乎是威廉”这里是一个失误。据我所知，比尔·加拉格或比尔·麦唐纳[马克]都与标的物无关。鸽子画在艺廊展出时，比尔·麦唐纳可能见过它。我不确定。威廉有没有可能来自标的物上面的赖瑞？
(6th Question: Anything else you want to add?“ A small box, and that is all." At this date we cannot recall. The book, the mimeographed sheet and the object itself may have been mailed to us in a small box, or a manila envelope, etc.(第六个问题：你有没有要补充什么？“一个小盒子，就这样。”到今天为止，我们都想不起来。书、油印表单和标的物本身可能是装在一个小盒子，或一个牛皮纸袋信封等等寄给我们。
(End at 10:26.)(10:26结束。)

SESSION 311 第311节 一切万有 个人神 人格神 神人格


JANUARY 11,1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年1月11日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, there are some philosophical matters that I would like to clear. Ruburt has been somewhat confused concerning some of these matters. The conventional Christian concept of God has been in many ways a convenient one, and it carries with it many truths. It is true, you see, while it is not true.现在，有一些哲学问题我想要澄清一下。鲁柏对于这些问题的其中一些一直有点困惑。基督教对于神的传统观念在很多方面是一个便利的观念，而且它带有很多真相。它是真的，你知道，同时它也不是真的。
When you realize that this is a symbol only then you begin to see more and come closer to an understanding, not further away from an understanding. There is no personal god-individual in Christian terms and yet you do have access to a portion of All That Is, that is highly attuned to you only above all others.当你明白这只是一个象征时，你就会开始看见更多，并且越来越接近一种理解，而不是距离一种理解越来越远。在基督教的说法当中，没有任何私人的神-个体(god-indivdual)，可是你确实可以接近一切万有的一部分，这部分完全只与你相通。
In this respect, you see, there is a personal god, if those are the words you use. There is a portion of All That Is, that is directed and focused upon every individual consciousness. A portion of All That Is resides within and is a part of every consciousness. Every consciousness is therefore cherished and protected individually. There are automatic electromagnetic connections that exist here.在这一方面，你看，有一位个人神(personal god)，如果那些是你们用的字词。一切万有的一个部分被引导和聚焦在每一个各别的意识上。一切万有的一部分留驻在其中，而且是每一个意识的一部分。因此每一个都是各别受到珍爱和保护的。这里存在着自动的电磁连结。
One portion of All That Is, is instantly aware, for example of your most insignificant and significant problems—of yours and yours alone. This portion of overall consciousness is the portion that is individualized within you.一切万有的一部分立即觉察到，比方说，你最无关紧要与最是要紧的问题——你的问题而已，而且就只有你的问题而已。整体意识的这个部分就是在你之内个体化的部分。
Now there is even something like the idea of a personality god, but hardly in the terms used by theologians. The personality of God, as it is generally conceived is again a one-dimensional concept based upon man's small knowledge of his own psychology.现在，甚至有某个像是人格神(personality god)这种概念的东西，但在神学家的用词里几乎看不到。在一般的想像中，神的人格又是一个一维的观念，根据的是人对他自己的心理学见浅识少的认知。
Many of the old ideas of precivilization come closer to anything near the truth. What you prefer to think of as God is basically and above all, indeed as I have said, an infinite energy gestalt: or pyramid consciousness. It is aware of itself as being, for example, you, Joseph. It is aware of itself as what seems to you as your own future and past selves.史前文明的古老概念有很多更接近任何近似真相的东西。你比较喜欢想成是神的东西基本上而且最重要的是，真的像我说过的，一个无限的能量完形；或金字塔意识。它觉知它自己是，比方说，你，约瑟。它觉知它自己，就像在你看来似乎是你未来和过去的各个自己那样。
It is aware of itself as the smallest seed, both those that grow and those that do not grow. The personality of this gestalt is beyond comprehension at this point. It is both demanding and compassionate. The word, justice, is a human one, always implying punishment. And it has nothing to do with the God concept.它觉知它自己是最小的种子，既是那些已经长成的也是那些没有长成的。这个完形的人格在此时是超出理解之外的。它既严苛又慈悲。正义，这个字眼是人类的说法，永远隐含惩罚。而且它和神的观念一点关系都没有。
While there is a portion of All That Is, that is aware of itself as you, for example, a portion that is indeed focused within your existence, whose energy is directed within you, and to whom you can call for help when necessary, there is also an overall god-personality that is aware of itself also as something that is more than the sum of its creations. This is All That Is, in the deepest sense.虽然一切万有的一个部分，比方说，觉知它自己是你，一个确实聚焦在你的存在之内的部分， 它的能量被引导到你之内，而且必要时，你可以向它求助，但是也有一个整体的神-人格(god-personalyty)，它觉知它自己是某个比它的创造物总和还要大的东西。就最深的意义来说，这就是一切万有。
I am trying to make this as simple as possible. The part of All That Is, that is aware of itself as you, is also aware of itself as something more than you. This portion that knows itself as you and as more than you is the personal god, you see. Again: This gestalt, this portion of All That Is, looks out for your interests and may be called upon in a personality manner. But this portion is only a part, itself, of All That Is.我试着尽可能简单说明这一点。一切万有觉知它自己就是你的这个部分，也觉知它自己是某个比你还大的东西。知道它自己是你而且不只是你的这个部分就是个人神，你知道。再一次；这个完形，一切万有的这个部分，照顾你的利益，也可以用人格的方式被召唤。但是这个部分本身只是一切万有的一部分而已。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Rest at 9:27. (Resume 9:38.)(9:27休息，9:38继续。)
But, you see, even this overall pyramid gestalt is not static. All or most concepts of a god deal with a static god and herein lies the main theological difficulties. The awareness and experience of this overall gestalt constantly change and grow. Again, there is no static god. When you say,” This is God", then God is already something else. I am using the term God for simplicity's sake.但是，你看，就算是这个整体的金字塔完形也是静止不动的。一个神的观念全部或大部分都是和一个静止不动的神打交道，而神学主要的难题就在这里。这整个完形的觉知和经验持续不断改变和成长。再一次，没有任何静止不动的神。当你说“这是上帝”的时候，上帝已经是别的东西了。我用上帝这个说法是为了简单起见。
All portions of All That Is are constantly changing and enfolding and unfolding. All That Is, seeking to know itself, constantly creates new versions of itself. For this seeking itself is a creative activity, and the core of all action.一切万有的每一部分持续不断改变，包覆、开展。一切万有企图认识它自己，持续不断创造它自己的新版本。因为这个追寻本身就是一个创造活动，也是所有行动的核心。
Consciousness, seeking to know itself, therefore knows you. You as a consciousness, seek to know yourself, and to some extent or other, you become aware of your self as a distinct and individual portion of All That Is. You not only draw upon this overall energy, but you do so automatically, for your existence is dependent upon it.意识企图认识它自己，因而认识你。身为一个意识，你企图认识你自己，而且某种或其他程度上，你开始觉察到你的自己是一切万有的一个部分，与众不同而且自成一格。你不只汲取这股整体的能量，而且还是自动这么做，因为你的存在仰赖着它。
The extent of your realization of this fact is the extent of your freedom or vitality, fulfillment and power. It should not be forgotten, however, that the ego is also a portion of All That Is, a highly specialized portion, enabling the inner self to manipulate and interpret particular conditions. If the ego considers itself as the only self, then you are cut off to a large degree from the vitality and energy available.你对这个事实的了悟程度就是你的自由或生命力、(价值)完成与力量的幅度。然而，不应该忘记的是，自我也是一切万有的一部分，一个高度专门化的部分，它让内我得以操纵和解读特定的状况。如果自我认为它自己是唯一的自己，那你就会有很大的程度无法汲取可得的生命力和能量。
The ego’s false ideas prevent it from accepting this energy, but once the ego is aware of its position as a portion of the self, then it should not be shunted aside, but can take its place. It is sometimes referred to almost as if it stood entirely outside of basic reality. It is, of course, within it also.自我的错误想法阻碍它接受这股能量，可是自我一旦觉知它作为自己的一一部分所属的地位时，它就不应该被撇在一旁，而是可以安住在它的位置上。有时候它被讲得好像是完全站在基本实相之外似的。当然， 它也是在基本实相之内。
The ego, as you now know it. will not always be necessary, you see, but a type of ego is a basis for individuality and will always be necessary. An inner ego, of course, that contains various egos that have been or will be a portion of any given self—these egos and any ego organizes experience along various lines and ties experience together within meaningful pattern.自我，如同你现在认识的它，不会一直都是必需的，你知道，但是有一个类型的自我对个体性来说是一个基础，而且永远都是不可或缺的。一个内在自我，当然，它包含了各式各样的自我，那些自我曾经是或将会是任何既定的自己当中的一部分——这些自我与任何自我沿着各式各样的路线组织经验，在有意义的模式之内把经验连结在一起。
The inner self or the whole personality consists of many such egos, as you know, but the inner self is also aware of itself as something more than the sum of its parts. Now this something more than the sum of its parts is a curious phrase, but within it lies a key that can give you some small understanding of what God may be.内我或整个人格是由很多这样的自我组成的，如你所知，但是内我也觉知它自己是某个比它各个部分的总和更大的东西。现在这个比它各个部分的总和更大的东西是一个奇怪的措辞，但是其中却有一个答案，可以让你对于神可能是什么有小小的一些了解。
Again, the term God is used simply because it is an accepted term for the reality we are discussing. That which knows itself, which experiences itself within many forms and yet knows itself as something apart from the total of its sums, that left-over, unexplainable remnant you see, can be thought of as original action, original consciousness, prime mover, or consciousness as distinct from its own creations, of which it is also part.再一次，之所以用神这个字，只因为它是我们正在讨论的实相接受的一个说法。那个东西认识它自己、在很多形式之内体验它自己，但也知道它自己有别于它全部的总和，有别于你知道无法解释的残余部分，可以被想成是最初的行动、最初的意识、原动力，或是与它自己的创造物截然不同的意识，但它也是其中一部分。
Now, this material is at best difficult to explain verbally.现在， 就算在最好的状况下，这个资料也难以用口语解释。
Take a break and we shall continue.休息一下，我们再继续。
(Rest at 10 PM. Jane felt herself” swept up" in this part of the material, as though she were feeling concepts. (Resume 10:15.)(10点休息。珍感觉她自己在资料的这个部分“深陷其中”，仿佛她感觉到观念似的。10:15继续。)
You are yourself obviously an energy gestalt; as you become more fully conscious of reality your sense of identity will contain larger and larger aspects of reality.你自己显然是一个能量完形；在你变得越来越充分意识到实相时，你对本体的感觉就会包含越来越大的实相面向。
Biologically all human beings, as you know them, have existed as the various cells of which a human image is composed. This is very difficult to explain clearly.在生物学上，你所知的人类全部都以有意识的各种细胞这种形式存在，而人类的形象就是由这些细胞构成的。这很难解释清楚。
I do not mean to imply, necessarily, progression here. Theoretically, you see, you will one day be a fully conscious portion of the personal god to whom you may now pray. By then, you see, you will be aware of further gestalts. Do you see?这里我不一定有暗示进展的意思。理论上，你知道，你有一天将会是你现在可能向它祈求的那位个人神所属的一个具有充足意识的部分。 到了那时候，你知道，你将会对更多完形有觉知。你明白吗？
("Yes.")(“明白”。)
All portions of All That Is do not recognize themselves consciously as All That Is. But know themselves mainly as individuals, not as the prime gestalt individual. When realization is reached at the highest level, then All That Is instantly creates new realities, and to some extent, you see, loses the conscious knowledge of its own identity.一切万有的每个部分在意识上都不认识它自己是一切万有。而是知道它们自己主要是个体，不是最初的完形个体。一旦有了最高层次的了悟，一切万有就会立刻创造新的实相，而且在某种程度上，你知道，它对自己的本体也失去有意识的认知。
The loss is always temporary and self generated. This is quite enough on a difficult subject this evening. We shall close the session, or I will be glad to answer any questions, if you wish.这种失去永远都是暂时的而且是自行产生的。今晚在一个困难的主题上讲得够多了。我们要结束这一切，不然你想要的话，我也很乐意回答任何问题。
("I guess not.” )(“我想不用了。”)
My best wishes to you both. This session has been an excellent one.给你们两位我最好的祝福。这是很棒的一节。
("Good night, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(10:27.)(10:27。)

SESSION 312 第312节 当下所是 信封82


JANUARY 16, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年1月16日 星期一 晚上9点
(The 82nd envelope experiment had as object common black pepper, poured into the inner of the two regular sealed envelopes we use. Hence no drawing is necessary. Results were good.(第82次信封实验的标的物是常见的黑胡椒，倒进我们使用的两个一般密封信封里面那一个。因此不需要画图。结果很好。
(Jane began speaking in trance, while sitting down and with her eyes closed. Her voice was deeper and stronger than usual, her pace good. Eventually her eyes began to open.)(珍在出神中开始说话，同时坐下来，眼睛闭着。她的声音比平常更深沉也更有力，速度很好。最终她的眼睛开始睁开。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. To arrive at any real understanding of human personality several prerequisites must be met.现在。要对人类的人格有任何真正的了解，一定要达成几个先决条件。
For one thing, you are not dealing with one linear self. The self is indeed multidimensional, and the driving force behind the self does not reside in the ego or in what you refer to as the subconscious.首先，你不是和一个线性的自己打交道。自己其实是多维的，而且在自己背后的驱动力并不在自我或你们指称的潜意识之中。
Any such divisions are of course arbitrary to begin with. Practically speaking a self can be defined as an energy gestalt whose perceptions are organized under the auspices of apparent identity. The more of reality that is perceived the larger the dimensions of the self, or identity.任何这类的区分当然一开始就是任意为之的。实际上来说，一个自己可能被定义为一股能量完形，它的感知在外显本体的护持之下组织成形。被感知的实相越多，自己或本体的维度也就越大。
Now I mean this literally. Reality is on the one hand the product of perception. On the other hand that which is, is always present as the basis for any perception. That which is perceives itself, you see. The unitary self is basically an illusions and yet individuality is no illusion.现在我说的就是字面上的意思。实相一方面是感知的产物。另一方面，当下所是永远都是任何感知的基础。当下所是感知它自己。一维的自己基本上是幻相，但个体性一点也不是幻相。
Diversity is a necessity even for that which is. To some extent, that which is must always be lost within itself. Lost in a multiplicity of numberless selves. The selves are self directing units, however. As you know there are no limitations to any identity. The limitations are illusions. And yet the extent to which the illusions are shattered represents on your level the sparks of the expanding consciousness.多元性甚至也是当下所是必需的。某种程度上，当下所是永远都必须迷失在它自己之内。迷失在无数自己的多维性之中。然而，各个自己都是自己主导(self-directing)的单位。如你所知，任何本体都是没有限制的。限制是幻相。可是在你们的层面，幻相破灭的程度代表扩展中的意识闪现的火花。
Until this is realized your psychology will raise more questions than it answers. The basis for all experience is depth perception, and value fulfillment. The self organizes data basically in a manner that psychology has not found. The organization of such data is not simply the result of pre-adulthood tendencies, inclinations or experience. Such tendencies are highly colored by previous existences, by past lives, and this prehistory, existing as the electromagnetic property of the whole self, is the blueprint which is followed by the structure of the chromosomes.在明了这一点之前，你们的心理学提出的问题多过于解答。所有经验的基础都是深度感知，以及价值完成。自我基本上是以心理学没有发现的一种方式来组织资料。这里资料的组织不只是成年前期的倾向、习性或经验的结果。这样的倾向深受先前的存在、受过去世的影响，而且以全我的电磁属性存在的这个生前史，就是染色体的结构所采用的蓝图。
That information, you see, will never be found in physical terms. It such past memories are consciously recovered, as they have been, the closed mind of the academic psychologist will not see what he has, but will suppose the overworked imagination responsible. A fully developed psychology will not exist until reincarnation is accepted as a fact.那个资讯，你知道，在物质界永远都找不到。如果在意识上重获这样的前世记忆，如同它们曾经有过那样，学院派心理学家的封闭心智也不会看见他有什么，反而会认为是想像力过头造成的结果。在接受转世是事实之前，充分发展的心理学并不存在。
Now, there is an overall personality pattern that is characteristic of each whole self, of which the reincarnated selves each give evidence. There are particular and unique overall goals and abilities that the whole self strives for through these existences. Any psychology worthy of the name must take this inner motivation into consideration.现在，有一个整体的人格模式是每一个全我的特征，而每一个转世的自己都是它的明证。有独特专属的整体目标和能力是全我透过这些生生世世的存在努力达成的。任何名副其实的心理学一定要把这个内在动机纳入考虑。
The study of dreams has been held back immeasurably because past-life memories have been stubbornly ignored. Reincarnational material usually discusses various existences as occurring one before the other. I emphasize strongly once more that the concept of continuity in terms of time is highly erroneous.梦的研究遭受无法衡量的阻碍，因为人们冥顽不灵，不把过去世的记忆当一回事。转世资料通常是讨论一世接着一切的各个存在。我要再一次大力强调，时间的连续是一个大错特错的观念。
In the spacious present there are no such terms. Other selves, reincarnated within the physical system as physical creatures, experienced time as you do, as a series of moments strung out one before the other. Memories in dreams and in the trance state are usually already censored. As physical creatures alone you cannot remember the future. Therefore only past lives are ever recalled. In the dream state however what would appear to you as future lives are already familiar. To the inner senses all of these existences are simultaneous.在广阔的现在，根本没有这种事情。其他的自己，在物质系统之内以物质生物的形式转世，和你们一样体验时间是一个衔接着另一个的一连串时刻。在梦中以及在出神状态里的记忆通常已经被审查过了。单单以肉体生物的形式存在，你们是无法记得未来的。因此想得起来的只有过去世而已。然而在梦状态中，在你看来是未来世的存在其实早已不陌生。对内在感官而言，这些前世与来生全部同时存在。
You may take your break.你可以休息了。
(9:27. Jane said the voice felt deep to her, and swept her along. Resume at 9:35.)(9:27分。珍说她感觉噪音低沉，深深触动了她。9:35继续。)
Now. Ruburt can learn much by observing his young students.现在。观察他的年幼学生，鲁柏可以学到很多。
I told you at one time that birth was a greater shock than death. Some personalities react strongly against the enforced dependency. Others embrace it gladly.我有一次告诉你，出生是比死亡更大的震撼。有些人格剧烈抗拒强加的依赖。其他的人格则是欣赏拥抱它。
The various reincarnated selves can be superficially (underlined) regarded as portions of a whole crossword puzzle for they are all portions of the whole; and yet they can exist scattered from the whole, although their meaning is then diminished. In the case of the whole self there is communication between various portions of the self. Future and past selves mingle. A thorough understanding of reincarnated existences are of benefit to the conscious present self. Unexplained tendencies and inclinations then are seen as part of an overall pattern.各个转世的自己在表面上(划线)都可以被当成是一整个字谜拼图的一部分，因为它们全部都是整体的一分子；但是它们可以从整体散开，分别存在，虽然它们的意义也跟着减小。就全我来说，自己的各个部分之间是有沟通的。未来的自己与过去的自己往来。彻底了解转世的存在对当下有意识的自己是有好处的。无法解释的倾向和习性于是被看成是一个整体模式的一部分。
The physical brain as you know it is but the camouflage mechanism belonging to the physically oriented self. In some cases, severe damage is done to the brain, and yet rationality continues. In these cases the mind behind the brain operates as always. When the individual is convinced that his activities are completely dependent upon the physical brain, then he is incapacitated almost completely by any injury to it. The brain itself contains knowledge that comes through the inner senses, and this knowledge would simply not be available to it, if it were dependent upon physical data completely.你所知的肉体脑只不过是伪装机制，属于物质导向的自己。在某些案例中，脑部严重受创，但理性依旧在。在这些案例中，脑部背后的心智一如平常那般运作。要是个体相信他的活动完全仰赖肉体脑，那它的任何损伤都会让他几乎完全失能。脑部本身包含在感官传来的知识，如果它完全依赖物质资料，根本就无法取用这个知识。
Now, do you have an envelope for me?现在，你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(At 9:45 Jane took the double sealed envelope from me for the 82nd experiment and pressed it to her closed eyes in a horizontal manner briefly, before gesturing with it.)(9:45，珍跟我拿了第82次实验的双层密封信封，把它放在她闭着的眼睛一下子，之后用它比手势。)
Give us a moment. I hold it with the point down.等我们一下。我让它的尖端朝下。
(Jane indicated the point of the flap on the back with a finger, her eyes still closed.(珍用一根手指比着信封盖口的尖端。她的眼睛依然闭着。
("Yes.")(“是的”。)
These are impressions.这些是印象。
A miscellany of united objects or images, of small patterns like dots but larger than small dots. Light and dark, rather highly contracted.一堆一致的物件或画面，有着像圆点的图案，但是比小圆点大。明和暗，非常窄缩。
A cloudlike or leaflike effect, or like pebbles, you see.一个像云朵或叶子的效果，或像鹅卵石，你知道。
The number 14. J A B. Connection with a squirrel or small animal, and perhaps a target.数字14。JAB。与一只松鼠或小动物，也许还有一个标靶有关联。
Something upside down, or difficult to tell the top from the bottom. A rooflike shape. Something stands on rocks. A face.某个头上脚下或难以分辨上下的东西。一个像屋顶的形状。某个竖立在岩石上的东西。一张脸。
A foreign connection. South or West, in relation to a trip. The impression of fine, finely patterned edges. Blacks and whites.与异国的一个关联。南方或西方，与一趟旅程有关系。印象是细微，图案细微的边缘。黑色与白色。
Writing on one side. The back, I believe, and something relating to images on the front. On the back I mean handwriting. Steps. Ruburt thinks of an old photograph of himself, with his dog. And connects this with his father.一面有手写字。我相信是背面，以及某个与前面的图像有关的东西。我是说背面有手写字。台阶。鲁柏想到他自己的一张旧照，与他的狗合照。而且把这个和他的父亲连结在一起。
1831. A village. Perhaps mentioned by name. A word like peck or pack.1831。一个村庄。也许是名字被提到。一张像peck(配克；译注：重量单位，大约等于9公升)或pack(包)的字。
Do you have questions?你有没有问题？
("No. I guess not.” )(“没有，我想没有。”)
You may take your break.你可以休息一下了。
(Break at 9:55. Jane had spoken rapidly, her eyes dosed, the envelope held up to her face practically the whole time. She had one image which will be mentioned in place. Seth returned and helped us out on a few connections, but in the meantime we made our own.(9:55休息。珍说得很快，两眼闭着，差不多全程都把信封放在脸上。她有一个画面，到时候会提到。赛斯回来帮我们理清几个连结，但同时我们也自己找关联。
(The” object" was, as stated, common black pepper. I shook a small amount of it into an envelope, sealed it, then placed this between the usual two pieces of Bristol board and sealed the sandwich in another envelope. No writing was involved. Jane said that as she held the envelope to her head she did not hear anything move within; nor did she shake the envelope, etc.(如上所述，“标的物”是一般的胡椒。我倒了少许在信封里，封口，然后把它夹在两片普通的西卡纸之间，再将这个三明治放进另一个信封里。其中没有任何手写字。珍说她把信封放在头上时，并没有听到里面有任何的声响；她也没有摇动信封等等。
("A miscellany of united objects or images, of small patterns like dots but larger than small dots. Light and dark, rather highly contracted." Excellent data, and Jane did everything but name the object as pepper. I almost called a halt to the data here, on impulse, but then decided to see what else Seth came up with.(“一堆一致的物件或画面，有着像圆点的图案，但是比小圆点大。明和暗，非常窄缩。”绝佳的资料，而且除了说出标的物的名称是胡椒以外，珍什么都说了。一时冲动之下，差一点在这里喊停，但后来决定看看赛斯还会想到什么。
("A cloudlike or leaflike effect, or like pebbles, you see." More development on the above data, the loose pepper could assume cloudlike shapes with the envelope, etc.(“一个像云朵或叶子的效果，或像鹅卵石，你知道。”上述资料的更多发展，散落的胡椒在信封内可能呈现类似云朵的形状等等。
(The pebbles data could also stem from the tin can of pepper used to fill the plastic shaker with which I filled the envelope. Jane located the pepper can in the kitchen. It was a McCormick product. On it were the words 'Pure Ground Black Pepper” etc., pebbles and ground being related.(鹅卵石资料也可能出自用来填充塑胶摇罐的胡椒马口铁罐。珍把胡椒罐放在厨房。它是未好美[McCormick]的一个产品。在它上面有“Pure Gure Ground Black Pepper”[研磨纯黑胡椒]等字，pebbles[鹅卵石]和ground[地面]是相关的。[译注：ground也有前文的研磨之意]
("The number 14." We don’t know for sure. The plastic shaker I used contains no markings except the letter P. The McCormick can contains the words” 4 Oz.” , Jane thinks it possible it took us about 14 weeks to acquire the set of dishes of which the salt and pepper shakers are a part.(“数字14。”我们不确定。我用的塑胶摇罐除了字母P以外，没有任何标记。味可美的罐子上面有“4Oz”[4盎司]的字样。珍认为有可能是我们花了14个星期才取得包含盐罐和胡椒罐的这套餐具。
(We acquired the dishes through trading at a certain supermarket and obtaining so many pieces weekly, through coupons. It took some time. Jane is quite sure we traded there at least three months.(我们是在某个超市透过购物，每周买了许多东西，才用积点兑换餐具。花了一些时间。珍很确定我们在那里购物至少有3个月之久。
("J A B." Seth helps out on this later. Our interpretation was not right. We thought the J B might refer to Jane‘s initials, but in this case couldn’t account for the A since Jane has no middle name.(“JAB。”赛斯稍后帮了忙。我们的解读不正确。我们以为JB可能是指珍的姓名缩写，但在这个情况下就无法说明A，因为珍没有中间名。
("Connection with a squirrel or small animal," We were partly correct here. Again, Seth helps out later. We thought possibly the animal reference concerned our occasional use of pepper acorns, which we used to grind ourselves. Jane has remarked that these remind her of bird feed, which we put out on the roof beside our kitchen windows. Squirrels also use the bird feeder.(“与一只松鼠或小动物[有关联]”这里我们有一部分是对的。再一次，赛斯稍后帮了忙。我们以为之所以提到动物可能与我们偶尔用到胡椒粒有关系，我们以前会自己研磨。珍说过这让她想到鸟的饲料，我们会把它放在厨房窗户旁边的屋顶上。松鼠也会来用喂鸟器。
("and perhaps a target.” We were correct here, in thinking target referred either to the hole in the bottom of the pepper shaker, or the hole in the McCormick can itself. This hole is covered by a red plastic plug.(“也许还有一个标靶有关联。”这里我们想的是正确的，标靶不是指胡椒罐底部的洞，就是指味可美铁罐本身的洞。这个洞用一个红色塑胶塞子盖住。
("Something upside down, or difficult to tell the top from the bottom.” To me, this referred certainly to the pepper shaker, as I turned it upside down while shaking into the envelope. The shaker itself is modern in design and is filled from the bottom.(“某个头上脚下或难以分辨上下的东西。”对我来说，这肯定是指胡椒罐，我让它头上脚下，倒过来摇晃，将胡椒撒入信封。胡椒罐本身的设计是现代的，填充口在底部。
("A rooflike shape.” We think this data also refers to the design of the shaker.(“一个像屋顶的形状。”我们认为这个资料也是指胡椒罐的设计。
("Something stands on rocks. A face.” Here Jane had an image—that of her face, small, as she stood on some rocks and near water. She was not sure in the image, that she was near an ocean, particularly. The face she saw was not that in a photo, but herself, alive. Seth explains this later.(“某个竖立在岩石上的东西。一张脸。”这里珍有一个画面——她的脸，小小的画面，她站在一些岩石上，靠近水边。她不确定在画面里，明确来说，她是不是靠近一片海洋。她看到的不是相片中的那张脸，而是她自己，活生生的。赛斯稍后解释了这一点。
("A foreign connection.” We thought the pepper, or object, itself, since it comes from foreign lands.(“与异国的一个关联。”我们认为是胡椒，或标的物本身，因为它来自异国土地。
("South or West, in relation to a trip.” On the McCormick pepper can, factories are mentioned as being located in Baltimore, MD, and San Francisco, CA, thus south and west from our Elmira location.(“南方或西方，与一趟旅程有关系。”在味可美胡椒罐上，提到工厂位于马里兰州的巴尔的摩，以及加州的旧金山，因此是位于我们埃尔迈拉所在地的南方和西方。
(This connection is not as remote as it might seem: Jane spent some time in Baltimore before we were married 12 years ago. Even so that location has strong personal associations for her today. Both of us have been to Los Angeles, CA, several times, but Jane has not been to San Francisco.(这个关联不是表面看来那么遥远：在我们位于12年前结婚之前，珍在巴尔的摩待过一段时间，即便如此，那个地点到今天对她来说都还有强烈的个人连结。我们两人去过加州的洛杉矶几次，但珍没有去过旧金山。
("The impression of fine, finely patterned edges. Blacks and whites.” Again, the pepper itself. When Jane opened the double sealed envelopes, she found the pepper had settled in a loose line at the bottom of the inside envelope; thus it formed a fine patterned edge, which also consisted of block and lighter colored grains even though the pepper is called black, in actuality less than half of it seemed to be black, literally.(“印象是细微，图案细微的边缘。黑色与白色。”再一次，指的是胡椒本身。当珍打开双层密封信封时，她发现胡椒在内层信封底部松散地排成一行；因此它形成一道有图案的细微边缘，而且是由黑色与比较浅色的颗粒组成，即便名称叫做黑胡椒，事实上不到一半是名副其实的黑色。
("Writing on one side. The back, I believe, and something relating to images on the front. On the back I mean handwriting. Steps. Ruburt thinks of an old photograph of himself, with his dog. And connects this with his father.” Again Seth helps out here after break. We think this data stems partly from the image Jane had of herself earlier, and that two ideas are mixed up here. There is a Baltimore connection, in that Baltimore is mentioned on the pepper can, as explained; also, Jane has a photo of herself taken on a set of the typical white Baltimore stone steps, with her dog, Mischa, now dead.(“一面有手写字。我相信是背面，以及某个与前面的图像有关的东西。我是说背面有手写字。台阶。鲁柏想到他自己的一张旧照，与他的狗合照。而且把这个和他的父亲连结在一起。”再一次，这里赛斯在休息之后帮了忙。我们认为这个资料有一部分出于珍之前看到她自己的画面，而两个意念在这里混合了。
(There is also a father connection here, as Seth explains with the salt and pepper shakers and the new set of dishes to which they belong.有一个巴尔的摩的关联，因为之前解释过，胡椒罐上提到巴尔的摩；此外，珍有一张她自己的照片是在一座典型的巴尔的摩石阶上拍的，与她的狗米夏[Mischa]合照，它现在已经死了。
("1831." No connections.(“1831。”没有任何关联。
("A village. Perhaps mentioned by name." We are not sure. On the upper can is the slogan” House of McCormick" and Jane wondered if she enlarged house into village.(“一个村庄。也许是名字被提到。”我们不确定，在罐子上半部有一句广告词：“味可美之家”，珍怀疑她把家放大成村庄。
("A word like peck or pack." At first, we thought these might be attempts to get at the word pepper. Then Jane remembered something of the old rhyme: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers, etc.(“一张像peck[配克]或pack[包]的字。”起初，我们以为这些可能是想要说出胡椒这个字词的尝试。然后珍想起一首老童谣的句子：彼得·派普抓了一配克的腌制胡椒等等。
(As we finished going over the data, Jane then remembered that as she was giving it she was going to say something about the implication of motion being connected with the object; for reasons unknown she didn’t give voice to it. Perhaps the motion referred to my moving the shaker as I put some pepper in the envelope, etc.(在我们重看了全部的资料以后，珍想起她在给资料时，本来打算说出动作的含义与标的物有关的某件事；由于某些原因，她没有说出口。也许动作是指我摇动罐子，把一些胡椒倒入信封等等。
(The letter P enters in through the initial on top of the shaker. See the sketch on page 245.(字母P经由摇罐顶端的缩写而进入资料中。见前面的素描。
(Jane resumed at 10:15.)(珍在10:15继续。)
Now. I do not particularly see the benefit of too much after discussion with these experiments, unless of course there is something to be learned. And here there is.现在。我没有特别看到在这些实验之后进行过多讨论的好处，当然，除非有需要学习的东西。而这里就有。
The photograph connection. Now. I tried to give the impression of salt, to bring Ruburt to salt and pepper. He interpreted this however in his own way, as saltwater, and the photograph was taken by the ocean, with rocks and sand, and the sand, you see, was picked up because of the grains.照片的关联。现在。我试着给出盐的印象，引导鲁柏说出盐和胡椒。不过，他用自己的方式解读成卤水，而照片是在海边拍的，有岩石和沙子，你知道，沙子之所以被接收到，是因为颗粒的关系。
(This would be a different photo, it seems, than the one of Jane and her dog in Baltimore.)(这似乎是不一样的照片，有别于珍和她的狗在巴尔的摩合照的那一张。)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
The South and West you interpreted correctly.南方和西方，你的解读是正确的。
The target. A poor interpretation, applying to the necessity of filling the hole of the shaker; and the red symbol on the can was meant here.标靶。一个糟糕的解读，适用于摇罐的洞口必须塞住的状况；这里指的就是铁罐上的红色符号。
The grain idea led to the animal connection, the squirrel. The JAB, Ruburt's own association. Wiping his eyes when filling the shaker, he jabbed his eye. The father connection, legitimate but not pertinent. He had vainly daydreamed that his father might send unexpected money, with which he could complete that set of dishes to which the pepper shaker belongs.颗粒的概念引出了动物的关联，松鼠。JAB，是鲁柏自己的联想。在填充摇罐时，他揉了双眼，戳到其中一只。与父亲的关联，合理但是不相干。他做过白日梦，希望他的父亲会出乎意料地寄钱来，那他就可以收集到胡椒摇罐所属的一套餐具，结果希望落空。
One note here. We shall be continuing our discussion of human personality and its composition, along with that which is, for they are inseparable.这里有一个注。除了当下所是以外，我们会继续讨论人类的人格以及它的构成，因为它们是不可分的。
Money will be arriving shortly. With that pleasant thought I will bid you a fond good evening. If you have any questions however I shall be most delighted to answer them.钱不久就会寄来。借着这个愉快的想法，我要祝你们有一个美好的夜晚。不过，如果你有任何问题的话，我会非常乐于回答。
("I'll ask this question now, and you can develop it as you choose: Can you help Jane contact survival personalities?")(“我现在要问这个问题，你来选择可以怎样阐述它：你可不可以帮助珍联系死后犹存的人格？”)
I can, when he is ready. His rate of development, his confidence, is all important.我可以，当他准备好的时候。他的发展速度、他的信心，都很重要。
(Active manner, eyes open, etc.)(态度积极、双眼圆睁等等)
Also, Emotional impetus is important. I have not believed either of you ready. Someone in your plane must want to contact someone on a nonphysical plane badly; and that survival personality must also want to communicate.还有，情感冲力也很重要。我不相信你们两人准备好了。在你们的层面上的某个人一定得非常想要联系某个在非物质层面的人；而且那个死后犹存的人格也一定得想要沟通。
This means that others are involved, you see. This is your decision. There may be friends who would like to contact their own relatives. You might start here when you are ready. But when you are ready, comparative strangers would be best, ideally speaking.这表示有其他人牵涉在其中，你知道。这是你们的决定。有可能是朋友想要联系他们自己的亲人。当你们准备好的时候，可以从这里开始。但是，当你们准备好的时候，理想上来说，相对陌生的最好。
Now this sort of experience would convince you of survival, as perhaps nothing else could. But your own willingness is a prerequisite. Have I answered you sufficiently?也许别的事情都没办法，但现在这类的经验会让你相信死后犹存。但是你自己的意愿是先决条件。我给你的回答够不够充分？
("Yes. Very good.” )(“够，非常好。”)
We can discuss the matter more fully, if you wish, later.如果你希望的话，改天我们可以更充分讨论这件事。
("Yes.")(“好。”)
Is there anything else?还有别的事吗？
("I guess not now, thank you.")(“我想现在没有了，谢谢你。”)
Tell Ruburt to call on me before he sleeps, and we shall see what we can do for his comfort. He is stubborn, but he is learning. The whole experience will be shortly over. Were it not for the benefit of his nature, and as a result of his nature, it would not have been necessary at all.告诉鲁柏在睡前来探问我一下，我们看看可以做什么让他觉得舒服。他是固执的，但他正在学习中。这整个经验很快就会结束。要不是有益于他的本质，而且也是他的本质造成的一个结果，它根本就没有必要。
Those who strive high must know what they do, and understand the effects of not working hard enough, of not allowing themselves sufficient freedom. Apparently he could learn no other way. It will be an object lesson for the rest of his life, but it was not thrust upon him, you see.那些力争上游的人一定要知道他们在做什么，也要了解不够努力、不给自己足够自由的后果。显然他只有用这种方法才能学到。对他往后的人生来说，它将会是一个从经验中学习的教训，但它并不是强加在他身上的，你知道。
Now. A most fond and affectionate good evening.现在。祝你们有个最温柔又亲昵的夜晚。
("Goodnight, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
I will look in on you, and you shall see me before long.我会来探望你们，而你们不久就会见到我。
("Good."(“好哦。”
(End at 10:34.)(10:34结束。)
JANE’S HANDWRITTEN NOTE, RELATING TO SETH’S COMMENTS IN SESSION 313珍的手写笔记，与赛斯在第313节的评论有关
On February 1, 1968, I sent Dreams to Doubleday on suggestion of Reverend Crosson. On February 16. (2 days after Valentine's Day) they wrote a letter of rejection.(的确接到一个叫吉恩·谢弗[Jean Schaefer]或发音为摩斯曼[Mossman]的人确认投稿寄达的通知。)
On February 28, 1968—I sent Dreams to McGraw Hill.1968年2月28日——我把《梦》寄给麦格罗希尔(McGraw Hill)出版公司。
On April 2, 1968—I sent it to Prentice Hall1968年4月2日——我把它寄给普伦蒂斯·霍尔(Prentice Hall)出版社。
On April 17, 1968— I got request from a Tam Mossman to do a book on Seth Material, using portions of the best chapters from dream book that deal with Seth.1968年4月17日——我收到谭·摩斯曼(Tam Mossman)的请求，要我利用《梦》当中一部分与赛斯有关的最佳章节，写一本谈赛斯资料的书。
This involves request from other publisher—same connection with February (the initials would be T. M. rather than Seth Material) and it would be a year off. Have no idea what Mossman looks like, etc. No travel.听了克罗森牧师(Reverend Crosson)的建议，在1968年2月1日，我把《梦》(编注：这里台版翻译为《梦、进化与价值完成》，应该不是。因为赛斯此时还没开始口述自己的书，可能是珍自己写的《梦与意识投射》)寄给双日(Doubleday)出版神。2月16日——(情人节之后两天)他们写了一封退稿信。
(Did receive an acknowledgement of manuscript prospectus from a Jean Schaefer or the sound Mossman.)这和其他出版社的请求有关系——与2月有相同的关联(姓名缩写是T.M.,而不是赛斯资料[Seth Material])，而且相隔一年。完全不知道谭·摩斯曼长什么样。没有旅行。

SESSION 313 第313节 珍、约翰·布莱德利私人课


JANUARY 18, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年1月16日 星期三 晚上9点
(John Bradley attended this session; most of the session contains material relating to him. Jane received her check from publisher Fell today and was pleased.)(约翰·布莱德利出席了这一节；这节课的资料大部分与他有关。珍今天收到出版商费尔寄给她的支票，她很高兴。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:]” Good evening, Seth.")(约翰：“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, you shall celebrate with a Seth session. I told you that your money would arrive. My greetings to our friend, Philip现在，你应该用一节赛斯课来庆祝。我告诉过你，你的钱会寄来的。问候我们的朋友，菲利普
(Seth's entity name for John).(赛斯给约翰的存有名)。
Now. For Ruburts benefit: There will be considerable movement and activity concerning his book in the month of February, and some travel on your part. The initials SM here. A short gray or white-haired gentleman. You might say prematurely white or gray, in his 40's. Perhaps around Valentine's day: in that general area. There will be an inquiry, a request for Ruburt to do a book from another publisher. The book involving me.现在。为了鲁柏的利益着想：在2月这个月份，有相当多的动作和活动与他的书有关，而且你也有一些旅行。这里有缩写SM。一个灰色或白色短发绅士。你可以说40多岁的他是早生白发或灰发。也许在情人节前后；大约在那个范围。会有人来询问，另一个出版商来请求鲁柏写一本书。这本书与我有关。
Now for Philip: Some impressions, if you will give me a moment, please. The death mentioned earlier will still occur. The physical ailment already is in existence and is being treated in privacy. An initial encounter for him, with a new individual, in business. I do not know if this is immediately past or immediately future.现在来说菲利普：一些印象，要是你们愿意，请等我一下。之前提过的死亡将会发生。身体的病痛已经存在，并且在私底下被治疗。在工作上，他和一个新的个体有第一次的邂逅。我不知道这是刚发生的过去，还是即将发生的未来。
([John:]” Is he with this company?")(“约翰：他在这家公司吗？”)
The new individual is either with the company or strongly connected with your attitude toward the company. Please wait until I am finished with spontaneous impressions for your questions, and then I will try to answer them.新的个体要不是在这家公司，就是与你对公司的态度有强烈的连结。请等我结束自发的印象，你再问问题，到时候我会试着回答。
The impression now of two men, one tall and bony, with sandy hair and ill-fitting clothes. One shorter with dark hair back from the forehead, and a round face from the front. But not from the profile.现在是两个男人的印象，一个高而瘦削，有着棕色的头发，衣服很不合身。一个比较矮，有着一头从前额往后梳的黑发，以及一张从正面看来呈圆形的脸，但从侧面看来不是。
A connection with Detroit.与底特律有一个关联。
Give us a moment. A new product being developed by the company that affects the nervous system, a strong U, long U sound connected with it. And a revival here, a stock revival. The product is in the works, so to speak, but that is all at present.等我们一下。这家公司开发的一个新产品，会影响神经系统，一个强烈的U，长音的U与它有关联。这里还有一次复苏、一次股票的复苏。产品正在准备中，可以这么说，但目前就这样而已。
A small boy connected with one of your children should be avoided: an unhealthy influence here. I am not sure. M J is the closest I can come. Perhaps I can clear this later. Is there perhaps a third grade child?应该要避开一个与你的孩子们有连结的小男孩：这里有一个不健康的影响。我不确定。就我能够想到的，MJ是最接近的。也许我稍后可以理清这一点。或许有一个三年级的孩子？
(Handwritten: “See Notes” Jane wrote after I typed the session.(手写笔记：“见注释”，珍在我为这一节打好字之后写的。
([John:] “Do you want me to answer that now?"(“约翰：你要我现在回答吗？”
(Pause.) The number three, you see, is strong here. I do not know if it refers to the third grade or a child three seats away.(停顿)数字3，你看，在这里很强烈。我不知道它是指三年级或隔三个座位的一个孩子。
An April meeting: The company again. About the 16th perhaps, the 6th, 16th or 26th.4月的一场会议：又是公司。也许是16日前后，6日、16日或26日。
A man in the background of your acquaintance, not connected with the company now, or if he is, he is far from your thoughts. As it would seem to be a professional man not at your firm. He appears to be offering you something for his own reasons, and for his own benefit rather than your own.在背景中一个你的熟人，现在与公司没有关联，或者有关联的话，你也很少想到他。因为他好像是不在你公司的一位专业人士。他刚好为了他自己的原因，为了他自己而不是你自己的利益，提供你某个东西。
I keep picking up the J initial all evening. There is a schedule of events that will not be followed, and a time schedule that the company will not meet. The new product may be the result of an error, for its benefits are not yet realized. Give us a moment on this. This, Joseph, is an attempt now(points to Robert Butts, eyes closed) for Ruburt does not know terms. M I or MY and a word that sounds like ocean, or M E O plus a C sound and a word that sounds like ocean. To do with red and white blood corpuscles, a deficiency, a check upon the deficiency, and an alteration of nervous reaction patterns. A two grain... gram tablet. Initially a byproduct of another investigation. The product the end result of an experiment initiated for other reasons, you see.我整个晚上不停接收到首字母J。有一个不会被采用的事件行事历，以及一个公司跟不上的时间表。新产品可能是一个错误造成的结果。因为它的好处尚未变成事实。这里等我们一下。约瑟，现这是一个尝试(指着罗勃·柏兹，眼睛闭着)，因为鲁柏不知道名称。MI或MY以及一个听起来像海洋(ocean)的字，或是MEO加上一个C的音和一个听起来像海洋的字。与红血球和白血球有关系，一种不足，针对不足以及神经系统反应模式变化的一种检查。一种两粒……克的药片。最初是另一个研究的副产品。这个产品是一个为了其他原因而开始的实验造成的最终结果，你知道。
Now you may take a break and we shall continue, and I will, before the evening is over, answer whatever questions Philip might have.现在你可以休息一下，我们再继续，而且在今晚结束之前，不管什么问题，我都会回答。菲利普可能有。
There is a timing element with the tablet.药片有一个定时元素。
(Break at 9:22.(9:22结束。
(The following is a resume of John Bradley's comments regarding the impressions given above. There was an initial encounter with a man in the company, in the immediate past—two weeks ago. The man, according to John, was also strongly connected to John's feelings about the company [or attitudes toward it] for he felt that the new man, a regional director, has some of the same attitudes he has.(以下是布莱德利对上文给出的印象所做评论的摘要。与公司里的一个男人有一次最初的邂逅，在刚发生的过去——两周前。据约翰说，这个男人与约翰对公司的感觉[或对它的态度]也有很强烈的关联，因为他觉得这个新来的男人，一个区域经理，有一些态度和他一样。
(The tall bony man mentioned could refer possibly to Dan Searle whose father is past president of the company, Dan is tall, bony and has sandy hair. Dan is now president.(提到的高瘦男人可能是指丹·瑟尔[Dan Searle]，他的父亲以前是公司总裁，丹又高又瘦，还有一头黑发。丹现在是总裁。
(The shorter dark-haired man mentioned reminds John strongly of the new regional manager mentioned above; particularly since the man's face looks round from the front, but not in profile. John noticed this.(另外提到的那个个子较矮的黑发男人，让约翰强烈联想到上文说过的新任区域经理；特别是因为这个男人的脸从前面看来是圆的，但侧面看来不是。约翰注意到这一点。
(He made no connections with Detroit.(他找不到底特律的关联。
(Concerning the new product mentioned; John said that fellow workers recently visited the laboratories in Chicago and told him about one scientist in particular who was testing, or wanted to test, or experiment for problems of the central nervous system, but the budget insistence made this difficult. Such a drug could result, of course, and could be in the works but such things take a long time.(关于提到的产品；约翰说同事们最近去过芝加哥的实验室，跟他说有一个科学家针对中央神经系统的问题正在测试，或想要测试，或做实验，但是碍于预算而难以进行。这样一种药物当然可能因此产生，也可能在准备中，只不过这种事情需要很长的时间。
(About the children: Two boys in particular meet at John's house to go to school with John’s two boys, His son, John, is in the third grade. John is not particularly fond of one of the boys, Brian and Todd Puleski. The J initial could refer to John Jr. perhaps, certainly not to the other two boys.(关于孩子们：特定的两个男孩在约翰的家碰面，与约翰的两个儿子一起上学。约翰，他的儿子是三年级。约翰不太喜欢其中一个男孩，布莱德利与陶德·普列斯基[Brian and Todd Puleki]。或许，首字母J可能是指约翰二世，肯定不是指另外两个男孩。
(Jane's handwritten note:” May 1968—John, in rereading a copy of this session, saw at once that the boy referred to as M J is M.J. Shuman—a child whose influence on his son he distrusts. The boy is called M.J., I think John said [This note correlates with the handwritten See Notes ’ earlier.” ](珍的手写注释：“1968年5月——在重读这一节的一个副本时，约翰立刻看到被称为MJ的男孩是指M·J·苏曼[Shuman]——他不喜欢这个男孩对他儿子的影响。我认为约翰说过，男孩叫做M.J.。[这条注释与之前手写的“见注释”有关。]
(Seth mentions an April meeting and John said that he expects to go to Chicago for a meeting this spring.(赛斯提到4月的一个会议，约翰说他预计今年春天会去芝加哥开一个会。
(John didn't know about the name given for the drug, though the name Myocarditis, inflammation of the heart muscle, came into his mind as a probable disease that the drug might be used for. In any case the name given might be the future name of the drug, impossible to check at this time. Two grams would be a large dose, John said, of any drug.(约翰不知道药物取什么名称，但是他的脑海出现心肌炎的名称Myocarditis，可能是这个药物用来治疗的疾病。不管怎样，给出的名称可能是这个药物未来的名称，此时无法核对。约翰说，对任何药物来说两克都是很大的剂量。
(Resume 9:45.)(9:45继续。)
Now give us a moment please. A woman in connection with your wife, an aunt or female relative, who will or has recently come up with an idea that is jarring or will be jarring to you. Some far west connection with yourself or your wife, further west than Chicago. Do you have any questions?现在请等我们一下。与你的妻子有关联的一个女人，一个姨姑或女性亲戚，将会或已经想到一个正在或将会让你反感的点子。某个远西的关联，与你自己或你的妻子有连结，比芝加哥更远的西边。你有没有任何问题。
([John:] “The man in loose clothes—can you tell me is this the son, president of the company or his father, the chairman of the board. This in relation to the illness being treated?")(约翰：“衣服宽松的女人——你能不能告诉我，这是儿子，公司总裁，还是他的父亲，董事长。这和被治疗的疾病有关吗？”)
It is related.有关。
([John:]” Is it the same person?")(约翰：“是同一个人吗？”)
We will try to separate the father from the son here. The man to which I refer is not terribly advanced in age, but he is at least 50. I do not believe he is over 80. At times he has a nervous twitch. He drinks coffee without milk and wears black shoes. This would seem to be the father. But if so, he has more drive than the son. The characteristics given however do apply to the man who is ill, whether it is the father or son.这里我们会试着区分父亲和儿子。我说的男人并不是非常年迈，但他至少50岁了。我相信他不超过80岁。偶尔他会神经抽搐。他喝咖啡不加牛奶，穿黑色鞋子。这好像是他的父亲。但如果是的话，他比儿子更有动力。然而给出的特征确实适用于生病的男人，不管是父亲或儿子。
There is a mole on the left hand, if this will help. An annoying condition in the left hip, of spasmodic but long duration. The condition originated in an infection of the intestine. The infection spreading to other organs. The present treatment being for a kidney or intestinal ailment. The left...I am searching here... ventri... ventric...左手有一颗痣，如果这有帮助的话。左臀有一个恼人的状况，间歇发作但持续时间长。这个状况源于肠道感染。感染扩散到其他器官。目前治疗的是肾脏或肠子的病痛。左边……这里我正在搜寻……ventri......ventric......
(Rob:] “Ventricle?")(罗：Ventricle[心室]？)
Ventricle, now being affected, and a secondary circulatory impairment resulting. The symptoms however are felt in the area of the shoulder blades. Some connection with injections which will antagonize or infuriate the basic condition. Do you have any questions?心室，现在受到影响，以及因之而起的继发性血液循环障碍。然而感觉到症状的部分是肩胛骨。与将会引发基本状况反弹或激化它的注射有某种关联。你有没有任何问题？
(John:]” This western connection and a female relative of my wife's. Do you have anything else on this?")(约翰：“这个西方的关联以及我太太的一个女性亲戚。对此你还有别的资料吗？”)
A connection with a letter or phone call and a small child. I am not certain, a female child. A suggestion having to do with projected changes. I do not know whether or not this refers to a change of dwelling, but a large change. A connection here with flowers that I do not understand. Perhaps a connection with spring: A stone structure, a house, I believe, a strange tree, the word hycynthia.与一封信或一通电话以及一个小孩有关联。我不确定，一个女孩。与计划中的改变有关的一个建议。我不知道这是不是指住处的改变，但是一个很大的改变。这里有一个与花的关联，我不了解。也许与春天有关联：一个石制结构，一间房子，我相信，一棵奇怪的树，hycynthia这个字。
([John:]” Or hyacinth?")(约翰：“或是hyacinth[风信子]？”)
It could be. Perhaps a fence and a large room divided into two. Now, Joseph ?可能是。也许有一道篱笆和一分为二的一个大房间。现在，约瑟？
([Rob:]” How will John make out on his trip to Chicago this spring?")(罗：“今年春天约翰到芝加哥出差的状况会怎样？”)
He will, as always, do well. An involvement with three men in particular, a room he will think inadequate. Arrangements having to do with the amount of air, either poor ventilation or failure of an air conditioner. A scrambled afternoon: two appointments not kept, one later kept, a caucus... caucus?一如既往，他会表现得很好。与特定的三个男人有关联，一个他认为不够好的房间。与空气的量有关的安排，不是通风不好就是空调故障。一个忙乱的下午：一次失约，或是后来才赴约，一个干部会议……干部会议？
([John and Rob:]” Yes.” ) With five men at its center affecting him, and a definite determination, decision, arrived at by him as a result of this, and a smaller meeting afterward at 8 in another place.(约翰和罗：“是的。”)在它的核心有5个男人影响他，而他因为这个影响造成的结果，下了一个明确的决心，决策，之后8点在另一个地方有一场比较小型的会议。
([John:]” Will I be a member of this caucus?")(约翰：“我是这个干部会议的成员吗？”)
You will be present and a member of the second meeting. You may or may not be a member of the caucus but you will be present at the caucus.你会出席而且是第二场会议的成员。你可能是或不是干部会议的成员，但会出席干部会议。
([John:]” What about the two appointments?")(约翰：“两次约见是什么情形？”)
You will keep one later. One will be made by you, and one by a man higher in the company. This one will be kept later, not at the original specified time. One will be deliberately not attended, though circumstances will make this absence understandable. There will be a reason, in other words, and an acceptable one. Now you may take a break, and we shall continue.你之后会赴约。一次是你约的，一次是公司里一个比较高阶的男人约的。这一次之后会见到面，但不是原来约定的时间。一次将是故意不出席，但是状况会让人能够体谅这次缺席。换句话说，有一个原因而且是一个可以接受的原因。现在你们可以休息一下，我们再继续。(以下是约翰的评论摘要，谈到和他太太的亲戚有关的印象。他们确实接到他太太的姊妹打来的电话，这个姊妹有一个小女儿，还有两个比较大的儿子。他为她与丈夫之间的问题感到非常沮丧。他们住在纽泽西，但丈夫现在住在夏威夷[西边？]。约翰的家与他小姨子的家都在转角。这个女人可能决定离开她的丈夫并且搬家？另一个印象指的是未来，现在无法核对。
(Break at 10:10.(10点休息。
(Resume 10:25.)(10:15继续。)
Now we will shortly end our session. There will be an ultimate move west rather than east, with the company circumstances maintained, things being as they are now, and probabilities as I see them. The impression of an M here. I do not know if it refers to a town or state. It will not be immediate. It will be rather to the south and west. It will not be to any place that there is an opening now, that is, you will not fill the position or the particular position will be reopened. It will be a better position than you anticipate and in a leapfrog development, so to speak.现在我们很快会结束这一节。会有一次最后的搬家，到西部而不是东部，同时公司的状况维持不变，情势与现在一样，还有我看到的可能性。这里有一个M的印象。应该是南部和西部。它不会是现在有一个职缺的任何地方，也就是说你会接任那个职位或是将会空出的特定职位。这个职位比你预料的还要好，而且可以说是一次跳跃式的发展。
([John:]” With the company I'm with now?")(约翰：“是我现在待的这间公司吗？”)
With this company. You will leap over a step that is usually taken, to another step. You will get a position without going through another position that is usually a prerequisite, you see. June and a series of three having to do with time: A city by a river that runs north and south; perhaps, perhaps the Mississippi. Not far south at all. Now unless you recall me, or unless you have questions, I will end our session.是这间公司。你将跳过一个通常会走的阶段，来到另一个阶段。你不用历经另一个通常是必要条件的职位，就会得到这个职位，你知道。与时间有关的6月和一连串的3：位于一条西北向的河流旁边的一个城市；也许，也许是密西西比河。不是太南方。除非你叫我回来，或是有问题要问，现在我要结束这一节了。
([John:]” You say that ultimately I will go south and west, and a connection with the letter M. What do you mean, ultimately?")(约翰：“你说我最后会去南部和西部，还有一个字母M的关联。究竟来说，你的意思是什么？”)
Within a period of three years. If you do not go within one year, then you will not go until the third year. This was the series of three referred to.在三年的时间内。如果你在一年内没有去，那你就会到第三年才去。一连串的三就是指这件事。
([John:]” St. Louis, Missouri? The Mississippi isn't southwest?")(约翰：“密苏里州的圣路易[St. Louis, Missouri]？密西西比河不是西北吗？”)
The area is southwest of your location now. You may take a break or end the session as you prefer.这个地区位于你目前所在地的西南方。如果你想要，你可以休息一下或是结束这一节。
([John to Rob:]” It’s up to you."(约翰对罗说：“你来决定。”)
([Rob:]” Well, then let's end the session.” )(罗：“嗯，那就结束这一节吗。”)
Good evening.晚安。
(10:35.(10:35分。
(Note: John’s experience at Rochester meeting recently—he saw his district supervisor's face turn younger before his eyes as the man spoke at the meeting—about fifteen years' difference, John said. John wasn’t alarmed because of the Seth material. The effects lasted at least a minute and probably longer. John didn't know if anyone else saw it as he mentioned what he saw to no one, including the man involved.(注释：约翰最近在罗彻斯特开会的经验——他看到他的区域主管在会议上说话的时候，脸在他眼前变年轻了——约翰说，大约差了15岁。约翰并不觉得震惊，因为赛斯资料的关系。这些效应持续了至少一分钟而且可能更久。约翰不知道别人有没有看到，因为他没有跟任何人提到他看见的现象，包括当事人在内。
(On January 16, in the 312 session, Seth said “money will be arriving shortly" page 247. Jane's cheek came today Wednesday January 18, for the ESP book.(1月16日，在第312节，赛斯说：“钱不久就会寄来。”今天，1月18日星期三，珍的支票寄来了，是《如何开发你的超感官能力》的稿费。
(Handwritten Note:” Session # 166June 30, 1965. Hierarchy shunted to side with no power. [See Volume 4.](手写笔记：“1965年6月30日第166节。阶层权力旁落。”[见第四册]
("Session #313, January 18, 1967: M.J. [Shuman], page 250.(“1967年1月18日第313节：M.J.[苏曼]”
("#402, April 1, 1968: incorporated.")(“1968年4月1日第402节：包含在内。”)

SESSION 314 第314节 珍的私人课 摆锤


JANUARY 25, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年1月25日 星期三 晚上9点
(The regularly scheduled session for Monday, January 23, was not held. Instead Jane and I worked with the pendulum and achieved good results.)(1月23日星期一的定期课没有举行。反之珍和我用了摆锤而且获得很好的结果。)
Good Evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now give us a moment.现在等我们一下。
(Pause.) The sessions with the pendulum are of great advantage. Your part in them is of particular benefit. I suggest, however, for this evening that you hold your pendulum session now and then return here for my comments. This should work very well, I believe.(停顿)摆锤的那些课是很有好处的。你在其中的角色特别有益。不过，我建议，今晚你们先举行摆锤课，然后再回来这里听听我的看法。这应该会很有效，我相信。
("Yes, Seth.” 9:01. (Resume session 9:28.)(“好，赛斯。”9:01。9:28继续。)
Now. The yoga exercises are of great benefit. They aid in keeping the channels open between the conscious and subconscious. They help in ridding the personality of harmful influences, and in generating new energy. Ruburt should continue them by all means. He has a habit of ignoring his subconscious, trying to reach other centers, not by going through the subconscious but by attempting to bypass it completely.现在。瑜伽运动的益处很大。它们有助于保持意识与潜意识之间通道的敞开。它们有助于消除人格受到的有害影响，并且再生新的能量。鲁柏应该想尽一切办法继续练瑜珈。他有一个习惯是忽视他的潜意识，试图到达其他中心，不是经由潜意识，而是企图完全绕过它。
The subconscious is a doorway into other portions of the self and it must be entered, and free access must exist to it. When it is free in this manner, then there is no need to block messages or distort material. The subconscious does this out of fear or resentment. I could have said more concerning his condition in the past.潜意识是通往自己其他部分的门户，它是非进入不可的，而且一定要自由进出它的入口。当它是可以这样自由进出时，就没有需要搁下讯息或扭曲资料了。潜意识是出于恐惧或憎恶才这么做的。关于他在过去的状况，我可以再多说一些。
Give us a moment. There is no need for him to punish himself now either, because he did not take full advantage of his psychic opportunities. He can more than make up for this from now on. There is one connection that should be mentioned and it can be quickly dispensed with when brought into the light. It is secondary but has had some effects.给我们一点时间。现在他也没有需要因为他没有充分利用自己的通灵机会，而惩罚它自己。他从现在开始可以做的不只是弥补这个遗憾而已。有一个应该提到的连结，一旦摊在阳光下，它很快就可以被屏除。它是次要的但是有一些作用。
When he was in kindergarten his mother was just becoming ill. Now, dealing with small children, this simply was added to the fuel. He can understand now however that this connection can be broken. He is himself and no one else. He is not his mother. They are worlds apart, the two personalities.当他在幼儿园时，他的母亲刚开始生病。现在，要照顾年幼的小孩，这简单是火上添油。不过他现在能够了解这个连结是可以断开的。他是他自己，不是别人。他不是他的母亲。他们是天壤之别，这两个人格。
He did feel that you had withdrawn from him as far as his writing was concerned, and he has a need for warm daily affection, which he felt you had also withdrawn, for varying periods, and that you did not care that he was feeling poorly. Of course he would not consciously admit these feelings, considering such sentiments were unbecoming on his part. Your help with the pendulum sessions therefore greatly increases their effectiveness. He felt closed off, yet did not consciously think his feelings justified. The feelings existed, however.就他的写作而言，他的确感觉你疏远他，而且他每天都需要温情爱意，但是他感觉你在不同时期也是退缩的，不在乎他感觉很糟。当然他在意识上不会承认这些感觉，认为他有这样的情绪是不得体的。你帮忙举行摆锤课，因此大为提高它们的效力。他感觉被隔离在外，但在意识上他并不认为他的感觉情有可原。然而，这些感觉是存在的。
I suggest for this material that you take a break and then I shall continue.为了这个资料，我建议你休息一下，然后我再继续。
(9:42. (Resume 9:52.)(9:42休息。9:52继续。)
He is by nature highly intuitive and should give his Moods some freedom. When he attempts to deny or block what he considers unsuitable Moods, outlets are denied them and the next natural cycle, the rising up of high spirits, does not come.他天生是个直觉非常敏锐的人，应该给他的情绪一些自由。当他试图否认或围堵他认为不适当的情绪时，它们就没有出口，而下一次的自然循环、高昂情绪的升起，便不会到来。
Of course some restraint is necessary, but he has been leaning toward too much restraint in this respect, trying to be what he is not. His personality pattern is not quiet, nor aloof, but given to spontaneous inner motion that maintains its own individualistic balance. He has attempted to tamper with it. Part of this is caused by a misconception, and it is because of this misconception that he found it difficult to see himself as a so-called psychic.当然一些克制是有必要的，但他在这方面偏向过度克制，试着不做他自己。他的人格模式既不安静，也不冷漠，而是爱好自发的内在动力，这个动力自行维持个人主义的平衡。他曾经试图扰乱它。这有一部分是一个错误观念造成的，因为这个错误观念，他发现他难以接受自己是一个所谓的灵媒。
A psychic, he thought, should be calm, untouched by physical events, highly disciplined, rather than spontaneous, such as he was, and sensitive to inner Moods, which he was. He attempted to make himself over and in a nearly disastrous fashion. For to his subconscious, such a personality pattern represented immobility, and this was reflected in the physical symptoms.他认为，一个灵媒应该是冷静的、不为实质事件所动、高度自律，而不是自发的，像他这样，也不是对内在情绪很敏感，他正是如此。他试图改头换面，而且是用一种几近于灾难的方式。因为对他的潜意识来说，这样一个人格模式代表静止不动(immobility)，而且这也反映在身体症状上。
These were meant as checks against impulsive or intuitive behavior. He must then behave, he thought, in a measured, reasoned, quiet, calm and disciplined way: and to see that he did, he slowed down the motions the body could make. Now, this is the heart of the matter, and he would not let me give it earlier. He should, and indeed, must, be himself. Those qualities of his of which he became suspicious are those that made our sessions and his development possible.这些本来就是在抑制冲动或直觉的行为。所以他认为他的言行一定要慎重、合理、安静又自律；而且为了看到他的确是，他让身体的动作尽其所能减慢速度。现在，这是问题的核心，他不让我早一点说出来。他应该，而且说真的，也必须是他自己。他对他自己起了疑心的那些特质，就是让我们的课以及他的发展成为可能的那些特质。
Now discipline was somewhat overstressed from the beginning, with the psychic work. This was natural, largely. In his adolescence he was told by many to slow down, to use discipline, and the old adages returned.现在，通灵工作的纪律从一开始就有点被过度强调了。这是天生的，大部分是。在他的青春期，很多人叫他放慢速度、严以律己，如今老格言又回来了。
He has a natural inner discipline which can be counted upon when he leaves it alone. The results of these feelings have been a loss of spontaneity in psychic matters and in physical ones, from which he is only now recovering.他有一种自然的内在纪律，当他不管它的时候，它是靠得住的，这些感觉的结果是，在通耿问题以及身体问题上都失去了自发，现在他才刚开始复原中。
He has blocked me several times when the cat lover and Jesuit were here, and the circumstances were good for a spontaneous session, particularly good, in fact. I had something to say each time and those moments are gone. He used the physical ailments as excuses to himself. The physical ailments were meant as checks from the beginning. Without spontaneity, he does not operate effectively or well. He has read too, too much along certain lines, and has tried too hard on a conscious level.当爱猫人和耶稣会士在这里的时候，他阻挡了我几次，那时的状况很适合自发的一节课，说真的，非常适合。我每次都有话要说，但那些时刻一去不复返。他利用身体的病痛当作他自己的借口。身体的病痛从一开始就是抑制。没有自发，他不能有效或顺利地运作。他也读了太多某些方面的东西，而且在一个意识层面太过用力了。
He compares himself unfavorably with what seem to him to be more spiritual psychics. They follow their own way. He must follow his own way. And this is the meaning of spirituality.比较之下，他觉得自己不如那些在他看来似乎比较灵性的灵媒。他们走他们自己的路。他一定要走他自己的路。而这就是灵性的意义。
You may take a break and I shall continue. If you are very tired, then you may end the session.你可以休息一下，我再继续。如果你很累了，那你可以结束这一节。
("No, I'm all right.”(“不，我还好。”
(10:09. (Resume 10:25.)(10:09。10:25继续。)
Now, if you err, it is far less dangerous to err on the side of spontaneity, given your personalities, than it is to use too much restraint. Too much restraint could eventually make the abilities inoperable. Too much spontaneity at worst could only cause some embarrassing moments. I am speaking of your personal cases only. The ability grows as it is used. This Uh . too highly.现在，如果你犯了错，有鉴于你们的人格特质，比起过度克制，在自发方面犯错的危险性低很多。过度克制最终可能造成能力无法施展。过度自发最糟不过就是产生一些尴尬的时刻而已。我只是在讲你们的个人情况而已。能力有使用就会有增长。这再怎么强调都不为过。
And in using, it will build up innate systems of checks and balances that will be natural for your own personalities, and effective. Not to use the ability in the face of sudden or spontaneous impressions can, under certain conditions, impede your progress. This applies to you both.而且在使用时，他将会建立内在的抑制和平衡系统，这些对你们自己的人格来说是自然的，而且有效。面对突然或自发的印象，不使用能力，在某些状况下，可能会妨碍你们的进展。这适用于你们两人。
Now, I have shortened your steps considerably this evening. Give us a moment.现在，今天晚上我已经大为缩减你们的步骤了。等我们一下。
Ruburt is himself and this self is a writer and this self has strong psychic abilities. These are all part of the self. It is dangerous to attempt to make the self into what it is not.鲁柏是他自己，这个自己是一个作家，而且这个自己拥有强大的通灵能力。这些全都是这个自己的一部分。试图让这个自己不做它自己，是危险的。
As a side issue here, he did not feel that dancing was seeming for a psychic, you see.这里岔题一下，他觉得跳舞不是一个灵媒外表应有的样子，你看。
We will end our session. If I have overlooked any major point, then I will bring it up in our next session, or earlier. I trust however that this evening's material will result in Ruburt’s speedy and complete recovery. Much of this has been buried, and instant improvement will show itself now.我们要结束这一节了。如果我忽略了任何主要的重点，那我会在下一节，或之前，提出来讨论。不过我相信今晚的资料将会让鲁柏复原得既快速又彻底。这有很多被埋藏起来，而现在立即的改善将会自行出现。
My best wishes to you both, and to our once again spontaneous Ruburt, a fond good evening.向你们两位致上我最好的祝福，也祝我们再一次自发的鲁柏有一个美好的夜晚。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
It will help if you discuss these points at your next pendulum session.在你们下一次的摆锤课讨论这些重点，会有帮助的。
(End 10:34.)(10:34结束。)

SESSION 315 第315节 约翰私人课


JANUARY 30, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年1月30日 星期一 晚上9点
(John Bradley was a witness to the session.)(约翰·布莱德利是这一节的见证人。)
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:]” Good evening, Seth.” )(约翰：“晚安，赛斯。”)
Good evening and welcome as always.缺
Now. Give us a moment, Joseph.缺
(Seth's entity name for me.)缺
The pendulum sessions should be continued, and you will find many of the answers Ruburt seeks. I will be of benefit with comments.摆锤课应该继续下去，你会发现很多鲁柏想要得知的答案。我的评论会很有帮助。
Now. With our friend Philip, a situation developing involving a white-haired man who is in the background, behind or connected with, the man who suggested Philip seek office.现在。关于我们的朋友菲利普，一个发展中的情况涉及到一个背景中的白发男人，在建议菲利普从政的男人背后或与他有关联。
(Philip is Seth's entity name for John.)(菲利普是赛斯给约翰的存有名)
The man who offered the suggestion to Philip may not realize himself that the original idea was not his own. It originated with the white-haired man. Very approximately here, his age—because of the hair color I am not sure—maybe 47 to 67, for his face is not old though his hair is white.给菲利普建议的男人本人可能没发觉最初的想法不是他自己的。它出自白发男人。这里很粗略地说，他的年纪——因为发色，所以我不确定——也许47到67岁之间，因为他的脸不老，但是头发白了。
Now this man by association reminds Ruburt of Dirksen because the temperamental similarities are fairly evocative. This man fuller in the face however, and less eloquent. The initial M somehow connected, though it may not necessarily be the initial of a person's name. Perhaps if not it is related to a place of residence, or district.现在经由联想，这个男人让鲁柏想到德克森(Dirksen)，因为气质的相似很容易引发联想。不过这个男人脸比较丰满，也比较不善言辞。首字母M不知为何有关联，但它不一定是一个人的姓名缩写。或许，如果不是，那它就是和一个居住地或区域有关。
I am fairly certain of the M, however, and later will try to be more specific. Somewhat more pressure will be applied to Philip than he perhaps anticipates here. Several, or seven, at a meeting will want him in that capacity. This is indeed what I referred to earlier.不过，我相当确定这个M，稍后我会想办法说得更具体一点。这里菲利普会有稍微多一点的压力，可能多过于他的预料。有几个，或7个，在会议上想要他坐上那个位置。这其实就是我之前说的意思。
(See page 249 of the 313th session: Wherein a professional man not with John's company offers John something.)(见第313节：一个不在约翰公司的专业人士给了约翰某个提议。)
Some connection with a store or shopkeeper who puts up money. I do not know to what this refers. Some pressure applied toward the end of February, and connection here with a Sunday, which seems strange.与一间商店或提供资金的店主有某种关联。我不知道这是指什么。接近2月底会出现一些压力，这里与一个星期天有关联，看起来很奇怪。
The request will be more formally made, also. A brother-in-law involved here. If not of Philip's, then a brother-in-law of the man who made the suggestion.此外，这个请求会比较正式。这里牵涉到一个男性姻亲。如果不是菲利普的亲戚，那就是提出建议那个男人的男性姻亲。
Still an unhealthy reaction between two children. A separate impression here now: An initial expenditure, that is unwise and should be avoided.还有两个孩子之间一个不健康的反应。现在这里有一个另外的印象：最初的一笔开销，是不明智的，应该避免。
For now you may take a break, and before long you will give me a gold star.现在你可以休息一下了，不久你就会给我一颗金星。
(Break at 9:16. Jane's eyes had remained closed most of the time.(9:16休息。珍的眼睛大部分时间都闭着。
(John witnessed the 313th session on January 18,1967. He told us this evening when we met that he had been asked to run for county commissioner by the assistant district attorney of his hometown, Williamsport, PA, but did not tell us anything else particularly. John was asked to run since the 313th session, and has turned down the offer; it would involve a financial loss.(约翰在1967年1月18日见证了第313节。今晚我们见面时，他告诉我们，他的家乡宾州威廉斯波特[Williamsport, PA]的地方助理检察官请他出来竞选县议长，但他没有特别跟我们说其他事情。自从第313节，约翰被要求出来竞选，他已经拒绝这个提议；这会牵涉到财务上的一次损失。
(The assistant district attorney is Clint Smith. John said that the senior partner in Smith's law firm is named Murphy—hence the M initial. He is closer to the 47. year age limit, and has whitish hair. He is fuller in the face than Senator Dirksen, as Seth states. Murphy is also a Republican, as Dirksen is. John met Mr. Murphy just once, briefly, he states, and has no idea of the man's position in politics, his influence, etc. It is possible that Murphy influenced Clint Smith.(地方助理检察官是克林特·史密斯[Clint Smith]。约翰说，在史密斯的律师事务所，资深合伙人的名字是墨菲[Murphy]——因此有首字母M。他比较接近47岁的年龄限制，而且头发花白。他的脸比德克森参议员丰满，像赛斯说的那样。墨菲也是共和党员，与德克森一样。约翰说，他只见过墨菲先生一次，时间很短，而且对他在政界的地位、影响力等等毫无概念。有可能墨菲影响了克林特·史密斯。
(John stated that his brothers-in-law live in Philadelphia and have no connection with John in Williamsport, or his political activities, etc.(约翰说他的男性姻亲住在费城，而且与威廉斯波特的约翰或他的政治活动等等毫无关系。
(John also stated talent Clint Smith has one young brother-in-law who lives in Lancaster, PA, south of Williamsport; but as far as John knows there would be no connection here either.(约翰也说克林特·史密斯有一个年轻的男性姻亲住在宾州的兰开斯特[Lancaster]，威廉斯波特的南边；但是就约翰所知，这里也没有任何关联。)
(John had no information on any possible expenditure.(关于任何可能的支出，约翰没有资讯。
(See the 313th session for the material concerning some of John’s children and a possible unhealthy relationship with other children.(与约翰的一些孩子以及与其他小孩有关的一个不健康的关系，见313节。
(Jane resumed at 9:25 )(珍在9:25继续。)
Now, Joseph, you two are on the right track as far as Ruburt's symptoms are concerned, and your aid in the pendulum sessions is invaluable.现在，约瑟，就鲁柏的症状来说，你们两个的方向是对的，而且你在摆锤课上的辅助是非常宝贵的。
Give us a moment... Symptoms in this case with the right hand or on the right side of the body, represent difficulties in the conscious realms. Symptoms of the left hand or left portions of the body represent difficulties from subconscious levels, and both represent failures between the conscious and subconscious portions of the self.等我们一下……在这个情况中的症状发生在右手或身体的右侧，代表意识界域当中的困难。左手或身体左侧部位的症状代表潜意识层面，而且两者都代表自己的意识部分与潜意识部分之间的失灵。
feelings of guilt in this case involved with the left hand. He will have more to say concerning these points, either at Wednesday’s session or perhaps we may hold a session tomorrow evening instead.在这个情况中的感觉与左手有关。关于这些点，他还会有更多话要说，要么在星期三的课上，要么我们晚上也许会来上一节课。
