Now. An unexpected and fairly long journey on Philip’s part, at least partially by car, within three months. To pick up someone or something. All I get here is A R, and do not know to what it refers.现在。菲利普有一次出乎预期而且时间相当长的旅行，至少有一部分是开车，在3个月内。去接某人或某个东西，我这里接收到的只有AR，不知道它指的是什么。
Also he will meet a woman in this town, a woman he has met here before, and he should not encourage any relationship. She has been mentioned in our sessions before. (To John:) I spoke to you then. This time you see I will tell you ahead of time.他也会在这个城镇见到一个女人，一个他以前在这里见过的女人，而且他不应该助长任何关系。以前我们在课里提过她。
There seem to be five women with whom your wife will be involved on a Thursday afternoon. No significance here.(对约瑟说)我当时对你说过。这次你知道我会提前告诉你。似乎有5个女人，你的妻子在一个星期四的下午会和她们有交集。这里没有什么大事。
The M did refer to the person Philip mentioned during rest period. (Murphy) And the expenditure to do with his household.M的确是指菲利普在休息时提到的那个人(墨菲)。而支出与他的家庭有关。
One small rather insignificant point, Joseph: the man for whom Ruburt works—the name, Miller—is also the name of one of his mother's old friends, though she was a woman. The similarity here somewhat unfortunate.约瑟，微不足道的一点是：鲁柏帮他做事的那个男人——姓氏，米勒(Miller)——他母亲有一个老友也是这个姓，但她是女人。这里的相似之处有点不幸。
In regard to Philip, a separation of elements I do not understand. A division of duties or some such, I do not know. Not a subtraction necessarily. A readjustment of sorts pertaining to work I believe. If anything working to his favor.关于菲利普，一个元素的分离，我不了解。职责之类的划分，我不知道。不一定是减少。我相信是与工作有关的重新调整之类的。如果有什么对他有利的事。
This could however apply to the political situation, though I do not see how.不过这可能适用于政治情势，尽管我没看到怎么会这样。
A film which will impress him. This does not seem to be a movie film. Perhaps a documentary, which will be shown to him. If you ran for office, you could count on my vote.一部让他印象深刻的影片。这似乎不是一部电影。也许是一部纪录片，将会播放给他看。如果你竞选公职，我肯定投你一票。
("Do you want to answer a question?")(“你想要回答一个问题吗？”)
You may take a conservative rest period, or I will answer questions first if you prefer.你们可以来一小段休息时间，或是你们比较想要的话，我也可以先回答问题。
("We can take the break, and I'll ask the question then.” )(“我们可以先休息，然后我再问问题。”)
As you wish.随你的便。
(Break at 9:45.(9:45休息。
(The woman John might meet in this town would be June Fleming, whom John met some time ago at a bar called The Elms. He has not seen her for a long time, nor has he been to The Elms recently. John heard Seth’s voice in warning one time when with June Fleming, and heeded the caution. This material is on record in the sessions.(约翰可能在这个城镇碰面的女人是茱·弗雷明[June Fleming]，前阵子约翰在一家叫作艾尔麦[Elms]的酒吧认识她。他已经好长一段时间没见过她了，而且最近也没有去埃尔麦酒吧。与茱·弗雷明在一起时，约翰有一次听见赛斯的声音在警告他，而且听从了这个警告。
(John verified Seth’s material regarding his wife, Mary Ellen. She is getting into the sale of Sarah Coventry costume jewelry, and in fact is attending a business meeting tonight. Mary Ellen is scheduled to attend, or have, a Sarah Coventry party soon, on a Thursday afternoon or evening, John said, and will be involved with four other women in particular. The five total could be that Mary Ellen herself is the fifth; as well as Mary Ellen herself, the other four women are holding Sarah Coventry parties for her. There will of course be more than five women at the parties.(约翰证实赛斯提到他太太玛莉·艾伦[Mary Ellen]的资料。她开始销售莎拉·柯文翠[Sarah Coventry]订制珠宝，而且事实上今晚正出席一个商务会议。约翰说，玛莉·艾伦预定不久要参加，或是举办，一场莎拉·柯文翠派对，在某个星期四的下午或晚上，而且会和特定的4个女人有交集。总数5当中，玛莉·艾伦可能是第五个；连同玛莉·艾伦在内，另外4个女人在为她举办莎拉·柯文翠派对。派对上当然不会只有5个女人。
(Jane said her mother does have a friend, Mary Miller, who did housekeeping for Jane and her mother when Jane was perhaps seven years old. Mary Miller is still alive. At the time Jane did not like her, she said. Mary Miller is the same age as Jane’s mother.(珍说她的母亲的确有一个朋友，玛莉·米勒[Mary Miller]，在珍也许7岁的时候，帮珍和她打理家务。玛莉·米勒还在世。珍说她当时不喜欢她。玛莉·米勒与珍的母亲同龄。
(Since the trip data involves a prediction John could offer no data here.(因为旅行资料是一个预测，所以这里约翰无法提供任何资料。
(John said the separation of elements or dates could refer to the political office he was asked to run for. Since the income would mean a loss to John, he thought it might be supplemented by his holding a sinecure of a job at the same time; said job being furnished by a member of the political organization. John said this is often done in political life.(约翰说元素或日期的分离可能是指人家找他出来竞选的公职。因为收入对约翰来说会是一个损失，所以他认为可以同时保有一个坐领干薪的工作来补足；上述工作是由政治组织的一名成员提供的，约翰说这是从政生涯常见的做法。
(See page 253 of the 313th session, describing a change of features John saw transform the face of his district supervisor recently at a meeting in Rochester. I asked Seth to discuss this phenomenon after break.(见第313节，描述约翰最近在罗彻斯特的一个会议上，见到他区域主管的脸因五官的一个变化而改变。在休息之后，我要求赛斯讨论这个现象。
(Resume at 10:12.)(10:12继续。)
Now, the spelling of the name is Seth.现在，名字的拼法是Seth(赛斯)。
([John, laughing:]” Thank you, Seth.” )(约翰笑着说：“谢谢你，赛斯。”)
Give us a moment.等我们一下。
Ruburt has half-jokingly suggested certain changes in your living arrangements. For the present, and near future, they would work out well.鲁柏半开玩笑地暗示，在你的生活安排上有某些改变。目前，以及不久的将来，它们会有很好的结果。
The visits to the chiropractor, simply from the standpoint of suggestion are good, and that is all.去看整脊师，单纯从暗示的立场来看，是好的，就这样而已。
On the other hand, he should also protect himself from personal remarks made by the chiropractor, through suggestion of his own, although this situation is better than it was. In his case at this time symptoms on the left side of the body have reference to early associations.另一方面，他也应该透过他自己的暗示，保护他自己不受整脊师的言词影响，尽管这个情况比以前好。在他此时的状况中，身体左侧的症状与早期的联想有关。
A lecture tour of sorts will develop. Obtaining money from this sort of activity will be more beneficial for him, and more lucrative. He should at present to some small extent decrease the salt in his diet. Also, add eggplant and continue with the yoga exercises. Wear green more often. The vibrations from the color in his case at this time are therapeutic.一趟勉强算是巡回演讲的旅程将会成形。从这种活动获取金钱对他比较有益，也比较赚钱。他目前在饮食上应该少量少盐的摄取。还有，加入茄子，并且继续做瑜珈。多穿绿色。这个颜色的振动此时在他的情况中具有疗愈效果。
The difficulty in wearing his sneakers, for example, is not physical. They remind him of a pair of his mother's shoes.比方说，他穿运动鞋有困难，并不是身体因素。这种鞋让他想到他母亲的一双鞋子。
Now. Philip's name mentioned at a party. I am not clear here: 4, 2, and one or two other numbers, and something drive, you see—the name of a road or location. Tonight I play the role of a doctor and politician.现在。在一个派对上提到菲利普的名字。这里我不清楚：4、2，以及一两个其他的数字，还有某个与开车有关的东西，你知道——一条路名或一个地名。今晚我扮演医生和政治人物的角色。
A tiff or argument involving Philip, rather unexpected, that will seem to shift alliances, but in the overall will not. Here involving a slightly older man who has a brother.涉及菲利普的一个口角或争执，相当出乎预期，似乎会变换盟友，但整体来说不会。这里牵涉到一个年纪稍大的男人，他有个兄弟。
External affairs involving Ruburt’s book will of themselves bring about a renewed physical vigor shortly. However it is to his advantage to solve these problems on his own before that time. Sometimes he wants to be too certain that his feet are on the ground.与鲁柏的书有关的外在事件本身不久就会带来身体活力的复苏。但是在那时候到来之前，他自己解决这些问题对他有利。有时候他也想要确定他脚踏实地。
You may ask questions, take a break, or end the session as you prefer.你们可以问问题、休息一下或结束这一节，你们比较喜欢怎样都可以。
([John:]” This tiff: Will I be a party to it, or will my name be the subject of it? Is it related to the political activity?")(约翰：“这个口角：我将会是其中一方，还是我的名字将会是它的话题？它与政治活动有关吗？”)
It is relative to the political activity.它与政治活动有关。
([John:]” Will I be involved—actually a party in the argument?")(约翰：“我将会卷入——实际上是争执中的一方吗？”)
I believe you will be involved, though this is not definite. A disagreement on the meaning of terms. Later the tiff will work to your advantage. The outcome will be advantageous though it will not at first seem so.我相信你会卷入，但这并不是绝对的。针对字词意义的一场争执。之后这个口角的发展将会对你有利。结果将是有利的，但是一开始似乎不是如此。
("Don't forget the question about John’s boss."(“不要忘记与约翰的老板有关的问题。”
([John:]” Do you want me to ask that?"(约翰：“你想要我问那个问题吗？”
("Yes."(“是的。”
([John:]” When I was in Rochester about three weeks ago I noticed a definite change in my boss’s features, while he was giving a speech. I'd say he appeared to be about fifteen years younger. Can you throw some light on this?")(约翰：“大约三个星期以前我在罗彻斯特的时候，我注意到我老板的五官有一个明确的变化，当时他正在演讲。我会说他看起来大约年轻15岁。你能不能解释一下这件事？”)
This was noticed by three individuals.有三个人注意到这件事。
([John:]” Can you describe these three?")(约翰：“你能不能描述这三个人？”)
One changed his opinion of the man, and for the better. Dark hair somewhat in a circle, with some of the head bare. An Andy Gump with a paunch. A long nose, and eyes with a twinkle. From a place with an Indian-sounding name. And just perhaps an E initial, pertaining to place of residence or name. And maybe an H.一个改变了他对这个男人的看法，而且是变好了。深色头发有些在一颗圆头上，其中有些部位是秃的。一个大肚子的安迪·甘普(Andy Gump，译注：西德尼·史密斯于1917年创作的连环漫画主角，由于缺乏下鄂弓而无下巴为其特征)。一个长鼻子，两眼发光。来自一个名字听起来像印第安语的地方。而且也许有一个首字母E，和居住地或姓名有关。可能还有一个H。
Another younger man with a broad, almost Slavic face and short prickly hair, black or brown.另一个是比较年轻的男人，有着一张几乎像斯拉夫人的大脸以及一头尖刺短发，黑色或褐色。
And a man in his 50 s. Some overweight, round. Something odd about his suit or clothing. Gray pin stripe. An interest in history. In an intermediate position in the company. A man known as a squawker.还有一个50多岁的男人。有些过重，圆圆的。他的西装或衣服有点怪。灰色细条纹。对历史有兴趣。在公司有个中阶职位。一个以其爱抱怨闻名的男人。
The transformation brought about subconsciously in answer to an inner need and to offset a growing feeling of panic and failure.转变发生在潜意识里，呼应内在的一个需求，以便抵消越来越严重的恐慌和失败感。
You may again ask questions, take a break or end the session.你们可以再问问题、休息一下或结束这一节。
([John:]” The man in an intermediary position: Could he be a regional manager?")(约翰：“在公司有个中阶职位的男人：他有没有可能是一个区域经理？”)
Yes.有。
I believe four separate speaking engagements. Joseph, sometime between February and Summer, including Summer perhaps.我相信有四次分开的演讲。约瑟，介于2月和夏天之间某个时间，也许还包含夏天。
I await your pleasure as always.我悉听尊便，一如既往。
("Can the conscious mind distort as well as the subconscious?")(约翰：“意识心有没有可能像潜意识一样扭曲？”)
You know that it can, quite as easily.你知道它可能一样很容易扭曲。
You may then end the session, unless our county commissioner would like to cross-examine me.接着你可以结束这一节，除非我们的县议长想要交叉质询我。
([John:]” At the moment I don't have enough information to ask specific questions. Could the outside sinecure be to what you referred?")(约翰：“当下我没有足够的资讯可以问特定的问题。有没有可能外面的闲差就是你指的意思？”)
Yes.是的。
([John:]” What about this trip?")(约翰：“这趟旅行是怎么回事？”)
It does not seem to refer to business matters as far as the company is concerned. More of a personal nature.它似乎不是指公司的商务。比较是私人性质的。
([John:]” To what area of the country would this trip be?")(约翰：“这趟旅行会去国内的什么地区？”)
I do not know. It seems to be connected with two areas. But you would only travel to one of these. It involves other people, not business associates.我不知道。它似乎与两个地区有关联。但是你只会去其中一个地区旅行。它涉及到其他人，不是业务上有往来的人。
([John:]” Can you tell me something about the future of the business endeavor for my wife?")(约翰：“关于未来在业务上的努力，或我太太，你能不能告诉我一些事？”)
An association connected with the number four. Four weeks, four months or four years. I do not believe it is four years however. It may lead to another more profitable endeavor, and will serve its purpose and be beneficial while it lasts. Not of long duration. Involvement with an older woman.与数字4有关系的一个联想，4个星期、4周或4年。不过，我不相信是4年。它可能导致另一个获利比较多的努力，并且在它持续的同时将会达成它的目标，而有所助益。持续时间不长。与一个年纪比较大的女人有关系。
Now, we shall take our break or end our session.缺
([John:]” I have no more questions."(约翰：“我没有问题了。”
("We might as well end it then.” )(“那我们不妨就结束吧。”)
Connection with a woman approximately 56 to enter in there. And later another arrangement like this one but more profitable.那里出现一个关联是一个大约56岁的女人。而且后来有另一个安排，类似这一个但是获利更多。
My heartiest regards, and I will get my gold star; though you shall have trouble pinning it on me.我最衷心的问候，而且我会拿到我的金星；但是你们很难把它们别在我身上。
("Goodnight, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:]” Goodnight, Seth.”(约翰：“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:50. Jane did not recall much of what she had said. She had remained seated all evening, and had spoken at an average pace with her eyes closed most of the time. Her delivery had been humorous at times.(10:50结束。珍不太记得她说过的话。她整晚都坐着，而且说话速度一般，大部分时间双眼闭着。她的传述有时语带幽默。
(Regarding the data on page 260: John made no connections about a party, the numbers 4, 2 and one or two others, and something drive, the name of a road or location.(关于上面的资料；约翰找不到一个派对、数字4、2以及另外一两个数字，还有某个与开车有关的东西、一个路名或一个地名连结的事物。
(Regarding the data on page 260: John said Seth's description of an Andy Gump type fits a salesman in his company named John Winslow and that JW was present at the Rochester meeting three weeks ago, during which time the transformation took place in the features of John’s district supervisor. Winslow is about 55, with brownish hair that is now graying. It is cut short and is circular in shape, with no widow's peak.(关于上面的资料：约翰说赛斯对一个安迪·甘普类型的描述与他公司里的一个业务员是符合的，他的名字是约翰·温斯罗[John Winslow]，而且JW在三个星期前出席了罗彻斯特的会议，当时约翰的区域主管脸上发生五官的转变。温斯罗大约55岁，有着褐色调的头发，现在正逐渐转为灰白，剪短而且是圆环状，没有美人尖。
(Winslow has an Andy Gump chin and a long nose which is quite prominent. He comes from Syracuse, which is an Indian name. This data backs up Seth's information very well.(温斯罗有一个安迪·甘普那样的下巴，以及一个相当突出的长鼻子。他来自锡拉丘斯[Syracuse，又名雪城]，这是一个印第安地名。这个资料充分证实了赛斯的资料。
(But John can offer nothing on the E and H initials.(但是约翰无法提供任何与首字母E和H有关的资料。
(John said Seth's description of a younger man with a Slavic face and short prickly hair fits Bob Dineen, another salesman also present at the Rochester meeting. However Dineen’s hair, which was once brown or dark, is now gray. Seth had given him black or brown hair.(约翰说赛斯对一个比较年轻、有着一张斯拉夫人面孔和一头尖刺发型的男人所做的描述，与另一个业务员鲍勃·迪宁[Bob Dineen]是符合的，他也出席了罗彻斯特的会议。然而迪宁的头发曾经是褐色或深色，但现在已经变白了。赛斯说他是黑色或褐色头发。
(John said the man in his 50’s mentioned by Seth could be Stan Farrer. Farrer is John’s regional manager, which would be an intermediate position in the company, Searle. He wore a gray suit at Rochester, John said, but not a pin stripe. John also said he doesn't know whether Farrer is a squawker; it is possible by contrast simply because most of the men don’t say anything.(约翰说赛斯提到的那个50多岁的男人可能是史丹·斐尔[Stan Ferrer]。斐尔是约翰的区域经理，在塞尔公司算是一个中阶职位。约翰说，他在罗彻斯特穿着一件灰白西装，但不是细条纹。约翰也说他不知道斐尔是不是一个爱抱怨的人；有可能只是因为大部分男人什么都不说，而产生的对比。
(John could offer nothing about a 56. year-old woman.(约翰无法提供任何与一个56岁女人有关的资料。
(John said that his boss was very nervous that day at the meeting in Rochester, when the transformation took place in his features. John's boss knew he wasn't doing well in the company these days. The regional manager that day also took over a big segment of time at the meeting that John’s boss would ordinarily be expected to use. The regional manager thus seemed to run the meeting, be on stage, etc. John said he could understand his boss’s feeling of desperation, which led in turn to the transformation.)(约翰说他的老板那天在罗彻斯特的会议上非常紧张，他的五官就在当时出现转变。约翰的老板知道这些日子在公司的表现并不好。区域经理那天在会议上也占用了一大段平常应该是约翰的老板使用的时间。因此区域经理似乎主持了会议， 在讲台上等等。约翰说他能够了解老板走投无路的感觉，这导致了五官的转变。)

SESSION 316 第316节 赛斯对珍的个人建议


FEBRUARY 1, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年2月1日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, we shall begin by talking around some issues. To some extent the fact that Ruburt's book is being read in his hometown disconcerts him. Those whom he relegated to the past are brought into the present. This causes some (panic?); there is a feeling that he is back in their control, and that the book in this respect has lain him vulnerable.现在，我们一开始先来谈谈一些问题。鲁柏的书在他的家乡为人所读，这个事实某种程度让他觉得困窘。他归类为过去的人被带到现在来。这造成一些(恐慌？)；有一种感觉是，他回到他们的控制中，而且在这方面，书让他处于脆弱的境地。
He has shown himself, so to speak, and can therefore be a target. The immobilization was partially a fear reaction, and yet it had some elements of courage in it, in that he would run in fear no longer, but face issues.可以说，他已经展现自己，因此可能是众矢之的。行动不便有一部分是一种恐惧反应，可是在它之内也有一些勇敢的成分，因为它再也不会恐惧到逃跑，而是面对问题。
At the same time, of course, conflicting is the desire to be known as a successful writer in his hometown, but to do so he must be known again, you see. He is afraid, literally, walking the streets of Saratoga, sneaking in and out when he visits. But here he feels is the best part of himself, unprotected, and the self he tried really to hide, now displayed.同时，当然，想要在他的家乡以成功作家身分为人所知的欲望是冲突的，但是要这么做，他必须再一次为人所知，你看。他真的害怕走在撒拉托加的街上，而在他逗留时，偷偷摸摸地进出。但是这里他感受到他自己最好的部分，毫无设防，而且真的试着隐藏的自己，现在崭露了。
Because of these feelings he reacts as if he is being attacked. The feelings however are the cause of the attack, for these feelings attract those elements that would otherwise be harmless. This is rather important.因为这些感觉，他出现仿佛受到攻击似的反应。但是感觉是攻击的肇因，因为这些感觉吸引那些原本无害的元素。这是相当重要的。
It is this basic feeling about the book and Saratoga that suddenly activated past associations and brought on some identification with his mother. He should remember here that he is not the person who lived in Saratoga now, unless he chooses in a self limiting way to be so. The book itself, oddly enough, provides a certain protection for it informs others of his basic strength. It shocked him to know that people of the past were reading the book in his present, and seemed to draw him closer to those original associations that caused him to leave Saratoga.对于这本书以及撒拉托加的基本感觉，突然活化了过去的人际关系，并且引发了他对他母亲的一些认同。这里他应该记住，他现在不是住在撒拉托加的那个人，除非他选择以一种自我设限的方式这样做。奇怪的是，书本身提供某种防护，因为它让其他人知道他的基本优势。知道过去的人在他的现在正读着他的书，让他感到震惊，而且他离开撒拉托加就是最初的那些人际关系造成的，但是书却拉近了他与它的距离。
Reading this material and understanding the nature of this attack should end it. His book is helping others in Saratoga. He should be drawing gratitude and health from this thought reality. The yoga exercises will in themselves straighten out the kinks here, with his understanding, as he begins to automatically attract forces of health and vitality.阅读这份资料，了解这个攻击的本质，应该就会终止它了。他的书正在帮助撒拉托加的其他人。他应该从这个思想实相汲取感激之情和健康。由于他的了解，他开始自动吸引健康和活力的种种力量，因此这里瑜伽运动本身将会解决抽筋问题。
The clothing sent by his mother has been somewhat dangerous to him because his feelings, given above, automatically extracted from them the negative feelings of his mother toward him, while blocking out the constructive and loving ones.他的母亲寄给他的衣服对他有点危险，因为前面说过，他的感觉自动从它们身上提取他母亲对他的负面感觉，同时阻挡了建设性的、有爱的感觉。
He did not want her to read the book, you see. He felt this left him open. His expectations, in other words, caused the attack, unfortunately. These feelings began when the book was definitely accepted. They did not grow into such actual disproportionate terms until the time of actual showing arrived.他不想要她读这本书，你知道。他感觉这让他暴露在攻击之下。换句话说，很遗憾，他的预期导致了攻击。这些感觉始于这本书肯定被接受的时候。一直到实际的攻击出现的时候，它们才越演越烈，真的变成这么大题小做。
The date was changed time and again. On one hand this gave him respite. On the other hand, he was angry at the delays. Added to this was what he felt to be the need to find employment, and the hope that his writing could be his livelihood. This has a connection with his grandfather that I will mention later.日期一再改变。一方面这给了他喘息的机会。另一方面，他又气时间延迟。雪上加霜的是，他感觉有需要找工作，也希望他能够靠写作维生。这与他的祖父有关联，我稍后会提到。
He felt that the dream book had let him down when it was rejected. His last experience in sitting in a yard with any regularity happened many years ago. He recalls a photo of his mother in the backyard when he was about seven. She had difficulty then and could not walk well. Because of other conflicts he remembered this, this Summer when he sat in the yard. His mother visited chiropractors, osteopaths, and he knows it. This gives rise to a suggestibility that should be taken into consideration in any visits of his own.当谈梦的书被退稿时，他感觉它让他失望了。他最后一次经常坐在一个院子里的经验发生在很多年前。他想起他母亲在后院的一张照片，当时他大约7岁。当时她有困难，不太能走路。因为其他冲突，今年夏天他坐在院子里的时候，想起了这件事。他的母亲去看了整脊师、整骨师，而且他知道。这引发了容易接受暗示的问题，在他自己任何一次的回乡探望中，应该要把它纳入考虑。
He identified with the bird the cat caught. His mother was superstitiously afraid of cats and in the incident in his bedroom an immediate identification was set up, under Emotional stress and because of past feelings.他认同猫抓到的鸟。他的母亲因为迷信而怕猫，在这个事件中，置身于情绪压力之下，一个立即的认同在他的卧室内被建立了，因为过去的感觉。
Now you may take a break for your hand’s sake.为了你的手，现在你可以休息一下了。
(Break at 9:31. (Resume 9:44.)(9:31休息。9:44继续。)
Now. The sore hip episodes represented the peak of inner panic, and the crises point of the whole affair. Ruburt recognized this as a particular danger point and managed to break away here. He began slowly to open up the channels he had closed and he took first steps toward regaining health. He could have become seriously ill several months ago, but he avoided this. He has been on a road to recovery since, though an uneven one. When he returns to work, this is the first sign.现在。髋部酸痛的插曲代表内在恐慌的高峰，以及整个事件的紧要关头。这里鲁柏认出这是一个特定的危机点，并且设法挣脱了。他慢慢开始敞开他封闭的通道，并且迈开最初的步伐，朝着重获健康的方向前进。几个月前，他本来可能会病得很重，但他避开了。自此他一直走在一条康复的路上，只不过那是一条崎岖不平的路。当他回去工作时，这是第一个征兆。
There was a connection when your cat had his accident, you see, the location of the injury.当你们的猫发生事故的时候，你知道，受伤部位是有关联的。
(Our cat, Catherine, has recovered from his broken hip.)(我们的猫，凯瑟琳，髋部骨折已经复原)
Because of the temporary mother identification, he was open to the suggestion he had concerning his publisher, as the father of his book, you see. He also, because of this identification, feared he would become crippled and that you would leave him. Hence he was supersensitive when he thought you had lost interest in his writing and when he interpreted some of your actions as general neglect or lack of real affection.因为暂时认同母亲，所以他很容易接受与他的出版商有关的暗示，后者就像他的书之父，你知道。因为这个认同，他也害怕他会残废，以及你会离开他。因此当他以为你对他的写作已经失去兴趣时，以及当他把你的一些行动解读成普遍的忽视或缺少真正的情爱时，他就会极度敏感。
What he refers to as the shallowness, comparatively speaking, of his sexual response, had its beginning, again, when he knew the book would be published. This was at first simply a temporary fear reaction, but it lengthened you see as other developments deepened his fear.相较而言，他所谓的性反应冷淡，有它的起点，再一次，就是在他知道这本书会出版的时候。起初这只是一种暂时的恐惧反应，但是你知道因为其他发展深化他的恐惧，所以时间拉长了。
Your own attitude toward Frederick Fell , and your remarks to Ruburt, deeply frightened him, for they reinforced the nagging feeling that Fell would not do well by him as his father had not done well by his mother. This was the sore point always felt in those discussions. He felt cornered, you see, as if you were saying, “ I told you so, your deepest fears will be realized.” He only wrote to his father when he needed money as a child and adolescent, and he only called or contacted Fell , it seemed to him, when he wanted money. Fell was late on payments as his father had been late. He felt urgently dependent upon the checks as his mother had been toward welfare checks and the father’s payments.你自己对于佛德瑞克·菲尔的态度，以及你对鲁柏说出的评论，吓坏了他，因为它们强化了让他不得安宁的感觉——菲尔不会善待他，就像他的父亲没有善待他的母亲一样。在那些讨论中，这是他一直感觉到的痛点。他感到担心，你知道，好像你在说：“我跟你说过了，你最深的恐惧将会成真。”在童年和青春期，他只有在需要钱的时候才会写信给他的父亲，而且似乎对他来说，他也只有在想要钱的时候才会打电话或联络菲尔。菲尔付钱会拖时间，就像他的父亲也会拖时间。他感觉迫切仰赖支票，就像他的母亲急需救济金支票和父亲的付款一样。
It just happens, you see, that when Ruburt's mother was coming down with arthritis, Ruburt was in the early grades—a kindergarten room with blocks and small stools and cloak room. This simply brings up associations, of course, with the nursery school, serving as another connection with his mother's symptoms.刚好，你知道，当鲁柏的母亲得了关节炎的时候，鲁柏还是低年级的学童——一间幼儿园的教堂，里面有积木，小椅凳和衣帽间。当然，这绝对引发托儿所的联想，具有另一个与他母亲的症状相关的连结作用。
The sensitivity to sneakers was activated because of these connections with the mother, the children’s work hung upon the wall—this is another connection with his own past, you see, with early grades, and so is the colored girl, Dagmar, as Edward Briscoe was the only colored boy in his early grades.因为这些与母亲相关的连结，所以对运动鞋的敏感被激发了，墙上悬挂的学童作品——这是另一个与他自己的过去，你知道，与低年级那时候相关的连结，而且黑人女孩黛格玛(Dagmar)也是，就像爱德华·布里斯柯(Edward Briscoe)在他低年级的时候是唯一一个黑人男孩一样。
If he were not already sensitized, these connections would not have bothered him, and they should fade as the general sensitivity disappears. It was because of such sensitivities being activated that Ruburt earlier responded in Marathon(Florida) to a sweater sent by his mother.要不是他已经变得敏感，这些连结就不会困扰他，而且它们应该会在一般性的敏感消失之时跟着消退。因为这样的敏感被激发了，鲁柏之前在玛拉松市(Marathon佛罗里达州)才会对他母亲寄来的一件毛衣有反应。
There is some sensitivity to beads at this time only due to a picture in which his mother wears them with short skirts. It is the combination, rather than the beads alone.这时对珠链有点敏感，是因为在一张照片里他母亲戴着它搭配短裙。重点是这个组合，而不光是珠链本身。
Many early morning symptoms of a few months ago were direct mimicry of the mother in this identification, but these particular ones have vanished.几个月前清晨时分的症状，有很多是在这样的认同当中直接模仿了母亲，但这些症状已经消失了。
Your parties were helpful. The moderate drinking helped reunite the conscious and subconscious as a total self, knocking out the unwholesome identification with the mother. The swearing bears a direct relationship to the mother's language.你的派对帮上了忙。适度的饮酒有助于重新统合意识和潜意识，合成一个完全的自己(total self)，把有害身心健康的这种对母亲的认同淘汰掉。骂脏话与母亲的用语有直接的关系。
Ruburt felt safe if his mother read his fiction, you see, for it was several steps removed from his inner life.如果他的母亲读他的小说，鲁柏就会感觉安全，你看，因为它距离它的内在生活有几步之遥。
You may take a break if you wish.你想要的话，可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:09. (Resume at 10:25.)(10:09休息。10:25继续。)
Your own positive action with the pendulum and in your personal life with Ruburt has been most beneficial, and resulted in the kind of support he needed at this time.在使用摆锤以及在你与鲁柏相处的私人生活中，你的正面行动非常有帮助，结果产生了他此时需要的这种支持。
The dreams he had tried to give him warning of probabilities, and he should have questioned me or used the pendulum. There were a series of these and I could have been asked for an interpretation. I told him to use positive suggestion concerning his mother before her letters. Positive suggestion should be used, a practice he began and discontinued.他做的梦试着警告他有诸多可能性，他应该来问我或使用摆锤。这些是一连串的，他本来可以要求我解读一下。在他写信之前，我告诉他，关于他的母亲，他要利用正面的暗示。应该要利用正面暗示，一个他起了头但没有继续做下去的练习。
He should not attempt at this time to write anything more than a friendly letter to his mother. When he tries to open up in a letter he panics. The pendulum sessions are helping indeed. I have given you most beneficial material this evening and I will close our session. Ruburt should read this many times.这时候他不应该试图写任何东西给他的母亲，除了一封友善的信以外。当他试着在一封信中敞开自己时，他就会恐慌。摆锤课其实是有帮助的。今天晚上我已经给你们非常有助益的资料，所以我要结束我们的课了。鲁柏应该要阅读这份资料很多次。
("Have you got time for a question?"(“你有时间回答一个问题吗？”
(Jane nodded.(珍点了头。
("Can you tell me about the dream I told Jane, concerning the primitive men?")(“你能不能跟我说说我告诉珍的梦，与原始人有关的那个梦？”)
Give me a moment.等我一下。
(Pause.) It is a rather lengthy explanation.(停顿)这个解释相当长。
(Pause.) The cavemen were pseudo realities. There were five others involved. There was a time travel here, but it was into a probable past. You knew that this was a reality in which you had not participated. You were in no danger within it, for you had never existed in it. The others were probability travelers like yourself. If you like, I will give you a more detailed explanation at our next session.(停顿)穴居人是伪实相。有其他5个牵涉在内。这里有一次时间旅行，但它是到一个可能的过去。你知道这是一个你没有参与过的实相。你在其中安全无虞，因为你从来不曾存在它之内。其他人是像你这样的可能性旅行者。如果你喜欢的话，在我们的下一节课，我会给你一个更加详细的解释。
("Okay.” )(“好。”)
Or if you prefer, now.或者你比较想要的话，现在也可以。
("No. That's all right.")(“不用，没关系。”)
Do you have other questions?你有没有其他问题？
("No.")(“没有。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both. A fond good evening.你们两位致上我最衷心的祝福。祝你们有一个美好的今晚。
("Good evening, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(10:27. Jane’s voice was quiet throughout the session, her pace mostly good, but with some long pauses. She spoke while sitting down.(10:27。这一节珍的声音从头到尾都很安静，她的速度大部分时间很好，其间有一些长时间的停顿。她坐着讲话。
(Recently Jane has requested a healing dream from her subconscious. See her following dream report.)(最近珍向她的潜意识要求一个疗愈梦。见以下她的梦记录。)
FEBRUARY 2, 1967 DREAM1967年2月2日 梦
Today at 9.40 AM a telegram from Anne Healy informed me that Blanche Price died early today. I quit work at 10, did psy-time, trying to contact Blanche with no results. Then tried to sleep, thinking that it might be easier for her if I were in a dream state. Had difficulty falling asleep, wasn't sleepy and at 11 decided to forget about it. Instead fell to sleep at once to have the following strange dream. I think it is a therapeutic one; I have been requesting one from the subconscious. It involves some projection, I think, and is one of those dreams where I was now and then aware of my dreaming condition. I’ve forgotten some of it, and am not sure of some of the early sequence.今天在上午9:40分，安希利(Anne Healy)发来的一封电报通知我，布兰琪·普莱斯(Blanche Price)今天一早过世了。我在10点停止工作，做了心理时间的练习，试着与布兰琪接触，但是没有结果。然后设法睡着，心想我要是在梦状态中，可能对她会比较容易一些。难以入睡，没有睡意，于是在11点决定这件事就算了。结果反而立刻睡着了，做了以下这个奇怪的梦。我想它是一个具有治疗作用的梦；我一直向潜意识要求这样一个梦。她涉及某种投射，我想，而且是那些我偶尔对我的做梦状况有觉知的梦之一。我忘了一些内容，也不确定开始阶段的一些部分。
FIRST SEQUENCE第一段
Rob and I are on vacation, perhaps only for a weekend, in a collegelike atmosphere, a town, with water nearby. We walk along a busy street. I say, 'I don't care if this isn't like it used to be years ago. It's great.” He agreed. I was very happy and carefree. Just about the whole dream takes place in this location. The houses were triangular A-type affairs, of multicolored pastels but also bright colors too, glass walls, the houses not crowded together, some above others on small knolls.罗和我在度假，也许只是一个周末，在一种学院似的氛围中，一个城镇，靠近水边。我们沿着一条繁忙的街道散步。我说：“我不在乎这是不是和几年前的样子一样。很棒！”他同意。我非常快乐又自由自在。整个梦几乎都发生在这个地点。房子是A字形的三角形建筑，有着多种色彩的粉色也有亮色的玻璃墙，房子并没有挤在一起，有一些位于小山丘上，在其他房子的上方。
I think the following is beginning of dream: Mrs. Mahaar calls me to go downstairs. In basement I find four or five young men laying on the floor, each with an ill dog beside him, at least the dogs looked sick. One was a Great Dane. Some girls there too. Can't remember how this worked out, but it was all right, they weren't as sick as they looked or something.我认为以下是梦的开始：马哈(Mahaar)太太叫我下楼。在地下室，我发现4或5个年轻男人躺在地板上，每一个的身边都有一只生病的狗，至少狗看起来病恹恹的。一只是大麦町。也有一些女孩子在那里。不记得这是怎么解决的，但是没有问题，它们不像它们看起来病得那么重之类的。
Then a group (perhaps this one?) goes upstairs to our apartment. Great conversation, stimulating, fun, etc. As I talk, I do yoga exercises easily and am surprised at this. We discuss a dream which I have just experienced (within the major dream). In this, I was with this same group in Saratoga, on Union Avenue. They had picked me up in their car and kept driving beyond where I wanted to get off. The road ahead was lovely, colors bright and brilliant. They slowed the car down, laughingly, to twenty-five or so (in this inner dream) and I jumped out, also laughing and unharmed. In the living room we discuss this dream. It featured one of the girls in the group particularly. She thought it was a clairvoyant one, but I said no. Whether it has or not seemed to hinge on the interpretation of a word, a city, I think. I tell them of my interest in dreams and that records are important. We are strangers, incidentally, meeting in the dream.然后一群人(也许是这一群)上楼到我们的公寓。很棒的对话，启迪人心、有趣等等。在我说话时，我练起瑜珈轻松自如，而且为此感到惊奇。我们讨论我(在主要的梦里)刚经历的一个梦。在这个梦里，我和同一群人在撒拉托加的联合大道(Union Avenue)上。他们开车搭载我，经过我想要下车的地方，还是继续往前开。前方的道路景色宜人，色彩明亮又灿烂。大笑着，他们放慢车速到25英里左右(在这个梦中梦)，我跳出车外，也是一边大笑，而且毫发无伤。在客厅里，我们讨论这个梦。这群人当中的一个女孩尤其突出。她认为它是一个千里眼的梦，但我说不是。无论它看起来是否取决于城市这一个词的解读，我想。我告诉他们我对梦有兴趣，而且记梦很重要。顺便一提，我们是在梦中相遇的陌生人。
SECOND SEQUENCE第二段
As we sit talking I notice some mail on a room divider, am surprised, and think that it must have come before Rob left for work, as it has been opened. One rather large advertisement and two letters. Now I am definitely back in the bed in which I am sleeping, trying to decipher the writing on the envelopes. (I think I was in my astral body though.) I knew that I was dreaming, thought to myself that it was very difficult to read such material in the dream state but that I would try in any case. Tried several times, holding them as close as I could, squinting, etc. Made out a New York postmark and the first names of a couple, and their last name, now all forgotten. The last name was something like Faulk, but it wasn't, I don't think. Was Betty the woman's name? They were friends of my mother but strangers to me and I thought that maybe they had read the ESP book.我坐着讲话时，注意到房间的隔屏上有个什么邮件，觉得惊讶，心想它一定是罗出门上班前送到的，因为它已经被人打开了。一则很大的广告，以及两封信。现在我肯定回到我正在睡觉的床上，试着解读信封上的字迹。(但我想我是在灵体中)我知道我在做梦，虽然在梦状态中要阅读这样的资料非常困难，但是无论如何要试一试。试了几次，尽可能把它放在近处、眯着眼等等。看出了一个纽约的邮戳以及一对夫妻的名字与他们的姓氏，现在全都忘了。姓氏是福尔克(Faulk)之类的，但我想并不是。女人的名字是贝蒂(Betty)吗？他们是我母亲的朋友，但我不认识，我想他们可能读过《如何开发你的超感官能力》。
Then, really astonished, I see some packages that simply were not there a moment earlier. I open them though they might possibly have been opened earlier by someone else. I am absolutely delighted with their contents. One held several pair of lovely pastel stockings, the kind you would ordinarily wear with high heels, slim and well-proportioned; they were wrapped together not in a box, with baubles of some kind. The other package I've forgotten. Then again I realize this is a dream and am determined to take my packages back with me, will not let them go. I stuff the things back into the large bags and hold them tight to my chest, hearing the paper crinkle, and once I almost think I will make it and bring them back. Instead I waken, and they are gone. I feel like crying.然后，真的很震惊，我看到一些包裹，前一刻它们根本不在那里。我打开它们，但是可能之前就有人把它们打开了。里面的东西真的让我很高兴。一个装着几只可爱的粉色丝袜，你平常会搭配高跟鞋的那种，修长而且比例很好；它们是用某种小玩意包在一起的，不是放在盒子里。另一个包裹我忘了。然后我再度发觉这是一个梦，而决心把我的包裹带回去，不要放手。我把东西塞进大袋子里，紧紧地抱在胸前，听见纸张的摩擦声，我一度以为可以顺利阅读，把它们带回来。反之，我醒了，而它们也不见了。我感觉想哭。
THIRD SEQUENCE第三段
I do not really waken however but continue dreaming. I'm downtown in the same town, with this group again. One girl asks me if Chuck stayed till nine last night and I say yes. Then one girl, not of the group, is crying. I say something about poetry and she says, well you d better talk fast because I've just about decided to stop writing poetry. She has light brown hair, rather dark circles under her eyes and is somewhat younger than I. I say that you can’t just decide consciously to give up writing poetry, you d write it anyhow, though you could subconsciously make such a decision and never know about it at all. Then rather dramatically but beautifully I tell her that: “Poetry is your characteristic method of expression, your way of translating the data into physical reality and that even its rhythm is the rhythm of your heartbeat." Tell her that she can't give it up.但是我没有真的醒来，而是继续做梦。我在同一个城镇的市中心，又是和这群人在一起。一个女孩问我，恰克(Chuck)昨晚是不是待到9点才走，我说是。然后一个女孩，不在这群人当中，正在哭。我说了一番关于诗的话，她说，嗯，你最好讲快一点，因为我差不多决定不要再写诗了。她有一头浅棕色的头发，黑眼圈很严重，比我年轻一点。我说你无法有意识地决定放弃写诗，不管怎样你就会写，但在潜意识里你可能做这样的一个决定，只不过你根本就不会知道。然后相当戏剧性却又说得好极了，我告诉她：“诗是你特有的表达方法，你把资料翻译成物质实相的方式，甚至它的韵律就是你心跳的节奏。”我告诉她，她不可能放弃它。
Then in here I enter a conversation with another girl about Louis Untermeyer.然后在这里，我与另一个女孩开始谈起路易斯·安特迈尔(Louis Untermeyer;译注：已故的美国诗人)。
I begin to mimic him then realize that she is the one who is doing this, and talking about Untermeyer, not I, and I become confused and embarrassed and excuse myself for butting in.我开始模仿他，接着发觉她才是在做这件事、在谈论安特迈尔的人，不是我，我觉得困惑又尴尬，为自己的插嘴道歉。
I run ahead of the other girl, and around her, really hunting her down, yelling again dramatically and accusingly: I ask myself, where are all my friends who were going to write no matter what, to work no matter what happened. Where are they all and now I work alone?" I almost chanted this, and more that I’ve forgotten.我跑在另一个女孩前面，并且绕着她转，真的对她穷追不舍，再一次戏剧性又兴师问罪地大喊大叫：“我问我自己，不管怎样都要写下去、不管发生什么都要创作的朋友全都跑哪里去了。他们都去哪里了？现在只有我一个人在创作。”我几乎是用吟唱的方式说了这番话，而且不止这些，但其余的我忘了。
(I don't think she wanted to hear and that I was making her listen on purpose, for her own good.) She ran, cringing, to hide. Friends gathered about her. One said, she’s in bad shape, or badly off words to that effect. You've made things worse. But I said,” No, you can't save a part of her (and sacrifice part) you have to save the poetry too.” And she did seem better. Friends comforted her. I said to some of them, “Do you know how to work the pendulum?" As I said this I knew that they did before they answered, yes. “Then check it out,” I said and they agreed.(我不认为她想听，我故意要说给她听，是为了她好。)她缩着身子，跑去躲起来。朋友聚集在她身边。一个说，她状况不好，或穷途潦倒，大意是这样。你这是雪上加霜。但我说：“不，你不能只拯救她的一部分(并且牺牲另一部分)，你也必须拯救诗。”而她似乎好一点了。朋友们安慰她。我对他们当中的一些人说：“你们知不知道怎么用摆锤？”在说这句话的时候，他们还没回答，我就知道他们会用。“那就试试看啊”我说，他们同意了。
Then we were all going back to our apartment, Rob's and mine. The scene was lovely. We stood blocks away but could see the houses where ours was, it was night now, the bright colors of the houses showing clearly, though. I couldn't pick out our place from where we stood, couldn't find it, but realized I had to get up or wake up, and did. I felt very good, refreshed, revitalized.然后我们全都回到我们的公寓，罗和我的公寓。场景很可爱。我们隔着几个街区站着，但是看得到我们的家置身其间的那些房子，这时已入夜，但是房子的鲜艳色彩却清晰呈现。从我们站立之处，我认不出我们的地方，找不到它，但我发觉我必须起床或醒来，于是我就醒了。我感觉非常好、神采奕奕、朝气蓬勃。
Earlier, one of the boys kissed me laughingly in front of the group and I laughed, delighted. They all seemed to look up to me in some way. Earlier too, someone asked me if my skin wasn't brown or when it looked brown and I said in Summertime.稍早前，一个男孩在众人面前，一边笑一边亲了我，我开心地笑了。他们在某一方面似乎全部都敬仰我。也是稍早前，有人问我，我的肤色是否不是棕色，或它何时看起来是棕色，我说在夏天的时候。
(Copy of the note used as the object in the 83rd envelope experiment, in the 317th session for February 6,1967.1967年2月6日第317节第83次信封实验用作标的物的笔记副本

SESSION 317 第317节 珍的私人课 自我不能与内我作对 信封83


FEBRUARY 6, 1967 8:45 PM MONDAY1967年2月6日 星期一 晚上8:45
(The object for the 83rd envelope experiment was a note Jane wrote to me today; I found it on the table this noon upon returning from work, left there by Jane shortly after 11 AM. As usual I placed it between two pieces of cardboard, then sealed it in double envelopes. Jane wrote her note in red ink.(第83次信封实验的标的物是珍今天写给我的一张字条；今天中午我从办公室回来时发现它在桌子上，珍在上午11点过后不久把它留在那里。一如往常，我把它夹在两片硬纸板之间，然后密封在双层信封内。珍用红色墨水在她的字条上写字。
(Jane began speaking in trance in a very jovial Mood, with her eyes wide open and very dark.)(珍在出神中间开始讲话，心情非常愉快，双眼圆睁，而且颜色很深。)
Good evening.晚安。
( Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. What have we here? A joyful heart? A grateful Ruburt?现在。我们这里有什么？一颗喜悦的心？一个感恩的鲁柏？
("I guess so."(“我想是吧。”)
(Smile. Eyes closed.) Give us a moment.(微笑。眼睛闭着)等我们一下。
He has indeed learned, the hard way, lessons that he had to learn if he were to further develop. And yet these lessons all in all were self given, and he is actually lucky, for they could have been far more difficult and the fruits of stubbornness could have been more bitter.他的确已经学到，千辛万苦，如果他要进一步发展，就是不得不学的功课。可是这些功课从各方面来说都是自找的，他其实很幸运，因为它们本来可能困难很多，而且固执的果实本来可能艰苦很多。
He has learned that the ego cannot set itself up against the inner self. He has learned to trust and have confidence in the inner self, and to listen to the subconscious which is a part of his inner identity.他已经学到，自我不能与内我作对。他已经学会信任，对内我有了信心，而且也会倾听他内在本体一部分的潜意识。
He developed this objective manner originally years ago because he feared he could not control his own spontaneity. It grew, however, into too strong an armor, and threatened to suffocate him. He will no longer block material now in the sessions, and therefore I will have a freer voice to counsel you when it may be needed.他最初在几年前发展出这种客观的态度，是因为他害怕他无法控制他自己的自发。然而，它却增长成太过强大的盔甲，使得他有窒息之处。现在上课时他不再阻挡资料，因此我将会有一个更加自由的声音，可以在需要的时候找你商量。
The emergence of these psychic abilities was indeed resented by his ego, and initiated a necessary overhaul of personality, against which it protested. Ruburt will be more his natural and uninhibited intuitional self now. The ego had simply overgrown its bounds.他的自我确实讨厌这些心灵能力的出现，于是对它反对的人物发动了一次必要的人格大检修。鲁柏现在将会更加做他自然又无拘无束的自己。自我只不过是长得太大、超出它的界限而已。
Remember, the normal consciousness is not synonymous with the ego. The ego is only a portion of consciousness. For Ruburt's benefit yes, indeed, the cure is permanent, as long as he utilizes what he has learned, and it seems fairly certain that he will.记住，正常的意识自我并不是同义词。自我只是意识的一部分而已。为了鲁柏好，没错，确实是，只要他运用他学到的东西，疗愈就是永久有效，而且似乎八九不离十的是，他一定会学以致用。
The other still-lingering symptoms will quickly vanish also; the pendulum sessions, quite apart from our sessions, should be maintained as a kind of personal psychic hygiene until the habit of communication is thoroughly established. Your help will still be of benefit for a short while. Your support is still, if not required, highly advantageous. I will, Joseph, discuss some past-life material here, when I finish with this.另外一些挥之不去的症状也会很快消失；摆锤课，截然不同于我们的课，应该被当作是一种个人的心灵保健法继续进行，直到这个沟通的习惯彻底养成为止。你的协助在短期内仍然有用。你的支持，就算不是必需，仍然非常有利。
(Long pause.) A variety of events led up to the sudden improvement. The letter to Miss Healy was important here; but more than this, intuitionally Ruburt became aware of insights that were necessary if the symptoms were to vanish.约瑟，讲完这件事之后，这里我要来讨论一些过去世的资料。(长时间停顿)各式各样的事件导致突然的改善。这里写给希丽小姐(Miss Healy)的信很重要；但不只这样，凭着直觉，鲁柏逐渐觉察到许多洞见，如果症状要消失，这些洞见是不可或缺的。
Some of these insights were realized last evening, and resulted in the first truly deeply relaxing sleep of some time. This allowed the subconscious healing abilities to work. He was also clairvoyantly aware of his friend's death before it occurred, for several months in fact.昨晚他领悟到这些洞见了，结果有了这段时间以来首次真正深度放松的睡眠。这让意识的疗愈能力得以发挥。他也凭着千里眼在他的朋友过世之前早就觉知他的残讯，事实上早了几个月。
This to some slight degree was responsible for added symptoms. For him personally the yoga should be a daily physical and psychic health measure. It will insure the mobility of the inner personality, and dissipate resistances before they accumulate.在某种微小程度上，这是症状增多的原因。对他个人而言，瑜珈应该是每天维持身体和心灵健康的一种方法。它将确保内在人格的机动性，并且在抗拒日积月累之前解散它们。
The stubborn part of his nature has been a characteristic of most of his past lives. It is basically a resolute characteristic with great potential for balance, a characteristic that can keep him headed, despite any disappointments in the proper directions. When the ego controls this resoluteness however, it turns into stubbornness, and works against the personality. Perseverance becomes pigheadedness then, you see.他本质里的固执成分一直是他大部分前世的一个物质。它基本上是一种不屈不挠的物质。然而，当自我控制这个不屈不挠的部分时，它转变成固执，而与人格作对。坚持不懈于是变成冥顽不灵，你看。
The resoluteness can now be used in a different manner. Ruburt can use it to insure his intuitional psychic and spiritual development.不屈不挠现在可以用不同的方式加以利用。鲁柏可以用它来保障他在直觉通灵和灵性方面的发展。
You may take your break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:06. During break we discussed some books on yoga by various authors. Resume at 9:17.)(9:06。在休息时，我们讨论了不同作者所写的一些瑜珈书。9:17继续。)
Now. You must not take too literally that which you read, but leave it to the inner self to interpret and decide, and leave it to our material also. For the material represents the very best of your knowledge as it is given to you. Do not let terms confuse you. They are by nature confusing and distorted.现在。对于你读的书，不可太执着于字面上的意思，而是留给内我，也留给我们的资料去解读和决定。因为这份资料代表你在它被给出时最佳的认知。不要让字词混淆你。它们本来就是令人困惑而又扭曲的。
The books will not harm you unless you take them as literal unbiased basic truth. They are groping attempts at inner knowledge. Your own knowledge will come from within.这些书不会对你造成伤害，除非你把它们当成毫无偏见、如实呈现的基本事实。它们是探索内在知识的尝试。你自己的知识将会来自于内在。
Some of the books will contain good i deas that you can use. Others you will discard. You must first of all remember the simple truth—that there is no upper or lower to the self. There is no low subconscious and high super conscious. They are one and the same. You simply seem to know them separately.其中有些书将会包含你可以加以利用的好点子。其他的，你将会舍弃。你首先必须记住这个简单的事实——对自己而言，没有高低之分。没有低等的潜意识与高等的超意识。你只不过好像个别认识它而已。
In time you will experience them as one. Therefore, when you read, and various names are given to, levels of the self, remember this. This point alone will save you much bewilderment. The exercises, the way Ruburt has adapted them recently, are excellent. He should keep this view. You will always adapt in any case. These sessions and material represent your closest and most dependable source of inner knowledge, outside of direct personal mystical experiences.最后你将会体验到它们是一体的。因此，你在阅读时，自己的各个层面会被赋予形形色色的名称，不要忘记这件事。光是这一点就足以消除你的很多疑惑。这些练习，最近鲁柏采用它们的方式，非常好。他应该保持这个观点。你在任何情况下都能够适应。这些课和资料代表你们最接近也最可靠的内在知识源头，在直接的个人神秘经验之外。
I am in many ways a most dependable contact, with that which is beyond your physical knowledge. While I am myself, I am also intimately connected with other portions of your own personalities that exist in other dimensions. And one day you will be more aware of me in, for example, projection experiments.在很多方面，我是一个最可靠的联络窗口，借由我连结到那在你们物质知识之外的一切。虽然我是我自己，但我也和你们自身人格存在于其他维度的其他部分有密切的连结。而且有一天你将会在——比方说——投射经验中更加觉察到我的存在。
You see during Ruburt’s past period of adjustment, our sessions were not cut off. I was able to keep those channels open. You are approaching some excellent periods in your lives, periods that would not have been possible had Ruburt not fully accepted, as he now has, the emergence of his abilities and his responsibility to develop them.你看到在鲁柏过去的调整期间，我们的课并没有中断。我能够让那些通道持续开放。你们正在接近你们生命中一些绝佳的时期，要是鲁柏没有像现在这样充分接受他的能力崭露头角，也不接受他有责任培养它们，这些时期就不会出现。
They cannot be intellectually held apart from the whole self You must actively practice what you both know in your daily living. If you do not do so you will forget what you know, literally. What is said in our sessions must be utilized, and for the sake of others as well as for yourselves.它们在理智上无法与全我拆开。你们必须积极地在日常生活中练习你们两人知道的事。如果你们不这么做，你们就会忘记你们知道的事。在我们的课间说过的事一定要加以运用，为了别人也为了你自己。
Ruburt did not trust the sessions for some time, since it was the abilities that made the sessions possible that so bothered him. So that has been worked out. A new balance has been achieved, and literally a new personality framework has been established. It too, of course, will change, but now he can let it change joyfully.鲁柏有一段时间不信任这些课，因为让这些课程为可能的能力是如此地困扰他。所以那件事已经解决了。一个新的平衡完成了，而且实际上是一个新的人格架构建立了。它当然也会改，但现在他能够喜悦地任由它改变。
A comparable change occurred in your personality, Joseph, after the sessions began. It was less difficult, mainly since you had been ill earlier, you see, and already forced to know the weight of the body when the ego fights the intuitional self.一个可以媲美的改变发生在你的人格中，约瑟，在课开始之后。它比较不困难，主要是因为你之前病了，你知道，而且已经被迫认识到，当自我与直觉的自己斗争时，身体多有分量。
You were therefore more willing to accept a psychic readjustment and experience. The self teaches its own lessons. The self knows the best way to get its message across.你因此更愿意接受一个心灵的重新调整和经验。自己为它自己上课。自己知道怎样传达它的讯息才是最好的方式。
Now. Ruburt had several dreams concerning Miss Price, also a therapeutic dream last evening that he did not remember. During this period he did not remember his dreams because he purposely closed subconscious channels.现在。鲁柏做了几个和普莱斯小姐有关的梦，还有昨晚的一个疗愈梦但他不记得了。在这段期间，他之所以不记得他的梦，是因为他故意关闭潜意识的通道。
There was a slight stroke on the left side several months ago with Miss Price, and Ruburt knew of this in a dream. There was, I believe, a hospital stay, though whether this was connected with the stroke I do not know.几个月前，普莱斯小姐的左侧有一次小中风，鲁柏在一个梦中得知这件事。我相信她住过一次院，但是不是和中风有关，这我就不知道了。
The impending death also brought forth associations concerning Saratoga, you see. Miss Price was to some extent a substitute mother image indeed, and a rather dangerous one potentially, in any case, because of the confusion in sex identity.这个即将到来的死亡也产生关于撒拉托加的联想，你看。普莱斯小姐在某种程度上其实是一个代理母亲的形象，而且就潜能而言还是相当危险的一个，不管怎样，因为在性别认同上的混乱。
(Saratoga Springs, NY, is Jane's hometown.)(撒拉托加温泉市，纽约州，是珍的故乡)
The poetry served as a convenient and suitable substitute for sexual attraction here on Miss Price's part. On the other hand she viewed Ruburt as the daughter she would never have, while Ruburt viewed her as the mother she wished for.这里在普莱斯小姐身上，诗是性吸引力的一个方便又合适的替代品。另一方面她把鲁柏看作是她从未有过的女儿，同时鲁柏也视之为她希望有的母亲。
All of this highly hidden of course. The sexual charge was always used in transformed nature by Miss Price, and turned into the propelling action of many beneficial deeds, for she helped literally hundreds of students, forcing their best from them. She had a military background in two past lives.这一切当然全都深藏着。本质已经转化的性电荷向来被普莱斯小姐加以利用，转变成推进的行动，促成很多有利的行为，因为她实实在在帮助了数百个学生，激发他们展现自己最好的一面。她在两个前世有过从军的背景。
In one, Miss Healy was a friend, a general: a Prussian war. They were both Prussian.在其中一世，希丽小姐是一个朋友，一名将军：一场普鲁士战争。她们两人都是普鲁士人。
Ruburt's letters in a metal box, with some clothing on top of the box. The poetry is separate. A sister of Miss Price's is connected here. You will also hear from Miss Healy again. I believe she will join Blanche before long.鲁柏放在一个金属盒子里的信，盒子上方有某种布料。诗作是分开的。这里和普莱斯小姐的一个姊妹有关联。你也会再度听到希丽小姐的消息。我相信她不久就会与布兰琪为伴。
(Pause, eyes closed.) The number 1815 may refer to a safety deposit box, I do not know. Give us a moment.(停顿，闭着眼睛)1815这个数字可能是指一个保险箱，我不知道。等我们一下。
(Pause.) An M and an L. We will see. I do not know if this has reference to Ruburt's letters and Blanche's sister or relative, or to a contact concerning the ESP book.(停顿)一个M和一个L。我们再看看吧。我不知道这是不是指鲁柏的信和布兰琪的姊妹或亲戚，还是指一个与ESP书有关的联络人。
Some money shortly. An initial encounter that will be the start of an enduring relationship for you both, I believe in February.很快就会有一些钱。一个最初的邂逅将会开启你们两人之间一段持久关系的起点，我相信是在2月。
Do you have an envelope for me?你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes.”(“有。”
(At 9:47 Jane took the sealed envelopes from me for the 83rd experiment; her eyes were closed; she held it to her forehead in the usual horizontal position.)(9:47，珍从我手上拿了第83次实验的密封信封；她的双眼闭着；她一如往常把横向的信封放在额头上。)
Give us a moment, please.请给我们一点时间。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Connection with a grave. With two people. With an expenditure of money. A knothole. I do not know to what this refers. And with shapes that appear like high buildings or a skyline of a city.与一个坟墓有关联。与两个人有关。与一次金钱支出有关。一个节孔。我不知道这是指什么。也和看起来像高楼大厦或城市天际线的形状有关。
I have the impression here of a large office in a building in a large city, like New York. With oval brick arches out in front of the windows. Three arches.我这里有个印象是，在一个像纽约的大城市里一栋建筑物当中的一间大型办公室。外头的窗户前面有着椭圆形的红砖拱顶。三座拱顶。
The impression of one cent, which leads me to suppose that money is connected here.一分钱的印象，这让我想到这里和钱有关。
A bucket shape. A variety of events that occur within three days, involving three people. Two men, I believe, and perhaps one woman. 1861 or 71. A date like the date on a building. Connection with a sordid affair.桶子的形状。发生在三天之内的各种事件，牵涉到三个人。两个男人，我相信，也许还有一个女人。18、6、1或7、1。像铭印在一栋建筑物上面的一个日期。与一个卑鄙的事件有关联。
5 4 3 1. A twister. A rectangular object. The color blue. Dark circles like black button shapes . A dark wooden door. A letter leaves this door. Spencer. The object came from that door. It was mailed or sent, or the object is connected with an item that was mailed or sent.5、4、3、1。一个龙卷风。一个长方形物体。蓝色。像黑色纽扣形状的深色圆圈。一扇深色的木门。一封信离开这扇门。史宾塞(Spencer)。来自那扇门的物体。它是邮寄或送达的，不然就是该物体与一个邮寄或送达的物件有关。
Printing on it. There is a connection with water, over water. Yellow. The number 4, perhaps referring to people. An SAG. Perhaps an implied division into four parts. Or a division such as comic strips, you see.它上面有印刷字。与水有关联，在水上面。黄色。数字4，也许是指人。一个SAG。也许隐含分成四等分的意思。或是像连环漫画那样的分隔，你知道。
Do you have any questions?你有没有任何问题？
("No.")(“没有。”)
You may take your break.你可以休息一下。
(Break at 9:58. I told Jane I hadn't asked questions because I didn't know whether the data were way off, or there were connections I didn't understand.(9:58休息。我告诉珍我之所以没有发问，是因为我不知道资料是太离谱了，还是有我不了解的关联。
(See the copy of the object on page 269. It consists of a note Jane wrote me late this morning, and left on the table for me to find upon coming home from work this noon. Jane herself left for work at about 11:30 AM at nursery school. The note used as object concerned work we had been doing with the pendulum recently, and which has also been discussed to some degree in recent sessions. I thought it would have strong Emotional attachment for Jane.(见前面标的物副本。它是珍在今天早上很晚的时候写给我的一张字条，留在桌上，要让我中午回家时看到。珍她自己在上午11点半左右出门去幼儿园工作。被当作标的物的字条与我最近用摆锤在做的事情有关，最近的几节课某种程度也都讨论过。我认为对珍来说，它应该有强烈的情感连结。
(Jane received a telegram from Ann Healy on February 2, Thursday, informing her of the death of her college teacher friend, Blanche Price. Jane answered the wire this morning before writing me the note. The answer was by letter after unsuccessful attempts to telephone Ann Healy over the weekend. I thought that possibly the data had been displaced from Jane's note to me, to the letter she wrote Anne. The two were closely connected in time, and both concerned highly charged events for Jane.(珍在2月2日星期二收到安·希丽拍来的一封电报，通知她一位友人的死讯，在大学教书的布兰琪·普莱斯。珍今天早上在写字条给我之前回了这封电报。珍在周末打了几通电话给安·希丽都无人接听之后，才写信回复。我认为可能资料被替换了，从珍写给我的字条换成她写给安的信。这两者的时间接近，而且都关联到对珍而言情感能量非常充沛的事件。
(There is also some factual connection in the displacement, since by using the pendulum recently we have learned of the rather important role Blanche played in some of Jane’s earlier associations; due to a complicated variety of events Jane has been bothered lately by some physical symptoms we are in the process of eliminating. These symptoms, and Blanche, as well as Jane’s mother and other contributing factors, are also discussed thoroughly in the next session.(在替换中也有某种实际的连结，因为我们最近使用摆锤而得知，布兰琪在珍之前的一些联想中扮演相当重要的角色；由于各种复杂的事件，珍近来为一些我们正在消除过程当中的身体症状所苦。这些症状，以及布兰琪，还有珍的母亲和其他促成因素，在下一节也有详尽的讨论。
(At break, I hoped aloud that Seth would discuss the data in the light of our suspicions. Resume at 10:02.)(在休息时，我说出我希望赛斯根据我们的怀疑来讨论这个资料。10:02继续。)
Now. The Emotional effects of the letter to Miss Healy superseded even those of your note in this case. They came written closely together. The city was Baltimore. The arched windows, Miss Healy s. The date the approximate date the house was built.现在。在这个案例中，写给希丽小姐的回信引发的情绪效应甚至取代了你的字条当中的那些效应。写这两封信的时间很接近。城市是巴尔的摩。拱顶窗，希丽小姐的。日期接近那间房子建成的日期。
The door, the door from which she emerged after sending the telegram. The money having to do with concern over Blanche's family, and how they would handle Blanche's estate. The Spencer is a future development. The black buttons on Blanche's death—the dress she wore. The grave is obvious. Other impressions also apply to the same circumstances—the city, Baltimore. Ruburt was so certain not to block anything that he did not let me focus clearly enough, but that is all right for now. The mail had to do with his letter. That will do for explanation, I believe.门，她在发了电报之后出来的门。钱与担忧布兰琪的家人，以及它们怎么处理布兰琪的遗产有关。史宾塞是一个未来的发展。在布兰琪之死的黑色纽扣——她穿的洋装。坟墓的意思很明显。其他印象也适用于同样的状况——城市巴尔的摩。鲁柏非常确定而没有阻挡任何她不让我清楚对焦的事情，但目前那都不要紧。邮件与她的信有关。我相信，这样解释应该够了。
("Yes.")(“是的。”)
You, may end the session or continue as you prefer.你，你想要结束或是继续这一节都可以。
("Well, I guess we’ll end it then.” )(“嗯 ，那我想我们结束吧。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both, and my assurances to Ruburt that he is indeed out of the black woods.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福，而且我向鲁柏保证，他确实已经走出黑森林了。
("Goodnight, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:10. We may or may not make an attempt to check the data with Ann Healy. It may be quite legitimate.(10:10结束。我们可能会也可能不会找安·希丽来核对这份资料。它可能相当符合事实。
(Jane said she cannot remember Ann's house, except that she recalls it as quite old. But she doesn't know whether it is of brick or wood, for instance; she last saw it about 1952. She has a feeling the house is dark—dark woodwork, etc. She cannot remember the door.(珍说她想不起安的房子，只记得房子很老了。但是她不知道，比方说，它是砖房或木屋；她最后一次见到它大约是在1952年。她有一种感觉是房子是深色的——深色的木作等等。她想不起门的样子。
(Jane said the house is in Baltimore, in an old highly built-up area, though not in the actual downtown city area.(珍说房子在巴尔的摩，在一个建筑密集的旧城区，但不是在真正的城中区。
(Handwritten: Note: The next day, February 7, I received $20.00from M. Spaziani. See page 273. Marian Spaziani’s husband Jimmy is our landlord.)(手写：注释：隔天，2月7日，我收到玛丽安·史帕日尼寄来的29元美金。玛丽安的丈夫吉米是我们的房东。)

SESSION 318 第318节 珍的症状与其母亲的关系


FEBRUARY 8, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年2月8日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, there is a point, quite important, that Ruburt will not consciously as yet accept, and that is the influence of telepathic and clairvoyant data. This does affect the personality.现在，有一点，很重要，是鲁柏在意识上还不会接受的，而且那是心电感应和千里眼资料的影响。这确实会影响人格。
He responds to the totality of stimuli that reaches him, regardless of the way in which any given stimuli is received. Quite adequate protection here can be given if he gives the daily suggestion that he will only react to constructive suggestions.他对于触及到他的全部刺激起反应，不管是用什么方式接收任何既定的刺激。这里有相当足够的保证可以给，如果他每天暗示他只对建设性的暗示起反应的话。
Some symptoms are indeed caused by telepathic knowledge. He reacts to it as he reacts to other information. Personal associations are generated, and so forth. The affair with Muriel was known to him, though again he is not consciously convinced. (Muriel is the daughter of Marian and Jimmy.)有些症状确实是心电感应引起的。他对它的反应如同它对其他讯息的反应一样。个人的联想因此产生，诸如此类。与穆瑞克(Muriel)有关的事件为他所知，但同样的，他在意识上并不相信。(穆瑞儿是玛丽安和吉米的女儿)
Now, here is a certain connection that he well knows. Marian Spaziani has some, though slight, trouble with arthritis and it was her daughter who became ill mentally. Marian did not approve of her daughter's companions. And Ruburt's mother did not approve of his.现在，这里有一个他明知就里的某种关联。玛丽安·史帕日尼在关节炎方面遭遇到一点麻烦，但是不严重，出状况的是她这个在心理上生病的女儿。玛丽安不认同她女儿的朋友们。而鲁柏的母亲也不认同他的朋友。
Muriel left college without completing it and in disfavor, and so did Ruburt. The similarities alone made it easy for Ruburt to be sensitized on Muriel's behalf and to clairvoyantly observe the illness. All of this added to the previous negative associations, and reinforced the existing symptoms, except that the identification was with the mother. Ruburt must understand that his abilities do include such clairvoyantly received data. The suggestion above should be given daily and as a matter of course.穆瑞儿没有念完大学就辍学而失宠，鲁柏也是。光是这些相似之处就让鲁柏很容易代表穆瑞儿变得敏感，而透过千里眼观察这个疾病。这一切添加在之前的负面联想上，强化了现有的症状，除了认同的对象是母亲以外。鲁柏必须了解他的能力的确包含这种透过千里眼接收到的资料在内。上述的暗示应该要每天当作例行公事进行。
He will automatically react to such information whether or not he consciously admits that he receives it. Ignorance is no excuse, for I have told him. The whole psychic development can and should, and was meant, to provide exactly what was needed, and its timing was no accident.他会自动对这样的讯息起反应，无论他在意识上承不承认接收到它都一样。无知不是借口，因为我告诉过他了。整体的心灵发展可以也应该，而且是必定，有什么需要就会正好提供什么，而且它出现的时机绝非意外。
It provides for the deepest spontaneous expression of the subconscious, gives the ego a directive and sense of purpose, and develops the overall abilities of the personality, which in the past were completely denied, for lack of training and out of fear. The poetry was always a part of the psychic nature.它之所以提供，是为了潜意识最深的自发表达，给自我一个指引和目的感，以及发展人格全部的能力，这在过去是被全盘否定的，因为缺少训练又心怀恐惧之故。诗一直都是通灵本质的一部分。
The poetry allows for fullest possible creative expression in the full meaning of the word, art. It also siphons off, expresses and uses subconscious desires and Moods and repressions, thus freeing the channels of the personal subconscious so that those deeper areas can find expression in psychic work.诗让可能的创造性表达能够以文字、艺术最完整的意义得到最充分的展现。它也抽取、表达和利用潜意识的欲望、情绪和压抑，因此解放个人潜意识的通道，这样一来，那些更深的区域就能够在通灵工作中找到表达之道。
In his case, the two go together and serve each other. The poetic creation, itself art, also serves to free the personal subconscious and to transform personal material into art. The subconscious is thus uncluttered because of the poetic expression, and this helps to make the psychic work possible.在他的案例中，两者互相协调而且相辅相成。诗的创作本身是艺术，也具有解放个人潜意识以及把个人资料转化为艺术的作用。潜意识因为诗的表达而不凌乱，这有助于促成通灵工作。
The psychic experiences are then used as poetic subjects, and this cycle of creativity is always enriched as the whole personality continually develops itself and grows. Any undue tampering disrupts this function. The personality could not approach its own promise until the poetic nature led to the psychic development. When this occurred, some personality adjustments were required. The ego felt threatened in direct proportion to the strength of the newly felt abilities, and performed a huge trick.通灵经验于是被用来当作诗的主题，随着整体人格持续发展它自己和成长，这整个创造过程一直被强化。任何过度的干扰都会破坏这个功能。在诗的本质导向通灵发展之前，人格无法实现它自己的承诺。当这种情况发生时，人格就必须作一些调整。自我感受到威胁的程度，与刚感觉到的能力强度直接成正比，因而耍了一个大花招。
This trick was this: it pretended to accept the psychic nature as part of itself and began a campaign ostensibly aimed at living up to its image, of adapting it. But it purposefully distorted the idea image so grotesquely that it knew it could not be maintained. It would get its own way by pretending to give in. Psychics were saintly, dignified, quiet, restrained. They were, it said, everything that Ruburt was not. Therefore, Ruburt must be changed. It knew the change would be disastrous and in fact, impossible.这花招就是：它假装接受通灵本质是它自己的一部分，而开始了表面上以符合其形象标准为目标的活动，来调整它。但是自我故意扭曲意念形象到荒腔走板的地步，以至于它知道它是无法维持的。自我借由假装退让为所欲为。通灵者是圣洁、庄严、安静、克制的。它说，只要鲁柏没有的，他们都有。因此，一定要改变鲁柏。它知道改变的后果是灾难，而且事实上，根本不可能。
To some extent this was indeed a spiteful reaction, but do not forget it had been a good protector in the past, developed during Ruburt's years with his mother into a strong armor. It called itself the writer, if it had any name. The writer protected Ruburt against frightening experiences. This experience frightened it and it reacted.在某种程度上，这的确是一种怀恨在心的反应，但不要忘记过去它一直是个很好的保护者，在鲁柏与他的生活在一起的那些年发展成一个强大的盔甲。它称它自己是作家，如果它有名字的话。这个作家保护鲁柏免于令人害怕的经验。这个经验吓到它了，它起了反应。
In Ruburt's years with Zeh, there was severe splitting of the personality. It is not a new thing with him to push aside the subconscious at all. In all cases when he does, an explosion of one kind occurs. His subconscious intuitive self, you see, is extremely vital, alive, and unusually insistent for expression, even for the subconscious which is known for this.在鲁柏与泽(Zeh)共度的岁月里，人格有过严重的分裂。对他来说，把潜意识推开根本不是新鲜事。在他这么做的所有情况中，某一种爆炸发生了。他潜意识直觉的自己，你看，是极度有生命力、活生生的，而且对于表达，甚至对于以此闻名的潜意识，都有着非比寻常的坚持。
His ego however is also very strong. His mother taught him to be extremely fearful of his subconscious, and the rigid ego became a protection from it and her. As he grew older he thought of the ego as a balancing agent against an inner spontaneous self that always, it seemed, got him into trouble. Now I would like to continue here, but I imagine your hands are tired.然而，他的自我也非常强大。他的母亲把他教成一个极度害怕潜意识的人，他僵化的自我变成抗拒潜意识和她的一种保护。随着他的长大，他认为自我是平衡内在一个自发自己的媒介，那个自己似乎老是给他惹麻烦。现在这里我想要继续，但我想像你的手酸了。
("No. Go ahead." Walter Zeh was Jane's first husband.)(“不酸。继续讲。”华特·泽[Walter Zeh]是珍的第一任丈夫。)
Then, the strong conflict between the ego and subconscious was the result of home environment. He allowed himself no spontaneous expression at home with his mother. This denied, his normal spontaneity exploded when it was allowed opportunity, sometimes in unfortunate circumstances. In panic, the ego then tripled its defenses. He was not capable of loving Zeh or anyone, later. They both knew this and counted upon it. With Zeh, again, Ruburt denied the spontaneous self in normal daily interaction with him; with Zeh. And this denied spontaneous self exploded when and where it could.然后，自我与潜意识之间的最终冲突是家庭环境造成的结果。他不允许自己在家与母亲相处时有任何自发的表达。这被否定了，他正常的自发一有机会就爆炸了，有时候是在令人遗憾的状况下。在恐慌中，自我于是把它的防卫增强到三倍。后来，他没有能力爱泽或任何人。他们两人都知道这一点也指望着它。对泽，同样的，鲁柏在每天与泽的正常互动中也否定自发的自己。而这个被否定的自发自己只要遇到天时地利就会爆炸。
Usually this occurred when alcohol relaxed the ego, and the results would then make the ego tighten its control. When Ruburt becomes leery or afraid to allow himself the normal amount of social drinking, this is a symptom, telling you that the subconscious is being too tightly held. The ego fears any weakening, for it feels the pressure of the subconscious demand for expression. You may now take your break. I will try to finish this, this evening, for it will be invaluable.通常这都发生在酒精放松自我的时候，然后造成的结果又让自我加重掌控。当鲁柏有了戒心，或在社交时不敢允许他自己正常适量饮酒，这就是一个症状，告诉你潜意识被过度束缚了。任何削弱，自我都怕，因为它感受到潜意识要求表达的压力。你现在可以休息一下了。我会设法讲完这个资料，今天晚上，因为它具有无法估量的价值。
(9:43. Jane was aware of what she was saying; she called it a devastating psychological analysis and intuitively felt that is was correct.(9:43。珍对她在说什么有觉知；她称之为一场令人震撼的心理分析，而且直觉这是正确的。
(10 PM. Session resumed.)(10点整。继续上课。)
Now give us a moment.现在等我们一下。
(Pause.) The psychic work offers the personality a perfect method for development and unification. The hands and feet are part of the mother identification and are also important in another connection. Ruburt blames himself for running from difficulties in the past. This way he cannot run, you see, symbolically. He is forcing himself to face his difficulties, but thus far his hands are tied, you see.(停顿)通灵工作提供人格一个发展合一的完美方法。双手和双脚是他认同母亲这个心理的一部分。而且在另一个连结中也很重要。为了过去的逃避问题，鲁柏责怪他自己。这样他就跑不了，你看，就象征意义来说。他正强迫他自己面对困难，但是到目前为止，他的双手并未松绑，你看。
The hand development came last when the personality realized that the problems were not being solved, and that symbolically, his hands were tied. He was left in a dilemma. Having decided not to run, yet finding he was not getting anywhere either. The answer, symbolically, is that movement can be toward, and not away from.手的发展到最后，当人格明白问题并没有解决，而且就象征意义而言，他的双手并没有松绑。他陷入一个两难困境里。决定不要跑，却发现他任何地方都去不了。就象征意义来说，解答是可以往前进，而不是跑开。
Movement can be freely in new directions, and movement does not necessarily imply a running away from. Ruburt, you cannot deny motion simply because motion can sometimes be used to flee from problems. You must allow yourself free motion.前进可以是自由地朝着新的方向走，而且行动不一定含有跑开之意。鲁柏，你不能只因为行动有时候可能被用来逃离问题，就否认行动。你必须允许你自己自由行动。
The conflict between the ego and subconscious, as given, was symbolically expressed in the tying of the hand symptoms. He was tied in knots, hence the swollen joints. There is a line from a poem of his, written years ago, in a period of stress, “ If I can't move one finger, how can the whole soul rise?" from his dance floor poem.自我与潜意识之间的冲突，正如之前说的，以象征的方式表达在手部症状这种捆绑中。他被打了结，因此关节肿胀。多年前，在一段压力很大的时期，他写的一首诗里有一句话：“我连一根手指都动不了，整个灵魂如何能够提升？”出自他的舞池之诗。
Understanding of these conflicts will go a long way to ease the symptoms. The stiff neck, when it occurs—the neck quite literally expresses the rigidity of attitude. It is easier for him to withdraw than it appears. In this case, however, the subconscious recognized the danger and symbolically expressed through the organism, the ego's intent. The symptoms therefore were therapeutic in nature, in that their purpose was the solving of the dilemma.了解这些冲突对于缓解症状将会大有帮助。颈部僵硬，当它发生时，颈部相当如实地表达态度的僵化。退缩对他而言比表面看来更容易。不过，在这个情况下，潜意识认出危险，而以象征的方式透过有机体表达出自我的意图。因此症状在本质上具有疗愈作用，因为它们的目的是化解这个两难困境。
There is very little danger that Ruburt's ego would be suppressed. Even in psychic work, though generally speaking, of course, the connotations frighten the ego. The danger is that the subconscious be suppressed, and this is the only real time that Ruburt runs into difficulty.鲁柏的自我会受到压制，但危险非常小。甚至在通灵工作中，当然是就一般而言，但是言外之意都会吓到自我。危险的是潜意识受到压制，而这才真的是鲁柏遇到困难的时候。
Now. A strong part of the ego identity is based upon the continuity of creative achievement, which springs from the subconscious. If this were severely tampered with, the ego itself would suffer. Now give us a moment on the clairvoyant question. If the suggestion is given daily as I told you, there will be no great difficulty in any case. There is at present no outstanding clairvoyant data that is affecting his symptoms or causing any new symptoms, outside of those given.现在：自我本体的一个强大部分是奠基在连续不断的创造成就上，而潜意识是泉源。如果这受到严重的干扰，自我它自己反而会受苦。关于千里眼的问题，现在等我们一下。如果每天照我说的给自己暗示，那么在任何情况下都不会出什么大问题。目前没有任何显著的千里眼资料正在影响他的症状或引发任何新的症状，除了之前说过的那些以外。
There is always some clairvoyant material to which he is reacting, generally speaking, even as you do. There is a man it seems, somehow three times removed, but not related with any symptoms on Ruburt’s part. Proper suggestions should indeed be given before bed, along with the request for further therapeutic dreams and dreams that will give insight.一般来说，他正在作出反应的一些千里眼资料所在多有，甚至你也是。好像有一个男人，不知怎地是个隔了三层的远亲，但是与鲁柏身上的任何症状没有关联。确实应该在睡前给自己适当的暗示，同时要求自己做更深一层的疗愈梦以及会提供洞见的梦。
He reacts favorably to the color green as I told him. It has a healing quality for him. The cod-liver oil should not be renewed, although he was told it is a protection against arthritis; the word itself operates with each dose in a negative way.就像我告诉他的那样，他对绿色反应良好。它对他具有一种疗愈的特性。不应该补充鳕鱼肝油，虽然有人跟他说它可以预防关节炎；每次服用，这个字词本身就会以负面的方式运作一次。
Your parryings and excursions elsewhere in particular are beneficial now. I suggest possibly that you have an evening out during the weekend. The early morning symptoms in general mimic his mother’s situation.你们在其他地方的派对和出游现在是有益的。我可能建议你们周末期间找个晚上出去玩。清晨的症状通常是模仿他母亲的情况。
("Do you want to say something about Jane's dream?")(“你想要说说珍的梦吗？”)
Give us a moment here also.这里也等我们一下。
(Pause; eyes closed.)(停顿；眼睛闭着)
For several reasons I would prefer to discuss the dream at our next session. Part of it was clairvoyant however, and part was highly distorted. Do you have any more questions?基于几个理由，我比较想要在我们的下一节讨论这个梦。不过它有一部分是千里眼，也有一部分是严重的扭曲。你还有没有问题？
("No.")(“没有。”)
You see, as Ruburt allows himself spontaneity, again, the mother identification will automatically vanish, and with it the symptoms it causes. My best wishes to you both and I shall look in on you now and then. The constructive suggestions before bed are particularly important, and the request for therapeutic dreams, as these automatically relieve the morning symptoms, and further dissipate the lingering mother identification.你看，随着鲁柏允许它自己自发，再一次，他对母亲的认同将会自动消失，它引发的症状也会解除。给你们两位我最好的祝福，而且我时不时会来照看你们一下。睡前给自己建设性的暗示特别重要，并且要求自己做疗愈梦，因为这些会自动缓解早晨的症状，进一步驱散他对母亲挥之不去的认同。
The small lamp in the bedroom, incidentally, added to his disinclination to sleep there. The pink nightgown should be lain away with the sweaters for now. In fact it should probably be disposed of, because of the bedroom connotation.顺便说一下，卧室里的一盏小台灯让他更不愿意在那里睡觉。粉红色的睡袍应该暂时不要和毛衣摆放在一起。事实上，可能应该把它扔了，因为卧室隐含的暗示之意。
(Pause.)(停顿)
I would suggest that for any trip to New York you do not stay entirely at Ruburt’s aunt's, you see, though this in many ways may be convenient. And now, good evening.我会建议你们去纽约的任何一趟旅行都不要全程待在鲁柏的姨妈家，你知道，虽然这样做在很多方面可能很方便。那好吧，晚安。
("Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End session 10:31.)(10:30本节结束。)
(Section of linen canvas practically identical with that used as object in the 84th envelope experiment in the 319th session for February 13,1967.)一截亚麻帆布，它实际上与1967年2月13日第319节第84次信封实验用作标的物的那一块一模一样

SESSION 319 第319节 全我是海洋 自我是最上面的浪 信封84


FEBRUARY 13, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年2月13日 星期一 晚上9点
(See page 279for an approximation of the envelope object.)(近似信封标的物的布料见第279节。)
Now. Good evening.现在。晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.")(“晚安，赛斯。”)
If you compare the whole sell with an ocean, then the topmost wave at any given time would represent the ego. It is not by or of itself a separate thing, but part of the whole, forever changing, to return to the whole and be tumbled under and emerge again in new form.如果你把全我比喻成一座海洋，那么在任何既定时间，最上面的浪代表的就是自我。它自己本身并不是一个分开的东西，而是整体的一部分，永远在变化中，回归整体并且跌落其下，再一次以新的形式出现。
When it attempts to hold the upper position indefinitely, there is frozen motion and built-up pressures, but there will be the inevitable tumbling under. For the tumbling under is the motion that forms the ego itself, and without it the ego would be meaningless.当它试图无限期地维持上位时，就会有冻结的动作与累积的压力，却不可避免跌落其中。因为跌落其下就是形成自我本身的动作，没有它，自我就毫无意义了。
Various portions of the self therefore face physical reality at any given time as the ego. The process is constant. An attempt to maintain the status quo is of course natural on the part of the ego, but when this becomes a stubborn effort to maintain dominancy then the difficulties arise. The self throws up those portions of itself that it considers most able to handle the changing physical environment at any given time.因此自己的各个部分在任何既定时间和自我一样面对物质实相。这个过程持续不断。企图维持现况的行动就自我而言当然是自然而然的事，但是当这变成顽固的努力，非要维持支配地位时，困难就会产生了。自己抛出本身那些它认为在任何既定时间最有能力应付变动物质环境的部分。
The characteristics of the ego therefore change as various situations are met. The term ego, implying one phenomena, is therefore confusing. What was ego today may belong to the subconscious tomorrow. Any attempt at rigidity is therefore defeating.自我的特质因此随着遇到的各种不同情况而改变。自我这个词含有一种现象之意，因此令人困惑。自我今日所是，到了明天可能就属于潜意识。所以任何食古不化的企图都会败下阵来。
Now to some extant Ruburts ego wanted to stay where it was also: hence, comparatively speaking, the frozen motion.现在鲁柏的自我某种程度上也想要原地不动；因此，相对来说是，冻结的动作。
It attempted to stop other portions of the personality from entering into the ego framework. This ego that so behaved was then simply a group of particular qualities belonging to Ruburt, that were given control for a while to meet particular circumstances, and then stubbornly refused to return to the whole personality.它试图阻止人格的其他部分进入自我架构里。这个如此行事的自我当时只不过是属于鲁柏的某一堆特质而已，为了应付特定状况，它被授权掌控一阵子，但后来却顽固抗拒，不肯回到整体人格之中。
There had been a tendency, as given, for a rigid personality ego framework in any case. The qualities thrown up to the surface were those in the past most capable to handle highly difficult situations, and in some of these stubbornness was, comparatively speaking, a virtue.之前说过，在任何情况下，一个僵化的人格自我有着一种倾向，被抛到表面上来的是过去那些最有能力处理高难度状况的特质，而且相对来说，在这些顽固当中有些是优点。
The situations had changed but the ego framework had grown rigid, rigid enough so that it could in a large degree dominate certain normally subconscious processes, bringing forth the physical symptoms. Now there is always an imprinting process within the personality, belonging to past experience. A previous inclination to gluttony had once led him to some slight gout, and in the present case there was a swelling of the feet.情况变了但自我架构却越发僵化，僵化到它在很大程度上能够支配某些正常潜意识的过程，产生身体症状。现在，在人格之内一直都有一个铭印的过程，属于过去的经验。以前的暴食倾向曾经导致他患有某种轻微的痛风，而在目前的情况中是脚肿。
There had been in the past overweight, and in this instance there was in some portions of the body an overextension of tissue about the joints. The morning symptoms incidentally have to do with this life however, bringing back earlier fears of facing the day, you see.过去曾经过重，而在这个例子当中，身体的一些部位有关节周边组织伸展过度的问题。不过，附带一提，早晨的症状与这一世有关，带回了以前面对一天的恐惧，你知道。
Give us a moment here. (Pause,) To some extent the symptoms did represent caution. He did not want to move until he was sure of his direction once more. It was the stubborn ego in this case that prevented him from seeing clearly the direction which had been given by other portions of the self.这里等我们一下。(停顿)某种程度上，症状的确代表警戒。他不想动，直到他再度确定他的方向。在这个案例中，是顽固的自我阻止他看清楚自己的其他部分已经提供的方向。
The knees, incidentally, I can help him here: in Saint Vincent’s punishment took the form of having the child kneel straight upward, and doing so Ruburt's knees often became sore. The knee symptoms were a later development in this present series of symptoms, his way of punishing himself for his previous lack of understanding. This knowledge should greatly relieve the symptoms.膝盖，顺便一提，这里我可以帮他；在圣文森(Saint Vincent)的处罚中，采取让小孩挺身跪下的形式，鲁柏的膝盖因为这么做而经常酸痛。膝盖的症状在当下这一连串症状中是比较晚发展出来的一个，是他为了之前缺乏了解而惩罚自己的方式。这个知识应该会大大地缓解症状。
The stability of the whole self is dependent upon the mobility of each portion of the self. When the physical system is in good operating order, then the various portions of the self are operating properly. The fault will not always lie with the conscious or subconscious, however, but in other layers.全我的稳定仰赖自己每一步的活动自如。当身体系统运作顺畅的时候，那么自己的各个部分也是在正常运作中。不过，毛病不会老是出在意识或潜意识，而是在其他层面。
Previous ego patterns can still operate under various circumstances. Ruburt was often a male, and he sometimes attempts to manhandle the feminine aspects of his present personality, to inflict upon it literally qualities that go against its grain. Force, logic over intuition, for example, or intellect over psychic awareness . The psychic abilities in his case are, among other things, aided by that balance of characteristics, and these should not be tampered with.以前的自我模式还是能够在各种不同的状况下运作。鲁柏经常是男性，而且他有时候会试图粗暴对待他当前人格的女性面向，实际上是把违反常态的特质强加在它身上。暴力、逻辑胜过直觉，比方说，或是理智胜过通灵觉知。在他的案例中，除了别的以外，通灵能力得助于那种人格特质的平衡，而且这些特质不应该被胡乱窜改。
You can take a break and I shall continue.你可以休息一下，我再继续。
(9:28—9:35. Jane attended Saint Vincent’s, a Catholic school)(9:28——9:35。珍在圣文森读过书，那是一所天主教学校。)
You see, for years Ruburt hid himself from his mother, and as stated earlier he felt that in giving her his book he had opened himself to her. For years he would not wear anything that had been close to her. Then he shoved this feeling away and would not face it.你看，鲁柏躲着他的母亲很多年，而且如上所述，以前他感觉在拿他的书给她的举动中，他对她敞开自己。多年来他不穿戴任何接近过她的衣物。然后他把这种感觉推开，不愿面对它。
Egotistically he forced other aspects of his personality to accept what they feared. In times of high vitality the effects were minor. After the book's publication however the effects multiplied. A message to this effect was given him in a dream, and he ignored it.以自我为中心，他强迫人格的其他面向接受它们恐惧的东西。在生命力高昂的时候，影响不大。然而在书出版以后，影响倍增。在一个梦中给过他一个大意是这样的讯息，但他不予理会。
You see however he felt that he was learning maturity by ignoring the subconscious. This is at the base of these problems. He mistrusted the most reliable portion of his present personality. He automatically rejected the sweaters as giving warmth on a subconscious basis. Even then, however, the subconscious would not be forced too far, and a good deal of the time the sweaters sat in his drawer. They were not his style, they were his mother's style and in wearing them he felt further alarm that he was being cast in her world, so to speak.不过你知道，他觉得他是借由忽视潜意识来学习成熟。这是这些问题的基础。他不相信他当前人格最可靠的部分。他在潜意识中自动排斥毛衣的保暖作用。可是，就算这样，潜意识也不会被迫离得太远，很长时间毛衣都放在他的抽屉里。它们不是他的风格，它们是他母亲的风格，穿着它们的时候，他更加警觉到他被丢在她的世界里，可以这么说。
Only the last one was simple. His letters of thanks protested too much. He wore the sweater night and day in a frenzied attempt to prove that it I had no harmful effects upon him. From the subconscious standpoint this was simply too much.只有最后一件是简单的。他的感谢信太多抱怨。他从早到晚穿着毛衣，疯狂地试图证明它一点都伤害不了他。从潜意识的观点看来，这根本太过火了。
At various times when working he went without a bra because his shoulders bothered him, and he wore one of his mother’s sweaters. Now his mother never wore a bra, you see. The thin shoulders he imagines he has are a part of mother identification.在不同的时候，他工作中不穿胸罩，因为他的肩膀让他不舒服，他穿了一件他母亲的毛衣。现在，他的母亲从来不穿胸罩，你看。他想像他有着单薄的肩膀，其中一部分是对母亲的认同。
Now do you have an envelope for me?现在你有没有信封要给我？
("Yes."(“有。”
(At 9:47, Jane took the envelope double for the 84th experiment from me, her eyes closed, and held it to her forehead in a horizontal position.)(9:47，珍从我这里拿了第84次实验的信封，双眼闭着，把横向的信封放在她的额头上。)
Give us a moment please. These are impressions.请等我们一下。这些是印象。
Sturdy. Stubble. (Jane repeated this word at my request) or stumble. Five words. Small squares, perhaps three of these. And a connection with, I believe, the same number of large colored squares or rectangles. Rather brilliant. The color red among others, and yellow.坚固的。胡渣(珍在我的要求下重复说了这个词)或绊倒。5个字。小正方形，也许有三个这种正方形。而且我相信也和同样数量的彩色大正方形或长方形有关联。相当鲜艳。除了其他颜色之外还有红色，以及黄色。
Connection with an old car. An old date, 18 or 1932. A view of water.与一车老四有关联。一个过去的日期，18或1932。水景。
A miscellaneous list or group of names or designations. A string of numbers. A window, or indication of an open viewpoint, or station from which activities may be viewed. A high window or exalted viewpoint.一列或一堆各式各样的名字或称号。一串数字。一扇窗户，或是一个开阔视角的征象，又或是可能会看见活动的站台。一扇高窗或居高临下的视角。
A letter. Something picked at random, as from a grab bag, you see. A gasoline connection.一封信。某个随机挑拣的东西，就像从一个模彩袋拿出一样，你知道。与汽油有关联。
Connection with a fabric that somehow seems glued on. Something glued on something, perhaps paper.与一种上面不知为何有胶水的面料有关联。某个东西用胶水黏在某个东西上面，也许是纸张。
1937 and 1961 connection.与1957和1961有关联。
A platitude and two people, one distant and one near. A connection with Chicago, distant. Two lines and four boxes. A mischief. A design on rectangle. Your initials connected here.一个陈腔滥调和两个人，一远一近。与芝加哥有遥远的关联。两条线和四个方格。一件不对劲的事。长方形上面的一个设计。这里与你的姓名缩写有关联。
Do you have questions?你有没有问题？
("The only one would be to name the object as best you can.” )(“只有一个，是请你尽你所能说出标的物的名称。”)
Rectangular, having it seems some connection with metal or an automobile. Some dates and numbers, like an application. With holes in it, or torn.长方形，似乎与金属或一辆汽车有某种关联。一些日期和数字，像一份申请书。里面有洞，或是破了。
Something on both sides, and connection with an erratic behavior. Perhaps with a key. also.两侧有东西，而且和一个古怪的行为有关联。或许也和一把钥匙有关联。
You may take your break if you have no other questions.如果你没有其他问题，你可以休息一下。
(Break at 10:00. Jane said she felt as though the experiment had been a failure. She had no images. Actually she scored some excellent points.(10点整休息。珍说她感觉就像实验失败了一样。她没有任何画面。实际上她说中了一些非常棒的要点。
(See page 279for a copy of the object. As usual I placed it between two pieces of cardboard, then sealed it in two envelopes. Jane's eyes remained closed as she gave the data. The object is a strip from a piece of linen canvas which I bought a few weeks ago at the Art Shop, in Elmira. Details on this will be given as the data is interpreted. Seth doesn't discuss the data, and we made our own connections.(见前面的标的物副本。一如往常，我把它放在两片厚纸板中间，然后密封在两个信封内。珍在给这份资料时，双眼一直闭着。标的物是从一块亚麻帆布取下的一片布条，几周前我在埃尔迈拉的艺术商店买了那块布。这上面的细节会在解读资料时加以说明。赛斯没有讨论这份资料，我们自己找出关联。
("Sturdy.” Yes. The linen artist's canvas is very strong and sturdy, the best kind to use for paintings, and I bought it with this purpose in mind.(“坚固的。”是的。亚麻画用帆布是非常强韧又坚固的，用来作画最好的一种，我买它的时候，心里就是带着这个目的。
("Stubble, or stumble.” Here we think Jane was trying to get across the idea of stubble meaning texture, which the canvas of course possesses. This woven texture was another reason for my buying canvas, rather than smooth boards for instance, such as Masonite.(“胡渣[stubble]或绊倒[stumble]。”这里我们认为珍设法说明胡渣这个意味着质地的概念，帆布当然有这样的质地。这种纺织的质地是我之所以买帆布的另一个原因，而不是比方说买光滑的木板，像是纤维板之类的。
("Five words.” No connections.(“5个字。”没有任何关联。
("Small squares, perhaps three of these.” Upon examination it can be seen that the linen canvas used as object is made up of small squares of thread, especially when it is held up to the light. I believe the three data following are also related here.(“小正方形，也许有三个这种正方形。”仔细检视下，可以看到用作标的物的亚麻帆布是由线交织的小正方形组成的，尤其拿它对着灯照的时候。我相信下面的三个资料在这里也是相关的。
("And a connection with, I believe, the same number of large colored squares or rectangles. Rather brilliant. The color red among others, and yellow." It seems here that Jane referred to the purpose for which I bought the canvas—to paint on.
