Some of my recent work has been in the abstract vein, also, and incorporates squares, angles, etc., some of them in brilliant primary colors. Actually I have not painted any pictures on the specific batch of linen which furnished tonight's envelope object; but I have painted on other canvas of a comparable texture, etc., and which was prepared in the same manner. Association thus could be at work. There could be other connections also.(“而且我相信也和同样数量的彩色大正方形或长方形有关联。相当鲜艳。除了其他颜色之外还有红色，以及黄色。”这里看来好像珍指的是我买帆布的目的——在上面作画。此外，我最近的一些作品具有抽象的特征，纳入了正方形、角度等等，其中一些是鲜艳的原色。实际上我并没有在今晚用做信封物件的特定这一匹亚麻布上面任何图像；但是在其他质地可与之相比的帆布上，我有画，而且准备方式是一样的。因此联想可能在此产生作用。也可能有其他的关联。
("Connection with an old car.” Jane feels this refers to a young man, Tom, who works at the Art Shop where I bought the canvas which furnished the object. Jane often runs errands there for me, and Tom, a frame maker, often waits on her. Tom has an old sports car, and not long after I had bought the canvas, he described the car to Jane on one of her visits there, detailing his troubles with it, etc.(“与一车老四有关联。”珍感觉这是指一个年轻男人，汤姆，他在艺术商店工作，我在那里买了用作标的物的帆布。珍经常去那里帮我跑腿，而裱框师汤姆常常服务她。汤姆有一辆老跑车，就在我买了帆布之后不久，他在珍有一次去那里的时候描述了这辆车给她听，详述它给他带来的麻烦等等。
(This is a stronger connection than it would seem, for Tom is a friend of ours who visits us fairly often. He also paints himself. Other references to Tom crop up in the data also.(这是一个比表面上看来还要有力的连结，因为汤姆是我们的一个朋友，经常来拜访我们。他自己也作画。其他与汤姆有关的连结也在资料中冒出来。
("An old date, 18 or 1932." Possibly a reference to the old brick building which houses the Art Shop, on Elmira’s West Water Street. The location is a few blocks down street from our house address. The building is old, but probably not as old as 1832. Nor is Tom's car as old as 1932 for instance.(“一个过去的日期，18或1932。”可能是指艺术商店所在的那栋砖造老建筑，在埃尔迈拉的西华特街上。这个地点距离我们同一条街的房子位置几个街区。这栋建筑物是老屋，但可能没有到1832年那么老。比方说汤姆的车也没有到1932年那么老。
(The row of old buildings on West Water Street has been in for much discussion recently, as eyesores, etc. Many people want them torn down. Recently a group of these buildings near the Art Shop burned down in a spectacular fire.(西华特街上的一排老建筑最近有很多次出现在讨论中，像是难看等等。很多人想要拆掉它们。最近靠近艺术商店的这些建筑有一堆在一场火中烧毁。
("A view of water." Another reference to the Art Shop, and through this the object. In Elmira the Art Shop is located on West Water Street, which parallels the Chemung River through the heart of the city. The river can be seen from the back door of the Art Shop, and from the second-story workroom above where Tom makes his frames, etc. It was in this large upstairs room that Tom described his car troubles to Jane.(“水景。”另一个涉及艺术商战的资料，而且透过这个也连带指涉标的物。在埃尔迈拉，艺术商店位于西华特街，它与穿越市中心的祈梦河平行。从艺术商店的后门，还有从汤姆裱框之处上面的二楼工作间等等，可以看到河。汤姆向珍描述他的车有什么毛病的地方，就在楼上这个大房间内。
("A miscellaneous list or group of names or designations. A string of numbers." These can quite possibly refer to the pencil lists I am in the habit of making up, of materials I need at the Art Shop. I have the habit of making these lists for Jane especially with prices included. I almost always have a list when I go to the Art Shop, and so does Jane. I do not recall whether I had such a list on the day I bought the canvas which furnished tonight's object, but the chances are that I did have. Very seldom do I make a trip therefor just one object.(“一列或一堆各式各样的名字或称号。一串数字。”这些很可能是指我习惯用铅笔条列的清单，上面写着我在艺术商店需要买的材料。我有个习惯是给珍写这些清单，连价格都会写进去。每次去艺术商店，我几乎都会带一张清单，珍也是。我想不起我买今晚用作标的物的帆布那天有没有带这样的一张清单，但我很可能有带。我很少专程去那里只买一样东西。
("A window, or indication of an open viewpoint, or station from which activities may be viewed. A high window or exalted viewpoint.” This is excellent data, and refers again to the second-story workroom above the Art Shop. From this room a large plate glass window looks down on West Water Street, and Tom is in the habit of watching the busy activities on the main street below. He has often waved to Jane and me as we walked past. Jane always waves to him whenever she walks down Water Street, which is at least three times a week.(“一扇窗户，或是一个开阔视角的征象，又或是可能会看见活动的站台。一扇高窗或居高临下的视角。”这是很棒的资料，而且又是指艺术商店上面的二楼工作间。从这个房间，透过一扇平板玻璃大窗可以俯瞰西华特街，而汤姆习惯观望下面大街上车来车往的繁忙景象。在珍和我走过时，他经常向我们挥手。每当珍走在华特街上，她总是会向他挥挥手，一个星期至少三次。
(From the back window of this second-story room, a view can also be had of the river.(从这个二楼房间的后窗看出去，也可能是河景。
("A letter.” No connections.(“一封信。”没有任何关联。
("Something picked at random, as from a grab bag, you see." This could refer to the way I picked the canvas which furnished the object. On that particular visit to the Art Shop I wasn't looking for linen canvas, never having bought any there; indeed, thinking the shop didn’t stock it to begin with. I had bought other items, and was on my way out when I saw a piece of canvas tucked in a corner, quite wrinkled and obviously a remnant.(“某个随机挑拣的东西，就像从一个模彩袋拿出一样，你知道。”这可能是指我挑选用作标的物的帆布采取的方式。在那一次去艺术商店时，我并没有在找亚麻帆布，从来没有在那里买过任何一块；事实上，想的是这家店根本没有进这个货。我买了其他物件，就在我要走出去时，我看到一块帆布塞在一个角落，皱巴巴的，显然是零码布。
(I pulled it out to view. It was a piece two yards long, and the proprietor of the Art Shop sold it to me for half price; it was just what I had in mind for an experiment, as will be seen. I was very pleasantly surprised to find this canvas there, for I had thought I would have to order it from New York City.(我把它拉出来看。它是一块两码长的布，艺术商店的店主把它半价卖给我；它正是我心里想要用来实验的东西，之后就会看到。在那里找到这块帆布，我觉得非常惊喜，因为我以为我必须从纽约才订得到。
("A gasoline connection." Possibly another reference to Tom's story about his car. Cars and Tom are rather closely connected. Since his first tale to Jane we have heard subsequent stories about his car, the most recent being how he stripped several gears.(“与汽油有关联。”可能又是指汤姆讲他车的故事。车和汤姆有相当密切的连结。自从他第一次讲给珍听之后，我们随后听过他的车接着发生的故事，最近一次是他怎样扯断几次齿轮。
("Connection with a fabric that somehow seems glued on. Something glued on something, perhaps paper." This is excellent data, and very close indeed to the object. The object is trimmed from the linen canvas I bought at the Art Shop, and this piece of canvas was glued on to large sheets of Masonite so as to have a firm support—the experiment I had in mind which was referred to later.(“与一种上面不知为何有胶水的面料有关联。某个东西用胶水黏在某个东西上面，也许是纸张。”这是非常棒的资料，而且确实与标的物非常接近。标的物是从我在艺术商店买的亚麻布剪下来的，而为了强固的支撑，这块帆布被黏在大片纤维板上——稍后会提到我心里想做的那个实验。
(Jane thinks the paper reference here could refer to the object being sandwiched between the two pieces of cardboard, or Bristol, inside the double envelope; for when she opened the envelopes she at first thought the canvas was glued to one of the pieces of Bristol—probably because she had seen me working out the gluing problem in the studio in recent weeks. My experiment proved to be quite a task, but was successfully accomplished, with the use of polymer waterproof glue.(珍认为这里提到的纸张可能是指双层信封内被夹在两片硬纸板，或西卡纸之间的标的物；因为当她打开信封时，她最初以为帆布是用胶水黏在其中一片西卡纸上——可能因为最近几周她看过我在画室处理黏贴的问题。事实证明我的实验做起来很困难，但是用了聚合物防水胶，还是顺利完成了。
(The tack holes running along one edge of the object resulted from the canvas first being tacked to a sheet of board, then wet so that pre-shrinking would take place before the gluing process.(在标的物边缘的钉孔是先把帆布钉在一片板子上造成的，然后再弄湿，如此一来，用胶水黏贴的过程之前，就会发生预缩。
("1957 and 1961 connection.” No connections without Seth's help.(“与1957和1961有关联。”没有赛斯的协助，找不到任何关联。
("A platitude and two people, one distant and one near. A connection with Chicago, distant. Two lines and four boxes." Again, no connections without Seth’s help.(“一个陈腔滥调和两个人，一远一近。与芝加哥有遥远的关联。两条线和四个方格。”再一次，没有赛斯的协助，找不到任何关联。
("A design on rectangle.” The object is rectangular; it bears no design, but being canvas is meant to ultimately. A larger interpretation would be that I applied the linen canvas to large rectangular pieces of Masonite, with the idea of painting on these. I made no square panels for instance, not caring for this proportion.(“长方形上面的一个设计。”标的物是长方形；它上面没有任何设计，但是身为画布，最终一定会有设计。一个更大的解读是，我把亚麻帆布黏贴在许多片大型的长方形纤维板上，构想是在这些板子上作画。我没有制作任何——比如说——正方形的面板，因为不喜欢这种比例。
("Your initials connected here.” I was the one who personally bought the linen canvas that furnished the object, cut the canvas up, etc.(“这里与你的姓名缩写有关联。”亲自去买用作标的物的帆布、裁切帆布等等的人是我。
("A mischief." We don't know; possibly a reference to the episode in which Tom recently stripped the gears of his car, as mentioned. Quite a story is connected here.(“一件不对劲的事。”我们不知道；可能是指前文提过，汤姆最近扯断他那辆车的齿轮这件事。一个与这里有关联的精彩故事。
(Question: “The only one would be to name the object as best you can.(问题：只有一个，是请你尽你所能说出标的物的名称。
"Rectangular; having it seems some connection with metal or an automobile. Some dates and numbers, like an application.” Again, apparently a reference to Tom and his car; and through this to the Art Shop, the linen canvas, etc.(With holes in it, or torn."" Now Seth gets more specific, and again this is excellent data. See page 281 for a copy of the object. Note that the top edge is frayed, appearing to be torn; actually this results from an unraveling after cutting. The cutting took place before the preshrinking. Again, note the holes spaced along the top edge of the object. These are tack holes spaced rather close together around each piece of canvas, because the linen exerts a strong pull when wet; it had to be securely fastened to the Masonite panels, until dry."“长方形，似乎与金属或一辆汽车有某种关联。一些日期和数字，像一份申请书。”再一次，显然是指汤姆和他的车；透过这个也指涉艺术商店、亚麻帆布等等。(“里面有洞，或是破了。”此时赛斯说得更具体了，而且再一次，这是非常棒的资料。见前面标的物副本。注意上方边缘有磨损，看起来像破了；其实这是裁切之后布料散开造成的结果。裁切发生在预缩之前。再一次，注意沿着标的物边缘间隔分布的洞。这些是钉孔，沿着每一块帆布的周围分布，间隔的距离相当靠近，因为打湿的时候，亚麻的拉力很大；一定要把它牢牢固定在纤维板上直到干燥为止。
('Something on both sides," Is this a reference to the texture of the canvas showing on both sides of the object?(“两侧有东西”这是不是指标的物两侧显现的帆布质地？
("and connection with an erratic behavior. Perhaps with a key also." These may refer, again, to Tom’s episode with his car, when he stripped gears, etc. We cannot be sure without Seth's help, but this data does fit the events of that evening as described to us by Tom himself and others.(“而且和一个古怪的行为有关联。或许也和一把钥匙有关联。”这些可能是指，再一次，汤姆的车子事件，他扯断齿轮等等。没有赛斯的协助，我们无法确定，但是这个资料的确符合那天晚上汤姆本人和其他人描述给我们听的事件。
(Jane resumed in trance at 10:19.)(10:19珍在出神中继续。)
We will now indeed end our session. My heartiest wishes to you both.我们现在真的要结束我们的课了。给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。
One note here: Ruburt’s disinclination to walk outside is another instance of mother identification这里加个注：鲁柏不愿走出门外是另一个他认同母亲的例子。
There were many more instances, in terms of physical symptoms, which have now vanished, and so he is progressing.就身体症状而言，还有很多例子，那些症状现在消失了，他正在进步中。
(” Goodnight, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10:20. Jane's voice average, pace okay with pauses, eyes open at times.)(10:20结束。珍的声音普通，速度还好，偶有停顿，眼睛有时候睁开。)

SESSION 320 第320节 某些行动具有仪式感


FEBRUARY 20, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年2月20日 星期一 晚上9点
(No envelope session was held.(没有做信封实验。
(The regular session scheduled for Wednesday, February 15, was not held.)(预定在2月15日星期三的定期课没有举行。)
Now. We will begin with some relatively superficial but beneficial comments, and then continue along more deep lines.现在。我们将从一些相对肤浅但有益的评论开始说起，然后继续比较深入的探讨。
Some environmental influences of a real but not profound nature can be cleared up by the simple process of the housecleaning ritual. Disinfectants and the symbolic chase after germs—these simply serve as a symbolic but helpful aid in ridding the atmosphere of the idea of illness.借由房屋清扫仪式这个简单的过程，可以清除某些本质上真实但并不深远的环境影响力。杀菌与象征性的灭菌行为——这些只不过是在摆脱疾病这个意念的氛围时，一种象征性质但有用的辅助而已。
As one of you mentioned earlier the windows should be thrown open and the rooms thoroughly aired. Such actions simply bring to a senselevel your inner intentions, and serve to reinforce them through the physical actions involved.正如你们其中一人之前提到的，窗户应该大开，让房间彻底通风。这样的行动只不过是把你们的内在意向带到一个感觉的层面上，并透过其中涉及的身体动作来强化它们。
It would be of help along these lines for Ruburt to scrub his rug, as for him rugs have a certain significance in this respect, and particularly air the bedding. As long as you understand the reason behind these actions, you see, you will not overestimate them.沿着这些方向，刷洗地毯对鲁柏是有帮助的，因为对他来说地毯在这方面具有某些意义，尤其是晾晒寝具。只要你们了解这些行动背后的原因，你看，你们就不会高估它们。
If possible next weekend, air your clothing upon the line. Ruburt should brush his animals; all of this for its symbolic meaning, but symbolism reinforced on the Sense data level.下个周末如果可能的话，把你们的衣服晾晒在绳子上。鲁柏应该帮他的动物刷毛；这一切全都有其征象意义，但在感官资料层面上象征手法被强化了。
The ideas initiated this evening are good ones. Dinners out, and so forth. In fact, they are excellent. Both of you lean toward self denial, sometimes too acutely. Ruburt will react against this more often than you, being born under his particular birthmark.今晚一开头就讲的点子是很好的。出去吃晚餐等等。事实上，它们是绝佳的点子。你们两个都倾向于自我否定，有时候过于严重了。对此，因为他与生俱来的特质，所以鲁柏会比你更常有抗拒的反应。
If a portion of you feels it does not get treats, you see, it imagines that the whole personality does not consider it worthy of any consideration. You feel this also Joseph, though you are not as aware of it. Ruburt usually pays it no mind, believing it in the past a part of discipline to ignore the innate independent childlike desire for treats or special attention.如果一部分的你感觉自己没有得到宠爱，你知道，它就会想像整个人格都不认为它值得任何开心。约瑟，你也有这种感觉，虽然你对它不太有觉知。鲁柏对它通常不予理会，他相信，忽视得到宠爱或特别关注这种与生俱来、不受拘束、孩子似的欲望，在过去是纪律的一部分。
The plan evolved as to dinners and outings was only adopted by Ruburt as an emergency measure, but in your particular circumstances a modified version of this plan would serve as a steady and constant safety measure. If certain portions, dominating portions, of both of your personalities are willing to go without, for the sake of what you want, other portions do feel that they are being disregarded, without even token recognition.鲁柏只是把逐步形成的晚餐和出游计划，当成是紧急措施，但在你们的特定情况下，这个计划的修改版会有的效果却是，一个规律而且持续的安全措施。如果你们两个的人格当中有某些部分、主导的部分，为了得到你们想要的东西，而愿意将就，那么其他部分确实会感觉它们被忽略，甚至连标章认可(token recognition)都没有。
Now you can afford the token recognition. You cannot afford to deny them token recognition. They are not by any means over demanding elements in either of your personalities. Your weekend encounters have been an improvement here. The spirit behind the indulgence is important.现在你们给得起标章认可了。你们负担不起不给它们标章认证的代价。它们在你们任何一个的人格当中绝非要求过度的元素。你们在周末邂逅这里有改善了。放纵背后的精神很重要。
A grudging indulgence is perhaps worse than none however. At this time the plan is excellent, to offset the tight discipline that Ruburt attempted to force upon all other elements of the personality. He has been depriving it physically, in a misguided attempt to force it into the ego's idea of spirituality.可是，不情不愿的放纵也许比没有还要糟。此时，这个计划非常好，可以抵销鲁柏试图强加在人格其他所有元素上的严格纪律。他一直在肉体上剥夺它，在误导下试图迫使它符合自我的灵性观念。
He did not feed it properly. He denied it full satisfaction in your personal relationship. He tried to make it thin enough to disappear. He tried to douse his normally vital animal spirits, and now the body and the animal spirits do need some such extra attention.他没有正确喂养它。他不肯让它在你们个人的关系中完全得到满足。他设法让它变稀薄到消失。他设法浇熄他通常生气勃勃的动物本能，此时身体和动物本能确实需要一些这样的额外关注。
The reasons for this misguided activity have been given to some extent. He became determined not to pamper himself, but he never did pamper himself to any great extent. He would not buy clothes that you could afford, but wore others given to him by others, as if he did not feel he deserved his own.关于这个误导的活动，原因在某种程度上已经讲过了。他下定决定不纵容自己，但是他从来就没有大肆纵容过自己。他不会买你们买得起的衣服，而是穿别人给他的衣服，好像他觉得自己不配穿他自己的似的。
He feels, actually, an overly severe sense of responsibility to support himself, and not be as his mother was, a financial burden. At the same time however there is this determination to make his financial way through writing, and so far he has been caught between.实际上，他有一种过于沉重的责任感要养活自己，而不是像他母亲那样成为一个财力重担。但同时他也有透过写作赚钱的这个决心，所以到目前为止，他一直卡在中间。
He is willing to compromise by taking various jobs, but here there are other influences also. His grandfather strongly influenced him, and to the grandfather only a man who worked for himself was independent. Only in his last ill year did he work for others. He had his own businesses, but he barely scraped by with them you see.他愿意妥协，从事各式各样的工作，但是这里还有其他的影响。他的祖父对他的影响很大，对于祖父来说，为自己工作的人才是独立的。只有在他生病的最后一年，他才为别人工作。他有自己的事业，但几乎是勉强糊口而已，你看。
You can understand then some of the conflict here. That is one of the reasons that he seeks what you call offbeat positions, but he has made progress in this line, and should continue to do so. At one time only a freelance selling position, you see, would have been an acceptable compromise.所以这里你就可以了解一些冲突了。他之所以寻求你所谓的另类职位，这就是原因之一，但他在这方面已经有进展，应该继续这样做。本来一个可以接受的妥协，就只有自由的销售职位，你知道。
Is your hand tired?你的手累了吗？
("No.")(“不累。”)
Now. Friday, his two books came. They had not been paid for as yet, and he had lost some money earlier. On the way to work he found some sweaters he wanted. To some degree he felt guilty, wanting the sweaters when he had already lost money, and when they were obviously meant to replace the sweaters of his mother.现在。星期五，他的两本书来了。它们的稿费还没付，而且他早些时候亏了一些钱。在上班的路上，他发现了一些他想要的毛衣。在某种程度上，当他已经亏了钱的时候，以及当它们的用意显然是取代他母亲的毛衣时，想要毛衣让他有罪恶感。
He was offered a ride home and cashed his check. This deprived him of an opportunity to change his mind and buy the sweaters then. He also felt guilty because of your neck difficulties. He was angry at the route the driver took, and not able to say so. The story told by the driver upset early sexual feelings, and all of this together caused his difficulties. Later that evening the torture discussion, you see—this frightened him because his withheld anger and aggression found the talk most satisfying, and Ruburt then and there fought desperately to deny this. The symptoms begun earlier in the afternoon, then intensified.他搭便车回家并且兑现了支票。这剥夺了他改变主意，然后买下毛衣的一个机会。因为颈部的问题，他也有罪恶感。驾驶走的路线让他生气，却说不出口。驾驶讲的故事翻搅了早期在性方面的感觉，而这一切加在一起造成了他的问题。那天晚上稍后，关于酷刑的讨论，你知道——这让他害怕，因为他克制住的愤怒和攻击性非常满意这场谈话，然后鲁柏在那里拼命努力否认这一点。症状从下午早些时候开始发作，然后加剧。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:38. Jane had spoken actively, sitting down, her eyes very dark. She had smoked constantly. Resume at 9:50.)(9:38。珍说话态度活跃，坐着，眼睛很黑。她不停抽烟。9:50继续。)
Now. In Ruburt's past compulsive behavior was established at a rather early age, the ritualized activity serving as a substitute security framework.现在。在鲁柏的过去，强迫行为在他很小的时候就建立了，仪式化的活动具有替代安全架构的效果。
The impetus behind the compulsive activity was fear, and the fear was directed against the mother. The compulsive behavior was also intermixed with religious connotations, the crucifix and rosary being part of the objects used at times. The desire to move furniture at times represents an attempt to break highly ritualized behavior on his part, and is constructive. When it becomes frantic of course it is a sign that the technique is not working.强迫活动背后的推动力是恐惧，而且是针对母亲的恐惧。强迫行为也和宗教意涵混杂在一起，十字架和念珠属于偶尔使用的物品。有时候需要移动家具的欲望代表一种打破高度仪式化行为的尝试，而且具有建设性。当它变得疯狂时，当然，那它就是这个技法不管用的一个征兆。
The compulsive behavior gave him a safe circle in which to operate, but it was a small circle. It was meant to keep harmful influences out, but it was also meant to keep harmful influences in.强迫性行为给了他在其中运作的一个安全圈，但这是一个小圈子。它本来是要把有害的影响挡在外面，但同时也在把有害的影响留在里面。
He often projected these onto his mother, so that she became the symbol of all evil, at various times in any case. This regardless of the harmful qualities of her own nature, the mother's.他经常把这些投射在他的母亲身上，如此一来，她就变成所有邪恶的象征，在各种不同的时候，在任何情况下都是。这与他母亲自己本性里的有害特质没有关系。
Now, he tried to block off subconscious feelings concerning his mother because he could not afford, he felt, to react to them, and there was little avenue for expression of his aggressive feelings toward her. She knew this and mocked him, daring him to kill her physical.现在，他试着阻挡潜意识里对母亲的感觉，因为他觉得自己承受了他对它们的反应，所以几乎没有什么途径能够表达他对她的攻击性情感。她知道这一点并且嘲笑他，扬言要在肉体上杀死她。
The urge between the child's desire to do so, the basically kind nature, and the inability to carry out any such actions in any case, led to an over guarding ego. The ego did not appear rigid, for the inner seethings made it impossible, and spontaneity constantly erupted, but in ways the whole personality felt were the least dangerous.在孩子想要这样做的欲望——基本上这个欲望的本质是善良的——以及在任何情况下都无法实行任何这类行动的无能为力之间，迫切感导致自我过度警惕。自我看起来并不死板，因为内在的沸腾，所以这不可能僵化，于是自发性不断爆发，但采用的却是让整个人格感觉最不危险的方式。
Any spontaneity became suspect however, except artistic spontaneity. For various reasons, not necessary in this discussion, the tendency was carried over with Ruburt's first husband. At the same time through adolescence the quality of the ego had not sufficiently shown its true character as yet. The spontaneity did erupt in constant nervous behavior, and erratic behavior. He was constantly told to slow down, to use discipline, and this reinforced the fear that what he was, was fearful, powerful, evil, and best hidden.然而，除了艺术上的自发，任何自发都变得可疑。原因各式各样，在这个讨论里没有必要谈，这个倾向延续到鲁柏的第一任丈夫身上。同时在整个青春期，自我都还没有充分展现出它的真实面目。自发性确实在持续不断的紧张行为以及喜怒无常的行为中爆发了。旁人一直告诉他放慢脚步、要有纪律，而这加深了他害怕他所是，是可怕的、是强大的、是邪恶的恐惧，所以最好藏起来。
The spontaneous self when it did escape, you see, managed to do so only under circumstances where the explosive impulses shattered their way through. In the years between there was some considerable improvement in balance. When the situations developed which we have discussed, setting off the old conflicts, again you see, then the discipline idea was short-circuited back to the old compulsive behavior, though in different form, and with the old religious connotation of self denial. The old fear of spontaneity returned, and the methodical attempt to deny subconscious impulses; the old feeling of unworthiness was also activated, and the body duly denied. Now this self denial began in the Catholic home, and he was peculiarly prone to accept it. It was part of the old Catholic training, and he fell for it under a new guise.当自发的自己确实逃脱时，你知道，它只有在爆炸性冲动把它们的路炸开的状况下才有办法这么做。在这之间的几年当中，平衡状况有了很大的改善。当我们讨论过的情况发展出来，引发了旧有的冲突时，再一次你看，纪律观念那时又抄近路回到以前的强迫行为，尽管形式不同，但旧有的那种自我否定的宗教内涵仍在。以前对自发的恐惧又回来了，有条不紊地试图否认潜意识的冲动；旧有的无价值感被触发，身体也被适当地否定了。现在，这种自我否定始于天主教家园，而且他特别容易接受。它是老派的天主教训练的一部分，他被一个新的花样迷住了。
(Jane spent over a year in such a home while her mother was hospitalized for arthritis.)(在她的母亲因关节炎住院时，珍在这样一个家园住了一年以上的时间)
In some ways, quite understandable. Old guilts held regularly in normal balance concerning his mother then leapt upward. The adult wondered then, had he misjudged the mother? Was not the mother at last sending him presents? To punish himself he attempted to give himself his mother's symptoms, to put the shoe on the other foot, so to speak, almost in a religious like atonement.在某些方面，这是可以理解的。与他的母亲有关的旧有罪恶感规律地维持正常的平衡，然后往上跃升。于是成年的他纳闷，他是不是看错他母亲了？母亲最后不是给他送礼物了吗？为了惩罚自己，他试图让自己表现出母亲的症状，可以说是，把鞋子穿在另一只脚上，几乎充满了宗教般的赎罪感。
Now all of this should be taken with other material that I have given you, for all these reasons clicked together at the time. His book was a good one and he was proud of it. But because he felt at this time unworthy, for the reasons given, then he must punish himself for its success, artistically speaking. I can tell you that our work and the stability of our sessions has been of great aid in keeping the symptoms under some control. Had this happened before our sessions the difficulty would literally have been most severe, with other bad physical symptoms.现在这一切应该要和我给你的其他资料一起用，因为这些原因当时全都相扣在一起。他的书是一本好书，他引以为豪。但是因为此时他觉得没有价值，原因已经说过了，所以从艺术的角度来说，他必须为书的成功惩罚自己。我可以告诉你，我们的工作以及稳定的课对于控制症状有很大的帮助。这要是发生在我们的课之前，问题实际上会很严重，还会有其他糟糕的身体症状。
Now occasionally the ego has risen up in our sessions, but to no alarming degree. On the few occasions when the symptoms were mentioned and a particular time given, this was a rather pathetic attempt on the part of the ego to make use of the sessions.现在，在我们的课当中，偶尔自我会起来反抗，但不到令人忧心的程度。在少数提到症状以及特定时间的情况下，这是自我在利用这些课的一个相当可悲的尝试。
The pendulum sessions have been of value. The listing of the symptoms is not a good idea now however. An outgoing atmosphere, oddly enough, will now allow the spontaneous inner self freer expression spontaneously, you see; the yoga, I am afraid, did represent a severe distortion, and yet a particularly tricky one, for generally speaking the exercise is excellent; and in the beginning when I recommended it, it was helpful in slowly coaxing out the inner self.摆锤课很有价值。但是条列症状的清单现在不是一个好主意。奇怪的是，外向的气氛现在自发地允许自发的内我更加自由地表达，你看，瑜珈恐怕确实代表了严重的扭曲，而且还是特别棘手的一个，因为一般来说，这个运动非常好；在一开始我推荐它的时候，它有助于慢慢地把内我劝诱出来。
After this there was an inhibiting factor involved, and only a portion of my statement actually came through, you see. The distortion resulted from the cautionary statement that was not allowed to come through.在这之后，有一个抑制因素涉入了，我的陈述实际上只有一部分传送过来，你知道，扭曲是警告声明不被允许传过来而造成的结果。
Now you are making progress. For now, activity will be good. Physical activity, the normal aggressive activity of social endeavor, the creative activity involved in writing, and the housecleaning procedures mentioned. The poetry is exceedingly important.现在你们正在进步。就目前而言，活动会很好。身体活动、发展社交的种种正常攻击性活动、写作涉及的创造活动，以及之前提过的房屋清扫过程。诗极其重要。
Your stiff neck, my friend—you felt responsible to some extent for Ruburt's habits of ultra-discipline. They were obviously breaking down in any case, no longer serving their purpose you see, and you did not realize that they were being fueled by early compulsive behavior.你僵硬的脖子，我的朋友——对于鲁柏极端自律的种种习惯，你感觉你应该负某种程度的责任。它们显然在任何方面都分解了，再也达不到它们的目的，你看，并且你没有发觉早年的强迫行为是它们的燃料。
I would suggest that you both in summertime indulge in physical activity in the yard—quick activity of a game variety. The fact that Ruburt begins to remember his dreams shows that the inner self is being allowed more freedom, and it responds to physical touch, pampering, denial, as the case may be.我建议你们两个在夏天的时候到院子里从事身体活动——各种游戏类型的快速活动。鲁柏开始想起他的梦，这个事实显示内我正被允许更多的自由，而且它对肉体接触、呵护、否定有回应，就像这个情况可能也是这样。
Some extra care as you plan then will also serve to liven the spirits of the spontaneous self. Ruburt’s particular personality can also find refreshment at his job; as the earlier, still somewhat lingering but largely vanishing sensitivity vanishes, it can be a source of refreshment. It is less symbolic in a negative manner, you see, than it was. While he insisted upon this rigorous discipline for himself, he was caught between trying to inflict it upon the children, and by his natural tendency to enter into their spontaneous ways. This largely contributing to the difficulties after work, as a result of the tension.所以按照你的计划进行一些额外护理也有助于提振自发自己的精神。鲁柏特有的人格也能够在工作中找到神清气爽的感觉；之前那种仍然挥之不去，但大部分在消失中的过度敏感消失了，它就可能是神清气爽的一个来源。比起以前，你看，它在象征上的负面意义比较少了。在他坚持严格自律的同时，他被困在设法把它强加在孩童身上，以及按照他的自然倾向加入他们的自发方式这两者之间。这在很大程度上造成了下班后的问题，原因出在这股拉扯的张力上。
This should vanish, and is as he regains his own spontaneity. You may take a break or end the session as you prefer.这应该消失，因为他拿回了他自身的自发性，所以这会消失。你比较想要休息或是结束这一节都可以。
("We'll take a short break."(“我们休息一下好了。”
(10:30. Resume at 10:42.)(10:30休息，10:42继续。)
Ruburt correctly interpreted the evening symptoms that sometimes occur. There is some identification with the mother here, based on highly falsified data; if he becomes the mother, then the mother cannot hurt him. And in all such identifications, there is the feeling that by becoming that which one fears there is safety. This is obviously wrong and dangerous.鲁柏正确解读有时候出现的夜间症状。根据严重扭曲的资料，这里有某种对母亲的认同；如果他成为母亲，那母亲就伤害不了他了。而在所有这样的认同当中，一个人借由变成他害怕的那个样子，反而有安全感。这显然是错误的也是危险的。
A secondary cause is that the spontaneous self has not been until recently allowed to express itself very well through the physical body, and when it is not in motion the spontaneity has been largely denied.一个次要的原因是，自发的自己直到最近才得以透过肉体充分表达它自己，而当它没有在活动的时候，自发性大部分都被否定了。
Ruburt's mother is part of an entity, and he should remember this. He does not have arthritis, although he has been mimicking the symptoms, and could in time hypnotize himself into believing he did have the disease, though this is highly improbable given his own constitution. The spontaneous self happens to be basically more powerful and far more sensible than the ego, and would never stand for this development. It would doubtless cause some sort of an explosion however, in order to prevent any such occurrence.鲁的母亲是一个存有的一部分，他应该记住这一点。尽管他一直在模仿这些症状，但他并没有关节炎，而且他能够及时催眠自己相信他确实患有这种疾病，但是因为他自己的体质，这是极不可能发生的事。自发的自己刚好基本上比自我更强大、更明智，而且永远不会支持这种发展。然而，这无疑会引发某种爆炸，为的是避免发生任何这样的情况。
The explosion would most likely take the part of explosive behavior. This will not be necessary now however. You should make definite plans for a vacation, and discuss them so that the idea is a reality in the present. Enjoy some creature comforts, whatever these mean to you.爆炸很可能以爆炸行为的方式呈现。不过现在没有必要这样了。你们应该做些明确的计划，去度过假，而且要讨论这些计划，好让想法变成当下的一个实相。享受作为生物的一些安逸与舒适，不管在你们看来这些意味着什么。
Yes, Ruburt should make an effort, some at least, to go out in the morning, if it only be down the stairs and around the yard. Now he is at the point where mental activity will also quicken the spontaneous self. Before, this was not even workable.是的，鲁柏应该努力，至少努力一下，在早上出门去，就算只是下楼到院子里也好。现在他正在一个节骨眼上，心智活动也会让自发的自己变得活跃。以前，这甚至是行不通的。
The physical exercises now will be most beneficial. No very heavy moving for example, but a resumption, steadily, of normal behavior.现在身体运动将会是最有助益的。比方说，不是太用力的行动，但是稳定地恢复正常行为。
("Does going up and down stairs mean anything in particular to Jane?")(“上下楼梯对珍来说有什么特别的意义吗？”)
There is no deeply symbolic meaning here, the stairs having simply become a transitional point between the outside and the inside. Although going down is somewhat significant, representing to the ego the fear of going down into the self.这里没有深层的象征意义，楼梯只不过是变成外面和里面之间一个过渡的点而已。虽然下楼也有些许重要的意义，对自我来说，代表着下降到自己之中的恐惧。
The going up is reassuring, you see. Now he may if he prefers, and this is not original with me, imagine a circle of psychic safety about him, through which only constructive suggestions and influences can pass.上楼是令人安心的，你知道。如果他愿意的话，现在他可以，而且这不是我原创的，想像一下他周围有一个心灵安全圈，只有建设性的暗示和影响才能通过。
I will close our session unless you have questions, or prefer that I carry on.除非你有问题或希望我继续下去，不然我要结束这一节了。
("Just one, and that is this: Will the ego ever accept these sessions?")(“只有一个，那就是：自我到底会不会接受这些课？”)
The ego has to a large extent accepted them already, as is shown by the results of our test data, for which the ego's cooperation is necessary.自我在很大程度上已经接受它们了，这显示在我们的测验资料结果上，因为那必须要有自我的合作才能进行。
A fond good evening to you both.祝你们两位有个美好的夜晚。
("Goodnight, Seth.” (11 PM.)(“晚安，赛斯。”(晚上11点整。)

SESSION 321 第321节 珍的症状成因


FEBRUARY 22, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年2月22日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
("Good, evening, Seth.” Seth’s entity name for Jane is Ruburt—he, him, his.)(“晚安，赛斯。”赛斯给珍的存有名是鲁柏——他、他的。)
He tries at times to use a schedule, a disciplined schedule as a fence against the subconscious, and becomes panic-stricken imagining himself without it. This is not to say that a schedule in itself is not good, it is to say that he can and sometimes does misuse one. In these instances the time is actually used to clamp down on the inner self, rather than to release it. These outings will be of benefit here, not only because they allow for spontaneous interaction, but because they serve to break the schedules in ways that do not disturb working hours. They provide a beginning for a habit of release. Here the ego is helping us now, for it is sticking to these plans, and the plans are those the ego itself enjoys, and can accept. He has been afraid to simply sit and think, for fear of letting the spontaneous self show without the symbolized writing mechanism.他有时候试着利用时间表，纪律严明的时间表，当作阻挡潜意识的围篱，并且在想像自己没有它的情况下变得惊慌失措。这并不是说时间表本身不好，而是说他可能而且有时候确实误用了。在这些情况下，时间实际上是被用来钳制内我，而不是释放它。此处这些郊游是有益的，不仅因为它们允许自发的互动，还因为它们以不影响工作时间的方式打破时间表。它们为建立一个释放的习惯起了头。此时自我在这里正帮着我们，因为它坚持这些计划，而计划正是自我本身乐在其中，而且可以接受的那些计划。他一直害怕只是坐着思考，因为恐惧自发的自己会在没有象征书写机制的情况下现身。
This rigid control of consciousness prevented spontaneous enjoyment of an everyday variety that would otherwise have had a beneficial and balancing effect. On this dining out, for example: even the small shock, you see, involved in different tastes provides small surprises that are releasing to the sensemechanisms.这种对意识的严格控制阻止了天天变化的自发享受，若非如此，自发的享受本来会产生一种有益的平衡作用。例如，在这次外出用餐时：即使是小小的震惊，你看，不同的滋味带来一些小小的惊喜，对感官机制而言都是释放。
Again: a change of schedules and habits. It is good that you are making these changes. If some were not made, they would be demanded by other portions of the self. They are breakthroughs, and therapeutic. The ego is working with you now, for it grew frightened and is taking steps to change.再一次：时间表和习惯的改变。你的这些变化是好的。如果不做一些改变，自己的其他部分就会要求变化。它们是突破，具有疗愈效果。此时自我正在与你一起工作，因为它越来越害怕，正在一步步改变中。
The gestures you are making are important not only for their innate benefits. They are a vital means of showing your intent to other portions of the self. One small note here: at those times when Ruburt wears sweaters to bed, you see, they serve as reminders of his mother's bed jackets. This was the main reason for his difficulty regarding the arms last night in bed.你做出的种种示意动作之所以重要，不仅因为它们本来就有的好处。要向自己的其他部分展现你的意图，它们是一个不可或缺的手段。这里有一个小注：在鲁柏穿着毛及睡觉的时候，你看，它们的作用是让他想起母亲的睡衣外套。昨晚他在被窝里手臂有问题，这就是主要的原因。
The sensitivities are vanishing. Improvements come as the personality learns intuitively, you see, having nothing to do with time in a basic manner. An intuitive grasp may come suddenly with an equally fast disappearance of blocks of symptoms. The spontaneous self is being allowed more freedom now, this is the source of the intuitional understanding.过敏正在消失。随着人格凭着直觉学习，而有了改善，你知道，与时间基本上没有任何关系。一种直觉的理解可能会突然出现，同时一批批症状也一样快速地消失。自发的自己现在被允许更多的自由，这是直觉理解的根源。
A variety of small, perhaps, but frequent alterations of schedule or habit are very helpful. More extensive changes, a change in working hours, for example, might frighten the ego and should be avoided.时间表或习惯上各种也许微小但频繁的改变，是很有帮助的。更大幅度的改变，例如工作时间的一个变化，可能会吓到自我，应该要避免。
Affection on your part, Joseph, is as you know very highly effective, giving all the portions of Ruburt's personality simultaneous support. This and warm companionship. Spontaneity should be encouraged whenever possible in your daily activities, while still the overall stable conditions are maintained. You understand me here?你的深情，约瑟，如你所知，是非常有效的，让鲁柏人格的所有部分同时得到支持。这件事再加上温暖的陪伴。在你们的日常活动中，一有可能，就应该鼓励自发，但同时仍然要维持全面和稳定状态。这里你了解我的意思吗？
("Yes.")(“是的。”)
These measures, incidentally, will refresh you both and are always excellent provisions against rigidity in any form. They are actually exercises in the spontaneous release of the intuitive portion of the self. I would suggest for awhile that he refrain from wearing black sweaters in general, except that I fear his wardrobe is already depleted.顺便提一下，这些措施将会使你们两人都焕然一新，而且对于任何形式的僵化，始终都是绝佳的防备。它们其实是练习，用意是自发地释放自己的直觉部分。我建议他一阵子整个不穿黑色毛衣，只不过他的衣橱恐怕已经片甲不留了。
(Smile.)(微笑)
You have been doing well with the pendulum, and the exercise has successively opened up communication with deeper layers of the self. An hypnotic session would be helpful, but only when you feel confident. A point here involving Ruburt's hands and his mother's sweaters: he knew that knitting was a therapeutic measure suggested in the past to exercise his mother's hands. When he became sensitized to the sweaters, then he had difficulty with his own hands, you see.你在摆锤方面做得很好，这个练习已经相继开启了你与更深层次的自己交流。催眠课会有帮助，但前提是你要有信心。这里有一点和鲁柏的双手以及他母亲的毛衣有关：他知道编织是过去为了锻炼他母亲的双手而建议的一种治疗方法。当他对毛衣变得敏感时，那时他便难以使用自己的双手，你看。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:31. Rest. (9:43. Resume.)(9:30休息。9:43继续。)
He is allergic, so to speak, to perfumes or colognes that come in a particular shaped bottle, rather than to their contents. His mother, incidentally, called him greedy for wanting to use her perfume. He does not like your room heater. It reminds him of his mother's space heater. Give us a moment. (Pause.) These various sensitivities will lose, and are losing their power, and the fact of recognizing them is an automatic benefit.对于在特定形状的瓶子装着的香水或古龙水，可以说，他会过敏，而不是它们里面装的东西。顺带一提，他的母亲因为他想用她的香水而说他贪婪。他不喜欢你们房间里的加热器。它让他想起他母亲的空间加热器。等我们一下。(停顿)这些各式各样的过敏将会失去，而且正在失去它们的力量，而认识它们这个事实就是一个自动产生的好处。
He is beginning to identify his spontaneous self now with the spontaneity of the nursery school children, and this is a definite improvement. Did you have any specific questions?他现在开始认同自发的自己是幼儿园的孩子，这是一个明显的进步。你有没有什么特定的问题？
("What outstanding clairvoyant and telepathic data is at work involving his symptoms?")(“有什么显著的千里眼和心电感应资料对他的症状起作用吗？”)
Nothing outstanding.没有什么显著的。
("Isn't there a day to day fluctuation?")(“每天都有波动吗？”)
There is indeed. The sensitivities will block out such psychic abilities out of fear. The reaction is not blocked. The information is simply not allowed clear channel through, you see.确实有。出于恐惧，过敏会挡住这样的通灵能力。反应没有被挡住。根本就不允许讯息清晰传递过来，你知道。
("Are we reaching the proper levels of the personality and are we getting reliable answers with the pendulum?")(“我们有没有触及正确的人格层面？我们有没有用摆锤得到可靠的答案？”)
The answers here are reliable, generally speaking. Underline the generally. You are reaching deeper layers of the personality as you progress with the pendulum. Ruburt could put himself in a light trance state before a session, and you could ask the questions while he holds the pendulum.一般来说，这里答案是可靠的。一般两字划线。随着你们运用摆锤的进展，你们正在触及人格更深的层面。鲁柏可以在课前先让他自己处于轻度出神状态，然后你可以在他拿着摆锤时发问。
("I've thought of that.")(“我想过那样做。”)
This would add to the depth and reliability, and also allow suggestions given to take hold. A session dealing with upsetting material should lead or be directed toward some immediate release. If extremely upsetting material is obtained then the Emotional release must be allowed before the session is considered finished. On a few occasions such material was partially uncovered, and you both ended the session. No release.这会增加深度和可靠程度，也会让给出的暗示扎根。一节摆锤课要是处理令人沮丧的资料，就应该通往或被导向某种立即的释放。如果取得了极度令人难过的资料，那么在考虑结束之前，应该要让情绪先释放出来。在一些情况下，这样的资料有一部分被揭开了，而你们两人就结束了那一节。没有释放。
("How do you allow for this release?")(“你要怎么做才能有这种释放？”)
Spontaneous talking out on Ruburt's part for this particular incident or times, to elicit the full release of pent-up Emotions that lay behind the uncovering, you see. In some such instances, proper suggestions will help. This is excellent therapy incidentally, for the release of the Emotions automatically releases the symptoms. A discharge of this type is required when unpleasant material of an Emotional kind is uncovered through the pendulum.鲁柏自发地说出这个特定的事件或时期，把藏在没有揭开的资料背后种种压抑的情绪全部释放出来，你知道。在一些这类的情况下，适当的暗示会有帮助。顺便说一下，这是绝佳的疗法，因为情绪的释放会自动解除症状。透过摆锤揭露属于情感类型的不愉快资料，这种放电是必须的。
("Is the pendulum good for dream interpretation?")(“用摆锤来解读梦有效吗？”)
It is. Without the trance however you will not reach buried past-life data.有效。但是，没有出神，你们无法触及埋藏的前世资料。
(“I wanted to ask about that. Is the pendulum a help with clairvoyant and telepathic data?")(“我本来想问那个问题。摆锤对千里眼和心电感应有帮助吗？”)
Not without the trance state, not in a dependable manner.没有出神状态就没有用，不是可靠的方式。
("We can use some more past-life data on this problem. How about Boston?")(“我们可以多用一些这个问题的前世资料。波士顿怎么样？”)
In this particular instance there is no overriding past-life data that is important in context with Ruburt’s condition, except the overall personality patterns that existed.在这个特定的情况下，没有任何胜过一切的前世资料对鲁柏的病情是重要的，除了存在的整体人格以外。
( Jane has been psychically involved with her mother's entity before, hasn't she?")(“珍以前一直在心灵上与她母亲的存有关系密切，是不是？”)
Indeed.确实是。
("And with Walter Zeh's?" [Walt was Jane’s first husband.])(“还有华特·泽？”[华特·泽是珍的第一任丈夫])
Indeed. I will have something to say shortly, incidentally, concerning the ways in which you may change the past in the present, for this will be useful. First we must relieve the sensitivities and we are, and then we shall work toward the construction of a more favorable past, you see. You may take a break and we shall continue.确实是。顺便提一下，不久之后我要说一件事，关于你可以在当下改变过去的方式，因为这很有用。首先，我们必须减轻过敏，而现在我正在做，然后我们努力的方向是建设更有利的过去，你知道。你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(10:09 rest.(10:09休息。
(Question at break:“Does my entity have anything to do with Jane's symptoms?"(休息时的问题：“我的存有与珍的症状有关系吗？”)
(10:21 resume.) We will shortly end this session. I intend to go into past-life experiences rather extensively, but in another context. The main problems with Ruburt exist as given, and when these are cleared then we will have clear access to our other material, that is, the past-life data.(10:21继续。)我们马上要结束这一节。我打算很广泛地探讨前世经验，但是要用另一个脉络来说。鲁柏的主要问题已经存在，当这些问题被清理后，我们就会顺畅取得我们的其他资料，也就是，前世的资料。
Water has healing qualities, and walks by the river when practical, will be of benefit. Therapeutic dreams should be requested each night for now, as standard practice. A small note, not necessarily a recommendation here: a change of hair color would minimize any lingering mother identification.水具有疗愈作用，如果可行，沿着河边散步是有益的。目前应该每晚都要求做疗愈梦，把它当作常规。一个小提示，这里不一定是一个建议：改变发色会让任何挥之不去的母亲认同减到最低。
He is growing out of this, however. This is sufficient for this evening. Let Ruburt read over these last sessions closely, and the house-cleaning procedures should be carried out when it is practical. My fondest wishes, unless you have further questions.不过，他正在摆脱这种情况。今天晚上这样就够了。让鲁柏仔细阅读最后这几节课，而且在可靠时应该进行房屋清扫的步骤。我衷心祝福，除非你还有别的问题。
("No. Goodnight, Seth."(“没有。晚安，赛斯。”
(10:29. Flowing through Elmira, NY, the Chemung River passes close to our apartment.)(10:29。祈梦河穿过纽约州埃尔迈拉，流经我们的公寓附近。)

SESSION 322 第322节 做梦的自己及人格的各个层面


FEBRUARY 27, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年2月27日 星期一 晚上9点
(No envelope experiment was held.(没有举行信封实验。
(John Bradley was a witness.)(约翰·布莱德利是见证人。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Good evening to our friend here.我们在这里的朋友晚安。
Now. I will give you some material that I had in mind pertaining to the dreaming self and the levels of the personality.现在。我要给你一些我想到的资料，是关于做梦的自己和人格的各个层面。
You have by now become acquainted with a self you did not know before our sessions, a self who keeps watch upon both the ego and the subconscious. This is no longer theory to you, for you are practically aware of the self in an ever-growing fashion.你现在已经熟悉一个我们课开始前你不认识的自己，一个同时关注自我和潜意识的自己。对你来说，这不再是理论，因为你实际上已经觉察到这个自己，而且这份觉知正日益增长中。
This self is also a director of dream activities. It is in some ways an intermediate self. You realize that all these terms are basically artificial, for simplicity’s sake. There are no real divisions to the self, though you may feel at times self divided.这个自己也是梦活动的一个导演。在某些方面，它是一个中间的自己。你发觉这些字眼基本上全都是人为的，为了简单起见。自己没有任何真正的分隔，尽管有时候你可能会感觉自己四分五裂。
This portion of the self then can be utilized to keep the ego and the subconscious in balance. Your own identity is still greater than this however. This portion of the self can serve to keep you informed as to the balance and efficiency of the immediate operating personality.所以这个部分的自己可以用来维持自我和潜意识的平衡。但是，你自己的本体仍然比这个还大。自己的这个部分可能的作用是，随时告诉你当前运作中的人格处于何种平衡和效率状态。
(Jane pointed to John.) At times our friend has sensed this portion of the self. This is not, basically speaking, a supraself. It only seems so to you. You are becoming consciously aware of it, but it exists whether or not you know it. It can correct errors made, by other portions of the personality. It can request and arrange for the removal of physical symptoms, because it knows the reasons behind such symptoms.(珍指着约翰)有时候，我们的朋友已经感觉到自己的这个部分。基本上来说，这不是一个最高的自己。只不过在你看来好像是。你在意识上对它有觉知，但无论你知不知道它，它都存在。它能够改正人格其他部分造成的错误。它能够要求和安排身体症状的解除，因为它知道这类症状背后的原因。
It is an instant calculator that can tell you your relative position. It is this portion of the self that initiates many of the creative ideas that seem to spring from the subconscious. These will always appear through the subconscious, but the original concepts originate with this portion of the self.它是一个即时计算机，能够把你的相对位置告诉你。看似从潜意识冒出来的创意，很多都是自己的这个部分发起的。这些向来都会经由潜意识出现，但原创的概念却是源于自己的这个部分。
It is this portion who seems to stand outside and view the subjective self. It is the I who is aware and alert within the dream state and who watches the dreaming self. (Long pause, eyes dosed.) This portion, while still within the three-dimensional system, is closely allied with other portions of the self that are free of that system.似乎站在外面察看主观的自己，正是自己的这个部分。它是在梦状态中既觉知又有警觉的我，观察着做梦的自己的我。(长时间停顿，双眼闭着)这个部分虽然仍在三维系统之内，但是它与自己不受那个系统束缚的其他部分紧密相连。
We will have a relatively brief session this evening, for I would hesitate to disrupt what our friend anticipated to be a purely social occasion.今天晚上我们会有一节相对简短的课，因为我会犹豫，不想破坏我们的朋友以为这是一个纯粹社交场合的期待。
([John:]” You do what you want to, Seth.")(约翰：“你想做什么就做吧，赛斯。”)
(Smile.) I am indeed honored. Especially since I realize that you are not usually so docile.(微笑)我真的觉得很荣幸。特别是因为我明了你通常没有这么温顺。
I did want to make the point however that you are now aware in practical terms of a conscious part of the personality that appears to be independent of the ego and aware of the ego’s activities.不过，我的确想要指出一点就是你现在实际上觉察到人格当中一个有意识的部分，看起来独立于自我之外而且对自我的活动有觉知。
You are practically aware in everyday life now of a self who watches the self. This is important. For later you will be aware of a self who watches this self, and I want you to note the difference.现在你于日常生活中实际上意识到一个看着自己的自己。这很重要。以后，你会觉察到一个看着这个自己的自己，我要你注意其中的差别。
It will first appear in the dream state.它首先会出现在梦状态中。
You may take a social break and I shall continue.你可以休息一下，我再继续。
(9:20. This proved to be the end of the session. Janes eyes had been open some of the time, very dark; her pace had been rather fast, her voice a bit stronger than usual.)(9:20。事实证明这一节就此结束。珍的眼睛有些时候张开过，颜色很深；她的速度相当快，声音比平常有力一点。)

SESSION 323 第323节 催眠重点应该放在健康、丰盛、灵活、力量与生命力上


MARCH 1, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年3月1日 星期三 晚上9点
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, in the past when you said the word I, this I was the ego I, and you identified the whole self with the ego. Later you learned to distinguish between the ego and the subconscious. All of this simply means that you became aware of larger portions of the whole personality, and were consciously able to use these abilities, conscious and subconscious being, of course, artificial terms.现在，过去当你说“我”(I)这个字的时候，这个我是自我的我，而你把自我当成全我。后来你学会了区分自我和潜意识。这一切意味着你已经对整个人格的更大部分有觉知，并且有意识地能够使用这些能力，意识与潜意识当然是人为的用词。
Now when you use the word I, more and more, this is the portion of the self of which I spoke in our last session. You are aware of the ego and able to see yourself as something more than the ego is. This is the I that you have been using in the pendulum sessions, that questions both the ego and subconscious. These are all portions of the self, however; the difference is functional.现在，当你越来越常使用我这个字的时候，这就是我在我们的上一节谈到的自己。你对自我有觉知，也能够看见你自己不只是自我。这就是你一直在摆锤课上使用的我，这个我既询问自我也询问潜意识。这些全都是自己的其中一部分；差别在于功能。
This self can give directions to both the ego and the subconscious and can instruct the subconscious to speed up healing processes. Now you address this I automatically and identify it in with your own mind as a sort of supra-consciousness. You are only familiar with a small part of it, however. Here again, the division is arbitrary.这个自己可以给自我和潜意识方向，也能够指导潜意识加快疗愈过程。现在你自动对这个我说话， 在你自己的心智中认同它是一种超意识。但是，你只熟悉其中的一小部分。这里再一次，这种切割是任意为之的。
In those terms you could call it a part of a more expansive portion of the self, the only part that you are so far able to experience in your usual conscious terms. Ruburt has been using this part of the self automatically in the pendulum sessions, and in giving suggestions. You have appealed to it also.按照那些字眼来说，你可以称它是自己当中一个更为扩展的部分，迄今为止唯一一个你能够以平常的意识经验它的部分。在摆锤课中，以及在给出暗示时，鲁柏一直自动使用自己的这个部分。你也求助于它。
Now, the crucial mother identification is passed, and Ruburt is left with a system of habit, still based on some but relatively little mother identification. Ruburt did receive my message correctly. While the overall stability of working hours and arrangements should be largely maintained, he should make an effort to vary his activities and routine. This will generally help in the breaking up of habit patterns.现在，对母亲的认同这个重大的问题已经过去了，留在鲁柏身上的是一个习惯系统，而它仍然奠基在他对母亲的某种认同上，只是相对来说很少。鲁柏确实正确接收到我的讯息。很大程度上整体工作时间和安排的稳定应该维持，同时他应该努力让他的活动和生活常规有变化。这通常有助于打破惯性模式。
One or two excellent self hypnosis sessions a week will speed up complete release of symptoms. The more psychic energy he uses at such sessions, the speedier his progress. We are not dealing with time, but intensities. Intense concentration to other areas, you see, will take him out of the habitual patterns.每周举行一两次绝佳的自我催眠课，将会加快症状的完全释放。他在这样的课当中使用的心灵能量越多，他的进步速度就越快。我们并不是在和时间，而是和强度打交道。注意力集中在其他领域，你看，将会带他走出惯性模式。
The intensity of interest in other directions is much more important than time. We do not want intense concentration upon the symptoms. In all hypnotic sessions and in all periods of self suggestion, emphasis should indeed be upon health, exuberance, flexibility, strength and vitality. I mentioned this to Ruburt today, but he thought the idea his own.在其他方向上的兴趣强度，比时间重要多了。我们不想要把注意力集中在症状上。在所有的催眠课上以及所有的自我暗示期间，的确应该强调健康、朝气、弹性、力量和生命力。今天我跟鲁柏提起这件事，但他认为这个主意是他自己的。
The change of environment, out of the apartment, was partially suggested to break any suggestions that might be arising simply from the length, in your terms, of his difficulties. He should when possible, for now, wear yellows and greens to work. He should make a definite determined effort to walk home, for his confidence will grow with the success, you see.建议改变环境，在公寓外面，一部分是为了要打破任何可能仅仅因为他的难题——按照你们的说法——由来已久而产生的暗示。在可能的情况下，他应该暂时穿黄色和绿色的衣服去工作。他应该下定决心走路回家，因为他的信心会随着成功而增长，你知道。
The housecleaning procedures I mentioned should definitely be carried out. The work done in the kitchen last weekend helped him, for the reasons given. Through motor activities he rids himself of identification in a vigorous and aggressive matter, the symbolism worked out in physical terms. Since the symptoms have been physical, this is excellent therapy and most practical from a psychic viewpoint.我提到的房屋打扫步骤一定要执行。上周末在厨房完成的工作对他有帮助，原因我说过了。透过运动活动(motor activities),他在一种充满活力又具有攻击性的事情当中摆脱认同，经由身体活动解决了具有象征意义的问题。因为症状是身体的症状，所以从一个心灵的观点来看， 这是绝佳的疗法，而且也是最实际的。
There are symbols I have not gone into, nor is there reason to. But I have good reason for giving these suggestions. As an example only, I will give you two reasons for my suggestion that the windows be thrown open and the apartment aired.有些象征我没有探讨过，也没有理由探讨。但我有提供这些建议的充分理由。只是举个例子，我会告诉你们两人，我之所以建议窗户要打开，让公寓通风的原因。
When Ruburt’s mother went to the hospital in his high-school years, he had a symbolic way of ridding the house of her psychic presence, and to add to his own sense of inner freedom. He threw open the windows, something usually denied him. This also has a therapeutic symbolism for him in connection with his grandfather, that is the feeling that cleansing nature rids the air of impurities. He also liked to have the radio blaring as a gesture of defiance and freedom, and within limitations, this would be an aid when the windows are opened. There are other reasons for the housecleaning suggestions also, involving individualistic symbols that have strong value for him.当鲁柏的母亲在他高中时期住进医院时，他以一种象征性的方式让房子从他的心灵消失，增加他自己内在的自由感。他敞开通常将他封闭在内的窗户。对他来说，这也有一种治疗的象征意义，与他的祖父有关，就是净化的本质消除不洁空气的那种感觉。他还喜欢把收音机的音量转到震天价响。以示蔑视和自由，而在有限的范围内，当窗户敞开时，这是一个辅助。需要打扫房子还有别的原因，与对他具有重要价值的个人主义象征有关。
This should not be allowed to become a compulsive thing, you see. Certainly no week, for example, should be exclusively set aside. There is a strong charge of energy behind these activities, however, which is therapeutically discharged. You may take your break and we shall continue.你知道，不应该让这变成一件强迫性质的事。当然，比方说，不应该只单独拨出一周。然而，在这些活动背后有一股强大的能量电荷，在治疗上被释放。你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:30 break. (9:36 resume.)(9:30休息，9:36继续。)
Now, I have other suggestions. Ruburt should specifically request dreams in which he is running, with speed and flexibility, dreams in which he dances well, and dreams in which he experiences a magnificent sense of vitality and physical exuberance.现在，我还有其他的建议。鲁柏应该明确要求做他在其中奔跑的梦，既有速度又灵活，做他在其中舞跳得很好的梦，以及他体验生命力与肉体活力的强烈感受。
He should imagine himself, before he sleeps, indulging joyfully in the next day’s activities, and should not concentrate on his symptoms, even if it is to wish they disappear. These dreams should be rather specifically requested.他应该想像自己，在睡前，喜悦地沉醉在隔天的活动中，不要专注在他的症状上，就算是想要它们消失的希望也不要。应该很明确地要求做这些梦。
If possible he should make a strong effort to recall his previous sense of flexibility and not identify his personal image with the condition of his physical body during his difficulties.如果可能的话，他应该用力回想他以前手脚灵活的感觉，不要把他的个人形象与他在行动困难期间的肉体状况看成是同一件事。
Give us a moment. (Long pause.) There are no other pertinent suggestions here. The ones I have given are quite sufficient, if they are followed.给我们一点时间。(长时间停顿)这里没有其他相关建议。如果照着做的话， 我已经给出的内容就绰绰有余了。
Do you have any particular questions?你有什么特定的问题吗？
(“I can't think of any.” )(“我一个都想不到。”)
It would perhaps help if at least one window is open during Ruburts exercise period.如果在鲁柏的运动期间至少打开一扇窗户，可能会有帮助。
Symptoms still lingering should not be ignored, of course, but attention should be paid to advancements, and symptoms should not be overemphasized. Ruburt should attempt more and more to break out of these patterns he allowed to build up about him as a result of symptoms. He should tackle the back stairs more frequently, until they lose what negative significance they gained, you see.症状仍然挥之不去，当然不应该忽视，但是注意力应该放在进展上，不应该过度强调症状。鲁柏应该越来越多尝试，打破他因为症状而允许它们在他周围建立起来的这些模式。他应该更常去爬屋后的楼梯，直到它们得到的负面重要性消失为止。
These procedures would have been of some help in the past, but now that the basic reason for the symptoms is conquered, the effectiveness of these methods should lead to the disappearance of all symptoms. He must check himself, however. He is in a habit, for example, now, of not bending down deeply and when he catches himself, he must move as he used to.这些步骤在过去本来会有帮助的，但现在症状的基本成因既然已经被克服，这些方法的效力应该会导致所有症状的消失。不过，他得自己检查一下才知道。例如，他现在有一个习惯，就是腰不能弯到底，当他逮到自己时，他必须像他以前那样活动。
These suggestions will enable him to see himself you see, in the healed image. Begin to pick up his Willie again, for example. Do you see what I mean here?这些建议会让他能够——你知道——看见他自己已经疗愈的形象。比方说，再次开始弯腰抱起他的威立。这里你明白我的意思吗？
(“Yes.” Willie is our cat.)(“是的。”威立是我们的猫。)
Each success sets up a new constructive pattern. Part of the late afternoon symptoms at work, lately, have been caused by a simple fear that difficulty would strike him on his way home. To protect himself from this, he developed the symptoms before leaving, thus giving himself a legitimate excuse to ask for, or accept, a ride.每一次的成功都会建立一个新的建设性模式。最近，下午晚些时候在工作时的症状，有一部分是由一个简单的恐惧引起的；他害怕在回家的路上突然不良于行。为了保护他自己受到这个打击，他在离开之前发展出症状，从而给他自己一个正当的借口，要求或接受搭便车。
When he discovers he can walk home, this difficulty will vanish. There may be, but should not be, some slight difficulty at first, the result of his own idea patterns, but that is all. If he keeps track of himself, no difficulties at all will arise.当他发现自己可以走路回家时，这个问题就会消失。起初可能有但应该没有某个小困难，这是他自己的意念模式造成的结果，但就是如此而已。如果他追踪他自己的进展，根本不会有任何困难出现。
He should take frequent walks to build up his confidence, and to break up the patterns further.他应该经常散步以便建立他的自信，并且进一步打破模式。
Now you may take a break or end the session, as you prefer.现在，你可以休息或结束这一节，看你比较想要怎样。
(“Okay. Well take a break.”(“好的。我们休息一下。”
(9:56. Break. (10:06. Resume.)(9:56休息，10:06继续。)
Now that the basic reasons for the symptoms have been conquered, the symptoms would disappear in any case, but at a rather slow rate. The suggestions given, applied with intensity, can work wonders in a very brief time. Attention directed elsewhere is extremely important, for energy is withdrawn from the symptoms. A complete change of environment would be excellent of course if it were practical. Changes in the patterns and habits within the environment will do in place of the above, however.既然症状的基本成因已经克服，症状无论如何都会消失，但是速度相当缓慢。已经给出的建议，只要认真应用，就可以在很短的时间内创造奇迹。把注意力转移到其他地方极为重要，因为能量会从症状收回。只要是实际的，彻底改变环境当然好极了。然而，环境之内的模式和习惯变化确实会取代上述状况。
When Ruburt replaces the bed sheets, I suggest colored ones. As he goes to sleep this evening, have him try imagining a scene in springtime, with him walking briskly or running. When he walks now on the streets, he should keep the mental image just given in his mind, picturing the whole flexible and fleet image, and the inner self will take steps to see that the suitable adjustments are made. He should remember to give frequent suggestions pertaining to relaxation. This is extremely important.当鲁柏更换床单时，我建议用彩色床单。当他今晚上床睡觉时，让他尝试想像春天的一个场景，他在其中轻快地散步或奔跑。当他现在走在街上时，他应该在脑海里保有一个刚刚给他的心象，描绘出整个灵活又敏捷的形象，而内我会采取步骤，确保适当的调整。他应该要记得经常给出有关的暗示。这是非常重要的。
Once he has given suggestions, he should think of other things, and not check on his progress as this shows doubt. He has, you see, a negative picture of himself walking that must be replaced by a positive one.他一旦给了暗示，就应该思考别的事情，不要去检查他的进展，因为这显示他的怀疑。你看，他对自己走路有一个负面的画面，必须用一个正面的画面取而代之。
Gentle orders are fine. Attempts to bully can bring aggravations. Concentration on his writing in the morning helps rid him of symptoms, and so does concentration at nursery school, for his attention is otherwise centered. We want to develop these same qualities at other times also.温柔的命令很好。企图霸凌可能造成恶化。早上专注写作可以帮助他摆脱症状，在幼儿园专心工作也是，因为若非如此，他的注意力就会集中在症状上。我们也想在其他时间发展这些相同的特质。
His attention while walking has been centered upon his progress. He should think of other things, even he counts trees and looks about him. Activity is good for him now, you see. I emphasize the therapeutic dreams again. Whenever possible, attention should be directed away from the symptoms. This does not mean he should pretend they do not exist, but they will vanish to the extent that he directs energy away from them.在走路时，他的注意力集中在他的进步上。他应该想想别的事情，甚至是数一数树木并环顾四周。活动现在对他有好处，你知道。我要再次强调疗愈梦。不管何时，只要有可能，就应该把注意力从症状转开。这并不是说他应该假装它们不存在，而是说症状将会消失到他把能量从症状转移出来的程度。
Now we will close our session. I would be willing enough to do an envelope test, but presume you would rather wait.现在我们要结束我们的课了。我愿意做一个信封测验，但是我想你宁可等待。
(“I don’t have one ready.” )(“我没有准备信封。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both, and a good evening. Now I will do this evening what I can do for Ruburt while he sleeps, by way of redirecting his inner energies while he dreams. There should be an improvement in the morning, then.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福，祝你们有个美好的夜晚。现在，今晚在鲁柏睡觉时，我会尽力为他做我能做的事，以便在他做梦时改变他内在能量的方向。所以，早上应该就会有所改善。
(“Good night, Seth. ’’ (10:25. End of session.)(“晚安，赛斯。”10:25分，课结束。)

SESSION 324 MARCH 6, 1967 9PM MONDAY 第324节 暗示的时滞1967年3月6日 星期一 晚上9点


(Jane felt quite restless and energetic before the session, and her symptoms had subsided to a minimum after a poor night and morning. She began speaking in trance at a good pace; her eyes opened often, her voice was active, and she was smoking.)(课前，珍感觉相当坐立难安而且能量充沛。经过难受的一天一夜之后， 她的症状消退到最轻。她在出神中间开始讲话，速度很好；她的眼睛经常睁开，声音活泼，而且她抽着烟。)
Now you see, we must turn this energy outward in constructive ways, and in an exuberant fashion.现在你知道，我们必须用建设性的方式，而且是以生气勃勃的样子，把这股能量转向外在。
It has been dammed up and directed against the self. There is a need in him for excitement, but because of the maturity of the personality, the excitement now must in some manner be purposeful.它一直受到压抑而且被引导到与自己作对的方向。他需要兴奋，但由于人格的成熟，现在必须以某种方式为兴奋设定明确目标。
It seeks outlet and must find it, and must find it a manner that satisfies the creative abilities. The excitement need not be physical, though it will find some reflection in physical terms. He has enormous energy at his disposal, a large portion of which has been misdirected in the form of symptoms, and partially out of resentment.它寻求出口，非找到不可，而且必须以一种满足创造能力的方式找到出口。兴奋不需要是肉体的，但它会在肉体上找到某种反射。他有极大的能量任凭他使用。其中很大一部分被引导到错误的方向，以症状的形式呈现，而且有一部分是出于怨气。
The resentment was basic. The ESP book brought this out; that is, did not cause the resentment—the resentment was there—but allowed the resentment release. He did not feel that the publisher shared any enthusiasm from the beginning. He did feel that Wollheim did, and had no resentment toward Wollheim, though he did not publish the book. He felt Wollheim’s enthusiasm.怨气是基本的。ESP那本书把这股怨气带出来；也就是说，没有引发怨气——怨气在那里——但允许怨气释放出来。他觉得出版商打从一开始就不像他那样热中。他的确感觉韦翰是有热诚的，尽管他没有出版那本书，他也没有对韦翰怀恨在心。韦翰，尽管他没有出版那本书，他感觉到韦翰的热诚。
The power of his energies, unfortunately, can be seen quite clearly in the severity of the symptoms that the energy formed when it was so misdirected. The personal material on his background that I gave you is all part of this, of course. He felt extreme resentment at Fell generally. Since he did not want to hurt anyone, this ricocheted, affecting him. (F Fell published the ESP book.)不幸的是，这股能量被错误引导而形成症状，从症状的严重程度就可以相当清楚看见他的能量威力有多大。关于他的背景，我给你的私人资料，当然全部都是这件事的一部分。总的来说，他对费尔怀着极大的怨气。由于他不想伤害任何人，这反弹了，影响了他。(费尔出版了ESP书)
This energy is, of course, related strongly with his work, the relation is far more powerful than any strictly logical connection could ever be. The release of the energy in other directions automatically minimizes the symptoms, and will automatically negate them. They must, therefore, be used in exciting creative ways having to do with his intuitions, intellect, and creative work.当然，这股能量与他的工作密切相关。关系远比任何完全合乎逻辑的连结还要强大。能量释放到其他方向，就会自动把症状减至最轻，并且会自动让它们失效。因此，必须以令人兴奋而且与他的直觉，智识和创意工作有关的创造方式来使用它们。
When he attempts to restrain himself too vigorously, he automatically upsets the apple cart, so to speak, and it is on his head that the apples and cart fall.当他试图过于剧烈地克制自己时，可以说，他就会自动打翻苹果推车，苹果和推车全掉在他头上。
He is learning to handle, direct, manipulate and use his energy. Any serious difficulty here can automatically set forth old time bombs, that have, in the past, been denied energy, you see. When he is enthusiastically and exuberantly working, the past becomes comparatively insignificant for him as far as harmful elements are concerned.他正在学习处理、指挥、操纵和使用他的能量。这里，任何严重困难都可能自动引爆从前的炸弹，那是过去被否定的能量，你知道。当他热情洋溢而且兴高采烈地工作时，就有害的成分而言，过去对他而言就变得相对微不足道。
When an upset of balance scatters his energy then it escapes, or can, into those pitfalls. The energy is propelled outward when it is used correctly. Some of it is a result of incidents from the past. When it flows outward, the Emotional charges are used in those explosive developments of creative work.当平衡状态分散他的能量时，它就会逃逸，或可能，陷入那些陷阱之中。正确使用能量，它会向外推进。其中一些是过往事件造成的结果。当它向外流动时，情感能量就会被用在那些创意工作的爆炸性发展上。
If fear or resentment stops up the flow, then their origin, untranslated, unredeemed and un-sublimated, causes physical symptoms and disorders. The system will right itself if given any chance. The poetry is his best touchstone here. He was angry at Fell for rather obvious reasons, but the reasons involved his work, which touched upon his energy, and this caused then the unfortunate comparison between Fell and Ruburt’s father. He reacted then as Ruburt's mother reacted when deserted by the father. He adopted the same symptoms if not the disease itself.如果恐惧或怨气堵住了流动，那么它们的源头，未经翻译、未被实现也没有升华，就会引发身体的症状和失调。如果给系统机会，它就会自行修正。这里，诗是他最好的试金石。基于相当明显的原因，他生费尔的气，但其中的原因与他的工作有关，而工作又涉及他的能量，于是导致了费尔和鲁柏的父亲之间形成比较。然后，鲁柏的反应与他母亲被他父亲抛弃后的反应一样。
He did not adopt the disease itself.他采用了相同的症状，就算不是那种病本身。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:28 to 9:41.)(9:28至9:41分休息。)
Ruburts symptoms will disappear as soon as this energy is directed in the manner of which I have spoken.一旦按照我说的方式引导这股能量，鲁柏的症状就会消失。
The intuitive self' is now freed enough to make this possible, and provide the way, you see. The dream book should be finished. The resentment was not connected with the book per se, and in fact hampered the book's development.直觉的自己现在已被释放到足以使这件事成为可能，而且提供了方法，你看。谈梦的书应该要完成了。怨气与书本身没有连结，而且事实上阻碍了书的发展。
He projected his resentment into the future, and against all other publishers for awhile, anticipating the same sort of response as he felt the ESP book had received. He stopped sending our any material at all, for this reason. It is a healthy sign that he has changed his stand here.他把自己的怨气投射到未来，并与其他所有出版商对立了一阵子，预料它也会得到一样的回应，与他觉得ESP书得到的回应一样。由于这个原因，他完全停止，根本什么资料都不寄出去。这是一个健康的迹象，表明他这里已经改变立场了。
Now about the time lag on suggestions.现在来谈谈暗示的时间差距。
This has nothing to do with time, but with the intensity of any suggestion, and any countering suggestions. The most intensive will triumph, though there may be obstacles in its way Ruburt was furious.这与时间无关，而是与任何暗示，以及任何反向暗示的强度有关。强度最高的暗示将会胜出，尽管过程可能会有障碍。
(Friday morning, March 3,1967.) He thought he was being put off with the phone call. He did not admit his anger, and attempted to soothe himself with other suggestions.鲁柏气炸了。(1967年3月3日星期五)他以为他的电话被敷衍。他不承认自己的愤怒，试图用其他暗示来安抚自己。
He had, in fact, given some excellent suggestions earlier, which still served to protect him during the afternoon. These wore off and were not renewed, and the intense resentment then emerged in the symptoms.事实上，他早些时候曾给过一些很好的暗示，到了下午仍然有效地保护了他，这些暗示的效力逐渐减少，而且没有更新，于是强烈的怨气出现在症状中。
He was also angry that friends arrived near midnight, since already he felt poorly. Again he said nothing and the symptoms grew all the stronger as his desire grew to tell them to leave. The night symptoms should vanish. Without intensive constructive suggestions before sleep the personality shows the status quo relationship of its condition, whatever it is. If it is poor, the sleep is poor, and the inner intuitions denied their therapeutic functions.朋友们接近午夜才到，他也很生气，因为他本来感觉就已经很不好了。再一次他什么也没说，随着他想要叫他们离开的欲望越来越强，症状也越来越严重。夜间症状应该消失。没有睡前强烈的建设性暗示，人格都会显露其情况的现状关系，不管是什么。如果它不好，睡眠就不好，而且内在的直觉否认了它们的治疗功能。
The stimuli that can be used to absorb some of the misdirected energy in the day is no longer available. The self shows its true face. When the intuitions are allowed freedom you see they therapeutically aid the personality in sleep and refresh it. The more energy that is used on Ruburts part in exciting creative ways, the more is available, you see, for therapeutic purposes. The symptoms are denied energy and cannot survive.能够用来吸收一些白天被误导的能量那种刺激不再可得。自己露出了它的真实面目。当直觉被允许自由，你看，它们就会在睡觉时在治疗上帮助人格，使它焕然一新。鲁柏使用越多能量在令人兴奋的创造上，你知道，能够用在治疗目的上的能量就会越多。不给症状能量，它们就无法存活。
Even in sleep then, energy is used constructively. The mailing out of manuscripts with which he is pleased is automatically beneficial, in that energy is being directed outward. At his best he does lose himself in work, and finds himself; but the work must be to him exciting, highly creative and challenging. Work for work’s sake will not do for him.即使在睡眠中，也可以用建设性的方式利用能量。寄出他满意的手稿，这自动产生助益，因为能量被引到外面去。尽力而为之下，他确实在工作中失去自己，也找到自己；但是工作对他来说一定要令人兴奋、要有高度的创造性和挑战性才行。为了工作而工作对他没有帮助。
He must be in throes of creativity. This can apply to actual work on a manuscript, intellectual excitement, or intuitional discovery, but a humdrum creative ritual is defeating for him. His energy will then attempt to explode in other fashions, and denied this will feed on its origins and result in physical symptoms.他一定要为创作劳心劳力才行。这可能适用于写稿的实际工作、知性的兴奋或直觉和发现，但单调乏味的创作仪式对他来说却是令人挫败的。然后他的能量将尝试以其他方式爆炸，要是被否定，这就会以其起源为养分，引发身体症状。
The struggle between the ego and intuitional self follows here as I have told you, but with the correct use of energy these elements are balanced.我告诉过你，自我与直觉的自己之间的斗争这里随之而来，但是正确使用能量，这些要素就会平衡。
If you have no specific questions, I will end this evening's session.如果你没有特定的问题，那我要结束今晚的课了。
(“I guess not.” )(“我想没有。”)
jiuMy heartiest regards to you both, and you should find this session most helpful.我向你们两位致上最诚挚的问候，你们应该会觉得一节很有帮助。
(“Goodnight, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 10: 00.)(10点整结束。)

SESSION 325 第325节 关注症状就会强化症状


MARCH 13, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年3月13日 星期一 晚上9点
(The session scheduled for Wednesday, March 8, was not held. No envelope experiment was held this evening.)(3月8日星期三的定期课没有举行。今天晚上没有做信封实验。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Remaining symptoms can be broken by intense concentration in other areas.现在。把注意力集中在其他领域，就能够中断剩余的症状。
The critical part of the illness is over. You do not want any chronic lasting symptoms, even of lesser intensity, however. These are residue, acting on habit patterns, and they must be eventually erased.疾病的关键部分已经结束。然而，你不希望有任何慢性的持久症状，即使强度较小也一样。这些是残留物，按照习惯模式运作，最终一定要消除。
When you concentrate on a symptom you reinforce it. Ruburt should know this. I am not suggesting that you pretend the symptom does not exist, but that you quite deliberately give yourself constructive suggestion, and turn your attention immediately away quickly to other matters.当你专注在症状时，你就会强化症状。鲁柏应该知道这一点。我不是建议你假装症状不存在，而是建议你很刻意地给自己建设性的暗示，并且把你的注意力立即迅速转移到其他事情上。
In all cases emphasis on suggestions must be upon health and vitality. To concentrate upon a hand for example to see whether or not a suggestion has taken hold, is hardly beneficial. Ruburt is now at the stage where he has freed considerable energy, and this must now be utilized in constructive activity, and not to reinforce symptoms.在任何情况下，暗示都必须强调健康和活力。比方说，专注在一只手上，看看某一个暗示是否渗透入里，几乎没什么好处。鲁柏现在处于释放相当多能量的阶段，现在他必须把它用在建设性的活动上，而不是症状。
It will be highly advantageous now for him to renew projection attempts. His enthusiasm is returning as far as his work is concerned. This is automatically beneficial. Nightly suggestions should deal now with general health and vitality, and with pictures of anticipation for the following day’s activities.现在重新尝试投射，对他非常有利。就工作而言，他的热情正在回升。这会自动产生助益。每天晚上的暗示现在应该就在整体健康和活力上，而且要有第二天活动的预期画面。
Concentration should be upon his love of work, and enjoyment and simple pleasures. For now it is best that he not specifically give suggestions to any particular portion of the body, since he tends lately to concentrate upon that portion in a disadvantageous manner.专注在他对工作的热爱，以及享受和简单的乐趣上。就目前而言，最好不要针对任何特定的身体部分做暗示，因为他最近很容易以不利的方式专注在那个部位上。
We want him now too busy and joyful to accept symptoms. This will involve some work on his part, but all effort must be made. He is to make an effort to remember his dreams, get up and record them, and anticipate projection dreams. Now spring is approaching. His energy can and must be used to good purpose. Additional energy is usually available to him during spring season, and it must be used to facilitate a complete cure.我们现在想要他太忙而且太喜悦到无法接受症状。这需要他下一些功夫，但尽一切努力是一定要的。他要努力记住他的梦、起床把它们记录下来，并且预期做投射梦。现在春天快来了。他的能量可以也必须用在好的目标上。在春季，他通常可能取用更多能量，而且一定要用它来促成彻底的根治。
If it is directed into his poetry, his writing, and projection attempts, peaceful, enjoyment and pleasant social engagements, then unbelievable advancements will result. He will be in better condition than he has been in several years, and he will have learned lessons that will help him immeasurably.如果把能量用在他的诗作、他的写作，以及尝试投射、平静的享受和愉快的社交活动上，那么结果将会是令人难以置信的进步。他的状况将会比前几年好，而且他也会学到对他帮助极大的功课。
These suggestions of mine may sound simple but they are not.我的这些建议听起来可能很简单，但事实并非如此。
Concentration must be taken away from the symptoms. Periods of peaceful quiet are excellent. Periods of fearful quiet such as those of last weekend must not be indulged in. The Moods may be recognized of course, but their destructive nature must also be recognized, and concentration then directed to other stimuli.注意力一定要从症状转开。平和安静的时期是非常好的。千万不要沉迷在上个周末那种令人恐惧的安静时期。当然可以认可心情，但也要认清它们本质上的破坏力，然后把注意力集中在其他刺激上。
You may take your break and I shall continue.你可以休息一下，我再继续。
(9:18—9:26.)(9:18至9:26分。)
Now. He must change his expectations drastically. He must fully expect a complete cure and release from symptoms. Otherwise he prolongs them.现在。他必须彻底改变他的预期。他必须完全预期彻底根治和解除症状。否则，他会让它们拖得更久。
When he does not believe his muscles will work, he will not put full strength upon them, for example, and physically weakens the muscle. He must work upon his attitude. He must concentrate in other areas. Music can be extremely beneficial. Dancing can be of great therapeutic benefit. Not, however, when he concentrates upon his symptoms.当他不相信自己的肌肉管用时，他就不会——比方说——对它们使尽全力，因而在身体上削弱肌肉。他必须调整他的态度。他必须专注在其他领域上。音乐可能会非常有益。跳舞可能对疗愈会有很大的好处。但是，如果他专注在自己的症状上，就不会有效。
He uses his fingers well when he types, and he uses considerable pressure. His concentration is focused on a more intense stimuli. He forgets his symptoms to a large degree. He forgets them to a large degree at nursery school and remembers them incidentally afterward.他用手指打字很灵活，而且他按压的力道相当大。他的注意力集中在一个比较强烈的刺激上。他有很大程度忘记了症状。他在幼儿园有很大程度忘记了它们，之后又不经意地想起症状。
He felt guilty incidentally to some extent last weekend at leaving the house and putting off guests, as well he should, for his reasons were wrong.上个周末，当他为了推掉客人而离开家门时，无意间觉得有罪恶感。他是应该有罪恶感，因为他的理由是错的。
He did not want to face people that he knew. He did not want to make the effort to have a social evening with them. Going out was then an escape rather than a pursuit of pleasure, as I suggested.他不想面对他认识的人。他不想努力与他们社交一个晚上。所以出门就是逃避，而不是像我建议的那样追求乐趣。
I suggest that you change your environment and leave the apartment at times simply because there is such recognition of the symptoms within the apartment, and the change is beneficial. The breaking of habit patterns is beneficial, but this should involve a spontaneous, pleasant adventure.我建议你们换个环境，偶尔走出公寓，只因为在公寓之内有这种对症状的认可，而且这种改变是有益的。打破习惯模式是有益的，但这应该是一种自发、愉快的冒险。
I suggest you leave room for spontaneity on Fridays. Ruburt has become somewhat sensitized to the day because of the old Catholic connection of not eating meat. This has to do with the difficulty in buying groceries, the fish being an act of denial, you see.我建议你在星期五为自发留下空间。鲁柏对那一天变得有点敏感，这是因为有过去天主教不吃肉的连结。这与购买杂货的困难有关，你知道，鱼是一种否认的行为。
Earlier suggestions given by me should be heeded. He should try and see himself walking winningly down the street. When you go dancing, it would help if he wore clothes that he has worn in the past when he danced well, you see. I did not recommend, I do not recommend, Ida’s clothing, for she has back difficulties, and these were known to you.应该要留意我稍早前给的建议。他应该尝试看看自己胜利地走在街上。当你们去跳舞时，如果他穿上从前舞跳得好那时候的衣服，这会有帮助的，你知道。我没有推荐过，我也不推荐艾达(Ida)的衣服，因为她的背部有一些毛病，这些你是知道的。
(Ida is my brother Bill’s wife.)(艾达是我的弟弟比尔的妻子)
These suggestions, if faithfully followed, will result in the disappearance of symptoms.如果忠实地遵循这些建议，结果将会是症状的消失。
We will have a considerable amount of general material following all this, on health in general, and on the importance of the focusing of energy that is involved. There are many reasons for all of the suggestions given this evening, and they are significant from many standpoints.在这一切之后，我们有数量可观的一般资料，要来谈谈一般的健康，以及其中涉及的能量聚焦有多重要。今晚之所以给了这么多建议，原因很多，从很多角度来看，它们都很重要。
I will make myself better known to you when you are ready for me to do so.当你准备好，要我这么做的时候，我就会让你更加认识我自己。
You may, along with your dream suggestions, suggest that you see me on a dream projection, and I will tell you that I am I so you will know me.连同你的梦暗示，你可以暗示你会在梦中投射看见我，而我会告诉你，我是我，这样你就会知道是我。
You may take a break, or end the session, as you prefer.看你想要休息或结束这一节都可以。
(“We’ll take a short break.” (9:45 to 9:55.)(“我们稍微休息一下。”9:45至9:50分。)
Now, for your attitude, my friend.现在，来谈你的态度，我的朋友。
Praise him, without of course overdoing it (smile) but praise him when he is doing well and showing improvement, and encourage him. Do not comment overmuch about symptoms when they occur.赞美他，当然不要太夸张(微笑)，而是当他表现不错、有进步的时候赞美他，并且鼓励他。在症状发作时，不要做过多的评论。
Again do not ignore them, but do not let your comments act as a negative suggestion that already might reinforce those that he has inadvertently given himself. Comfort him when this is necessary, but the comforting should follow the lines of constructive suggestions:“You will feel better soon.”同样的，不要忽视它们，而是不要让你的评论行为成为一个负面暗示，那可能已经加强了他无意中给他自己的暗示。在必要时安慰他，但安慰他之后应该要给出几句有建设性的暗示：“你很快就会好起来的。”
Make an attempt to divert his attention. Even though this may require some ingenuity it is worth it.尝试转移他的注意力。即使这可能需要一些巧思，但是它值得。
Your attitude is also important, of course. It should not involve pity, for this reinforces the symptoms, but should involve a confident assurance, particularly when he is fearful—an encouragement on your part, of constructive activities, a comforting but not overindulgent attitude, you see.当然，你的态度也很重要。它不应该掺杂怜悯，因为这会强化症状，而是应有一种带着信心的保证，尤其是在他感到恐惧的时候——你鼓励他从事建设性的活动，一种令人安慰又不过分纵容的态度。
Your own projection attempts can be achieved now in the dream state, for you can take advantage of the time that you do not have in waking existence. A few such deliberate experiments, suggested before sleep, will give you the confidence you need to carry through on a waking projection. You need this practice, Joseph.你现在可以在梦状态实现你自己的投射尝试，因为你能够利用你在醒时的存在中没有的时间。在睡前暗示一些这类刻意的实验，会带给你进行醒时投射所需的信心。你需要这种练习，约瑟。
("Yes.” )(“是。”)
Such experiences are particularly helpful for the sense of freedom they allow you. They expand the personality in ways not available in ordinary physical existence.这样的经验对于它们给你的自由感特别有帮助。它们以平常的肉体存在不可得的方式扩展人格。
The training in manipulation of consciousness of this kind is invaluable. There are at least three different kinds of projections that you should experience in the dream state, that will facilitate waking experiences. You should give yourself projection suggestions now as a matter of course before sleep.这种意识操纵的训练是无价的。你应该在梦状态中至少经历三种不同的投射，这对醒时的体验有帮助。现在你应该把它当作例行公事一般，在睡前给自己投射暗示。
(I have been trying that lately.” )(“我最近一直在尝试。”)
It is quite beneficial to suggest you will awake at once afterward, to write the experience down. This helps to isolate it from other dream experience, and to alert you. You have sleep to consider of course, but this method is the best one of all.暗示你投射后马上醒来，把经验写下来，是非常有益的。这有助于它从其他梦经验分隔开来，并且提醒你。你当然需要考虑睡眠，但这种方法是最好的一个。
Now, unless you have particular questions, I will end this evenings session.现在，除非你有特定的问题，不然我要结束今晚的课了。
(“I guess not.” )(“我想应该没有。”)
My heartiest regards to you both, and if Ruburt will look and listen for me, he would know that he would find me.向你们两位致上我最衷心的问候，如果鲁柏要看到我和听到我，他会知道他找得到我。
(“Goodnight, Seth."(“晚安，赛斯。”
(10:10. Jane's pace at the beginning of the session was quite active and fast, her eyes open often. The tempo of the session slowed perceptibly as it progressed.)(10:10。珍在课一开始的步调非常积极又快速，他的眼睛经常睁开。课的节奏随着进度而明显变慢。)

SESSION 326 第326节 指导灵


MARCH 15, 1967 WEDNESDAY1967年3月15日 星期三
(Janes voice flat and subdued, eyes closed. Pace rather slow. Manner different than usual. Pauses.)(珍的噪音单调并压低，双眼闭着。速度很慢。举止不同于以往。有许多次停顿。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now, first, Ruburt is having some success in turning the focus of his attention away from the symptoms, and if he continues and remembers, then his progress will be speedy. He followed my suggestions several times today, with good results.现在，首先，把注意力焦点从症状移开，鲁柏有了一些成效，如果他继续并且记住，那么他的进步就会很快。他今天有几次听从了我的建议，结果很好。
Now, he would like me to say something concerning some other matters, and so I shall.现在，他想我说点别的，与一些其他事情有关的东西，所以我就照办。
In sleep, you do inhabit other planes, as I have told you. The term” spirit guides” is not the best, and Ruburt disapproves of it. The idea is quite legitimate and sound, however. I have on many occasions been with you both during such instances. As you progress, you will be able to remember more and more about such encounters.我告诉过你，在睡觉时，你确实住在其他层面。“指导灵”(spirit guides)一词并不是最好的，鲁柏不赞成。然而，这个概念很合理也很可靠。在这些情况当中，我有很多次与你们在一起。随着你的进步，你将能够记住越来越多这样的邂逅。
There is no substitute for the training that you receive as you learn the knack of remembering your dreams. The very training helps you manipulate more effectively in both ordinary waking and dream conditions.在你学到记梦的诀窍时，没有任何东西可以取代你接受的训练。正是这种训练帮助你在平常醒时和做梦状况中更有效地操纵。
In all probability you will become aware of me first either in a dream projection or in a session. The book you are reading will help you both. It can hardly cover very many points, but it is generally legitimate as far as it goes.很有可能你会在一次梦投射或一节课中首先觉察到我的存在。你正在读的书对你们两人都有帮助。它几乎涵盖不了太多要点，但大体上还算是合理。
If you call on me to help you in a dream projection, I will help you, though you may or may not remember the dream projection or my help. Joseph will find himself more likely to remember simple projections that do not involve any featured levitation. These will be the easiest for you, Joseph, to recall.如果你在梦投射中请我来帮你，我会帮你，虽然你可能记得也可能不记得这个梦投射或我帮的忙。约瑟会发现他自己比较可能记得简单的投射，其中不涉及任何明显可见的漂浮。这些是你最容易记住的，约瑟。
You should try willing yourself into another room. When you awaken in the middle of the night, try such an experiment. Your projections do involve you in extensive levitations from the dream state, but you recall only a few. The most extensive traveling is done in nightly excursions, but it is easiest to remember those dream projections that occur during naps in the day, simply because the waking consciousness is more alert.你应该尝试用意志力让自己进入另一个房间。当你半夜醒来时，尝试这样的实验。你的投射确实会让你在梦状态中进行大量的漂浮，但你只记得其中几次。最大规模的旅行是在夜间远足当中完成的，但是最容易记得的是白天小睡时发生的那些梦中投射，只因为醒时意识更加机警而已。
If possible, you should make an effort to conquer the fear involved with levitations, for the fear prevents you from recalling such experiences. Projections of a kind do also occur while the normal waking consciousness is up and about its normal chores. These are rarely remembered: that is, the waking consciousness retains no memory of them.如果可能，你应该努力克服与漂浮有关的恐惧，因为恐惧使你记不住这样的经验。在正常的醒时意识忙着处理它的正常工作时，确实也会发生某种投射。这些很少被记住：也就是说，醒时意识没有留下它们的任何记忆。
Reread the material I gave you concerning the various environments in which you may find yourselves, if you intend to embark upon this once again.关于你们可能发现自己置身其中的各式各样环境，我给过你们资料，如果你们打算再做一次，就重看一遍我给的这个资料。
You often travel together in projections, and you should be able to recall these in time.你们经常在投射中一起旅行，而且你们总有一天应该能够想起这些经验。
You may take your break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:25 break. Jane leaves rocker for straight chair. (9:37 resume.)(9:25休息。珍离开摇椅，去坐直椅。9:37继续。)
Now, your experience involved a projection, though you were unconscious when separation occurred.现在，你的经验涉及一次投射，虽然你在分离发生时没有意识。
(This refers to an experience on falling to sleep during which I saw a woman clearly. She stood in a room with bare wooden floor and, I believe, talked on a telephone [Rob's dream of March 13, 1967].)(这是指我入睡时的一个经验，我在当时清楚看见一个女人。她站在一个木地板上空无一物的房间里，而且我相信她在讲电话[罗在1967年3月13日的梦]。)
The woman was quite real, but existed in another plane of activity. She was a survival personality in your terms.
