You projected to her system of reality and the environment was pseudo-physical, the projection of her own thoughts made real in objective terms within the system.这个女人很真实，但是存在于另一个活动层面中。用你们的话来说，她是一个死后犹存的人格。你投射到她的实相系统，而且那是个伪物质环境，她自己的思想投射以客观的方式在系统之内变成真的。
You had one brief experience before this one but did not remember, where you walked along the banks of a misty river landscape. You had several other later projections that same evening that you did not recall.在此之前，你有过一个短暂的经验，但是不记得了，你在雾濛濛的河道两岸漫步。同一天晚上你后来还有几次你不记得的其他投射。
As I mentioned earlier, you do often accompany each other in your projections and I often am with you also. I give you direct experience during your projections to implement our sessions. These lessons remain a part of your total personality, though they have not been remembered in your terms thus far.我之前提过，你们在预测中确实经常相伴，而我也经常与你们在一起。在你们的投射中，我给你们直接的经验来实践我们的课。这些课仍然是你整体人格的一部分，尽管到目前为止，用你们的话来说，它们没有被记住。
Some of your environment under such conditions and at certain stages does represent what many occultists call thought forms. In one legitimate projection of yours, Joseph, you formed a vehicle, I believe. Perhaps it was a plane, so that you would not be frightened. The flying was a fact, you see, the plane was a thought form .在这样的状况下以及在某些阶段中，你的某些环境确实代表很多神秘学家所说的思想形式(though-form)。我相信，在你的一个有效的投射中，约瑟，你形成了一个载具。也许它是一架飞机，这样你就不会被吓到。飞行是一个事实，你知道，飞机是一个思想形式。
Ruburt, on one occasion, created a window thought form on the blank wall through which he actually flew, simply because he held fears and could not imagine going through a solid wall. He saw the window, incidentally, as opened, you see. (Pause.)鲁柏，有一次，在空白的墙面创造了一扇窗户的思想形式，而他实际上飞过那面墙，只不过因为他心怀恐惧，无法想象要穿过坚固的墙。顺便说一句，他还看到窗户是打开的，你知道。(停顿)
Some of the people in your dreams will be actual people you know who are also projecting. Others will he survival personalities. In some cases according to your own level of projection, some will be going about their normal lives within other planes or systems. They may or may not perceive you.在你的梦中，有些人将会是你认识的真人，他人也在投射中。其他人则是死后犹存的人格。在 某些情况下，根据你自己的投射程度，有些人会在其他层面或系统之内过着正常的生活。他们可能会也可能不会感知你。
When dream elements combine to cloud a projection, this is the work of a certain level of consciousness, trying to interpret the strange conditions. This usually occurs at certain levels where consciousness is not yet completely free of the physical body. Some of the dream elements will be thought forms.当梦元素结合起来而遮蔽投射时，这就是某种意识层面的工作，设法解读奇怪的状况。这通常发生在意识尚未完全脱离肉体的某些层面上。有些梦元素是思想形式。
Now, you form the physical universe individually and yet find it cohesive. There are similarities upon which you all agree, of environment and conditions. The same can he said of all systems into which you may project. But you must learn which portions of the environment are held by all, generally speaking, and which are not. You must learn the new root assumptions in other words. This is precisely what you are doing in your projections.现在，你们分别形成物质宇宙，却发现它具有凝聚力。环境和状况当中有着你们全都同意的相似之处。你可能投射进入的系统全部都可以这样说。但是，你必须了解，一般来说，环境中的哪些部分是大家都有的，哪些部分不是。换句话说，你必须学习新的根本假设。这刚刚好就是你在你的投射中正在做的事。
You may take your break and I shall continue. If you keep your mind on me when you give your projection suggestions, it will be easier for you to remember our encounters.你可以休息一下，我再继续。你在给自己投射的暗示时，如果把心思放在我身上，你就会更容易记住我们的相遇。
(9:57 break. (10:14 resume.)(9:57休息，10:14继续。)
I have told you that some portion of our sessions involves projection. The degree varies from session to session. There will be a time when Ruburt will project out of his body during sessions and remember what transpires while I speak through his body. When projections occur now he is not consciously aware of them. These things are not forced, you see. On other occasions we meet, so to speak. I will go into this perhaps soon, for there are the similarities here and significances, involving states of consciousness used by both Ruburt and myself, and the type of projection achieved. These have bearing on the clearness or undistorted nature of the material. Less satisfactory projections cause distortions, you see, that are characteristic features of this state of consciousness at that time.我告诉过你，我们课有一些部分涉及投射。程度因课的不同而有别。有时候鲁柏将会在课间投射出体，也会记得我透过他的身体讲话时发生的事情。现在发生投射时，他在意识上对它们毫无觉知。你知道，这些事情并不是被迫的。可以说，在我们见面的其他场合，我可能很快就会讲到这一点，因为这里有相似之处和意义，牵涉到鲁柏和我自己双方使用的意识状态，以及实现的投射类型。这些与资料的清晰度或是没有扭曲的本质有关联。你看，令人不太满意的投射会导致扭曲，这是当时这种意识状态的特征。
Ruburt's overall acceptance of me is growing, for which I can be thankful. I will want to elaborate on these points mentioned, perhaps in our next session.鲁柏对我全面接受的程度正在提高，为此我应该觉得感激。我想要详细阐述这些要点，也许在我们的下一节吧。
We will close this session unless you have questions.除非你有任何问题，不然我们要结束这一节了。
(“I guess not.")(“我想没有。”)
My best wishes to you both. I am with you, again, more often than you know, and perhaps now you can become aware of this fact.给你们两位我最好的祝福。再一次，我与你们同在的时候比你们知道的还要多，也许现在你对这个事实已经有觉知了。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(10:22 end of session.)(10:22结束这一节。)

SESSION 327 第327节 所有的思想都是投射


MARCH 20, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年3月20日 星期一 晚上9点
(No envelope experiment was held.)(没有进行信封实验。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now we will carry on a discussion begun in our last session.现在我们继续上一节开始的讨论。
Clairvoyance usually involves projection to some extent. Telepathy may or may not, according to the circumstances. Precognition requires projection, though here as with clairvoyance the projection itself may not be remembered.千里眼在某种程度上通常涉及投射。心灵感应可能会也可能不会，要看状况。预知需要投射，尽管在这里正如千里眼，投射本身可能不会被记住。
Our sessions involve projection, although the extent varies. The projection takes place on both Ruburts part and my own, and represents a psychic displacement of a kind.我们的课涉及投射，但是程度有所不同。投射既发生在鲁柏本人那边也发生在我自己这边，代表一种心灵的移位。
On some occasions our separate personalities may merge during sessions. At other times Ruburt may be projecting so well that his personality is relatively absent, and my projection in his place is relatively (underlined) complete.在某些情况下，我们分开的人格可能会在课间合并。在其他时候，鲁柏的投射可能如此顺利，以至于他的人格相对而言是不在场的，而我在他位置的投射相对来说(划线)是比较完整的。
Distortions occur at transitionary points, or at points of imbalances. There is a meshing then of data from various levels. A projection obviously need not be conscious. The waking self may be engaged in normal activities while the inner self is someplace else entirely. There are more brief periods of forgetfulness however than people usually realize, and in these periods often projections have occurred.扭曲发生在过渡点或是在不平衡点上。然后是来自各个层级的资料接合。投射显然不需要有意识。醒时的自己可能从事正常活动，同时内我则完全在别的地方。然而，有遗忘期，时间比人们通常意识到的还要短，而投射经常发生在这些时段中。
Projections continue in the waking state, beneath it, as they continue beneath the dreaming state, you see. Now you have learned the methods at least that allow you to become aware of some projections that occur during the dream state. You realize that knowledge alone is not enough, that practice and ability play a considerable part. There are methods that will allow you to catch yourself in the middle of projections embarked upon from the waking state. This is considerably more difficult.投射持续在醒时状态中进行，在它之下，如同它们在做梦状态之下持续进行一样，你知道，现在你已经知道许多方法，它们至少可以让你觉知一些在梦状态中发生的投射。你明白光靠知识是不够的，练习与能力扮演一个举足轻重的角色。有一些方法能够让你正从醒时状态投射而出的当下觉察自己。这件事的难度高多了。
It can only be achieved as a rule after some proficiency has been gained with recalling dream projections. Here you are dealing with the waking consciousness in its normally strong and dominant condition. You must be able to let it operate and yet perceive beneath its surface the other conditions, the projection conditions, that are also operating.一般来说，唯有在记得梦中投射上达到某种程度的熟练，才能做到这一步。这里你正在醒时意识通常强大而且占主导地位的状况中与它打交道。你必须能够让它运作，却也要在它的表面之下感知其他也正在运作中的状况，投射的状况。
You must allow the normal waking consciousness to become transparent, so to speak, without however disturbing its flow. When this is accomplished you can also become aware of the projection conditions. This is almost like working backward, for directly beneath the thoughts and impressions of waking consciousness, you will glimpse dream images like those that appear just as you fall to sleep.可以说，你必须允许正常的醒时意识变得透明，而不干扰它的流动。完成这一步之后，你也可能觉察到投射的状况。这几乎就像逆向运作一样，因为在醒时意识思想和印象的正下方，你会瞥见梦意象，就像你刚入睡时出现的那些画面。
These also must be allowed their motion and should not be hampered. Beneath these however you will senseeither light or darkness, images of light or darkness, and these will lead to the projection conditions or environment. The only way to prove waking projections of this type to yourself is by following this method.还得允许这些梦意象流动，不应该阻碍它们。然而，在这些之下，你会感觉到光明或黑暗，光明或黑暗的意象，而且这些将会形成投射的状况或环境。要向你自己证明这种类型的投射，唯一的办法就是采用这个方法。
You are not attempting a projection here. You are following levels of your own consciousness until you discover yourself in an environment of which the ordinary waking consciousness had been previously unaware. This is a relatively difficult feat, for the waking consciousness must not be shut off, or you defeat your purpose.这里你并不是在尝试投射。你是在跟着你自己的意识层面走，直到你在一个你先前觉察不到平常醒时意识的环境中发现你自己为止。这是一个相对困难的技艺，因为一定不可以关闭醒时意识，否则你是无法实现目标的。
Obviously the self that engages upon this study is not the waking normal consciousness, which becomes instead part of that which is studied, so another portion of the self is brought into activity. All of these exercises provide training that helps you in all your other work. This particular exercise however definitely requires some success in the recognition of dream projections.显然，从事这个研究的自己不是醒时的正常意识，反之，它变成被研究的那个意识的一部分，因此自己的另一部分开始活跃起来。这些练习全都是训练的机会，可以帮助你完成其他所有的工作。但是，肯定稍微能够成功认出梦中投射，才有可能做这个特定的练习。
You may take a brief break and I shall continue.你可以稍作休息，我再继续。
(9:24 to 9:30.)(9:24至9:30。)
Now. This is a complicated maneuver.现在。这是一个复杂的动作。
The ordinary waking consciousness is left intact, you see. Another portion of the self catches it unaware, leaves no ripple upon its surface, and looks beneath it to other layers of reality. You are watching the self in motion.你会发现，平常的醒时意识原封不动，你看。自己的另一部分不知不觉中抓住了它，没有在它的表面上掀起任何涟漪，而且望向它之下的其他实相层面。你正在观看着行动中的自己。
It goes without saying that the part that watches also belongs to the self, but it does not belong to the self as the self is thought of in usual psychological terms. You are bringing into operation, and exercising a higher faculty, and through these exercises this faculty matures.不用说也知道，观看的部分也属于自己，但它并不属于按照惯常心理学术语来说自己以为的自己。你正投入运作中，运用更高的能力，而且透过这些练习，这个能力就会成熟。
It matures as far as the normal you is concerned, you see. You are able to use more and more of its abilities. I am telling this to you because you may find that you are performing this exercise spontaneously. You are about ripe for it. This other self, or portion of the self, can be utilized also in dream projections and in deliberate projections, it is the part of Ruburt with which I normally work.就正常的你而言，它会成熟。你能够使用越来越多它的能力。我之所以告诉你这件事，是因为你可能会发现自己正自发地做这个练习。你准备好了。这另一个自己，或自己的这个部分，也可以用在梦中投射和刻意的投射中。我通常就是和鲁柏的这个部分一起工作。
We must use analogies. It can be thought of as the most exterior projection of the inner ego. When you find yourself, so to speak, watching what you think of as the ego, then you are in contact with this portion of the self. It is aware of both conscious and subconscious motivations and realities, and it is also aware of projections into other fields of actuality. I have hinted before of these matters, for when I say that you will use this other portion of the self to examine waking consciousness and probe beneath it, I already presuppose a you that uses this self. In other words, you are already magnifying the limitations of the self and extending them.我们必须使用比喻。可以把它想成是内在自我最外在的投射。当发现自己，可以说，看着你以为的自我时，那么你就是在接触自己的这个部分。它对有意识与潜意识的动机和实相都有觉知，而且对于进入其他现实场域的投射，它也有觉知。之前我已经略微提过这些事，因为当我说你将会使用自己的另一个部分来检视醒时意识并在它之下进行探究时，我已经预设一个使用这个自己的你。换句话说，你已经在扩大自己的限制并且扩展它们。
The self grows as you use it. Its potentials always exist, on the one hand. On the other hand, if you did not utilize them they may as well not exist now, for your purposes. The whole self is being expanded, is beginning to know itself, for it always was what it will appear to be. Yet until it realizes this, its existence cannot be valid completely in terms of self knowledge or realization.自己随着你的使用而增长。一方面，它的潜力始终存在。另一方面，如果你不使用它们，那么出于你的目的，它们现在倒不如不存在。全我正在被扩展，正在开始认识它自己，因为过去它一直都是它未来将会显现的样子。然而，在它了悟这一点之前，就自知或了悟而言，它的存在不可能完全有效。
There are, again, no limitations to the self, but those that you create. These become valid limitations for all practical purposes however. When you learn, and you are learning, to extend the limitations of your self, you simply become aware of what you are already. You become more aware, but there is always more to become aware of.再一次，自己是没有任何限制的，有的只是你创造的那些限制。然而，基于为了所有实际的目的，这些都变成有效的限制。当你学习，而且你正在学习，扩大你的自己所受的种种限制，你只会觉察到你已然所是的自己。你变得有觉知，但是总会有更多需要你变得有觉知的。
In one respect, and in quite a legitimate and objective manner, all thoughts are also projections. They leave you in an objective actual manner, and exert an objective effect. They are a part of your psychic identity projected outward, yet you do not feel any loss. Nor are you aware of what happens to these thoughts. You could not retain simultaneously all and exert all the thoughts of your lifetime thus far in any normally conscious way. To do so would be psychological suicide.在某一方面，而且是以相当合理又客观的方式，所有的思想也都是投射。它们以一种客观又实际的方式离开你，并且发挥客观的效果。它们是你向外投射的心灵本体的一部分，可是你不会感觉有任何损失。你也不会觉察到这些想法发生什么事。到目前为止，你无法以平常有意识的任何方式同时保留并且运用你一生当中所有的思想。这样做是心理自杀。
You do retain coded memory of these. The thoughts themselves, also psychic realities, were projected outward, changing and affecting the physical environment in direct and objective terms. They acted independently of you after their projection. Nevertheless they changed your (underlined) environment. Indeed, they form the environment.你确实保留这些的编码记忆。思想本身，以及心灵实相，都被向外投射，以直接和客观的方式改变和影响物质环境。在投射之后，它们的行动独立于你之外。虽然如此，它们改变了你的(划线)环境。实际上，它们形成环境。
Various levels of consciousness are projected from the self in much the same manner. They are united however as interior and subsidiary identities that are a part of your own, and they are sent out by the inner self for various reasons. The thought is a psychological reality, a psychological and psychic identity but not a structured personalized identity. The self may send out fragments of itself in projections. These may or may not be structured personalized identities though they will be dependent for their existence upon the whole self.自己以大同小异的方式投射出不同层次的意识。但是，它们作为你自身一部分的内部和附属本体结合在一起，并且由于各种原因，内我把它们发送出去。思想是一种心理实相，一种心理和心灵本体，但不是一个结构化的人格化本体。自己可能会在投射中发送出它自身的片段体。这些可能是也可能不是结构化的人格化本体，但是它们的存在将取决于全我。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:5 5 to 10:09.)(9:55至10:09。)
You will become practically concerned with the extension of the self as you know it in these terms. You will become intimately aware of this other portion of the self very shortly.在这些方面，你将开始在实际上影响你所知的自己的延展。你很快会密切的觉察自己这另一个部分。
Now I have little to say concerning Ruburts condition. I have said what is important and the suggestions that I gave you in the last two sessions still apply. He is learning.现在，我对鲁柏的病情没有什么可说的。我说过的重要事项以及我在前两节课给你们的建议仍然适用。他正在学习。
Now give us a moment please.现在请给我们一点时间。
(Pause, eyes closed.) There is a circumstance happening in another place that will concern you both. (Pause.) I do not know if it refers to Ruburt’s father, but it is to the south of you, and there are papers involved. A S and a scribbled note. A reference to an old date. The late 1800 s, or that is... (pause)... 18 (pause) 76 or 86.(停顿，眼睛闭着)发生在另一个地方的一种情况将会让你们两人担忧。(停顿)我不知道这是不是指鲁柏的父亲，但它在你的南方，而且其中涉及文件。一个S和一张潦草的字条。提到一个旧的日期。1800年代后期，或者那是……(停顿)……18(停顿)76或86。
A reference to a box with private papaers and with legalities. A death of a male seems involved. Perhaps this is the death of your sister-in-laws father, however.提到一个盒子，里面有私人文件而且是法律文件。似乎涉及一名男性的死亡。不过，也许是你弟媳的父亲去世。
We will now close this session. My best wishes to you both. The last data did involve now a projection of a kind, you see.现在我们要结束这一节了。给你们两我最好的祝福。你知道，最后的这个资料现在确实涉及一种投射。
("Good night, Seth.(“晚安，赛斯。
(End at 10:19 Jane said that with the above material, she had a feeling almost like a “ray out" in a southern direction—a strong concentration being sent out in a southerly direction. But she didn't feel that she was actually traveling.(10:19结束。珍说，传述上面的资料时，她几乎有一种像是朝着南方“向外发射”的感觉——一股强大的专注力被发送到一个朝南的方向。但是她并不觉得自己真的在旅行。
(During the session, Jane's eyes had opened often, her pace had been mostly average with pauses, her voice average.)(课间，珍的眼睛经常睁开，她的速度大多数时候不疾不徐，偶有停顿，声音普通。)

SESSION 328 第328节 投射


MARCH 22, 1967 9 PM WEDNESDAY1967年3月22日 星期三 晚上9点
(This was a short session. Jane had a head cold, and we had a session scheduled for the weekend for Claire Crittenden and Pat Norelli.)(这是一节短课。珍感冒鼻塞，而且我们预定在周末为克莱儿·克里特登[Claire Crittenden]和佩特·诺瑞利[Pat Norelli]举行一节课。)
We will have a brief session this evening, since you will have one over the weekend.今晚我们会有简短的一节课，因为你们周末将举行一节。
I did want to make a point however. Some projection environments will not, of course, appear physical in your terms, and in your terms will therefore lack the suitable characteristics of reality.不过，我确实想要指出一点。当然，某些投射环境在你们看来并不是实质的，因此在你们看来，缺乏适当的实相特征。
Your own system has those characteristics only to those entirely focused within it, however. You will only be tourists. You give stability and coherence to your own system. It does not have these characteristics on its own. Legitimate projection environments are as real as the physical environment.但是，你们自己的系统具有的那些特征，只适用于完全聚焦在其中的那些。你们只是旅客。你们让你们自己的系统维持稳定和一致。它本身是没有这些特征的。有效的投射环境和实质环境一样真实。
These environments may appear distorted to you, but the distortion is usually your own and not that of the environment. Vast differences of magnetic vibrations are concerned here, and projecting it will be difficult for you to maintain the steadiness necessary to hold to the necessary vibrations to which others, inhabitants of the systems, will be more or less automatically attuned. In parenthesis—(as you are automatically attuned to the physical system). Each successive projection makes it easier for another such experience to occur.这些环境在你们看来似乎是扭曲的，但扭曲通常是你们自己的，而不是环境的扭曲。这里关系到电磁振动的巨大差异，因此投射它对你们来说难以保持必要的稳定，进而维持各个系统中其他居民或多或少会自动对准的必要振动。用括号——(就像你们自动对准物质系统一样)。随后每一个投射都会让另一个这样的经验更容易发生。
Did you have any specific questions for me?你有没有特定的问题要问我？
(“I don't believe so.” )(“我相信应该没有。”)
The material I just gave you really belongs in our previous session.我刚才给你的资料其实属于我们的上一节课。
We will have a weekend session and our regular Monday session. I will close this one however, unless you do have anything specific that you wish to ask.我们在周末会有一节课，还有星期一的定期课。但是，除非你特别想要问什么，不然我要结束这一节了。
(“I guess not.” )(“我想没有了。”)
One point. When you turn on a radio to a particular station and find that it is distorted by static, you realize that the distortion is in the reception. This same idea should be applied to projection experiments. There is nothing wrong with the station, but with your reception of it.一个重点。当你把收音机转到一个特定的电台，发现它因为静电干扰而扭曲时，你了解到扭曲发生在接收中。同样的概念应用在投射实验上。电台一点问题也没有，而是你接收它有问题。
I have helped Ruburt to some extent in his own projections, though he does not remember them.我在鲁柏自己的投射中某种程度帮了他，但他不记得了。
My heartiest wishes to you both.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福。
(“Goodnight, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(9:16. Jane's pace was rather slow, with pauses. Her eyes were closed.)(9:16。珍的速度相当缓慢，时而停顿。她的眼睛闭着。)

SESSION 329 第329节 思想是世界的种子，世界是宇宙的种籽


MARCH 25, 1967 8:30 PM SATURDAY1967年3月25日 星期六 晚上8:30分
(A very successful session was held this evening for Claire Crittenden and Pat Norelli. The session was taped by Pat. She is a teacher in a Boston high school and has taken the tape to school; when she sends a transcript of the session it will be given below.(今天晚上，为克莱儿·克里特登和佩特·诺瑞利举行了一节非常成功的课。这一节由佩特录音。她是波士顿高中的一名老师，而且把录音带拿到学校去；她寄来这节的誊稿之后，会将它附录在下文。
(The first part of the session concerned data about a man Pat is interested in, Brian Houlihan, of Elmira. As will be seen, Seth handled this material very well, bluntly and to the point in no uncertain terms.(这节的第一部分，是与佩特感兴趣的埃尔迈拉的一个男人，布莱恩·胡立汉[Brian Houlihan]有关的资料。下文会看到，赛斯把这个资料处理得非常好，直截了当又切中要点，没有任何不确定之处。
(The balance of the session was material Seth delivered to be played for Pats high-school class of exceptional students, and is, we think, excellent. The students are acquainted with Seth through Pats efforts, and this enables Seth to get to the point concerning the idea of the material.(这节剩余的部分，是赛斯为佩特的高中特教班学生传述录音给他们听的资料，我们觉得这个资料非常好。在佩特的努力下，学生们认识了赛斯，这让赛斯能够直截了当说明资料的概念。
(This material was given in two sessions of about 20 minutes each. We thought the session ended with the first 20. minute delivery, but after a break Jane returned as Seth for more material. The presence of witnesses encouraged her; strong voice effects began to show themselves, the best in many sessions and toward the end of the Pat ’s delivery. Jane achieved a projection to the Boston classroom of Pats special class. In many ways Jane regards this session as one of the best ever. Toward the last part of the session her delivery was very strong and forceful very fast and emphatic and impressive; her eyes were closed for the most part, and she was really out.(这个资料分两段给出，每段约20分钟。我们以为这一节在最初20分钟述之后就结束了，但休息后珍再次以赛斯的身分返回，给了更多资料。见证人的在场鼓舞了她；强烈的声音效应开始自行展现，是很多节以来最好的一次，而且在佩特的传述快要结束时，珍顺利投射到佩特在波士顿教班的教室。在很多方面，珍认为这是有史以来最好的一节课。在这一节最后的部分，她的传述非常强大有力；非常快速而且语多强调，令人印象深刻；她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着，而且她真的出去了。
(Jane has her own notes on this session, and they may be included with these in these records. She took some little while to come out of the trance at the end, a fact attesting to the depth and effectiveness achieved. She achieved a legitimate projection to the classroom in Boston, and Seth deals with this to some extent in the next session. Jane believes she might have delivered much more evidential material had I asked questions; but I did not know whether to or not, fearing I might break continuity.(珍自己为这一节写了笔记，这些笔记可能会包含在这些记录中。最后她花了一些时间才回过神来，这个事实证明已经达成的深度和效力。她投射到波士顿的教室，赛斯在下一节某种程度上解答了这个问题。珍相信，如果我有发问，她可能会提供更多佐证的资料；但我怕会中断连续，所以不知道要不要发问。
(More notes may follow. Pats notes are typed up for insertion here.(可能会有更多笔记。佩特的笔记被打成字，以便插入这里。
(First section, concerning Pat Norelli and Brian Houlihan.)(第一段与佩特·诺瑞利和布莱恩·胡立汉有关。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth. ’’)(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. My welcome, of course, to our friends. I will speak fairly slowly then, Joseph, for your records.现在。当然，我欢迎我们的朋友。我会说得很慢，约瑟，方便你做记录。
(“Would you rather speak at a faster rate?)(“你比较想用更快的速度说话吗？”)
It makes little difference to me. We shall see. Give us a moment. (Pause.) These are impressions: 3 6. I will pick this up later. There are rather severe difficulties involving the male. (Meaning Brian) They are psychological problems, and there is an identification on the part of the questioner (Pat) this evening, an identification of a strong nature with the male. There is a confusion of identity here, and this is the basis of the questioner's problem.这对我没有多大影响。我们走着瞧。给我们一点时间。(停顿)这些是印象：36。我待会儿再看看。这名男性有相当严重的问题(意思是布莱恩)。它们是心理问题，而且今天晚上发问者(佩特)有一种认同，认同这名男性的强大本质。这里有一种本体的混淆，而这就是发问者的问题根据。
There is a strong and rather aggressive nature beneath the surface personality of the questioner, of which the questioner is frightened, to some extent therefore a divided self. The male is passive and of a submissive mind, and given to an obsession with over consideration for security. He will always seek security, but he enjoys being the object of a chase of this nature.在发问者的表面人格之下有一种强大又颇具侵略性的本质，发问者对此感到恐惧，所以在某种程度上是一个分裂的自己。这名男性是被动的，有一个顺从的心智，并且经常过度顾虑安全而偏执。他会一直寻求安全感，但他也乐意成为这种性质追逐锁定的对象。
The questioner is obviously the hunter. The questioner also enjoys the chase for the sake of a chase. It is the chase that is important to both personalities. The questioner deludes herself. The object of the chase is not the important point. The excitement involved in the chase is important, and the energy, the vital energy used is being directed away from its proper purpose.发问者显然是猎人。发问者也喜欢为了追逐而追逐。对两个人格都重要的是追逐。发问者欺骗她自己。追逐的对象不是重点。追逐过程中的兴奋很重要，而能量，所使用的生命能量正偏离它的正确目的。
The proper purpose should be the development of the self, and the development of abilities, and it is to elude this responsibility that the chase was originated. The excitement of the chase is being substituted for the excitement that is required and demanded by the questioner, and rightly so because of the questioner’s psychological makeup.正确的目的应该是自己的发展，以及能力的发展，而追逐的起源就是为了逃避这个责任。追逐的兴奋被发问者要求和索求的兴奋取代，而且由于发问者的心理结构使然，理当如此。
The excitement however is counterfeit at present. The questioner hunts out an object, another personality, when she basically believes the personality is unattainable. The other personality is not sought for because of any inherent qualities of his own. He serves, instead, as a substitute in a quest that the questioner has not yet begun.然而，目前这种兴奋是冒牌货。当发问者基本上相信这个人格求之不得的时候，她就会出猎一个对象，另一个人格。因为他自己与生俱来的任何特质，所以另一个人格没有被追求。相反的，他在发问者尚未开始的追求当中充当替代者。
The questioner is indeed on a pilgrimage to find her own personality. You cannot substitute some other personality, you see. It would work very well, but it does not work that way.发问者确实是走在寻找她自己人格的朝圣之路上。你无法取代某个其他的人格。虽然它会很管用，但不是用那样的方式。
There are definite reasons why the questioner chose the particular personality for this quest. An attempt was made to find a suitable substitute, you see, and a particular group of circumstances then seized upon, in order to initiate the proceedings. The questioner is subconsciously aware of those abilities that should be developed in her own personality, and attempts to project these outward into someone else. Then you see you search for the someone else, neatly labeled, but the capabilities and personality developments must be pursued within the self. You cannot chase after them and possess them by pretending they belong to someone else.发问者的追寻为什么选择特定的人格是有一定原因的。试图找到合适的替代品的一个举动，你看，然后抓住一组特定的情况，以便启动一连串事件。发问者在潜意识里觉知那些应该在自身人格当中发展的能力，而试图把这些能力向外投射到别人身上。然后你看你去找别人，干净利落地贴着标签，但是追求能力和人格的发展却必须在自己之内。你无法假装它们属于别人，借此追求它们和拥有它们。
You must know your own personality and develop your own abilities, and this should be your quest now. There is a strength of character, and indeed a rather heartless determination. These can be used to strengthen the framework and extend the limitations of your own personality. You are not developing your abilities, but using vital energies in pursuit of something that you do not basically want to attain.你必须认识你自身的人格，并且发展你自身的能力，这才是你现在应该追求的。性格的力量是有的，而且确实是一种无情的决心。这些可以用来增强架构，以及扩大你自身人格的限制。你不是在发展你的能力，而是利用生命能量追求某个你基本上不想要得到的东西。
You need the excitement vivid in the pursuit, but this excitement will be increased by far when your energy is used to perfect and develop your own personality. You are in effect putting the responsibility for your own development where it does not belong, and turning your destiny over to another person in a very real manner, in order to escape taking full responsibility for your own destiny.你需要在追求中鲜活的兴奋，但是当你把能量用在提升和发展自身的人格时，这种兴奋会大为增加。你实际上正把为自身发展的责任放在它不属于的地方，而且以真实的方式将你的命运移交给另一个人，为的是避免为自身命运承担全部的责任。
You fear the aggressive portions of your own personality, and instead of allowing these portions to work for you, you are sending them out on a counterfeit journey after an object, another person, with whom you would not be happy, and for whom you have little basic respect.你对自身人格当中具有攻击性的部分心生恐惧，所以你不是允许这些部分为你效劳，反而把它们送上一趟仿冒的旅程，追逐一个对象、另一个人，但你并不满意他，对他的基本尊重也很少。
Telepathically you were aware of the full nature of the males relationship with his mother. You chase him precisely because you were fairly certain you would not have him, for it was the search, again, that was important. It is a substitute for facing your own destiny. It is a counterfeit living pattern, and you are using it to avoid developing your full strength and stature as a personality.经由心电感应，你对这名男性与他母亲的关系本质全部了然于心。你之所以追逐他，正是因为你相当肯定不会拥有他，因为重要的，再说一次，是寻觅本身。它是面对你自身命运的替代品。它是一个仿冒的生活模式，你正利用它来逃避，不去发展你自己作为一个人格的全部力量和境界。
You would not be happy with the male, and you intuitively realize this. The obsession to have him grows precisely in proportion to your inner realization that you do not want him, but only the excitement involved in searching for him. You must end the search and face the self.你不会满意这名男性的，而且你在直觉上明了这一点。想要得到他的这份痴迷程度正好与你内心明白自己不想要他的了悟成正比，但是在寻觅他的过程中只有兴奋。你一定要停止寻觅，而对自己。
You have a full stature as a personality that you are not reaching. There is a self into which you shall grow, a strong intuitive self in full control of its own destiny so far as is possible. This is the self that you cannot deny, and this should be the object of your search for now.你作为一个人格拥有一整个境界，你却不去追寻。有一个你应该可以长成的自己，一个强大的直觉自己，能够尽可能全然掌握它自身的命运。你不能否认的就是这个自己，而且这才是你现在应该寻觅的对象。
Nor would such a counterfeit pattern suit you for long. self questioning and doubts would begin to drive you to distraction. You have inner strength that will give you your own sense of identity and continuity. Any inner security will come from this. You cannot abdicate, you see.这样的仿冒模式适合你的时间也不长。自我质疑和怀疑会开始让你分心。你拥有的内在力量将会带给你自身的认同和连续之感。任何内在的安全都是来自于此。你不可以弃权退位，你知道。
I have been speaking rather steadily, Joseph, without a break, for my friend Ruburt does not like me to speak so plainly, and I would prefer continuing briefly.我一直说着话，几乎不间断，约瑟，没有休息，因为我的朋友鲁柏不喜欢我说话这么坦率，但我比较想要再继续一会儿。
(“Go ahead.” )(“尽管说吧。”)
Before a break. You have not been facing yourself and you are trying to substitute another for the part of yourself that you will not face. You have inner stability, but you are in danger of losing inner stability whenever you try to project this upon someone else. The excitement involved in this chase is something like the excitement you feel speaking to your good students. In the one case it is the wholesome and joyful result of the expenditure of psychic energy. In the other case it is the counterfeit expression. It is a turning away from and not going toward.在休息之前。你一直没有面对自己，而是设法用另一个人代替你不愿面对的那一部分自己。你拥有内在的稳定性，但是每当你试着把它投射到别人身上时，你就有失去内在稳定性的危险。这场追逐涉及的兴奋就像你对着好学生说话时感受到的兴奋一样。在一种情况下，它是心灵能量支出造成的结果，有益健康又令人喜悦。在其他情况下，它是仿冒的表达方式。是转过去，而不是走过去。
I will indeed give you a break and we shall continue. We shall continue if you prefer me to continue.我真的要让你休息一下，我们再继续。如果你比较想要我继续，我们就继续。
(Break at 9:07. Jane's pace had been quite fast, much faster than usual; her voice had been deeper and stronger to some extent, her eyes open at times and very dark. Resume at 9:24.)(9:07休息。珍的速度非常快，比平常快多了；她的声音在某种程度上更深沉、更有力，她的眼睛时而睁开，颜色非常深。9:24继续。)
It is time for you to finish with childish games. They are draining your energy and they are keeping you from learning your own destiny. Now, if you have questions by all means ask them.现在是你结束幼稚游戏的时候了。它们正在耗尽你的能量，而且它们正妨碍你认识你自己的命运。现在，如果你有任何问题，尽管问吧。
([Pat:] “What talents have I to offer the world?” )(佩特：“我有什么才能可以贡献给这个世界？”)
First of all, the teaching ability is a good one, but it is being hampered and not developed simply because you are using vital energy in this counterfeit manner. Your abilities as a teacher will not be fully developed until you realize the potential of your personality.首先，教学能力是很好的一个，但是它受到阻碍而没有得到发展，只因为你正以这种仿冒的方式使用生命能量。在你明白你的人格潜能之前，你无法充分发展身为教师的能力。
(Seth’s pace was very fast in here, and I missed some material. I did not ask Seth to slow down, both in the interests of spontaneity for Jane, and because Pat was recording the session. Seth now told Pat she had writing ability, especially for historical works, and that she would do well in writing and history connected with the Tudor period.)(赛斯在这里的速度非常快，我错过了一些资料。为了顾及珍的自发，也因为佩特正在为这一节录音，所以我没有要求赛斯放慢速度。赛斯此时告诉佩特，她有写作能力，尤其在历史作品方面，还告诉她，与都铎时代有关的写作和历史方面，她会做得很好。)
...Give us a moment. (Pause.) You would do well with male characters and be fairly strong in plotting. You must above all things avoid superficialities, for you use them as excuses. You laugh at yourself, and then think that this means that you do not have to take yourself seriously.……给我们一点时间。(停顿)你描写男性角色很成功，而且设计情节的能力也相当强。首先，你必须避免肤浅，因为你利用它当借口。你嘲笑自己，然后认为这表示你不必认真对待自己。
You have an ability to develop awareness in young people...and to bring them to a point of enthusiasm, to spark their...no mean talent...你有能力培养年轻人的觉知……并且鼓舞他们的热情，激发他们……出色的才华。
(I missed more in here, and gave up for the moment. Seth spoke to Pat about such questions as love and marriage, feeling alone, etc. At about 10 PM, Seth spoke to Claire.)(我在这里错过更多，暂时放弃。赛斯对佩特谈到诸如爱情和婚姻、感觉孤单等等这类问题。大约晚上10点，赛斯开始对克莱儿说话。)
Now. I will address myself to our other young lady.现在。我要来跟我们的另一位女士说话。
There seems to be a potential change of interest for you, loosely within a three-year period. A change of focus, fairly complete and sudden. This may or may not occur due to other considerations. If it does occur, it will be the result of what appears to be an accident, not planned—the result of a meeting in a large city, New York, I believe, with a man. A J or A J L, somehow connected here.你的兴趣似乎有潜在的变化，大概在三年期间之内。焦点的改变，相当彻底而且突然。由于其他的考虑，这可能会也可能不会发生。如果确实发生了，那就会看起来像一个意外造成的结果，而不是计划中的事情——在一座大城市，我相信是纽约，和一个男人见了一面的结果。一个J或AJL，在这里有某种关联。
Again, the goal should be a development into the best possible self. There will be areas of contention with the young man with whom you are now involved.再一次，目标应该是发展成为最好的可能的自己。现在与你亲密和年轻男人，在许多方面会有争执。
([Claire:]” Will Bill Macdonnel be playing any part in my life?")(克莱儿：“比尔·麦唐纳会在我的生命中扮演任何角色吗？”)
No permanent part, unless drastic changes occur in both of your personalities, and this does not seem possible now. There is a psychic connection here, however, and the possibility much stronger in the past. Your ambitions should stand in the way of such a development, and the other personality realizes this.没有任何永久的角色，除非你们两个人格都发生巨大的变化，而且现在看来这似乎不可能。但是，这里有一个心灵的连结，而且这个可能性在过去大了很多。你的企图心应该会阻碍这样一个发展——而且另一个人格明白这一点。
([Claire:]” Will Robbie perhaps have influence in changing my wants for the future?” )(克莱儿：“罗比[Robbie，比尔的昵称]会不会影响我改变我想要的未来？”)
He will not be directly connected. There will be a very indirect connection here, but it is not significant. It is possible that the man will be a brother to someone you know now, or will know then.他不会有直接的关联。这里会有一个非常间接的关联，但是并不重要。这个男人可能会成为某个人的兄弟，而那个人是你现在认识的人，或是到时候会认识的人。
([Claire:]” Who will bring about the change?")(克莱儿：“谁会带来改变？”)
You will bring about the change. It will not be forced upon you by exterior circumstances.你会带来改变。外在环境不会把它强加在你身上。
([Claire:]” Can you tell me more about this A J L?” )(克莱儿：“你能不能多跟我说一些AJL的事？”)
Simply an impression, that will be connected at that time.只是一个印象而已，到那时候会有关联。
A moment. (Pause.) A party in a large room and a later meeting in a smaller room at the same establishment. An equalization. The numbers 4 3 1. Perhaps a room number or an address. I do not know. The man will be connected with an organization, or you will meet him first as a representative of some kind of an organization or bureau.稍等。(停顿)在一个大房间的一场派对，以及后来在同一个机构另一个比较小的房间中的一次课。均衡化。数字431。也许是房间号码或地址。我不知道。这个男人将与一个组织有连结，或是你初次见到的他是某种组织或局处的代表。
Now we have a brief break, and I will address myself to your students.现在我们先稍微休息一下，我再来跟你的学生讲话。
(10:15.)(10:15。)
PART ONE OF SETH’S LECTURE TO1967年3月25日
PAT'S BOSTON HIGH SCHOOL CLASS MARCH 25, 1967赛斯对佩特任教的中学班级讲课的第一部分
Now, dear friends, there is never any justification for war, and there is never any justification for killing.现在，亲爱的朋友们，战争绝对没有任何正当的理由，杀人也绝对没有任何正当的理由。
It is true that basically there is no death, but this cannot be used as an excuse within your sense-system. You have created death within your system. Since you have created it you are left to deal with it. As long as you believe that a bullet can kill a man, then it behooves you not to kill.的确，基本上没有死亡，但在你们的感官系统之内不能用这一点当作借口。你们已经在你们的系统之内创造了死亡。既然你们创造了它，你们就非得与它打交道不可。只要你们相信子弹可以杀人，那么你们就不应该杀人。
When you realize that a bullet cannot kill a man, then you will not need to kill. All of you have lived before, and many of you will live in physical form again. Some of you will be finished with earthly reincarnations after this life. There is a boy in a third or fourth seat, back from the front in the left row, toward the wall. He is on the last reincarnation within this system.当你们明白子弹杀不死人的时候，那么你们就不会需要杀人。你们以前全部都活过，而且你们当中有很多人将会以物质形式再活一次。在这一世之后，你们当中有一些人将会结束地球的轮回转世。从左边这排的前面向后，朝着墙壁，第三或第四个座位，有一个男孩。他正在这个系统之内的最后一次轮回当中。
All of you have but one responsibility, and that responsibility is to the self. Not necessarily to the self as you know it but to the whole self. It is your responsibility, you see, to develop all your abilities. It is your responsibility to materialize within your own system your own potentials.你们每个人都只有一个责任，而这个责任就是对自己的责任。不一定是对你知道的自己，而是对全我。发展你所有的能力，你知道，是你的责任。在你们自己的系统之内实现你自身的潜力，是你的责任。
I am no beady-eyed spirit. I am no granddaddy longlegs of the spirit world. I have simply lived before within your system and on your planet. Unless you have read the material, it does me little good to go deeply into any specific problems or questions, since you will not have the background for this. The only message I can give you clearly is that you must develop your own abilities. You must probe into the intuitive self, for you will find much knowledge there. Books will help you, but the greater knowledge is buried within the layers of the self. You all have abilities, and you all have liabilities. Both of these come from past experiences in other lives. The inner portions of your personality know the details of your past lives. The abilities that you have now have been developed in past lives. Those problems which you cannot solve on a psychic and mental level, you will have to solve in the physical system.我不是眼睛如珠子般又圆又亮的精灵。我不是灵界的长腿爷爷。我只是在你们的系统之内也在你们的星球上生活过而已。除非你读过这份资料，否则深入说明任何特定的难题或疑问，对我没有什么好处，因为你没有这方面的相关背景知识。我唯一能够清楚传达给你的讯息，就只是，你必须发展自身的能力。你必须探究直觉的自己，因为在那里你会发现很多知识。书会帮助你，但是在自己的各个层面之中埋藏着更多知识。你们都有能力，你们都有责任。这两者来自于其他世的过去经验。你人格当中的内在部分知道你前世的细节。你现在拥有的能力是在前世发展而成的。你无法在心灵和心智层面解决的那些问题，你不得不在物质系统里解决。
You will have to work out these problems in Sense data. That is why the abilities within your system are still working within the systems of war. There is no heaven and hell in Christian terms. However, if a personality believes strongly in the reality of hell, for some time after death he will experience the hallucination of a hell which will be of his own creation.你不得不在感知资料中解决这些问题。为什么在你们系统之内的能力仍然在战争系统之内起作用，这就是原因。没有基督教所说的天堂和地狱。但是，如果一个人格坚信地狱的实相，那么在死后的一段时间内，他就会经历他自己创造出来的地狱幻觉。
This will last very briefly. Heaven and hell, indeed, are mere representations. They represented originally intuitive insights. But no heaven or hell exist in those terms. There is no place within the universe or within any universe or system for them. You create reality according to your beliefs and expectations. Therefore, it behooves you to examine your beliefs and expectations very clearly.这个幻觉的持续时间很短。其实，天堂和地狱只不过是表象。它们代表最初的直觉洞见。但是没有那些说法所称的天堂或地狱存在。在宇宙之内或在任何宇宙或系统之内，没有它们的位置。你根据你的信念和预测创造实相。因此，你应该非常清楚地检视你的信念和预期。
Your lives at this point are the results of your own inner expectations. If you do not like your lives, then examine your expectations. Your future lives will be the result of your own expectations again. Change these expectations now if need be.你们在这一刻的生活是你们自身内在预期的结果。如果你们不喜欢你们的生活，那就要检视你们的预期。你们的未来生活同样也会是你们自身预期的结果。如果有需要，现在就改变这些预期。
Every thought in one way or another is constructed by you in physical terms. You cannot escape the result of one thought. Every thought is an actuality. It affects every action and it forms your physical environment. As you sit listening to my voice, you are all subconsciously forming the physical environment of your classroom. You are forming the physical chairs. You are forming the blackboard. You are all forming reality, as you know it. Then with your physical senses, you are perceiving that which you have already so created. If you do not like what you see, then who is to blame? For these are your own constructions , formed in faithful replica to your own thoughts. We do not have the time to explain now how this is done, but in the material we have explained it. Certain telepathic connections exist which are what we term root assumptions, of which you are all telepathically aware. Using these you form a physical environment that is cohesive enough so that you can all agree with what you see and feel and smell and touch.每一个思想都是你以某一种方式在物质上建构出来的。你无法摆脱一个思想的结果。每一个思想都是一个现实。它影响每一个动作，并且形成你的物质环境。当你们坐着聆听我的声音时，你们全都在潜意识里形成你们这间教室的物质环境。你们正在形成实质的椅子。你们正在形成黑板。你们全都在形成你们所知的实相。然后经由你们的肉体感官，你们正在感知你们已经这样创造出来的东西。如果你不喜欢你看到的东西，那要怪谁呢？因为这些是你自己的建构，是你自身思想的忠实复制品。现在我们没有时间解释这是怎样办到的，但是在资料里我们已经解释过了。有某些心电感应的连结存在，也就是我们所谓的根本假设，你们全都透过心电感应觉知到它们。利用这些根本假设，你们形成一个足够凝聚的物质环境，以便你们全都能够认同你们看到、感觉到、闻到和触摸到的东西。
It is all in one respect hallucinatory, and yet it is your reality and you must deal with it. If you do not like the looks of the adult world, then you had better change your own expectations now. The world in which your parents live is a world which they created. It existed first in thought. It existed first in mental realms. It existed first as the stuff of dreams, and from this they spawned their universe, and from this they made their world.这一切在某一方面全是幻觉，但这依然是你的实相，你不得不应付它。如果你不喜欢成人世界的样子，那么你最好现在就改变你自己的预期。你的父母生活所在的世界就是一个他们创造的世界。它首先存在于思想中。它首先存在于心智界域里。它最初的存在形式是梦中物，他们从这里开始孕育了他们的宇宙，也从这里开始创造了他们的世界。
It is the world in which you now will live, and if you will not face their problems, if you cannot solve their dilemma, it will be not their fault but your own. For you also have a hand in this. Every generation sits by. The young generation sits by, apparently helpless while the parents rule the world. But the young helpless ones mature, and they grow and they become parents. They become adults, but what about their world?它是你现在将会生活在其中的世界，如果你不要面对他们的问题，如果你不能解决它们的两难困境，那不是他们的错，而是你自己的错。因为你也在其中插了一手。每一代人都坐视不管。在父母无能为力的时候，年轻一代坐视不管，看样子是无助的。但是无助的年轻人成熟了，他们长大并且为人父母了。他们成年了，但是他们的世界呢？
What changes do they make? How many of them, after criticizing their elders, look inward into their own hearts? How many demand that they use their own potentials? How many demand the best of themselves? And it is this that you must do. Anything less is disaster. The exploration of inner space—this is your mission. It will lead you into more exciting realms than any you can imagine. It will literally reshape and remake your world. If you see but one item within your universe and it disgusts you, then look within yourself, for you have helped create it.他们做了什么改变？他们之中有多少人在批评他们的前辈之后，向内审视自己的心呢？有多少人要求自己发挥个人的潜力呢？有多少人要求自己做到最好呢？而这就是你们必须做的。若非如此就是灾难。内在空间的探索——这是你的任务。它会带领你进入更令人兴奋的界域，超乎你的想像。它会名副其实重新塑造和重新创造你的世界。如果你只看到你们宇宙之内的一样东西，而你厌恶它，那就看看你自己的内在，因为你帮忙创造了它。
You can change it in physical terms if you will. But no real change will be effected, for it will spring up again in new form. Any true progress is mental progress. You must change ideas if you would change the world. If you would end war, you must change yourself. It is the idea of war, then that you must fight.你要的话，可以在实质上改变它。但是不会产生任何真正的改变，因为它将以新的形式再次冒出来。任何真实的进步都是心智的进步。如果你要改变世界，你就必须改变观念。如果你要终止战争，你就必须改变你自己。所以你必须战斗的对象是战争的念头。
You will find exactly what you wish to find. You will make of your lives exactly what you expect to make of your lives. The beauties that exist in your physical universe are the results of constructive and positive thought. The ugliness is a direct result of negative thought.你希望找到什么，就一定会找到什么。你们预期在你们的生命中体现什么价值，就一定会在你们生命中体现什么价值。存在你们物质宇宙中的美，是建设性和正面思想的结果。丑陋是负面思想的一个直接结果。
How many of you are ill? How many of your parents are ill? The illness is a physical materiaizationl of an inner illness. You can rid yourself of the physical symptom perhaps, by taking medicine, but the illness will break out again and again. You can only rid yourself of such a condition by discovering the inner reason for it, by discovering the inner illness. And there are various ways of doing this.你们当中有多少人生病？你们的父母有多少人生病？这个病是一个内在疾病在肉体的一种物质化。你也许可以透过吃药摆脱身体症状，但病会一次又一次发作。你只有找出内在的致病原因，找出这个内在疾病，才能够摆脱这种状况。而且有多种方法可以做到这一点。
Many of these we have discussed in our sessions, and there is no time now to tell you. Look where nothing seems to be, for no place is truly empty. Where there appears to be nothing, there will be no distortion. Within that seeming nothingness, reality can show itself if you know how to look. That which appears full, that space which appears full, is misleading, for reality is already given to a rigid form.这些问题有很多在我们的课当中讨论过，现在没有时间告诉你们。去看看什么都没有的地方，因为没有一个地方真的是净空的。在看起来什么都没有的地方，不会有扭曲。在那表面的虚无之内，如果你知道怎么看的话，实相就能够显现。那看起来满满的，那看起来满满的空间，是令人误解的，因为实相已经被赋予了一个僵化的形式。
Anything that you can see and feel and touch exists within your own reality, yes, and within it, it is legitimate and valid. It is also highly distorted, for your physical senses are lovely liars that betray you constantly. They form reality for you, and yet the reality that they form is highly distorted; and what you see, dear friends, does not exist and you do not see what does exist.你可以看见、感觉和触摸到的任何东西都存在你自己的实相之内，是的，而且在它之内，它是确实又有效的。它也是高度扭曲的，因为你的肉体感官是可爱的骗子，一直不断背叛你。它们为你形成实相，但是它们形成的实相却是高度扭曲的。亲爱的朋友们，你看到的并不存在，你没看到的确实存在。
I regret the little time that I have to speak to you. I regret also the necessary limitations put upon me by this method of communication. Nevertheless I speak to you in terms of fondest affection. The voice which we must necessarily use it unfortunately, devoid now of humor, and yet I am indeed a man of humor. I give you all indeed my blessing, for I do have blessings to give. Look around you at your surroundings. Look within your surroundings. Do not trust what you see.很遗憾我跟你们讲话的时间很少。这种沟通方式带给我的必要限制，我也觉得很遗憾。虽然如此，我还是用最情深意切的语词来跟你们说话。不幸的是，我们非用不可的声音，现在一点幽默感都没有，可我真的是一个幽默的人。我确实给大家祝福，因为我确实有祝福可以给。在你们的环境里，环顾你们的四周。看看你们的环境之内。不要相信你们看到的东西。
(End of Part One, see Jane's notes at the end of session for the circumstances surrounding her delivery of this material. Most unusual.(第一部分结束，珍传述这个资料的周围情况，见这节最后她所写的笔记。很不寻常。
(Part Two. Jane resumed the lecture to Pats students after a short rest. Our discussion of the material in Part One led, we believe, to the continuance of the lecture, since we hadn’t planned it this way. Jane’s trance was now deeper, her pace faster and very emphatic; her voice began to go deeper and louder. The volume became very loud, though not as loud as it has been on a few occasions. Her eyes were closed for the most part and she sat leaning forward in her chair.)(第二部分。在短暂的休息后，珍继续对佩特的学生讲课。我们讨论了第一部分的资料，我们相信，促成这场演讲继续下去，我们并没有这种打算。珍的出神这时更深入了，她的速度更快，语气更强；她的声音开始越来越低沉响亮。音量变得很大，但没有不像曾有过的几次那么大。她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着，她坐在她的，身体往前倾。)
I am still addressing your students. You are all older than you know. There is knowledge within you that you do not realize that you possess, and you can all use this knowledge. You may think that you are 16 years old. You may think that you have existed for a certain period of years. You may think that before that time you knew nothing. You may look back to a time and remember no identity, and you wonder: Who was I then, and how did I come here?我还是在跟你的学生讲话。你们都比你们知道的还老。在你们之内有你们不知道你们拥有的知识，而且你们全都能够使用这个知识。你可能以为你是16岁。你可能以为你已经存在了一段时间。你可能以为在那段时间之前你一无所知。你可能回顾过去的某个时光，却不记得自己的本体，你纳闷着：当时我是谁？我是怎么来到这里的？
And yet a portion of you knows the answer, and a portion of you knows who you are, and the memories of your previous lives are not in your genes or in your chromosomes, but in the psychic reality that forms the genes and the chromosomes. For the identity is a different identity than the name that you bear. The physical mechanism has chromosomes indeed, but the physical chromosomes have a psychic counterpart, and the psychic counterpart is the original; and within you is the codified information containing all your past lives and all your knowledge, and it is hidden so deep within you that the subconscious as you know it does not realize the truth, for the subconscious as you know it is, indeed, a very shallow affair containing only those hidden memories from this life.可是，你们当中有一部分的人知道答案，你们当中有一部分的人知道自己是谁，你们的前世记忆并不是存在你们的基因或染色体里，而是存在形成基因和染色体的心灵实相里。因为这个本体不同于你们带着姓名的身分。身体机制确实有染色体，但是身体的染色体有心灵对等物，而心灵对等物是最初的原型。在你之内是经过编码的资讯，其中包含你所有的前世以及你所有的知识，而且它在你之内隐藏得如此之深，以至于你知道的潜意识没有发觉这个真相，因为你知道的潜意识，其实，是一个非常表浅的东西，只包含那些来自今生的隐藏记忆。
But beyond this life, and before this life, and forming this life, there are identities and there are realities and these are not dead. Identity as experience is intimate. It is a psychic reality but it exists electromagnetically. Identity, the self that you are, is made up of the selves that you were and, my dear friends, the selves that you shall be. The selves that you were still exist. The selves that you shall be already exist. The lives that you have lived, in your terms, are still being lived. There is no past, present or future.但是除了今生之外，以及在今生之前，而且形成今生的，还有本体，还有实相，这些都没有死。本体即经验是亲密的。它是一个心理实相，但它以电磁的方式存在。本体，你现在所是的自己，是由你过去所是的各个自己以及——我亲爱的朋友们——你未来将是的各个自己所组成的。你过去所是的各个自己依然存在。你未来将是的各个自己已经存在。用你们的话来说，你曾经活过的生生世世现在仍然继续活着。没有过去、现在或未来。
Time, as you know it, is a distortion brought about by the operation of the physical senses. Direct experience has no need of physical time. You exist now, period. The past, the present and the future as you know them are illusion, and yet they exist now. You can influence the past today; you can have memory of the future.你知道的时间是肉体感官的运作所造成的一种扭曲。直接的经验并不需要物理时间。你现在存在，就这样。你知道的过去、现在和未来是幻相，可是它们现在却存在。你可以影响过去的今天；你可以拥有未来的记忆。
You can draw upon the knowledge of the future today. You can change the past tomorrow. Your time is valid only within your system, and it is not particularly valid within your system. The dreams that you dream are as real as the classroom in which you sit. The dreams that you dream form your today.你今天可以汲取未来的知识。你明天可以改变过去。你们的时间只在你们的系统之内有效，而且它在你们的系统之内并不是特别有效。你梦到的梦与你所在的教室一样真实。你梦到的梦形成你的今天。
You are, in some respects, more awake when you sleep than you are when you sit in your classroom and listen to my voice. Your dreams appear as illusion to your normal waking self. Shall I tell you how your normal waking experiences appear to your dreaming self? Shall I tell you which of the two realities are more valid and which is least distorted? Shall I tell you where your abilities do originate?在某些方面，你们睡着时比坐在你们的教室里听我的声音时还要清醒。你的梦在你平常醒时的自己看来是幻相。我要不要告诉你，你正常醒时的经验在你做梦的自己看来是怎样？我要不要告诉你，这两个实相哪一个更有效，哪一个的扭曲最少？我要不要告诉你，你的能力究竟是从哪里来的？
Do you think your abilities originate with the self that sits in the classroom? What does your inner identity have to do with the self that brushes your teeth? Yet surely you are wide awake when you brush your teeth, and when you dream surely you will say you are sleeping and your consciousness is dead.你认为你的能力源自于坐在教室里的自己吗？你的内在本体与帮你刷牙的自己有什么关系？可是，当你刷牙时，你肯定很清醒；当你做梦时，你肯定会说你正在睡觉，你的意识死了。
How dead is sleeping consciousness, and where do you travel when you sleep? How many miles do you cover in a day? How many miles do you cover in a dream? How many things do you learn in a dream? You learn more things in a dream than you learn in this classroom. You learn your identity in a dream state. You have experiences even while you dream that are more real and more valid than any that you have while your eyes are wide open.睡着的意识死得有多透？睡着时你是去哪里旅行？你一天内走了几英里？你在梦中走了几英里？你在梦中学了多少东西？你在梦中学到的东西比在教室里学到的东西还多。你在梦状态中认识你的本体。甚至在你做梦时，你拥有的经验都比睁大眼睛时得到的经验更真实、更有效。
This does not mean that you must not manipulate within the physical universe. I am not telling you that you should forget your responsibilities in physical life. I am telling you that the origin and ability and power and identity has its origins deep within the personality, and that these origins have little to do with the waking self of which you are all so familiar.这并不是说你可别在物质宇宙之内进行操纵。我并不是在告诉你，你应该忘记你在肉体生命里的责任。我是在告诉你，起源、能力、力量和本体全都源自于人格深处，而这些起源与你们全都非常熟悉的醒时自己一点关系都没有。
The self that sits in class is not the self that wonders in a dream state, and the self that wonders in a dream state is, my dear friends, far more educated than the, self that sits in the classroom. The self you call yourself, what does it know? To whom must it listen? The self that you call yourself knows relatively little. It is perhaps 16 years old. Indeed, the inner identity knows, and the inner identity knows that it knows. All of you are on a threshold. Uncounted millions have been at that threshold.坐在教室里的自己并不是在梦状态中纳闷的自己，而在梦状态中纳闷的自己，我亲爱的朋友们，受过的教育比坐在教室里的自己多了很多。你称之为你自己的自己，它知道什么啊？它必须听谁的啊？你称之为你自己的自己知道得相当少。它大概是16岁吧。其实，内在本体知道，而且内在本体知道它知道。你们所有人都在一个门槛上。数不清的千百万人曾经在这个门槛上。
If you sell yourselves, this is what you will do. You will say, I am a physical organism and I live within the boundaries cast upon me by space and time. I am at the mercy of my environment. If you do not sell yourselves, you will say, I am an individual. I form my physical environment. I change and I make my world. I am free of space and time. I am part of the good mind. I am more than I know that I am, and there is no place within me that creativity does not exist. I will form the physical universe according to the picture that exists within my mind. I cannot kill, for there is only life, and life cannot be killed.如果你们妄自菲薄，这就是你们会做的事。你们会说，我是一个物质有机体，我活在空间与时间投射在我身上的边界之内。我任凭我的环境摆布。如果你们不出卖自己，你们会说，我是一个个体，我形成我的物质环境，我改变并且创造我的世界，我不受空间和时间的束缚，我是善心的一部分，我不只是我知道我是的我，在我之内没有一个地方没有创造力的存在，我会根据我心智之内存在的画面形成物质宇宙。我无法杀生，因为只有生没有死，而且生命是杀不死的。
Those of you who would change your world, then I tell you, listen: for if you would change your world you must listen to the voice within yourself. You must examine your own dreams. You must inspect the innermost portions of yourself, and from this indeed shall you be resurrected.你们当中要改变的那些人，那我告诉你，听好：因为，如果你要改变你的世界，你一定要倾听你自己内在的声音。你一定要检视你自己的梦。你一定要检查你自己内在最深处的部分，并且真的是从中复活。
For the thought shall seed the world and the world shall seed the universe. The cowering soul is, indeed, the soul who believes himself a physical being. He is therefore at the mercy of every physical camouflage. He does not realize that he is what he is. He must live in the world he has created, and it is a miserable and cruel world.因为思想是世界的种子，世界是宇宙的种籽。畏缩的灵魂，说真的，就是相信它自己是肉身存在体的灵魂。因此，他任凭每一种伪装的摆布。他不明白它就是它所是的他。他必须活在他创造的世界里，而这是一个悲惨又一残酷的世界。
The human personality is free. Any limitations are those created by itself. If you will not be limited, then do not create artificial limitations. If you would see through space and time then do not give any validity to the distortions of space and time. You can hardly follow your dreams while you consider your dreams hallucinations. You can hardly grow into your full potential if you think you are a physical creatures bounded and limited by the physical limitations of time and space, soon to fall corrupted into an early and filthy grave. If you think that is what you are, then for all practical purposes, for now, that is what you shall be. If you realize on the other hand that you are unlimited, that you are a part of All That Is, then indeed it shall be so as it is.人类的人格是自由的。任何限制都是它自身创造的。如果你不要受到限制，就不要创造人为的限制。如果你要看穿空间与时间，那就不要赋予空间与时间的扭曲任何效力。当你认为你的梦是幻觉时，你根本不可能追求你的梦。如果你认为你是一个物质生物，受困又受限于时间与空间的物质限制，不久就会英年早逝，在肮脏的坟墓里面腐烂，那么你几乎不可能发挥全部潜能。如果你认为这就是现在的你，那么在所有的实际面上，目前，这就是将来的你。另一方面，如果你明白你是无限的，明白你就是“一切万有”的一部分，那么未来就会是这样。
Shatter, then, these artificial boundaries that you have set upon yourselves, and that you have accepted from others. If you are to grow older within your system, then mature within it. Do not grow old into senility. Grow into wisdom, for the wisdom is already within you.所以，要打破你们自己设定，以及你们从他人那里接收的人为界限。如果你们要在系统之内渐渐变老，那就在系统之内长大成熟。不要渐渐衰老。要渐渐长出智慧，因为智慧已经在你之内。
The self that you shall be already exists. It you will realize your potential them you will find it is already accomplished.你未来的自己已经存在。如果你将来明了自己的潜力，那么你会发现它已经实现。
And now I give you my good evenings and my blessings, and say good evening again to you all.现在我祝你晚安，送上我的祝福，也向你们每个人再道一声晚安。
(Ends, about 12 PM. See Jane's notes beginning on the next page. See also the 334th session, and the additional data about Pats class, the room layout, etc., including the map drawn by Pat.(大约午夜12点结束。参见下一页珍写的笔记。以及有关佩特的班级、房间格局等等的额外资料，包括佩特画的地图。
(On a visit on April 15, Pat verified as much as possible the data Seth gave in the 334th session. She also confirmed as much as possible, apparently, the projection Jane achieved to the Boston classroom during this session, the 329th session.)(在4月15日来访时，佩特尽可能多核对赛斯在前面给出的资料。她也尽可能多确认，显然，珍在这一节，第329节，到波士顿教室的投射。)
27-Mar-671967年3月27日 珍·罗伯兹
NOTES ON SETH SESSION HELD SATURDAY, MARCH 25, 1967为赛斯在1967年3月25日
FOR PAT NORELLI BY JANE ROBERTS给佩特·诺瑞利和克莱儿·克里特登上课所写的笔记
(The session was particularly interesting from several standpoints as far as I was concerned.(对我来说，这节课从几个角度看来特别有趣。
(The Seth voice did come through to some considerable extent in the last portion of the session addressed to Pat's students. While the voice was not as unique—as low in pitch or as resounding, as it has been on some occasions it was definitely apparent at times during the session and sometimes it was quite startling. This is the first time in some while that the voice has come through, incidentally. We do tend to discourage it since [at] full strength it is very...strange and causes comments among our neighbors.(在这一节对佩特的学生讲课的最后一部分，赛斯的声音在相当可观的程度上传了过来。尽管声音不像它在某些场合那样独特——在音调上一样低沉或响亮——但是在课间有时它肯定很明显，有时甚至很惊人。顺便一提，这阵子以来，这种声音第一次传过来。我们确实不太鼓励这样做，因为[在]火力全开时，它非常……奇怪，而引起我们的邻居议论纷纷。
(The night of the session it literally swept me along toward the end and I want to make these comments while the affair is fresh in my mind. There seems no doubt that when the voice attains a certain...pitch or intensity—something clicks and I am simply out of it. There is a sense of great power sweeping me away and off. While this is happening I am in no condition to critically analyze my own state of consciousness. During this session, part of it at least, I seemed to be viewing a classroom, presumably Pat's; at first I looked down upon the room from above, then moved to a vertical position, searching for a particular seat. Here Seth mentioned a boy who sat there. I have no doubt that if Rob had questioned me I would have been able to describe the room. No one asked Seth to do so and, of course, all this time he was speaking through me in this voice of his. I think, though now it is difficult to recall, that I saw one rather long continuous blackboard, perhaps nearly across one whole wall. I was aware though Seth didn’t say so, that the last seats were usually empty.(上课这一晚，它名副其实带着我一直走到最后，我想要趁这件事在我脑海中记忆犹新的时候，发表一些评论。毫无疑问，当声音达到某一种……音高或强度时，似乎有什么东西“咔嗒一声”，“我”就完全出去了。有一种强大力量把我席卷而去的感觉。在这件事发生的同时，我根本无法站在批判的角度分析自己的意识状态。在这一节当中，至少有一部分时间，我好像在看着一间教室，大概是佩特的教室吧；起初，我是从上方俯视房间，然后移到一个垂直的位置，搜寻一个特定的座位。这时赛斯提到坐在那里的一名男孩。我毫不怀疑，如果罗问我问题，我是有办法形容这个房间的。没有人要求这么做，当然，这一段时间他都是用他的这种声音透过我讲话。我认为，尽管现在难以想起，但我看到连续很长的一片黑板，也许几乎横跨整面墙。我觉察到，虽然赛斯没有这么说，但最后面几个座位通常是空的。
(While the voice boomed out toward the end, I was in that classroom, certainly not in our living room. The Emotional projection at the very least was very strong—speaking out to those students—but some kind of out-of-body projection also occurred. This simply was: I could not critically comment on it at the time. I had some difficulty coming out of the trance state and did not realize the fact of the projection critically until I lay in bed.(在声音轰然而出一直到最后的同时，我在那间教室里，肯定不是在我们的客厅。至少，情感投射非常强烈——对那些学生说话——但是某种出体投射也发生了。这单纯只是：我当时无法站在批判的立场评论它，我脱离出神状态的过程有些困难，而且一直到躺在床上，才从批判的角度认知到投射的事实。
(Questions, of course, instantly come to mind. Who was in the classroom, Seth or me? One possibility here is that I do the projecting while Seth controls the physical body and uses the vocal cords to speak and to give verbal expression. I would be the perceptive mechanism in the other location while he would translate the perceptions and communicate them in physical terms. [In a usual out-of-body state it would be highly difficult for me, alone, to communicate my perceptions until I returned. ](当然，疑问立即浮现在脑海。谁在教室里，是赛斯还是我？这里有一个可能性是，在赛斯控制肉体并使用声带说话和进行口语表达的同时，我做了投射。在他翻译感知并且进行肢体沟通的同时，我就是在另一个地点的感知机制。[在平常的出体状态中，在我回来之前，我一个人很难传达自己的感知。]
(There is no doubt that Seth “comes through” much more clearly when the voice” turns on” . When it is at its best there is an odd distant quality about it as if it comes from a long way off; and a funny surging in it. It gains tremendous power but this seems to happen when a certain volume is reached. The volume is somewhat objectionable in our circumstances, living in an apartment. Perhaps this volume is a method I have chosen subconsciously to click Seth in? If so surely the two of us could find another method or certainly control the volume? While still allowing the strange buildup that precedes the “clicking in” ? I was in a very deep trance the night of the session, which deepened as the session continued. Had Rob asked questions about the room, or had someone asked again about the young man's mother 's maiden name [asked earlier] I am certain that Seth could have given the information—that“I” would have gone out after it while he spoke and controlled the mechanism. I was in no condition to offer or indeed to make any critical judgment at the time, and Seth was fully focused in delivering the statement to the students, however. I had thought when the session was over of suggesting we do this, but I was exhausted even though I knew I was having trouble snapping out of the trance.(毫无疑问，当这种声音“开启”时，赛斯“传过来”的清晰度高了很多。当它达到最佳状况时，就会有一种距离遥远的奇怪音质，仿佛来自很远的地方；还带着一种有趣的浪潮汹涌的起伏。它包含巨大的力量，但是好像要达到一定音量，才会这样。住在公寓里，音量太大在我们的状况下是令人反感的。也许这种音量是我在潜意识里选择的方法，借由与赛斯扣上连接？如果是这样，我们俩当然可以找到另一个方法，也当然可以控制音量？同时仍然允许“扣上”之前音量奇怪地加大？上课那天晚上，我在一种很深的出神中，随着课继续上下去而越来越深。如果罗问了房间的问题，或是有人再问一次这个年轻人的母亲娘家姓什么[稍早前问过]，我确定赛斯一定会给出这个资料——在他讲话和控制肉体机制的同时，“我”就在这之后出去了。当时我根本没有办法提出或实际上做出任何批判性质的决断，然而，赛斯是完全聚焦在传述这份声明给学生们听。当课结束时，我曾想过建议我们这样做，但就算我知道自己难以回神过来，我还是累坏了。
(Definitely Pat’s desire for the special session was a contributing point. I reacted to her desire; just as I react negatively to someone who is highly critical. I must react to need in this respect—and it seems necessary at this point that I feel perfectly comfortable and safe before I allow Seth to take over so completely. Yet it is not Seth’s taking over that concerns me for when he does take over I am not afraid at all. It is the idea of leaving myself vulnerable to criticism I suppose.(当然，佩特想要一节特别课的欲望是促成此事的一个要点。我对她的欲望做出了反应；就像我对很爱批评的人做出负面反应一样。我必须在这方面对需求做出反应——在我感觉完全自在又安全的这一刻之前，我是不会允许赛斯这样彻底接管的。可是，我担心的不是赛斯的接管，因为当他真的接管时，我一点也不害怕。我想问题出在让我自己在他人批判面前毫无防备的这个念头。
(A note here: Seth told Pat that she had a strong interest in history which could be utilized along with a writing ability; then Pat told us that she majored in history in college; we just took it for granted she majored in English since she teaches it.(这里加个注释：赛斯告诉佩特，她对历史有着深厚的兴趣，可以结合写作能力一起运用；后来佩特告诉我们，她在大学主修历史；因为她教英语，所以我们理所当然就认为那是她的主修。
(Seth mentioned a boy who sat in a third or fourth seat in a specific row also given—had he said, for example, fifth or sixth this would have been wrong since Pat told us the students only sit four down.(赛斯提到坐在特定一排第三或第四个座位的一名男孩——要是他说，例如，第五或第六个座位，那就错了，因为佩特告诉我们，一排只座四个学生。
(Again I'm led to see that good sitters are a definite benefit; bad sitters of course would simply be those that were distracting or pulled against me, I suppose—or those who demanded too much. A desire on the part of a sitter to know or understand is a help.)(再一次我被带去那里，看到好的坐观者是绝对有帮助；坏的坐观者当然就是让我分心或对我有抗拒的那些，我想——或是要求太多的那些。坐观者想要知道或了解的欲望，是一个助力。)

SESSION 330 第330节 珍的私人课


MARCH 27, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年3月27日 星期一 晚上9点
(This session was also a short one, primarily because Jane still had her cold. The cold, however, did not interfere with her giving a long and very successful session last Saturday evening for Claire Crittenden and Pat Norelli. See the 329th session, and our notes.(这一节也是短课，主要因为珍还在感冒。但是，感冒并没有妨碍她在上星期六晚上为克莱儿·克里特登和佩特·诺瑞利举行了非常成功的一节长课。见第329节，以及我们的笔记。)
(During that session Jane achieved outstanding voice effects, a very deep trance, and a projection to the Boston classroom of Pats special high-school class. Through her Seth delivered an excellent lecture to Pats class. Jane regards the session in many ways as one of the best yet, and wanted Seth to discuss the session this evening.(在那一节课里，珍展现出色的声音效果、非常深的出神，并且投射到佩特在波士顿的高中特教班教室。透过她，赛斯对佩特的班级发表了一篇绝佳的演说。珍认为那一节在很多方面看来都是目前最好的一节，她希望赛斯今晚讨论那一节。
(She particularly had some questions about the projection and voice.(她对投射和声音特别有一些疑问。
(She spoke for the whole session with her eyes closed. Her voice was quite a bit deeper also, but not loud; and it was very slow and with many pauses.)(在这一整节课里，她都闭着眼睛讲话。她的声音低沉不少，但是音量不大；而且非常缓慢，还有多次停顿。)
Now, good evening.现在，晚安。
("Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
There was a legitimate projection involved in our last session.我们的上一节涉及了一次真实有效的投射。
Now. Ruburt did the projecting, with my help. I supplied some of the necessary energy, even while I spoke through his organism.现在。在我的帮助下，鲁柏进行了投射。即使在我透过他的有机体说话的同时，我也提供了一些必要的能量。
The volume of the voice is the result of a buildup of power, or energy. This is a method peculiar to Ruburt. At a particular point the power becomes usable in other terms. It is of course always available during sessions if circumstances are good.声音的音量是力量或能量增强的结果。这是鲁柏特有的一个方法。在特定的一点上，力量在其他方面变成可以使用。如果情况良好，在课间当然一直都可以取用。
The volume exerts a kind of kinetic cadence that results in certain electromagnetic and biochemical changes. In this instance, he is turning the dial on full force, so to speak, and for a while he does not know how to adjust or manipulate the controls.音量给出一种动态节奏，导致某些电磁和生化的变化。在这种情况下，可以说，他正把调整按钮转到最大，而且有一段时间，他不知道怎么调节或操纵控制按钮。
I am fairly certain that I achieved excellent Emotional contact with the students I addressed; for the projection was not only of Ruburt’s perceptive mechanisms, there was a strong psychic projection on my part.我相当确定的是，我与我对他们演说的学生之间建立了绝佳的情感连结。因为投射的不仅是鲁柏的感知机制而已，我这边也有一种强大的心灵投射。
When he is away on such endeavors of course our results are excellent.当他去做这样的努力时，我们的结果当然非常好。
I have the impression of the initials H R, having to do with that session. I could have told you more had you asked me, but another voice could have broken the connection. Any such questions should be inserted as quietly as possible under those circumstances.我有个印象是首字母HR，与那一节有关。如果你问了我，我本来可以告诉你更多资料，但是另一个声音可能会破坏连结。在那些状况下，插入这类问题应该尽可能不声张。
We also have the impression of N A R or N A I R. Also the impression of a woman who was a widow.我们也有NAR或NAIR的印象。还有一个守寡女人的印象。
The projection was indeed informative, since Ruburt’s physical body was able to speak clearly and concisely while the consciousness traveled elsewhere.这个投射确实提供很多资讯，因为鲁柏的身体能够在意识转移到其他地方时，清晰又简洁地说话。
(And at this time Jane's voice was at its best—very loud and strong and powerful. Her eyes were closed. She sat leaning forward in her chair for the most part.)(此时，珍的声音处于最佳状态——非常响亮、强健又有力。她的眼睛闭着。大部分时间她都向前倾身坐在椅子上。)
I was able to get my own message across more clearly also in this manner.经由这种方式，我也能够更清楚传达我自己的讯息。
There seems to be someone in that class, or connected with our teacher, whose initials are LBJ, or who has the name of a president. Or perhaps connection with Washington—the place, I believe.那个班上似乎有个人，或是与我们的老师有连结的人，名字的首字母是LBJ，或是与一任总统同名。或也许和华盛顿——地方，我相信——有关联。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:20 to 9:33.)(9:25至9:33。)
Now. Ruburt learned several things during our last session.现在。在上一节，鲁柏学到几件事情。
He began to take steps that will serve us well in the future, and you will learn when to question him and when to remain silent.他开始采取未来对我们有好处的步骤，而你必会懂得何时向他提问，以及何时保持沉默。
When specific details are mentioned under such circumstances you may gently probe:” Is there more?” or” Do you see more?” or” Are you there?” These are general permissive questions that allow him leeway. He can still probe his environment in his own manner. Later more specific questions may be asked when he is more sure of himself.在这样的状况下，在提到具体细节时，你可以轻声探问：“还有吗？”或“你还有看到什么吗？”或“你在那里吗？”这些是可以接受的一般问题，让他有选择的余地。他仍然能够用自己的方式探索他的环境。以后，当他对他自己更有把握的时候，就可以提出更具体的问题。
Sitters as a rule are indeed a benefit, in that the Emotional impetus causes him to allow me greater freedom. In doing this he develops his own abilities also. The practice is invaluable. Obviously it will be difficult to judge a good sitter before the fact unless Ruburt follows his own intuitions. (Long pause, eyes closed.)一般来说，坐观者确实是一个助力，因为情感动力促使他允许我拥有更大的自由。这么做，他也发展出他自己的能力。这种做法是难能可贵的。显然，除非鲁柏跟随他自己的直觉，否则很难在事实之前判断坐观者的好坏。(长时间停顿，眼睛闭着)
In the future perhaps we can give you some other details concerning your friend’s existence, and daily environment. (Meaning Pat Norelli.)关于你朋友的存在，以及日常环境，未来，也许我们可以给你其他的一些详情。(意指佩特·诺瑞利)
We will close this session, but will hold a full one Wednesday.我们要结束这一节了，但是星期三会举行完整的一节。
(“Can I ask a question?” )(“我可以问一个问题吗？”)
You may.你问。
(“Jane wants to know if she can wear sneakers yet.)(“珍想要知道她可不可以穿运动鞋了。”)
He can indeed, if he believes that he can. (See sessions 316 and 318.) The original identification has considerably weakened now. He knows what is needed, the intense concentration in his work. Do you have any other questions?如果他相信他可以的话，他的确可以。(见第316节和318节)现在，最初的认同已经大幅度减弱。他知道需要什么，聚精会神在他的工作上。你还有别的问题吗？
(“Can she wear black sweaters?"(“她可以穿黑色毛衣吗？”)
(Pause.) These may be worn. (Pause.) He should not wear any of his mothers sweaters however.(停顿)可以穿这些。(停顿)但是，他不应该穿他母亲的任何一件毛衣。
(“Why doesn't Jane feel so hot today?'')(“为什么珍今天觉得那么热？”)
He is not concentrating his full energy in his work. Obviously under usual circumstances this would have no such effects. Do you have any more questions?他没有把他自己的全部能量集中在工作上。显然，在平常的状况下，这不会产生任何那样的影响。你还有其他问题吗？
(“No. ’’)(“没有。”)
My best wishes to you both, and good evening.给你们两位我最好的祝福，晚安。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End at 9:45. Jane's eyes remained closed all session. Her slow pace picked up somewhat after break.)(9:45结束。珍一整节始终闭着眼睛。休息之后，她的缓慢速度加快了一些。)

SESSION 331 第331节 继续讲投射


APRIL 3, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年4月3日 星期一 晚上9点
(Last night Jane had several revelatory dreams, but on awakening could remember no details. She thought projection was involved, along with other kinds of information, and was quite vexed at her failure to recall them. She definitely wanted Seth to discuss these dreams tonight.)(昨晚珍做了几个启示梦，但在醒来时什么细节都记不住。她认为其中有投射，另外还有其他类型的讯息，想不起它们让她有懊恼。她肯定想要赛斯今晚讨论这些梦。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Now. Ruburt was definitely given information in several projections from the dream state early this morning.现在。今天一早，从梦中出发的投射绝对给了鲁柏讯息。
He did not alert his critical faculties however, and is consciously unaware of the experiences and the information. There were three projections involved.但是，他没有通知自己的批判机能待命，而且在意识上对这些经验和讯息没有觉知。其中有三次投射。我是他的向导。
I was his guide. We shall have to discuss this information, in our own way, so that you can be consciously aware of it.我们一定要来讨论这个讯息，用我们自己的方式，这样你在意识上才能够对它有觉知。
There are many portions of the self, as you know. They do assume a form that is visible within their own dimension. These portions of the self are all simultaneous; in various stages of consciousness you become aware of other portions of the self, and an I identifies itself with one or another of these.如你所知，自己(self)有很多部分。它们确实采用一种在它们自己的维度之内可见的形式。自己的这些部分都是同时存在的。在意识的各个阶段中，你会觉察到自己的其他部分，而一个我(I)认同这些自己的其中一个或另一个。
When consciousness leaves the body, it identifies itself with one of these portions, and travels in its form. Each form, embodying certain identity characteristics, has its own environment. Its abilities allow it to operate in particular dimensions.当意识离开身体时，它认同它自己是这些部分的其中一个，用它的形式来旅行。每种形式都是某些本体特性的具体化，有它自己的环境。它的能力使它能够在特定的维度运作。
One form may indeed serve, and then consciousness may project out of it into a new form that is familiar with other dimensions. In Ruburt’s experience three different forms were used. He spoke, incidentally to his Father Trainor, and Lizzie Roohan together, while he was in the second form . He was then led by me into a further dimension of reality in which his third form was used. You must remember that all of these portions of the self exist at once, and that the whole inner self knows them as a part of its own identity.一种形式其实可能就够用了，然后意识也许会从中投射出来，进入一种熟悉其他维度的新形式。在鲁柏的经验中，用了三种不同的形式。顺便一提，当他在第二种形式时，他与崔诺神父(Father Trainor)和丽兹·如翰(Lizzie Roohan)一起谈话。然后，我带他进入实相的另一个维度，他在其中使用了第三种形式。你必须记住，自己的这些部分全都同时存在，而且整个内我都知道它们是它自身本体的一部分。
(Lizzie and her mother shared the two-family Saratoga, NY home with Jane and her mother.)(丽兹和她的母亲在纽约州撒拉托加与珍和她的母亲一起住过双户住宅)
Consciousness as manifested individually simply adopts various images, though some of these are not physical in your terms. There is nothing so strange at this, since in physical life there is the definite difference between the body form of the child, the young adult, and the old man. You do not think this strange, nor do you think of it as three separate forms, you see.个别显化的意识只是采用了各种不同的形象而已，但其中一些并不是你们所说的实体。这没有什么好奇怪的，因为在物质生命中，儿童、年轻成人和老人的身体形式之间存在明显的差异。你不会觉得这样很奇怪，也不会认为它是三种个别的形式，你看。
In the first stage, Ruburt projected through physical reality and saw personalities who had very recently died in physical terms. Now, it is very difficult to tell you simply what happens at physical death, for the conditions vary considerably, according to the individual; his abilities and beliefs will largely determine what happens in those terms.在第一个阶段，鲁柏投射穿越物质实相，看到就肉体而言最近才死亡的人格。现在，很难告诉你，肉体死亡的时候究竟发生什么，因为状况因人而异，而且差异相当大；在这些方面会发生什么，在很大程度上是他的能力和信念决定。
A personality may or may not realize the fact of physical death, for example. Literally, he may or may not find himself in a physical-seeming environment. He will be in a form, however, and will seem so to himself also.比方说，一个人格可能会也可能不会发觉肉体死亡的这个事实。就字面上来说，他可能会也可能不会发现他自己在一个看起来好像是物质的环境中。但是，他将会在一种形式之中，而且在他看来似乎也是如此。
He will seem to have a physical perception. The senseapparatus, supposedly the exclusive right of the physical body, will be much more acute, and yet it will not be determined by any physical mechanisms. The form will be produced directly by idea, yet it will be a definite form in objective terms.他似乎有一种肉体的感知。感觉器官，据说是肉体专属的权利，将会敏锐很多，可是它不是由任何物质机制决定的。形式将由意念直接产生，但客观来讲它会是一种明确的形式。
Under usual conditions it will not be perceived by those still in physical form. This form is much like the form in which you project, but the form which you project is not truly complete, for there must be some (underlined) division of vitality so that physical existence is maintained during out-of-body episodes.在平常的状况下，还有肉体形式中的那些人不会感知它。这种形式很像你投射的形式，但是你投射的形式并不是真正完整的形式，因为一定要有某种(划线)生命力的划分，这样才能够在出体期间维持肉体的存在。
Since these selves exist simultaneously, it is then possible for consciousness to enter, or really form, such an image, undergo experiences within the characteristic pattern of reality, and then project to another image. In all cases consciousness forms the image. When consciousness changes, or travels at certain frequencies, it automatically changes its form. It is indeed possible to be involved with more than one form at once as in usual projection.由于这些自己同时存在，因此意识才有可能进入或真正形成这样一个形象，在实相特有的模式之内体会经验，然后投射到另一个形象上。在所有的案例中，都是意识形成形象。当意识改变或以一定的频率旅行时，它会自动更改它的形式。就像在平常的投射中，同时涉及一种以上的形式确实有可能。
You can enter a trance state in any form, you see. The time element is important when you project from the physical image. It becomes less important the further away you get from the physical form. Since all of these selves are simultaneous, it is also possible to project yourself into one of your own previous identities.你用任何形式都可以进入出神状态，你看。从肉体形象投射出去的时候，时间元素很重要。距离肉体形式越远，它越不重要。由于这些自己全部都是同时存在的，所以你也有可能把自己投射到你自己以前的某一个本体之中。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break at 9:33. Jane's pace had been quite slow, her eyes mostly closed. Resume at a faster pace at 9:41.)(9:33休息。珍的速度很慢，双眼大部分时间都闭着。9:41继续，速度比较快。)
Any real psychology must take all these levels of the self into consideration, for the physically-oriented self that you know is largely formed by the subjective self of which you know so little.任何真正的心理学都必须把自己的这些层面全部考虑在内，因为你知道的这个物质导向的自己，大部分是由你的主观自己形成的，但对它却知之甚少。
Survival personalities can recognize an earthly projectionist, for the form is not fully materialized in their terms. Many of you do, while projecting, council and help those who are newly dead in physical terms.死后犹存的人格能够认出地球来的投射者，因为这种形式在他们来看并没有完全物质化。在投射时，你们当中有很多人的确会给出建议和帮助那些就肉体而言刚死不久的人。
The conscious self is not aware of this. I instructed Ruburt in the procedure last evening. A man from Kentucky, and woman from Vermont, and an Indian from Quebec were involved.有意识的自己对此是没有觉知的。昨晚我在过程中指导了鲁柏。一名来自肯塔基州(Kentucky)的男人，一名来自佛蒙特州(Wvrmont)的女人，以及一名来自魁北克(Quebec)的印第安人。
(Hesitantly:) Que—a—mac... Quymire (phonetically) was one name. A teacher.(犹豫不决)魁——尔——迈克(Que——a——mac)……魁迈尔(Quemire，拼音)是一个名字。一个老师。
(“How do you spell that?")(“怎么拼？”)
Q-u-a-i-m-e-y-e-r.Q-u-a-i-m-e-y-e-r。
(Pause.)(停顿)
Ruburt was not meant to remember the episodes consciously, merely to become aware of their existence as a preliminary step. Soon he will retain conscious knowledge of them.鲁柏本来没有要在意识上记住这些情节，而只是想要对它们的存在有觉知，当作是起步。不久他就会在意识上留住他对它们的认识。
He is bolder in his projections than you, Joseph.约瑟，他的投射比你大胆。
(“Yes.” )，，(“是啊。”)
Particularly when he is in the dream state, so-called. You have had a characteristic distrust of fantasy, you see, that even extended itself into your knowledge of your dreams; and a fear of flinging yourself off from the recognizable. This is lessening, however.尤其是他处于所谓的梦状态时。你看，你对幻想有一种特有的不信任，甚至延伸到你对自己的梦所有的认识；还有一种恐惧，你害怕从可辨识的环境中把自己抛出来。但是，这正在减少中。
Ruburt exuberantly goes forward, particularly in sleep, when his ego is stilled.鲁柏勇往直前，尤其是在睡觉中，当它的自我按兵不动时。
Now when you leave one form for the other, it of course is in the trance state. This applies to other forms beside the physical. You may look back upon it and think it a dead image of yourself, you see. Some individuals in their first astral form see their physical bodies as dead images of themselves and become frightened.现在，当你离开一种形式，来到另一种形式时，它当然处于出神状态。这适用于肉体以外的其他形式。你可能会回头看它，以为它是你自己死亡的样子。有些个体在他们最初的灵体形式中把自身的肉体看成是他们自己的死亡形象，而吓了一跳。
Practically speaking, three other forms are available to you in projections beside the physical, though others are theoretically available. It goes without saying that the consciousness works as hard at night as in the daytime, and always the experiences become part of the whole inner self.实际上，除了肉体形式以外，你在投射中还可以使用其他三种形式，但其他形式在理论上是可以使用的。毋庸置疑的是，意识在晚上和在白天一样努力工作，而且经验向来都会变成整个内我的一部分。
These various seemingly separate projecting selves are of course portions of the one. Now there are classes indeed where the newly dead are instructed. I used to teach some of these. We attended such a class last evening. The physical self as you know it, for physical purposes hardly needs to be concerned with these issues.看似分开的这些投射的自己当然是一体的一部分。现在，确实有新的死者上课的课程。我曾经教过其中一些。昨天晚上我们参加了一个这样的课程。你所知的肉身自己，出于物质上的目的，几乎不需要关心这些问题。
However that portion will not always be physically oriented, and so its consciousness does become aware of certain other realities. On one level your religions try to explain such matters.但是，那个部分并不一定永远是物质导向，所以它的意识的确对某些其他实相有觉知。在某个程度上，你们的宗教试图解释这样的事情。
We have been speaking of ascending selves in your terms. In your (underlined) terms, there are also, of course, descending selves, in that each atom and molecule has its own consciousness and contains all the characteristics inherent in consciousness itself. It is individualistic, it contains qualities you term personality qualities. It adopts form, gains experience, and develops through value fulfillment.我们一直在谈论你们所谓上升的(ascending)自己。用你们的(划线)话来说，当然也有下降的自己，因为每个原子和分子都有它自己的意识，而且包含意识本身固有的所有特性。它是个体主义者，它包含你们所说的人格特质。它采用形式，累积经验，并且透过价值完成来发展。
Projection can occur then in those terms or directions also. This is however much more difficult, and of a different nature entirely. The consciousness that ordinarily projects in an out-of-body experience could not practically project into one atom. The realities are too different.所以，在那些方面或方向上也可能发生投射。然而，这个难度高很多，而本质完全不同。平常在经验中投射的意识实际上无法投射到一个原子之内。实相太不一样了。
A kind of projection can occur, but never a full projection of this type. A fragment may project, you see, but one atom could not contain the full projecting consciousness of an adult human mind.可能会发生一种投射，但永远不会是这种类型的完整投射。一个片段体可能会投射，你看，但是一个原子不可能包含一个成年人心智当中全部的投射意识。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(10:10 to 10:22.)(10:10至10:22。)
Your physical personalities as you know them are projecting personalities from the whole inner self. But the projecting fragments themselves, you see, do not come and leave unaffected, but grow and mature and develop, really, other portions of the self in continuing extensions. There are no dead-end projections.你所知的肉身人格正从整个内我投射出人格。但是，投射的片段体本身，你看，并不是来来去去全然不受影响，反而会在持续扩展的过程中成长、成熟并且发展，真的，自己的其他部分。没有死胡同的投射。
The physical personality, a projection from a whole inner self, develops into more than it was, and has experiences that the inner self could not have under any but those particular circumstances.肉身人格是整个内我的一个投射，发展到比它原来更大的程度，并且拥有内我除了特定状况以外无法在任何状况下拥有的经验。
Your nightly projections work to your credit. Most of you are better than you know, doing good in other dimensions even though you may do poorly within physical reality. Much of this was explained to Ruburt last evening.你的夜间投射对你有利。你们大多数人都比你们知道的还要好，即使在物质实相之内可能做得不好，但在其他维度却做得很好。这其中的大部分在昨晚都向鲁柏解释了。
