Before I forget: There are many reasons why your home has become the center of a small group, even though the members may change. You are helping these people. They come and take what they are capable of taking, and then they will leave. But they will be changed for the better.在我忘记之前：即使成员可能改变，但你们的家为什么变成一个小团体的中心，有很多的原因。你们正在帮助这些人。他们来拿他们有能力拿的东西，然后他们就会离开。但是他们会变得更好。
Ruburt should not demand more of them, for it is necessary that both of you do give in this manner, and for this particular kind of giving you cannot demand thanks. The giving is for your own benefit as well as for theirs. If you could not give then your knowledge would be of less worth.鲁柏不应该对他们要求更多，因为你们两个人都必须以这种方式给予，对于这一种给予，你不能要求感谢。这种给予是为了你自己也为了他们自己的利益。如果你们无法给予，那么你们的知识也会比较没有价值。
I see no reason to go into the various personalities who congregate here, but if you are ever really interested, I will for you.我认为没有理由讨论聚焦在这里的各个人格，但是，如果你真的有兴趣，我会为你这么做。
Now in projections you meet individuals as you do in physical life, and make friends who are interested in your welfare. Perhaps later you will become more aware of some of these.现在，在投射中，你会遇到你在物质生命中遇到的个体，也会结交对你的幸福感兴趣的朋友。也许以后你会对其中一些个体更有觉知。
The information on Malba that you received from your correspondent was legitimate. She is in another plane of reality now, and quite well.你从通讯者那里收到的马尔巴资料是实在的。她现在处于实相的另一层面，而且过得很好。
Unless you have any other questions we will now end our session.除非你有任何其他的问题，否则我们现在要结束我们的课了。
("I guess not.” )(“我想没有了。”)
My heartiest wishes to you both, and a fond good evening.给你们两位我最衷心的祝福，希望你们有个美好的夜晚。
("Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(10:37. Janes pace was much faster the latter part of the session. Her eyes were mostly closed; voice average. See Jane's Malba notes in session 16, Volume 1.)(10:37。珍的速度在后半节加快很多。她的双眼大部分时间都闭着；声音普通。珍的梅尔巴笔记见第一册第16节。)

SESSION 332 第332节 怎样去除负面暗示和心象


APRIL 5, 1967 9:15 PM WEDNESDAY1967年4月5日 星期三 晚上9:15
(Bill Macdonnel witnessed the session. Earlier he’d asked if Seth would speak about his health problems.)(比尔·麦唐纳见证了这一节。早些时候他问赛斯愿不愿意谈谈他的健康问题。)
Good evening.晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.” )(“晚安，赛斯。”)
Good evening to our friend, Mark. (Mark is Bill’s entity name.)向我们的朋友马克说声晚安。(马克是比尔的存有名)
([Bill:]” Good evening.” )(比尔：“晚安。”)
A preliminary note, Joseph. Tonights affairs were hardly a coincidence. The young woman you did not know is in severe difficulty, and unless her method of operation changes, there will be tragic circumstances, indeed. There is Emotional and psychological instability there. The evening here offered a few moments of peace.一个开场的注，约瑟。今晚的事绝非偶然。你不认识的年轻女子正处于严重的困境中，除非她的运作方法发生变化， 否则就会发生悲惨的状况，真的。那里有情绪和心理上的不稳定。今晚这里提供了几个片刻的平静。
Now give us a moment, please.现在请等我们一下。
Difficulty in the third and seventh vertebrae with our friend, Mark, causing pressure. (Pause.) A steady rather than too spasmodic application to his work is needed. He will always work quickly and intuitively, this is beneficial and characteristic of him. Thought and planning can be utilized however, when he is not working well. The thought and planning will then show itself even in the intuitional work.在我们的朋友马克身上，第三和第七节椎骨有问题，造成压力。(停顿)他的工作需要实际采用一种平稳而不是起伏太大的做法。他总是快速又凭着直觉工作，这对他有好处也是他的特性。但是，当他工作状况不佳时，思考和计划是可以用得上的。这样，即使是运用直觉工作，思考和计划自会显现。
His people series is a step to something else, a good and necessary step from which a new development will mature. It should be followed through for it will open him to new developments. The material given earlier for this personality still applies. The psychic abilities are considerable. Under the present conditions, however, he is not likely to utilize them fully.他的人物系列是迈向其他事物的一步，很好而且必要的一步，从此一个新的发展将会开始成熟。应该要贯彻始终，因为它将为他开启一个新的发展。先前给过这个人格的资料仍然适用。心灵能力是相当大的。但是，在目前的条件下，他不太可能充分利用它们。
There is an inability to handle his own energy. At times his own energy frightens him, and then it seems to abandon him completely. Here, however, he has abandoned it, for he succumbs easily to negative suggestions. Because he is sensitive to various elements, he also soaks up atmosphere and suggestions like a sponge, and he has not learned to protect himself.他无法操控自己的能量。有时他自己的能量吓坏了他，然后它好像完全抛弃他。但是，这里，他放弃了它，因为他很容易屈服于负面暗示。因为他对各种不同的元素很敏感，所以就像海绵一样，他也吸收气场和暗示，还没有学会保护他自己。
In poor periods he is almost completely vulnerable to negative suggestion, so that it operates through his own psychic and physical system. He should then often give himself the following suggestion:” I will only react to constructive suggestions.” You may take a break and we shall continue.在状况不佳的时期，他对负面暗示几乎毫无招架之力，因此它透过他自己的心灵和身体系统运作。所以，他应该经常给自己以下的暗示：“我只会对建设性的暗示起反应。”你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(Break 9:28 PM. (Resume 9:35 PM.)(晚上9:28休息。9:30继续。)
Now, listen to me. When you find yourself facing such negative images in your mind and projecting them into the future, you should at once mentally wipe out that image and replace it with a constructive image, seeing yourself, for example, sitting in command of a well-ordered room.现在，听我说。当你发现你自己面对这样的负面意象并且把它们投射到未来时，你应该立刻在心智里消除那个意象，并且用建设性意象替换它，看见你自己，比方说，坐着控制井然有序的房间。
This must be done immediately and upon every such occasion and under every such circumstance. This exercise will indeed wipe out the previous negative image.这件事必须立刻、在每一次这样的场合，以及在每一个这样的情况下，都要做。这个练习确实会消除以前的负面意象。
([Bill:]” Well-ordered room?")(比尔：“井然有序的房间？”)
You must mentally wipe out the negative image, for example. If you think that tomorrow Johnny F will misbehave in study hall, you should, in your mind, replace this with the image of Johnny F behaving very well. In the first place, if you imagine that a particular student will misbehave, you are automatically sending him a telepathic message to that effect. If he is highly susceptible to suggestion, he will carry out the suggestions that you have given.比方说，你必须在心智里消除负面意象。如果你认为明天强尼会在自习室捣乱，你就应该在你的心智里，用强尼表现良好的意象来代替它。首先，如果你想像某个学生会捣乱，你就会自动向他发送心电感应的讯息。如果他非常容易受暗示影响，那他就会落实你给出的暗示。
Joseph: Slow me down when necessary.约瑟：必要时让我放慢速度。
(“Yes.")(“好。”)
When you replace this with a constructive thought, you are sending that constructive suggestion to which he will also react. Any time you see yourself in your mind as unhealthy or staggering, you must immediately wipe the image away and make an effort to see instead a mental image of yourself as healthy and strong.当你用一个建设性的想法代替它的时候，你正在发送那个建设性的暗示，而他也会对它做出反应。每当你在你的心智里看到你自己不健康或摇摇欲坠时，你必须立刻涂掉意象，变成努力看见一幅你自己健康又坚强的心象。
Such images affect your whole physical system through the manufacture of hormones and chemicals. Suggestions, whether given to you or given by you, cause an Emotional situation that automatically affects the production of hormones and chemicals.这样的意象透过荷尔蒙与化学物质的分泌影响你的整个身体系统。暗示，无论是别人给你还是你给别人，都会引发情绪状况，从而自动影响荷尔蒙与化学物质的产生。
I told you to tell yourself: I will only react to constructive suggestions. If however, you find yourself harboring a negative suggestion, then instantly counter it by replacing it with a constructive one.我叫你要告诉你自己：我只会对建设性的暗示起反应。但是，如果你发现你自己有个负面暗示，就要马上用建设性的暗示取而代之，借此与它抗衡。
This can be compared and correctly to errors in a painting. When you are in a poor state of mind, you automatically affect the others you meet, negatively. You then react to their behavior and complete the circle. Now this leads into a highly charged Emotional environment, which is the cause of the depressions of which you have spoken.这可以正确地比喻成绘画中的错误。当你的心情不佳时，你会自动以对你遇到的其他人产生负面影响。然后，你对他们的行为起反应，完成这个循环。现在， 这会形成一个高度充电的情绪环境，也是你说过的忧郁之所以产生的原因。
When the peak is reached then self pity controls your Emotions so completely that there seems to be no escape. In a Mood of self pity there is indeed an almost perverted luxury, the luxury of despair, for despair says: There is nothing I can do, and relieves you of any responsibility for change. This applies not to you only but to such a state in general. You become incapable of getting out of yourself, even to the extent of enjoying small pleasures and, little by little it seems every joy is withdrawn from you until nothing is left but despair.一旦到达顶点，自怜就会完全控制你的情绪，以至于似乎无处可逃。在自怜的心境中，确实存在着一种几近变态的奢侈，一种绝望的奢侈，因为绝望说：我无能为力，所以免除了你承担任何改变的责任。这不只是用于你， 一般来说也适用于这样一种状态。你变成没有能力挣脱自己，甚至到了这一点点小确幸都无法享受的程度，一点一滴地，似乎所有的喜悦都从你身上抽走了，直到除了绝望，什么都没有。
This is caused by the culmination of negative suggestions and of negative thought. They build up until you can take it no longer. In the natural state of affairs, however, sooner or later, some highly charged positive suggestion then begins to clear the Emotional air.这是负面暗示和负面思想造成的状况。它们会逐渐累积，直到你再也受不了为止。但是，在顺其自然的状态下，尽早会有某个高度充电的正面暗示开始清净情绪空气。
In the past, you have had to wait for this, for you did not know how to combat the situation otherwise. You may take a break and we shall continue. If Ruburt is weary, my friend Joseph, I indeed am feeling fine.过去，你不得不等待它的到来，因为你不知道除此之外要怎么与这个情况对抗。你可以休息一下，我们再继续。我的朋友约瑟，如果鲁柏觉得疲倦的话，我倒是感觉很好。
("Good.’’)(“好。”)
And I will have more to say to you concerning this evening, and the earlier circumstances, which you do not understand.关于今晚以及较早前你不了解的状况，我还有更多话要跟你说。
(Break 9:50 PM. Bill agreed with Seth’s analysis. He left at break, as he was tired. Janes pace was fast, her voice deeper and louder than usual. (Resume session 10:12.)(晚上9:50休息。比尔同意赛斯的分析。因为累了，他在休息离开了一下。珍的速度很快，声音比平时更低沉、响亮。10:12继续。)
Now, Ruburt was aware of this evening's gathering this afternoon. He felt trapped, unable to escape an unwanted situation, and here, the foot difficulties. The two of you do not understand thus far, out of fear. I do not know if this is the evening to attempt such a discussion. Your purpose is to help others.现在，鲁柏今天下午对今晚的聚会有觉知。他感觉被困住了，无法逃脱一个不想要的情况，而这里，脚有问题。出于恐惧，所以你们两人至今还不了解。我不知道今晚适不适合这样的讨论。你的目的是帮助他人。
The development of your I and identity is strengthened and developed as you help others. You help others through your work. This I is not threatened when you help others. It is threatened when you think that it is threatened.当你帮助他人时，你的我(I)和本体的发展都会增强和成长。你透过工作来帮助他人。当你帮助他人时，这个我不会受到威胁。当你认为它受到威胁时，它就会受到威胁。
You will not become a doormat, at the utter command of others. This is your fear speaking. Instead, you will be refreshed and strengthened, for their inner gratitude enriches your own atmosphere.你不会变成门口的擦鞋垫，任由他人随意使唤。这是你的恐惧在说话。相反，你会焕然一新而且更有力量，因为他们内在的感觉丰富了你自己的气场。
When this is understood, others will not take advantage of you. Mark has been wanting to attend a session, and Ruburt did not encourage him. You become strengthened as you help others. Ruburt felt resentful and trapped, thereby depriving himself of the rightful benefits that should have resulted from the afternoon and evening encounters.了解这一点，其他人就不会利用你。马克一直想参加一节课，而鲁柏并不鼓励他。当你帮助他人时，你会变得更有力量。鲁柏觉得气愤和受困，因而丧失了下午和晚上的邂逅本来应该会带给他应得的助益。
Now you may take a break, or end the session, as you wish.现在，你可以休息，或是结束这一节，随你便。
(“Well take a short break.”(“我们稍微休息一下。”
(10:21. Break. (10:29. Resume session.)(10:21休息。10:29继续上课。)
When you help others in your own way, you help and reinforce the self. You develop your own abilities and in closing off from others, you close yourself. You both seem to fear that ail your time will be consumed, or that you will be at the mercy of others if you give in at all. This alternative exists only in your own minds, for others will show both gratitude and consideration, and your abilities will deepen and mature, and the gift of empathy be heightened.当你用你自己的方式帮助他人时，你也帮助并且增强自己。你发展你自身的能力并且隔绝他人时，你也封闭你自己。你们两人似乎都害怕你们的时间全部会被消耗掉，或害怕如果你们真的让步，就会任凭他人摆布。这种非A即B的情况只存在你们自己的心智，因为其他人会同时展现感激和体贴，而且你们的能力会加深和成熟，同理的天赋也会增强。
The added sensitivity will show in your work, and the flexibility will aid you in many ways. To help and resent helping is worse for you than not to help at all, for you are then deprived of time without benefit.新增的敏感度会展现在你的工作上，而且弹性也会在很多方面给你助力。一边帮忙又一边怨恨帮忙，对你来说，比根本不帮忙还糟糕，因为这样一来，你不但被剥夺了时间而且又没有得到好处。
Now this is the main thing I wanted to say this evening to you. Without wholehearted cooperation and willingness, then you will allow yourself to succumb to the problems others have brought you. With a willingness to help, you rise above both their problems and your own, and are benefited in other ways.现在，这就是我今晚想要对你说的重点。没有全心全意的合作与意愿，那么你会让你自己屈服于别人给你带来的问题。有帮忙的意愿，你不但会解决他们的问题，也会解决你自己的问题，并且得到其他方面的好处。
I believe that the two girls will separate, in any case. The relationship is not particularly good for either of them, and brings forth their weaknesses rather than their strengths. I could continue but will end the session out of consideration for you both. The bookcase is a good addition, incidentally. My heartiest wishes to you both and a fond good evening.我相信，无论如何，这两个女孩将会分开，这种关系对她们两个人都不怎么好，暴露的是她们的弱点，而不是她们的长处。我可以继续，但是出于体贴你们两位，我要结束这一节了。顺便说一句，多了书柜是个好主意。给你们两位我最衷心的祝福，希望你们有个美好的夜晚。
(“Good night, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
(End of session 10:35.(10:35，课结束。
(By now Jane's pace was slower and quieter. She was quite tired. The company referred to in the session arrived at 4 and stayed till 9 PM. Jane was amazed to find that Seth was” still fresh as a daisy” and could easily go on for another hour, when she was so tired.)(这时，珍的速度更加缓慢，也更加安静。她很累了。在课间提到的客人四点抵达，一直待到晚上9点。珍诧异地发现，她这么累了，赛斯却“还是像雏菊一样新鲜”，可以轻轻松松再讲上一个钟头。)

SESSION 333 第333节 芭芭拉、约翰·布莱德利私人课


APRIL 10, 1967 9 PM MONDAY1967年4月10日 星期一 晚上9点
(Barbara Ingold and John Bradley witnessed the session. Last night, Sunday, April 9, Seth spoke briefly to Barbara and invited her to attend this evenings session.)(芭芭拉·殷戈尔德和约翰·布莱德利见证了这一节。昨晚，4月9日星期天，赛斯对芭芭拉说了一会儿话，并邀请她来参加今天晚上的课。)
Now, good evening.现在，晚安。
(“Good evening, Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”
([John:]” Good evening, Seth.” )(约翰：“晚安，赛斯。”)
And welcome to our friend Philip. (Philip is John Bradleys entity name.)欢迎我们的朋友菲利普。(菲利普是约翰·布莱德利的存有名。)
I bid welcome, of course, to our new guest. (Humorously:) I shall indeed act the host this evening. (Voice louder than usual; eyes mostly closed however.)当然，我向我们新来的客人表示欢迎。(语带幽默)今天晚上我真的是做东的主人。(声音比平时大；但是，眼睛大多时间都闭着)
Affairs will turn out, Philip, as I have said that they would. The meeting of the five will have some repercussions that are not apparent perhaps to you now.事件最后将会发展成，菲利普，我说过的那样。5个人的会议将有一些后果，但此时在你看来并不明显。
Give us a moment, please. (Pause.)请给我们一点时间。(停顿)
Decision will be made in another city, not Chicago, that will reach into this state, concerning of course your godly company (again humorously), to which you have taken such a pledge of allegiance. Your loyalty astounds me. (Smile, eyes closed.)做出决定的地方将是另一个城市，而非芝加哥，并且延伸到这一州，当然与你如此效忠的这间神也似的公司有关(再次语带幽默)。你的忠诚让我跌破眼镜。(微笑，眼睛闭着)
There seems to be an S G connected with the repercussions of the meeting of the five. One is given to reading books, though he does not carry a portable bar in his car.有一个SG似乎与5人会议后果有关联。有一个虽然没有带活动吧台到他的车上，但还是习惯读书。
May or June, 4th or 5th, the early portion of May or June, also connected here, and one of the men of the five will start a new undertaking, I believe with a different kind of merchandise entirely; having some, though perhaps a distant, connection with fabrics.5月或6月，4日或5日，5月或6月的上旬，这里也有关联，5个男人当中有一个将会开始一项新的事业，我相信是种类完全不同的一种商品；与布料有某种也许很遥远的关联。
I speak to our Philip first, since he is indeed such a faithful and amusing guest, of whom I am indeed quite fond. This will not keep me from speaking out to you in the future however when you need it, as you have needed it upon one occasion in the past.我先跟菲利普讲话， 因为他真的是一个老实又好玩的客人，我的确挺喜欢他的。但是，这不会阻止我未来在你需要的时候对你直言不讳，就像你过去曾经有一次需要那样。
(Meaning the Jane Fleming incident at The Elms in Elmira Heights; covered in Session 204, Volume 5 of The Early Sessions J(意思是说茱·弗雷明事件，发生在埃尔迈拉高地[Elmira Heights]的埃尔麦酒吧；《早期课》第五册204节有讨论到。)
Give us a moment please. (Pause.)请给我们一点时间。(停顿)
Our new guest: 15th century, rather a strange itinerary, from Holland to Turkey. A male. Involved in pursuits that took him from city to city and to town to town. To do with musical scores of some kind.我们的新客人：15世纪，一趟相当奇怪的旅程，从荷兰到土耳其。一名男性。在追寻着什么，使他从一个城市追到另一个城市，从一个镇追到另一个镇。与某种乐谱有关。
He could write music. It seems he stole scores and sold them to recognized composers.他会谱曲。好像他偷了乐谱，把它们卖给知名的作曲家。
(pause) The endeavor hardly made him rich however. His father is a musician.(停顿)但是这种努力根本没有让他致富。他的父亲是一位音乐家。
Mandaven... (groping.曼达文……(摸索中)
(“How do you spell that?” )(“怎么拼？”)
Mansdavens, the last name.Mansdavens(曼达文斯)，姓氏。
(Pause.) The first (gesturing) T a n z. 1487, 1535, dying in Turkey. Three children and a wife who was German. The personality then irresponsible but full of gaiety, with some effeminate characteristics from an earlier 9th century life. (Pause.) A tendency then to run from problems, and a fear of settling in one place.(停顿)名字(比手势)Tanz(坦兹)。1487年，1535年，死在土耳其。3个孩子和一个德国妻子。这个人格当时是不负责任的，但充满欢乐气息，带着早先在第9世纪那一世的某些阴柔特征。(停顿)当时有一个逃避问题的倾向，以及一种定居在一个地方的恐惧。
A musical talent but without the discipline or desire to perfect the gift. A series of petty crimes and a violent death as a direct result of business endeavors.有音乐天赋，但没有纪律或欲望让天赋臻于完美。卖力经商的一个直接结果是，一连串违法犯纪的小罪以及一次暴力致死。
He was carried along somehow in a national rebellion; a minor character in this, following soldiers, seeking for the scores of ballads.他不知怎么搞的卷入一场民族叛乱中；在这里面是一个小角色，跟着士兵跑，寻找民谣乐谱。
You may take a break and we shall continue. I shall be listening in to your social chatter, and may make my own comments when I have the time.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。我会偷听你们的社交闲谈，而且我有时间的话，说不定还会发表自己的看法。
(9:16. Jane reported she had images of block letters, as on children blocks, when giving the data on the name Tanz Mansdavens.(9:16。珍说她在给出Tanz Mansdavens这个名字的资料时，她有一些就像刻在儿童积木上面那种大写正体字母的画面。
(John Bradley was recently on a business trip to Chicago. The meeting of the five refers to a group of five executives of Searle Drug, Johns employer.(约翰·布莱德利最近去了芝加哥出差一趟。5人会议是指约翰的雇主，塞尔药厂[Searle Drug]的5名高阶主管组成的一个团体。
(During break Barbara said in conversation that she didn’t like” any” Germans and that she has no musical ability.(在休息期间，芭芭拉在谈话中说她不喜欢“任何”德国人，还说她没有音乐才能。
(Resume at 9:28.)(9:28继续。)
The music ability was misused, and therefore is no longer dominant, you see.音乐才能被滥用，因此不用占有优势，你看。
You were separated from your wife for many years, and did not get along well. You resented her as you would have resented any woman. If you will forgive me, she was more a male than you were, in reality, and the Germans to you now still represent arrogant masculinity.你与妻子分居多年，相处不来。你讨厌她，就像你本来就会讨厌任何女人一样。请恕我直言，她其实比你更像男人，而德国人对你来说，现在仍然代表着傲慢自大的男性特质。
Now. (Pause.) Late 17th century. China. Again as a male. This time of very poor circumstances, but of somewhat moral caliber. The lowest class of merchant dealing however with foreigners in a border town, an outpost.现在。(停顿)17世纪以来。中国。再一次是男性。这一世的状况非常糟糕，但是有一点道德品行。不过，是阶级最低的商人，在一个边境城镇、一个前哨站，与外国人打交道。
A follower of Hay Chi-Chu (my phonetic interpretation )who was a combination outcast-commander and merchant for the foreigners who lived in the mountains; an outpost to the northwest, where it snowed severely in the wintertime.你是韩池褚(Hay Chi-Chu，我的拼音解读)的一名追随者，他既是流放边疆的指挥官也是与住在山上的外国人做买卖的商人；位于西北方的一个前哨基地，冬季下雪严重。
(pause) You were a member of a band of such men, dealing honorably enough with wares, but cut off from the main stream of civilized endeavors. A Manchurian encounter here, with hordes coming from another country some 30 years previous, their descendants still living in the mountain passes.(停顿)你是这样一群男人当中的一名成员，买卖货物的手段算是体面，但与文明的商业主流完全隔绝。这里有满族人，差不多50年前成群结队来自另一个国家，他们的后代仍然住在各个隘口。
There was a rather natural spiritual element in the culture, and you learned and grew with it.在文化中有一种相当自然的灵性元素，而你学习并与它一起成长。
In the past century you lived in this country in Oklahoma. 1831—1876, a woman. A town then of 5100, now close to 4500(0). Southwest portion of the state, name Nigar, N i g a r (spelled) last name.在上一个世纪，你住在这个国家的奥克拉荷马州(Oklahoma)。1831年到1876年，一个女人。一个城镇，当时人口是5100，现在接近4500(0)。这个州的西南部，姓名是尼格尔(Nigar)，Nigar(拼音)是姓氏。
(I write the figure 4500(0) in this fashion because of Janes pronunciation. She said: “ Four, ’’ then” five thousand.” At the time I wasn’t sure whether she meant 4,500 or 45,000.)(我用这种方式写下数字4500[0]，是因为珍的发音。她说：“4”，然后是“5000”。当时我不确定她的意思是4500还是45000。)
Your husband was a farmer.你的丈夫是农民。
("Can you give us the name of the town?")(“你能不能给我们城镇的名字？”)
It begins with a P or B and ends I believe with an a r a. The name may have been changed. The word alto connected with the name of the town.它是P或B开头，我相信结尾是ara。名字可能已经变了。Alto(译注：有男中音、女低音、高地等字义)这个字与镇名有关。
([Barbara:]” Do you mean alto, alt o?")(芭芭拉：“你是说alto,alto吗？”)
Indeed. You may take a brief break and we shall continue.没错。你可以稍微休息一下，我们再继续。
(9:40. Jane's voice had been quite loud throughout, though her pace was rather slow and her eyes were closed most of the time. She said she had the feeling while giving the data that alto was connected somehow with the word” low.” Musically, for instance, alto means high.(9:40。珍的声音从头到尾一直很响亮，但是她的速度相当缓慢，而且她的眼睛大部分时间都闭着。她说，在给出这个资料的同时，她感觉不知为何alto与“low”[低]这个字有关联。例如，在音乐上，alto的意思是高。
(At break a quick check of a road atlas showed the town Altus in the southwest corner of Okbhoma. Its population is from 5,000-10,100 according to the symbol used. We did not have time to investigate the P or B a r a data in connection with the town. (9:50.)(在休息时，快速查看公路地图集，结果显示奥克拉荷马州西南角的城镇阿尔特斯[Altus]。根据地图使用的符号，该镇的人口在5000至10100之间。我们没有时间调查与这个城市有关联的P或B结尾ara资料。9:50继续。)
We find here now however a fairly rigid personality, with many prejudices, given to literal interpretations.但是，这里我们现在发现一个相当僵化的人格，有很多偏见，习惯字面上的解读。
There is a curiosity however that is highly redeeming, but there is not a well-established pattern that has been developed, by which the personality can consistently learn and grow. The rigidity becomes too demanding and the impulse toward freedom is fought vigorously.不过，有一份好奇心，截长补短的作用很大，但是没有一个已经发展出来的稳固模式，让人格可以借此不断学习和成长。僵化变得过于苛求，而追求自由的冲动遭受强烈抵抗。
There is a tendency toward overdependence balanced by a scorn toward those who are over dependent. There are some conflicts still operating from the 15th-century existence, with the result that the male is drawn so idealistically that the real male is found wanting by contrast.有一种过度依赖的倾向，对那些过度依赖的人的鄙视平衡了这个倾向。有一些冲突从15世纪那一世到现在还在运作中，结果是男性被描绘得如此理想，以至于相比之下觉得这名真正的男性不够格。
There is some other material here that we shall give at a later date.这里还有一些其他的资料，我们改天再给。
There is on the one hand a fear of demanding, and on the other hand a tendency to demand too much in personal relationships in which the other sex is involved. There is no commitment to an idea as such, and yet the personality is quite capable of such commitment.一方面有一种害怕苛求的恐惧，另一方面有一种在涉及异性的个人关系当中要求过多的倾向。对这样一个想法没有任何投入，但是这个人格很有能力做出这样的投入。
More freedom should be allowed in many respects, but more freedom should be allowed to others also. (Pause.)应该在很多方面允许自己有更多的自由， 但是也应该允许别人有更多的自由。(停顿)
Deepest abilities are not being developed because of the basic rigid attitudes. There is deep distrust of the male, but this is based mainly upon the difficulties in the 15th-century personality. These are projected outward, you see, and then reacted against.因为基本的僵化态度，所以没有发展出最深的能力。对男性有很深的不信任，但这主要是基于15世纪人格的难题。这些被向外投射，你看，然后又对它们做出反应。
Give us a moment, please. (Pause.)请等我们一下。(停顿)
A communication, Philip, from someone rather distant in space, say across the continent, perhaps even on an island. Or the person has connections with such a place. This is family or personal rather than business, I believe. {Pause) Also a woman in a rather small town. Either her name is Ann or she has a mother or sister with the name of Ann.一次沟通，菲利普，来自空间里跟离相当遥远的某个人，就说，横跨整个大陆，甚至可能在一个岛上。或是这个人与这样一个地方有连结。我相信，这是家事或私事，而不是公事，我相信。(停顿)还有一个女人，住在很小的一个城镇。要不是她的名字叫做安(Ann)，就是她有个名叫安的母亲或姊妹。
Connection with a diner or place where food and drink is served, perhaps with a very large tree outside, front. I am not sure here: the tree connection could be Hazelton.与一间餐馆或供应食物和饮料的地方有关联，也许外头有一棵很大的树，在前面。这里我不确定；树的关联可能是黑哲顿(Hazelton)。
Late afternoon. A game接近傍晚。一场游戏。
(Jane paused, eyes closed, then shook her head in puzzlement)(珍停下来，闭着眼睛，然后困惑地摇了摇头。)
That has something to do with words.这和字词有关。
Are there any questions?有没有任何问题？
(There was silence) Such curiosity amazes me.(无人出声)这样的好奇让我惊讶。
(“Did Barbara have any children in her last life, the Oklahoma existence?")(“芭芭拉在上一世，奥克拉荷马那一世，有没有孩子？”)
In the Oklahoma life, five.在奥克拉荷马州那一世，5个。
([Barbara:]” What was my first name in the Oklahoma life?”(芭芭拉：“我在奥克拉荷马州那一世叫什么名字？”
(Very humorous) You will not like it. It is, unfortunately, Soda.(非常幽默)你不会喜欢它。它是，很遗憾，苏打(Soda)。
([Barbara:]” Do you mean soda?)(芭芭拉：“你是说Soda吗？”)
Indeed. Do not blame me. I did not name you, perhaps you were bubbly. You left school in the sixth grade, but in your town you were considered fairly educated, you see. There was a Miss Thompson’s School for Girls. Taught by a maiden lady in her home.没错。不要怪我。你的名字不是我取的，也许是你热情的冒泡吧。你读到6年级就辍学，但是在你的镇上，大家都认为你的教育程度不错。有一间汤普森小姐女子学校(Miss Thompsons School for Girls)。一位未婚女士在她家中上课。
(“Is Barbara psychically involved with any of the five children in this life?” )(“芭芭拉这一世在心灵上与5个孩子当中的任何一个有没有连结？”)
With two of them. We will give that information at a later date.与其中两个有。我们改天会给这个资料。
([John:]” What will be the result of the communication sent by me to Philadelphia today?” )(约翰：“我今天发送到费城的讯息会有什么结果？”)
Now my dear friend... give me a moment.现在，我亲爱的朋友……给我一点时间。
(pause)(停顿)
A very bland response. It will not be ignored, but the response will be so bland that it will seem your communication was not understood.一个非常平淡的回应。它不会忽略，但是回应会非常冷淡，以至于你讯息流好像没有被了解似的。
There was a challenge involved, implied perhaps, and I assume it will not be taken up but it will be understood. It will be sidestepped. The reply will be polite in comparison.涉及，也许是隐含，一个挑战，而且我认为它不会被接受但会被理解。它会被避开。相较之下，回复会是客气的。
(Pause.) The man who receives it will understand it. A man to whom he shows it will not. No meeting will result as a direct result.(停顿)收到它的人会了解它。一个他把它拿给他看的男人不会了解。直接的结果不会是会议。
You may take a break and we shall continue.你可以休息一下，我们再继续。
(10:11.’re Seth's data: John said the island data could be correct, and a family connection. His brother-in-law, who is an industrial engineer for a plywood concern, either is now, or will soon be, in Hawaii for a month.(10:11。关于赛斯的资料：约翰说岛的资料可能是正确的，以及家庭的关联也是。他的姐[妹]夫是胶合板公司的一名工业工程师，不是现在，就是不久将会在夏威夷待一个月。
(Offhand the Ann connection meant nothing to John. But he said the bar connection could very well apply to Hazelton, PA, and that the Ann could be connected through this. John could not say about the large tree, however.(当场听到，安的关联对约翰毫无意义。但是他说，酒吧的关联很可能适用于资料的黑哲顿，而安可能是透过这一点而有了关联。不过，关于那棵大树，约翰没法说什么。
(John said he did not give his missive to Philadelphia the same interpretation as Seth, when he wrote it; but that Seth’s interpretation could be correct, and therefore the results could very well be as Seth predicts.(约翰说，他在写公函的时候，并没有把赛斯说的那个解读发到费城去；但是赛斯的解读可能是正确的，因此结果很可能和赛斯预测的一样。
(Bill and Peggy Gallagher are on vacation in New York City this week and Seth was to give data concerning them during the session this evening. Jane now resumed at a slower pace, her eyes closed, at 10:20.)(比尔和蓓·加拉格这周在纽约市度假，赛斯今晚在课间给了有关他们的资料。珍现在以较慢的速度继续，她的眼睛闭着，时间是10:20分。)
Give us a moment please. (Pause.)请给我们一点时间。(停顿)
These impressions will apply to our friends the Jesuit and the cat lover.这些印象适用于我们的耶稣会士和爱猫人。
The room; a green modernistic plastic chair with wooden legs—dark green. A spread (gesturing) with upraised pattern in hobnail fashion. An appliance into which one places coins.房间；有着木制椅脚一张绿色现代塑胶椅——深绿色。一块桌布(比手势)，有着平头钉样式的隆起图案。一个放置硬币的器具。
The number 202, perhaps an address or room number. A combo, South American. Conchita.数字202，可能是地址或房间号码。一个小型爵士乐团，南美洲人。孔奇塔(Conchita)。
A scroll, which I do not understand. A meeting with an acquaintance. The number 12. Fourteen steps and a circular clock, very large, above a stairway, with spokes out from it in gold, of wood, of nautical design. (Gestures.)一幅卷轴，我不了解。与一个熟人见面。数字12。14个台阶和一个圆形的时钟，非常大，位于楼梯间上方，外围是金色辐条，木制，航海的设计。(许多手势)。
Three friends and a story of disaster, though not that strong. Something cracked in the room in which they stay, a glass perhaps or mirror, a small insignificant accident. A finger cut slightly.3个朋友和一个故事，但不是那么强烈。他们住的房间有东西破了，也许是一个玻璃杯，或是一面镜子，一个微不足道的小事故。手指轻微割伤。
(pause) An antique they prize. A miscellany of objects arranged in pyramid form, and people dressed as constables who are not constables. They went to their room shortly after seven, and leave it again. They eat at a place that begins with a D. This is not it: It sounds like Den-i-ah (my phonetic interpretation) however.(停顿)一件他们珍视的古董。各式各样排列成金字塔形式的物品，以及打扮成警员但不是警员的人。他们7点过后不久就去了他们的房间，然后又离开。他们在一个名字是D开头的地方吃饭。不是这样；听起来像丹-艾-阿(Den-i-ah，我的拼音解读)。
Their dinner comes to $7.95. Their menu has pictures of mermaids or Hawaiian dancers upon it.他们的晚餐总共是美金7元95分。他们的菜单上面有美人鱼或夏威夷舞者的图片。
(Pause.) There is a long dark bar, a long, narrow establishment, tables to the left, and too many people to be served. They must wait.(停顿)这里有一个又长又暗的酒吧，一个又长又窄的场所，桌子在左边，要服务的人太多了。他们必须等待。
I am giving you frequent breaks since Ruburt is dealing primarily with this sort of work this evening, and there is a difference in the energy used. We shall shortly continue.我会经常让你休息一下，因为鲁柏今晚主要处理这类工作，使用的能量不一样。我们很快再继续。
A stop at 74th Street, and an 82nd-Streer address.在第74街的一个停靠站，以及在第82街的地址。
(10:31. Jane said she may have had a vague image of the long narrow bar while speaking. She resumed at the same slow pace, but in a fairly good voice, at 10:47.)(10:31。珍说她说话时可能有一个模糊的画面是狭长的酒吧。10:47分，她以同样缓慢的速度继续，但声音很好。)
Now. We will shortly end our session.现在。我们很快就要结束我们的课。
There was a relationship existing between you and your friend, (pause) in the Oklahoma existence. He was your grandmother.有一种关系存在你和你的朋友之间，(停顿)在奥克拉荷马州的那一世。他是你的祖母。
(Here Seth refers to Barbaras friend, Dick. We had been discussing both relationships at break.)(这里，赛斯指的是芭芭拉的朋友迪克。我们在休息时讨论过两种关系。)
He brought you up, and it is in that home that you lived. There were many problems not worked out that are being worked out now. We will go into more personal material if you wish at another session. (Pause.) There is also a connection with an individual where you work. If no one has any questions then we shall close the session.他把你养大，就在你住过的那个家。有很多过去没有解决的问题现在正在解决中。如果你想要，我们在另一节课会详谈更多个人资料。(停顿)此外，在你工作的地方有一个人也有关联。如果没有人有任何疑问，我们就结束这一节。
([John:]” Does the April l6-26th date still have relevance?” [Seth gave John this date in Session 313. See pages 249-50.])(约翰：“4月16日至26日这个日期还有意义吗？”[赛斯在第313节给了约翰这个日期])
It has. Is there anything else?有。还有别的事吗？
([Barbara:]” Would you advise against a meeting with Kenneth?” )(芭芭拉：“你会建议不要和肯尼斯[Kenneth]见面吗？”)
I suggest that you make your own decisions, young lady, for making them you will discover your strengths and weaknesses. You know what you should do, and the decision must be your own.我建议你自己做决定，年轻的女士，因为做出这些决定，你才会发现自己的强项和弱点。你知道你应该做什么，而且你必须自己做决定。
I will not advise you now in your particular circumstances, for to advise you would not be to help you. You are looking to the past however, and you should look to the future. You will learn from such a meeting in any case, and you have set yourself already to go.我现在不会在你的特定情况下给你建议，因为给你建议不是帮助你。不过，你正看着过去，但你应该看着未来。无论如何，你都会从这样的见面当中学到东西，而且你已经做好出发的准备了。
I will help you rely upon yourself to better advantage, but I will not make your decisions for you, nor allow you to use me, in that respect. I mean this quite kindly.我会帮助你依靠你自己获得更大的优势，但是在这方面，我不会为你做决定，也不允许你利用我。我这么说是出于好意。
([Barbara:]” Will you tell me if he’s interested in a meeting, or will go along with this just for my sake, as is his nature?” )(芭芭拉：“你能不能告诉我，他有没有兴趣见面？还是说他只是为我着想才答应，他的本性就是这样？”)
Give us a moment please... We find we do not believe that he is interested in the kind of relationship that you have in mind. He is somewhat sentimentally intrigued, but he is not about to change the framework of his days, and he is not resolute. He realizes that basically you expect what he cannot give. There will be sentiment. There will not be any basic long-term commitment.请给我们一点时间……我们发现我们不相信他对你心中所想的那种关系有兴趣。他的情感上多少有点被挑起兴趣，但他并不打算改变他的生活框架，而且他没有下定决心。他发觉，基本上你预期的东西他无法给你。会有情愫。没有任何基本的长期承诺。
Now you may indeed end the session, or break, as you prefer.现在你真的可以结束这一节或休息一下，看你比较想要怎样。
(“Well, I guess it’s time to end it.” )(“嗯，我想是时候结束了。”)
My heartiest wishes to you all.给你们每位我最衷心的祝福。
(To John:) And your portable bar are not the only spirits in your car.(对约翰)还有在你的车子里，你的活动吧台不是唯一的灌顶醍醐。(译注：爱玩双关语的赛斯。在这里又一语双关，spirits既是指烈酒，也是指灵魂、幽灵，暗示他也在车上。赛斯曾自称幽灵、老鬼，醍醐是酒的别称之一，灌顶有灌输智慧之意，故而作此译。)
(“Good night., Seth.”(“晚安，赛斯。”)
(“Good night, Seth.” [Barbara and John.](“晚安，赛斯。”[芭芭拉和约翰])
(10:59.)(10:59。)
